text: Oh Aang, it's good to see you. You haven't changed a bit. Literally.

title: The King of Omashu
text: Uh, over here!

title: The King of Omashu
text: Little help?

title: The King of Omashu
text: Bumi breaks the crystals using earthbending, making pieces fly everywhere. He catches one of them.

title: The King of Omashu
text: Jennamite is made of rock candy. [He takes a bite into the crystal.] Delicious!

title: The King of Omashu
text: So this crazy king is your old friend Bumi?

title: The King of Omashu
text: Who are you calling old? Okay, I'm old.

title: The King of Omashu
text: Why did you do all of this instead of just telling Aang who you were?

title: The King of Omashu
text: First of all, it's pretty fun messing with people. [Snorts.] But I do have a reason. Aang, you have a difficult task ahead. The world has changed in the hundred years that you've been gone. It's the duty of the Avatar to restore balance to the world by defeating Fire Lord Ozai. You have much to learn. You must master the four elements and confront the Fire Lord. And when you do, I hope you will think like a mad genius. And it looks like you're in good hands. You'll need your friends to help defeat the Fire Nation. [Momo climbs up on Aang.] And you'll need Momo, too.

title: The King of Omashu
text: Thank you for your wisdom, but before we leave, I have a challenge for you.

title: The King of Omashu
text: Scene changes to show Bumi and Aang riding down the mail system. Cut to view of the entire city. A cloud of dust is raised as a crash is heard.

title: The King of Omashu
text: My cabbages!

title: The King of Omashu
text: Fade to credits.

title: The King of Omashu
text: Aang

title: Imprisoned
text: The scene opens up in a forest. Katara and Aang are on a raised, grassy plateau. A gentle stream is running out beneath it. Katara is folding one of their sleeping blankets. Aang is lying on the root of a tree. Momo screeches and lands on the plateau as Sokka approaches.

title: Imprisoned
text: [Enthusiastically.] Great, you're back!

title: Imprisoned
text: Aang leaps off the root with his airbending, landing beside the Water Tribe siblings as Sokka digs in his bag.

title: Imprisoned
text: What's for dinner?

title: Imprisoned
text: [Digs nuts from his bag.] We've got a few options. First; round nuts. And some kind of oval shaped nuts? And some rock-shaped nuts, that might just be rocks. [Throws the rock-shaped nut toward Momo.] Dig in! [Aang and Katara look at each other then back at Sokka.]

title: Imprisoned
text: Seriously ... what else you got?

title: Imprisoned
text: Momo coos, and sniffs the rock-shaped nut, before taking it with one of his paws and slapping it against a stone twice. Attempting to break it, he takes it with both paws and slams it down on the big rock. The moment he does so, however, the entire earth quakes, making Momo shriek and his hair stand up on end.

title: Imprisoned
text: What was that?

title: Imprisoned
text: Momo, believing he may have caused the quake, cautiously drops the rock to the ground in test. The quake returns, causing Momo to leap away.

title: Imprisoned
text: It's coming from over there!

title: Imprisoned
text: [Aang and Katara run off-camera.] Shouldn't we run away from huge booms? Not toward them?

title: Imprisoned
text: The three, joined by Momo, hide behind a fallen tree and spy on a young boy bending boulders into the air and punching them into the side of the ravine.

title: Imprisoned
text: An earthbender!

title: Imprisoned
text: Let's go meet him!

title: Imprisoned
text: He looks dangerous, so we better approach cautiously.

title: Imprisoned
text: [Suddenly Katara is a few feet in front of them, excitedly addressing the earthbender.] Hello there! I'm Katara! What's your name?

title: Imprisoned
text: The young boy gasps in surprise, dropping the boulder he was bending to the ground. He flees quickly, bringing down an avalanche of boulders with his bending to block his exit.

title: Imprisoned
text: [Sokka and Aang approach Katara; yelling.] Nice to meet you!

title: Imprisoned
text: [Shrugging.] I just wanted to say hi.

title: Imprisoned
text: Hey! That guy's gotta be running somewhere. Maybe we're near a village? And I bet that village has a market!

title: Imprisoned
text: [Excitedly.] Which means no nuts for dinner!

title: Imprisoned
text: [Katara and Aang chase after Haru.] Hey! I worked hard to get those nuts! [Momo flies overhead, chasing Katara and Aang.] Yeah, I hate 'em too. [Slowly follows Katara and Aang.]

title: Imprisoned
text: Katara and Sokka stroll through the mining village's streets while Aang speaks with a shopkeeper under a terrace.

title: Imprisoned
text: Great hat! [Tries on the hat.] I'll trade you some nuts for it.

title: Imprisoned
text: [Notices the boy enter a shop. Speaks to herself in surprise.] Hey ...

title: Imprisoned
text: The boy enters into the dark, wooden building and approaches a woman.

title: Imprisoned
text: Hi, Mom.

title: Imprisoned
text: Where have you been, Haru? You're late! Get started on your chores.

title: Imprisoned
text: [Enters the shop's front door, startling Haru.] Hey. You're that kid. Why did you run away before?

title: Imprisoned
text: Uh, you must have me confused with some other kid.

title: Imprisoned
text: [Aang and Sokka enter the shop.] No, she doesn't. We saw you earthbending.

title: Imprisoned
text: Haru and his mother gasps in horror at his secret being revealed and both the door and window to the small shop are promptly slammed shut.

title: Imprisoned
text: [Standing by the window.] They saw you doing what?!

title: Imprisoned
text: They're crazy, Mom! I mean, look at how they're dressed.

title: Imprisoned
text: Aang gazes to his conical hat, shifting it about in confusion. Katara awkwardly grasps at her dress, looking with astonishment at herself. Sokka quirks an eyebrow and smooths out his sleeve.

title: Imprisoned
text: You know how dangerous that is! You know what would happen if they caught you earthbending!

title: Imprisoned
text: [Heavy knocks on the door.] Open up!

title: Imprisoned
text: [Sokka peeks through the window's blinds.] Fire Nation! Act natural!

title: Imprisoned
text: Haru's mother opens the door, allowing the Fire Nation tax collector to walk inside. He stares awkwardly at the four children in front of him. Haru grasps his chin and stares toward Katara, cross-eyed. Sokka eyeballs an apple. Katara hunches forward with her eyes wide open, having stuffed her mouth with berries. Aang has his hand atop a barrel, beaming an immense toothy smile. His pose is short-lived as the barrel's lid spins, dunking Aang's hand into the barrel of water and causes him to fall down.

title: Imprisoned
text: [The tax collector stares sourly toward the four children; aggressively.] What do you want? I've already paid you this week!

title: Imprisoned
text: The tax just doubled. [Arrogantly.] And we wouldn't want an accident, would we? [Creates a ball of fire between his hands, making everyone slightly back away.] Fire is sometimes so hard to control.

title: Imprisoned
text: Haru's mother and the tax collector approach the store's counter, where she opens a small chest and passes a meager handful of Earth Kingdom currency to the tax collector. Haru leans against the counter, staring with contempt toward the Fire Nation man.

title: Imprisoned
text: You can keep the copper ones. [Walks away, dropping four copper pieces to the floor, exits.]

title: Imprisoned
text: [Door slams.] Nice guy. How long has the Fire Nation been here?

title: Imprisoned
text: Five years. Fire Lord Ozai uses our town's coal mines to fuel his ships.

title: Imprisoned
text: They're thugs. They steal from us. And everyone here's too much of a coward to do anything about it.

title: Imprisoned
text: [Angered.] Quiet, Haru! Don't talk like that.

title: Imprisoned
text: [Curiously.] But, Haru's an earthbender? He can help!

title: Imprisoned
text: Earthbending is forbidden. It's caused nothing but misery for this village! [Casts a meaningful glance toward her son.] He must never use his abilities.

title: Imprisoned
text: How can you say that? Haru has a gift! Asking him not to earthbend is like asking me not to waterbend. It's a part of who we are.

title: Imprisoned
text: [Shakes head in dismay.] You don't understand.

title: Imprisoned
text: I understand that Haru can help you fight back. What can the Fire Nation do to you that they haven't done already?

title: Imprisoned
text: They could take Haru away! Like they took his father.

title: Imprisoned
text: Scene changes to late evening, viewing farmland and a barn. Appa walks into the barn. Cut to a closer view of Sokka, Katara, Haru, and Aang standing inside the barn.

title: Imprisoned
text: My mom said you can sleep here tonight. But you should leave in the morning.

title: Imprisoned
text: Thanks. I'll make sure Appa doesn't eat all your hay.

title: Imprisoned
text: Appa engulfs a mouthful of hay. Appa pauses, turning to stare dubiously toward Aang before continuing to chew hay. The scene switches to Katara and Haru taking a walk into the woods outside under the setting sun.

title: Imprisoned
text: I'm sorry about what I said earlier. I didn't know about your father.

title: Imprisoned
text: That's okay. It's funny, the way you were talking back in the store? It reminded me of him.

title: Imprisoned
text: [Flattered.] Thanks.

title: Imprisoned
text: My father was very courageous. When the Fire Nation invaded, he and the other earthbenders were outnumbered ten to one. But they fought back anyway.

title: Imprisoned
text: He sounds like a great man.

title: Imprisoned
text: The two approach the top of a steep cliff, gazing out to the setting sun beyond.

title: Imprisoned
text: [Stops.] After the attack, they rounded up my father and every other earthbender, and took them away. [Kneels.] We haven't seen them since.

title: Imprisoned
text: So that's why you hide your earthbending.

title: Imprisoned
text: Yeah. Problem is ... [Close-up, earthbends two stones in a circle above his hand.] the only way I can feel close to my father now [Crushes the stones to sandÂ with his hands. The sand blows away.] is when I practice my bending. He taught me everything I know.

title: Imprisoned
text: [Sits beside Haru, sets her fingertips on her necklace.] See this necklace? My mother gave it to me.

title: Imprisoned
text: It's beautiful.

title: Imprisoned
text: I lost my mother in a Fire Nation raid. [Hangs her head, turning away.] This necklace is all I have left of her.

title: Imprisoned
text: It's not enough, is it?

title: Imprisoned
text: No. [Hangs her head and turns away.]

title: Imprisoned
text: The scene switches toÂ Katara and Haru who have continued their walk along the dirt trail. A loud boom sounds and rock and dust blasts from a distant mine entrance. An old man cries out.

title: Imprisoned
text: Help, help!

title: Imprisoned
text: The mine!

title: Imprisoned
text: Katara and Haru run quickly to the entrance, which has caved in and left a tremendous pile of rocks pinning the old man to the ground on his stomach. Sand continues to pour down, rocks intermittently falling.

title: Imprisoned
text: Help me!

title: Imprisoned
text: [Haru braces his back against the mine entrance. Katara pulls the old man.] Ugh! It's not working! We have to get help!

title: Imprisoned
text: There's no time, pull harder!

title: Imprisoned
text: [Getting an idea.] Haru. There's a way you can help him.

title: Imprisoned
text: [Guilty fear.] I can't.

title: Imprisoned
text: Please, there's no one around to see you. It's the only way!

title: Imprisoned
text: Haru leaps away from the falling debris, spinning back to face it as he assumes an earthbending form. With a sudden and strong move, he blasts all the rocks down the tunnel, freeing the old man.

title: Imprisoned
text: [Excitedly.] Haru! You did it! [The two take place beside the old man and aid him walking away from the mine.]

title: Imprisoned
text: At the barn, Katara is sitting up in her bedroll with a lamp in her lap. Sokka is lying on a square bale of hay with his blanket over him, and Aang is sprawled out on Appa's head with Momo lying on his back.

title: Imprisoned
text: It was so brave of Haru to use his earthbending to help that old man.

title: Imprisoned
text: You must have really inspired him.

title: Imprisoned
text: I guess so.

title: Imprisoned
text: Everyone should get some sleep, we're leaving at dawn.

title: Imprisoned
text: [Unhappily.] Dawn?! Can't we sleep in for once?

title: Imprisoned
text: [Commandingly.] Absolutely not! This village is crawling with Fire Nation troops. If they discover you're here, Aang, we'll be eating fireballs for breakfast. Goodnight.

title: Imprisoned
text: [Slyly, with a wry smirk.] I'd rather eat fireballs than nuts.

title: Imprisoned
text: [With finality.] Goodnight!

title: Imprisoned
text: Katara and Aang share a few playful chuckles with each other before she blows out the lamplight to get some rest.

title: Imprisoned
text: [Points accusingly.] That's him! That's the earthbender!

title: Imprisoned
text: The Fire Nation leader shoves the old man out of the way and approaches Haru. Haru screams as the man forces Haru into his grip and hauls him away.

title: Imprisoned
text: [Enters barn to see Aang and Sokka folding blankets; emotionally.] They took him! They took Haru away!

title: Imprisoned
text: [Surprised.] What?

title: Imprisoned
text: [Hurriedly.] The old man turned him in to the Fire Nation - it's all my fault - I forced him into earthbending!

title: Imprisoned
text: [Steps beside her, taking her hand in his and laying his other hand supportively behind her shoulder.] Slow down, Katara. When did this happen?

title: Imprisoned
text: Haru's mother said they came for him at midnight.

title: Imprisoned
text: Then it's too late to track him, he's long gone.

title: Imprisoned
text: [Turns defiantly to the open door, clenches fists.] We don't need to track him. The Fire Nation is going to take me right to Haru.

title: Imprisoned
text: [Confused.] And ... why would they do that?

title: Imprisoned
text: [Determined.] Because they're going to arrest me for earthbending. [Aang and Sokka share a horrified look.]

title: Imprisoned
text: Scene changes to Sokka and Katara working together to push a boulder overtop an air vent on a rocky road.

title: Imprisoned
text: I thought you were crazy at first, Katara, but this might work. There are ventilation shafts throughout these mines. All Aang has to do is send an air current from that vent to this one right here. The boulder levitates and ta-da! Fake earthbending.

title: Imprisoned
text: [Props hands off hips, turns to Aang.] Aang? Did you get all that?

title: Imprisoned
text: [Snapping small puffs of air at a sooty copper fritillary butterfly; dismissively.] Sure, sure. I got it.

title: Imprisoned
text: Do you remember your cue?

title: Imprisoned
text: [Continues snapping puffs of air; still dismissive.] Yeah, yeah. Just relax. You're taking all the fun out of this.

title: Imprisoned
text: [Aggravated.] By this, do you mean intentionally being captured by a group of ruthless firebenders?

title: Imprisoned
text: [Humored.] Exactly! That's fun stuff!

title: Imprisoned
text: [Group of firebenders with spears approach.] Here they come! Get in your places!

title: Imprisoned
text: Aang stops playing with the butterfly and Momo tries catching it as it flies away. As the group of spear-wielding guards approach, Katara and Sokka make a show of walking into one another by their stomachs before emphatically shouting.

title: Imprisoned
text: [While angrily pointing at Katara.] Get out of my way, pipsqueak! [The soldiers watch in confusion. One of them even raises an eyebrow.]

title: Imprisoned
text: [Angrily hunched over.] How dare you call me pipsqueak, you giant-eared cretin!

title: Imprisoned
text: [Just as angrily hunched over.] What did you call me?

title: Imprisoned
text: [Far too dramatically as her hair loopies move with her motion.] A giant-eared cretin! Look at those things! Do herds of animals use them for shade?! [Imitates an elephant's ears.]

title: Imprisoned
text: [Towers over his sister.] You better back off! [Slips his hand by his mouth and mutters.] Seriously, back off.

title: Imprisoned
text: [More determined, heightens above her now-cowering brother.] I will not back off! I bet elephants get together and make fun of how large your ears are!

title: Imprisoned
text: That's it! You're going down!

title: Imprisoned
text: I'll show you who's boss! [Angrily points at Sokka.] Earthbending style! [Over-dramatically leaps toward the boulder, clenching her fist upward to which there is no reaction. Angrily.] I said, earthbending style!

title: Imprisoned
text: At Katara's shout, Aang gasps quietly as he realizes his mistake by missing his cue. The young airbender ceases playing with the butterfly, leaps up, and blasts a strong jet of air into the ventilation duct, suddenly sending the boulder levitating into the air. This reveals Momo behind the boulder, who has his arms raised, licking himself.

title: Imprisoned
text: [Points a finger to the lemur; surprised.] That lemur! He's earthbending!

title: Imprisoned
text: [Katara and Momo each remain in their positions. Katara eyes the man in surprise. Sokka, angrily, waves his arms toward her.] No, you idiot, it's the girl!

title: Imprisoned
text: Oh. [Blushes shamefully.] Of course.

title: Imprisoned
text: Sokka steps beside Katara, laying his hands on her shoulders as the boulder falls to the ground. Katara stands patiently.

title: Imprisoned
text: I'll hold her. [Close-up. Whispers to Katara.] You've got twelve hours to find Haru. We'll be right behind you.

title: Imprisoned
text: The guards escort Katara away, leaving Aang, Sokka, and Momo to watch as she takes a final glance back. Sokka unhappily tugs at his ears, testing their sizes.

title: Imprisoned
text: [Eyeballs Momo perched off of Aang's shoulder. Points accusingly.] Momo, you have some big ears! [Momo folds his ears back, hunches down, and coos in protest.]

title: Imprisoned
text: Katara is in the back of a Fire Nation transport with other earthbender prisoners. She wears a brown, tattered prison garb over her blue Water Tribe outfit and stares glumly downward. Sokka and Aang each have conical yellow hats in a crowd, attempting to stealthily observe her travel. Katara looks longingly over shoulder as the cart bobs along a pier, heading toward a waiting barge on the ocean.

title: Imprisoned
text: [Aang stares nervously at the barge carrying Katara to the prison.] She'll be fine, Aang. Katara knows what she's doing.

title: Imprisoned
text: After the barge arrives, six prisoners, including Katara, line up on the deck of the prison. Spear-wielding guards stand at either side. A prison warden approaches.

title: Imprisoned
text: [Smugly.] Earthbenders. It is my pleasure to welcome you aboard my modest shipyard. I am your warden. I prefer to think of you not as prisoners, [Quips smartly.] but as honored guests. And I hope you come to think of me as your humble and caring host. [Paces nonchalantly.] You will succeed here, if you simply abide-

title: Imprisoned
text: The warden pauses, suddenly interrupted by a prisoner in line coughing. With no forewarning, the warden leaps into the air and aims a blast of fire at the prisoner's legs in anger. The prisoner cowers away for safety as the warden stands defiantly toward the man.

title: Imprisoned
text: [Very angrily.] What kind of guest dishonors his host by interrupting him?! Take him below! [Swings his arms. Some guards escort the man away. Mutters.] One week in solitary will improve his manners. [Continues smug gait.] Simply treat me with the courtesy that I give you-

title: Imprisoned
text: Approaches Katara, kneeling to stare into her obstinate expression. She crosses her eyebrows, scowling coarsely at the man.

title: Imprisoned
text: And we'll get along famously.

title: Imprisoned
text: The prisoners are taken on a tour of the facility. Below, fellow prisoners are seen laboring.

title: Imprisoned
text: You will notice, earthbenders, that this rig is made entirely of metal. You are miles away from any rock or earth. [Katara pauses, glancing over the expansive ocean to the land far away.] So, if you have any illusions about employing that brutish savagery that passes for bending among you people ... [Lowly.] forget them. It is impossible. Good day.

title: Imprisoned
text: A guard escorts the prisoners into the prison courtyard. Katara enters last and the metal gates close behind her. Among many earthbender prisoners, Haru takes notice of Katara. Above the courtyard, a watchman and the warden monitor the scene.

title: Imprisoned
text: [Surprised.] Katara?

title: Imprisoned
text: [Excitedly. Runs and hugs Haru.] Haru!

title: Imprisoned
text: [Confused.] What are you doing here?

title: Imprisoned
text: [Somewhat apologetically.] It's my fault you were captured. I came to rescue you.

title: Imprisoned
text: [Shocked.] So, you got yourself arrested?

title: Imprisoned
text: It was the only way to find you.

title: Imprisoned
text: You've got guts, Katara. I'll give you that. [Places hand on her shoulder.] Come on. There's someone I want you to meet.

title: Imprisoned
text: The two approach an old, gray-bearded man eating dinner among other prisoners.

title: Imprisoned
text: Katara. This is my father, Tyro. [The older man looks up.] Dad. This is Katara.

title: Imprisoned
text: [Slightly bows.] It's an honor to meet you.

title: Imprisoned
text: [Hands Katara a bowl.] Have some dinner, Katara. [Katara accepts the bowl, but grimaces.] It's not as bad as it looks. [Katara tries a spoonful, but becomes further disgusted. He finds humor in this with a small chuckle.] It's still pretty bad though.

title: Imprisoned
text: [Walks up and lays a hand on Tyro's shoulder.] Tyro. The prisoners are complaining there aren't enough blankets to go around.

title: Imprisoned
text: I'll talk to the guards. In the meantime, make sure the elderly are taken care of. The rest of us will simply have to hope for warmer weather.

title: Imprisoned
text: If you don't mind me asking, what's your escape plan?

title: Imprisoned
text: Excuse me?

title: Imprisoned
text: You know, the plan to get everyone off the rig? What is it? Mutiny, sabotage?

title: Imprisoned
text: The plan? The plan is to survive. Wait out this war. Hope that one day some of us can get back home and forget this ever happened.

title: Imprisoned
text: [Shocked.] How can you say that? You sound like you've already given up!

title: Imprisoned
text: Katara, I admire your courage. And I envy your youth. But people's lives are at stake here. The warden is a ruthless man, and he won't stand for any rebellion. I'm sorry, but we're powerless.

title: Imprisoned
text: [Obstinately.] We'll see about that.

title: Imprisoned
text: Katara stands up and carries a trash can lid and a ladle, climbing on top of a wooden table. From there, she bangs the ladle against the lid to draw attention.

title: Imprisoned
text: Earthbenders! You don't know me, but I know of you. Every child in my Water Tribe village was rocked to sleep with stories of the brave Earth Kingdom, and the courageous earthbenders who guard its borders. [The watchman walks up to talk the warden, but the warden stops him and listens.] Some of you may think that the Fire Nation has made you powerless. Yes, they have taken away your ability to bend. But they can't take away your courage. And it is your courage they should truly fear! Because it runs deeper than any mine you've been forced to dig, any ocean that keeps you far from home! It is the strength of your hearts that make you who you are. Hearts that will remain unbroken when all rock and stone has eroded away. The time to fight back is now! I can tell you the Avatar has returned! So remember your courage earthbenders, [Shouts clearly.] let us fight for our freedom!

title: Imprisoned
text: Katara's speech is met with utter silence and a small cough in the background, leaving her to fall into sorrow as she realizes the muted answer she receives. The warden walks away from the courtyard. Later that night while she is sleeping, Aang sneaks into the prison and taps his hand to her shoulder, waking her. Urging her to be quiet, he leads her to the perimeter where Sokka and Appa are waiting to make their escape.

title: Imprisoned
text: Your twelve hours are up; where's Haru? We've gotta get outta here!

title: Imprisoned
text: I can't.

title: Imprisoned
text: [Hurriedly.] We don't have much time. There are guards everywhere. Get on!

title: Imprisoned
text: [Concerned.] Katara, what's wrong?

title: Imprisoned
text: I'm not leaving. [Aang and Sokka share a questionable look.] I'm not giving up on these people.

title: Imprisoned
text: Fade to black. Cut to Sokka, Aang, and Katara on the metal perimeter.

title: Imprisoned
text: What do you mean you're not leaving?

title: Imprisoned
text: We can't abandon these people! There has to be a way to help them.

title: Imprisoned
text: Maybe she's right. What do you say, Sokka?

title: Imprisoned
text: I say you're both crazy! [The trio ducks a searching spotlight.] Last chance! We need to leave, now!

title: Imprisoned
text: [Sternly.] No!

title: Imprisoned
text: [Shakes his head dismally.] I hate when you get like this. Come on, we better hide.

title: Imprisoned
text: [Katara and Sokka flee. Aang whispers to Appa before joining them.] Go hide.

title: Imprisoned
text: [Appa soars overhead to fly away and hide.] Look!

title: Imprisoned
text: The two guards who witnessed Appa take to the skies approach the warden on a catwalk.

title: Imprisoned
text: Tell me exactly what you saw.

title: Imprisoned
text: Well, sir, it looked like a flying bison.

title: Imprisoned
text: [Surprised.] What?

title: Imprisoned
text: It was a giant flying buffalo, sir. With an empty saddle.

title: Imprisoned
text: Which was it? A buffalo or a bison?

title: Imprisoned
text: Uh, I'm not sure what the difference is, but that's not really the point, is it, sir?

title: Imprisoned
text: [Furiously.] I'll decide what the point is, fool!

title: Imprisoned
text: The warden throws the first guard overboard. The man screams in horror before finally being silenced by a splash below.

title: Imprisoned
text: [To the second guard as he straightens up.] You! Wake up the captain. Search the entire rig! [Turns to walk away.]

title: Imprisoned
text: Uh, sir.

title: Imprisoned
text: [Annoyed.] What?

title: Imprisoned
text: [Somewhat timidly.] That was ... the captain you just threw overboard, so ...

title: Imprisoned
text: [Still quite annoyed.] Then wake up someone I haven't thrown overboard and search the rig! There's something going on here and I don't like it.

title: Imprisoned
text: Cut scene; Momo peeps over a wooden crate where the trio is safely hiding behind numerous boxes. Scene opens up to show the three huddled together seated on the metal ground in the darkness.

title: Imprisoned
text: We don't have much time. What are we gonna do?

title: Imprisoned
text: I wish I knew how to make a hurricane!

title: Imprisoned
text: Both Sokka and Katara provide Aang with assuredly un-entertained facial expressions.

title: Imprisoned
text: The warden would run away and we'd steal his keys!

title: Imprisoned
text: Wouldn't he just take his keys with him?

title: Imprisoned
text: I'm just tossing ideas around.

title: Imprisoned
text: I tried talking the earthbenders into fighting back but, it didn't work! If there was just a way to help them help themselves.

title: Imprisoned
text: For that they'd need some kind of earth, or some rock. Something they can bend.

title: Imprisoned
text: [Lays her palm to the surface.] But this entire place is made of metal!

title: Imprisoned
text: No, it's not. [Points to smokestacks.] Look at the smoke! I bet they're burning coal. In other words, earth.

title: Imprisoned
text: Morning arrives, the scene gaining light. Sokka and Katara are alone by an air duct. Sokka is peering down into it, while Katara kneels beside it with her hands on its rim.

title: Imprisoned
text: It's almost dawn. We're running out of time! You sure this is gonna work?

title: Imprisoned
text: It should. These vents reminded me of our little trick back at the village. We're gonna do the same thing, but on a much bigger scale. [The camera zooms through a visual walkthrough of Sokka's explanation.] There's a huge deposit of coal at the base of the silo. And the whole system is ventilated. Aang closed off all the vents except one. When he does his airbending the coal only has one place to go, right back here.

title: Imprisoned
text: There's the intruder!

title: Imprisoned
text: The two siblings are suddenly surrounded by a number of spear-wielding Fire Nation guards. The prisoners have gathered a safe distance away from this spectacle, observing what is happening.

title: Imprisoned
text: Stay back! I'm warning you! [Pulls out his boomerang, turning back-to-back with his sister.]

title: Imprisoned
text: [Roughly.] Katara, stop! You can't win this fight!

title: Imprisoned
text: Listen to him well, child. You're one mistake away from dying where you stand.

title: Imprisoned
text: A sudden rush of air fills their ears as the facility shakes. The ventilation shaft bursts off its hinges as an immense blast of coal soars into the air, crashing down into a gathered pile. Everyone present is silent, staring in stark surprise at this turn of events. Lastly, Aang leaps out from the barren ventilation shaft, landing atop the coal pile and coughing, covered in soot and dirt. Momo follows him and Katara runs up to the coal, turning to face the earthbenders.

title: Imprisoned
text: [Lifting up a piece of coal.] Here's your chance, earthbenders! Take it! Your fate is in your own hands!

title: Imprisoned
text: Haru bolts ahead without hesitation, prepared to bend the waiting coal as a weapon. Tyro throws his hand up, bracing his son's chest to halt his advance.

title: Imprisoned
text: [Bursts out into highly amused laughter.] Foolish girl. You thought a few inspirational words and some coal would change these people? Look at these blank, hopeless faces. Their spirits were broken a long time ago. [Katara's expression dims as she does as instructed, staring at the forlorn prisoners.] Oh, but you still believe in them. How sweet. They're a waste of your energy little girl. You failed.

title: Imprisoned
text: The warden finishes his speech by turning to take leave of the facility. As he does so, a single piece of coal sails through the air and pelts the back of his head. Outraged, the warden spins back to see who dared toÂ attack him. Haru stands defiantly levitating three pieces of coal above his hand. The warden sends a blast of fire toward Haru, but the fire is blocked, as Tyro raises a wall of coal in his defense.

title: Imprisoned
text: [Guards line up and prepare for battle.] Show no mercy! [The guards send a blast of fire as one toward the rebelling prisoners.]

title: Imprisoned
text: [The earthbenders work together to haul a sizable mass of coal to block the fire.] For the Earth Kingdom, attack!

title: Imprisoned
text: Slamming the coal to the ground; chunks of rock assault the guards. The battle immediately flares, prisoners ducking blasts of fire and countering with fists of coal. Katara and Aang chase after Sokka as he snaps soldiers spears in two with his boomerang, tossing the broken shafts to Momo overhead. Momo continues to collect other pieces of broken spears that are thrown up to him.

title: Imprisoned
text: Get to the ships! We'll hold them off!

title: Imprisoned
text: Do not let them escape!

title: Imprisoned
text: [Generates an air funnel and holds it between his hands; to Katara and Sokka.] Guys! Throw me some coal!

title: Imprisoned
text: Katara and Sokka drop heaps of coal into his funnel, firing the material rapidly at the warden and his fellow benders, knocking them to the ground. Following this, Tyro and two other earthbenders work together to lift coal beneath these adversaries, moving them away from the rig and over the ocean.

title: Imprisoned
text: [Pleading.] No, please! I can't swim!

title: Imprisoned
text: Don't worry. I hear cowards float. [Drops their enemies into the ocean.]

title: Imprisoned
text: On the barge headed to their homes, Haru and Tyro approach Katara on its deck.

title: Imprisoned
text: I want to thank you for saving me. For saving us.

title: Imprisoned
text: [Turning to face Haru. Denying.] All it took was a little coal.

title: Imprisoned
text: It wasn't the coal, Katara. It was you. [Katara blushes.]

title: Imprisoned
text: Thank you for helping me find my courage, Katara of the Water Tribe. My family and everyone here owes you much.

title: Imprisoned
text: So, I guess you're going home now.

title: Imprisoned
text: Yes. To take back my village. [Raises his voice to the crowd on the lower deck.] To take back all of our villages! The Fire Nation will regret the day they set foot on our land! [Crowd cheers at Tyro's bravado.]

title: Imprisoned
text: [To Katara.] Come with us.

title: Imprisoned
text: I can't. Your mission is to take back your home. Ours is to get Aang to the North Pole. [Gazes over the rail to see Momo join Aang atop Appa's head, floating in the ocean.]

title: Imprisoned
text: That's him, isn't it? The Avatar. [Aang airbends an encased piece of coal. Momo jumps into his lap.] Katara, thank you for bringing my father back to me. I never thought I'd see him again. I only wish there was some way ...

title: Imprisoned
text: I know. [Reaches for her necklace wistfully, but realizes it is not around her neck and panics.] My mother's necklace! It's gone!

title: Imprisoned
text: Back on the prison rig, Zuko stands alone facing the sunset amid coal lying sparsely on the deck. He seizes Katara's necklace in his fingers, lifting it to stare at it grimly.

title: Imprisoned
text: Fade to credits.

title: Imprisoned
text: Aang

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: The episode opens to a cloudy sky, looking toward the ground. The point of view switches to one above the clouds as they pass by. A messenger hawk floats into view, emitting a cry. When Appa overshadows the bear and roars, it shrieks again and stoops down, swiveling out of view. The camera shifts to a side-view of Appa soaring along with Aang, Katara and Sokka in his saddle.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: [Voice-over; somewhat dreamily.] Those clouds look so soft, [Cut to Aang sitting lazily atop Appa's head, a twig in his mouth; the view pans to the left, showing Sokka carving something with an uninterested look on his face, Katara lying on her stomach, popped up on her elbows, staring dreamingly over the rim of Appa's saddle, and Momo sleeping on the luggage.] don't they? Like you could just jump down and you'd land in a big, soft, cottony heap?

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: [Turns to Katara; mockingly with a smile.] Maybe you should give it a try.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: [Looks at Sokka with annoyance; sarcastically as she looks away from him.] You're hilarious.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: [Frontal shot; excitedly.] I'll try it! [Carrying his staff, he jumps off Appa with a big smile on his face. As he begins to fall, he turns once around his axis, winking at the camera as he passes. He falls down spreadeagled, laughing joyously.] Yeah!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Cut to a side-view of Appa's saddle as Katara and Sokka pop their heads over the rim, looking down in the direction Aang went. Cut to an upward looking shot following Aang falling down, still smiling broadly. As he passes the camera, it tilts down, following him as he vanishes in a cloud. Cut back to the siblings; Katara looks somewhat worried, while Sokka gazes wide-eyed at the point where Aang vanished. When he leans over to search the sky, Aang comes back up from behind them on his glider. The siblings turn around as they hear the snapping noise of Aang's glider being closed, and they watch how the airbender plops down on the saddle, his legs spread apart and a big smile on his face. Cut to a side-view of an unimpressed looking Sokka, before switching back to a frontal shot of Aang who is dripping wet.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: [Looking at himself.] Turns out, clouds are made of water.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: He breaths in deeply and slams his balled, right fist against his stretched left hand, creating an expanding air ball around him in the process, drying himself off. As Aang leans back to rest on both his hands, he contently looks at Momo, whose fur got all fluffed by Aang's airbending. Cut to a side-view of Sokka, who is still looking at Aang unimpressed. Katara glances at her brother, but her attention is drawn to something over his shoulder.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Hey, what is that?

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Sokka looks over his right shoulder in the direction Katara is looking as well. Katara gets up and walks to the front of Appa's saddle. Cut to a shot of the landscape in front of them, a large, dark patch of burned land standing out among the lush green of the forest. Cut to a frontal view of the trio now all looking over the front rim of Appa's saddle, surprised looks on their faces.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: [Camera zooms in.] It's like a scar ...

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: The scene fades to a ground view of the scorched forest. The camera pans to the right, showing many burned trees, and Team Avatar standing in the middle of a gray, barren patch.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: [Voice-over.] Listen. [Cut to a frontal shot of a sad-looking Aang, his friends behind him.] It's so quiet. There's no life anywhere.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Aang? Are you okay?

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: [Noticing footprints; angrily.] Fire Nation! Those evil savages make me sick! They have no respect for -

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Shhh!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: [Whispering angrily.] What? I'm not allowed to be angry?

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Katara points to Aang with a somewhat concerned look on her face as he slumps over, downcast at the sight.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: [Kneels down and sighs. He picks up some ash as it slowly seeps through his hand and drops to the ground; sadly.] Why would anyone do this? How could I let this happen?

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Aang, you didn't let this happen. It has nothing to do with you.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: [Sadly.] Yes, it does. It's the Avatar's job to protect nature. But I don't know how to do my job.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: That's why we're going to the North Pole. [Smiling softly.] To find you a teacher.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Yeah. A waterbending teacher. But there's no one who can teach me how to be the Avatar. Monk Gyatso said that Avatar Roku would help me.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: The Avatar before you? He died over a hundred years ago; how are you supposed to talk to him?

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: I don't know. [Momo comes up to Aang and settles in his lap.]

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: In another area, Zuko comes looking for Iroh.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Uncle! It's time to leave! Where are you? Uncle Iroh!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: [Relaxing in a hot spring.] Over here!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Uncle? We need to move on. We're closing in on the Avatar's trail and I don't want to lose him.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: You look tired, Prince Zuko. Why don't you join me in these hot springs and soak away your troubles?

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: My troubles cannot be soaked away. It's time to go!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: You should take your teacher's advice and relax a little. The temperature's just right. I heated it myself. [He breathes steam through his nose.]

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Enough! We need to leave now. Get out of the water!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Very well! [He gets up, exposing himself.]

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: [Shielding his eyes.] On second thought, why don't you take another few minutes? But be back at the ship in a half-hour or I'm leaving without you!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Iroh sighs as he slumps back into the water.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: [Approaches Aang.] Hey, Aang! You ready to be cheered up?

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: [Sadly.] No. [An acorn is thrown at him.] Ow! Hey, how is that cheering me up?

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: [Chuckles.] Cheered me up. [An acorn gets thrown at him.] Ow. Yeah, I probably deserved that.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: These acorns are everywhere, Aang. That means the forest will grow back! Every one of these will be a tall oak tree someday, and all the birds and animals that lived here will come back. [She places the acorn in his hand and closes it.]

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Thanks, Katara.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Katara smiles at him before gasping at the sight of an old man approaching.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Hey, who are you?

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: When I saw the flying bison, I thought it was impossible! [Approaches Aang.] But, those markings ... are you the Avatar, child? [Aang look to Katara, who nods. He nods himself.] My village desperately needs your help!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: The scene cuts to them at Senlin Village at sunset. The village has been partially destroyed. The wanderer leads them into the center building.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: This young person is the Avatar!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: So, the rumors of your return are true! It is the greatest honor of a lifetime to be in your presence.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Nice to meet you too! So ... is there something I can help you with?

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: I'm not sure ...

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Our village is in crisis, he's our only hope! [To Aang.] For the last few days at sunset, a spirit monster comes and attacks our village. He is Hei Bai, the black and white spirit.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Why is it attacking you?

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: We do not know, but each of the last three nights, he has abducted one of our own. We are especially fearful because the winter solstice draws near.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: What happens then?

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: As the solstice approaches, the natural world and the Spirit World grow closer and closer until the line between them is blurred completely.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Hei Bai is already causing devastation and destruction. Once the solstice is here, there's no telling what will happen.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: So, what do you want me to do, exactly?

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Who better to resolve a crisis between our world and the Spirit World than the Avatar himself? You are the great bridge between man and spirits.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Right ... that's me.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Hey great bridge guy, could I talk to you over here for a second? [She leads him toward a window.] Aang, you seem a little unsure about all of this.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Yeah, that might be because I don't know anything at all about the Spirit World. It's not like there's someone to teach me this stuff!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: So ... can you help these people?

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: I have to try, don't I? Maybe whatever I have to do will just ... come to me. [Momo lands on his shoulder.]

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: [With a kind and reassuring smile.] I think you can do it, Aang.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: [With a similar expression.] Yeah. [Brief pause.] We're all going to get eaten by a spirit monster.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Cut back to the hot spring. A sleeping Iroh is awoken by nearby stirring in the trees.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Who's there? [He sees a rat-like animal.] A meadow vole! I should have known. [He takes the creature into the palm of his hand.] You startled me, little one. [Sighs.] It seems I dozed off and missed my nephew's deadline, but it was a very sweet nap.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: The meadow vole leaps up and down. This is followed by shaking and the ground moving toward Iroh. Suddenly, the rock at the bottom of the spring jumps up, capturing him. Three Earth Kingdom soldiers surround him.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: [Picks up Iroh's clothes.] He's a Fire Nation soldier.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: He's no ordinary soldier. This is the Fire Lord's brother, the Dragon of the West. The once-great General Iroh, but now, he's our prisoner.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Iroh gives the captain a stern look.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: [Walking toward the village entrance.] Hello, Spirit? Can you hear me? This is the Avatar speaking. I'm here to try to help stuff.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Cut to the building interior. Sokka and Katara watch.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: This isn't right. We can't sit here and cower while Aang waits for some monster to show up.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: If anyone can save us, he can.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: He still shouldn't have to face this alone.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: The sun sets and night falls. Cut back to Aang.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: The sun has set. Where are you, Hei Bai? Well ... spirit ... uhhh ... I hereby ask you to please leave this village in peace. [He spins his staff and sticks it down, in apparent authority.] Okay ... well ... I guess that's settled, then.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: He walks away. Behind him, however, the Hei Bai fades into the real world. He walks right behind Aang, who turns to see him.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: You must be the Hei Bai spirit. My name isâ

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: The spirit releases a burst of energy at him. It moves past him.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: My name's Aang! I'm the Avatar and I would like to help. Hey, wait up! [Hei Bai wreaks havoc, smashing buildings and destroying a tower with energy.] Uhhh.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: The Avatar's methods are ... unusual.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: It doesn't seem too interested in what he's saying. Maybe we should go help him.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: No. Only the Avatar stands a chance against the Hei Bai.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Aang will figure out the right thing to do, Sokka.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Hei Bai smashes another building.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Please, would you stop destroying things and listen? I'm trying to do my job as spirit bridge! Excuse me, would please turn around? I command you to turn around now!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: The spirit hits Aang and sends him flying to the roof of another building.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: That's it. He needs help. [Exits the building.]

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Sokka, wait! [Starts to follow him.]

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: [Stops her.] It's not safe!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Hei Bai, over here! [He throws his boomerang at him, but it barely affects the monster. He runs toward it.]

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Sokka, go back!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: We'll fight him together, Aang.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: I don't want to fight him unless Iâ [Sokka is taken by the Hei Bai, and the spirit flees. Aang chases it.]

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: [Running to the village entrance.] Sokka! [The villagers go the entrance as well. Katara is left standing fearful.]

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Back near the hot spring. Two soldiers and Zuko look for Iroh.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Uncle! Uncle, where are you?

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Sir, maybe he thought you left without him.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Something's not right here. That pile of rocks.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: It looks like there's been a landslide, sir.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Land doesn't slide uphill. Those rocks didn't move naturally. [Stands up straight.] My Uncle's been captured by earthbenders!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Back to the forest. Aang continues to pursue the Hei Bai, looking for Sokka.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Aang! Over here! Help!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Hang on, Sokka!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Aang pulls out his hand, trying to free Sokka. However, before he can grab him, the spirit fades away, taking Sokka with it. Aang falls in front of a bear-like statue, knocked out.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Sokka! [He realizes Sokka is nowhere to be seen.] I failed.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: The next scene cuts back to the soldiers who captured Iroh. They are riding ostrich horses. One soldier carries a torch with him for light.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Where are you taking me?

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: We're taking you to face justice.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Right, but where, specifically?

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: A place you're quite familiar with, actually. You once laid siege to it for 600 days, but it would not yield to you.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Ah, the great city of Ba Sing Se.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: It was greater than you were, apparently.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: I acknowledge my defeat at Ba Sing Se. After 600 days away from home, my men were tired, and I was tired. [Yawns.] And I'm still tired. [He falls off one of the horses. He is quickly picked back up. However, he leaves one of his sandals behind and smiles cleverly.]

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Cut back to Senlin Village. Katara awaits at the village entrance for Sokka and Aang. The Old wanderer approaches her.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: I'm sure they'll be back.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: I know.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: [Places a blanket around her.] You should get some rest.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Everything's going to be okay ...

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Your brother is in good hands. I would be shocked if the Avatar returned without him. [As he is speaking, Aang approaches.]

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Katara? Katara, I lost him.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: The sun rises.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: The sun is rising. Perhaps he will return soon.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: [His appearance is blue.] What? No, I'm right here! [He waves his hand in the Wanderer's face, only to notice his own appearance.] I'm in the Spirit World!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Cut back to the forest. Zuko comes up on Iroh's sandal.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: [Sniffs and gets a disgusted look.] Yeah, that's Uncle Iroh. [He re-mounts his rhino.]

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Back at the Village.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: I'll figure this out, Katara. I promise. Like they said, I'm the bridge between the worlds, right? All I have to do is ... figure out what I have to do. But once I do that, no problem. [Appa approaches.] Appa! Hey buddy, I'm right here! [He breathes on Katara.] But, I guess you can't see me either.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: It's okay, Appa, don't worry. I'm sure they're on their way back. I bet they even found you a bunch of moon peaches for a treat. [The two return the village.]

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: What am I supposed to do? Avatar Roku, how can I talk to you? [He hears something.] Sokka? [He notices a dragon coming toward him.] That's definitely not Sokka. [He tries to fly away but cannot. He notices his airbending is not working at all.] What? I can't airbend in the Spirit World. [The dragon lands just before him.] You don't know where Sokka is, do you? [The dragon touches him. He sees a vision of Roku flying on this dragon.] You're Avatar Roku's animal guide! Like Appa is to me! I need to save my friend and I don't know how! Is there some way for me to talk to Roku? [The dragon curls around him, and he gets on him.] I'll be back, Katara. [It gets up.] Take me to Roku! [The dragon flies away.]

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Cut to a mountain the earthbenders are leading Iroh through. Iroh looks at the skies and notices the dragon and Aang. He gasps in wonder.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: What's the problem?

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Nothing. [Pauses.] Actually, there is a bit of a problem. My old joints are sore and aching, and these shackles are too loose.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Too loose?

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: That's right. The cuffs move and jangle around and bump my wrists. It would help me if you tighten them so they wouldn't shake around so much.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Very well. Corporal, tighten the prisoner's handcuffs.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: They all stop. The corporal dismounts and moves to Iroh. As he touches his handcuffs, Iroh breathes deeply and heats them up. He pushes the corporal's hand to the cuffs, causing him to scream in pain. Iroh jumps free and blasts fire at the soldiers. He rolls down the hill as the soldiers try to get control of their ostrich horses.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Hey, what are you doing? [He screams, but they fly right through the roof and into a mysterious room. Within is a celestial calendar and a statue of Roku.] I don't understand, this is just a statue of Roku. [Fang presses one of his feelers to Aang's forehead. A vision of a comet appears to him.] Is that what Roku wants to talk to me about? A comet? When can I talk to him? [Fang moves his head, allowing a light beam to appear. This is just to the right of Roku's statue. With another feeler press, he sees a vision of the sun setting and rising repeatedly, and the light closing in on Roku.] It's a calendar, and the light will reach Roku on the solstice! So, that's when I'll be able to speak to Roku? [The dragon breathes an apparent yes.] But I can't wait that long! I need to save Sokka now! [The dragon takes Aang from the temple.]

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Cut back to Iroh rolling down the hill. One of the soldiers hits him with a rockslide. All of the soldiers chase after him, reaching him at the bottom of the hill.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: He's too dangerous, Captain! We just can't just carry him to the Capital! We have to do something now!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: I agree. He must be dealt with immediately and severely.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Iroh spits a rock out.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: It's no use, Appa. I don't seem them anywhere. Our best hope is to go back to the village and wait. [She re-directs Appa to the village's direction.]

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: While following the ostrich horse footprints, Zuko notices Appa.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: The Avatar! [He turns slightly, but looks back at the footprints.]

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Fang takes Aang back to the statue at fast speed. Aang notices his body is there and also prepares for impact. Suddenly, Fang disappears into the statue and Aang is returned to his body. He looks around at the statue, opens his glider, and flies back to the village.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: You're back! [She embraces Aang.] Where's Sokka?

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: I'm not sure ...

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: The evening gives way to night.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: These dangerous hands must be crushed. [He brings up and prepares to drop it. However, Zuko jumps in and kicks the rock away before breaking Iroh's chain with his boot.]

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Excellent form, Prince Zuko.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: You taught me well.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Surrender yourselves. It's five against two. You're clearly outnumbered.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Yeah, that's true, but you are clearly outmatched.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: The solders fire rocks, but Iroh destroys them with the chains. Zuko takes out two soldiers with fire. A rock is fired at him, but Iroh catches it and throws it back at the soldiers, knocking them down. The Captain fires three rocks at Zuko, which he dodges. Zuko counters with fire blasts that are dodged. The captain brings up a large mass of rock, however, Iroh throws his chains around his ankles, knocking him and causing the rocks to fall on top of him. The soldiers are heard groaning underneath the rocks.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Now would you please put on some clothes?

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Cut back to Senlin. Aang awaits at the entrance for the Hei Bai. After some time, he gives up and returns to the center building. Just as he exits, however, the spirit appears to his left. He throws up an air shield to stop its attack.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Aang, what are you doing?! Run!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: The spirit prepares to resume its attack when Aang jumps in front of it. He feels its forehead and notices that a panda lurks below it.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: You're the spirit of this forest! Now I understand. You're upset and angry because your home was burned down. When I saw the forest had burned, I was sad and upset, but my friend gave me hope that the forest would grow back. [He shows it the acorn and leaves it at his feet. The spirit picks it up and reverts to the panda form. It walks away peacefully. As it exits, a series of branches grow, and three villagers and Sokka emerge from it.]

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Sokka! [She runs to him and embraces him, while other villagers embrace their loved ones.]

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: What happened?

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: You were trapped in the Spirit World for 24 hours! How are you feeling?

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Like I seriously need to use the bathroom. [Katara gives Sokka a somewhat disgusted look.]

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Thank you, Avatar. If only there were a way to repay you for what you've done.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: You could give us some supplies, and some money.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Sokka!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: What? We need stuff.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: It would be an honor to help you prepare for your journey.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: I'm so proud of you, Aang. You figured out what to do, all on your own.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Actually, I did have a little help and there's something else.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: What is it?

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: I need to talk to Roku and I think I found a way to contact his spirit.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: That's great!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Creepy, but great.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: There's a temple on a crescent-shaped island and if I go there on the solstice, I'll be able to speak with him.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: But the solstice is tomorrow!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Yeah, and there's one more problem. The island is in the Fire Nation.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: The siblings grow fearful. The shot slowly moves up to the moon over the hills.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Fade to credits.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 1: The Spirit World
text: Aang

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: The scene opens to a full moon in the sky. The camera pans down and shows Senlin Village during early morning hours. Cut to a view from among the houses, slowly zooming in on Aang who tries to get Appa to move, yanking on the reins, though the bison continually refuses and sits down.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Strained voice.] Let's go, Appa! Come on, boy! [Appa roars in protest and sits down. Cut to a close side-view; Aang sadly addresses his pet.] Look I'm sorry, but Katara and Sokka aren't coming to the Fire Nation with us. [Frontal shot; looks down and away, sadly.] If they got hurt, I'd never forgive myself. [Cut back to the side-shot; sternly, emphasizing his command by straightening himself.] So get your big butt off the ground and let's go!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: He jerks at the reins, stretching them out, but is flung to the ground when the ropes pull him back as Appa did not move a muscle. Cut to a forlorn looking Aang, sitting spread-legged on the ground.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Voice-over; Aang gasps in surprise and looks over his right shoulder and over his left, turning around in search for the origins of the voice.] I think his big butt is trying to tell ya something.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Cut to a frontal shot of Appa as the camera swiftly pans to the right to reveal a collection of Senlin villagers, with Katara and Sokka standing in the front.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Desperately.] Please don't go Aang. The world can't afford to lose you to the Fire Nation. [Closer shot of Katara's pleading face.] Neither can I.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Looks away sadly and recalls an image of Sozin's Comet.] But I have to talk to Avatar Roku to find out what my vision means! [Side-shot as he approaches his friends.] I need to get to the Fire Temple before the sun sets on the solstice. That's today!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Aang airbends himself atop Appa's head. Close shot of him looking back with a sad expression on his face as he prepares to leave. As Appa stands up, the shot changes to a frontal view, and Katara and Sokka run to stand before the bison, preventing him from moving any further.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: We're not letting you go into the Fire Nation, Aang.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Aang stares curiously.] At least, not without your friends. We got your back. [Momo soars up and perches atop Aang's shoulder, and Appa licks Sokka, who angrily looks at the bison.] Ew!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: It's a long journey to the Crescent Island. [Hands Aang a small bundle.] You'll have to fly fast to have any chance of making it before sundown. Good luck.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Thank you for your-

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Interrupts sharply, yelling. Points toward the ocean.] Go!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Appa takes off with Aang, Momo, Katara, and Sokka. Later that morning, the Senlin Village leader exits a building, but he stops in his track upon finding Zuko standing in his path. In the background, Iroh is sitting on a komodo rhino.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [The Senlin Village leader gasps.] Having trouble sleeping? [Pushes the man back through the door, knocking him down. Frontal shot as he approaches him.] Seen the Avatar lately?

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Day has come. Appa soars over the ocean. Aang, Katara, and Sokka all watch the ocean fearfully.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Come on boy, we've got a long way to go. Faster!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Close-up.] Sailing into Fire Nation waters ... Of all the foolish things you've done in your sixteen years, Prince Zuko, this is the most foolish!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: I have no choice, Uncle.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Angrily.] Have you completely forgotten that the Fire Lord banished you? [Fearfully.] What if you're caught?

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Breaks away from telescope to talk to his uncle.] I'm chasing the Avatar! My father will understand why I am returning home!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: You give him too much credit. My brother is not the understanding type!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Looks back into his telescope. Dark scope view reveals Appa mid-flight.] There they are. Helmsman! Full steam ahead!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Looking back to Zuko's ship.] Aang. We've got trouble!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Panicked.] Yeah! And it's gaining, fast!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: A Fire Nation catapult is raised to the deck of Zuko's ship. It is loaded with a steaming projectile.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Waving a fan at his face.] Uh, really Prince Zuko, couldn't you shoot them down with something more fragrant?

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Lights the stinking ball with a fire punch.] On my mark! Fire!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: A guard beside him slices the rope holding back the catapult. The flaming projectile races toward Appa.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Yelling.] Fireball!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: I'm on it!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Aang, Katara, and Sokka all make faces and grasp their noses.] We have to get out of Zuko's range, before he shoots another hot stinker at us!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Can't you make Appa go any faster?

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Yeah. But there's just one little problem.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Close-up. Eyes widening.] A blockade.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Birds-eye view of a two-row line of Fire Nation ships stretching across the ocean as far as the eye can see. Brief glimpse of numerous Fire Nation catapults prepared to fire.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Technically you are still in Earth Kingdom waters. Turn back now and they cannot arrest you.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: If we fly north, we can go around the Fire Nation ships and avoid the blockade! It's the only way.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: There's no time!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: This is exactly why I didn't want you to come! It's too dangerous!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: And that's exactly why we're here.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Boldly.] Let's run this blockade! [Both Katara and Sokka grin confidently.]

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Appa, yip-yip! [Appa roars readily, sailing forward even quicker.]

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: He's not turning around!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Please Prince Zuko! If the Fire Nation captures you, there is nothing I can do! Do not follow the Avatar.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Lowers his head, closes his eyes, and clenches his hands into fists. Sorrowfully.] I'm sorry, Uncle. [Raises his head, opens his eyes, and thrusts his right hand forward commandingly.] Run the blockade!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Gazing through telescope.] The Avatar. [Lowers telescope lens to spot Zuko's ship.] And the banished prince. [Lowers telescope.] This must be my lucky day.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Commander Zhao. What are your orders?

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Shoot the bison down, captain.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Surprised.] But there's a Fire Navy ship out there, sir! One of our own! What if it's hit?

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: So be it. [Captain backs up in shock. Zhao continues coolly.] It belongs to a traitor. [Command.] Ignite. Launch!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: The sky becomes littered with flaming fireballs fired from the blockade. View from Zuko's ship as the fireballs fill the sky. Close-up of a screaming Aang, Sokka, and Katara. Zoom out as Appa evades numerous fireballs, some exploding mid-air. Camera switch to forward view, close-up, as they fly through a blanket of fireballs. The team flies directly through one that exploded before them, Appa's fur darkened from the explosion. Katara, Sokka, and Momo all slap out embers on Appa's fur.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Appa, are you okay? [Appa roars a reply. They soar higher into the clouds.]

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: On the ocean surface, Zuko's ship is narrowly missing many falling fireballs. Sheets of ocean water crash over the ship, and crew members run for safety. A single fireball explodes on the aft side of the vessel.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Prince Zuko! The engines are damaged! We need to stop and make repairs!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Spins away from the man, facing the blockade.] Do not stop this ship.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Launch!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Close-up of Aang's view. Just over a cloud; fireballs burst through everywhere and smoke fills the screen. Aang, Katara, and Sokka scream and duck away, while Katara and Sokka grip Appa's saddle. Appa dodges many fireballs before two collide and explode in front of him. Sokka is thrown from the saddle and begins to plunge for the ocean, screaming anew.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Cries out desperately.] Sokka! [Whips the reins down and begins a speedy descent in chase of Sokka.]

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Appa reaches Sokka just in time. Katara grabs his hand, pulling him back into saddle. Appa skims the ocean surface. A fish appears out of nowhere and slaps Sokka square in the face, knocking him into the saddle. Momo leaps up and grabs the fish as Appa continues his swift flight mere feet above the ocean. Fireballs crash into the water all around them.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Ready ... [Holds hand up, issuing his command.]

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Close-up of Appa's view, approaching the ships. Camera switch once to Zhao, moving to prepare the signal. Back to Aang, a look of obstinate determination overcomes him.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Fire!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: A single catapult launches a fire blast directly toward Appa. Close-up of Aang's eye as it snaps open, unafraid. Aang airbends forward off of Appa's head. He uses a powerful airbending kick, and the flaming boulder explodes in a large smoky blast. Aang falls back to Appa's head, Katara and Sokka grabbing him. Appa soars safely over the blockade, passing them.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Ecstatic.] We made it!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Katara and Sokka each grimacing in terror.] We got into the Fire Nation. [Meekly.] Great.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Where do you think the Avatar is headed, sir?

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: I'm not sure. [Turns aside, gazes at Zuko's smoking ship.] But I bet a certain banished prince will know.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Scene switch to just overhead Zuko's ship. His small vessel approaches two ships in the blockade. These two ships sail opposite directions, in a moment they will close off Zuko's ship's path.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: We're on a collision course!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Confidently.] We can make it!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Captain stands ahead of a squad of nine firebenders.] The boarding party is ready to apprehend Prince Zuko, sir.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Swiftly.] Wait! Cut the engines, and let them pass.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Sir?

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Each ship in the blockade halts, allowing Zuko's ship to glide by beneath their deck, untouched. Zhao stands high, sharing an interlocked gaze with the banished prince below. Zuko and Iroh look behind them in silence as they sail safely through. Iroh strokes his gray beard curiously.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: The scene cuts back to Appa, flying among blue skies. Sokka and Katara sit up in the saddle, while Aang sits on Appa's head.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Close-up. Momo is shown bouncing about in eager surprise.] There it is! [Sokka and Katara pop up in the saddle.] The island where Roku's dragon took me. [Full view of Crescent Island and its smoking volcano as Appa descends.]

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Appa is lying at the base of a stone bridge leading up to the island's mountain. The bridge ends at an elegant, multi-story Fire Temple. Lava is flowing beneath the bridge. The air is thick with steam. Aang stands by Appa's head, and Katara stands to Appa's side. Sokka is stretching further away.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Rubs against Appa's head.] You did it buddy. Nice flying. [Appa bellows in satisfaction, rolling to his side to wave his three legs into the air lazily. Appa's tongue lolls out.]

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Smiles sweetly and approaches Appa. Rubs his belly.] Aww, you must be tired.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Joyous. Katara's expresses dumbfounded interest.] No! I'm good. Refreshed and ready to fight some firebenders! [Continues to work out and flex his body.]

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Props hand off hip. Responds dryly.] I was talking to Appa.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Instantly halts exercise.] Well ... I was talking to Momo. [Points to the lemur clinging to a dead tree's branch.]

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Scene cut to Katara, Sokka, Aang, and Momo walking along the stone bridge to approach a multi-story Fire Temple.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Close-up, top-to-bottom view of the Fire Temple.] I don't see any guards.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Camera drops to show the group taking cover behind a lower wall below steps.] The Fire Nation must have abandoned the temple when Avatar Roku died.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: It's almost sundown. We better hurry! [The group leaps over the wall and charges for the front door.]

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [The group tip-toes through an enormous chamber with fire-decor columns.] Wait. I think I heard something.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Turning around, they see five men standing in the hallway dressed in red with tall hats.] We are the Fire Sages. Guardians of the temple of the Avatar.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Great! I am the Avatar!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: We know. [Inhales briskly before punching a blast of fire their direction.]

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Deflects three balls of fire with his airbending. Close-up. Shouts over his shoulder.] I'll hold them off. Run!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
