text: Aang leaps forward and spins his leg across the ground, sending a low air blade that sweeps the Fire Sages' legs out from beneath them, and they all fall to the ground. Aang flees after his friends.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: If the Avatar contacts Roku, there's no telling how powerful the boy will become! Split up and find him.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Hallway view; Aang skids in front of Katara and Sokka and continues running.] Follow me!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Do you know where you're going? [The two follow Aang.]

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Rounds a corner and disappears from sight.] Nope! [A moment passes, Katara and Sokka stop when Aang skids into view again. Fearfully.] Wrong way! [Runs past them.]

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Rounds the corner, frightening Sokka and Katara to chase after Aang.] Come back!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: The trio turns another corner and charges down the hallway. However, they reach a dead-end as Aang skids to an immediate halt. Turning around, they face Shyu, who raises a hand in peace.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: I don't want to fight you! I am a friend.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Firebenders aren't our friends! [Aang steps ahead of his friends, assuming an airbending posture.]

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Steps toward the Avatar, before dropping to his knees and pressing his palms to the floor in submission. This startles Aang, Katara, and Sokka.] I know why you're here, Avatar.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Surprised.] You do?

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Yes. [Rises from the floor to stand again.] You wish to speak to Avatar Roku. I can take you to him.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Skeptically.] How?

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Slides back a lamplight on the wall. Places palm on wall, focuses firebending into this location to open a secret passage.] This way.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Echoes in the distance.] Find him.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Briefly glances down the hall.] Time is running out! Quickly!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Aang and Katara exchange a look with one another, asserting each other's belief to trust this firebender. The group enters the passage and descends the steps into the cave. Shyu enters behind them and closes the passageway.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Close-up. Tightens knuckles on ship's railing. Smoke billows behind his ship.] What's he up to, Uncle? Why didn't Commander Zhao arrest me?

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Because he wants to follow you. He knows you'll lead him to the prize you're both after: the Avatar.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Close-up.] If Zhao wants to follow a trail of smoke, then that's exactly what I'll let him do.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Brief scene cut to show the sun nearly setting. Far overhead view of Shyu leading the group through caverns.] Avatar Roku once called this temple his home. He formed these secret passages out of the magma.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Did you know Avatar Roku?

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: No. But my grandfather knew him. Many generations of Fire Sages guarded this Fire Temple long before me. We all have a strong spiritual connection to this place.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Is that how you knew I was coming?

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: A few weeks ago, an amazing thing occurred. The statue of Avatar Roku; its eyes began to glow!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: That's when we were at the Air Temple. Avatar Roku's eyes were glowing there, too!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: At that moment, we knew you had returned to the world.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: If this is the Avatar's temple, why did the sages attack me?

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Things have changed. In the past, the sages were loyal only to the Avatar. When Roku died, the sages eagerly awaited for the next Avatar to return. But he never came.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Looking down, guiltily.] They were waiting for me.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Humorously mocking.] Hey don't feel bad. You're only a hundred years late! [Aang scowls heavily at Sokka.]

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: They lost hope the Avatar would ever return. When Fire Lord Sozin began the War, my grandfather and the other sages were forced to follow him. [Shakes head sadly.] I never wanted to serve the Fire Lord. When I learned you were coming, I knew I would have to betray the other sages.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Thank you for helping me. [Close-up as Shyu smiles to Aang.]

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Continues leading the group up a spiraling flight of stairs.] We'll follow these stairs to the sanctuary. [Time skip, Shyu continues talking as they near the top of the stairs.] Once you're inside, wait for the light to hit Avatar Roku's statue. Only then will you be able to speak with him.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Slides back a secret tile and climbs into the outer sanctuary. Massive columns with dragon statues atop them line the room. An immense door is before them with a device holding five open-mouthed dragons.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Gasps.] No!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Approaches door.] Shyu, what's wrong?

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: The sanctuary doors, they're closed!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Aang tugs at the door uselessly.] Can't you just open them with firebending? Like you opened that other door?

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: No. Only a fully realized Avatar is powerful enough to open this door alone. Otherwise, the sages must open this door together, [Sokka shown in deep thought.] with five simultaneous fire blasts.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Ponderously states.] Five fire blasts, huh? [Zoom out to show a lamplight above him.] I think I can help you out.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: The scene switches to Zuko's smoke-billowing ship. Close-up to show a small vessel holding Zuko being slid into the waters.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Uncle, keep heading north. Zhao will follow the smoke trail, while I use it as a cover.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Iroh grunts in doubt, stroking his beard in deep thought. Zuko's boat settles on the ocean's surface and disappears in the smoke. Switch to a telescope view of nothing but smoke. Zhao lowers telescope, staring with determination.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Kneeling. Pours oil into a bag.] This is a little trick I picked up from my father. I seal the lamp oil inside an animal skin casing, Shyu lights the oil soaked twine and, [Picks up bag, holds it proudly before him.] ta-da! Fake firebending!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Impressed.] You've really outdone yourself this time, Sokka.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: This might actually work.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Time skip. Sokka places his last bag into the dragon's mouth.] The sages will hear the explosion, so as soon as they go off, you rush in!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Hides behind a column with her brother. Holds Momo. Glances to the next column where Aang hides.] It's almost sunset. Are you ready?

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Definitely.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Shyu thrusts his finger forward, sending a small flare racing across the door to light all five bags at once. Shyu hurries to take cover. There is an intense explosion, producing a lot of smoke. Aang bursts forward and runs for the door. Aang strains to open the door, which has not budged.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Surprised.] They're still locked!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Sadly sighs. Sokka rises from hiding behind his sister.] It didn't work. [Aang falls to his knees.]

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Time skip. Everyone stands in front of the door. Aang beats upon it furiously with consecutive airbending slices.] Why, won't, it, open?!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Presses forward. Seizes Aang's arm.] Aang! Stop! [Relaxes, releasing his arm.] There's nothing else we can do ...

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Glumly.] I'm sorry I put you through all of this for nothing.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Examining the explosion. Runs his finger across the black soot.] I don't get it. That firebending looked as strong as any firebending I've seen.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [A moment passes. Sudden excitement.] Sokka, you're a genius!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Confused.] Wait. How is Sokka a genius? His plan didn't even work.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Pleasantly.] Come on Aang. Let her dream.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: You're right. Sokka's plan didn't work. But it looks like it did.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Dubiously.] Did the definition of genius change over the last hundred years? [Katara grasps her chin, slyly grinning toward Aang.]

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Time skip. Fire Sages run toward Shyu in front of the door.] Come quickly! The Avatar has entered the sanctuary!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: How did he get in?

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: I don't know. But look at the scorch marks! And down there! [Points to a shadow visible at the bottom of the door.]

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: He's inside! Open the doors, immediately! Before he contacts Avatar Roku!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Aang slides into position behind a nearby column as the five sages firebend the doors locks open. As the door opens, a sooty Momo is revealed sitting on the floor. Momo sneezes, blowing the soot off himself.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: It's the Avatar's lemur. He must have crawled through the pipes! We've been tricked!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Momo springs into action, leaping atop the Great Fire Sage's head and clinging to his hat. Katara charged forward, pulling a nearby sage's tunic over his head to blind him. Sokka grabs the lower skirt of a sage's outfit, lifting it completely over his body to cover his face.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Grabs the last free sage and hauls him into his grip, pinning him.] Now, Aang!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [A moment of silence.] Aang! Now's your chance!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Steps out from behind column. Grips Aang from behind, pinning Aang's arms behind him.] The Avatar's coming with me! [The captured sages use their captors' surprise to reclaim the upper hand, pinning their captors down. Momo flies off with the Great Fire Sage's hat.] Close the doors! Quickly!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Walking down steps, Aang glances over his shoulders to see Sokka and Katara being chained to a column. He breaks free, spinning behind Zuko to send him down the stairs with an airbending blast. Aang runs for Katara and Sokka.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Chained. Sees him coming toward her. Turns head toward the closing door.] Go!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Aang listens without hesitation, turning to charge for the door guarded by two sages. He leaps into the air to avoid the Great Fire Sage's fire punch. Aang bounces off his hands from each of the two sage's heads before sailing through the door just as it closes.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Pleased.] He made it!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Everyone looks away as the door seals with a blinding flash of white light. Inside, Aang is kneeling and looks up to a tall statue of Avatar Roku. A beam of red sunlight enters the room and strikes a glistening red jewel held by the statue.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Stands. Confused.] The light hits the statue and I talk to Roku. So why isn't anything happening?

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [He and four sages launch fire blasts into the door's locks. Nothing happens. Frustrated.] Why isn't it working? It's sealed shut!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: It must have been the light. Avatar Roku doesn't want us inside.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Exasperated. Standing in the middle of the room, facing the statue.] Why isn't anything happening? I don't know what I'm doing! All I know is airbending! Please Avatar Roku, talk to me!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Roku's statue turns red as sunlight engulfs it. Its eyes glow white. View of Aang as smoke fills the room. When the white smoke dissipates Avatar Roku is standing before him, they are on a mountaintop and only clouds are visible below.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: It's good to see you Aang. What took you so long? [Aang respectfully places a fist into his palm, bowing his head to the Avatar before him.]

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Firmly to Shyu, who is kneeling before him with his hands behind his back.] Why did you help the Avatar?

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Sadly and proudly.] Because it was once the sages' duty. It is still our duty.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Claps. Interrupts interrogation. Approaches with six firebender guards.] What a moving and heartfelt performance. I'm certain the Fire Lord will understand, when you explain why you betrayed him.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Places palms together. Bows head forward.] Commander Zhao.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: And Prince Zuko. It was a noble effort, but your little smokescreen didn't work. [Zuko scowls sharply. Firebenders step behind him, seizing his arms.] Two traitors in one day, the Fire Lord will be pleased.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Strains against his captor, snaps at Zhao.] You're too late, Zhao! The Avatar's inside and the doors are sealed.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: No matter. [Grins confidently.] Sooner or later, he has to come out. [Katara and Sokka share a worried glance.]

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: I have something very important to tell you, Aang. That is why, when you were in the Spirit World, I sent my dragon to find you.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Interested, curious.] Is it about that vision? The one of the comet?

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Yes.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: What does it mean?

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: One hundred years ago, [Viewers see a visual of a comet in the dark sky.] Fire Lord Sozin used that comet to begin the War. He and his firebending army harnessed its incredible power, and dealt a deadly first strike against the other nations.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Close-up.] So the comet made them stronger?

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Close-up.] Yes. Stronger than you could even imagine.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Close-up.] But that happened a hundred years ago. What does the comet have to do with the War now?

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Listen carefully. [Viewers see silhouette of Fire Lord Ozai standing amid flames, fists taut.] Sozin's Comet will return by the end of the summer, and Fire Lord Ozai will use its power to finish the War, once and for all. [Visual and audio of Ozai's silhouette roaring upward, fire streaming from his mouth.] If he succeeds, even the Avatar won't be able to restore balance to the world. Aang. You must defeat the Fire Lord, before the comet arrives.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Counters anxiously.] But I haven't even started learning waterbending! Not to mention earth and fire!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Mastering the elements takes years of discipline and practice. But if the world is to survive, you must do it by summer's end. [Close-up of a shocked Aang.]

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Firebenders, including Zhao and his crew, circle around the door's perimeter, assuming a firebending form. A monk chant begins for the audience only. They wait patiently for the door to open.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: When those doors open, [Shouts.] unleash all your firepower!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Worried.] How's Aang gonna make it out of this?

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Troubled, questioning.] How are we gonna make it out of this?

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Terrified.] What if I can't master all the elements in time? What if I fail?

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: I know you can do it Aang. [Close-up of half his face.] For you have done it before. [Close-up of half of Aang's now-smiling face.] The solstice is ending. We must go our separate ways, for now.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: But I won't be able to come back to the temple. What if I have questions? How will I talk to you?

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: I am a part of you. When you need to talk to me again, you will find a way. [Closes his eyes, providing Aang a vision of Fire Navy ships surrounding the island. Speaks to his mind without words.] A great danger awaits you at the temple. [Provides a vision of the awaiting firebenders on the other side of the door.] I can help you face the threat. But only if you are ready.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Eyes and arrows glow.] I'm ready.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Scene switches to the guard surrounding the door. The door glows bright white once again. Smoke streams come through into the room. The door unlocks itself, beginning to open. As it opens, a blinding white light forces all present to look away.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Ready ... [Light fades, revealing a pair of glowing white eyes in the darkness.]

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Sokka struggles against his chains. Katara is terrified.] No! Aang!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Fire! [He and his guards cooperate in blasting fire onto the unseen target.]

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: The wall of fire amasses, circling its new host as Avatar Roku, eyes aglow, is revealed behind the flames, untouched. Close-up of a shocked and horror-stricken Zhao.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [In awe.] Avatar Roku ...

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Avatar Roku draws the circling fire together in one motion. He sends it forward in one powerful wave that sears the room, blasting the offenders off their feet and melting the chains binding Katara, Sokka, Shyu, and Zuko with precision. View of outside the temple as the blast destroys the outer wall. Close-up of ghostly Avatar Roku, turning his glowing glare upon the offending sages. The sages panic, all turning to run from his wrath.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Implores.] Avatar Roku is going to destroy the temple! We have to get out of here!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Not without Aang!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Roku kneels into a forward strike, melting the floor with a molten firebending trail. He steadily lifts his hand, causing the stream of lava below to erupt into maddened explosions. The lava soars through the temple, tearing it apart. Zhao and his firebenders are shown fleeing for the temple's exit.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Aang sighs weakly and drops to his knees. Sokka and Katara approach Aang's sides, supportively lifting him back to his feet.] We got your back.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Weakly.] Thanks. Where's Shyu?

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [ Walking away with Sokka, helping Aang.] I don't know.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Visual of the temple as it begins to lean, due to the destruction caused. Aang, Katara and Sokka stare in horror upon seeing the stairwell leading to the exit filled with lava. They quickly turn to the only exit; the hole in the wall Roku had created. There is no escaping, as they are on the top level of the temple.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Turns angrily, snapping.] No Prince, no Avatar! Apparently, the only thing I do have is five traitors!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Interjects.] But Commander! Only Shyu helped the Avatar.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: [Close-up.] Save your stories for the Fire Lord. As far as I'm concerned, you are all guilty! [Orders.] Take them to the prison hold!

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: The scene changes to show Zuko spying with his telescope toward Appa flying away. He lowers the telescope and sails off in his vessel.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Fades to credits.

title: Winter Solstice, Part 2: Avatar Roku
text: Aang

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Scene opens with the camera zoomed out showing Appa flying in above the mountains with a few viewable trees, carrying Aang, Katara, Sokka, and Momo.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Aang is pacing around on Appa's saddle, breathing heavily.] Would you sit down? [Turns around from his perch on Appa's head.] If we hit a bump, you'll go flying off. What's bugging you anyway?

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Worriedly.] It's what Avatar Roku said. I'm supposed to master all four elements before that comet arrives.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [In a sarcastic, amused tone while facing Aang.] Well, let's see. You pretty much mastered airbending and that only took you a hundred and twelve years. I'm sure you can master three more elements by next summer.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Frightfully.] I haven't even started waterbending and we're still weeks away from the North Pole. What am I gonna do?

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Grabs Aang's arm.] Calm down, it's going to be okay. [Aang sits down in front of her.] If you want, I can try to teach you some of the stuff I know.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Smiling.] You'd do that?

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Nods and looks over the side of Appa's saddle.] We'll need to find a good source of water first.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Grinning; sarcastically.] Maybe we can find a puddle for you to splash in.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Cuts to Aang, Katara, Sokka, and Momo standing in front of a large waterfall and river.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Frowning beside Aang and Katara's ecstatic faces.] Nice puddle.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Appa flies down into the river and creates a huge splash that soaks and almost knocks Momo of the rock he is standing on, turns over, and floats on his back.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Takes off his shirt, smiling.] Yeah! Don't start without me, boy! [Begins to run toward the water.]

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Somewhat blankly.] Remember the reason we're here.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Stops short and looks at Katara.] Oh right. Time to practice waterbending. [Puts his clothes back on.]

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Sarcastically.] Great. So what am I supposed to do?

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: You could ... clean the gunk out of Appa's toes. [Hands Sokka a branch with a bushel of leaves at the end.]

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Frowns and crosses his arms.] So, while you guys are playing in the water, I'm supposed to be hard at work picking mud out of a giant bison's feet?

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Smiles; somewhat cheerfully.] Mud and bugs!

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Okay. [Takes stick and walks over to Appa who is floating in the water.]

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Scene changes to Zuko's ship in the ocean. On the deck, Zuko is practicing firebending with hisÂ  Lieutenant Lee when the boat turns and they are thrown to one side on their backs.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Close-up of his face; he glares at the tower.] Someone's changing our course.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Cuts to a crew member steering the ship at the top of the boat.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Storming in, yelling.] What is the meaning of this mutiny? No one told you to change course! [Shows Iroh and the rest of the crew playing Pai Sho behind them.]

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Actually, someone did. I assure you, it is a matter of utmost importance, Prince Zuko. [Scratches beard.]

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Hopefully.] Is it something to do with the Avatar?

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Even more urgent. It seems, I- [Rubs forehead in stress.] -I have lost my lotus tile. [Moves a piece of his across the Pai Sho board.]

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Confused.] Lotus tile?

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: For my Pai Sho game. Most people think the lotus tile insignificant, but it is essential for the unusual strategy that I employ.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [In disbelief.] You've changed our course for a stupid lotus tile?

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: See, you, like most people, underestimate it's value. Just give me ten minutes to check the merchants at this port of call. [Excitedly.] Hopefully, they will have the lotus tile in stock and I can get on with my life. [Zuko breathes fire up at the ceiling in anger and Iroh smiles.] I'm lucky to have such an understanding nephew.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: The room fills with smoke of Zuko's outburst, clouding the scene from view.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Yeah, don't get too happy. You've got to do me next. [Appa moans happily.]

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Shows Katara and Aang by the shore.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: This is a pretty basic move, but it still took me months to perfect. So don't get frustrated if you don't get it right away. [She moves her hands back and forth and makes small waves in the water, while Aang looks up, smiling.] Just push and pull the water like this. The key is getting the wrist movement right.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Stands up.] Like this? [Does the hand movements Katara is doing, but nothing is happening yet.]

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Kindly.] That's almost right. If you keep practicing I'm sure eventuallyâ

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Hey, I'm bending it already! [Shows Aang making much bigger waves than Katara's on his first try.]

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Surprised.] Wow, I can't believe you got that so quickly. It took me two months to learn that move.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Shrugs shoulders.] Well, you had to figure it all on your own. I'm lucky enough to have a great teacher.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Smiles.] Thanks.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: So, what's next?

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: This is a more difficult move. I call it streaming the water. [She moves her hands and raises a stream of water from the river into the air and moves it around.] It's harder than it looks, so don't be disappointed if- [Shows Aang already controlling a stream of water, moving it around and above his body and neatly coiling it back into the river, much to Katara's dismay.] Nice work. [She frowns.] Though the over-the-head flare was unnecessary.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Sorry. [Excited.] Well, don't stop now! Keep 'em coming!

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Looks up sadly.] Well I kind of know this one other move, but it's pretty hard. I haven't even totally figured it out yet. The idea is to create a big, powerful wave. [She moves her hands up, shaking, and starts to get a big mass of water to rise out of the river, but it pops before forming into anything substantial.]

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: So, like this? [He raises his hands and creates a massive wave that towers over their heads.]

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Still working on cleaning up Appa, he looks up and stares at Aang's wave crashing toward him in fear.] Aang?! [The wave throws Sokka off into the water and his head slowly rises out, annoyed.]

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Smiling.] Looks like I got the hang of that move! What else do you got?

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Angry at Aang's quick success.] That's enough practicing for today.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Head still sticking out of the water.] Yeah, I'll say! [Points to the left.] You just "practiced" our supplies down the river. [Shows a group of bags floating away.]

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Looking guilty.] Uh, sorry. [Smiles worriedly.] I'm sure we can find somewhere to replace all this stuff.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: My life was hard enough when you were just an airbender. [Sinks back underwater.]

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Cuts to Katara, Sokka, and Aang walking through the streets of a city market and port. Shows many armed men staring at the trio. Sokka and Katara look nervous while Aang looks around in wonder.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Walking back from alleyway with a bag over his shoulders.] We've got exactly three copper pieces left from the money that King Bumi gave us. Let's spend it wisely.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Uh, make that two copper pieces, Sokka. I couldn't say no to this whistle! [Pulls out a white whistle that looks like a bison, takes a huge breath and blows into it, but it barely makes a sound.]

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Pulls out fingers over his ears after expecting a loud noise.] It doesn't even work. [Aang stops blowing when Momo squawks at him.] See? Even Momo thinks it's a piece of junk.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: No offense Aang, but I'll hold the money from now on. [Aang hands her the two copper coins.]

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Cuts to the other side of the port where a man is talking in front of his boat docked in the water.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Moving hands and shouting excitedly.] Earth Nation! Fire Nation! Water Nation! So long as bargains are your inclination, you're welcome here! Don't be shy, come on by! [Sokka, Katara, and Aang walk by and he runs up to them.] Oh! You there, I can see from your clothing that you're world-traveling types. Perhaps I can interest you in some exotic curios?

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Walks back to the man.] Sure! What are curios?

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Looks confused and thinks.] I'm not entirely sure. But we got 'em! [Puts his hand on Aang's shoulder and smiles, walking him into the ship.]

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Cuts to the inside of the boat where strange collectibles are lined up on shelves on the walls. Aang, Katara, and Sokka walk in.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Looks up close at an item on a shelf, confused.] Huh?

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Katara stares at an ornate monkey statue on one of the shelves eerily.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Standing in a dark doorway as Aang passes by with Momo on his back.] I've never seen such a fine specimen of lemur. [Walks into the light, an iguana parrot on his shoulder.] That beast would fetch me a hefty sum if you'd be interested in bartering. [The iguana parrot squawks at them.]

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Grabbing Momo.] Momo's not for sale.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Shows Katara walking over to a shelf where a number of scrolls are kept. She grabs one with the waterbending symbol on it and opens it to see lines of waterbending diagrams and writing.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Smiling.] Look at this, Aang. It's a waterbending scroll! [Aang walks over.] Check out these crazy moves.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Turns to the captain, excited.] Where did you get a waterbending scroll?

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Slams his hand onto the scroll and pulls it away.] Let's just say I got it up North, at a most reasonable price, free. [Rolls the scroll back up and puts it away back in its shelf.]

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Turns around and looks at the captain from the other side of the room.] Wait a minute ... Sea loving traders, with suspiciously acquired merchandise, [Raises eyebrows, almost yelling.] and pet reptile birds? [Turns around to Oh, almost spitting in his face.] You guys are pirates!

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Puts his arm around a terrified Sokka's shoulders.] We prefer to think of ourselves as "high risk traders."

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Cuts to Katara holding their two copper pieces next to Aang, with the captain on the other side of the counter they are leaning on.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: So, how much for the, uh, traded scroll?

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: I've already got a buyer, a nobleman in the Earth Kingdom. [Voice turns less serious.] Unless of course, you kids have two hundred gold pieces on you right now.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Turns around and whispers to Katara.] I know how to deal with these guys, Katara. Pirates love to haggle. [Katara drops the final coins in his hand.] Watch and learn. [Walks over to the counter, leans against it, and talks in a pirate voice.] Let's say to the price of, one copper piece! [Smiles, and dramatically presents the single coin.]

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Laughs hysterically.] The price is two hundred gold pieces. I don't haggle on items this rare.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Still smirking and talking like a pirate.] Okay, two copper pieces!

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Aggravated.] It's not as amusing the second time, boy!

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Whispering.] Aang, can we get out of here? I feel like we're getting weird looks.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Aye, we be casting off now! [Walks away.]

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Cuts back to outside, Aang, Katara, and Sokka are walking off the boat and back down the street.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: What was that all about, Katara?

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Yeah, I was just starting to browse through their boomerang collection.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Worried, holding her arms.] I'll just feel a lot better once we get away from here.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Cuts back to the pirate ship. Oh is running across the deck looking for them.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Hey you! Get back here!

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Calmly turns around.] Well, well. Look who's come to their senses. Told you the haggling would pay off.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Suddenly, the group of armed pirates jump out of the boat and run to Aang, Katara, and Sokka, whispering menacingly and swinging their weapons.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Scared.] I don't think these pirates are here to trade with us. [Turns around and runs, Aang and Sokka follow and the pirates chase behind them. Half of the group runs down one street while the other goes down the one next to it.]

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: This way. Let's cut 'em off!

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Turning a corner with Aang and Katara.] Whoa! [Katara freezes a puddle behind them that a pirate slips on.]

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Cuts to peaceful scene of the cabbage merchant with his cart of cabbages in an alleyway. Sokka, Katara, and Aang run past him and almost knock his cart over. Aang sends a blast of wind that throws the cart into the group of pirates behind them.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Angry.] My cabbages! This place is worse than Omashu!

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Group of pirates jump out of another street and chase Aang, Sokka, Katara, and Momo.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: I hope that lemur of yours has nine lives!

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Him and the pirates corner them in the dead end of a street.] Now, who gets to taste the steel of my blade first?

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: No thanks. [Spins and hurls a blast of air at the pirates that send them backward, and runs toward them with his glider out.] Grab on tight!

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Aang! I thought we were running away from the pirates! [Jumps on to Aang's glider with Sokka and they lift off into the air.]

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Just hang on! [Flies over the pirates' heads and into the distance.]

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Cuts back to their camp by the river, where Aang, Sokka, and Katara stand by the shore.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Putting his glider away.] I used to kind of look up to pirates, but those guys are terrible.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Mischievously.] I know. That's why I took this. [Holds out the waterbending scroll they saw in the shop.]

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Surprised.] No way!

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Excited.] Isn't it great?

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: No wonder they were trying to hack us up! You stole their waterbending scroll!

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Jokingly.] I prefer to think of it as high risk trading.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Laughs.] Good one, Katara.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Sokka, where do you think theyÂ got it? They stole it from a waterbender!

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: It doesn't matter. You put all of our lives in danger just so you could learn some stupid, fancy splashes.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: These are real waterbending forms. You know how crucial it is for Aang to learn waterbending!

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Walks away.] Whatever.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Well, what's done is done. We have it, we might as well learn from it.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: The scene cuts to show Zuko and Iroh standing in the market place.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: I've checked all the shops on this pier. Not a lotus tile in the entire marketplace.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: It's good to know this trip was a complete waste of time for everyone!

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Quite the contrary. I always say, the only thing better than finding something you are looking for [Crew members begin to walk past carrying Iroh's purchases.] is finding something you weren't looking for at a great bargain! [A crew member walks past the two playing a tsungi horn.]

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: You bought a tsungi horn?

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: For music night on the ship. Now, if we only had some woodwinds. [Pointing to the ship.] Oh, this place looks promising! [The monkey statue is shown again.] Oh, that is handsome! Wouldn't it look magnificent in the galley?

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [To pirate captain.] We lost the Water Tribe girl and the little bald monk she was traveling with.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Turning.] This monk, did he have an arrow on his head? [Iroh turns around, making a face similar to the monkey's.]

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: The camera cuts show Katara looking at the scroll.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: I just want to try this one move first and then it's all yours. [Gives it to Aang.] Here, hold it open for me. The single water whip. Looks doable. [Attempts the move, but ends up hitting herself in the forehead.] Ow!

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Ha, ha, ha!

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Glaring at Sokka.] What's so funny?

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: I'm sorry, but you deserved that. [To Aang.] You've been duped; she's only interested in teaching herself.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Angrily.] Aang will get his turn once I figure out the water whip. [She tries again, but hits Momo instead, who screeches.] Ugh, why can't I get this stupid move?

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: You'll get it. [Katara glares at him.] You just gotta shift your weight through the stances. [He tries and does it perfectly on the first try.] There, see, the key to bending isâ

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Screaming.] Will you please shut your air hole? Believe it or not your infinite wisdom gets a little old sometimes! Why don't we just throw the scroll away since you're so naturally gifted! [Sokka glares at her.] What? [She looks back at Aang, who has tears in his eyes.] Oh my gosh, Aang, I am so sorry, I don't know what came over me. But you know what, it won't happen again. [She gives the scroll to Aang.] Here, this is yours. I don't want to have anything to do with it anymore.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: It's okay Katara.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: What about Momo? He's the real victim here.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Bends down to pet Momo as he rubs his hind end.] I'm sorry, Momo.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: And what about me? There was that time youâ

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: No more apologies!

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: The camera fades to show a much smaller boat being launched out of Zuko's ship. The camera fades again to show the boat and the pirate ship sailing down a river.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Shouldn't we stop to search the woods?

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: We don't need to stop. They stole a waterbending scroll, right?

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Mm-hm.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Then they'll be on the water.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: The scene fades to show Katara, Sokka, and Aang sleeping by the campfire. Katara quietly takes the scroll and sneaks away from the camp. However, when she turns around she comes face-to-face with Momo, who starts chattering.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Whispering.] Shhh, Momo! Go back to sleep. Shh! [The camera fades to show her standing by the river, attempting but failing to perfect the water whip, frustrated.] Ugh, ugh, ugh! Shoot! Come on water, work with me here! Okay, what if I just, ow! Stupid scroll! [The pirate captain and Zuko are shown hearing her.] Okay Katara, shift your weight through the stances. [She drops the water again and hears the ship pulling up onto the river bank. She peaks through the bushes to see what the noise was, and gasps upon seeing the pirates. She turns to run, but it grabbed by a pirate.] No! Let go of me! [She bends water up into the pirate's face, and he releases her, she runs but is grabbed again on the wrists by Zuko.]

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [He glares at her as she looks frightfully at him.] I'll save you from the pirates.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: The scene cuts to show Katara tied to a tree with Zuko standing in front of her.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Tell me where he is and I won't hurt you or your brother.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Furiously.] Go jump in the river!

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Try to understand. I need to capture him to restore something I've lost, my honor. [Katara jerks her head away from Zuko.] Perhaps in exchange I can restore something you've lost. [He holds her mother's necklace up to her neck.]

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: My mother's necklace! How did you get that?

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: I didn't steal it, if that's what you're wondering. Tell me where he is. [Points at Katara.]

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: No!

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Enough of this necklace garbage! You promised a scroll!

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: I wonder how much this is worth ... [The pirates gasp as he takes it out and holds it over a fire in his hand.] A lot, apparently. Now you help me find what I want, you'll get this back, and everyone goes home happy. Search the woods for the boy and meet back here!

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Fine.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: The scene cuts to the campsite, where Sokka is waking up.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Notices Katara's missing.] Huh? Where did she go? [Looks through the bag.] I don't believe it.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Yawns.] What's wrong?

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: She took the scroll! She's obsessed with that thing. It's just a matter of time before she gets us all in deep- [Yells as a pirate throws a rope around his arms and drags him forward. He rolls away and charges at the pirate while another pirate captures Aang in a net and drags him away.]

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: I got him, come on!

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Oh, what? I'm not good enough to kidnap? Ah! [The pirate shoots another net at Sokka and drags him away too.]

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Cuts back to the place where Zuko and the pirates are gathered. The pirates are holding Aang and Sokka, who are tied up. Sokka is struggling with the ropes.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Nice work.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Aang, this is all my fault.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: No Katara, it isn't.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Yeah, it kind of is. [Katara glares at Iroh.]

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [To the pirate captain.] Give me the boy.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: You give us the scroll.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: You're really gonna hand over the Avatar for a stupid piece of parchment?

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Don't listen to him, he's trying to turn us against each other!

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Turns to Aang.] Your friend is the Avatar?

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Sure is, and I'll bet he'll fetch a lot more on the black market than that fancy scroll.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Shut your mouth, you Water Tribe peasant!

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Yeah, Sokka, you really should shut your mouth.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: I'm just sayin' it's bad business sense. Think how much the Fire Lord would pay for the Avatar. You guys would be set for life.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [To Zuko.] Keep the scroll; we can buy a hundred with the reward we'll get for the kid. [The pirates turn to leave.]

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: You'll regret breaking a deal with me. [He and two of his soldiers send a blast of fire at the pirates. The pirates jump back and Oh runs out, throwing smoke bombs and jumping into the cloud as the fight ensues. Some of the soldiers run out to Sokka and Aang, who are struggling with their ropes, but are stopped by several pirates. Momo runs down the tree and frees Katara.]

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Thanks, Momo. I owe you a bushel of apples. [She runs to join the fight. Aang is shown lost in the smoke, a thrown knife narrowly misses him and cuts through his ropes. Zuko finds his way out of the smoke cloud and hides the scroll behind his back, but the pirate captain sees him and the two begin to fight. The scroll flies into the air and his caught by Momo, the iguana parrot sees him and hits Momo. The scroll flies back down to the ground. A knife narrowly misses Sokka's head, and he uses it to cuts the ropes on his hands.]

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Shouting.] Aang, are you there?

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: I'm over here! Follow my voice!

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Where? I can't find you!

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: I'm right here! [Airbends the dust away, revealing the pirates surrounding him, and immediately airbends it back around himself.] Never mind! I'll find you! [Sokka climbs out of the dust cloud on his hands and knees. Aang vaults over him in a full sprint.] Run! [They find Katara, who is trying to push the pirate boat back into the water.] Katara, you're okay!

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Help me get this boat back in the water so we can get outta here. [They join her in trying to push the boat, but can't.]

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: We'd need a team of rhinos to budge this ship.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: A team of rhinos, or two waterbenders.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Cuts to Aang and Katara pushing and pulling the water until the boat rises up.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Everybody in!

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Cuts to show Iroh breaking up the fight between the pirate captain and Zuko.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Are you so busy fighting you cannot see your own ship has set sail?

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: We have no time for your proverbs, Uncle!

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: It's no proverb! [Points to Team Avatar who has hijacked the pirate ship.]

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Bleeding hog monkeys! [Zuko laughs while pointing at him. His laughter dissipates as the pirates hijack his own boat. The pirates taunt him and the screen pans to a steaming Zuko.]

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Angrily.] Hey! That's my boat! [Goes chasing after the hijacked boat.]

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Pondering.] Maybe it should be a proverb ...

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Off camera.] C'mon, Uncle! [Iroh runs after Zuko.]

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Sokka, can't you make it go any faster?

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: I don't know how. This thing wasn't made by the Water Tribe!

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Several of the pirates jump onto the ship, but are quickly swept away by Aang's waterbending. Determined, Katara performs a perfect water whip to throw the last pirate off.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Hey, you did the water whip!

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: I couldn't have done it without your help.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Sokka is shown being held in place by two pirates.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Would you two quit congratulating each other and help me out?

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Momo is shown still being chased by the iguana parrot; he flies up to the top mast and entangles the bird in the ship's flag. Sokka is shown being thrown by one of the pirates.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: That's good ... [Aang lands behind him and airbends him and the other pirate off the ship before jumping down to Sokka.]

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Pointing.] Aang, look! [The ship is shown headed toward a huge waterfall.]

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Oh no ...

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Oh comes up behind him with a knife, Aang turns and blows the bison whistle. Oh stands confused while Sokka comes up behind him and pushes him off the ship.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Have you lost your mind? This is no time for flute practice! [Katara and Aang stare in horror at the approaching waterfall.]

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: We can stop the boat! Aang, together, push and pull the water! [They create a small Whirlpool that stops the boat.] It's working, it's slowing down! We're doing it!

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: But we have another problem. [Zuko's boat is shown sailing straight toward their ship. The boat rams into the ship and Sokka, Aang, and Katara are forced to jump as the boat goes over the falls.]

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Jump! [Appa is shown flying toward them. They land on him and fly to safety.]

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Holding up the whistle.] I knew a bison whistle would come in handy! Thanks Appa.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Yeah, we owe you one. [Appa roars and the scene cuts to show Zuko running to the cliff in horror at the fact that his boat has gone over the falls.]

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: My boat!

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Chuckles.] Prince Zuko, you're really going to get a kick out of this. That lotus tile was in my sleeve the whole time! [Has a big smile on his face.]

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Zuko snatches the lotus tile and furiously throws it down the waterfall.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Cuts back to Appa flying through the clouds.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Aang, I still owe you an apology. You were just so good at waterbending without really trying. I got so competitive that I put us all in danger, I'm sorry.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: That's okay Katara.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Besides, who needs that stupid scroll anyway?

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Holding the scroll. Sarcastically.] Is that really how you feel?

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: The scroll!

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Puts his hand in front to keep Katara from grabbing it.] First, what did you learn?

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Stealing is wrong. [Snatches scroll.] Unless it's from pirates.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: [Laughing.] Good one, Katara.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Fades to credits.

title: The Waterbending Scroll
text: Aang

title: Jet
text: The episode opens in a forest. Momo is chasing a bug through the trees. In his pursuit he lands on the ground to see a neatly stacked pile of lychee nuts. When he runs toward it, Momo is pulled into the air by a cage trap, joining two other caged animals. Camera changes focus to find the rest of Team Avatar camping.

title: Jet
text: Where's Momo? [Camera zooms in to close-up shot of Aang, Katara, and Sokka, the siblings sitting next to each other with bored faces, and Aang standing with his back to the camera. Momo screeches and the gang looks around.]

title: Jet
text: Camera fades to find Aang as he spots the three animals in their cage traps hanging by rope on tree limbs.

title: Jet
text: Hang on, Momo! [Aang uses his airbending to fly to the top of the tree, jumping from trunk-to-trunk to get higher. He finds the traps' mechanisms, undoes them, and carefully lowers Momo to the ground where Katara and Sokka are waiting. They open the trap together and the lemur runs out with one of the lychee nuts in his mouth. Katara and Sokka look on as Momo gets on his hind legs and eats it as though nothing has happened. Sokka grunts in frustration and facepalms. When Aang lands, he looks up to see the other two animals seemingly crying out to him for help.] All right, you too. [Jumps up to them.]

title: Jet
text: This is gonna take forever. [Throws his boomerang to simply cut the animals free.]

title: Jet
text: [Inching his way upside-down to the traps on the tree branch. They fall before he can reach them.] That works.

title: Jet
text: The hog monkeys run up the tree and out of the camera's view and Aang jumps back down, dirt flying from the ground as he lands. Everyone gathers around two of the traps and Sokka kneels down to examine them.

title: Jet
text: These are Fire Nation traps, [Camera zooms to upward shot of the gang looking at the trap.] you can tell from the metalwork. We better pack up camp, and get moving.

title: Jet
text: They gather their things and begin to pack them onto Appa's saddle.

title: Jet
text: Uh uh. No flying this time.

title: Jet
text: [Confused.] What? Why wouldn't we fly?

title: Jet
text: [Takes the sleeping bag from Aang's hands.] Think about it: Somehow Prince Zuko and the Fire Nation keep finding us. It's because they spot Appa, he's just too noticeable.

title: Jet
text: What? Appa's not too noticeable!

title: Jet
text: [Points dramatically at Appa; condescendingly.] He's a gigantic fluffy monster with an arrow on his head! It's kinda hard to miss him! [The bison yawns and the camera flashes to Aang sitting comfortably on the animal's head.]

title: Jet
text: [To Appa.] Sokka's just jealous 'cause he doesn't have an arrow.

title: Jet
text: [Camera closes in on Sokka and Katara next to each other.] I know you all wanna fly, but my instincts tell me we should play it safe this time and walk.

title: Jet
text: [Leans forward at her brother and smiles.] Who made you the boss?

title: Jet
text: [Points his finger at his chest; to Katara.] I'm not the boss, I'm the leader.

title: Jet
text: [Amused.] You're the leader? But your voice still cracks!

title: Jet
text: [Voice cracks.] I'm the oldest, and I'm a warrior, so [Deepens voice.] I'm the leader!

title: Jet
text: [Close-up shot of Katara's face.] If anyone's the leader, it's Aang. I mean he is the Avatar. [Pan back to Sokka.]

title: Jet
text: Are you kidding, he's just a goofy kid!

title: Jet
text: [While hanging upside-down from Appa's right horn with feet sticking out in the air.] He's right.

title: Jet
text: Why do boys always think someone has to be the leader? I bet you wouldn't be so bossy if you kissed a girl.

title: Jet
text: [Close-up on Sokka; defensively.] I've kissed a girl, you just haven't met her.

title: Jet
text: [Back to Sokka.] Who? Gran-Gran? I've met Gran-Gran.

title: Jet
text: [Throws arms into the air.] No! Besides Gran-Gran. Look, my instincts tell me we have a better chance of slipping through on foot, and a leader has to trust his instincts.

title: Jet
text: [Sarcastically.] Okay, we'll try it your way, oh wise leader.

title: Jet
text: [Aang steps over, now wearing a backpack. Momo is sitting on the top.] Who knows? Walking might be fun. [Cut to the forest at a later time. Between trees the group trudges along, with Sokka in front, followed by Aang and Momo, Katara, and Appa.] Walking stinks! How do people go anywhere without a flying bison?

title: Jet
text: [Sarcastically.] Well I don't know, Aang. Why don't you ask Sokka's instincts? They seem to know everything.

title: Jet
text: [Sarcastically.] Ha, ha, very funny.

title: Jet
text: [Complaining.] I'm tired of carrying this pack.

title: Jet
text: You know who you should ask to carry it for a while? Sokka's instincts. [Sokka's eyes turn to her in irritation.]

title: Jet
text: That's a great idea. Hey, Sokka's instincts, would you mind-

title: Jet
text: Okay, okay, I get it. Look guys, I'm tired too. But the important thing is that we're safe from the [Walks through a bush and sees something in front of him.] Fire ... Nation.

title: Jet
text: Sokka sees a Fire Nation campsite with a lot of soldiers; most of them are seated or crouched near the fire with bowls in hand and a couple of them sit close to the tents, which have the Fire Nation emblem on the doorflap. One of these soldiers has a patch over his left eye. They all notice the group and get up.

title: Jet
text: Run! [They turn to run but a firebender blocks them off by setting the plants behind them on fire.] We're cut off!

title: Jet
text: Sokka, your shirt! [Sokka yells; Katara clears a fire on Sokka's shirt with waterbending.]

title: Jet
text: If you let us pass, we promise not to hurt you.

title: Jet
text: [Whispers.] What are you doing?

title: Jet
text: [Whispers.] Bluffing?

title: Jet
text: You promise not to hurt us? [He's somehow knocked out.]

title: Jet
text: Nice work, Sokka! How'd you do that?

title: Jet
text: Uh, instinct?

title: Jet
text: [Points up a tree.] Look!

title: Jet
text: In a tree, a man with hook swords, Jet, jumps and takes down two soldiers. He runs forward and takes down two more using his hook swords.

title: Jet
text: Down you go. [Katara looks amazed, Aang shocked, and Sokka confused.]

title: Jet
text: Another soldier charges at Jet, but he is defeated.

title: Jet
text: They're in the trees!

title: Jet
text: A young boy lands on top of the soldier and turns his helmet around to blind him, before riding him around while laughing. Another boy launches arrows at the soldiers while more boys come out of the trees. Aang and Katara are shown fighting the soldiers. Sokka holds up his boomerang and yells as one approaches him, but stops when Jet takes him down first.

title: Jet
text: Hey, he was mine!

title: Jet
text: Gotta be quicker next time.

title: Jet
text: Sokka looks dismayed and the camera cuts to show a huge boy fall out of the trees and easily take down two soldiers as Jet skillfully takes down one more, causing this soldier's weapon to hit another soldier, who was going to battle Sokka, in the head, making that soldier also fall down.

title: Jet
text: [Angrily.] Man!

title: Jet
text: Jet disarms another soldier and runs up to Katara.

title: Jet
text: Hey.

title: Jet
text: Hi.

title: Jet
text: They look around to see a now empty camp

title: Jet
text: [Amazed.] You just took out a whole army almost single-handed.

title: Jet
text: [Disdainfully.] Army? There were only like, twenty guys.

title: Jet
text: My name is Jet, and these are my Freedom Fighters, Sneers, Longshot, Smellerbee, The Duke, and Pipsqueak.

title: Jet
text: [Laughing; looking at The Duke.] Ha, ha, Pipsqueak, that's a funny name. [The Duke sniffs his nose, as the camera pans upward to Pipsqueak.]

title: Jet
text: [Looming over Aang in a threatening manner; in a low, growling tone of voice.] You think my name is funny?

title: Jet
text: [Side-shot; Aang looks taken aback for a second before replying in an upbeat tone.] It's hilarious!

title: Jet
text: Facial shot of Pipsqueak, still looming forward with a frown on his face. He suddenly starts laughing. The camera moves back, showing Aang and The Duke following suit. Pipsqueak pats the Avatar on the back in a friendly manner, though the hit was hard enough to knock Aang flat on the ground. The Duke stops laughing and looks down at Aang sprawled on the ground before his feet, face flat in the dirt, though when Aang raises his head and continues laughing, so does The Duke.

title: Jet
text: [Approaching Jet.] Umm, thanks for saving us Jet. We're lucky you were there.

title: Jet
text: I should be thanking you. We were waiting to ambush those soldiers all morning, we just needed the right distraction, and then you guys stumbled in.

title: Jet
text: [Eyeing Sokka.] We were relying on instincts.

title: Jet
text: You'll get yourself killed doing that.

title: Jet
text: Sokka looks at them disdainfully as The Duke and Pipsqueak look through the barrels.

title: Jet
text: Hey Jet, these barrels are filled of blasting jelly.

title: Jet
text: That's a great score.

title: Jet
text: And these boxes are filled with jelly candy!

title: Jet
text: Also good, let's not get those mixed up.

title: Jet
text: We'll take this stuff back to the hideout.

title: Jet
text: You guys have a hideout?

title: Jet
text: You wanna see it?

title: Jet
text: [Very excitedly.] Yes, we wanna see it!

title: Jet
text: Jet smiles at her and the camera fades to show them standing on the forest floor.

title: Jet
text: We're here.

title: Jet
text: Where? There's nothing here.

title: Jet
text: Hold this. [Gives a rope to Sokka.]

title: Jet
text: [Skeptically.] Why? What's this do? [Screams as he is pulled up into the branches.]

title: Jet
text: Aang? [Offers Aang another rope.]

title: Jet
text: I'll get up on my own. [Leaps up into the trees with airbending.]

title: Jet
text: Grab hold of me, Katara.

title: Jet
text: Katara blushes as she takes his hand and they rise up through the tree together in a romantic setting. They come to a landing on a wooden platform in the trees. Once up there, Aang is seen zip lining through the trees.

title: Jet
text: [While passing through with Momo.] Nice place you got!

title: Jet
text: It's beautiful up here!

title: Jet
text: It's beautiful ... and more importantly the Fire Nation can't find us. [Smellerbee lands near the two.]

title: Jet
text: They would love to find you. Wouldn't they, Jet?

title: Jet
text: It's not gonna happen, Smellerbee.

title: Jet
text: [As Aang zips by again.] Why does the Fire Nation want to find you?

title: Jet
text: I guess you could say I've been causing them a little trouble. See, they took over a nearby Earth Kingdom town a few years back.

title: Jet
text: We've been ambushin' their troops, cutting off their supply lines, and doing anything we can to mess with 'em. [Sokka is now seen comically hopping around trying to get past Pipsqueak.]

title: Jet
text: One day, we'll drive the Fire Nation out of here for good and free that town.

title: Jet
text: That's so brave. [Sokka manages to get by Pipsqueak.]

title: Jet
text: [Sarcastically.] Yeah, nothing's braver than a guy in a tree house.

title: Jet
text: Don't pay any attention to my brother.

title: Jet
text: No problem. He probably had a rough day.

title: Jet
text: So, you all live here? [Sokka who is being ignored comically sinks back behind them.]

title: Jet
text: That's right. Longshot over there? [The screen cuts to Longshot and The Duke walking not making a sound.] His town got burned down by the Fire Nation. And we found The Duke trying to steal our food. I don't think he ever really had a home.

title: Jet
text: What about you?

title: Jet
text: [Katara and Jet come to a halt as the rest pass.] The Fire Nation killed my parents. I was only eight years old. That day changed me forever.

title: Jet
text: Sokka and I lost our mother to the Fire Nation.

title: Jet
text: I'm so sorry, Katara.

title: Jet
text: The screen fades from the two of them alone on the suspension bridge to the blue sky above the canopy. A cloud of cawing birds is disturbed as Appa raises his head with a roar. In the hideout, ropes with lanterns hang between branches. Sentries keep watch on several upper platforms while the group sits at a banquet table. While the group eats, Jet stands on the table.

title: Jet
text: Today, we struck another blow against the Fire Nation swine. [Everyone cheers. Katara and Aang smile while Sokka cops an attitude and a scowling face.] I got a special joy from the look on one soldier's face, when The Duke dropped down on his helmet and rode him like a wild hog monkey. [The Duke, without his helmet, climbs up the table. He marches on the table with his arms in the air.] Now, the Fire Nation thinks they don't have to worry about a couple of kids hiding in the trees. [He prepares to take a drink from his wooden cup.] Maybe they're right. [A very loud and long boo is heard; with an angry face.] Or maybe ... they're dead wrong. [A loud and long cheer is heard.]

title: Jet
text: Hey Jet, nice speech.

title: Jet
text: Thanks. By the way, I was really impressed with you and Aang. That was some great bending I saw out there today.

title: Jet
text: Well, he's great. He's the Avatar. [Blushes.] I could use some more training.

title: Jet
text: Avatar huh? Very nice.

title: Jet
text: Thanks Jet.

title: Jet
text: So I might know a way that you and Aang can help in our struggle.

title: Jet
text: Unfortunately, we have to leave tonight. [Sokka starts walking away.]

title: Jet
text: Sokka, you're kidding me! I needed you on an important mission tomorrow. [Sokka turns around.]

title: Jet
text: What mission?

title: Jet
text: The scene changes to the top of the forest the next day. Jet and Sokka are in branches of the same tree. Jet cups his hands and makes a birdcall; several trees down Pipsqueak and Smellerbee step into view from their branches. They reply with another birdcall. Sokka jams his jawbone knife into the trunk of the tree

title: Jet
text: What are you doing?

title: Jet
text: Shh ... It amplifies vibrations.

title: Jet
text: [Impressed.] Good trick.

title: Jet
text: [Sokka puts his ear to the handle of his knife.] Nothing yet. [Whispers.] Wait! Yes, someone's approaching.

title: Jet
text: [Whispers.] How many?

title: Jet
text: I think there's just one.

title: Jet
text: [Does a another birdcall.] Good work, Sokka. Ready your weapon. [Sokka takes his knife out of the tree. His eyes spot an old man.]

title: Jet
text: [Whispers.] Wait, false alarm ... He's just an old man.

title: Jet
text: Jet ignores Sokka and prepares to attack the old man, leaping to the ground in front of the traveler. Sokka watches with horror.

title: Jet
text: What are you doing in our woods, you leech?

title: Jet
text: Please sir, I'm just a traveler.

title: Jet
text: Jet takes a step, and with one swipe, sends the man's cane flying from his hand. The old man backs away, but when he tries to flee the way he came, he runs face first into Pipsqueak's chest. The force of the impact knocks him to the ground; Pipsqueak looms over him. He tries to crawl away, but Pipsqueak's foot on his backside effectively pins him.

title: Jet
text: Do you like destroying towns? Do you like destroying families? Do you?

title: Jet
text: Oh ... Please let me go ... have mercy ...

title: Jet
text: Does the Fire Nation let people go? Does the Fire Nation have mercy?

title: Jet
text: Jet is about to kick the man, but his foot is snagged by Sokka's club before it can be delivered. Sokka releases him.

title: Jet
text: Jet, he's just an old man!

title: Jet
text: He's Fire Nation! Search him! [Pipsqueak holds the prisoner and Smellerbee steps up to search the poor man.]

title: Jet
text: But he's not hurting anyone!

title: Jet
text: Have you forgotten that the Fire Nation killed your mother? Remember why you fight!

title: Jet
text: We've got his stuff, Jet. [She holds up the old man's bag. The old man is thrown back on the ground.]

title: Jet
text: This doesn't feel right.

title: Jet
text: It's what has to be done, now let's get outta here.

title: Jet
text: Jet pushes past Sokka. Pipsqueak and Smellerbee follow. Sokka looks at the old man still on his hands and knees in pity.

title: Jet
text: Come on, Sokka!

title: Jet
text: Sokka slowly turns and runs to catch up with the others. At the hideout, Aang and Momo are playing with the ziplines again. He leaps near Sokka.

title: Jet
text: Sokka! Look what the Duke gave me! [Aang is wearing a bag and pulls a small pellet from it. With a sly grin, he tosses it next to Momo, where it explodes with a pop. Momo puffs up like a startled cat. He hisses and lunges for the bag. Momo sits on Aang's shoulder and tosses several pellets at his feet. Aang dances about wildly.] Ow! Quit it!

title: Jet
text: Sokka is oblivious of it all. He's sitting with his back to the trunk and staring at the ground, glaring. Katara walks up.

title: Jet
text: Hey, Sokka. Is Jet back?

title: Jet
text: Yeah he's back. But we're leaving.

title: Jet
text: What?

title: Jet
text: But I made him this hat. [She shows a cap made out of stitched leaves with a flower on top.]

title: Jet
text: Your boyfriend Jet's a thug.

title: Jet
text: What? No, he's not.

title: Jet
text: He's messed up Katara.

title: Jet
text: He's not messed up, he's just got a different way of life, a really fun way of life.

title: Jet
text: He beat and robbed a harmless old man!

title: Jet
text: I wanna hear Jet's side of the story. [The scene changes to Jet in a room.]

title: Jet
text: Sokka, you told them what happened, but you didn't mention that the guy was Fire Nation?

title: Jet
text: Jet is sitting on a hammock-bed, the others stand. Sokka stands grumpily as far away as he can get. Aang is wearing the hat Katara made; he looks ridiculous and goofy.

title: Jet
text: No, he conveniently left that part out.

title: Jet
text: Fine! But even if he was Fire Nation, he was a harmless civilian!

title: Jet
text: He was an assassin, Sokka.

title: Jet
text: Jet pulls out a knife and thrusts it into a nearby stump. It is a sinister looking curved blade. There are four spikes evenly spaced along the grip, with enough space for fingers to go between them. There is a ring on the butt of the knife.

title: Jet
text: See? There's a compartment for poison in the knife. [He pulls on the ring and removes a small glass tube filled with red liquid.]. He was sent to eliminate me; you helped save my life, Sokka.

title: Jet
text: I knew there was an explanation.

title: Jet
text: I didn't see any knife!

title: Jet
text: That's because he was concealing it.

title: Jet
text: See, Sokka? I'm sure you just didn't notice the knife.

title: Jet
text: There was no knife! I'm going back to the hut and packing my things. [Sokka stomps away.]

title: Jet
text: Tell me you guys aren't leaving yet. I really need your help.

title: Jet
text: What can we do?

title: Jet
text: The Fire Nation is planning on burning down our forest. If you both use waterbending to fill the reservoir, we could fight the fires. But if you leave now, they'll destroy the whole valley.

title: Jet
text: Aang and Katara look at each other. Fade to them entering their hut. Sokka is tying up a mat on the floor.

title: Jet
text: We can't leave now with the Fire Nation about to burn down a forest!

title: Jet
text: I'm sorry Katara. Jet's very smooth, but we can't trust him.

title: Jet
text: You know what I think? You're jealous that he's a better warrior and a better leader!

title: Jet
text: Katara, I'm not jealous of Jet. It's just that my instinctâ

title: Jet
text: Well my instincts tell me we need to stay here a little longer and help Jet. Come on Aang.

title: Jet
text: Sorry, Sokka.

title: Jet
text: They leave the hut. Fade to the night sky above the canopy. A full moon shines on Appa, who is on his back and snoring extremely loud as he sleeps. Inside the Trio's hut, Sokka sleeps propped up against his still-packed gear while the others sleep in their sleeping bags.

title: Jet
text: Let's go.

title: Jet
text: Sokka wakes up. He pulls the door flap aside enough to see some of Jet's followers descending on the rope lines. Sokka grabs a rope line down to a lower branch. On the ground below him, Jet's Freedom Fighters are quietly pushing the loaded wagon as Jet leads them out of the camp. Sokka stealthily follows. In the dark valley. Upstream, and up toward the wall of the valley there is an old falls, and beyond that a man-made dam. A bare cliff off to the reservoir's left provides the view. Jet and his boys emerge from the forest. He goes to the edge and looks down on the dam below. The reservoir behind it is low. He turns back to the wagon.

title: Jet
text: Now listen, you are not to blow the dam until I give the signal. If the reservoir isn't full, the Fire Nation troops could survive. [The Duke jumps off the wagon.]

title: Jet
text: But what about the people in the town, won't they get wiped out too? [Jet places a hand on The Duke's shoulder.]

title: Jet
text: Look Duke, that's the price of ridding this area of the Fire Nation. [To Longshot.] Now don't blow the dam until I give the signalâgot it? [Longshot nods.]

title: Jet
text: Sokka watches incredulously from the bushes. He frowns, and hears rustling just before Pipsqueak drags him out by his wolf-tail. Smellerbee's knife is instantly at his throat.

title: Jet
text: [Sneering.] Where do you think you're going, ponytail?

title: Jet
text: Jet, standing near the edge of the cliff. As he watches, Pipsqueak and Smellerbee drag Sokka between them. Pipsqueak still has a handful of Sokka's wolf-tail.

title: Jet
text: Sokka, I'm glad you decided to join us. [Pipsqueak and Smellerbee send Sokka to his knees. He rubs his shoulder.]

title: Jet
text: I heard your plan to destroy the Earth Kingdom town.

title: Jet
text: Our plan is to rid the valley of the Fire Nation.

title: Jet
text: There are people living there, Jet; mothers and fathers and children.

title: Jet
text: We can't win without making some sacrifices. [Sokka points an accusing finger at Jet.]

title: Jet
text: You lied to Aang and Katara about the forest fire!

title: Jet
text: Because they don't understand the demands of war. Not like you and I do.

title: Jet
text: I do understand. I understand that there's nothing you won't do to get what you want.

title: Jet
text: I was hoping you'd have an open mind, but I can see you've made your choice.

title: Jet
text: Pipsqueak and Smellerbee grab for Sokka. Before he can even react, Jet has his wrist pinned with the hooks of his shuang gou. Sokka's other hand is forced behind his back.

title: Jet
text: I can't let you warn Katara and Aang. [Jet releases Sokka's hand; it is immediately forced behind his back.] Take him for a walk, a long walk.

title: Jet
text: You can't do this!

title: Jet
text: Cheer up, Sokka. We're gonna win a great victory against the Fire Nation today.

title: Jet
text: The screen pans to the riverside upriver from the dam. The collected water behind it is much less than the larger cavity of the reservoir. The river leading to down to it is a thread compared to its 'rainy season' gully. Jet, Katara, and Aang are seen walking upriver along its west bank.

title: Jet
text: Jet, I'm sorry about how Sokka's been acting.

title: Jet
text: No worries, he already apologized.

title: Jet
text: Really? [Aang and Katara stop and look at one another.] Sokka apologized?

title: Jet
text: Yeah, I was surprised too. I got the sense that maybe you talked to him or something.

title: Jet
text: Yeah, I did.

title: Jet
text: I guess something you said got through to him. Anyhow, he went out on a scouting mission with Pipsqueak and Smellerbee.

title: Jet
text: I'm glad he cooled off. He's so stubborn sometimes.

title: Jet
text: They are now walking in the gully, beside the 'river'. Aang pauses after noticing something strange, and is launched into the air by a blast from the geyser he was standing on.

title: Jet
text: All right, we're here. Underground water's trying to escape through these vents. I need you guys to help it along.

title: Jet
text: I've never used bending on water I can't see. I don't know ... [Jet stands behind her and places his hands on her shoulders.]

title: Jet
text: Katara. You can do this.

title: Jet
text: [Airbends himself back on the ground.] What about me?

title: Jet
text: I know the Avatar can do this.

title: Jet
text: Aang and Katara stand on one of the many geysers in the gully. While Jet looks on, they bend the water up. After a few minutes, a stream of water emerges from the hole. They pull it to their height and send it toward the river where it continues to flow like a waterfall. The water quickly joins the river.

title: Jet
text: Yes! Good job! This river empties into the reservoir--a few more geysers and it'll be full.

title: Jet
text: Look, there's another steam vent. [Aang and Katara walk off in its direction.]

title: Jet
