text: Okay. You two keep it up, I'll go check on things at the reservoir. [He turns and walks away.]

title: Jet
text: When we're done we'll meet you over there.

title: Jet
text: Actually ... probably better if you meet me back at the hideout when you're done. [Jet resumes walking away Aang and Katara bend the next geyser into another fountain.]

title: Jet
text: [Later.] I bet that's enough, and I'm not just saying that to be lazy. [Around them, over a dozen geysers flow into the river.]

title: Jet
text: Let's catch up with Jet at the reservoir.

title: Jet
text: I thought we agreed to meet Jet back at the hideout.

title: Jet
text: Well, we finished early. I'm sure he'll be happy to see us.

title: Jet
text: The screen changes to a path in the forest. Pipsqueak and Smellerbee follow Sokka, who has his hands tied behind his back. Smellerbee gives Sokka a shove; Sokka stumbles but remains on his feet.

title: Jet
text: Come on, move along!

title: Jet
text: How can you stand by and do nothing while Jet wipes out a whole town?

title: Jet
text: Hey listen Sokka, Jet's a great leader. We follow what he says, and things always turn out okay. [Sokka notices a couple of snare leaf-piles nearby identical to the one that enticed Momo, right down to the pile of nuts.]

title: Jet
text: If that's how Jet leads, then he's got a lot to learn. [Sokka sprints off in the direction of the snares. Smellerbee makes a grab for him, but misses.]

title: Jet
text: Hey! [They give chase. Sokka leaps over the leaf piles. Pipsqueak and Smellerbee don't, and end up snared and hanging many feet up in the air.]

title: Jet
text: While you two are up there, you might want to practice your knot work. [He holds up his now-worthless bindings, turns, and walks away.]

title: Jet
text: Hey Smellerbee, you gonna eat your lychee nuts? [Smellerbee hits him in the head with a lychee nut and it lands in the pile he's holding.] Ooh. [He picks one up and licks his lips.]

title: Jet
text: Katara and Aang are standing on the edge of the cliff. At the base of the dam, four of Jet's people are unloading barrels from the wagon and arranging them.

title: Jet
text: What are they doing?

title: Jet
text: Hey, those are the red barrels he got from the Fire Nation.

title: Jet
text: Why would they need blasting jelly? [Zooms on Aang, who is horrified.]

title: Jet
text: Because Jet's gonna blow up the dam.

title: Jet
text: What? No, that would destroy the town. Jet wouldn't do that. [Aang opens his glider.]

title: Jet
text: I've gotta stop him. [He takes off.]

title: Jet
text: [Less convinced.] Jet wouldn't do that.

title: Jet
text: Before Aang can reach the edge, Jet crosses his path from behind and snatches the glider. Aang is left wobbling precariously on the edge, and uses airbending to get himself back on stable footing.

title: Jet
text: Yes I would.

title: Jet
text: Jet, why?

title: Jet
text: Katara, you would too if you just stopped to think. Think about what the Fire Nation did to your mother, we can't let them do that to anyone else, ever again.

title: Jet
text: This isn't the answer!

title: Jet
text: I want you to understand me Katara. I thought your brother would understand, butâ

title: Jet
text: Where's Sokka? [Tears fall from her eyes. Jet reaches out and touches her face.]

title: Jet
text: Katara.

title: Jet
text: She lowers her head, and with a shout, sends Jet flying with the water from her waterskin. She draws it back into the skin when she's done.

title: Jet
text: I need to get to the dam.

title: Jet
text: Aang's closed glider is on the ground. As he reaches for it, one of Jet's hook swords pins it. Jet has the two swords hook to hook; with a yank he pulls Aang's glider to him.

title: Jet
text: You're not going anywhere without your glider.

title: Jet
text: Jet swings the swords at Aang. Aang somersaults backward to avoid the extra reach. Aang finishes his retreat in a nearby tree.

title: Jet
text: I'm not gonna fight you, Jet.

title: Jet
text: [Taunting.] You'll have to if you want your glider back.

title: Jet
text: Aang retreats back into the forest, as Jet hooks the branch and pulls himself up. Katara follows on the ground. Jet attacks; Aang defends himself with balls of air, which Jet ducks. Jet attacks head on, but Aang blocks with his arms and sends his opponent flying into a tree trunk with an air kick. Jet combines his swords again and advances. Aang avoids the flail-like move and sends another air blast. Jet stoops down and lets the air flow over and past him before lunging.

title: Jet
text: They continue the chase through the many levels of the forest. Jet catches up to Aang and sends them both freefalling, attacking as they go. They both end up on a branch. Jet continues his attack. Aang avoids it all. Jet charges again, but Aang hits him with a jetstream of air. Jet falls. He recovers, but loses the glider in the process. Before Aang can get to the ground Jet kicks him into a trunk. He lands with a thud next to his glider.

title: Jet
text: A small tributary flows past him. Aang is slow to get up. Before Jet can take more than a step however, he his hit by a large water strike. Katara is there; she uses water from the river to throw Jet against the trunk of the tree. Over and over she attacks; Jet is unable to cut the water and its force plasters him against the trunk. She freezes Jet from toe to neck.

title: Jet
text: Why, Jet? I can't believe I trusted you. You lied to me, you're sick and I trusted you! [A birdcall is heard. Katara and Aang are startled, and look to the valley beyond where it's coming from. Jet gives an answering birdcall.] What are you doing?

title: Jet
text: You're too late.

title: Jet
text: [Horrified.] No!

title: Jet
text: Aang opens his glider and runs for the nearby cliff. His glider's wings are damaged to the point that he has no lift, and slams back into the ground near the edge. Katara runs over to help him.

title: Jet
text: [In pain from the fall.] Sokka's still out there, he's our only chance.

title: Jet
text: Come on, Sokka. I'm sorry I ever doubted you, please.

title: Jet
text: Longshot stands on a branch, his bow pulled. He has a flaming arrow on the string. He takes aim and fires. It arcs down to the base of the dam. Katara watches in horror.

title: Jet
text: [Whispers.] No ...

title: Jet
text: The center of the dam explodes in a cloud of smoke and fire. Katara and Aang watch a massive wall of water go to the town. Inside the town the streets are empty except for the occasional barrels and the Cabbage Merchant's cabbage cart. The water rushes through the open gate, as a cresting wave dwarfs it. The wall and gate are swallowed as the wave strikes the town. The flotsam carried away includes a smiling doll in a purple dress.

title: Jet
text: Sokka didn't make it in time.

title: Jet
text: All those people ... [She turns in rage back to Jet.] Jet, you monster!

title: Jet
text: This was a victory, Katara. Remember that. The Fire Nation is gone and this valley will be safe.

title: Jet
text: It will be safe, without you. [In shock, Jet looks up to see Sokka, Appa, and Momo rise from below the level of the cliff.]

title: Jet
text: Sokka!

title: Jet
text: I warned the villagers of your plan, just in time.

title: Jet
text: What?!

title: Jet
text: [Cuts to an illustrated set of flashback stills each being panned through.] At first they didn't believe me. The Fire Nation soldiers assumed I was a spy. But one man vouched for me, the old man you attacked. He urged them to trust me, and we got everyone out in time. [The flashback ends and the townsfolk are seen on high ground above the river, on the bank opposite the town. A little girl, who was seen in the flashback, runs down to the water's edge as the doll floats by. She retrieves it.]

title: Jet
text: [Happily.] Misses Pretty! [She hugs her doll.]

title: Jet
text: Sokka, you fool! We could've freed this valley!

title: Jet
text: Who would be free? Everyone would be dead.

title: Jet
text: You traitor!

title: Jet
text: No, Jet. You became the traitor when you stopped protecting innocent people.

title: Jet
text: Katara. Please, help me.

title: Jet
text: Goodbye Jet. [Sokka gives Appa's reigns a flick.]

title: Jet
text: Yip yip. [Jet is left behind, still frozen to the tree.]

title: Jet
text: The sky they fly in is empty, save a few wispy clouds.

title: Jet
text: We thought you were going to the dam. How come you went to the town instead?

title: Jet
text: Let me guess, your instincts told you.

title: Jet
text: [Shrugs his right shoulder.] Hey, sometimes they're right.

title: Jet
text: Um ... Sokka? You know we're going the wrong way, right? [Sokka is surprised, but quickly recovers.]

title: Jet
text: And sometimes they're wrong. [With a grin, he pulls Appa's reigns. They fly off screen before reappearing, going in the opposite direction.]

title: Jet
text: Fades to credits.

title: Jet
text: Aang

title: The Great Divide
text: Opening shot of the sun setting behind some tall rock outcroppings. The sky is mostly cloudy and the clouds reflect the light of the dying sun. Pan down to show a patched up tent being jostled about from the inside. A rolled up tarp lies next to the tent. Sokka is inside a tent, trying to assemble it. Sokka can be heard grunting and fussing about as he tries to finish setting up the shelter. Katara walks in the frame, her back to the camera, with a pile of fire wood in her arms.

title: The Great Divide
text: Um, aren't you forgetting the tarp?

title: The Great Divide
text: Right, got it ... [Tosses the wrapped up tarp inside the tent.]

title: The Great Divide
text: Sokka, you're supposed to put the tarp on top of the tent. You know, so we don't get rained on? [Cut to an overhead shot of the two, Sokka gesturing widely as he replies to his sister.]

title: The Great Divide
text: Ordinarily, you'd be right, but seeing how it's the dry season, you're not. Besides that tarp makes a pretty warm blanket.

title: The Great Divide
text: But what if it does rain?

title: The Great Divide
text: [Spreading his arms wide in exasperation.] What if it doesn't? Then I would have put up the tarp for nothing.

title: The Great Divide
text: You're infuriating!

title: The Great Divide
text: Katara, why don't you worry about gathering firewood, because that kindling is looking pretty sorry.

title: The Great Divide
text: [Angrily.] Well, if you don't like my firewood- [Throws the sticks at Sokka who shields himself from the wood. He stands in anger after the hail of sticks subsides.]

title: The Great Divide
text: [Angrily.] Fine by me, if you're not gonna do your job- [He tears the tent down and the two stare at each other angrily as Aang approaches.]

title: The Great Divide
text: Okay, I got the grub if you guys got the- [The siblings turn away from each other in anger with their arms folded.] hey, where's the campfire? And what happened to the tent?

title: The Great Divide
text: Why don't you ask Miss Know-It-All, Queen of the Twigs.

title: The Great Divide
text: Oh yeah? Well, you're Mister Lazy Bum, King of the [Picks up and throws a twig at Sokka's head.] Tents! [Sokka turns around, looking angrily at her.]

title: The Great Divide
text: [Laughs.] Okay, listen guys, harsh words won't solve problems, action will. Why don't you just switch jobs?

title: The Great Divide
text: Sounds good.

title: The Great Divide
text: [At the same time.] Whatever.

title: The Great Divide
text: [Grinning while gloating.] You see that? Settling feuds and making peace, all in a day's work for the Avatar. [Turns his head to see Momo and Appa fighting over a watermelon. Momo continuously tries to fly away with it, while Appa pins it down. Aang takes the melon and uses airbending to slice it. Momo seems to be complaining about how he got the much smaller half and Appa got the bigger half.] Come on, Momo, that's fair. Appa's got five stomachs. [Appa eats his half of the melon.]

title: The Great Divide
text: The scene fades to show the group standing on the edge of a huge canyon.

title: The Great Divide
text: There it is, guys, The Great Divide.

title: The Great Divide
text: [In awe.] Wow, I could just stare at it forever. [Zoom backward to show Sokka in the foreground.]

title: The Great Divide
text: Okay, I've seen enough.

title: The Great Divide
text: How can you not be fascinated Sokka? This is the largest canyon in the entire world.

title: The Great Divide
text: Then I'm sure we'll be able to see it very clearly from the air while we fly away.

title: The Great Divide
text: [Shoving past Sokka.] If you're looking for the canyon guide, I was here first!

title: The Great Divide
text: Ooh, canyon guide? Sounds informative.

title: The Great Divide
text: Believe me, he's more than a tour guide, he's an earthbender, [Oblivious to the fact that Sokka is behind him, mocking him.] and the only way in and out of the canyon is with his help, and he's taking my tribe across next.

title: The Great Divide
text: Calm down, we know you're next.

title: The Great Divide
text: You wouldn't be so calm if the Fire Nation destroyed your home and forced you to flee! My whole tribe has to walk thousands of miles to the capital city of Ba Sing Se.

title: The Great Divide
text: You're a refugee!

title: The Great Divide
text: Huh, tell me something I don't know.

title: The Great Divide
text: A large group of poorly dressed people is shown walking toward them.

title: The Great Divide
text: Is that your tribe?

title: The Great Divide
text: It most certainly is not! That's the Zhang tribe, a bunch of low-life thieves. They've been the enemies of my tribe for a hundred years. [Whistles to them.] Hey, Zhangs! I'm saving a spot for my tribe so don't even think about stealing it!

title: The Great Divide
text: Where are the rest of the Gan Jin? Still tidying up their camp site?

title: The Great Divide
text: Yes, but they sent me ahead of them to hold a spot.

title: The Great Divide
text: I didn't know the canyon guide took reservations.

title: The Great Divide
text: Ha, of course you didn't! That's the ignorance I'd expect from a messy Zhang. So unorganized and ill-prepared for a journey. [The Zhang tribe members yell out in protest behind them. Katara and Aang look at each other worriedly, but turn around to see a large pile of rocks being levitated up and thrown away. The canyon guide stands behind where the rocks used to be.]

title: The Great Divide
text: Sorry about the wait, youngsters. Who's ready to cross this here canyon?

title: The Great Divide
text: Uh, one of them, I think. [Camera pans left to reveal the Zhang and the scout.]

title: The Great Divide
text: [Rushing forward.] I was here first, my party's on their way.

title: The Great Divide
text: I can't guide people who aren't here. [Cut to a wider shot showing the Zhang filing past the three kids and the fuming Gan Jin scout.]

title: The Great Divide
text: [Mockingly.] Guess you guys will have to make the trip tomorrow.

title: The Great Divide
text: The shot shifts to a close-up the scout, whose eyes twitch in anger. The camera zooms backward and pans left to reveal another tribe entering the canyon entrance area. The scout points to them in triumph.

title: The Great Divide
text: Wait, here they come! [A group of clean, finely dressed people are shown coming toward them.]

title: The Great Divide
text: [To the canyon guide.] You're not seriously gonna cave into these spoiled Gan Jins? I mean we're refugees too! And we've got sick people that need shelter.

title: The Great Divide
text: I ... uh ... well ...

title: The Great Divide
text: We've got old people who are weary from traveling.

title: The Great Divide
text: Sick people get priority over old people.

title: The Great Divide
text: Maybe you Zhangs wouldn't have so many sick people if you weren't such slobs.

title: The Great Divide
text: If you Gan Jins weren't so clean, you wouldn't live to be so old.

title: The Great Divide
text: [Over the two arguing tribes.] Well Aang, ready to put your peace-making skills to the test?

title: The Great Divide
text: I don't know, a fight over chores is one thing, but these people have been feuding for a hundred years.

title: The Great Divide
text: [Stepping forward.] Everybody listen up! This is the Avatar, and if you give him a chance, I'm sure he can come up with a compromise that will make everyone happy.

title: The Great Divide
text: Uh, you could share the earthbender and travel together?

title: The Great Divide
text: Absolutely not! We'd rather be taken by the Fire Nation than travel with those stinking thieves!

title: The Great Divide
text: We wouldn't travel with those pompous fools anyway! [The two tribes begin to shout at each other again.]

title: The Great Divide
text: [Shouting.] All right here's the deal, you're all going down together and Appa here will fly your sick and elderly across! Does that seem fair? [Both leaders nod in agreement, and the scene fades to show the sick and elderly boarding Appa.]

title: The Great Divide
text: [To Appa.] Sorry, Appa, you'll have to do this on your own.

title: The Great Divide
text: Aang, this feuding tribe stuff is serious business. Are you sure it's a good idea getting involved in this?

title: The Great Divide
text: [Grinning broadly.] To tell you the truth, I'm not sure. But when have I ever been?

title: The Great Divide
text: He's the Avatar, Sokka, making peace between people is his job.

title: The Great Divide
text: [Dismayed.] His job's gonna make us cross this whole canyon on foot isn't it? [Cut to an overhead wide shot of the two tribes and the others.]

title: The Great Divide
text: Okay, now comes the bad news. [Cut to a frontal shot of the guide.] No food allowed in the canyon, it attracts [He makes motions with his hands to illustrate the skittery monsters that might lurk in the canyon.] dangerous predators. [Both tribes yell out in protest.]

title: The Great Divide
text: No food?! This is ridiculous.

title: The Great Divide
text: Oh, you babies can go a day without food? Would you rather be hungry, or dead? [He raises an earth pillar to tower over the rest. He continues, cupping his hands to his mouth to amplify his voice.] Now, we're heading down in ten minutes. All food better be in your gut or in the garbage!

title: The Great Divide
text: The Zhang tribe quickly whips out and shoves food into their mouths, which stands in stark contrast to the Gan Jin tribe, who eat slowly with chopsticks.

title: The Great Divide
text: [To the people on Appa.] Appa's going to take good care of you 'till we get there. [To Appa.] See you on the other side, buddy! Yip yip! [Appa roars and takes off. The camera fades to show both groups of people climbing down into the canyon. The tour guide earthbends to form a bridge in a gap in the path.]

title: The Great Divide
text: Nice bending!

title: The Great Divide
text: The job's much more than bending, kid. Folks want information. [Turns to the travelers.] Many of you are probably wondering how canyons are formed. Experts tell us this canyon was most likely carved into the ground by earth spirits who were angry at local farmers for not offering them a proper sacrifice.

title: The Great Divide
text: Katara and Sokka look up in fear as an avalanche of rocks comes falling toward them, and the canyon guide earthbends it away from them.

title: The Great Divide
text: He he he, guess the spirits are still angry! Hope you all brought sacrifices.

title: The Great Divide
text: Cut to a wide shot of the canyon floor and the canyon wall on the right side of the screen. The view pans slowly rightward before cutting to a closer, overhead shot of the group now at the bottom of the switchback trail. They have just entered the canyon floor. The guide stands in front of the two tribes and the kids. Katara, Aang, and Sokka look at each other in exasperation and the scene fades to show them standing at the bottom of the canyon next to a huge boulder.

title: The Great Divide
text: Okay, everyone stand clear of the wall. [He throws the boulder and destroys the bridge he had made earlier.]

title: The Great Divide
text: Why'd you do that?

title: The Great Divide
text: These people are fleeing the Fire Nation, aren't they? Gotta make sure we can't be followed. We'll be safe now. [Yells out, as he is picked up by a huge animal. Aang blows away the dust to reveal a canyon crawler.]

title: The Great Divide
text: We gotta help him! [He throws his boomerang at the crawler, which drops the canyon guide and comes after Sokka instead.] Okay, now we gotta help me! [Katara comes to his aid and does a water whip on the crawler, but she is quickly thrown aside. Aang jumps down and sends a multiple blasts of air at the crawler and drives it away.]

title: The Great Divide
text: [To the canyon guide.] What was that?

title: The Great Divide
text: [On the ground.] Canyon crawler. [Groans in pain.] And there's sure to be more!

title: The Great Divide
text: Your arms, they're broken!

title: The Great Divide
text: Without my arms, I got no bending. In other words-

title: The Great Divide
text: We're trapped in this canyon.

title: The Great Divide
text: The camera fades to show them grouped together.

title: The Great Divide
text: I thought the whole point of ditching our food was so we wouldn't have to deal with things like canyon crawlers.

title: The Great Divide
text: It's the Zhangs! They took food down here even after the canyon guide told them not to.

title: The Great Divide
text: What? If there's anyone who can't go without food for a day, it's you pampered Gan Jins!

title: The Great Divide
text: I hope you're happy. We're stuck in this canyon with no way out.

title: The Great Divide
text: Why don't you thank yourself, food hider?

title: The Great Divide
text: Look, sticking together is the only way to-

title: The Great Divide
text: I'm not walking another step with the likes of them!

title: The Great Divide
text: Now there's something we can agree on.

title: The Great Divide
text: [To the canyon guide.] Any ideas?

title: The Great Divide
text: No bendng ... we need to get out of this canyon ... I won't die down here! I won't become part of the food chain!

title: The Great Divide
text: See! We're going to become part of the food chain because of you! [Points to Zhangs.]

title: The Great Divide
text: Sure, unjustly blame the Zhangs like you always do!

title: The Great Divide
text: Gladly.

title: The Great Divide
text: [Angrily.] Enough! I thought I could help you guys get along, but I guess that's not gonna happen. [Jumps onto a tall rock.] We should split up, Gan Jins on this side and Zhangs on that side. We'll travel in two separate lines. [The two leaders nod at each other and start walking. Aang jumps down to Sokka and Katara.] Sokka, you go with the Zhangs and Katara, you go with the Gan Jins. See if you can find out why they hate each other so much.

title: The Great Divide
text: They split up and the camera pans to show them walking separately. The scene changes to show Sokka in the Zhang camp.

title: The Great Divide
text: So, you guys aren't going to put up your tarps?

title: The Great Divide
text: What for? Its the dry season.

title: The Great Divide
text: Exactly!

title: The Great Divide
text: Besides, we like to use the tarp as a blanket.

title: The Great Divide
text: [Smiling.] Finally, someone gets it!

title: The Great Divide
text: Katara is shown at the Gan Jin camp, where they are putting up tarps over their tents.

title: The Great Divide
text: You really think it'll rain?

title: The Great Divide
text: No, but you can never be too careful, right?

title: The Great Divide
text: Katara smiles and the camera fades to nightfall, where they are sitting around their campfire. The Gan Jin leader looks around and pulls a piece of bread out of his sleeve. Katara looks stunned to see all the other tribe members doing the same.

title: The Great Divide
text: Would you care for some bread, Katara?

title: The Great Divide
text: So it was you guys who had food!

title: The Great Divide
text: Oh come now, you really think that tribe of thieves isn't smuggling food? Why should my people go hungry when the sneaky Zhangs are stuffing their faces?

title: The Great Divide
text: [Hesitates.] Well, I guess it's okay if everyone's doing it. [Takes the bread and eats it.] So, why does your tribe hate the Zhangs so much?

title: The Great Divide
text: You seem like a smart girl Katara, I bet you would enjoy hearing some history. [Fades to show a large gate with a finely dressed man running toward it. Voice-over.] The patriarch of our tribe, Jin Wei, was an earthbender warrior who was assigned an important duty, transporting our sacred orb from the great eastern gate, to the great western gate. Taking the orb from the east to the west represents the sun's rising and setting. It was our tribe's ancient redemption ritual. But as he approached the gate, Jin Wei was attacked by one of the Zhang, a vermin named Wei Jin, who looked at the orb with envy. That coward Wei Jin knocked Jin Wei to the ground, and stole our sacred orb. [Camera goes back to the Gan Jin leader's face.] Our people have never forgotten. You can never trust a Zhang.

title: The Great Divide
text: Katara glares at the Zhang's camp and the scene fades to show the Zhang tribe and Sokka sitting around the campfire.

title: The Great Divide
text: [To Sokka.] Care for some meat?

title: The Great Divide
text: Would I! [Takes the meat and bites down hungrily.]

title: The Great Divide
text: I know what you must be thinking, we're horrible for endangering everybody by bringing food down here.

title: The Great Divide
text: Hm-hmm.

title: The Great Divide
text: The Gan Jin think so badly of us, they probably assumed we brought food in and decided to bring food in themselves. That's why we brought food in.

title: The Great Divide
text: [Still eating.] Hmm.

title: The Great Divide
text: Our conflict with the Gan Jin goes back over a hundred years. [Fades to show a poorly-dressed man running through a large gate. Voice-over.] Our forefather Wei Jin was leaving the western gate of our village, when he saw a figure in the distance. It was a man of the Gan Jin tribe, Jin Wei, collapsed on the ground. Noble Wei Jin stopped to help him. Jin Wei was transporting a sacred orb, a very powerful relic used in his tribe's redemption ritual. Wei Jin tried to tend to the man's wounds but Jin Wei insisted the orb was more important, and asked him to take it back to his tribe. Kind Wei Jin promised to send help for the man as soon as he could, but as Wei Jin crossed the border to return the orb into Gan Jin territory, he was arrested. Instead of thanking him for his kind and selfless deed, they sentenced him to twenty long years in prison. [Back to Zhang leader.] We Zhangs will never forget that injustice.

title: The Great Divide
text: That's just terrible. [Looks at her piece of meat.] You gonna finish that?

title: The Great Divide
text: Fades to show Aang sitting with Momo far from both camps.

title: The Great Divide
text: Sure would be nice to be sitting around one of those campfires, telling stories and laughing. Its okay Momo, we'll be out of here soon enough, and then we can eat our weight in leechi nuts! [Momo jumps up and snatches a bug out of the air, he eats part of it before offering the rest to Aang.] Nah, I'll wait for the leechi nuts.

title: The Great Divide
text: [Slowly approaching Aang.] Lonely isn't it, being impartial?

title: The Great Divide
text: I wish I could help these people get along, but it just seems impossible. Anyhow, I guess our biggest problem is getting out of here.

title: The Great Divide
text: I'm not so sure the two problems are unrelated.

title: The Great Divide
text: Aang looks away sadly and the scene fades to show the two tribes traveling again in daylight.

title: The Great Divide
text: All clear, we're almost to the other side.

title: The Great Divide
text: [Jumps down to Katara and Sokka.] Katara, Sokka, will these people cooperate long enough to get out of the canyon?

title: The Great Divide
text: I don't think so, Aang, the Zhangs really wronged the Gan Jins. They ambushed Jin Wei and stole the sacred orb.

title: The Great Divide
text: What are you talking about?

title: The Great Divide
text: Yeah Katara, what are you talking about? Wei Jin didn't steal the orb, he was returning it to their village gate and was wrongfully punished by the Gan Jin.

title: The Great Divide
text: Not punished enough if you ask me.

title: The Great Divide
text: [Over Sokka's frustrated growls.] Okay, okay I get it! Now I need your help, I need everyone together at the base of the canyon wall. [He takes off on his glider and the scene fades to show him landing between the two tribes.] Please everyone, as soon as we get out of here we can eat and then go our separate ways, but I need you all to put your heads together and figure out a way up this cliff.

title: The Great Divide
text: Maybe the Zhang can climb the wall with their long disgusting fingernails.

title: The Great Divide
text: Oh sorry, I forgot that to the Gan Jin unclipped fingernails is a crime punishable by twenty years in jail!

title: The Great Divide
text: Why, you dirty thief!

title: The Great Divide
text: You pompous fool!

title: The Great Divide
text: The tribes began to argue loudly again, accompanied by Katara and Sokka.

title: The Great Divide
text: [Shouting.] Guys, focus! How many times do I have to say it? Harsh words won't solve problems, action will!

title: The Great Divide
text: Perhaps the Avatar is right.

title: The Great Divide
text: Yes, perhaps he is. [Aang grins happily at this.]

title: The Great Divide
text: Harsh words will never solve our problems.

title: The Great Divide
text: Action will!

title: The Great Divide
text: They both draw their swords and Aang yells in surprise, as they clash their swords.

title: The Great Divide
text: To the death! And let this be the end of this rivalry!

title: The Great Divide
text: You know, I take it back. Harsh words aren't so bad!

title: The Great Divide
text: The two leaders ignore him as they begin to fight. They are evenly matched, and continue until Aang blows them apart with a strong gust of air. The two tribes go flying backward, revealing a large amount of hidden food.

title: The Great Divide
text: [Shocked.] Is that ... food? Everyone smuggled food down here? Unbelievable! You guys put our lives in danger because you couldn't go without a snack for a day? You're all awful! [He looks in wonder at a custard tart, and his stomach growls.] So hungry. Is that an egg custard in that tart? [He turns to see dozens of canyon crawlers approaching, and they all try to flee.]

title: The Great Divide
text: Oh no, that's a lot of canyon crawlers.

title: The Great Divide
text: [Taking out his boomerang.] We barely survived one!

title: The Great Divide
text: They're coming back for me! They've had a taste and they're coming back for me!

title: The Great Divide
text: Sokka, wait. [Stops him as he runs forward.] I don't care about this stupid feud, I just want us to get out of here alive.

title: The Great Divide
text: Me too. I only took their side 'cause they fed me.

title: The Great Divide
text: The camera cuts to show Aang fighting off the canyon crawlers, and soon has them all in a pile. The crawlers pick themselves up and target the refugees. Though Aang, Katara, Sokka, and the tribe leaders fight hard to hold them off, they are vastly out numbered. Aang looks around to see the crawlers eating the food out of the bags.

title: The Great Divide
text: [Shouting.] Everybody, watch me and do what I do! [He distracts a crawler with a piece of food, leaps on its back, and throws a bag over its snout. The two tribes mimic him, working together.] Now follow me! We're riding out of this hole! [Aang ties a huge bag of food onto a stick and uses it to guide the crawlers up the canyon wall.] Everyone, get off!

title: The Great Divide
text: [Jumping off a crawler.] We made it!

title: The Great Divide
text: As soon as all the people have made it up the cliff, Aang throws the bag back down, and the crawlers follow.

title: The Great Divide
text: I never thought a Gan Jin could get his hands dirty like that.

title: The Great Divide
text: And I never knew you Zhangs were so reliable in a pinch.

title: The Great Divide
text: Perhaps we're not so different after all. [They both smile at each other and Aang sighs in relief.]

title: The Great Divide
text: Too bad we can't rewrite history. You thieves stole our sacred orb from Jin Wei! [Draws his sword.]

title: The Great Divide
text: [Draws her sword.] You tyrants unjustly imprisoned Wei Jin for twenty long years!

title: The Great Divide
text: [Sighs in frustration.] Wait a second ... Jin Wei? Wei Jin? I know those guys!

title: The Great Divide
text: Yes, yes, we're all aware of the story.

title: The Great Divide
text: No, I mean I really knew them. I might not look it, but I'm a hundred and twelve years old. I was there one hundred years ago on the day you're talking about. [Scene fades to show the two men facing each other. Voice-over.] There seems to be a lot of confusion about what happened. First of all, Jin Wei and Wei Jin weren't enemies. They were brothers, twins in fact, and they were eight; and most importantly, they were just playing a game! The sacred orb from the legend, that was the ball! And the eastern and western gates were the goal posts. Jin Wei had the ball and was running toward the goal when he fell and fumbled it. Wei Jin didn't steal the ball, he picked it up and started running it toward the other goal, but he stepped out of bounds, so the official put him in the penalty box. Not for twenty long years but for two short minutes. [Fades back to Aang.] There was no stealing and no putting anyone in imprison, it was just a game.

title: The Great Divide
text: You're saying the sacred orb was actually a sacred ball?

title: The Great Divide
text: Nope, just a regular ball.

title: The Great Divide
text: What about our tribe's redemption ritual?

title: The Great Divide
text: That's what the game was called, redemption. As soon as you got the ball from one end to the other, everyone would yell "redemption"! [The tribe leaders look at each other skeptically.] Don't get me wrong, Wei Jin was kind of a slob and Jin Wei was a little stuffy, that much is true. But they respected each other's differences enough to share the same playing field.

title: The Great Divide
text: [To the Gan Jin leader.] I suppose it's time we forget the past.

title: The Great Divide
text: [Bowing.] And look to the future.

title: The Great Divide
text: The Zhang leader bows back and Aang looks at them happily. The scene fades to show them standing with Appa.

title: The Great Divide
text: Good to see you, boy. Did you miss me? [Appa licks Aang as the Gan Jin leader approaches.]

title: The Great Divide
text: I cannot thank you enough, Avatar.

title: The Great Divide
text: [Covered in Appa's slobber.] Well, you know I try.

title: The Great Divide
text: [Recoils in disgust.] Ugh!

title: The Great Divide
text: Fades to show the two tribes standing together.

title: The Great Divide
text: Let us travel to the Earth Kingdom capital as one tribe. [Both tribes cheer as they start walking.]

title: The Great Divide
text: [Running forward.] I'm going too! I'm sick of this place!

title: The Great Divide
text: That's some luck you knew Jin Wei and Wei Jin.

title: The Great Divide
text: You could call it luck. Or you could call it lying.

title: The Great Divide
text: [Flabbergasted.] What?

title: The Great Divide
text: I made the whole thing up.

title: The Great Divide
text: [Shocked.] You did not! [In devilish admiration.] That is so wrong.

title: The Great Divide
text: Now where is that custard tart? I'm starving!

title: The Great Divide
text: Fades to credits.

title: The Great Divide
text: Aang

title: The Storm
text: The episode begins in Aang's dream. The scene itself, dominated by a tinge of warm yellow, is filled with clouds for a moment before Aang slides into the frame of the shot, his face happy as he flicks the reins. The shot switches to a far view, showing that he is riding Appa, who is flapping his six legs in unison up and down as if he were a bird. The camera pans to the right, revealing Sokka as he pulls alongside Appa, using Aang's glider to fly with the Avatar. The shot cuts to a close-up of the Water Tribe warrior as he turns his head toward Aang, grinning broadly and contentedly at him. Cut to Aang as his face exhibits the same contented grin. He turns his attention to his right and the camera follows his gaze, revealing Katara sitting atop the head of an enormous Momo; she waves at Aang. Camera moves back to a wide frontal shot of the group coursing leisurely through the open sky.

title: The Storm
text: [Voice-over.] We need you, Aang.

title: The Storm
text: [Close-up as he is looking toward Katara; contentedly.] I need you, too.

title: The Storm
text: Aang notices something out of the corner of his eyes. As he turns toward it, his expression changes to shock. Focusing on Aang's face, the camera turns 180 degrees and switches to his point of view as the sky's coloring changes to a dark, ominous gray, revealing a churning storm cloud before him. Cut back to Aang, who yanks Appa's reins in fright.

title: The Storm
text: [Alarmed.] Be careful, guys! [He looks to his left and right, uneasy.] Guys?

title: The Storm
text: The scene rapidly zooms out, revealing that Aang and Appa are alone, surrounded by nothing but the darkening sky. Cut back to Aang's point of view as Gyatso, in lotus, floats downward, positioning himself in front of Aang.

title: The Storm
text: [Surprised.] Gyatso?

title: The Storm
text: [Whispering, his tone sad.] Why did you disappear?

title: The Storm
text: [Frontal shot; his voice soft and sad.] I didn't mean to.

title: The Storm
text: Cut to a side-view of the two monks, not a meter apart from one another. Aang reaches out to Gyatso, but before he can touch him, Gyatso turns gray and dissipates into smoke; it blows over Aang, causing him to raise his left arm in front of his face and turn away to shield himself from it. Frontal shot of Aang as the last of the smoke washes over him. He peeks over his arm, but instantly raises his head, his eyes growing big in shock; a dark shadow passes over him as the shot cuts to a distant side-view of Appa being swallowed by the dark cloud.

title: The Storm
text: [Voice-over.] We need you, Aang.

title: The Storm
text: A bolt of lightning splits the shot for an instant before cutting to a frontal shot of a screaming and frightened Aang, wrestling with the reins, as he and Appa are caught in the belly of the storm with rain beating down on them. Cut to an underwater shot as Aang and Appa plummet into the ocean. The duo floats for a moment. Cut to a close-up of Aang's hand as his grip on Appa's reins loosens and they slip from his limp grasp.

title: The Storm
text: [Echoing voice-over.] We need you, Aang. [Cut to a downward view of an unconscious Aang sinking.] We need you. We need you, Aang. We need you.

title: The Storm
text: Unmoving, Aang sinks and disappears into the darkness of the ocean. For a fraction of a second, lightning splits the shot once again and the silhouette of the Fire Lord surrounded by flames appears.

title: The Storm
text: [Drowsily.] What's going on? [He looks around.] Did we get captured again?

title: The Storm
text: [Shot looking down, sliding right; Aang turns to his friends.] It's nothing. I just had a bad dream. [He curls up, facing away from them.] Go back to sleep.

title: The Storm
text: [Curls up, facing away from Aang.] Don't have to tell me twice.

title: The Storm
text: [Frontal shot of Aang with Katara behind him, looking at him in concern.] Are you all right, Aang?

title: The Storm
text: [Looking lost.] I'm okay.

title: The Storm
text: You seem to be having a lot of nightmares lately. You want to tell me about it?

title: The Storm
text: [Briefly closing his eyes.] I think I just need some rest.

title: The Storm
text: [Sitting up behind Katara; upbeat.] You guys want to hear about my dream? [Katara glares at him, an expression Sokka returns.] That's okay. I didn't want to talk about it anyway.

title: The Storm
text: Sokka lies down, disappearing from view; Katara does the same.

title: The Storm
text: Look at those clear skies, buddy! [Pets Appa's head. Cut to a close shot as he looks up at a flock of birds arranged in a "V" flying overhead, their goose-like honking audible.] Should be some smooth flying.

title: The Storm
text: Cut to an overhead shot looking down of Katara looking into a bag before holding it upside down, sprinkling the ground with crumbs; Momo instantly eats them. Sokka walks past her toward Appa, carrying some of their luggage.

title: The Storm
text: [Looking from the contents of the bag up to Aang.] Well, we better smoothly fly [She steps onto Appa's tail and walks to the saddle.] ourselves to a market, 'cause we're out of food.

title: The Storm
text: [Side-shot as he suddenly straightens up, his tone serious.] Guys, wait. This was in my dream. [Momo lands on the pack behind him.] We shouldn't go to the market.

title: The Storm
text: [Shot cuts beside Sokka, facing out toward Katara and Aang, who turn to look at him; curious.] What happened in your dream?

title: The Storm
text: [Frontal shot; his eyes are bugged out in terror and the camera zooms in on him, rolling slightly as the shot takes on a greenish tint and alien music dubs the scene.] Food eats people! [The colors return to normal as the shot cuts to Katara's face as she shakes her head. Behind her, Aang goes back to adjusting the reins. Cut to Sokka again as he points at Momo.] Also, Momo could talk. [He glares at Momo while crossing his arms.] You said some very unkind things.

title: The Storm
text: Momo's ears droop as Sokka speaks. Cut to downward looking shot of a flock of birds in V-formation flying over the open ocean. As the scene pans to the left, Zuko's ship sails into view. Cut to the deck, where Iroh stands on the deck, with Zuko looking through a spyglass behind him. As the flight of birds passes over Iroh's head in the distance, he sniffs the air and Zuko lowers the spyglass to turn to his uncle, who speaks.

title: The Storm
text: There is a storm coming. A big one.

title: The Storm
text: You're out of your mind, Uncle. [Walking up to Iroh.] The weather's perfect. There's not a cloud in sight.

title: The Storm
text: The shot cuts behind the two, facing the prow of the ship and showing a clear sea and sky.

title: The Storm
text: A storm is approaching from the north. [He turns to face Zuko.] I suggest we alter our course and head southwest.

title: The Storm
text: [Taking a few steps in Iroh's direction, pointing briefly northward.] We know the Avatar is traveling northward, so we will do the same.

title: The Storm
text: [Cut to his face; stern.] Prince Zuko, consider the safety of the crew.

title: The Storm
text: [Cut to his face as he advances on his uncle angrily.] The safety of the crew doesn't matter!

title: The Storm
text: Behind them, Lieutenant Jee walks onto deck, inadvertently overhearing the conversation. As Zuko realizes Jee is behind him and turns to face him, his expression briefly loses its raging intensity. A quick close-up shows Jee raising an eyebrow as Zuko walks over to him; another cut shifts the view to the lieutenant's side as Zuko, addressing Jee directly, struts up to him, dominantly looking him right in the eyes from a close distance as he finishes speaking.

title: The Storm
text: Finding the Avatar is far more important than any individual's safety.

title: The Storm
text: As Zuko walks away, Jee glares after him. The shot switches, showing Zuko leaving the deck through the door at the base of the superstructure. Cut to a frontal shot of Jee, who looks slightly enraged as Iroh walks over to him.

title: The Storm
text: [Reassuringly, a twinge of uncertainty in his voice, almost as if he does not fully believe what he is saying.] He doesn't mean that. He's just all worked up.

title: The Storm
text: The scene changes to a seaside hamlet built on the side of a cliff face, the roofs all teal-green; a collection of houses sits back from the waterfront, where a row of warehouses adjoins the docks. Among the several ships moored on the town's four piers is Appa, floating in the water by himself. Cut to Katara, who stands in front of a small merchants' stand, suspiciously eying a watermelon.

title: The Storm
text: [Scowling.] Ahhh, it's good. It's perfect, I'm telling you!

title: The Storm
text: [Shaking the watermelon, which emits an audible sloshing sound.] I don't know if I like the sound of that swishing.

title: The Storm
text: [As the shot zooms out, the merchant moves around the stand where Katara stands. Sokka and Aang, staff in hand, stand beside them; the former is filling a basket with fruit.] Swishing means it's ripe! It's the ripe juices swishing around, eh?

title: The Storm
text: [Taking a step toward Katara.] I think it's true, Katara. Swishing means it's ripe.

title: The Storm
text: [As the shot cuts to a frontal view of her, she puts the melon back on the stand.] I just realized we're out of money anyway.

title: The Storm
text: [Annoyed, grabbing a basket full of fruits from Sokka.] Awww!

title: The Storm
text: As Sokka walks past the merchant, she indignantly kicks him in the rear, drawing a cry of pain from Sokka. Cut to Sokka, Katara, and Aang on the docks. Sokka is rubbing where the lady kicked him and seems downcast.

title: The Storm
text: Out of food and out of money. Now what are we supposed to do?

title: The Storm
text: You could get a job, smart guy.

title: The Storm
text: A fisherman and his wife are walking behind the gang. As Katara finishes, they begin a loud, heated conversation, which is overheard easily by Aang, Katara, and Sokka.

title: The Storm
text: We shouldn't go out there! Please, the fish can wait. There's going to be a terrible storm. [Camera cuts to show Aang, who appears alarmed by the prediction.]

title: The Storm
text: You're crazy. It's a nice day: [Gesturing to the sky with both arms.] No clouds, no winds, no nothing. So quit your nagging, woman.

title: The Storm
text: [Nervously suggesting to Katara and Sokka.] Maybe we should find some shelter?

title: The Storm
text: [Indicating the fair weather.] Are you kidding? Shelter from what?

title: The Storm
text: My joints say there's going to be a storm! A bad one.

title: The Storm
text: Well, it's your joints against my brain.

title: The Storm
text: Then I hope your brain can find someone else to haul that fish, 'cause I ain't comin'.

title: The Storm
text: Then I'll find a new fish hauler and pay him double what you get! [Cut to a side shot of the couple, showing Sokka running up to them.] How do you like that?

title: The Storm
text: [Interrupting, raising his hand.] I'll go.

title: The Storm
text: You're hired! [Shoots a triumphant look at his wife, who scowls back.]

title: The Storm
text: [After a short pause, to Katara and Aang.] What? You said get a job ... and he's paying double.

title: The Storm
text: [Rounding on Sokka, his expression wild.] Double? Who told you that nonsense?

title: The Storm
text: The scene changes to Zuko's ship on the open ocean. As the shot pans right, a massive bank of darkening clouds, having appeared seemingly out of nowhere, rolls into view, looming in front of the ship. Cut to the deck, where Lieutenant Jee and several other soldiers stand a short distance from the shot, staring at the clouds. Zuko walks into the foreground, regarding the clouds as Jee and the others turn to face him. Iroh walks between Zuko and Jee as the latter taunts the former.

title: The Storm
text: Looks like your uncle was right about the storm after all.

title: The Storm
text: [Pleasantly.] Lucky guess.

title: The Storm
text: [Whirling around and walking toward Jee; angry.] Lieutenant! You'd better learn some respect [Jabs two fingers into Jee's chest.] â or I will teach it to you. [Begins to walk away from Jee, who follows Zuko with his eyes, continuing his taunting after a short pause.]

title: The Storm
text: What do you know about respect? [Behind Jee, Iroh's expression turns to panic and he makes a cutting motion at his throat with his hand, trying to signal Lieutenant Jee to stop. Cut to Zuko's back as he stops walking before switching to his face as he listens to Jee's words.] The way you talk to everyone around here, from your hard-working crew to your esteemed uncle, shows you know nothing about respect! [Cut to a close-up of Iroh's face as he gasps slightly, reaching out a hand in desperation before moving it to his forehead in resignation, believing Jee has gone too far. Cut back to Zuko's face, contorted with rage.] You don't care about anyone but yourself! Then again, what should I expect from a spoiled prince?

title: The Storm
text: Zuko turns around and extends his right arm as if preparing to firebend. Lieutenant Jee does the same.

title: The Storm
text: Easy now. [Both Zuko and Jee wrist-block the other's arm; smoke rises from a furious Zuko's hand. Interrupting the staredown, Iroh extends an arm and pulls theirs apart; the smoke fades.] Enough! We're all a bit tired from being at sea so long. I'm sure after a bowl of noodles, everyone will feel much better.

title: The Storm
text: Lieutenant Jee walks away.

title: The Storm
text: I don't need your help keeping order on my ship.

title: The Storm
text: Iroh puts a comforting hand on Zuko's right shoulder, but Zuko shrugs it off and walks away. Scene changes back to a dock at the fishing town, where Team Avatar stands. Sokka is carrying supplies onto the fisherman's boat.

title: The Storm
text: Sokka, maybe this isn't such a good idea. Look at the sky.

title: The Storm
text: I said I was going to do this job. I can't back out just because of some bad weather.

title: The Storm
text: The boy with the tattoos has some sense. You should listen to him!

title: The Storm
text: Boy with tattoos? [The fisherman turns around to look at Aang.] Airbender tattoos. Well, I'll be a hog monkey's uncle. You're the Avatar, ain't ya?

title: The Storm
text: That's right. [Katara and Aang smile.]

title: The Storm
text: Well, don't be so smiley about it. [Katara and Aang frown now.] The Avatar disappeared for a hundred years! You turned your back on the world!

title: The Storm
text: Don't yell at him! Aang would never turn his back on anyone.

title: The Storm
text: Oh, he wouldn't, huh? Then I guess I just have imagined the last hundred years of war and suffering. [Aang's eyes widen.]

title: The Storm
text: Aang is the bravest person I know. He's done nothing but help people and save lives since I met him. [Behind Katara's back, Aang slowly begins to backpedal away from her.] It's not his fault he disappeared, right Aang? [Katara turns around to see Aang backing away.] Aang, what's wrong?

title: The Storm
text: A look of shock and horrified guilt on his face, Aang opens his glider and vaults into the air, rapidly disappearing into the distance.

title: The Storm
text: That's right! Keep flying!

title: The Storm
text: You're a horrible old man! [She gets on Appa, who is floating beside the dock.] Appa, yip yip!

title: The Storm
text: As Appa flies out of the water, a big wave splashes the fisherman. Sokka walks out from below deck on the boat.

title: The Storm
text: Hey! They left without saying good-bye!

title: The Storm
text: Your friends ain't too polite, are they?

title: The Storm
text: I know! This one time, I was ...

title: The Storm
text: [Hands Sokka a crate, interrupting him impolitely.] Yeah, yeah, yeah, yeah. Get below deck!

title: The Storm
text: Scene changes to show Katara riding on Appa in the rain, trying to find Aang. The shot cuts to show a cave in the side of a cliff face. Camera changes to a view of Katara outside the cave and Aang sitting alone inside, surrounded by darkness.

title: The Storm
text: [Quietly.] I'm sorry for running away.

title: The Storm
text: It's okay. That fisherman was way out of line.

title: The Storm
text: Actually, he wasn't.

title: The Storm
text: [Surprised.] What do you mean?

title: The Storm
text: [Speaks in a sad voice.] I don't want to talk about it.

title: The Storm
text: It has to do with your dream, doesn't it? [Puts her hand on his shoulder.] Talk to me.

title: The Storm
text: Well, it's kind of a long story.

title: The Storm
text: Suddenly, Momo leaps past Aang and Katara, startling them. Appa has also entered the cave. He nuzzles Aang's head with his nose, making Aang smile. Aang pats Appa's chin.

title: The Storm
text: I'm going to try to get a little fire going.

title: The Storm
text: Next scene shows Katara and Aang sitting around a fire. Momo is lying on Aang's lap.

title: The Storm
text: I'll never forget the day the monks told me I was the Avatar. I was playing with some other kids just outside the South Wall. I was trying to teach them how to do the air scooter.

title: The Storm
text: Scene changes to a flashback when Aang is with some other Air Nomads.

title: The Storm
text: First you got to form the ball, then you got to get on quick.

title: The Storm
text: Aang is seen riding around on the scooter in the court. One of the boys tries it.

title: The Storm
text: Okay, here goes.

title: The Storm
text: The boy forms it and tries getting on, but spins and falls off. Aang gently gets off his.

title: The Storm
text: You kind of have to balance on it like it's a top.

title: The Storm
text: Man, that's hard.

title: The Storm
text: Where'd you learn that trick, Aang?

title: The Storm
text: I made it up.

title: The Storm
text: Wow!

title: The Storm
text: The Council of Elders shows up at that moment.

title: The Storm
text: Aang, come with us. We need to speak with you.

title: The Storm
text: Scene changes to when Aang and the elder monks are in the meeting room.

title: The Storm
text: How do you know it's me?

title: The Storm
text: We have known you were the Avatar for some time. Do you remember these?

title: The Storm
text: Monk Tashi airbends a wrapped-up mat to Aang. It opens up, revealing four toys.

title: The Storm
text: Those were some of my favorite toys when I was little! [He picks up the propeller toy.]

title: The Storm
text: You chose them from among thousands of toys, Aang. The toys you picked were the four Avatar relics. These items belonged to Avatars past. Your own past lives.

title: The Storm
text: I just chose them because they seemed fun.

title: The Storm
text: He smiles and pulls the cord on the propeller toy, sending the propeller spinning into the air. It spins through the air and the scene cuts back to a close view of the five monks. The toy goes over Monk Tashi's head.

title: The Storm
text: You chose them because they were familiar.

title: The Storm
text: Normally we would have told you of your identity when you turned sixteen, but there are troubling signs. Storm clouds are gathering.

title: The Storm
text: I fear that war may be upon us, young Avatar.

title: The Storm
text: We need you, Aang.

title: The Storm
text: Aang lowers his head, his responsibility crushing him. His head stays lowered as the flashback ends and his head remains lowered in the present as well. Cut to a wider shot of Aang on the left, Katara on the right, the fire between them. Katara looks upon him with concern and sympathy. The scene changes back to Zuko's ship. Jee is talking about Zuko to a couple other men.

title: The Storm
text: I'm sick of taking his orders! I'm tired of chasing his Avatar! I mean, who does Zuko think he is?

title: The Storm
text: Do you really want to know?

title: The Storm
text: Jee is shown standing up at the sound of Iroh's voice.

title: The Storm
text: General Iroh. We were just- [Iroh cuts him off.]

title: The Storm
text: It's okay. May I join you?

title: The Storm
text: Of course, sir.

title: The Storm
text: Iroh is shown sitting down.

title: The Storm
text: [Massages his beard.]Â Try to understand. My nephew is a complicated young man. He has been through much.

title: The Storm
text: Scene changes to a flashback. Zuko walks up to the curtains to get in the war room, but the guard on the left moves in front of the curtain to stop him.

title: The Storm
text: Let me in!

title: The Storm
text: [Places his hands on Zuko's shoulders.]Â Prince Zuko, what's wrong?

title: The Storm
text: I want to go into the war chamber [Points to the guard.]Â but the guard won't let me pass!

title: The Storm
text: [Leads Zuko away with his left hand still on his shoulder.]Â You're not missing anything, trust me. These meetings are dreadfully boring.

title: The Storm
text: If I'm going to rule this nation one day, don't you think I need to start learning as much as I can?

title: The Storm
text: Very well. But you must promise not to speak. [Another elder soldier walks by them into the war chamber.]Â These old folks are a bit sensitive, you know?

title: The Storm
text: [Bows to Iroh.]Â Thank you, Uncle.

title: The Storm
text: Zuko and Iroh walk into the war room. The meeting starts.

title: The Storm
text: The Earth Kingdom defenses are concentrated here. [Bujing shows the place on the map.] A dangerous battalion of their strongest earthbenders and fiercest warriors. So I am recommending the forty-first division.

title: The Storm
text: But the forty-first is entirely new recruits. How do you expect them to defeat a powerful Earth Kingdom battalion?

title: The Storm
text: I don't. They'll be used as a distraction while we mount an attack from the rear. What better to use as bait than fresh meat?

title: The Storm
text: [Zuko is shown standing up.] You can't sacrifice an entire division like that! Those soldiers love and defend our nation! How can you betray them?

title: The Storm
text: Camera shows everyone in the war room staring at Zuko, save for Iroh, who is kneeling behind his nephew. The scene changes back to the present time.

title: The Storm
text: Zuko was right, you see, [Massages his beard again.]Â but it was not his place to speak out. And there were dire consequences.Â [Slightly bows his head.]

title: The Storm
text: Scene changes back to Aang and Katara.

title: The Storm
text: So you were upset that you were the Avatar? Why wouldn't you be excited about it?

title: The Storm
text: Well, I didn't know how to feel about it. All I knew was that after I found out, everything began changing.

title: The Storm
text: Scene changes back to flashback. Aang enters into the South Wall again. The Air Nomad kids are shown on air scooters.

title: The Storm
text: Hey, not bad! You guys have been practicing!

title: The Storm
text: Not only that! We made up a game you can play with the air scooters!

title: The Storm
text: Great! [Aang is shown making his own. But everyone else makes theirs vanish.] What's going on?

title: The Storm
text: Now that you're the Avatar, it's kind of an unfair advantage for whichever team you're on.

title: The Storm
text: But I'm still the same! Nothing's changed! So, what? I can't play?

title: The Storm
text: That's the only fair way.

title: The Storm
text: Oh, okay.

title: The Storm
text: Sorry, Aang.

title: The Storm
text: Aang is shown leaving the South Wall.

title: The Storm
text: Okay. Now, who wants Jinju on their team?

title: The Storm
text: Jinju is shown in the corner with a gas around him, laughing. Scene changes to Aang and Gyatso playing a game of Pai Sho. Aang is shown moving a piece.

title: The Storm
text: Very interesting move, young one.

title: The Storm
text: What do you mean?

title: The Storm
text: Gyatso is shown using airbending to make a spiral, flipping a part of Aang's clothing. Gyatso quickly moves two pieces around. Aang is shown flipping his clothing back into place.

title: The Storm
text: Hey!

title: The Storm
text: Gyatso and Aang laugh. Monk Tashi appears.

title: The Storm
text: You're playing games with him? The Avatar should be training!

title: The Storm
text: Aang has already trained enough for today.

title: The Storm
text: Time is short. [To Aang.] Come with me. I must test you on some high level techniques.

title: The Storm
text: No. As long as I'm his guardian, I will decide when he trains ... and when he gets his butt kicked at Pai Sho.

title: The Storm
text: Hmph.

title: The Storm
text: Monk Tashi is shown walking away. The flashback ends, and the scene changes to on Zuko's ship. A flashback appears of the fire in front of the Fire Lord's throne rising.

title: The Storm
text: After Zuko's outburst in the meeting, the Fire Lord became very angry with him. [Flashback quickly ends.] He said the challenge against the general was an act of complete disrespect! And there was only one way to resolve this.

title: The Storm
text: Agni Kai. A fire duel.

title: The Storm
text: That's right. Zuko looked upon the old general he had insulted and declared that he was not afraid. But Zuko misunderstood. [Flashback shows an overview of the chamber; the camera cuts to show Zuko preparing for the Agni Kai.] When he turned to face his opponent, he was surprised to see it was not the general. [Flashback shows the tippet that was on Zuko's shoulders fall down to the ground.] Zuko had spoken out against the general's plan, but by doing so in the Fire Lord's war room, it was the Fire Lord whom he had disrespected. [Frontal shot of a surprised Zuko; as the camera zooms in on him, his expression changes to one of fear.] Zuko would have to duel his own father.

title: The Storm
text: Cut to a wall of the cave. The shot pans down to show Katara and a sad-looking Aang around their campfire. While Momo is asleep in his lap, Aang stares off into the fire with unseeing eyes as he continues his story.

title: The Storm
text: Then, just when I was feeling better, something worse happened.

title: The Storm
text: Scene changes to flashback of Monk Tashi and Monk Gyatso speaking to Monk Pasang.

title: The Storm
text: Aang needs to have freedom and fun. He needs to grow up as a normal boy.

title: The Storm
text: You cannot keep protecting him from his destiny.

title: The Storm
text: Gyatso, I know you mean well, but you are letting your affection for the boy cloud your judgment.

title: The Storm
text: All I want is what is best for him.

title: The Storm
text: But what we need is what's best for the world. You and Aang must be separated! The Avatar will be sent away to the Eastern Air Temple to complete his training.

title: The Storm
text: Aang is shown looking through a hole in the ceiling, shocked at the news that he just heard.

title: The Storm
text: That's awful, Aang. I don't know what to say.

title: The Storm
text: [Stands up.] How could they do that to me? They wanted to take away everything I knew and everyone I loved! [He activates the Avatar State.]

title: The Storm
text: Whoa! Hot cinders!

title: The Storm
text: Aang comes out of the Avatar State, walks to the fire, and sits down again.

title: The Storm
text: I'm sorry I got so mad.

title: The Storm
text: You have the right to be angry after the monks sent you away like that.

title: The Storm
text: Well, that's not exactly what happened. [Flashback starts again, showing Aang looking out the window of his bedroom.] I was afraid and confused. I didn't know what to do.

title: The Storm
text: Flashback shows Aang lying on his bed before changing to Gyatso walking to Aang's room.

title: The Storm
text: Aang, I'm not going to let them take you away from me. Aang? [Gyatso is shown opening the door more, spotting the scroll, and opening it up. He gasps, and sees a storm coming outside the window.]

title: The Storm
text: [Still in present, but flashback playing still.] I never saw Gyatso again. [Flashback shows Aang and Appa through the storm, and how Aang got into the iceberg.] Next thing I knew, I was waking up in your arms after you found me in the iceberg.

title: The Storm
text: Flashback shows Katara's face that was seen in "The Boy in the Iceberg". The flashback ends.

title: The Storm
text: You ran away.

title: The Storm
text: And then the Fire Nation attacked our temple. My people needed me and I wasn't there to help.

title: The Storm
text: You don't know what would have-.

title: The Storm
text: The world needed me and I wasn't there to help.

title: The Storm
text: Aang ...

title: The Storm
text: The fisherman was right! I did turn my back on the world!

title: The Storm
text: You're being too hard on yourself, even if you did run away. I think it was meant to be. If you had stayed, you would have been killed along with all the other airbenders.

title: The Storm
text: You don't know that.

title: The Storm
text: I know it was meant to be this way. The world needs you now. You give people hope.

title: The Storm
text: Scene changes back to Zuko's ship.

title: The Storm
text: When Prince Zuko saw that it was his father who had come to duel him, he begged for mercy.

title: The Storm
text: Flashback shows a side overview of the Agni Kai chamber where Ozai is advancing on Zuko.

title: The Storm
text: [Cut to a side-view of Zuko.] Please, Father. I only had the Fire Nation's best interest at heart. I'm sorry I spoke out of turn! [Slightly lowers his head.]

title: The Storm
text: Cut to a frontal shot from a worm's eye perspective of Ozai's silhouette walking up to Zuko.

title: The Storm
text: You will fight for your honor.

title: The Storm
text: [Frontal shot; kneels on his knees and forearms, while looking at the floor.]Â I meant you no disrespect. [Gazes up at his father, tears shimmering in his eyes as his voice starts to waver.] I am your loyal son.

title: The Storm
text: [Far off frontal shot of Zuko as Ozai's shadow and eventually his head come into view.] Rise and fight, Prince Zuko!

title: The Storm
text: Cut to a side-view from behind some of the spectators as Ozai reaches Zuko, who lowers his head to the floor again.

title: The Storm
text: I won't fight you.

title: The Storm
text: You will learn respect, [Zuko pushes himself up on his knees and hands. Cut to a frontal shot of Zuko as he starts to shake.]Â and suffering will be your [Zuko looks up at Ozai, tears streaming down his face.] teacher.

title: The Storm
text: Cut to a frontal view of Zhao, Iroh, and Azula in the crowd. While Iroh clenches his teeth and looks fearful and worried on Zuko's behalf, Zhao looks on with a smirk on his face, while Azula smiles and raises her left fist in front of her chest in anticipation.

title: The Storm
text: [Voice-over; Iroh closes his eyes and averts his head to the left.] I looked away.

title: The Storm
text: As the sound of a fire blast is heard, Zuko is screaming "no", which echoes. While the faces of the spectators are brightened by the flames, the camera slowly zooms in on Iroh's averted face. The scene switches from the past to the present, where Iroh is sitting in the same manner.

title: The Storm
text: I always thought that Prince Zuko was in a training accident.

title: The Storm
text: It was no accident. After the duel, the Fire Lord said that by refusing to fight, Zuko had shown shameful weakness. As punishment, he was banished and sent to capture the Avatar. Only then could he return with his honor.

title: The Storm
text: So that's why he's so obsessed. Capturing the Avatar is the only chance he has of things returning to normal.

title: The Storm
text: Things will never return to normal. But the important thing is the Avatar gives Zuko hope.

title: The Storm
text: Scene changes to show Zuko meditating, while having flashbacks of his younger life. He is stopped by a hit on the ship. Scene changes to Aang and Katara. The fisherman's wife appears.

title: The Storm
text: Help! Oh, please help!

title: The Storm
text: [Grabs lady and brings her near the fire.] It's okay. You're safe.

title: The Storm
text: But my husband isn't.

title: The Storm
text: What do you mean? Where's Sokka?

title: The Storm
text: They haven't returned! They should have been back by now! And this storm is becoming a typhoon! They're caught out at sea!

title: The Storm
text: I'm going to find him!

title: The Storm
text: I'm going with you!

title: The Storm
text: I'm staying here.

title: The Storm
text: The fisherman's wife is shown sitting down by the fire. Aang and Katara are shown about to leave on Appa.

title: The Storm
text: We'll be back soon. I promise.

title: The Storm
text: Aang and Katara fly out. Scene changes to Zuko's ship, with Zuko on the deck.

title: The Storm
text: Where were we hit?

title: The Storm
text: I don't know!

title: The Storm
text: Look!

title: The Storm
text: The helmsman!

title: The Storm
text: Zuko and Lieutenant Jee are shown climbing up a ladder to help a man who is about to fall. Lightning goes down to the middle of the ship, where Iroh is. He uses redirection so it does not damage the ship. Scene changes to Katara and Aang looking for the fisherman and Sokka.

title: The Storm
text: Where are they?

title: The Storm
text: Appa is shown descending, hitting the water.

title: The Storm
text: Come on, Appa! The boat! There!

title: The Storm
text: Zuko is shown spotting Appa.

title: The Storm
text: The Avatar!

title: The Storm
text: What do you want to do, sir?

title: The Storm
text: Let him go. We need to get this ship to safety.

title: The Storm
text: Then we must head directly into the eye of the storm.

title: The Storm
text: Scene changes to show Sokka and the fisherman rocking back and forth on the boat.

title: The Storm
text: I'm too young to die!

title: The Storm
text: I'm not, but I still don't wanna!

title: The Storm
text: Aang shows up. He jumps down onto the boat. As a pole is falling down, Aang brings up fours pouts of water, splitting the pole in half. After the pole splits in half, Sokka and the fisherman are shown hugging each other. A rope is seen.

title: The Storm
text: Hang onto the rope.

title: The Storm
text: The fisherman and Sokka do so. Appa starts flying again. The rope swings up, making Sokka and the fisherman land on the saddle. A big wave hits the gang underwater. Everyone is shown floating away from Appa. Aang goes into the Avatar State and saves everyone. They all go back to the cave where the fisherman's wife is. Scene changes to Zuko and Iroh together.

title: The Storm
text: Uncle, I'm sorry.

title: The Storm
text: Your apology is accepted.

title: The Storm
text: Scene changes to Appa, Katara, Aang, Sokka, and the fisherman at the cave. The fisherman's wife runs up to the fisherman and hugs him.

title: The Storm
text: Oh, you're alive! You owe this boy an apology!

title: The Storm
text: He doesn't have to apologize.

title: The Storm
text: What if, instead of an apology, I give him a free fish and we call it even?

title: The Storm
text: Actually, I don't eat meat.

title: The Storm
text: Fish ain't meat!

title: The Storm
text: Seriously, you're still going to pay me, right?

title: The Storm
text: The fisherman hands Sokka a fish. Katara and Aang are shown in a corner of the cave.

title: The Storm
text: Katara, I think you were right before. I'm done dwelling on the past.

title: The Storm
text: Really?

title: The Storm
text: I can't make guesses about what would have turned out if I hadn't run away. I'm here now and I'm going to make the most out of it.

title: The Storm
text: I don't think you're gonna have those nightmares anymore.

title: The Storm
text: And if you weren't here now, well, I guess I wouldn't be either. Thank you for saving my life, Avatar.

title: The Storm
text: Do you hear that? It stopped raining.

title: The Storm
text: Everyone goes outside. Appa shakes raindrops off himself, splashing everyone.

title: The Storm
text: Appa!

title: The Storm
text: Fade to credits.

title: The Storm
text: Aang

title: The Blue Spirit
text: The scene opens on a messenger hawk flying toward an imposing Fire Nation fortress as the scene changes to its tower. The camera pans across the tri-level fortress and it's tall balconies before settling on a courtyard where a group of archers stand at the ready. Switch to a closer shot of a single archer. The archer draws his bow and releases three times in succession, sharply and accurately. Switch to a shot of the bowman's target. The first arrow strikes dead center, the second arrow splits the first arrow in half, and the third arrow splits the second arrow in half and completely impales the target. Switch back to a shot of the archers as they draw their bows. The camera pans up to a balcony where Colonel Shinu is arguing heatedly with Commander Zhao.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: [In response to Zhao; somewhat angrily.] Absolutely not! The Yuyan Archers stay here. Your request is denied, Commander Zhao.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Colonel Shinu, please reconsider ... Their precision is legendary. The Yuyan can pin a fly to a tree from one hundred yards away ... without killing it. [Annoyed.] You're wasting their talents using them as mere security guards.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: I can do whatever I want with their talents, they're my archers, and what I say goes.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Zhao turns to face the colonel, frustrated and angry.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: But my search for the Avatar is-

title: The Blue Spirit
text: [Cutting Zhao off mid-sentence while getting close to him and scoffing angrily.] Is nothing but a vanity project! We're fighting a real war here, and I need every man I've got, commander.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: But-!

title: The Blue Spirit
text: [Furiously.] That's final! I don't wanna hear another word about it!

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Zhao fumes. In the background, the cry of a messenger hawk is heard. Camera shifts to an above view and follows a messenger hawk as it reaches Colonel Shinu. Shinu opens the container on the hawk's back and reads the message inside with a puzzled expression.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: [Intrigued.] News from Fire Lord Ozai?

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Shinu hands Zhao the message with irritation. Zhao takes the message, rudely brushing past the Colonel as he reads the news. Zhao smiles smugly.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: [Pleased.] It appears I've been promoted to Admiral. My request ... is now an order.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Colonel Shinu bows respectfully, and leaves.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: [Pressing a wet rag onto Sokka's forehead.] This should bring your fever down.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: You know what I love about Appa the most? His sense of humor.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: That's nice. I'll tell him.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Appa growls.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: [Laughs.] Classic Appa.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: How's Sokka doing?

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Not so good, being out in that storm really did a number on him.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Sokka starts sniffing pitifully.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: I couldn't find any ginger root for the tea. But I found a map. There's an herbalist institute on top of that mountain. We could probably find a cure for Sokka there.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Aang, he's in no condition for travel. Sokka just needs more rest. I'm sure he'll be better by tomorrow. [Starts coughing.]

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Not you too!

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Relax, it was just a little cough. I'm fi- [She coughs again, this time with greater force, and lightly groans after.]

title: The Blue Spirit
text: [Shielding his face.] That's how Sokka started yesterday. Now look at him! He thinks he's an earthbender!

title: The Blue Spirit
text: [Delirious.] Take that, you rock! [He flails his arms as if he is hitting something.]

title: The Blue Spirit
text: A few more hours and you'll be talking nonsense, too. I'm going to go find some medicine! [He grabs his glider and begins to head out just as a flash of lightning strikes.] Uh, maybe it's safer if I go on foot. [To Appa and Momo.] Keep an eye on them guys. [Appa groans while Momo chitters.]

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Ha, ha! You guys are killing me!

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Aang jumps, and uses airbending to help him run faster. The scene switches to Prince Zuko's ship.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: We haven't been able to pick up the Avatar's trail since the storm, but if we continue heading northeast ... [A larger Fire Nation ship pulls up next to theirs.]

title: The Blue Spirit
text: What do they want?

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Perhaps, a sporting game of Pai Sho!

title: The Blue Spirit
text: A soldier from the other ship walks in.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: [To Zuko.] The hunt for the Avatar has been given prime importance. All information regarding the Avatar must be reported directly to Admiral Zhao.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Zhao has been promoted? Well, good for him! [As Iroh makes a move in his Pai Sho game, another player slaps his hand against his own forehead as if he lost.]

title: The Blue Spirit
text: [Looking down.] I've got nothing to report to Admiral Zhao. Now get off my ship and let us pass.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Admiral Zhao is not allowing ships in or out of this area.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Off my ship!

title: The Blue Spirit
text: [Iroh wins his game.] Excellent! I take the pot! [A crew member punches himself.] But you're all improving! I'm certain you will win if we play again.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: The scene switches to a hidden outpost. One soldier is looking at Aang's wanted poster while the other is on watch duty.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: [Reading Aang's wanted poster out loud.] Says here that the Avatar can create tornadoes and run faster than the wind. Pretty amazing!

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Ah, that's just a bunch of Fire Lord propaganda! There's no way that's true!

title: The Blue Spirit
text: The scout returns to his task and sees a cloud moving swiftly along the ground which turns out to be Aang. Aang runs by wrecking the outpost on accident. One of the scouts blows a horn signaling that Aang has been spotted.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: [Weakly.] Katara, please, water.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: [Also weak.] Listen carefully, Momo. [Holds up a water skin.] I need you to take this to the river, and fill it with water. [She is shown through Momo's eyes, speaking gibberish.] Got it? [Momo takes the skin and flies off.]

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Aang runs up the stairs and enters the green house.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: [Speaking fast.] Hello, I'm sorry to barge in like this, but I need some medicine for my friends, they have fevers and they were coughing- [Gets cut off by the herbalist.]

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Settle down, young man. Your friends are going to be fine. I've been up here for over forty years you know, used to be others, but they all left years ago. [She pets Miyuki who begins to purr.] Now it's just me and Miyuki.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: That's nice.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Wounded Earth Kingdom troops still come by now and again, brave boys, and thanks to my remedies they always leave in better shape they when they arrive.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: That's nice. Are you almost done?

title: The Blue Spirit
