text: Hold on, I just need to add one last ingredient. [Walking among the shrubbery, looking around and muttering to herself.] Oh, sandalwood ... oh, er, uh, that won't do, banana leaf? Ah, nope, uh, ginger root, uh uh, oh where is that pesky little plant?

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Aang looks exasperated in the background and face-palms himself. Cut to Zuko's ship steaming by the shore, the sunset in its last stages in the background. Cut to Zuko practicing firebending on the foredeck in the background. Iroh's arm comes into the frame.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Is everything okay? It's been almost an hour and you haven't given the men an order.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: I don't care what they do.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Don't give up hope yet. You can still find the Avatar before Zhao.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: [Turning back, desperation and fear on his face.] How, Uncle? With Zhao's resources, it's just a matter of time before he captures the Avatar. [Turns back out to sea and whispers.] My honor, my throne, my country, I'm about to lose them all.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Cut back to an exterior shot of the herbalist institute, followed by a shot of the old woman in front of some bushes.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Ah! Plum blossom! [She plucks a flower from the tree.]

title: The Blue Spirit
text: [He lifts up his head off the table.] Finally! [Close-up of the mixing bowl as the herbalist drops the flower into the mixture, and Aang grabs for the bowl.] Thanks for all your help!

title: The Blue Spirit
text: The scene moves back, just as Aang wants to yank the bowl out of the herbalist's hands, and she slaps his hands roughly away with her spoon.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Hands off!

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Ow!

title: The Blue Spirit
text: [Close-up, holding her spoon at the ready for a new attack.] What do you think you're doing?

title: The Blue Spirit
text: [Rubs his hand, flinching.] Taking the cure to my friends.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: [Lowers her spoon; laughs.] This isn't a cure! It's Miyuki's dinner. Plum blossom is her favorite.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: What about my friends?

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Well, all they need are some frozen wood frogs. There's plenty down in the valley swamp.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: [Confused.] What am I supposed to do with frozen frogs?

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Why, suck on them of course!

title: The Blue Spirit
text: [Shocked and disgusted; his eye twitches.] Suck on them?

title: The Blue Spirit
text: The frog skin excretes a substance that will cure your friends. Be sure to get plenty because once those little critters thaw out, they're useless!

title: The Blue Spirit
text: You're insane, aren't you?

title: The Blue Spirit
text: [Crazily.] That's right! Well, don't stand there all day! Go!

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Aang runs out and the storm gets worse; he wipes his face from the excessive rainfall. Several arrows comes out of nowhere and pins Aang's pants to the ground; he airbends a shield sending some off them away. Aang removes one.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Uh ... I think you dropped this ... [Screams as he sees the Yuyan Archers taking aim at him. Panicking, he frees himself from the arrow that had pinned his foot to the ground and runs. He falls off a cliff into a swamp and finds the frozen frogs.] A frog!

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Aang sticks the frog in his shirt and manages to get four more before getting one of his sleeves pinned to a rock. Aang waterbends an ice wall in front of himself. An arrow strikes the wall before two more land in the same spot and slice the arrows that came before it. The ice cracks and another set of arrows pin his other sleeve before a net is launched at him.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: So this is the great Avatar. Master of all the elements. I don't know how you've managed to elude the Fire Nation for a hundred years, but your little game of hide and seek is over.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: [Angry.] I've never hidden from you! Untie me and I'll fight you right now!

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Uhh, no. Tell me, how does it feel to be the only airbender left? Do you miss your people? [Aang looks down sadly.] Don't worry, you won't be killed like they were. [Aang looks angry again.] See, if you die you will just be reborn and the Fire Nation would have to start searching all over again. So I'll keep you alive, but just barely. [Aang takes a deep breath and blows at gale force at Zhao, who falls over.] Blow all the wind you want, but your situation is futile. There is no escaping this fortress, and no one is coming to rescue you.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Zhao exits the room with the door slamming behind him. Back to Katara and Sokka snuggled up in their sleeping bags which lie between Appa's feet. Sokka has a coughing fit.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: [Weakly.] Water ...

title: The Blue Spirit
text: [Weakly.] Momo should be back any minute.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Momo jumps into the shot, chittering happily. He jumps up close to Katara. He drops a dead mouse on to her chest. She looks at it in disgust.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: [Weakly; in disgust.] Ugh! No, Momo, water. Wa-ter! [Momo's ear go straight up. He jumps off her and scampers.] Aang, what in the world is taking you so long?

title: The Blue Spirit
text: The scene changes to an overhead shot of Aang still bound between the pillars, still trying to get out of the chains. The scene changes again, to several exterior night shots of the fortress, culminating in a long shot of the Blue Spirit. The camera zooms in three step changes to a close-up of the Blue Spirit, who moves left. Cut to a view of the road leading to the fortress where a wagon is making its way toward the gate. Cut to a view of the undercarriage of the wagon as it passes. The Blue Spirit is holding on to the underside of the wagon. The wagon reaches the gate.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: All clear.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: A gate guard looks at the wagon and walks around it. When the guard checks the undercarriage, the Blue Spirit is gone. The guard gets back up. Cut to a wider shot of the wagon and the guards around it.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: All clear. Go on in.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Shift to a view from inside the wagon where the Blue Spirit has hidden himself; cut to an overhead shot of the wagon as it enters the first of the fortress' three gates. The shot pans up to rest on the massive central tower where Aang is held prisoner. Cut to a view of the first courtyard where the boxes in the wagon have been unloaded. The Blue Spirit runs from them and ducks into the shadows. Cut to a shot of an ornate balcony with bonfire pots on either side. The balcony is festooned with gold and red spades. Admiral Zhao appears flanked by attendants. During his speech the view cuts to show the innermost courtyard full of Fire Nation soldiers standing at attention.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: We are the sons and daughters of fire, the superior element! Until today only one thing stood our path to victory, the Avatar. I am here to tell you that he is now my prisoner! [The crowd cheers.] This is the year Sozin's Comet returns to grant us its power! [The crowd cheers.] This is the year the Fire Nation breaks through the walls of Ba Sing Se and burns the city to the ground!

title: The Blue Spirit
text: As Zhao speaks, various shots are seen of the Blue Spirit steadily and stealthily infiltrating the fortress. Cut back to Aang, still struggling fruitlessly against his chains. He finally stops, breathing heavily. It's useless. Suddenly, frogs start leaping out of his shirt.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: [To the frogs.] What? No! Don't leave, frogs! My friends are sick and they need you! Please go back to being frozen!

title: The Blue Spirit
text: He begins to struggle again as the frogs hop away toward the door, croaking. Cut to the four guards standing outside the chamber. They begin to look confused when they hear croaking. They look down to see the frogs coming from underneath the door. Suddenly they look up as a Fire Nation soldier's helmet comes bouncing down the corridor toward them. One of the guards walks up the corridor and turns right at the first junction, disappearing from view. A gout of flame erupts from the cross hallway as well as the sound of a brief scuffle. Two more guards go up to the junction and turn right, firebending stances at the ready. Cut to a view looking down the cross hallway. The first guard who went is hanging from the ceiling, tied up. Shift to the hanging soldier and pan up to reveal the Blue Spirit on the ceiling above the two new combatants. He drops down and melee begins, but it is over quickly. Cut back to the last guards, where they now see the Blue Spirit at the junction.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Who are you? What's going on? Are you here to rescue me? [The Blue Spirit opens the door and motions for him to follow.] I'll take that as a "yes."

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Aang follows him out past the gagged and tied guard at the door to his chamber. He hears frog noises and turns to see his half-frozen frogs crawling on the floor.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: My frogs! Come back! And stop thawing out! [The Blue Spirit comes back, picks him up by the collar and carries him out.] Wait! My friends need to suck on those frogs!

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Meanwhile, back at the run-down temple, Momo has succeeded in piling up mountains of junk around Katara, but no water. Momo returns again with a crown.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: [With a weak, sickly voice.] How many times do I have to tell you, Momo? We need water, wa-ter. Oh forget it. Aang, please, hurry.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: [Delirious.] Who's this "Aang" kid you keep talking about, Your Highness? [Katara gets an annoyed look on her face.]

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Scene shifts back to a few exterior shots of the fortress before switching to Aang and the Blue Spirit walking silently in the sewer system underneath the fortress. Soldiers walk back and forth above them. They hope out of a grate and into one of the courtyards. Cut to Zhao walking in one of the torch-lit corridors of the fortress, followed by a scribe.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: I want a full transcription of my speech sent to the Fire Lord, along with glowing testimonials from all of the ranking officers present, and â

title: The Blue Spirit
text: He cuts himself off as he hears moans. Cut to Zhao's right, where the soldiers that the Blue Spirit tied still lie. Zhao, upset, slams open the door to Aang's prison cell. It is empty, except for a frog which croaks at him from the floor. Zhao turns in anger and leaves, the scribe in tow.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Sir, should I hold off sending that speech to the Fire Lord?

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Cut back to the two would-be escapees who are now scaling a rope on the innermost wall of the fortress. They are spotted and the view zooms out as one of the guards shouts.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: There, on the wall!

title: The Blue Spirit
text: A soldier appears at the top of the wall they are climbing. He cuts the rope and the pair fall down the wall, Aang screaming. Cut to side-view where Aang airbends them to a soft landing. When the dust clears, the Blue Spirit unsheathes his swords and they run. Cut to Zhao on the ornate balcony.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: [Shouting.] The Avatar has escaped! Close all the gates immediately! [Cut to the escapees running, Aang passes the Blue Spirit.]

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Stay close to me!

title: The Blue Spirit
text: The third gate is closing in front of them, as are the two beyond it, and it is blocked by many soldiers. Aang airbends a blast of air that blows them out of the way. Aang makes for the gate, but the Blue Spirit gets involved in melee and has to stop and fend them off. Aang turns to see the Blue Spirit in trouble. He grabs a spear from a guard near him, airbends him out of the way, spins it around and breaks the head off the spear on the ground and launches back into battle to save his new friend. The gate closes behind him. The Blue Spirit is surrounded, but Aang airbends them all out of the way. With a mighty effort, he catapults the Blue Spirit to the top of the third wall.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Take this. Jump on my back!

title: The Blue Spirit
text: The Blue Spirit complies and Aang begins to use the ladders as massive stilts, shedding one each time a step is taken. Cut to a wide shot of the second courtyard, where dawn is approaching in the background. The first ladder shed still has some Fire Nation soldiers on it, but it falls into the dust.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Give me the next one!

title: The Blue Spirit
text: The Blue Spirit again complies. Cut to the bottom of their final stilt where a Fire Nation soldier sends a gout of flame up the ladder. It is too late though, as Aang and the masked man jump from the last stilt and just manage to grab the edge of the final wall. They are unable to hold on, however, and fall to the ground. The Blue Spirit draws his swords. Four firebenders unleash their flame on them, but Aang puts the masked man behind him and airbends the flames away.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Hold your fire! The Avatar must be captured alive!

title: The Blue Spirit
text: The Blue Spirit instantly comes up behind Aang and crosses his swords in front of Aang's throat, surprising him. Cut to a view behind the escapees that pans right slowly, accenting the stand-off, before cutting to the implacable blue mask of the intruder. Cut back to a close of Zhao's eyes.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: [Through gritted teeth.] Open the gate.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Admiral, what are you doing?

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Let them out, now!

title: The Blue Spirit
text: The gate is opened and the Blue Spirit backs out with his captives, swords still at his throat. Cut back to Zhao, the officer questioning him still visible over his left shoulder.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: How could you let them go?

title: The Blue Spirit
text: A situation like this requires ... precision.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: The Blue Spirit continues backing away from the fortress. Zhao now looks on from the top of the main gate. Cut to an arrow being strung on a bow by an unseen soldier; cut back to Zhao, who looks to his right as he speaks.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Do you have a clear shot?

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Cut to a Yuyan Archer, who is silent, but aims.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Knock out the thief. I'll deliver him to the Fire Lord along with the Avatar.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: The archer releases his arrow, which the camera follows across the field to its impact point on the Blue Spirits masks. Cut to a side-view of Aang and the Blue Spirit as the masked man collapses backward in slow motion. Aang turns in horror, his eyes glazed. He recovers, turns around and airbends up a huge cloud of dust around him and the Blue Spirit.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Quick! Recover the Avatar!

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Cut to the main gate opening and a crowd Fire Nation soldiers emerging and running toward the dust cloud. Cut to inside the dust cloud, where Aang removes the Blue Spirit's mask to reveal Zuko. Aang starts back in horror and falls backward on the ground. He jumps up and runs away, but turns to look at Zuko, his eyes huge and full of compassion. He sees the Fire Nation soldiers getting close through the smoke. Still, he hesitates. When the dust clears, however, the soldiers find nothing. Cut back to Zhao, looking insanely angry. A frog hops up onto the railing, croaks, and hops off. Fade to white, followed by a blurry shot of a forest looking straight up into the canopy overhead. It is morning. The screen pans down to Aang sitting on a nearby root, the view is still blurry. He looks forlorn. Cut to Zuko, whose view we were clearly just seeing. He looks a bit dazed still.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: [To Zuko.] You know what the worst part of being born over a hundred years ago is? I miss all the friends I used to hang out with. Before the war started, I used to always visit my friend Kuzon. The two of us, we'd get in and out of so much trouble together. He was one of the best friends I ever had, and he was from the Fire Nation, just like you. If we knew each other back then, do you think we could have been friends, too?

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Cut to a wide shot of Zuko lying on the ground, Aang next to him, perched a large tree root. After a pause, Zuko lets loose a huge fireball at him, but Aang dodges and flies away on a current of air. Zuko watches him hop away from tree branch to tree branch and out sight. Cut to Zuko as the camera slowly zooms backward. Zuko raises his eye in consideration. Fade to a close-up of the swamp, where Aang is collecting frozen frogs once again. Cut back to a wide shot of Zuko's ship reeling in the cutter vessel back into the mother ship. Shift to Zuko, sullen, walking past his Uncle on the main deck.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Where have you been, Prince Zuko? You missed music night! Lieutenant Jee sang a stirring love song.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: I'm going to bed. No disturbances.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Iroh rubs his head and begins to blow his horn again. Fade back to the ruins. Aang returns, downcast. He puts frogs in his friends' mouths.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Suck on these. They'll make you feel better.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Aang collapse backward onto Appa's tail with a sigh. Cut to Sokka with a frog in his mouth.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: [With his mouth full; still spouting out nonsense.] Aang, how was your trip? Did you make any new friends?

title: The Blue Spirit
text: No, I don't think I did.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Aang rolls over. Fade to Prince Zuko lying awake in his own chamber, lost in thought. He looks at the Fire Nation symbol hanging on his wall, and rolls over himself. Cut back to the ruins and to Sokka, a happy expression on his face, still sucking on the frog in his mouth.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Mmmm! This is tasty! Mmm!

title: The Blue Spirit
text: It thaws out and begins moving around and croaking. Sokka realizes what it is and spits it out in disgust. Cut to Katara where her frog has also thawed. She cries out and it hops out of her mouth. Both Katara and Sokka begin spitting and coughing, Sokka rubs his tongue in panic against Appa's fur.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Fades to credits.

title: The Blue Spirit
text: Aang

title: The Fortuneteller
text: The episode opens to a sunny lake scene; Aang, Katara, and Sokka are sitting around a bundle of sticks with a blue tent behind Katara and are surrounded by trees and rocks. A large se tu suddenly bursts from the surface, leaps through the air, and lands with a splash into the water. Katara rises and points at it.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Excitedly.] Look!

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Sokka rises to view the spectacle. The fish, a se tu, leaps into the air again, facing the group in mid-jump in slow-motion before landing in the water again. The camera cuts to Sokka and Katara.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: He is taunting us! [Camera zooms out to the lake and the group's camp site.] You are so going to be dinner!

title: The Fortuneteller
text: He grabs his fishing pole from his tent set up nearby and attempts to cast the pole into the water unsuccessfully.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Observes the fishing pole.] Hey, where's the fishing line?

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Sheepishly.] Oh, I didn't think you would need it, Sokka. [He holds up an intricately woven necklace decorated with a red flower.]

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Walks over and examines the necklace.] Aw, it's all tangled!

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Rises to his feet.] Not tangled. Woven! I made you a necklace, Katara. I thought since you lost your other one ...

title: The Fortuneteller
text: He pauses in mid-sentence and displays the necklace, holding it between his hands as he flashes a toothy grin.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Smiling and approaching him.] Thanks, Aang. [Takes the necklace.] I love it.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Sarcastically.] Great, Aang. Maybe instead of saving the world, you can go into the jewelry-making business.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: I don't see why I can't do both.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: While saying this, Katara can be seen in the background, trying on her new necklace. Sokka turns back to the lake, where the se tu continues its acrobatic display. Sokka tosses the fishing line into the water in an attempt to spear the fish. He only grows more frustrated when he sees the se tu leap from the water, unharmed.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Stop taunting me!

title: The Fortuneteller
text: He runs into the water, holding his jawbone dagger. Aang watches him run off.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Off-camera.] So, how do I look?

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Aang turns to look at her, a bored expression on his face. His uninterested expression, however, soon transforms into one of awe and amazement. The camera focuses on Katara, panning upward from her feet to her head. The background around her has become colored with shades of pink and purple, sparkles of light glistening every now and then. The panshot reveals her smiling sweetly, blushing slightly with one hand behind her back and the other touching her necklace in a pose. The scene cuts to Aang, who nervously pulls at his collar with his hand, smiling awkwardly.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Nervously.] You mean, all of you or just your neck? [Puts his right hand behind his head in embarrassment.] I mean, because they both look great!

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Emerges from the water, holding the se tu.] Smoochie, smoochie, someone's in love! [Makes kissing noises before the se tu breaks free from his grasp, slapping Sokka in the face with its tail and disappearing under the water.]

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Embarrassed.] I ... well, uh ...

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Annoyed.] Stop teasing him, Sokka. Aang's just a good friend. [Pats the side of his head.] A sweet, little guy! Just like Momo. [Pets Momo, who lands on Aang's shoulder.]

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Dismayed.] Thanks.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Sokka emerges empty-handed from the lake, soaking wet and cross. Momo suddenly flies off Aang's shoulder upon hearing a loud noise in the distance. He leaps onto a rock followed by Aang, who observes the scene. He points to the source of the commotion.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Urgently.] Someone's being attacked by a platypus bear!

title: The Fortuneteller
text: The camera focuses on a large, ferocious creature having dark brown fur, the body and head of a bear, the tail and bill of a platypus and bearing a white "V" across its chest. The creature stands upright on its hind legs and swings at a man clad in blue, who smiles merrily, his hands behind his back. The man manages to avoid the bear's swing by calmly stepping backward. The creature continues its attacks as Aang leaps onto a rock directly behind it. The camera focuses on the calm man, who continues to smile as though nothing is occurring.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Well, hello there! [Dodges another swift swing of the bear's claws.] Nice day, isn't it?

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Make noise! He'll run off!

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Sokka and Katara approach the scene.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: No, play dead! He'll lose interest!

title: The Fortuneteller
text: The bear swings its claws only to miss striking the man once again.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Happily.] Whoa, close one! [Laughs bemusedly.]

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Cups a hand to her mouth and makes gestures with her other hand.] Run downhill, then climb a tree!

title: The Fortuneteller
text: No, punch him in the bill! [Swings a fist upward.]

title: The Fortuneteller
text: And then run in zig-zags!

title: The Fortuneteller
text: No need, it's going to be fine!

title: The Fortuneteller
text: The platypus bear attempts to land a blow, cutting a large chunk of wood from the trunk of a nearby tree, the calm dodging the attack. Aang leaps into the air and lands onto the ground, placing himself between the calm man and the platypus bear. He sends the creature back slightly with an air blast.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Holding his hands out in front of him and assuming a fighting stance.] Whoa there!

title: The Fortuneteller
text: The platypus bear only rears up on its hind legs further, letting out a loud cry. Appa suddenly appears from behind the bear and bellows, causing the animal to bristle in fear. The bear lays a large, spotted egg and escapes the scene, swimming down the river.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Joyfully picks up the egg.] Mmm, lunch! [He sniffs it.] Lucky for you, we came along.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Thanks, but everything was already under control. Not to worry. Aunt Wu predicted I'd have a safe journey. [Folds hands together and bows slightly.]

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Aunt who?

title: The Fortuneteller
text: No, Aunt Wu. She's the fortuneteller from my village. Awful nice knowing your future.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Looks off to the side as she ponders this.] Wow, it must be. [Faces the man with a bright expression on her face.] That explains why you were so calm!

title: The Fortuneteller
text: But the fortuneteller was wrong! You didn't have a safe journey; you were almost killed!

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Cheerfully.] But I wasn't! All right, have a good one! [He bids them a farewell and begins to walk away only to turn back again.] Oh, and Aunt Wu said if I met any travelers to give them this.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: He hands Aang a wrapped parcel seemingly containing a long, thin object and leaves mysteriously. Sokka eyes the man suspiciously.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Excitedly.] Maybe we should go see Aunt Wu and learn our fortunes. It could be fun.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Oh, come on. Fortune telling is nonsense!

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Aang quickly unwraps the mysterious parcel, which turns out to be a red umbrella. He opens it and holds it over his head.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: What do you know? An umbrella!

title: The Fortuneteller
text: At that moment, the sky darkens and it begins to rain. A low rumble of thunder can be heard. Katara bends an arched shield of water over her head to shelter herself from the weather.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: That proves it! [She ducks under the umbrella.]

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Holding egg above his head to shield himself from the rain.] No, it doesn't! You can't really tell the future!

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Smugly.] I guess you're not really getting wet then.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Sokka suddenly loses his grip on the platypus egg as it flies through the air. He attempts to catch it, however, it merely flies a few feet into the air and lands on his head, cracking and causing the egg to run down his face. Cut to the group walking along the path; as the rain continues, Aang and Katara are sheltered under the umbrella, while Sokka stays away from them, drenched by the downpour.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Crossly.] Of course she predicted it was going to rain. The sky's been gray all day!

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Just admit you might be wrong, and you can come under the umbrella.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Look, I'm going to predict the future now. [Stops walking and hops from foot to foot in an exaggerated way.] It's going to keep drizzling. [The rain continues to fall.] See?

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Suddenly, the rain stops falling and sky lightens up slightly. Cut to a shot of Aang and Katara, Aang titling the umbrella back to observe the dramatic change in weather.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Not everyone has the gift, Sokka.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: The camera cuts to a side-view of the entire team walking along the path in a strong, yet calm, breeze which rustles the grass on the side of the path. Aang and Katara continue to stroll leisurely under the umbrella ahead of Sokka. Appa plods behind, pausing briefly to shake his wet fur out, soaking Sokka in the process and causing him to flinch.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Disgusted.] Agh!

title: The Fortuneteller
text: The scene changes to a view of a large mountain, its peak covered in snow. The camera pans down to a small village, which lies at the mountain's very base. The team walks through the entrance into the village, turkey ducks quacking as they pass. The camera cuts to a strange man dressed in a black robe standing by a round doorway.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Aunt Wu is expecting you.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Excitedly.] Really?

title: The Fortuneteller
text: The trio walks through the doorway, Sokka expressing his disgust. They enter a room, three pillows situated on the floor to the right of the room. The strange man closes the door. A young girl walks into the room clad in a pink robe and wearing her hair in braids that stick out from the sides of her head.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: My name is Meng and I'm Aunt Wu's assistant.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Her eyes suddenly widen. The camera cuts to a shot of Aang, panning upward from his feet to his head. The background is similar to that of Aang's romanticized shot of Katara. The pan shot reveals him to be quite bored and slumped over. Cuts to close-up of Meng.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Pleased.] Well, hello there.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Rubs nose in disinterest.] Hello.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Aang and Katara seat themselves on the pillows.] Can I get you some tea or some of Aunt Wu's special bean curd puffs?

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Brightening.] I'll try a curd puff.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Holds up index finger in gesture.] Just a second. [To Aang.] So what's your name?

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Flatly.] Aang.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Delighted.] That rhymes with Meng! And you've got some pretty big ears, don't you?

title: The Fortuneteller
text: The camera cuts to a shot of Aang, somewhat exaggerating the size of his ears.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Awkwardly.] I guess.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Waves hand in dismissal and jokes.] Don't be modest! [Spreads arms outward in emphasis.] They're huge!

title: The Fortuneteller
text: The camera cuts to a shot of the entire group, Aang covering his ears in embarrassment and glaring at Sokka.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Begins walking away.] Well, Aang, it was very nice to meet you. [Smiles slyly.] Very nice. [Turns and leaves.]

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Likewise.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: I can't believe we're here in the house of nonsense.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Try to keep an open mind, Sokka. There are things in this world that just can't be explained. Wouldn't it be nice to have some insight into your future?

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Nonchalantly.] It would be nice to have some bean curd puffs.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Cuts to where Meng is shown approaching the room through a nearby hallway with a tray of bean curd puffs. A door in the hallway opens and a woman clad in green exits. She approaches Meng excitedly.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Oh, Meng! Aunt Wu says I'm going to meet my true love. He's going to give me a rare panda lily.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: That's so romantic! [Dreamily, while casting Aang a flirtatious look.] I wonder if my true love will give me a rare flower.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Breezily.] Good luck with that!

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Trying to contain her laughter.] Is that the big-eared guy who Aunt Wu predicted you'd marry?

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Embarrassed by this statement, Meng pushes the woman aside and continues on her way to the other room. She approaches the team, her eyes fixated hopefully on Aang, who stares off into space, unaware of her presence. She suddenly trips; Aang attempts to help her recover, accidentally holding her hands in his in the process. The two stare at each other for a moment; Meng blushes.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Nervously.] Enjoy your snack! [Leaves in a hurry.]

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Sokka takes the tray of curd puffs from Aang; he prepares to sample one only to be interrupted by an elderly woman, clad in a yellow robe, who enters the room.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Welcome, young travelers. Now, who's next? Don't be shy.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Cuts to a shot of the team. Sokka looks away uninterested and Aang casts a look at Katara.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Rising in anticipation.] I guess that's me.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: The two exit. Aang and Sokka sit idly on the floor, Sokka tasting the curd puffs.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Delighted; with his mouth full.] Mm, not bad, not bad! [Holding out bowl to Aang.] Mhm?

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Refusing the bowl.] I'm good on puffs. [Sokka shrugs and continues eating the puffs; trying to act casual.] So, what do you think they're talking about back there?

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Causally, holding up puff.] Boring stuff I'm sure. Love, who she's going to marry, how many babies she's going to have.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Trying to act cool.] Yeah, dumb stuff like that ... [Tenses a bit and bites his fingers nervously.] Well, I've got to find a bathroom.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: He rises and walks away off-screen. Sokka lies down, relaxed and samples another puff. While eating it, Momo comes on-screen and sneakily takes the bowl away for himself. Sokka places his hand down to grab another curd puff, only to open his eyes and realize the bowl is gone. Cuts to Aang, who tiptoes down the hallway to where Aunt Wu had led Katara into another room, clearly ready to eavesdrop on their conversation. Cuts to shot of Aang pressing his ear to the doorway. The following conversation between Aunt Wu and Katara occurs off-screen from behind the wall.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Your palms are so smooth. Do you use moisturizer?

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Actually, I have this special seaweed lotion. I can get you some if you want. [Aang sticks out his tongue; slight pause.] So, do you see anything interesting in my love line? [Aang immediately perks up upon hearing this.]

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Somewhat dramatically.] I feel a great romance for you. The man you are going to marry.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Excitedly.] Tell me more!

title: The Fortuneteller
text: I can see that he's a very powerful bender.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Upon hearing this statement, Aang smiles mischievously and leaps in the hallway, delighted upon hearing this. Cuts to the room where Sokka sits, picking his teeth. Aang struts into the room happily.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Looks like someone had a pretty good bathroom break.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Yeah ... when I was in there ...

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Disgusted, looking away and holding up a hand to signal Aang to stop.] I don't even want to know!

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Entering the room with Katara.] Who's next?

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Rising.] Okay, let's get this over with.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Dryly.] Your future is full of struggle and anguish. Most of it, self-inflicted.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Holding up his hands in protest.] But you didn't read my palms or anything!

title: The Fortuneteller
text: I don't need to. It's written all over your face. [Sokka resumes picking his teeth in disgust; to Aang.] You there, come with me.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Aang follows Aunt Wu out of the room and into her chamber. The chamber is a fairly spacious, dimly lit room. Four pillars support the ceiling and four cushions are situated in the center of the room, surrounding a small fire. Off to the side is a jug of bones. Aunt Wu and Aang approach the jug.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: This is the most reliable method of telling your fortune. The bones never lie. [Urging Aang to pick a bone.] Go on, pick one. [Aang takes one bone and they sit down.] Now throw it on the fire. [Aang tosses the bone into the fire.] The heat makes cracks in the bone and I read the bone cracks to tell your destiny.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Cuts to a shot of the bone sitting in the fire. The camera zooms in on the bone as a large crack splinters down its side.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Wow, that's a big crack.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Surprised.] I've never seen this before!

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Cuts to shot of the bone, camera panning to the right to show more cracks forming. The bone explodes and sends a burst of flames up to the ceiling.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Her and Aang shielding their faces in surprise.] Oh my! [Cuts to shot of the bone lying in the fire and back to Aunt Wu who is fascinated.] Your destiny! This is incredible. You will be involved in a great battle, an awesome conflict between the forces of good and evil. A battle whose outcome will determine the fate of the whole world!

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Casually.] Yeah, yeah, I knew that already. But did it say anything about a girl?

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Surprised.] A girl? You want to know about love?

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Excited.] Yes!

title: The Fortuneteller
text: I'm sorry, but I didn't see anything.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Aang looks down, disappointed at this. Aunt Wu realizes this.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Trying to cheer him up.] Well, look! [Holding her hand against her face in mock forgetfulness.] I must've missed something. [Cuts to a bone piece lying on the floor; Wu picks it up.] Right here. [Holds bone up to examine it.] It says "trust your heart and you will be with the one you love."

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Really? [Rises to his feet joyfully.] Thank you, Aunt Wu!

title: The Fortuneteller
text: He runs out of the room gleefully. Aunt Wu hold her hand to her forehead and shakes her head in dismay. The scene changes to an overhead view of outside Wu's building, the three gathered together with Appa standing behind them. The three begin walking down a street.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Well, now you got to see for yourselves how fortune telling is just a big, stupid hoax.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: You're just saying that because you're going to make yourself unhappy your whole life.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Voice rising in anger.] That woman is crazy! My life will calm and happy and joyful!

title: The Fortuneteller
text: He roughly kicks a nearby stone, which soars into the air and comically ends up ricocheting off a hanging metal sign and striking the warrior, who had been standing breezily with his arms crossed. He covers his head in pain and falls to the ground, off-camera. Hunched over out of view, he raises a finger into the frame in protest, his tone agitated.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: That doesn't prove anything!

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Satisfied.] Well, I liked my predictions. [Clasps her hands together anxiously.] Certain things are going to turn out very well.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Slyly, crossing his arms and leaning in toward her.] They sure are ...

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Why? What did she tell you?

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Ambiguously.] Some stuff. You'll find out.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Katara exits along with Aang, who folds his hands contentedly behind his head. Cuts to an overhead shot of the village courtyard, a pagoda-like structure lying centered in the middle. Cuts to shot of the villagers looking up at the sky before switching to a shot of the ground where the team approaches.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Looking at the sky.] What's with the sky?

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Also viewing the sky.] We are waiting for Aunt Wu to come and read the clouds to predict the fate of the whole village.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Pointing upward.] That cloud kind of looks like a fluffy bunny.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Slightly worried.] You better hope that's not a bunny! The fluffy bunny cloud forecasts doom and destruction.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Disgusted.] Do you even hear yourself?

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Gesturing to the mountain in the background.] The cloud reading will tell us if Mt. Makapu will remain dormant for another year or if it will erupt.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: We used to have a tradition once a year of going up the mountain to check the volcano ourselves. [Smiles.] But every since Aunt Wu moved to the village twenty years ago, we have a tradition of not doing that.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: I can't believe you would trust your lives to that crazy, old woman's superstition!

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Laying a hand on Sokka's shoulder.] Shhh! She's coming!

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Cuts to shot from in between Katara and Sokka's heads. The camera zooms in to show Aunt Wu and her guard appearing on-screen, ascending a stairwell. Cuts to an overhead shot of the entire courtyard, the crowd having formed an aisle to allow for the two figures to pass by. Cuts to shot of Aang and Katara standing next to each other, smiling widely as Aunt Wu and the guard walk by them. The crowd is clapping for the fortuneteller. Meng appears on-screen next to Aang.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Trying to impress him.] Hey, Aang. [Pointing upward.] Don't you think that cloud looks like a flower?

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Awkwardly.] Huh? Sure, I guess. [He pushes Meng away as the camera pans to the right; to Katara.] Hey, Katara, don't you think that cloud look like a flower?

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Annoyed.] Shhh!

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Aang shows clear disappointment at being hushed. Cuts to the pagoda, where Aunt Wu approaches. She spreads her arms outward dramatically. Cuts to shot of the sky, an arrow-shaped cloud hovering above. Cuts to Aunt Wu who studies a cloud reading book in her hand.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Thoughtfully.] Bending arrow cloud ... good crops this year. Nice big harvest.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Hugs elderly woman happily.] Darn good news!

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Wavy, moon-shaped cloud ... let's see. [Smiling.] Gonna be a great year for twins!

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [High-five each other joyfully.] Yes!

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Thoughtfully.] And a cumulus cloud with a twisted nob coming off the end of it ... [Spreads arms outward again.] The village will not be destroyed by the volcano this year!

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Cuts to an overhead shot of the courtyard, where the crowd cheers ecstatically. Cuts to shot of Aang and Katara standing among the crowds, their backs facing the camera.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Slightly nervous.] Since I got you here, uh, there's something I want to tell you. I like you, but more than normal.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Katara, enthralled with Aunt Wu and her predictions, runs off to follow the fortuneteller, clearly paying no attention to Aang. Aang becomes upset at this.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Crushed.] Never mind.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Cuts to shot of the upper levels of Aunt Wu's building, the camera panning downward to its entrance. Cuts to the hallway leading to Aunt Wu's chamber, where Katara stands before the doorway and knocks. Aunt Wu slides open the door.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Hi, Aunt Wu! Sorry to bother you.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Any time.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: About this man I'm supposed to marry ... [Looks down awkwardly and blushes.] Is he going to be handsome? [Clasps her hands together hopefully.] Oh, I hope he's tall!

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Ah ... You want another reading?

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Yes, please!

title: The Fortuneteller
text: The two enter the room with the door sliding closed behind them. Cuts to shot of upper portion of Sokka's head, an angered expression on his face as he marches past in the courtyard.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: I can't believe all these saps! [Cuts to side-view of Sokka walking forward, Aang following close behind.] Someone really needs to scream some sense into them.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: They seem happy, Sokka.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Not for long. I'm going to prove Aunt Wu's predictions are nonsense. [Pulls over a man standing nearby.] Hey you, I bet Aunt Wu told you to wear those red shoes, didn't she? [Cuts to shot of the man's red shoes.]

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Yeah. She said I'd be wearing red shoes when I met my true love.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Uh huh ... And how many times have you worn those shoes since you got that fortune?

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Smiles sheepishly.] Everyday.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Background becomes a spiral of swirling orange and yellow flames; angry.] Then of course it's gonna come true!

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Delighted.] Really? You think so? [Begins walking away.] I'm so excited!

title: The Fortuneteller
text: In a fit of anger, Sokka kicks a nearby stone; it flies off-screen and ends up comically hitting a turkey duck, which flies on-screen and begins attacking Sokka. The warrior crouches over and tries to ward of the bird. The scene changes to Aunt Wu's chamber, shot from the view of outside the doorway. Cuts to shot of Katara's hand outstretched as Aunt Wu traces her finger across her palm.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: And then you will have your third great-grandchild before quietly passing away in your sleep. [Cuts to shot of Aunt Wu, who does not seem particularly happy.] Is that enough information for you?

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Lifts her palm in wonder.] Wow, thanks, Aunt Wu. [She rises and prepares to leave, but suddenly turns back.] Oh wait, one more thing. How warmly should I dress tomorrow?

title: The Fortuneteller
text: You want me to do a reading for that?

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Cuts to shot of Katara, who nods almost crazily, a huge grin spread across her face. Cuts to outside in the courtyard where Aang stands behind Sokka, who is clearly ready to lose his mind, holding his hands up to his head in frustration.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Crazed.] I don't care what Aunt Wu told you! You have to take a bath sometime!

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Cuts to shot of a middle-aged man, covered in dirt and grime from head to toe. The man shrugs, grunts a bit and walks off smiling.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: So, Sokka, you know some stuff about ladies, right?

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Pleased.] Some stuff? [Places an arm around Aang's shoulders.] You've come to the right place. What can I do you for?

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Well, there's this girl.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Cuts to shot of Aang, Meng in the background, standing behind a barrel. She laughs.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Thinking of Meng rather than Katara.] I think I know who you mean.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Surprised.] You do? And you're okay with it?

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Of course I am. And to tell you the truth, I've been picking up a subtle vibe that she likes you, too.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Growing anxious; Meng tries to catch Aang's attention in the background.] She does?

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Oh yeah, she's crazy about you. All you have to do now is not mess it up.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Well, how do I do that?

title: The Fortuneteller
text: The number once mistake nice guys like you make: being too nice.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: You can be too nice?

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Yep. If you want to keep her interested, you have to act aloof, like you don't really care one way or the other.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Well, okay ...

title: The Fortuneteller
text: The camera shifts to show Meng approaching Aang shyly.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Hey, Aang, I was wondering ...

title: The Fortuneteller
text: See you later ... [Walks away casually and waves hand breezily.]

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Meng sighs and her ears droop downward, like dog ears.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Impressed.] Wow, that kid is good.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Cuts to overhead shot of the entranceway to Aunt Wu's building, where a clearly impatient Wu is shoving Katara out the door. A couple of idle Turkey ducks scramble away.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: And you'll be fine as long as you've got a scarf. Bye-bye now.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Okay, okay, but one more thing.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Stares horrified at Katara before sighing and leaning forward slightly in surrender.] All right, what is it?

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Puts a hand to her chin thoughtfully.] Should I eat a mango or a papaya for breakfast tomorrow?

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Angrily.] Papaya! [Slams the door shut.]

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Kicks the ground, sending up a small cloud of dust.] Aww, I hate papaya.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: The view widens to where Aang can be seen slumped against the wall of the building, trying to act aloof on Sokka's advice.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Breezily.] Oh, hey, Katara. I didn't see you there.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Half-heartedly.] Hey, Aang. [Walks away.]

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Trying to catch her attention.] That's okay. I'm busy with my own stuff.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Aang stands idly before a turkey duck flies over and lands near him. After a brief moment of looking at each other, the duck quacks. Cuts to shot from slightly behind the pagoda in the courtyard, where Katara is seen in the background standing by a fruit stand.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Less than pleased.] Ugh, papaya please.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Cuts to shot from behind the stand, where Katara is seen on the opposite side of the vendor, taking a papaya from the seller's hands. Aang casually walks up to her, Momo perched on his shoulder.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Aloof.] So ... papaya.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Uh huh. Would you like some?

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Causally, picking an apple from the stand.] You know me. I don't really care what I eat.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Begins walking away.] Okay then. See you later.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: She exits the scene as Aang bites into the apple only to spit out the contents afterward in disgust.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Slightly downcast.] Maybe aloof isn't my style.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: He casts his gaze over to a man and the woman seen in Aunt Wu's building earlier, who stand in the background, the man having just offered something to the woman.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [From afar; delighted.] Oh, a panda lily!

title: The Fortuneteller
text: The couple embraces. Cuts to shot of Aang, who looks impressed by this display.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [To Momo.] Did you see that?

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Cuts to close-up of the panda lily, the camera zooming out to show the couple still embracing. Aang suddenly appears between the two, pushing them away from each other and startling both.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Excuse me. [Pointing to the flower.] Where can a guy find one of those things?

title: The Fortuneteller
text: The scene cuts to an area outside the village, a forested landscape in the background, Mt. Makapu standing magnificently behind the trees. Cuts to the side of the mountain, Aang leaping upward along the rocky outcrops.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Off-camera.] I can't believe you're dragging me all the way up here for a stupid flower.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Not just any flower, a panda lily. I've seen it in action and boy, does it work.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Cuts to shot of Sokka scaling the mountain.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Flowers are fine once you're married, but at this early stage, it's critical that you maintain maximum aloofness.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: But my heart is telling me to get this flower, [Looks up toward the rim of the mountain.] and Aunt Wu said if I trusted in my heart, I will be with the one I love.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Irritated.] What? Don't tell me you believe in that stuff, too.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Cuts to shot of Aang perched on one boulder, Sokka appearing on-screen.] Well, Aunt Wu hasn't been wrong yet. Why should she be wrong about love? [Leaps upward and points in delight at the rim.] There! On the rim!

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Cuts to shot of the rim from the center of the volcano's peak, several lilies growing. Aang appears on-screen, picks a panda lily and smells it. He opens his eyes and gasps in horror. Cuts to a view of the crater, which is nearly filled to the brim with lava. Sokka appears beside Aang and also looks horrified.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Shocked.] Oh no. [Cuts to overhead shot of the volcano.] Aunt Wu was wrong.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: He drops the panda lily which floats down into the lava, a flame appearing in its wake. Cuts to an overhead shot of the volcano, the camera shifting downward to show Aang and Sokka on the rim, clearly shocked at the view. Cuts to shot from inside the volcano, Aang and Sokka looking downward at the sight.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Those people all think they're safe! We've got to warn them!

title: The Fortuneteller
text: There's no time to walk! [Whips out his glider.] Grab on! [He pulls Sokka forward, who shouts in surprise and the two take off.]

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Cuts to shot of rim as they disappear over the edge, mounted on the glider. Cuts to shot of the treetops, Aang and Sokka appearing on-screen. Cuts to overhead shot of the village, as they fly toward it rapidly. Cuts to shot of Katara standing before the entrance of Wu's building clearly irritated. Aang and Sokka walk up to her, having now landed.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Shyly, raises hand slightly.] Hi, Katara.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Annoyed.] Can you believe she won't let me in? And after all the business I've given her?

title: The Fortuneteller
text: But she doesn't even charge.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: I know, but still ...

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Well, we have other things to worry about. Aunt Wu was wrong about the volcano.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Slightly irked, raises finger accusingly.] Sokka, you tried to convince me she was wrong before. It's going to take an awful lot to change my mind -

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Her eyes widen in surprise, and she lurches forward as an explosion is heard and the volcano rumbles violently. Cuts to shot of the entire group, who is slightly shaken. Cuts to shot of her and Aang looking up at the volcano, both their backs turned, gray smoke is emitting from the peak of the mountain.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Worriedly.] Oh no.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Cuts to overhead shot of the villagers mingling about in the courtyard, Aang, Katara and Sokka among them.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Urgently.] Everyone, that volcano is gonna blow any second! Aunt Wu was wrong!

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Not buying his claim.] Yeah, yeah, we know you don't believe in Aunt Wu, Mr. science and reason lover.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Stepping forward.] If you won't listen to him, maybe you'll listen to me. I want to believe Aunt Wu and her predictions as much as you do, but my brother and Aang saw the lava with their own eyes.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Unmoved.] Well, I heard Aunt Wu's prediction with my own ears.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Leaps onto the awning of a nearby building; urgently.] Please listen to us! You are all in danger! And we have to get out of here! You can't rely on Aunt Wu's prediction, [Cuts to shot of villagers who gaze up at him, seemingly listening.] you have to take fate into your own hands!

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Another explosion is heard from the volcano. The villagers seem mildly alarmed.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Look! [Points to the volcano.] Can your fortune telling explain that?

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Cuts to shot of the volcano, smoke rising from the top in great plumes.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Amused.] Can your science explain why it rains?

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Turns to him; yells angrily.] Yes! Yes, it can!

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Cuts to overhead shot of the courtyard as the villagers walk away, oblivious to the danger. Cuts to shot of Katara and Sokka.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Dismayed.] They just won't listen to reason. [Aang leaps down from the awning.]

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Brightening.] But they will listen to Aunt Wu!

title: The Fortuneteller
text: I know that's the problem.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Well, it's about to become the solution. We're taking fate in our own hands. First, I need to borrow Aunt Wu's cloud reading book.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: The scene cuts to Sokka and Katara, who stand in front of Aunt Wu's building, trying to act casual. Sokka flashes an innocent smile. The camera pans upward to the top of the building. Aang appears over the rooftop, along with Momo, and and climbs downward onto the porch of the highest story. Cuts to overhead shot of Aunt Wu's chamber. Cuts to shot of one corner of the room, where Aang is peering in various drawers for the book. Momo chirps.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Whispering.] Shhh! We don't want anyone to hear us.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Cuts to shot of him as he continues to snoop about, his back facing the camera. Meng's reflection appears in the mirror hanging over the dresser. Aang sees this reflection and turns around, startled. He stands up straight, Momo hiding behind his back.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Oh, I didn't see you there.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Sadly.] You don't like me, do you? [Her ears droop down.]

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Of course I like you.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Downcast.] But not the way I like you.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Oh, I guess not.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: It's okay. It's just really hard when you like someone, but they don't think of you that way.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Casting sad glance to the side.] I know what you mean.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Off-camera.] She's beautiful, by the way.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Blushes and looks at her, surprised.] Huh?

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Cuts to shot of the two standing in the room.] That Water Tribe girl. I can see why you like her so much. [Clasps hands together, counts on her fingers.] She's sweet, she's a bender [Cuts to shot of Meng.] and her hair seems so manageable. [While saying this last part, she tries to smooth down her braids only for them to immediately stick up again.]

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Don't worry. You're going to meet a great guy who's going to completely fall for you. I know it. [Places a hand on her shoulder comfortingly; turns to leave.]

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Thanks. [Holds up hand in alert.] Wait! Don't you want this? [Aang looks surprised; Meng hands him the cloud reading book, revealing she had had it in her possession the whole time.]

title: The Fortuneteller
text: How did you know?

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Nervously playing with her fingers.] I've kind of been stalking you. [Smiles sheepishly.] Heh ...

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Blushing.] Oh, thanks ... I guess.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Cuts to shot to shot of Appa flying through the clouds with Aang and Katara on his back, Aang at the reins, Katara seated in his saddle.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Clouds are made of water and air, so between the two of us, we ought to be able to bend them into any shape we want.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Reading Aunt Wu's book.] I found it. The symbol for volcanic doom.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: She turns the book around, but keeps her hand placed on the image for volcanic doom, obscuring the person's view of the symbol. A cloud passes over the screen, signaling the change of scene. The cloud cover clears, depicting both Aang and Katara standing on Appa's saddle. In synchronization, they raise their arms upward, preparing to shape the clouds. Cuts to shot of Appa sailing through the sky; he leans over on his side and sprawls out his legs, dipping into the clouds below. Cuts to shot of the villagers below, viewing the changing cloud formations. Cuts to shot of the clouds; Appa appears from beneath one of the clouds and flies upward, Aang and Katara seen mounted on his saddle. The bison emerges from the top of a cloud. Cuts to Katara, who swivels around, a smile spread across her face. Cuts to Aang, who swings his arms in a circular motion, using airbending to shape the formation. Cuts to shot of Appa flying in the sky that is now rapidly changing. Below, the villagers look up to see the clouds shifting. Sokka brings Aunt Wu over to her stage. He points to the sky.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Aunt Wu, look! Something is happening in the clouds.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Quizzically.] That's very strange. It shouldn't ... [A shadow falls over her face as the sky darkens; suddenly terrified.] Oh my!

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Cut to a view of the new skull-shaped cloud that Aang and Katara formed. Cut to a view of a mountain spewing smoke into the air. The screen pans down to the village before cutting to a shot where Aang is addressing the crowds.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: We still can save the village if we act fast. [Gesturing toward Sokka, who stands on the pagoda.] Sokka has a plan.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Making motions with his arm.] Lava is gonna flow downhill to this spot. If we can dig a deep enough trench we can channel all the lava away from the village to the river.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: If any of you are earthbenders, come with me.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Cut to the Twins from earlier in the episode.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Raising hand.] I'm an earthbender!

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Raising hand.] I'm not!

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Everybody else grab a shovel [As another explosion resonates over the village, everyone stumbles before regaining balance.] Come on! We've gotta hurry!

title: The Fortuneteller
text: The crowd disperses very fast, now desperate to put Sokka's plan into action. A few cries of urgency are uttered. Cut to overhead shot of the ground outside the town during twilight, a deep trench is beginning to form. Team Avatar and the town's people labor to dig the trench, using both earthbending and manual means. Cuts to shot of two earthbenders, who make motions with their arms and legs. Cuts to overhead shot of a portion of the trench as two large boulders are cleared out of the way. Cuts to shot from inside the trench as villagers continue their labor; Appa is seen transporting loose boulders from the scene, using a net attached to his body. Another explosion makes a cut to the mountain again, now lava is spewing out.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Resuming work.] Dig faster! Dig faster!

title: The Fortuneteller
text: As lava begins to flow down the volcano in the background, the shot cuts to Poi as he runs and sweeps his arms forward. Cuts to overhead shot of the trench, the bank of the river lying just ahead. A torrent of boulders is cleared and sent down the river as Poi creates a channel toward the river. Cuts to shot of the villagers standing inside the trench. Aang leaps onto the edge of the trench. In the background, the lava steadily creeps further down the mountain toward the village.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Everyone needs to evacuate! We'll come for you when it's safe!

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Everyone runs. Momo arrives and puts a small rock on the edge of the trench and lands on Aang, who pets him before also running away from the edge. Cut to the volcano as lava is erupting from its peak. A stream of stream of the burning liquid is coursing down the mountain and into the forest. The scene cuts to Aang, Sokka, and Katara; their faces illuminated by the approaching lava as they watch anxiously, ash falling down upon them. The scene switches to a view of the village gate. An eerie reddish light emerges from the forest with its source, the approaching lava, close behind. As it passes the gate, the burning substance causes the structure to catch fire and crumble down. Unwavering and all-consuming, the lava continuous its descent through the cemetery, destroying several headstones as it passes. Reaching the trench, the lava falls in the ditch, though the steady incoming river of lava quickly threatens to overflow the trench. Cut to the group on the safe side of the trench.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: It's too much! It's gonna overflow!

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Another explosion rocks the village. Cut to the volcano, where a huge column of lava and smoke explodes out of the peak. Burning rocks begin to rain down in addition to the ash. Katara and Sokka begin to run for safety but turn to see Aang has not moved. A huge boulder falls out of the sky and lands in the trench, throwing up a fountain of lava. A massive wave of lava begins to head toward the village. Cut to Aang, who is rushing forward with a furious face. He propels himself into the air and begins to airbend. As the lava begins to overflow, Aang blows the lava straight up, not allowing it to advance on the village. Finally, he draws in a mighty intake of breath and expels it, airbending it as it exits, cooling all the lava to stone. Aang relaxes and assumes a meditation pose. Cut to Katara and Sokka watching in surprise, their backs to the camera.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Man, sometimes I forget what a powerful bender that kid is. [Katara's expression changes at this, remembering Aunt Wu's words about her future marriage.]

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Wait, what did you just say?

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Casually.] Nothing, just that Aang is one powerful bender.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Cut to Katara's and Sokka's view of Aang and back to shot of Katara.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Slowly widens her eyes in realization; as if having an epiphany.] I suppose he is.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Cuts to the volcano, smoking, but no longer erupting. Cuts to a view of the square where Aunt Wu and the town's people, including the Calm man, have assembled. A tall, jagged wall-like formation of cooled lava towers over the square. Aang stands in front of Aunt Wu, offering her back the cloud book he took.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Sheepishly.] By the way, we kind of borrowed your book.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: So you messed with the clouds, did you?

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Wu grabs the book in anger while Katara looks guilty and Sokka smiles and points at her, indicating that she had a part in the cloud manipulation, too.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Laughs in amusement.] Very clever!

title: The Fortuneteller
text: No offense, but I hope this taught everyone a lesson about not relying too much on fortune telling.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Cheerfully.] But Aunt Wu predicted the village wouldn't be destroyed and it wasn't. She was right, after all.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Gets near the Calm man's face, through gritted teeth.] I hate you.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Holding Sokka by the shoulders and leading him away.] It's okay, Sokka. Everything's going to be all right.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Cuts to a shot of Aang and Wu.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Can I ask you something?

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Of course, honey.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Disappointed.] You didn't really see love in my fortune, did you? You just told me what I wanted to hear.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: I'll tell you a little secret, young airbender. [Gestures to the sky.] Just as you reshaped those clouds, [Cuts to shot of Aang, who smiles; off-camera.] you have the power to shape your own destiny.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Aang smiles. Cut to shot of Appa and Team Avatar. Meng stands in front of Appa. Aang airbends himself onto Appa's saddles; Katara is at the reins.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Brightly.] Goodbye everyone! It was so nice to meet you! [To Meng.] Take care, Meng.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: [Waving.] Take care! [Appa turns away. Cuts to Meng's face, whose smile disappears and is replaced by a frown.] Floozy.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Fades to credits.

title: The Fortuneteller
text: Aang

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: The episode opens up to a body of water, waves crashing against the rocks. The camera cuts to grass and sticks, before slowly panning up to reveal a whale tooth scimitar standing upright in the ground. Aang's hand comes into view as he grasps the weapon's hilt and yanks it out of the ground. Cut to a shot of him holding it up while Sokka slides down a dirt slope.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Hey, look! [Examines the sword.] A sword made out of a whale's tooth.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: While Aang draws the weapon free from the ground, Sokka slides down the slope and pulls up behind the Avatar, snatching the weapon from his hands as Aang turned to show it to him.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Let me see that.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Sokka walks on for a little while, before he stops, not too far from Aang, to study the weapon closely. Cut to a shot of the scimitar in his hand. The scene switches into a flashback; Southern Water Tribe warriors are preparing their ships, loading them with supplies. The camera pans to the left as a warrior walks past, carrying a bundle, revealing that a younger Sokka is observing them, his back to the camera. Cuts to frontal shot of him as he looks at the scene wistfully, cradling his battle club. Flashback fades to present-day, where Sokka bears the same wistful expression while holding the whale's tooth scimitar in the same way as his club.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: This is a Water Tribe weapon. [Turns to Aang, his expression serious.] See if you can find anything else.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Cuts to shot of Aang and Sokka searching the wooded area for more weapons. Katara walks toward them, curious.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Curiously.] Did someone lose something?

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Rummaging through the bushes; somewhat cheerfully.] No, we found something!

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Cut to shot of a spearhead lying on the ground beneath a few fallen leaves. Sokka kneels before it, brushes aside the debris and picks up the spearhead, examining it and running his fingers along its point, noticing ash on it.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: It's burned. [Cut to shot of a tree trunk, scorch marks and sharp cuts running across its bark. Cut to shot of Sokka and the others.] There was a battle! Water Tribe warriors ambushed a group of firebenders. [He turns away from the tree and looking down the slope of the hill seeing a black spot on the ground.] The firebenders fought back, but the warriors drove them down this hill.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Cut to shot of Sokka racing down the hill along a dirt path, the camera panning downward. He leaps over a few large rocks in his way and continues forward. Cuts to shot of a sandy beach. Sokka appears on screen followed closely by Aang and Katara.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Intrigued.] So, then what happened?

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Disappointed.] I don't know. The trail ends here.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Pointing at something in the distance.] Wait, look! [Cut to shot of a Water Tribe ship, half obscured behind large rocks, sitting idly on the shore.]

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Happily.] It's one of our boats!

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Is this dad's boat? [She and Sokka run toward it. Cut to shot of entire ship as they approach.]

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: No, but it's from his fleet. [Strokes the boat off, while Aang appears behind them.] Dad was here. [Turns to Katara.]

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: The scene changes to a close-up of Iroh sipping a cup of tea, with a relaxed expression on his face.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Exhaling.] Aahh! [Cuts to shot of entire room where he and Zuko are seated at a low-lying table.] See Prince Zuko, a moment of quiet is good for your mental well-being. [Pours Zuko a cup of tea.]

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Zuko raises the cup to take a sip, but the ship suddenly jerks; the vibrations cause the tea in the cup to go flying, soaking Zuko's face and hair. Zuko grunts in frustration, pushes his ponytail back, and rises to see what the commotion is about. Cut to the deck of the ship, several firebenders stand poised, ready to attack. A large beast, called a shirshu, suddenly leaps onto the deck, a young woman mounted on its back. The firebenders flee from the beast. Cuts to closer-up shot of the woman, who slows down the beast's progress.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Look out! Argh!

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Holding a rolled up whip.] Get back! We're after a stowaway! [Cut to overhead shot of the ship's deck.]

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Arrives with Iroh.] There are no stowaways on my ship.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Cuts to shot of Nyla, the shirshu, who tears off a chunk of the metal deck flooring and hurls it in Zuko's direction. Alarmed, the prince ducks for cover, the firebenders and Iroh move to the side, and the metal piece hits the doorway leading to the main compartments of the ship with a clang as they turn around to watch it hit the door. Zuko looks on in frustration while the firebenders and Iroh take a firebending stance.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Shocked.] He's paralyzed.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Only temporarily. [Lifts the man and slings him over her shoulder.] The toxins will wear off in about an hour. But by then, he'll be in jail and I'll have my money. [Walks to Nyla.]

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: But how did you find him on my ship?

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Prepares to mount Nyla, the stowaway already slung onto his back.] My shirshu can smell a rat a continent away. [Mounts her shirshu.]

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Well, I'm impressed. [June cracks her whip. Cuts to shot of the shirshu bolting off the ship and racing down the dock.] Very impressed. [Leaning over the ledge of the ship with Zuko, stroking his beard thoughtfully; Zuko look at him, disgusted.]

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: The scene changes to that night, the camera panning downward to show that Team Avatar has settled down for the night beside the Water Tribe ship. Cut to shot of Appa. Aang and Momo are lying on his right paw, all three fast asleep. The camera pans left, showing Katara having also drifted off in her sleeping bag. Sokka remains awake, poking a stick into a blazing campfire, looking worried. Cut to side-shot of him; the scene fades to the flashback seen earlier. A younger Sokka is seen walking by, carrying a large bundle in his arms, wearing face-paint. Cut to a shot of Hakoda standing beside a ship, having handed a bundle to a man in the ship. He turns and walks forward. Cut to a shot of Sokka who has halted in his tracks, his father approaching him and standing before his son.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Sokka.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: I'm coming with you.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: You're not old enough to go to war, Sokka, you know that.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Desperately.] I'm strong, I'm brave, I can fight! Please, Dad!

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Lays a hand on his son's shoulder; grimly and sadly.] Being a man is knowing where you're needed the most. And for you right now, that's here, protecting your sister.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: I don't understand. [His eyes glisten.]

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Someday you will. [Sokka throws aside his bag and throws himself into his father's arms. Cut to close-up of him as he sobs and buries his face in his father's parka.] I'm gonna miss you so much.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: The scene fades back to present day, Sokka still looking sullenly into the fire. Suddenly a strange noise can be heard, its source originating from somewhere off-camera.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Alert.] Who's there? [Stands up, boomerang in hand.]

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Cut to a shot of the campsite from several feet away. A pair of boots appears in front of the camera. Cut to shot of a man, hailing from the Water Tribe with white bandages wrapped around the upper left portion of his torso, stepping out of the shadows. He is clearly surprised to see them.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Sokka?

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Quizzically, raising an eyebrow.] Bato? [Spirited.]

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Having awoken, along with Katara.] Who the what now?

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Cheerfully.] Bato!

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Cuts to side-shot of Bato, Sokka running over to him, followed closely by Katara.] Sokka! Katara! It is so good to see you two. [Hugs Katara and Sokka.] You've grown so much! [Aang follows them, but remains standing a few feet away.]

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Bows in greeting.] Hi, I'm Aang.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Where's Dad?

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Is he here?

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: No, he and the other warriors should be in the Eastern Earth Kingdom by now. [Both siblings look crestfallen at this news. A gust of wind blows, causing them to shiver. Cut to a shot of Bato who shivers as well.] This is no place for a reunion. Let's get inside.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: He turns and slings his arms around Sokka and Katara, leading them away. After a moment, he looks back at Aang and gestures for him to follow. Cut to an overhead shot of the shore, the campsite in the distance, as the group begins walking away. The scene cuts to a different location altogether, the moon hanging in a purplish-blue night sky. The camera pans downward to show the roof over of the entrance to an open courtyard. Cut to a shot inside the courtyard, a few nuns milling about, Appa and the group approaching.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
