text: After I was wounded, your father carried me to this abbey. The sisters have cared for me ever since. Superior, [A woman turns around.] these are Hakoda's children. They've been traveling with the Avatar. I found them by my boat.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Young Avatar, it gives me great joy to be in your presence. Welcome to our abbey.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Thank you, it's truly an honor to be here. If there's anything- [Sokka abruptly cuts him off.]

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: What smells so good, Bato?

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Sniffs.] The sisters craft ointments and perfumes.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Perfume? [Pointing his thumbs at Appa.] Maybe we can dump some on Appa, because he stinks so much. [Waves his hand in front of his face.] Am I right? [Everyone is silent, a single person coughs.]

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: You have your father's wit.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: The scene cuts to the hut in which Bato is staying, with a tent on the opposite side of the door being the bed chamber, a fire with cousins in the middle, and various pelts placed and hung everywhere.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Bato, it looks like home! [Bato, Katara, Sokka, and Aang file inside.]

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Everything's here, even the pelts!

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Sarcastically.] Yeah, nothing's cozier than dead animal skins.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Momo leaps from Aang's arms and starts hitting the head of a bear pelt. The bear's mouth closes, Momo is alarmed a retreats back to Aang. Katara and Sokka are by the fire. Katara opens the lid of a pot cooking over the fire as Bato joins them.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Surprised and delighted.] No way! Stewed sea prunes!

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Help yourself!

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Dad could eat a whole barrel of these things!

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Aang takes a bowl of stewed sea prunes and sniffs it, but looks away in disgust and sets it to the side.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Bato, is it true that you and dad lassoed an arctic hippo?

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: It was your father's idea, he just dragged me along. Well, the hippo did the dragging! [Momo, sitting by Aang, starts to eat the stewed sea prunes that Aang set aside, but ends up spitting it out.]

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Sokka and Katara are slurping their stewed sea prunes as Aang speaks.] Hey, I ride animals, too! There was this one time when I rode a giant eel and I-

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Cutting Aang off.] So, who was it that came up with the Great Blubber Fiasco?

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Chuckles to himself.] You knew about that?

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Everyone does!

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Curiously.] What's that story?

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Waving Aang off.] It's a long one Aang, some other time.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [To Bato.] You and Dad had so many hilarious adventures.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Not all of which were hilarious at the time, but everything's funny in hindsight. [Chuckling.] Hey, Aang! Please put that down, [Aang is shown wearing a fur pelt on his head.] it's ceremonial and very fragile. [Aang puts the pelt back on the wall, and sits in the back of the room.]

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Was it you or Dad that put an octopus on your head and convinced Gran-Gran you were a water spirit?

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Your dad wore the octopus, [Lowers his voice.] but I did the spooky voice.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: The scene cuts to a seedy tavern in the Earth Kingdom. A man is thrown through the roof and land of the ground. Cut to a snake tattoo on a woman's arm. The camera zooms out, showing that it is June's tattoo. She calmly arm-wrestles a man, who gnashes his teeth and sweats. The shot changes to the back of the crowd where Zuko arrives.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Annoyed.] Out of my way! [Pushing a man out of the way.] Step aside, filth!

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Apologetically.] He means no offense! I'm certain you bathe regularly!

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Zuko approaches June, who is still arm wrestling. Iroh reaches her as well.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: I need to talk to you!

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Well, if it isn't my new friends: Angry Boy and Uncle Lazy.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Her opponent strains to get the upper hand. Iroh laughs at her remark and June wins her match without breaking a sweat. The crowd cheers and throws money at the winner.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Your beast trashed my ship. You have to pay me back!

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [As she collects her winnings.] Well, I'd love to help you out, but I'm a little short on money. [To the crowd.] Drinks on me! [The crowd cheers.]

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: June moves to take sip of her drink, but Zuko grabs her wrist in anger.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Money isn't what I had in mind.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Cut to moths flying around a lantern.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: I need you to find someone. [Cut to Katara's necklace.]

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Shot changes to show June leaning on Nyla while Iroh and Zuko stand in front of June.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Sarcastically.] What happened, your girlfriend run off on you?

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: It's not the girl I'm after, it's the bald monk she's traveling with.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Unamused.] Whatever you say.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: If you find them, I'll consider the damage to my ship paid for.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Scoffs.] Heh, forget it. [She starts to climb her saddle.]

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Plus, we'll pay your weight in gold.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Stops and widens her eyes in surprise. She smiles. Cut to a side-shot of June walking over to Iroh.] Make it your [Pokes his stomach.] weight, and we gotta deal.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Laughs with his hand on his stomach.] You got it!

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [As she turns back to Nyla.] Get on!

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: June takes Katara's necklace from Zuko, and shows it to Nyla. The camera shows the surroundings through Nyla's sight. As the shirshu looks around, the colored scents of humans are shown. Nyla soon finds Katara's purple scent on the necklace, and the threesome head off. The scene changes to an aerial shot of the abbey, and cuts to inside Bato's room.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: There's something I should tell you kids. I'm expecting a message from your father. [Aang is shown with his eyes closed, excluded from the group.]

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Excited.] Really?

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Slightly demanding.] When?

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Any day now. Your father said he'd send a message when they found the rendezvous point. If you wait until the message arrives, you can come with me, and see your father again.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Aang looks toward his friends with a sad and worried look.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: It's been over two years since we've seen Dad. That would be so incredible! Katara!

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: I do really miss him, it would be great to see Dad. [Aang gets up to leave, but no one notices him.]

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: It's been far too long, hasn't it? [As Aang leaves.] I'm not sure when word will arrive, but when it does-

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Aang closes the door and heads toward the abbey gate. Cut back to inside Bato's room.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: It would be great, but we can't. We have to take Aang to the North Pole first.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Even if we do have time to wait for the message, who knows how far we'd have to travel. We don't have time for a long detour.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: I'm sure your father would understand, and be proud that his children are helping the Avatar.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: The scene cuts to footprints on the beach at night. The camera pans upward to reveal Aang sitting on the bow of Bato's boat.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: I can't believe they would leave me.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: An ostrich horse can be heard coming. A messenger arrives.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: I'm looking for Bato of the Water Tribe.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Uhhh, I know Bato!

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Make sure he gets this! [Hands Aang the scroll and rides away.]

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Aang curiously unravels at the message, finding that it is actually a map.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: It's the map to Sokka and Katara's dad!

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Aang's curious look changes to frustration as he crumples the map and stuffs it inside his clothes. Shot changes to a further distance of Aang sitting on the boat. Cut to an aerial shot of the abbey. Cut to a door which Aang opens.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Hey everyone! Sorry I was gone so long.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Turns to face him.] Hey, Aang, I didn't notice you left.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Yup, but now I'm back. [Sitting down.] Sure could go for some delicious sea prunes!

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Aang quickly takes some bites of sea prunes, but chokes them back up, yet he pretends to enjoy them. Katara, Bato, and Sokka look at him strangely. The scene changes to the herbalist's home that Aang visited to find a cure to Katara and Sokka's sickness in the past. Nyla growl can be heard, to which Miyuki hisses. The herbalist turns around to find Nyla, June, Zuko, and Iroh.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Out for a bit of fresh air, are we?

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: We're looking for someone.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: I hope it's not Miyuki [To Miyuki.] Miyuki, did you get in trouble with the Fire Nation, again? [Miyuki meows.]

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: The Avatar's been through here. Let's keep moving.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Cut to an aerial shot of the abbey. The shot changes to show Aang airbending a pile of hay to Appa. As he finishes his form, the map falls out of his sleeve.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Aha! I caught you. [Picks up the crumpled paper as Aang looks at her nervously.] You should be ashamed of yourself ... Littering in the courtyard.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Takes back the crumpled paper.] I'm sorry, I'll take care of this. [Bows. As Mother Superior walks away, Aang stuffs the map back up his sleeve.]

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: The scene cuts to Bato's ship the next day. Bato, Sokka, Katara, and Aang are seen walking toward it.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: This ship is sentimental to me. It was built by my father.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Aang looks down at the ground, noticing the tracks from the messenger's ostrich horse are still visible. He airbends the sand to cover the tracks and whistles nonchalantly. Aang walks up to Bato.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [To Bato.] Is this the boat he took you ice dodging in?

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Yep! It's got the scar to prove it. Ha. How 'bout you Sokka? You must have some good stories from your first time ice dodging. [Sokka begins to look saddened.]

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: He never got to go. Dad left before he was old enough.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Oh, I forgot you were too young.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: What's ice dodging?

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: It's a rite of passage for young Water Tribe members. When you turn fourteen, your dad takes you- [Bato smile and puts his hand on Sokka's shoulder with a new thought.] You know what, you're about to find out!

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: June, Zuko, and Iroh followed Katara's trail to the Makapu Village. As citizens flee from Nyla in terror, he stops in front of Aunt Wu's shop. Wu remains outside her shop, completely calm.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Annoyed.] Why are we stopping?

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Because the girl must have spent a lot of time here.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: We have no time for this!

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Zuko gets off Nyla and hangs the necklace in front of his face. Nyla appears agitated and he snaps at Zuko, who swiftly ducks down.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Hey! Watch it!

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [As Iroh laughs from behind her.] Oh look, he likes you!

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Aunt Wu approaches Iroh, still calm.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Care to hear your fortune, handsome?

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: At my age, there's really only one big surprise left, and I'd just as soon leave it a mystery.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: The threesome leave on Nyla, and the scene cuts back to Bato's ship, which is now sailing close to shore.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Ice dodging is a ceremonial test of wisdom, bravery, and trust. [Shot changes to on the boat.] In our village, ice dodging was done by weaving a boat through a field of icebergs.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: How are we supposed to ice dodge without ice?

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: You'll be dodging those. [Points to a group of tall, sharp, jagged rocks near the shore. Katara and Sokka appear nervous.] Sokka, you steer and call the shots, lead wisely. Katara, you secure the main sail. [Katara grabs a rope.] The winds can be brutal, so be brave. Aang, you control the jib. Without your steady hand, we all go down. Your position is about trust.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Blinks. Defensively.] I know that. Why wouldn't I know that? [Folds his arms.] I'm the Avatar; I know about trust. [He crosses his arms and looks away, but gives Bato a second glance.]

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: For this is to be done right, I cannot help. [Sits cross-legged at the front of the boat.] You pass or fail on your own.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Studies the rocky shores.] Aang, ease up on the jib. Katara, steady. [Katara looks at the shore with concern.] Aang, less sail. Katara, give him room. [The ship moves to the side and sails between some rocks.] Aang, helm to lee. Helm to lee!

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: What does that even mean?

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: The waves knock Bato around. Sokka struggles while Katara and Aang close their eyes. The shot changes to show the boat pass between more rocks.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Great job!

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Katara and Aang smile. Aerial shot of the boat heading toward a large bundle of rocks.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: There's no way through!

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: We can make it.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Stands up and grabs the side of the boat.] Sokka, you've already proven yourself. Maybe we should-

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Aang, I'm gonna need air in that sail. [Aang nods.] Katara, I want you to bend as much water as you can between us and those rocks. Now!

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Katara bends the water below the boat while Aang fires airbending blasts at the sail. Sokka groans nervously as the boat clears the rocks. When they reach clear water, Sokka sighs and relaxes. The rest of the group smiles at him. Fade to an aerial shot of Bato's boat beached on the shore. Shot changes to Bato carrying a small cup of purple paint.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Dips his fingers in the paint.] The spirits of water bear witness to these marks. For Sokka, the Mark of the Wise. [Uses his thumb to put an arc and small dot on Sokka's forehead.] The same mark your father earned. For Katara, [Uses his thumb to put a crescent moon mark on Katara's forehead.] the Mark of the Brave. Your courage inspires us. [Using his thumb to put an arc on Aang's forehead.] And for Aang, the Mark of the Trusted. You are now an honorary member of the Water Tribe.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: I can't. [Looks down.]

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Of course you can!

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Rubbing off his mark and backing away.] No, you can't trust me.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Concerned.] Aang, what are you talking about?

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Takes the crumpled map out of his sleeve.] A messenger gave this to me for Bato. [Katara takes it from him.] You have to understand. I was afraid you would-

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Angrily.] This is the map to our father! You had it the whole time? How could you? [Aang shrugs his shoulders.] Well, you can go to the North Pole on your own. I'm going to find Dad. [Walks away.]

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Well, Sokka. I think you should-

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Turns back.] Katara, are you with me?

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Turns to look at Aang and closes her eyes.] I'm with you Sokka.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Aang sadly looks at Sokka, Katara, and Bato as they walk away. Cut to an aerial shot of the abbey. The shot changes to show Bato helping Katara secure her pack as Sokka puts on his own pack. Sokka and Bato off camera. Cut to Aang sitting on Appa with Momo next to him. Shot changes to show Katara walking in front of the camera.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Good luck.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Okay. You too.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Katara joins Sokka and Bato at the abbey gate. Mother Superior, in front of Appa, stares at Aang.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Guess I should be moving on.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: That would be best.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Appa growls. The shot changes to outside the abbey. Appa walks out and Aang notices three figures walk away in the distance.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: I'm an idiot, Momo. [Momo chitters.]

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Cut to an aerial view of the abbey. The shot cuts to three nuns stirring perfume. The sound of rumbling alerts the nuns as they stare in fright as Nyla enters the abbey holding June, Iroh, and Zuko. The shot cuts to Nyla's point of view, who sees the purple scent and turns his head to follow it.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: We're getting close. [Whips Nyla, who runs out of the abbey and into the woods.]

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Cut to a view of the sky amidst some trees and the camera pans down to show Bato, Katara, and Sokka walking through the woods. A wolf's howl can be heard in the distance.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [To Sokka.] That wolf sounds so sad.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: It's probably wounded.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Turns back to them.] No, it's been separated from the pack. I understand that pain. It's how I felt when the Water Tribe warriors had to leave me behind. They were my family, [Shot of Sokka, who looks sadly at the camera.] and being apart from them was more painful than my wounds.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Fade to another one of Sokka's flashbacks. The young Sokka stands at the end of an ice pier as eight ships travel away, fading into the fog. Frontal shot of the young Sokka fades to Sokka wearing a similar expression from the flashback as he stares at the camera.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Sokka?

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: We need to go back. I wanna see Dad, but, helping Aang is where we're needed the most.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Smiles.] You're right.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Walks up to Katara and Sokka and puts his arms on their shoulders.] Your father will understand, and I know he's proud of you.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Thanks, Bato.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: I know where to go from here. [Takes the map from out of his Water Tribe outfit.] Take this in case you want to find us. I'll leave a message at the rendezvous point.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: The camera pans up and cuts to Aang and Momo sitting on Appa with the abandoned Water Tribe ship behind them.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Looks like we're going alone, guys.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Runs on camera. Desperately.] Avatar, you must leave!

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Annoyed.] Okay, I get it. Everybody wants me gone.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: A group of people came to the abbey looking for you.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Who?

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: A fierce looking woman with a horrible monster, and a young man with a scar.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Zuko.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: The beast was using the scent of a necklace to follow you.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: A necklace? [Gasps.] Katara!

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Cut to a long path heading toward the abbey and the camera pans down to two figures walking toward the abbey. The shot changes to show Sokka and Katara walking down the path. Sokka hears a rumbling noise and puts his hand up to stop his sister from walking. Nyla jumps behind them and they both turn around in fear. Nyla looks at Katara.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [To Zuko.] So this is your girlfriend. [Zuko jumps down.] No wonder she left, she's way too pretty for you.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [To Sokka and Katara.] Where is he? Where is the Avatar?

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: We split up. He's long gone.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: How stupid do you think I am?

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Pretty stupid. [Grabs his sister.] Run!

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: They start running, but Nyla uses his tongue to paralyze them.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: What are we supposed to do now?

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Nyla walks closer to Sokka and Katara.] It's seeking a different scent. Perhaps something that the Avatar held.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Nyla knocks the map off Sokka's pack and smells its blue scent and follows the trail. Cut to the gates of the abbey as Nyla breaks them down. Nuns scatter and the shot shows Nyla holding June, Iroh, Zuko, Katara, and Sokka. Nyla walks around in a circle.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: What's it doing? It's just going in a circle.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: The camera shows Nyla's point of view as he follows the blue scent trail up into the air and sees Aang flying down. The shot changes to Aang flying over Nyla, who stands on his hind legs and attempts to paralyze the Avatar with his tongue, throwing off his riders. Nyla falls down, too.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Looks up.] Aang!

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Up! [June cracks her whip. Nyla stands up and June mounts him.]

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: June and Nyla charge at Aang, but Appa knocks down Nyla by leaping on the shirshu's side. Appa growls and snorts at June and Nyla. Cut to Zuko and Aang facing each other. In the background, two nuns drag Sokka and Katara to the side of the abbey. Shot changes from Zuko to Aang to Zuko. Zuko firebends a blast at Aang, who stops it by waving his glider. Aang sends a blast of air at Zuko, who sidesteps it and sends a fire blast at Aang, who spins his staff to stop the blast. Aang sends an airbending blast at Zuko, who sidesteps it and sends another fire blast at Aang. Aang jumps to avoid the blast. Zuko moves in closer to Aang and sends two fire blasts at Aang's head and feet. Aang throws his staff and both jump and duck at the blasts. Zuko punches and kicks at Aang, sending fire blasts at him. Aang avoids these blasts and sends an air blast at Zuko's head. Zuko ducks and sends more fire blasts at Aang. Zuko and Aang both firebend and airbend, respectively, at each other at the same time, creating large explosion that forms a mushroom cloud. The shot changes to show Zuko and Aang fall on different roofs. Cut to Nyla and June lying on the ground. Iroh runs up to June and puts his hand on her cheek. June wakes up and stands up.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Whips Nyla.] Come on! Get up!

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Nyla gets up. Shot of Iroh smiling. Cut to Nyla running across the abbey with June riding him. Cut to Appa's paw as Nyla lashes his tongue at it. Appa lands and falls down, paralyzed. Cut to a shot of June looking at Appa, who opens his eyes and slowly gets back up to his feet and growls. Nyla growls back and they charge at each other when June cracks her whip. The collision between the two beasts sends June flying over Appa, and she takes the opportunity to whip the sky bison. She lands on the ground and quickly rolls to the side before Appa stomps on the ground behind him where June had landed, cracking the floor.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: I'm ... starting to get some feeling back! [Rubble from the roof falls on him.] Ow.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Cut to Aang jumping in the abbey courtyard stream and Nyla follows him. Cut to June and Nyla on the roof. They run to the side as a part of the abbey roof explodes. The dust clears to show Appa. Cut to Iroh examining some perfume bottles. He sniffs one and sneaks it into his sleeves. Cut to Aang standing by a well. Zuko sends him three firebending blasts. Aang jumps to the other side of the well to dodge them. Zuko sends another fire blast at him. Aang ducks and notices Zuko is carrying Katara's necklace.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: You've got something I want.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Aang jumps between the four beams of the well. He dodges Zuko's fire blasts by moving on all sides of the well. Zuko breaks two of the well's beams and sends the wooden structure away. Zuko jumps on the well's circular stone structure to join Aang. Zuko sends two fire blasts at Aang, who dodges them by stepping around the well. Aang sends two air blasts at Zuko. The shot focuses on well as the two opponents walk on top of the well. Aang snatches at Katara's stole necklace, but misses. Zuko lunges at Aang, who jumps onto his back. Cut to a shot of Aang flying through the air as he grabs Katara's necklace off his foot. Aang lands in the well. Zuko sends a fire blast down the well. The water from the well rises out and sends Zuko flying. Aang jumps out with the water, which rains a little before Zuko falls down. Zuko stands up.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: That thing sees with its nose. Let's give him something to look at.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: The perfume?

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Sokka nods. Cut to four pots of perfume. The nuns and Sokka push the pots. Cut to Nyla and Zuko cornering Aang. Zuko attacks Aang with a two fire blasts. Sokka and the nuns pour the perfume pots onto the ground. Katara waterbends the perfume into the air and pours it on Nyla. The shot changes to show Nyla's point of view as the perfume scents cloud his vision of Aang.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Nyla paralyzes Zuko as Iroh looks at Nyla in concern.] June! No! [Nyla tongue lashes out and hits June, who falls back into Iroh's arms.]

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Shot cuts to Nyla running around in a circle and bumps into more perfume pots. Nyla jumps over the abbey wall. Shot cuts to Aang picking up his staff and wiping his brow. Katara and Sokka stand next to Aang and smile at him. Cut to Zuko and Iroh lying down on the ground. Iroh cradles June in one hand.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Uncle? I didn't see you get hit with the tongue.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Shhh.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Iroh goes back to his position, smiling. June opens her eyes angrily upon learning this.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: So ... where do we go?

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: We're getting you to the North Pole.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Yeah, we've lost too much time as it is.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Turns to the group.] Don't you want to see your father?

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Of course we do, Aang. But, you're our family, too. And right now, you need us more.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: And we need you.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: I wish I could give you a little piece of home, Katara. Something to remind you ...

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: I'll be okay.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Still, just a little trinket. Maybe something like ... [Holds up Katara's necklace.] this? [Closer shot of the necklace.]

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Takes the necklace.] Aang, how'd you get that?

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Zuko asked me to be sure I got it to you.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Aw, that's so sweet of Zuko. Could you give him a kiss for me when you see him?

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Sure.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Katara kisses Aang on the cheek and Aang blushes and twiddles his thumbs. Further shot of Appa flying toward the horizon.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Fade to credits.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: The scene opens with a shot of the full moon. The camera pans down to reveal the Water Tribe ship and Team Avatar, who decided to make camp next to the boat.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: So, how long do you think it's been since someone was here?

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Sokka is standing by the boat, while Aang and Katara huddle around a campfire. The camera cuts to a side shot, showing Sokka inspecting the boat.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Long enough for moss to grow on the hull. [He turns to Katara; unsure.] About three months.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Close-up of Katara; disappointed.] Oh. [She looks down, saddened.] So dad's probably long gone.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Cut to a shot from behind Aang.] I wonder why they left this boat? There's nothing wrong with it.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: When was the last time you saw your dad?

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [He turns away.] I don't want to talk about it.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [The camera cuts to a frontal of Aang.] Sorry. [He looks down in guilt.] I didn't mean to bring that up.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Shot of Katara and Aang around the campfire.] It's okay Aang. Our dad left about two years ago, with all the other Water Tribe men.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: [Sokka enters the shot and proceeds to lay down in front of the campfire; interrupting Katara.] Maybe we should all get some sleep.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Sokka pulls a blanket over himself. Fade to a shot of Aang lying on one of Appa's legs.

title: Bato of the Water Tribe
text: Aang

title: The Deserter
text: The episode opens in a forest while Momo suddenly appears, jumping from a tree to another tree. A mysterious figure is seen following him, and Momo lands on a roadside kiosk, while Team Avatar is arriving at it.

title: The Deserter
text: [Walking toward a poster on the kiosk, present in the middle of a crossroad.] This should give us a good idea of what's around here.

title: The Deserter
text: [Flips a small pouch to find it empty aside from a few crumbs.] See if you can find a menu, I'm starving! [Wipes his mouth.]

title: The Deserter
text: I bet we'll find something to eat here, [Pointing at the poster.] the Fire Day's Festival. [Momo jumps down. Aang begins reading-out the poster.] Fire Nation cultural exhibits, jugglers, benders, magicians ... [Turns to Katara.] This would be a great place for me to study some real firebenders.

title: The Deserter
text: [Looking at another poster on the other side of the kiosk; seriously.] You might wanna rethink that. Look at this.

title: The Deserter
text: [Comes over to at the poster.] Hey, a poster of me!

title: The Deserter
text: A wanted poster! This is bad. [Aang removes the poster from the wall and starts reading it.]

title: The Deserter
text: [Stares at the wanted poster.] I think we better keep moving.

title: The Deserter
text: [Looking at Katara.] I have to learn firebending at some point and this could be my only chance to watch a master's up close.

title: The Deserter
text: [Swayed by Aang; while her head is bowed.] I guess we could go check it out. [Aang begins rejoicing.]

title: The Deserter
text: [Moves in front of Katara; in an opposing tone.] What? You wanna walk into a Fire Nation town where they're all fired-up with their ... you know, fire? [Aang becomes serious again.]

title: The Deserter
text: [Starts walking toward Appa and is followed by Aang.] We'll wear disguises and if it looks like trouble, we'll leave.

title: The Deserter
text: [Not convinced; sarcastically.] Yeah! Because we always leave before we get into trouble.

title: The Deserter
text: [To Appa and Momo.] You guys stay out of sight here while we go to the festival. [To Katara and Sokka.] Ready disguises!

title: The Deserter
text: Sokka and Katara put on their black cloaks while Aang pulls his orange shawl over his head with a smile on his face making him look ridiculous.

title: The Deserter
text: [Sarcastically at Aang's goofy disguise.] It's like you're a whole different person ... [Katara giggles.]

title: The Deserter
text: Let's go.

title: The Deserter
text: The gang looks around seeing everyone in masks.

title: The Deserter
text: I think we need some new disguises.

title: The Deserter
text: Where are we gonna get masks like that?

title: The Deserter
text: Get your genuine Fire Festival masks here!

title: The Deserter
text: That was surprisingly easy.

title: The Deserter
text: The gang chooses three masks. Katara chooses a lady with makeup, Sokka a blue smiling mask with petals around the rim, and Aang who chooses a red mask with a frown on it. Katara removes Sokka's mask, revealing him to be frowning, and Aang's mask, revealing him to be the one smiling. She places Sokka's original mask over Aang's face and Aang's over Sokka.

title: The Deserter
text: Hey, there's some food.

title: The Deserter
text: Finally! [To the shop keeper.] What do you have?

title: The Deserter
text: Flaming fire flakes! Best in town.

title: The Deserter
text: I'll take'em!

title: The Deserter
text: Sokka gobbles down the fire flakes, but has a spasm from the spiciness.

title: The Deserter
text: Aaahhh! Hot! Hot!

title: The Deserter
text: [Sarcastically.] "Flaming fire flakes", hot? What do you know?

title: The Deserter
text: Hey, look at this.

title: The Deserter
text: Don't worry loyal citizens! No one can surprise the Fire Lord!

title: The Deserter
text: [As an Earth Kingdom general puppet pops up behind the Fire Lord's puppet, with a rock ready to attack.] Oh no! Look out! [The puppet breaths fire, burning the other puppet.]

title: The Deserter
text: Aang, hold on! Where are we going?

title: The Deserter
text: I don't know, but there's a big crowd so it must be good.

title: The Deserter
text: [Sarcastically.] Knowing the Fire Nation, it's probably an execution.

title: The Deserter
text: I gotta learn that trick!

title: The Deserter
text: Thank you! For my next trick I need a volunteer from the audience!

title: The Deserter
text: [Waving his hand up in the air all around childishly.] Oh! Oh! Me! Me!

title: The Deserter
text: [In a stern tone while pulling his arm down.] What do you think you're doing?

title: The Deserter
text: I want to get a closer look.

title: The Deserter
text: It's better that we don't attract any attention to ourselves.

title: The Deserter
text: How about you, little lady?

title: The Deserter
text: [While backing away.] Uh.

title: The Deserter
text: Awww, she's shy. Leeet's give her some encouragement, folks!

title: The Deserter
text: [In a jealous tone while folding his arms.] Awww! That could've been me.

title: The Deserter
text: This next trick is called "Taming the Dragon." [While sitting her down in a chair and tying her to it.] You will be my captured princess! Don't worry, young maiden! I will tame this fiery beast! It's too strong, I can't hold it!

title: The Deserter
text: We gotta help her!

title: The Deserter
text: No, we don't want to make a scene!

title: The Deserter
text: The rope, it's breaking! [Aang saves Katara with his airbending, dispersing the flames is a ray of colors while he loses his mask in the process.] Hey, you tryin' to upstage me, kid?

title: The Deserter
text: Aang starts doing a goofy dance as everyone boos at him for ruining the trick.

title: The Deserter
text: Hey! That kid's the Avatar! [Aang stops dancing and runs.]

title: The Deserter
text: I think it's time to go.

title: The Deserter
text: Follow me! I can get you outta here! [The kids follow Chey.]

title: The Deserter
text: There they are!

title: The Deserter
text: Chey throws a series of explosives at the Fire Nation soldiers that are chasing them.

title: The Deserter
text: Over there!

title: The Deserter
text: I'm calling Appa. [Aang blows his whistle.]

title: The Deserter
text: I hope he can really hear that bison whistle!

title: The Deserter
text: [Making a sharp turn down one of the several alleys.] This way! [Comes running back.] Okay! Not this way!

title: The Deserter
text: They make another turn, but the way they came is blocked by guards. Chey throws another smoke bomb and runs past them into another alley. They group comes across another dead end where there is an enormous supply of fireworks. Cut to an overhead shot that reveals Appa has arrived in the nick of time.

title: The Deserter
text: Appa! Down here!

title: The Deserter
text: Appa lands between the kids and the guards, with his backside facing the guards. Appa airbends a gale force wind which results in the guards getting blown out of sight. As the guards run back into the alley, Appa has already taken off. Cut to Chey, he bites the top off a bomb to light it. He throws it at the fireworks supply and it blows up creating a beautiful display of fireworks. Cut to Chey removing his hood as they cruise away.

title: The Deserter
text: Nice touch setting off the fireworks.

title: The Deserter
text: [Impressed.] You really know your explosives ...

title: The Deserter
text: I'm familiar.

title: The Deserter
text: You're a Fire Nation Soldier!

title: The Deserter
text: Was. My name's Chey.

title: The Deserter
text: The group lands and makes camp.

title: The Deserter
text: I serve a man. More than a man really, he's a myth, but he's real, a living legend, Jeong Jeong the Deserter. He was a Fire Nation general, or wait, was he an admiral?

title: The Deserter
text: [Not amused.] He was very highly ranked, we get it.

title: The Deserter
text: Yeah! Way up there! But he couldn't take the madness any more. He's the first person ever to leave the army - and live. I'm the second, but you don't get to be a legend for that. That's okay though. Jeong Jeong's a firebending genius. Some say he's mad - but he's not! He's enlightened.

title: The Deserter
text: You mean there's a firebender out here who's not with the Fire Lord? [Gets up in excitement.] We've gotta go see him! He can train me!

title: The Deserter
text: [Snaps at Aang.] We're not gonna go find some crazy firebender!

title: The Deserter
text: [Annoyed; Stands up to gesture.] He's not crazy! He's a genius! And he's the perfect person to train the Avatar! That's why I followed you into the festival.

title: The Deserter
text: Look, thanks for the help, but we're leaving for the North Pole in the morning.

title: The Deserter
text: Sokka, this could be my only chance to meet a firebending master who would actually be willing to teach me.

title: The Deserter
text: It can't hurt just to talk to him.

title: The Deserter
text: [Very annoyed.] That's what you said about going to the festival! Why doesn't anyone ever listen to me?

title: The Deserter
text: As Sokka turns to pout, he almost runs right into a spear. In a flash, they are surrounded by men wearing straw hats, light armor, wearing tribal make up, and wielding spears.

title: The Deserter
text: Don't move!

title: The Deserter
text: The tribal folks escort them to their settlement.

title: The Deserter
text: [Angry.] Jeong Jeong told you not to look for Avatar!

title: The Deserter
text: Hold on, you know these guys?

title: The Deserter
text: Oh yeh! Lin Yee's an old buddy! Right, Lin Yee?

title: The Deserter
text: [Not amused with Chey.] Shut up! Keep moving.

title: The Deserter
text: Down the hill, there is a little cottage with leaves and logs.

title: The Deserter
text: Go on. He sees you only.

title: The Deserter
text: Oh that's okay, we can chat later.

title: The Deserter
text: Is that where Jeong Jeong is? I need to talk to him right away.

title: The Deserter
text: Aang tries to move forward, but it stopped by a spear shaft.

title: The Deserter
text: No! You wait there. [Pushes Chey forward.] Go now!

title: The Deserter
text: Don't worry! Everything'll be fine. He's a great man, great man!

title: The Deserter
text: Chey walks toward Jeong Jeong's cottage. Back in the Fire Days Festival in the now deserted central square of the town where some guards are being interrogated by Admiral Zhao who is accompanied by a few guards himself.

title: The Deserter
text: So, the Avatar was here and you let him slip away?

title: The Deserter
text: [Anxiously.] Yes, sir, but other than that the festival went off without a hitch! [A huge piece of burning planks of wood falls in the background with a massive crash making the guards twitch.] No fights. Theft was way down.

title: The Deserter
text: [Irritated.] I don't care about your local crime rates! Which way did they go?

title: The Deserter
text: They headed into the forest, up the river I suspect.

title: The Deserter
text: Ready the river boats. We're going after the Avatar.

title: The Deserter
text: Back in the settlement, Chey exits Jeong Jeong's cottage. He arrives back where Aang and the others are fast asleep. Everyone wakes up instantly as Chey approaches.

title: The Deserter
text: What happened? Can I see Jeong Jeong now?

title: The Deserter
text: [Looking downcast.] He won't see you. He's very angry that I brought you here. He wants you to leave immediately.

title: The Deserter
text: Finally! Let's hit the road. [He stretches back out again.]

title: The Deserter
text: Why won't he see me?

title: The Deserter
text: He says you're not ready. Says you haven't mastered waterbending and earthbending yet.

title: The Deserter
text: [Shocked.] Wait, how does he know that?

title: The Deserter
text: He saw the way you walked into camp. He could tell.

title: The Deserter
text: I'm going in, anyway!

title: The Deserter
text: Aang walks to Jeong Jeong's cottage. He takes a deep breath, parts the curtain, and walks into the darkness. Cut to a dark figure seated cross legged amidst a semicircle of candles, his back to Aang.

title: The Deserter
text: Get out.

title: The Deserter
text: Master, I need to learn firebending.

title: The Deserter
text: Only a fool seeks his own destruction.

title: The Deserter
text: [To Jeong Jeong.] I'm the Avatar, it's my destiny toâ [Gets interrupted.]

title: The Deserter
text: Destiny? What would a boy know of destiny? If a fish lives its whole life in this river, does he know the river's destiny? No! Only that it runs on and on out of his control! He may follow where it flows, but he cannot see the end. He cannot imagine the ocean.

title: The Deserter
text: Okay, but it's the Avatar's duty to master all of the bending disciplines.

title: The Deserter
text: To master the bending disciplines, you must first master discipline itself. But you have no interest in this, so I have no interest in you! Now, get out.

title: The Deserter
text: Please, I have to learn. This could be my only chance.

title: The Deserter
text: Are you deaf? How can I teach you if you refuse to listen? Before learning firebending you must learn water and earth. Water is cool and soothing, earth is steady and stable, but fire, fire is alive! It breathes, it grows. Without the bender, a rock will not throw itself! But fire will spread and destroy everything in its path if one does not have the will to control it! That is its destiny! You are not ready! You are too weak!

title: The Deserter
text: At this final gesture the candles around Jeong Jeong violently flame up to illuminate the entire hut before quickly going out. A vision in front of Jeong Jeong begins, as one candle is seen lit in front of the firebender. A tree is in the background behind the Deserter. In front of him, stands Avatar Roku.

title: The Deserter
text: You think I am weak?

title: The Deserter
text: Avatar Roku! No, No! I did not mean that.

title: The Deserter
text: I have mastered the elements a thousand times in a thousand lifetimes. Now, I must do it once again. You will teach the Avatar [He raises his hand and ignites the tree behind Jeong Jeong.] firebending.

title: The Deserter
text: Yes, yes, I will teach you.

title: The Deserter
text: Really? That's great! [Raises his hands happily; Jeong Jeong groans in dismay fearing this may not end well.]

title: The Deserter
text: In the morning outside of Jeong Jeong's cottage. Sokka is sitting on a boulder by the river, fishing. The screen pans up the river where Katara is practicing waterbending before switching to Aang and Jeong Jeong in front of the cottage. Aang stands, bandy legged, on a flat stone in the river. Jeong Jeong stands a foot or two away on the bank in front of his cottage.

title: The Deserter
text: Widen your stance. Wider! Bend your knees. Now, concentrate. [Aang expresses his concentration.] Good, good!

title: The Deserter
text: Wait! What do I do now?

title: The Deserter
text: [Turns around.] Silence! Talking is not concentrating! Look at your friend, is she talking? [Points at Sokka.] Even that oaf knows to concentrate on what he's doing!

title: The Deserter
text: [Annoyed.] Hey!

title: The Deserter
text: But what am I concentrating on?

title: The Deserter
text: Feel the heat of the sun. It is the greatest source of fire. Yet, it is in complete balance with nature!

title: The Deserter
text: So when do I get to make some fire?

title: The Deserter
text: Concentrate!

title: The Deserter
text: Aang breathes and is embarrassed as his friends laugh at him from behind. He turns to look at them, but they stop instantly, as he tries to innocent. Cut to a long shot of the figures in the distance climbing the slope of a mountain. Cut to a close-up shot of Aang and Jeong Jeong walking up the path to the mountain's summit.

title: The Deserter
text: Are we coming up here so I don't burn anything with my fire blasts?

title: The Deserter
text: No fire yet.

title: The Deserter
text: What?

title: The Deserter
text: Power in firebending comes from the breath. That is why you must master proper breath control.

title: The Deserter
text: You brought me up here to breathe?

title: The Deserter
text: Assume your stance.

title: The Deserter
text: Aang assumes the proper stance.

title: The Deserter
text: [Faces the opposite direction of Aang.] Wider.

title: The Deserter
text: You're not even lookâ [Interrupted by Jeong Jeong.]

title: The Deserter
text: Wider! Now, inhale through the nose and exhale through the mouth - without talking. Good. Keep going.

title: The Deserter
text: Jeong Jeong walks down the path and out of the frame as Aang continues to breathe, a look of fierce concentration on his face. Cut to a view of Aang's lower body as he parts the curtain into Jeong Jeong's cottage.

title: The Deserter
text: What are you doing here? I did not tell you to stop!

title: The Deserter
text: I've been breathing for hours!

title: The Deserter
text: You want to stop breathing?

title: The Deserter
text: I want you to stop wasting my time! I already know how to squat and breathe and feel the sun! [Wiggles fingers to the ceiling to gesture this.] I wanna know how to shoot fire out of my fingertips!

title: The Deserter
text: [Sighs gruffly.] I had a pupil once who had no interest in learning discipline. He was only concerned with the power of fire - how he could use it to destroy his opponents and wipe out the obstacles in his path, but fire is a horrible burden to bear. Its nature is to consume and without control it destroys everything around it. [While he was speaking, the camera cuts to Zhao on his boat; several men attack him, but he fends them off easily, leaving a fire in his wake. Cuts back to Jeong Jeong.]

title: The Deserter
text: Learn restraint, or risk destroying yourself and everything you love.

title: The Deserter
text: After several hours Jeong Jeong finds Aang in front of the hut meditating.

title: The Deserter
text: I thought about what you said, I promise I'll be more patient.

title: The Deserter
text: We're going to work with fire now.

title: The Deserter
text: Oh yeah! [Aang gets excited and airbends himself into the air. He quickly gets serious again.] I mean, let us begin.

title: The Deserter
text: Jeong Jeong grabs a falling leaf and burns the center.

title: The Deserter
text: Concentrate on the fire. I want you to keep the flame from reaching the edges of the leaf for as long as you can.

title: The Deserter
text: Master! There is trouble.

title: The Deserter
text: What's going on?

title: The Deserter
text: Concentrate on your leaf!

title: The Deserter
text: [Annoyed.] This is the worst firebending instruction ever! All he does is leave me for hours to concentrate or breathe!

title: The Deserter
text: I'm sure there's a good reason.

title: The Deserter
text: But I'm ready to do so much more.

title: The Deserter
text: Aang remembers to concentrate on his leaf and gets into a stance and breaths. Moments later, the leaf burns up creating a small flame.

title: The Deserter
text: [Excited.] I did it! I made fire!

title: The Deserter
text: Aang, that's great, but you should take it slow.

title: The Deserter
text: Aang starts playing with it by tossing it back and forth from in front to behind himself. He makes a blast go in the opposite direction.

title: The Deserter
text: Now that's some firebending!

title: The Deserter
text: Aang, you'll hurt yourself!

title: The Deserter
text: I wonder how that juggler did it.

title: The Deserter
text: Aang tosses it into the air and spreads his arms out. For a second, he has a smile on his face, but it vanishes as he accidentally burns Katara's hands. Katara shrieks in pain.

title: The Deserter
text: Katara! I'm so sorry!

title: The Deserter
text: Sokka comes running to Katara's side.

title: The Deserter
text: [Concerned.] Katara, what's wrong? [Angrily.] What did you do?!

title: The Deserter
text: It was an accident! I was, uh... Katara, I'm so--

title: The Deserter
text: Sokka tackles Aang.

title: The Deserter
text: I told you we shouldn't mess around with this! Look what you did! You burned my sister! [Katara runs away.] You burned my sister! [As Jeong Jeong walks in.] This is all your fault!

title: The Deserter
text: I know! Now pack your things. You must leave immediately.

title: The Deserter
text: Katara runs off.

title: The Deserter
text: I'm sorry, I didn't ... [Sokka runs off.] I'm sorry! [Jeong Jeong looks at Aang, displeased.]

title: The Deserter
text: The scene cuts to Katara who is sulking by a creek due to the pain of her burns. She dips her hands in; they glow briefly, and a few seconds later her hands are healed.

title: The Deserter
text: You have healing abilities. The great benders of the Water Tribe sometimes have this ability. I've always wished I were blessed like you - free from this burning curse.

title: The Deserter
text: But you're a great master. You have powers that I will never know.

title: The Deserter
text: Water brings healing and life. But fire brings only destruction and pain. It forces those of us burdened with its care to walk a razor's edge between humanity and savagery. Eventually, we are torn apart.

title: The Deserter
text: Suddenly the water is front of them is blasted with flames. Jeong Jeong gets up and gets into a defensive bending stance and breaks the flames that wash over him and Katara. The screen changes to a frontal shot of Zhao's riverboats coming toward them before switching back to Katara and Jeong Jeong.

title: The Deserter
text: Go get your friends and flee! Do not come back here or you will all be destroyed. Hurry!

title: The Deserter
text: Jeong Jeong faces the boats that land harmlessly around him. The screen shows Zhao looking ahead through a telescope from the main deck of his ship. He lowers it and smiles. The screen goes back to Jeong Jeong produces a large wall of fire in front of the ships. An overhead shot of the ships is shown; the boats turn to land on the beach. The screen goes back to the front of the beach. Zhao comes into view.

title: The Deserter
text: Don't worry, men. My old teacher gave up fighting a long time ago. [The screen pans to Jeong Jeong. Suddenly, Zhao parts through the wall.] Haven't you, Master Jeong Jeong?

title: The Deserter
text: [The screen goes for a close of Jeong Jeong's face, and a wide shot as he drops the wall of fire. Cut to Katara running up to where Sokka is preparing Appa to leave.]

title: The Deserter
text: Katara! Are you all right?

title: The Deserter
text: I'm fine, we've got to get out of here. Where's Aang? [Sokka gestures to the cottage.]

title: The Deserter
text: Katara enters the cottage to find Aang sulking.

title: The Deserter
text: Jeong Jeong tried to tell me that I wasn't ready. I wouldn't listen. I'm never going to firebend again.

title: The Deserter
text: You'll have to eventually.

title: The Deserter
text: No, never again.

title: The Deserter
text: It's okay, Aang. I'm healed.

title: The Deserter
text: [Surprised.] What? How?

title: The Deserter
text: I'll explain later. But right now, we have to get out here. Zhao and his soldiers are attacking!

title: The Deserter
text: [Gets on his feet.] Where?

title: The Deserter
text: By the river. They captured Jeong Jeong.

title: The Deserter
text: I have to help him!

title: The Deserter
text: [The screen switches to an overhead shot of the beach. Zhao and his men stand against Jeong Jeong, before cutting to a closer shot.]

title: The Deserter
text: Look at you. You were once so great. I can't believe my former master has become nothing more than a simple savage.

title: The Deserter
text: It is you who have embraced savagery, Zhao.

title: The Deserter
text: It's Admiral Zhao, now.

title: The Deserter
text: That title will not help you against the Avatar. Do not try to fight him! You are no match!

title: The Deserter
text: [Amused.] I think I can handle a child.

title: The Deserter
text: I have never seen such raw power ...

title: The Deserter
text: Jeong Jeong!

title: The Deserter
text: We'll see. Men! Take the deserter!

title: The Deserter
text: Cut to overhead shot of Jeong Jeong surrounded by five firebenders. Aang tops short in horror as they close in. Jeong Jeong smirks and wraps himself in a ball of flames. When the flames completely dissipates Jeong Jeong is nowhere to be seen.

title: The Deserter
text: [Angry.] It's a trick! He's run off into the woods. Find him! [Faces Aang.] Let's find out what my old master has taught you.

title: The Deserter
text: [Shocked.] You were Jeong Jeong's student?!

title: The Deserter
text: Until I got bored.

title: The Deserter
text: Zhao throws a fireball at Aang.

title: The Deserter
text: I see he taught you how to duck and run like a coward. But I doubt he showed you what a firebender is truly capable of! [Throws another intense fireball.]

title: The Deserter
text: Whoa! Wild shot!

title: The Deserter
text: [Roars with rage.] I'll show you wild!

title: The Deserter
text: Aang looks over to the side where Zhao just burned.

title: The Deserter
text: No self-control ... [Gets an idea.]

title: The Deserter
text: Stand and fight, Avatar!

title: The Deserter
text: [Mockingly.] Oh, were we fighting? I thought you were just getting warmed up!

title: The Deserter
text: [Burns in anger at the remark.] I was ... [Shoots another fireball.]

title: The Deserter
text: Zhao fires many more fireballs which all miss.

title: The Deserter
text: Is that all you got? Man, they'll make anyone an admiral these days! [Nearly gets blasted.] [Aang cups his hands over his to sound louder.] Ahoy! [Moons Zhao with pants up.] I'm Admiral Zhao! [Zhao gets even angrier and Aang nearly gets blasted again.] I don't know why, but I thought you'd be better than Zuko. [Aang looks disappointed when he says this. His eyes go wide and he lies down on the deck fast enough to avoid being burnt. Mocking Zhao's firebending.] Sloppy. Very sloppy.

title: The Deserter
text: Nowhere to run now, you little smart mouth!

title: The Deserter
text: [Having dodged a series of blasts from Zhao on several ships.] You've lost this battle.

title: The Deserter
text: [Enraged disbelief.] Are you crazy? You haven't thrown a single blow!

title: The Deserter
text: No, but you have. [He gestures around, all the boats are on fire and sinking.] Jeong Jeong said you had no restraint. [Jumps in the water.] Have a nice walk home!

title: The Deserter
text: Aang, come on! Let's go!

title: The Deserter
text: Cut a shot from behind Aang, who is now looking at the river bank beach. Aang hops on Appa and they fly away.

title: The Deserter
text: Wait! Where's Jeong Jeong?

title: The Deserter
text: He disappeared. They all did.

title: The Deserter
text: [Walks into the now abandoned village; not amused.] Hey, where did everybody go? [Sarcastically.] Very funny guys

title: The Deserter
text: Aang, you're burned! Let me help you. [Katara heals the burn on Aang's arm.]

title: The Deserter
text: Wow, that's good water.

title: The Deserter
text: When did you learn that?

title: The Deserter
text: I guess I always knew.

title: The Deserter
text: [Sarcastically.] Oh ... Well then thanks for all the first aid over the years. Like when I fell into the greaseberry bramble. [Angrily.] Or that time I had two fishhooks in my thumb!

title: The Deserter
text: [Shocked.] Two?

title: The Deserter
text: [Amused.] He tried to get the first fishhook out with another fishhook.

title: The Deserter
text: [Still being sarcastic.] Oh, and the time that mink snake bit me! Thanks for healing that up. That was great. Really helpful.

title: The Deserter
text: Fade to credits.

title: The Deserter
text: Aang

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: The episode begins with the gang sitting around a camp site with several other groups, listening to a man telling a story of 'airbenders'.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [Dramatically; out of view.] So, travelers. The next time you think you hear a strange, large bird talking, take a closer look. It might not be a giant parrot, but a flying man. A member of a secret group of air walkers, who laugh at gravity, and laugh at those bound to the earth by it!

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [Cuts to a wide shot, showing the gang and the other travelers surrounding a small campfire. The Storyteller, having finished his story, is going around collecting coins from the other travelers.] Aren't airbender stories the greatest? [Talking to Katara and Sokka, who are sitting next to him.]

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [Excitedly.] Was it realistic? Is that how it was back then?

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Cuts to the three kids.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: I laugh at gravity all the time. [Chuckling to himself.] Gravity.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [Arrives in front of the gang, having already collected money from the rest of the audience.] Jingle, jingle! [Jingles the hat in front of Sokka, asking for money.]

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Sokka searches inside his heavy cloak, and manages to pull out a bug, a worm and a few crumbs.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Sorry ...

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [Upset and somewhat downcast.] Aww, cheapskates! [Walks away as Sokka puts the bugs back in his pocket.]

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Aang stands up and runs after the storyteller, who is kneeling in front of an old man.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [Happily.] Hey! Thanks for the story.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [Holds out his cap.] Tell it to the cap, boy.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: The Storyteller shakes his cap behind him as he kneels in front of an old man. The shaking causes a coin to come loose and fall from the cap. As Aang searches his clothes for some money, Momo picks up the coin and puts it in the cap as the Storyteller turns around.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Aww, much obliged, little bat-thing. [He pets Momo on the head.]

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [Having given up trying to find a coin.] It means a lot to hear airbender stories. It must have been a hundred years ago your great grandpa met them.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [Confused.] What are you prattling about, child? Great Grandpappy saw the air walkers last week. [He indicates to the old man he was kneeling in front of before. The old man makes a sound in his throat akin to a laugh, and waves a greeting to Aang. The shot cuts to Aang, who has a shocked and disbelieving expression.]

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: The scene changes from the campsite to a shot of clouds, and Appa flying above them.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [Sitting on Appa's neck, steering. He is talking to Katara and Sokka, who are riding in Appa's saddle.] Hey, we're almost at the Northern Air Temple. This is where they had the championships for Sky Bison polo.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [Moving to sit at the back of the saddle with her brother.] Do you think we'll really find airbenders?

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [He is whittling a piece of wood. The design is indecipherable.] You want me to be like you, or totally honest?

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [Crossing her arms, obviously angry with him.] Are you saying I'm a liar?

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [He shrugs, unconcerned with her mood.] I'm saying you're an optimist. Same thing, basically.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [Excitedly.] Hey, guys, look at this!

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: The camera moves to show Appa, who is flying toward a mountain with a large structure on top. It looks very similar to the Southern Air Temple, with obvious spires reminiscent of a temple's architecture. Around them are several dark specks. The camera zooms in, and the specks are revealed to be people, flying around the temple in plane-shaped contraptions.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [Amazed.] They really are airbenders!

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [His face falls as he sees the 'airbenders', and after Katara's excited outburst, he leans back and scowls while crossing his arms.] No, they're not.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [Exuberantly.] What do you mean "they're not"? Those guys are flying!

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [Bitterly. He is glaring at the direction of the people flying around the temple.] Gliding maybe, but not flying. You can tell by the way they move, they're not airbending. Those people have no spirit.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Suddenly, a boy sitting in an oddly shaped chair flies right above them, nearly hitting them, and laughing as he does so.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: I don't know, Aang.[Katara points to the boy.] That kid seemed pretty spirited. [Katara indicates to the boy, who is flying dangerously close, but still laughing.]

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: The boy begins to fly away, shooting Aang one more look back as he does so while grinning. Aang grins devilishly, and opens up his glider to follow the boy. He leaves Katara and Sokka on Appa, and they quickly become surrounded by gliders as they get closer to the temple. Several gliders almost hit Appa, which causes Katara to knock into her brother and shout in pain as Appa moves sharply to avoid them.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: We better find some solid ground, before it finds us. [The siblings land Appa on the temple courtyard, out of the hazardous sky. Aang is still flying with the boy, and seems to be having fun at the surprise competition.]

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [Several children are on the ground, cheering on their friend.] Go Teo! Show that bald kid how it's done!

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Teo and Aang do two loop-de-loops as they fly around the air temple. The two boys do a spiral downwards.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [The boy doesn't seem upset at Aang, and seems happy that he isn't angry for nearly flying into him.] Hey there, you're pretty good!

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [Nonchalantly, but with a smirk.] Yeah, I know. But I can do more than fancy gliding.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Aang begins flying closer to the temple, under a bridge. Cut to a scene of Aang jumping off his glider and allowing it to fly forward on its own. He begins running along a wall, switching to an air scooter halfway, before jumping off onto his glider again.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [He is looking amazed, before thinking of his own plan.] Wow, I don't think I can do that. But here's a good one.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Teo turns on a small canister that is positioned under his glider. White smoke begins to stream from the strange contraption, and Teo flies around in the sky. The camera pans to show the sight from the ground, where it is revealed that he has created an image of Aang's face, complete with an annoyed expression. The crowd below cheers.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: What do you think?

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [Annoyed; his face mimics the one Teo has just drawn.] It's great.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Aang lands beside Katara and Sokka. Teo lands soon after and pulls on the brakes. Other children take the glider off of the top of his wheel chair. Teo rolls up to Aang.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Hey, you're a real airbender. You must be the Avatar! That's amazing! I-I've heard stories about you!

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [Rubs his head, embarrassed.] Thanks.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [Sokka ignores all formalities, instead going over to Teo's chair and examining the strange shape and design.] Wow! This glider chair is incredible!

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: You think this is good, wait until you see the other stuff my dad designed.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: All four walk inside the building. They enter a room filled with pipes and machinery. Aang looks around worriedly. Beneath the pipes, an original mural can be seen, although it has been destroyed by the pipes, which are sticking into the walls.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Wow! [Runs up to machines.]

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Yeah, my dad is the mastermind behind this whole place. Everything's powered by hot air. [Shows women using an elevator like contraption.] It even pumps hot air currents outside to give us a lift while we're gliding.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [Monotonously.] This place is unbelievable.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Yeah, it's great, isn't it?

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: No, just unbelievable. [Walks away.]

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [Katara approaches Teo, who seems disappointed at Aang's reaction.] Aang used to come here a long time ago. I think he's a little shocked it's so ... different.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: So better!

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Katara walks up to Aang, who is looking at a painted wall with pipes going through it.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: This is supposed to be the history of my people.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Katara puts her hand on his shoulder. He walks over to a fountain with an air bison statue on it. He looks at his reflection in the dirty green water, Aang looks at it squeamishly. The sky bison statue suddenly has black smoke coming out of it's mouth.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Ugh!

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [Walks up and puts her hand on his shoulder.] I'm sure some parts of the temple are still the same.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Screen pans off to show Aang, Katara, Sokka and Teo walking across a bridge to a large room that looks well kept. The room has no roof, although around the walls there are statues of monks, mostly meditating.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: It's nice to see that at least one part of the temple that isn't ruined.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Katara and Aang look at a statue of a long-bearded airbender meditating.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [Off-screen.] Look out!

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: The statue is knocked down by a wrecking ball and all four cover their heads. Dust is coming from the statue, so all four cough. The dust clears to show six men standing where the statue used to be.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: What the doodle? Don't you know enough to stay away from construction sites? We have to make room for the bathhouse! [He has approached Aang and the group, looking more surprised than upset.]

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [He turns to the mechanist and yells angrily at him.] Do you know what you did!? You just destroyed something sacred! For a stupid bathhouse!

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Well, people around here are starting to stink. [Waves his hand in front of his face, as though trying to dissipate a bad smell.]

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [Points at the mechanist.] This whole place stinks! [Using his airbending, Aang flips the crane contraption off of the edge of the building.]

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Cut to exterior shot, showing the crane falling and landing heavily against the side of the cliff the temple is situated on. It is covered by a cloud of dirt and snow as it is utterly destroyed.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: This is a sacred temple! You can't treat it this way! [Walks closer to the mechanist.] I've seen it when the monks were here! I know what it's supposed to be like!

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: The monks? But, [Scratches his beard.] you're twelve.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [Teo rolls up.] Dad, he's the Avatar. He used to come here a hundred years ago.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Aang takes a menacing step closer to the mechanist, who takes a step back.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: What are you doing? Who said you could be here?

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [Turns away from Aang.] Hmm, doing here ... A long time ago, [Points finger up.] but not a hundred years, my people became refugees [Walks behind his son's wheelchair.] after a terrible flood. My infant son, [Teo looks down sadly.] Teo, was badly hurt and lost his mother. [Sniffles.] I needed somewhere to rebuild and I stumbled across this place. Couldn't believe it! Everywhere! Pictures of flying people! But empty, [Looks around.] nobody home. Then, [Does a airplane like gesture, like he's flying up to Aang.] I came across these fan-like contraptions!

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Our gliders.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Yes! Little, light flying machines! [Waves his hands up and down.] They gave me an idea. Build a new life for my son, in the air! Then everyone will be on equal ground! So to speak. We're just in the process of improving upon what's already here. [Katara wipes her tears on Aang's shirt, and Sokka looks like he's holding back tears.] And, after all, isn't that what nature does?

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Nature knows where to stop.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: I suppose that's true. Unfortunately, progress has a way of getting away from us. Look at the time! [Points at candles.] Come! [To other workers.] The pulley system must be oiled before dark.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Wait, how can you tell the time from that thing? The notches all look the same.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: The candle will tell us. Watch. [Candle pops four times.]

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: You put spark powder in the candle!

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Four flashes. So it's exactly four hours past mid-day. Or, as I call it: four o'candle. [Sokka laughs. Cut to a frontal shot of the mechanist, pleased that Sokka is interested.] If you like that, wait till you see my finger-safe knife sharpener. [He holds up his left hand, revealing that three of the fingers are made of wood.] Only took me three tries to get it right. [He pulls off the three wooden fingers, and throws them into Sokka's hand.]

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [Horrified.] Aaah!

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [Pokes Sokka in the back with his one remaining finger and gestures for him to come.] Follow me! [Sokka runs after him.]

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Hey, Aang. I want to show you something.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Screen fades to black before reappearing with Katara, Teo and Aang walking inside a building.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: I just can't get over it. There's not a single thing that's the same.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: I don't know about that. The temple might be different [Picks upÂ hermit crabÂ from the ground.] but the creatures that live here [Hands it to Katara.] are probably direct descendants of the ones who lived here a long time ago.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [Pokes hermit crab.] You're right. They're kind of keepers of the temple's origins. [Katara hands it to Aang. It moves around in his hand and he smiles.]

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Besides, there's one part of the temple that hasn't changed at all.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Screen fades slightly and reappears at a long hallway with airbending symbols through it. Shows all three looking at a door with an airbending contraption on it.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Hey, it's just like the one in the other temple!

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [Confidently, with a matter-of-fact tone.] Only an airbender can open it, so inside it's completely untouched. Just the way the monks left it. I've always wondered what it's like in there ...

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [She looks at him, as though slightly scared of his reaction. Her tone is gentle and questioning.] Aang?

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [He turns away from the door and his friends.] I'm sorry. This is the last part of the temple that's the same as it was. I want it to stay that way.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [Somewhat disappointed, although he tries not to let it show.] I completely understand. I just wanted you to know that it's here.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Thanks. [All three start to walk away.]

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Screen cuts to Sokka and the mechanist walking down a dark stairway holding lanterns.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: These lanterns are terrible. I can't see! [Opens the top of his lantern only to find them filled with fireflies.] Why would you want to use fireflies for light? [One flies out.]

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Hey! Close that up! They'll get loose! [Sokka closes it.] Fireflies are a non-flammable light source. [Both begin to walk again.]

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: They continue for a while until they arrive at a wooden door.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Cover your nose [Both plug their noses.] and hold your breath. [The mechanist opens an eye slot in the door, both look inside a pitch-black room.]

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [Nasally, due to his nose being blocked.] Okay ... so you brought me all the way down here to see an empty room.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [Closes eye slot.] Wrong. It's filled to the brim with natural gas. Came across it my first time here. Unfortunately, I was carrying a torch at the time. Nearly blew my self and the whole place even more sky high! Thought my eyebrows would never grow back. [Pans up to his eyebrows.] Anyway, there's a vital problem that needs solving. From time to time, we have gas leaks. And they're nearly impossible to find.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: So, this place is an explosion waiting to happen.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Yes, until I figure out how to locate something I can't see, hear, smell, or touch.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Cut to a exterior of temple with people flying in the sky. Aang, Katara and Teo are on the ground.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: The wind will carry you. It supports something inside you. Something even lighter than air. [Shows Katara holding a glider and standing at the edge of a building.] And that something takes over when you fly. [Katara puts down her glider and looks up at the other people flying.]

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [Nervously.] I've changed my mind. I think I was born without that something.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [Laughs.] Impossible! Everybody has it!

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Spirit.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: What?

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Spirit. That's the something you're talking about.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [Thoughtfully.] Yeah, I suppose it is.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Shows Katara with the glider in her hands again.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Are you ready?

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: No! [Jumps off anyway.] Aaaaah! [Starts to fall down wards, but eventually starts to fly straight. Her scream peters off as she begins laughing.] I can't believe I'm flying!

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Aang and Momo fly up beside her.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Just make sure you keep your mouth closed so you don't swallow a bug! [Shows Momo flying by and eating a bug.]

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Teo was right about the air. All I had to do was trust it, let it carry me.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Even though Teo's not an airbender, he really does have the spirit of one! [Aang lands beside him on the building.] I've been thinking. If you want to see what's in that room, I'd be happy to open the door for you.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Great!

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Wait! [Katara flies by.] How do I land this thing? What if I land over a-ack-ack-bleck! Bug! Bug! Ack, that was a bug!

title: The Northern Air Temple
