text: Back to Sokka and the mechanist. The mechanist is drawing on a large piece of paper and Sokka is looking through shelves. Sokka drops various things, including seven scrolls, four pieces of paper, a hard-boiled egg and a model of a hot air balloon.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: I said don't touch anything! [Comes over to help Sokka pick things up.] Oh, don't worry. That experiment's old, [Referring to the hot air balloon.] and that egg was just part of last week's lunch.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [He sniffs the air before wincing.] Ugh! Week old egg smell!

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Quick, find that egg! [Both crawl around the floor looking for it.]

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Shows Aang, Teo and Katara at the door of the airbending room.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: I can't believe I'm finally going to see what's inside!

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Aang airbends into the door's contraption, flipping three dials so air comes out of them. Cut to Sokka and the mechanist searching for the egg.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: How can something so small that you can't even see it make such a big stink!?

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: The mechanist looks up from searching.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: That's the solution to our problem!

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Yeah ... [Both turn toward each other.] if we put a whole mess of rotten eggs in the cellar where the gas seeps up ...

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: ... The gas will mix with the smell of rotten eggs!

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Then, if there's a leak ...

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: ... You smell rotten eggs! Then, you just follow your nose to the place where the smell is coming from ...

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: And plug up the hole where the gas is escaping!

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Both throw up their hands.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: You're a genius! [Bell rings on one of his desks.]

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Something's wrong. [Stands up.] I've go to go! [Runs out the door and Sokka follows.]

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Shows Aang, Teo, and Katara walking into the large room. It's filled with Fire Nation weapons, tools and a red hot air balloon with the Fire Nation insignia on it.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: This is a nightmare.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [Walks in with Sokka behind him.] You don't understand!

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [Accusingly.] You're making weapons for the Fire Nation!

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [Angrily.] You make weapons for the Fire Nation?!

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Explain all this! Now!

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [He is hesitant, but resigned as he begins to explain.] It was about a year after we moved here. Fire Nation soldiers found our settlement. You were too young to remember this, Teo. They were going to destroy everything! Burn it to the ground! I pleaded with them, I begged them to spare us! They asked what I had to offer. I offered ... my services. You must understand. I did this for you!

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Teo looks away in shame and the mechanist leaves. The scene cuts to him in his workshop, placing two eggs with smiley faces in his hot air balloon model, along with a candle to make it float. He looks rather depressed. He lets go of the bottom and it starts to float. As this happens, the door opens, with Aang and Teo standing in the doorway.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: When are they coming?

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Soon. [Candle pops once.] Very soon.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: You can't give them more weapons.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: If I don't give them what they want, they will destroy this place! [The model of the hot air balloon catches fire and crashes. The mechanist puts the fire out with a cloth.]

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: How can I be proud of you when your inventions are being used for murder?

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: I need some time to think. [Bell rings on his desk.] You need to leave! Go!

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: We're not leaving!

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Then hide! Quickly! [They hide behind some of his inventions. the mechanist pulls a rope that opens a trapdoor, and a war minister from the Fire Nation is lifted into the room.]

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: You know better than to keep me waiting. Give me what you owe us so we can be on our way. [The mechanist looks down.] Well? Is there a problem?

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [Hurredly.] No, right this way. [Gestures toward the door.]

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Qin is about to go out the door, but Aang airbends it shut. He jumps in front of the door.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: The deal's off.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: The Avatar ...

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Aang, don't get involved!

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: If I don't get what I came here for, the Fire Nation will burn this place to rubble!

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Get out of here! [Slaps him in the face with an air swipe; continues off screen.] You're leaving empty-handed!

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Then the destruction of this temple [Pointing at Aang.] will be on your head! [He leaves through the trap door and Aang airbends it shut.]

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: The four children are now talking on the tall bridge.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: This is bad.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Very bad!

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Aang, what are we going to do? How can we possibly keep them all away?

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: I'll tell you how. We have something they don't. [Points to the sky.] Air power. We control the sky. That's something the Fire Nation can't do. We can win!

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: I want to help. [He appears at the door.]

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Good. We'll need it.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Cuts to an aerial shot of the temple, before cutting to the mechanist's workshop. He is standing behind a table with Sokka. The model hot air balloon, a few plans, and a candle are resting on the table. Aang, Katara, and Teo are on the other side, surrounded by other colonists.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: We finally got the war balloon working, thanks to Sokka. This boy's a genius!

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Thank you. You're a genius!

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Thank you! [Katara and Aang exchange unamused glances.]

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: See, the problem with the old war balloon was you could get it air-borne, [Places the candle in the model.] but once it did, it just kept going. [He pulls a string connected to the model, putting it on the table.] You could put a hole in the top, but then all the hot air would escape. So the question became, how do you keep a lid on hot air?

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Ugh, if only we knew. [Teo, Katara, and Aang laugh.]

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: A lid is actually the answer. If you control the hot air, you control the war balloon.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Huh, that's actually pretty smart.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Okay, we've got four kinds of bombs: [He begins listing them off on his fingers.] smoke, slime, fire, and ...

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Stink! Never underestimate the power of stink!

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Cut to exterior shot of temple. Everyone is outside, watching anxiously for any sign of the Fire Nation.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [Looking over a ledge.] They're coming!

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Are we ready?

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [Worriedly.] Yes. But where's Sokka with the war balloon?

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [Jumping off Appa.] We'll have to start without it.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Cut to shot of people readying their flying machines for take off. They begin the assault as their gliders fly off into the air. Cheers from the crowd below. Cut to Fire Nation troops climbing the cliff path. They are attacked by the various bombs thrown at them. Cut back to Aang and the other flyers going down through the clouds. The gliders fly over the Fire Nation troops dropping bombs below. Cut to Fire Nation troops on the cliff edge.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Take them out of the sky. Now!

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Cut to more gliders dropping bombs. Fire Nation soldiers cough and some fall off the cliff. Cut to Aang jumping onto an air scooter, moving across a ledge, causing snow to fall onto soldiers below before jumping back onto his glider. Cut to the soldiers retreating.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: We've got them on the run! We need more slime!

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Cut to gliders flying up through the clouds to Appa and receiving more bombs from Katara. Hooks fly through the clouds nearly hitting Appa and latching onto the cliff. Cut to tanks scaling the cliffs via the chains. Aang sees this and manages to remove one hook. The tank falls before sending out another hook. Cut to distance shot of temple with tanks closing in. Gliders continue to fly dropping bombs in an attempt to slow the tanks down. Many cuts to interiors of tanks showing soldiers firebending out of them. Aang lands and airbends the tanks away. The tanks flip over and readjust themselves before continuing on. Cut to Katara and Teo in sky.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Those things are unstoppable!

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [Thoughtfully, trying to remember what he knew.] I think I know how they work. I remember my dad tinkering with the counterbalancing system. Something to do with water. Works great, huh?

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Water? Can you get me close to one?

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: No problem!

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Cut to aerial view of Aang fending off firebending blasts. Cut to Katara landing next to him. Katara freezes multiple tanks with waterbending. Camera zooms out to show more tanks. Aang defends Katara from fire blasts before Appa drops in front and knocks the tanks away. Cut to behind Appa showing Katara and Aang climbing up his tail. Cut to Aang and Katara looking down at the oncoming force. Cut to the temple balcony with Katara, Aang and Teo.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: We're out of bombs!

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Come on Sokka. [Side-view of Katara.] Where's that war balloon?

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: The war balloon appears behind Katara. Cut to wide-view of temple balcony with war balloon in background. Cut to view of soldiers and tanks advancing forward with war balloon above. Cut to view of Sokka and the mechanist on the war balloon.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Hey, why aren't they shooting at us?

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: The insignia! [Close-up of Fire Nation insignia.] They think we're on their side.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [Close-up of Sokka on war balloon.] Then I guess they won't see this coming. [Slices rope attached to a large bomb.]

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [Cut to view of both balloon and advancing army.] Bombs away!

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Cut to ground view of soldiers being washed away by slime. Cut to above war balloon showing Sokka cut another rope. Cut back to view of soldiers and balloon showing the bombs stopping some of soldiers and tanks. Cut to shot under balloon showing Sokka and the mechanist looking down.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Oh no, that was the last one. [Cut to tanks beginning to scale the cliffs.]

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [Cut back to Sokka and the mechanist.] Wait a second. You smell that?

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Rotten eggs! [Cut to a view of the balloon and a large crevice in the ground below.] There! That's were the gas is escaping.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Cut to close-up of Sokka with the expression of having an idea. Cut to tanks scaling cliff side. Cut to Earth Kingdom civilians trying to knock the hooks away. Cut to Sokka and the mechanist on the balloon. Sokka is levering the engine away from the bottom of the balloon in an attempt to get it free.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: What are you doing? That's our fuel source.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: It's the only bomb we've got.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Cut to view below the balloon as the engine drops to the crevice below. Cut to exterior of temple as the army advances on the temple. Cut to a view of Katara, Aang and Teo looking down. Cut to Sokka and the mechanist on balloon. Cut to wide-view of the temple and the war balloon in distance. An explosion goes off and the temple is blocked from view. Cut to Sokka and the mechanist on war balloon, smoke covers the view. Cut to Katara, Aang and Teo with smoke again covering the view. Cut to wide shot of temple with smoke dissipating. Cut to chains hanging off the cliffs, no tanks in sight. Cut to balcony and view of cliffs below.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Look! They're retreating! [Cheers from crowd.]

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [War balloon flies past.] We're going down!

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [Cut to Aang and Katara on balcony.] No, Sokka! Hold on! [Aang jumps on his glider and flies toward them.]

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Cut to view of war balloon falling.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [Cut to close-up of Sokka swinging his boomerang around with a rope attached, the mechanist behind him.] Get ready!

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Cut to Aang flying toward them. Cut to behind the war balloon as Aang circles it. Sokka throws the boomerang toward Aang which latches onto his glider. Cut to Sokka and the mechanist being pulled out of the balloon and dragged away with the mechanist moaning in fright. Cut to show war balloon floating away. The scene ends and cuts to the temple.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: You know what? [Cut to close-up panning shot of Sokka, Katara, Aang, Teo, and the mechanist.] I'm really glad you guys all live here now. [Cut to shot above Aang picking up a hermit crab.] I realized, it's like the hermit crab. [Cut to close-up of Aang's hands surrounding the hermit crab.] Maybe you weren't born here, but you found this empty shell and made it your home. And now you protect each other.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: That means a lot, coming from you.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [Cut to Aang, Sokka and Katara.] Aang you were right about air power. As long as we've got the skies, we'll have the Fire Nation on the run. [Cut to wide-view of temple grounds, crowd cheering.]

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Cut to panning shot of the people, with the mechanist turning away from the crowd and looking down as though sad. Cut to snowy trees in a forest below the temple. The Fire Nation capturing and figuring out how to use the war balloon.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: [Cut to Qin, surrounded by two other ministers.] This defeat is the gateway to many victories.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Cut to behind the Fire Nation soldiers as they begin inflating the balloon up with firebending. Cut to close-up of Fire Nation insignia.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Scene fades to credits.

title: The Northern Air Temple
text: Aang

title: The Waterbending Master
text: The episode opens to show a koala otter calmly floating on its back on the water, purring slightly. Noticing something approach to its right, it turns its head, chirps, and dives under water as a large shadow passes it by. It turns out to be Appa flying overhead.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: [Hanging lazily over the back of Appa's saddle; grumpily.] I'm not one to complain, [Side-view shows Appa flying just above the water.] but can't Appa fly any higher?

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Sokka's words barely left his lips as Appa loses more altitude and his paws drag through the water momentarily, before rising slightly again. Cut to a shot from Appa's saddle, showing a bored Katara popping herself up on her elbows, staring into nothingness in front of her, and a peeved Aang looking back from atop Appa's head.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: [Irritably.] I have an idea! Why don't we all get on your [Points angrily at Sokka; Katara briefly looks at Aang, but resumes her stare in front of her.] back and you could fly us to the North Pole?!

title: The Waterbending Master
text: [Back-view of Sokka looking over his shoulder; sarcastically.] I'd love to. [Points to his back.] Climb on everyone, [Shakes his rear.] Sokka's ready for take off.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: A chirping Momo hops on his back, making Sokka shoot an angry glare at the animal. Cut back to the shot of Katara and Aang, with the latter still staring angrily at Sokka.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: [Waving her hands up and down while shifting looks between Aang and Sokka.] Look, we're all just a little tired and cranky because we've been flying for two days straight.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: [Frontal shot, Momo is now on his lap; annoyed.] And for what? We can't even find the Northern Water Tribe. [Cut to a wide side-shot, revealing Appa floating along a vast ocean of only water and ice.] There's nothing up here.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Cut to Katara and Aang, with the former having laid down her head in boredom, letting it rest on her hands. She looks up in wonder when a slushing sound can be heard. Cut to a frontal shot of Appa, while the water in front of him suddenly rises and solidifies to ice spikes. Cut to a frontal shot of Aang screaming in fright, his eyes wide in horror, as he violently yanks the reins to this right in an attempt to avoid the sudden obstacle. Cut to a side-view of a growling and turning Appa. Cut to the siblings yelling in fright as they hold on for dear life to the sides of the saddle. Cut to a back-shot of a swerving Appa, who suddenly shoots up as another ice spike manifests right in from of him. A close-up shot of his underside shows that he was not quick enough, and part of the ice attaches itself to his leg, freezing instantly. His momentum causes the ice to break, but he is thrown off balance and catapulted away. Frontal shot of Katara and Sokka who loudly scream in fright. Cut to a wider shot of Appa spiraling toward the camera, before switching to an overview shot of him landing into the water, throwing it up high. As he turns upright again, the water around him instantly freezes, and he is locked in place. Cut to the surrounding ice spikes from which Water Tribe boats appear, each carrying several waterbenders, surrounding the team. Cut to a surprised looking Katara and an alarmed looking Sokka who is reaching for his boomerang atop the saddle.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: They're waterbenders! [Happily.] We found the Water Tribe!

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Cut to a more far-off shot of the scene, revealing Appa to be frozen in the water, with six Water Tribe boats surrounding him.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: He's heading north. The Northern Water Tribe. The Avatar needs to master waterbending. He's looking for a teacher.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: [Impatiently.] Then what are we waiting for? Let's go get him!

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Patience, Captain Li. This isn't some little earth village we can just march into. The Water Tribe is a great nation. There's a reason they've survived a hundred years of war. The frozen tundra is treacherous, the landscape itself is an icy fortress. We'll need a massive invasion force.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: The scene changes to the North Pole where the group is being escorted to the Northern Water Tribe. The magnificent wall of the city comes into view much to everyone's amazement.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: [Pointing excitedly.] There it is!

title: The Waterbending Master
text: [In awe.] The Northern Water Tribe.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: [Surprised.] We're finally here.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: A portion of the icy wall is lowered, allowing them to enter into the city. Canal workers use waterbending to transport the group into the city.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: [Fascinated.] I can't believe how many waterbenders live up here!

title: The Waterbending Master
text: [To Katara.] We'll find a master to teach us, no problem.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: The team passes through the channels of the city, catching the attention of several civilians who run over to spectate them. Aang waves happily at the people. As they continue their trek inward, Sokka notices a young lady going by on a boat, capturing his attention. He blushes at the sight of her and leaps onto Appa's tail as she pulls away from view.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: This place is beautiful.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Yeah ... she is ...

title: The Waterbending Master
text: The scene changes to nightfall, where Zuko's ship is docked in a port. Members of the crew have gathered for music night on the ship. Lieutenant Jee plays a lute as Iroh sings. Several other crew members play instruments or dance.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: [Singing.] Winter, spring ... Summer, and fall ... Winter, spring ... Summer, and fall ... Four seasons ... four loves ... Four seasons ... for love.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: The music stops as they notice Admiral Zhao boarding the ship, along with two soldiers. The crew looks in surprise at the admiral. A high-pitched chord emits from the lute. The scene switches back to the Northern Water Tribe, where Team Avatar is being honored with a feast, hosted by the tribe's chief. Men play drums and a giant crab is set in a pool of water.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Tonight, we celebrate the arrival of our brother and sister from the Southern Tribe. And they have brought with them, someone very special, someone whom many of us believed disappeared from the world until now ... the Avatar! [Crowd applauds and cheers.] We also celebrate my daughter's sixteenth birthday. Princess Yue is now of marrying age!

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Thank you, Father. May the great Ocean and Moon Spirits watch over us during these troubled times!

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Now, Master Pakku and his students will perform!

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Pakku and two students bend significant blobs of water, captivating Aang and Katara. They merge the three blobs into one stream, bending it around each other. Yue approaches Sokka.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Hi there. Sokka, Southern Water Tribe.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: [Smiling and bowing slightly.] Very nice to meet you. [They nervously share an awkward silence for a moment.]

title: The Waterbending Master
text: [Nervously.] So ... uhhh ... you're a princess, huh? [She nods and smiles.] You know, back in my tribe, I'm kind of like a prince, myself. [Shot pans left to reveal Katara.]

title: The Waterbending Master
text: [Hopping in on the conversation; teasingly.] Ha, prince of what?

title: The Waterbending Master
text: A lot of things! Do you mind? I'm trying to have a conversation here.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: [Sarcastically.] My apologies, Prince Sokka.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: So, it looks like I'm going to be in town for a while. I'm thinking ... maybe we could ... do an activity, together?

title: The Waterbending Master
text: [Slightly confused; laughs.] Do an activity?

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Embarrassed while sweating, Sokka stuffs food in his mouth. Screens widens to the left to show Katara clearly enjoying her brother's attempt at courting.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Very smooth ...

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Cut to a long shot of the plaza fountain. In front of it stand the Chief, Master Pakku and Aang. Arnook and Aang go to Pakku.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Master Pakku, meet your newest student, the Avatar. [Aang bows.]

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Just because you're destined to save the world, don't expect any special treatment.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: My friend and I can't wait to start training with you! After we relax for a couple of days.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: If you want to relax, then I suggest visiting a tropical island. If not, I'll see you both at sunrise. Good night.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Back on Zuko's ship. Iroh enters Zuko's room.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: For the last time, I'm not playing the tsungi horn!

title: The Waterbending Master
text: No, it's about our plans. There's a bit of a problem.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Zhao enters.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: I'm taking your crew.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: [Cut to a shocked Zuko.] What?! [Turns around to face Zhao.]

title: The Waterbending Master
text: I've recruited them for a little expedition to the North Pole.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Uncle, is that true?

title: The Waterbending Master
text: I'm afraid so. He's taking everyone ... [Putting his arm over his face in woe.] even the cook.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Sorry you won't be there to watch me capture the Avatar. But I can't have you getting in my way again.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: [Cuts to a furious Zuko. Zuko charges at Zhao in anger, but Iroh cuts him off.] No!

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Zhao notices a pair of swords on the wall. Cut to a close-up of Zhao's face, swollen in anger as he recognizes the blades. He flashes back to the Rescue in Pohuai Stronghold, where the same swords were wielded by the previously-unknown Blue Spirit. He takes one off the wall; cut to Zuko's face, his eyes wide and mouth open, clearly recognizing the danger he is in. Iroh, visible over Zuko's shoulder, does not. Cut back to Zhao, who begins practicing with the sword he has removed from the wall.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: I didn't know you were skilled with broadswords, Prince Zuko.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: I'm not. They're antiques. Just decorative.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Have you heard of the Blue Spirit, General Iroh?

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Just rumors. I don't think he is real.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: He's real, all right. [He hands the broad sword to Iroh.] He's a criminal, and an enemy of the Fire Nation. But I have a feeling justice will catch up with him soon. [Zhao moves to exit the cabin.] General Iroh, the offer to join my mission still stands ... if you change your mind.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: The next morning, at the Northern Water Tribe.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: [Excitedly.] I've waited for this day my whole life. I finally get to learn from a real waterbending master!

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Pakku is bending a stream of water.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Good morning, Master Pakku!

title: The Waterbending Master
text: [Drops the water, and speaks in an annoyed tone.] No, please, march right in. I'm not concentrating or anything.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Uhhh ... This is my friend, Katara. The one I told you about?

title: The Waterbending Master
text: I'm sorry, I think there's been a misunderstanding. You didn't tell me your friend was a girl. In our tribe, it is forbidden for women to learn waterbending.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Cut to a shot panning up Katara's body, her face clearly reflecting the anger she feels.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: [Angrily.] What do you mean you won't teach me? I didn't travel across the entire world so you could tell me no!

title: The Waterbending Master
text: No.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: But there must be other female waterbenders in your tribe!

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Here, the women learn from Yugoda to use their waterbending to heal. I'm sure she would be happy to take you as her student, despite your bad attitude.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: I don't want to heal, I want to fight!

title: The Waterbending Master
text: I can see that. But our tribe has customs, rules.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: [Furious.] Well, your rules stink!

title: The Waterbending Master
text: [Also just as angry.] Yeah, they're not fair! If you won't teach Katara, then ...

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Then what?

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Then I won't learn from you!

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Well, have fun teaching yourself! I'm sure you'll do a great job.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Wait! Aang didn't mean that! [Goes to Aang.] You can't risk your training for me. You have to learn from Master Pakku, even if he is a big jerk.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Aang nods. Katara exits.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Why don't we get started, then? [Aang gets hit with a water blast from him.]

title: The Waterbending Master
text: In another part of the city. Sokka catches up with Princess Yue.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Princess Yue, good morning! How about that picnic last night? Boy, your dad sure does know how to throw a party.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: I'm happy you enjoyed yourself.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Well, it wasn't as much fun after you left. [They both blush.] So, I'm still hoping we can see more of each other.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Do an activity, you mean?

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Yes ... at a place ... for some time.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: [Laughs.] I'd love to. I'll meet you on that bridge tonight. [Points at a bridge.]

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Great! I'll see youâ Ah! [Falls into the water.]

title: The Waterbending Master
text: [Laughs.] Sorry.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: [Climbs out of the water.] That's okay, it was worth it. See you tonight.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Back at the Fire Navy base.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: I'm very impressed. You all seem highly qualified for the mission I have in mind.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: The pirate captain pulls a small chest toward him and opens it, a dim glow radiating from within. Pirate Barker Oh takes a piece of gold from the chest and bites down on it.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: That's some tasty gold.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: What do you need us to do?

title: The Waterbending Master
text: I believe you're acquainted with Prince Zuko.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Back to the Northern Water Tribe, where Katara enters the healing hut.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Uhhh ... Hi. Are you Yugoda?

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Are you here for the healing lesson?

title: The Waterbending Master
text: [Looks at all the young girls, and speaks in a disappointed tone.] I guess I am.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Welcome ... welcome!

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Back at Pakku's class. Aang is working with a stream of water.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: You're moving the water around, but you're not feeling the push and pull.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: I'm trying ...

title: The Waterbending Master
text: [Slurps some tea.] Maybe that move is too advanced for you. Why don't you try an easier one?

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Aang slams down the water in frustration. Back at the healing hut, Katara starts a conversation with Yugoda.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Thanks for the lesson.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: So, who's the lucky boy?

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Huh?

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Your betrothal necklace. You're getting married, right?

title: The Waterbending Master
text: [Shocked.] Ah ... No. I don't think I'm ready for that yet. My grandmother gave my mother this necklace and my mother passed it down to me.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: I recognize this carving! I don't know why I didn't realize sooner; you're the spitting image of Kanna!

title: The Waterbending Master
text: [Confused.] Wait, how do you know my Gran-Gran's name?

title: The Waterbending Master
text: When I was about your age, I was friends with Kanna. She was born here in the Northern Tribe.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: She never told me.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Your grandmother had an arranged marriage with a young waterbender. He carved that necklace for her.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: If Gran-Gran was engaged, why did she leave?

title: The Waterbending Master
text: I don't know. That's always been a mystery to me. She left without saying goodbye.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Later that night, at Zuko's ship.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Good luck!

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Inside Zuko's room.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: [Cut to a shot of Prince Zuko lying in bed in the foreground of his cabin. The door opens and Iroh sticks his head in. Entering.] The crew wanted me to wish you safe travels.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: [Bitterly.] Good riddance to those traitors.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: It's a lovely night for a walk. Why don't you join me? It would clear your head. [No response.] Or just stay in your room and sit in the dark. Whatever makes you happy.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: The pirates make their way onto Zuko's ship, bringing up blasting jelly.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Careful with the blasting jelly!

title: The Waterbending Master
text: [Hearing the noise.] Uncle? Uncle, is that you? [Walks around the ship.]

title: The Waterbending Master
text: The fuse to the blasting jelly is lit. The ship explodes.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Zuko! [Runs back to see the ship destroyed.] Zuko ...

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Back to the North Pole. Sokka goes to meet Yue, who is looking out over the bridge.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Hi, Princess Yue. I made you something. I carved it myself.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Shows her a roughly-crafted creature.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: It's a bear.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Actually, it's supposed to be a fish. [Flips the carved creature around.] See, it has a fin.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Oh. I'm sorry, I made a mistake. I shouldn't have asked you to come here. [Runs away.]

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Sokka is left stunned. He throws the fish into the water. Cut to the team's place of stay.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: How's warrior training going? [Sokka kicks his bag.]

title: The Waterbending Master
text: That bad?

title: The Waterbending Master
text: No, it's Princess Yue. I don't get it, one minute she wants to go out with me, and the next, she's telling me to get lost. [Changing the topic.] So, how's waterbending training?

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Master Poophead won't teach her because she's a girl.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Why don't you just teach her, Aang?

title: The Waterbending Master
text: [Excited.] Why didn't I think of that? At night, you can teach me whatever moves you learn from Master Pakku! That way, you have someone to practice with, and I get to learn waterbending! Everyone's happy!

title: The Waterbending Master
text: I'm not happy.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: But you're never happy. Come on, Aang.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Outside, near the water.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: [Bending up some water.] Master Pakku said this move is all about sinking and floating. [Sends the water to her.]

title: The Waterbending Master
text: [Bending the water.] I got it!

title: The Waterbending Master
text: The water suddenly shoots upward.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: That was amazing!

title: The Waterbending Master
text: That wasn't me.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Master Pakku has caught them. He takes the water, freezes it, and sticks the ice crystals into the ground.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: I was just showing Katara a few moves.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: You have disrespected me, my teachings, and my entire culture.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: I'm sorry, I ...

title: The Waterbending Master
text: You are no longer welcome as my student.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: The next morning, the three meet with Chief Arnook, Master Pakku, and Arnook's family members.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: What do you want me to do? Force Master Pakku to take Aang back as his student?

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Yes ... please!

title: The Waterbending Master
text: I suspect he might change his mind, if you swallow your pride and apologize to him.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Fine.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: I'm waiting, little girl.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: No. [Begins cracking the ice inadvertently.] No way am I apologizing to a sour old man like you! [Two pots shatter.]

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Uhhh ... Katara?

title: The Waterbending Master
text: I'll be outside if you're man enough to fight me.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Yue gasps. Katara angrily walks out.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: I'm sure she didn't mean that.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Yeah, I think she did.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Back at the Fire Navy base. Zhao meets with Iroh over tea.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: I'm devastated to hear about Prince Zuko. Just ... devastated.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: The Fire Lord will not be pleased when he learns who was responsible.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: You know who was behind the attack?

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Yes ... pirates. We had a run-in with them a while back. They wanted revenge.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: [Sips his tea.] So, have you reconsidered my offer?

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Yes, I accept. It will be an honor to serve as your general. To the Fire Nation!

title: The Waterbending Master
text: To victory!

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Back to the Northern Tribe. The three head outside, looking for Pakku.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Are you crazy, Katara? You're not going to win this fight!

title: The Waterbending Master
text: [Takes off her coat.] I know! I don't care!

title: The Waterbending Master
text: You don't have to do this for me. I can find another teacher.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: I'm not doing it for you! Someone needs to slap some sense into that guy! [Pakku comes down.] So, you decided to show up? [Pakku walks away.] Aren't you going to fight?

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Go back to the healing huts with the other women where you belong. [Katara tightens her fist and sends water whips at him. Pakku halts.] Fine. You want to learn to fight so bad? Study closely! [He bends two streams of water from nearby pools and sends them both at a charging Katara, who falls back. He joins the two streams together, encircling both Katara and himself in a forceful ring of water.] Don't worry, I'm not going to hurt you!

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Katara edges away from the ring and redirects the water away. The resulting blast hits Sokka. Pakku builds an ice wall in defense, which Katara slides up. She lands onto a nearby post. He melts the ice and directs the full blast at her. However, Katara freezes her feet down and is able to direct the blast away.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: [Determined.] You can't knock me down!

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Some of the crowd cheers.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Go, Katara!

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Katara charges at him; Pakku draws up a wall of ice, which she quickly liquefies. She attempts to land blows, but Pakku ducks them all. He whips water and throws her into a pool, earning the approval of other members of the crowd.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Well, I'm impressed. You are an excellent waterbender.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: But you still won't teach me, will you?

title: The Waterbending Master
text: No.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Katara bends over sharply, sending a wave of ice at Pakku, who merely raises himself onto an ice pillar. He proceeds to liquefy the pillar, charging straight at Katara, who sends a powerful stream of water his way. Pakku avoids the attack, instead managing to freeze Katara's stream of water which he slides across. He surges past her and strikes her down, knocking her necklace off in the process. Katara falls roughly to the ground as Pakku lands onto the rim of a pool, bends a tower of water and manipulates the stream overhead his opponent. He deftly freezes the water into several ice shards, which he sends down at Katara. She becomes trapped in the flurry of frozen daggers and appears still for a moment. The crowd gasps in horror; one child looks away in fear. Katara lifts her head and begins to struggle, attempting to break free as Pakku casually strolls away.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: This fight is over.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Come back here. I'm not finished yet!

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Yes, you are. [Notices the necklace.] This is my necklace ...

title: The Waterbending Master
text: No, it's not. It's mine! Give it back!

title: The Waterbending Master
text: I made this sixty years ago for the love of my life ... for Kanna.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: [Unfreezing the ice; surprised.] My Gran-Gran was supposed to marry you?

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Back at the Fire Navy base. The ships are set to begin the trek north. On board, Iroh meets up with Zuko, who is disguised as a shipman.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Our plan is working perfectly. Zhao doesn't suspect a thing.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: You didn't have to do this.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: No nephew of mine is going to stow away on a ship without some backup.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Thank you, Uncle.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: A door opens.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Someone's coming. Stay hidden until we get to the North Pole and the Avatar will be yours. Good luck. [The two head their separate ways.]

title: The Waterbending Master
text: The scene changes back to the North Pole.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: I carved this necklace for your grandmother when we got engaged. I thought we would have a long, happy life together. I loved her.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: But she didn't love you, did she? It was an arranged marriage. Gran-Gran wouldn't let your tribe's stupid customs run her life. That's why she left. It must have taken a lot of courage.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Yue cries and runs away.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: [To Sokka.] Go get her.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Sokka exits. Later that night, he catches up with her on the bridge.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: What do you want from me?

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Nothing. I just want you to know, I think you're beautiful, and, I never thought a girl like you would even notice a guy like me.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: You don't understand.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: No, no. See, that's the thing. I think I do understand now. You're a Princess, and I'm ... I'm just a Southern peasant.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: No, Sokka ...

title: The Waterbending Master
text: It's okay. You don't have to say anything. I'll see you around, okay? [Yue grabs him and kisses him.] Okay, now I'm really confused. Happy, but confused.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: I do like you, a lot. But we can't be together, and not for the reason you think. It's because ... I'm engaged. [She pulls down the collar of her coat and shows him her betrothal necklace.] I'm sorry. [Runs off.]

title: The Waterbending Master
text: The next morning, at Pakku's class. Aang turns a blob of water into a stream and awkwardly sends it off.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Not bad, not bad. [Laughs.] Keep practicing and maybe you'll get it by the time you're my age.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Aang turns around, annoyed, but quickly smiles when he notices Katara coming up.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Hey, Katara!

title: The Waterbending Master
text: What do you think you're doing? [Pause as Katara looks up.] It's past sunrise. You're late.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Good to see you here.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: You, too.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Back at the Fire Navy fleet. Zhao and Iroh stand on top of the lead ship.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: My fleet is ready. Set a course for the Northern Water Tribe.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Cut to a panning overhead shot, which reveals dozens of Fire Navy ships firing up their engines in preparation to launch the final assault on the Northern Water Tribe.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Fade to white, followed by credits.

title: The Waterbending Master
text: Aang

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: The episode opens to under the water. The camera pans upward to sea level, and higher up into the city. The scene changes to where Katara is set to spar with a young boy named Sangok. She eyes her opponent with a look of determination. Sangok looks at her with a frightened expression on his face, shaking slightly. He summons a globule of water, freezes it into an iceball, and fires it at her. Katara, however, is quick to melt the iceball and, turning around swiftly, bends a wave of water at him, which she proceeds to freeze, thus suspending Sangok in an icy trap.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Displeased.] Nice try, Pupil Sangok. [Shows Sangok trying to break free.] A couple of more years and you might be ready to fight a sea sponge. [He unfreezes the ice; Sangok falls to the ground dazed.] Would anyone care for a rematch with Katara? [The scene cuts to several students sitting by the sidelines, the camera panning to the right showing all of them to be tired and unamused.] Katara, you've advanced more quickly than any student I've ever trained. [Cuts to a shot of Katara, who smiles brightly.] You have proven that with fierce determination, passion and hard work, you can accomplish anything. [Turns to Aang irritably.] Raw talent alone is not enough. [Cut to Aang who is lying on the ground with a lazy smile, floating Momo around on an airball above him.] Pupil Aang!

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Stops bending at the sound of his name; Momo lands on his head.] Yes, Master Pakku?

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Sarcastically.] Care to step into the sparring circle? I figure since you've found time to play with house pets, you must have already mastered waterbending.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Jumps off the ground with airbending.] I wouldn't say mastered, but check this out.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: He twists around, bending some snow around him to make a snowman of himself, which Momo knocks over. Cut to Pakku and Katara who wear similar expressions of disdain. Pakku shakes his head in disappointment, while Katara looks on in irritation. The scene changes to another part of the city where Sokka and Yue are taking a walk along a bridge. Sokka is walking along the top of bridge's wall while balancing.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: So they don't have palaces in the Southern Tribe?

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Sitting down on the ledge.] Are you kidding? I grew up in a block of ice. It's not exactly a cultural hub.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Laughs and places her hand on Sokka's shoulder; when Sokka smiles at her, she gets a little upset and looks at him seriously.] Sokka, this is wrong.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Protesting.] What's wrong? We're taking a walk!

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Unsurely.] I'm engaged. It just feels ...

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Brightens.] I know what you need. [He hops off the rail to stand by her side.] You need to meet my good friend, Appa.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Curiously.] Who?

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: The scene changes to where the two approach the stables, where Appa is resting.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Opening his arms out in enthusiasm.] Appa and I go way back, don't we, boy? [The thunder of Appa's shifting bulk is heard and Sokka's features turn to surprise. Appa enters from the left and lands on top of him and licks him, much to Sokka's dismay.] Ah, ah, easy! Down boy! Agh! No, up!

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: Looks like you haven't been giving Appa enough attention!

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: Yue laughs. Sokka attempts to pull himself free of Appa, who continues to lick his face. The scene changes to the two sitting on Appa's saddle, Sokka holding the reins in his hand.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Excitedly.] So, how does this work?

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: You holding on tight? [Yue nods; in a cool tone.] Yip ... [Cut to a close up of Sokka's face.] yip.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: The camera zooms out to a shot of the entire city as Appa takes off.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Impressed.] Oh ... my ... goodness! [Cuts to where Appa is soaring over the ocean; Yue is looking over the saddle.] Wow, I can't believe you do this every day.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Stretches.] Yeah, we pretty much live up here.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: Is it always this cold in the sky? [Moves closer to Sokka.]

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Happily.] Not when you're with someone.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Turning to face Sokka, blushing.] It's beautiful up here.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: Yeah ... [The two turn to each other and slowly begin to lean in, but at the very last moment, Sokka widens his eyes, turns away and pretends to act cool again.] Woo, yeah! Ahhh, good times, good times. [Snow and black soot start to fall from the sky.] Hey, look!

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Camera zooms out to Appa flying through the gray snowfall; worried.] What's happening?

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Nervous.] Oh no ...

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: The scene cuts to where civilians have stopped to observe the sooty snow. Cuts to Aang, who laughs as he gleefully rolls around in the snow in a circular pattern. Cuts to Momo, who opens his mouth and catches a sooty snowflake only to bristle and spit out the contents. Aang stops playing around and looks up at the snowfall with a concerned face. Cuts to civilians standing near a fountain. Camera pans down to show the fountain's water turning black.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Picking up handful of black snow.] Soot.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: What?

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: Scene reveals Sokka, Yue, and Appa having landed right outside the outskirts of the city, near the shores of the North Pole seas. Sokka is kneeling down, observing the snow.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: I've seen this before, right before my village was attacked. It's soot mixed with snow. [Rises.]

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: But, why?

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Looking out over the horizon.] It's the Fire Nation. [Looks at Yue concerned.] They've closed in on the North Pole and from the looks of this stuff, [Camera zooms out to show the enormity of the sooty snowfall.] I'd say there's a lot of them.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: Cuts to the lead ship sailing toward the Water Tribe, under the command of Admiral Zhao and Iroh.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Voice-over.] This will truly be one for the history books, General Iroh. [Cuts to Zhao and Iroh standing on deck.] Just think, centuries from now, people will study the great Admiral Zhao, who destroyed the last of the Water Tribe civilization. You're lucky you're here to see it.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Tersely.] Be careful what you wish for, Admiral. History is not always kind to its subjects.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: I suppose you speak from experience, but rest assured. This will be nothing like your legendary failure at Ba Sing Se. [Walks forward.]

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Sadly.] I hope not, for your sake.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: Tell the captains to prepare for first strike.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: Iroh walks away. Cuts to the bow of the lead ship breaking through thick ice floes floating in the water. Cuts to the interior of the ship, where Iroh is confronting Zuko disguised as a Fire Nation soldier. Zuko is forced to wear the disguise to keep the secret from Zhao that he survived an attempted assassination.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Secretly.] We'll be landing soon. Do you have a plan?

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Removes face covering to reveal his face covered in cuts.] I'm working on it, Uncle. [Puts covering back in place.]

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: The two head off in separate directions. Back at the Northern Water Tribe, citizens flee to the town hall, as two watchmen hit a drum to signal the Fire Nation's approach. Sokka and Yue make their way up the steps, but Yue stops the approach.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Trying to drag her along.] What's wrong? [Pointing up to the citadel.] We have to go!

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Sadly; lets go of Sokka's hand.] No, Sokka, wait, I can't see you anymore. Not at all.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Protesting.] What? We're just friends.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: I wish we could just be friends, but I like you too much and it's too confusing to be around you. I'm marrying someone else! [Turns away sorrowfully.]

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: You don't love him, do you? You don't even seem to like him.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: But I do love my people.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Objecting.] You're not marrying them.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Turns to face Sokka.] You don't understand. I have duties to my father, to my tribe. I have to do this. Goodbye.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: She runs past Sokka up the stairs quickly. Closes up on Sokka, who looks on with dismay. The scene cuts to inside the chief's Royal Palace.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: The day we have feared for so long has arrived. The Fire Nation is on our doorstep. It is with great sadness I call my family here before me, knowing well that some of these faces are about to vanish from our tribe, [While saying this line, the scene flashes from Yue to Pakku to Hahn.] but they will never vanish from our hearts. Now, as we approach the battle for our existence, I call upon the great spirits. Spirit of the Ocean! Spirit of the Moon! Be with us! I'm going to need volunteers for a dangerous mission.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Rising from his seat.] Count me in!

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: Sokka ...

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: Be warned, many of you will not return. [Several Water Tribe men rise and walk forward.] Come forward to receive my mark, if you accept the task.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: Arnook paints three red line marks with his fingers on one man's forehead. The man walks away, slightly sorrowful. Sokka steps forward and Arnook paints the same three marks. He begins walking away sadly and turns to look at Yue. After staring at each other for a few moments, Sokka continues walking. Yue averts her gaze, closes her eyes and begins crying.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: The stillness before battle is unbearable. Such a quiet dread.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: Katara joins them.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: I wasn't there when the Fire Nation attacked my people. [Determined.] I'm going to make a difference this time.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: He rises and holds his staff behind his back in a similar pose as seen in the opening sequence. The camera pans upward to the sky. The scene changes to where Aang, Katara, Sokka, Appa and all the warriors are gathered at the wall. Something distant can be seen soaring toward the city from the horizon. Aang squints his eyes before realizing the object is a fireball. Cuts to Sokka and Katara, who look on in terror. The fireball collides into the wall of the city, sending Team Avatar and several warriors flying back. Cuts to the wall of the city, damaged and beginning to fall apart.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: Yip-yip!

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: He and Appa take flight, heading toward the fleet. Cuts to the warriors who regather themselves, helping each other up.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Pulls his arm free from the snow.] Katara!

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: Katara uses waterbending to free herself from a snow mound she became buried underneath. Sokka smiles and hoists his sister onto her feet. The two cast their eyes upward, catching sight of two fireballs that soar overhead. Cuts to Appa who grunts, Aang guiding him, a determined look on his face. Cuts to bird's-eyes view of the ocean, Aang flying toward a single Fire Navy ship. Two fireballs are launched. Cuts to the deck of the ship, where trebuchet operators launch another fireball back to Appa and Aang. Cuts to fireball soaring straight toward Aang, who uses his glider to direct it into an icy cliff side near the city.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: I'll take it from here, boy.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: He jumps down from Appa and flies downward on his glider onto the first ship. Using airbending, he sweeps several trebuchet operators off their feet and leaps onto one trebuchet. An operator comes forward and slams a sledgehammer onto the machine, nearly striking Aang who manages to back-flip away. Cuts to where he stands on top of the contraption, two more operators approaching him from opposite directions, each holding a sledgehammer. The one on his right brings the sledgehammer down proceeded by the one on his left. He jumps into the air, avoiding both blows and completely collapses the trebuchet with his glider and the use of airbending. He lands onto the deck, triumphant.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Brightening.] Appa!

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: Appa leans over the deck of the ship and tosses the man overboard before turning to Aang, who runs over and embraces him.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: Thanks for the rescue, buddy!

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: His expression of relief becomes one of alarm when the ship begins to rumble. Cuts to an undamaged trebuchet that collapses when a gigantic spike of ice pierces straight through the hull and deck of the ship. Cuts to dozens of Water Tribe warriors riding on boats, who are using waterbending to suspend the ship. Cuts to the entire ship being uprooted. Cuts to Appa, who stands on the sloping deck, the ruins of machinery sliding downward past them. He and Aang take off. Cuts to the horizon, where an entire fleet comes into view, the ships large in quantity.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Shocked.] You've got to be kidding me ...

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: The scene cuts to the training for the mission.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: Men, you'll be infiltrating the Fire Nation Navy. That means you'll all need one of these uniforms.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: The camera pans upward, revealing a young man, Hahn, who appears in the uniform that will be used. Sokka laughs. The rest of the warriors turn to stare at him.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Angrily.] What's your problem?

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: Fire Navy uniforms don't look like that.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Irritably.] Of course they do. These are real uniforms captured from actual Fire Navy soldiers.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Sarcastically.] When, like, a hundred years ago?

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: Eighty-five.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Walks over and flings one of the shoulder spikes with his finger.] The Fire Nation doesn't wear shoulder spikes anymore. The newer uniforms are more streamlined.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: Sokka bends the tip of one of the shoulder spikes back with the tip of his finger and lets go. It bounces back to its original shape with a little comic sound effect.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: How do we know we can trust this guy? [Turns to growl at Sokka, who glares at him in return.] Such bold talk for a new recruit.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: Sokka is from our sister tribe, Hahn. He's a capable warrior and I value his input. [Sokka shoots Hahn a smug look; Arnook turns to the rest of the regiment.] Now, our first objective is to determine the identity of their commanding officer.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: His name is Zhao. Middle-aged, [Tracing imaginary sideburns with his fingers.] big sideburns, bigger temper ...

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: Sokka, I want you to tell everything you know to Hahn. He's leading this mission. Hahn, show Sokka your respect. [Beginning to walk away.] I expect nothing less from my future son-in-law.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Stares at Hahn, mouth agape; points at him and narrows his eyes.] Princess Yue's marrying you?

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Irritated.] Yeah, what of it?

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Turns away from Hahn, upset.] Nothing. Congratulations.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: Scene fades to sunset where fireballs are continually launched. A bird's-eye view is shown of the fleet attacking the city. Cuts to several fireballs; camera pans downward to show them hitting the city.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Pointing to the sky.] Stop those fireballs!

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: Cuts to shot of oncoming fireball. The waterbenders bend up a column of water and freeze it, capturing the fireball. Cuts to side-view of the leading ships of the fleet, the uprooted ship in view. The scene cuts to the interior of Zhao's ship.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: It's almost twilight, Admiral. As your military consultant, I must advise you to halt your attack. [Cuts to shot of the ship, sailing past a rising moon.] The waterbenders draw their power from the moon, and it is nearly full tonight. You should wait and resume the attack at daybreak. [Cuts back to Iroh and Zhao.]

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: Oh, I'm well aware of the moon problem and I am working on a solution. But for now, daybreak it is.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: The lead ship drops its anchor, followed by the rest of the ships, who drop their anchors and cease the attack. Cuts to a shot of the city, smoke billowing from several spots. Yue can be seen looking out over the horizon.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: They've stopped firing.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: Yue and Katara stand side by side, viewing the city. Appa appears over the horizon, flying toward them.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: Aang!

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: Aang lands on the ground, exasperated. Katara and Yue approach him.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Clearly exhausted, placing his hands on his head.] I can't do it ... I can't do it.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: What happened?

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Dimly.] I must have taken out a dozen Fire Navy ships, but there's just too many of them. I can't fight them all.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Pleadingly.] But, you have to. You're the Avatar.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Solemnly.] I'm just one kid.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: He buries his face in his arms. Katara kneels down beside him in an attempt to comfort him. The scene changes to nightfall on the lead ship. Cuts inside a room where Zuko prepares a boat, winding up some rope. Iroh enters.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: If you're fishing for an octopus my nephew, you need a tightly woven net, or he will squeeze through the tiniest hole and escape.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: I don't need your wisdom right now, Uncle.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: I'm sorry. I just nag you, because ... well, [Voice breaking slightly.] ever since I lost my son ...

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: Uncle, you don't have to say it.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: ... I think of you as my own.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Faces his uncle, a softer expression on his face.] I know, Uncle. We'll meet again. [Iroh hugs him.] After I have the Avatar. [He turns away and gets on the boat.]

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: Remember your breath of fire. It could save your life out there.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: I will. [Lowers the boat, suspended by ropes, down the side of the ship into the water.]

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: And put your hood up. Keep your ears warm!

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: I'll be fine!

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: The shot cuts to the city, several ships lying stationery ahead of him. Back inside the warriors' base. Hahn and Sokka sharpen their axes against grindstones.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Smugly.] Let me tell you Sokka, I've courted a lot of girls, but Yue is the finest and she comes with the most perks.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Annoyed.] Perks? What does that mean?

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: I mean, Yue's nice and everything, but the points I'll gain with the chief aren't bad either.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Angered.] Princess Yue is wasted on a self-absorbed weasel like you!

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Camera begins closing up on Hahn.] Whoa, hang on. What do you care? [Sokka closes his eyes sorrowfully.] You're just a simple rube from the Southern Tribe. What would you know of the political complexities of our life? [Smirking.] No offense.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Shouts and tackles Hahn; the two begin rolling around on the floor in a struggle.] You're just a jerk without a soul, no offense!

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: The two continue to roll about on the floor. Cuts to a shot of Sokka and Hahn, each pulling the other's ponytail in fury. They are suddenly separated by Arnook.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: That's enough! Sokka, you're off the mission!

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: Sokka, his hair loose and hanging in locks, appears stunned before crossing his arms in anger.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: All right, fall in men! Everybody listen to what I say and we'll take out this Admiral ChÅ in no time!

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Irritated, waves arms in gesture.] It's Admiral Zhao!

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: The scene changes to outside on the water where Zuko rows past, navigating his way through the path of ice spikes. Cuts to a view of a Water Tribe guard on patrol, pausing and looking out over the horizon just as Zuko's canoe disappears behind an ice spike. The guard continues walking. Cuts back to Zuko who continues to paddle toward the wall, before switching to a shot of him peering from behind an ice spike, his canoe pulled up onto the ice. Camera cuts to and zooms in on a shot of several Water Tribe guards marching atop the wall. Zuko turns around and sees a group of turtle seals resting by a hole in the ice. One seal plunges head first into the icy water. Zuko looks back up to the wall and begins approaching the hole.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Peering down into the hole.] Where are they going? [Cuts to a shot of the hole, his face reflected in the water.] They're coming up for air somewhere.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: He pulls down the mask covering his mouth and nose and inhales deeply. Cuts to shot of Zuko from beneath the water; he plunges into the water. The scene changes, cutting to a shot of the waxing gibbous moon hanging in the sky.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Off camera.] The legends say the moon was the first waterbender. [Cuts to shot of her, Katara and Aang standing on a balcony, looking up at the sky.] Our ancestors saw how it pushed and pulled the tides and learned how to do it themselves.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: I've always noticed my waterbending is stronger at night.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: Our strength comes from the spirit of the moon. Our life comes from the spirit of the ocean. [Camera pans slightly downward, showing Aang with a dull expression on his face.] They work together to keep balance.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Brightening.] The spirits! [Raises head, startling Momo.] Maybe I can find them and get their help!

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: How can you do that?

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Approaching her.] The Avatar is the bridge between our world and the Spirit World! Aang can talk to them!

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [To Aang.] Maybe they'll give you the wisdom to win this battle!

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Waves arms out in gesture.] Or maybe they'll unleash a crazy amazing spirit attack on the Fire Nation! [The two girls look at him oddly; Aang looks at them and straightens up.] Or wisdom. That's good, too.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: The only problem is, last time you got to the Spirit World by accident. How are you going to get there this time?

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: I have an idea. Follow me.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: She begins walking away. Cuts to a shot of the chief's Royal Palace, the camera panning downward to the ground where Yue walks by, followed by Aang and Katara. Cuts to shot of Yue standing by a small, round wooden door, Aang approaching close behind.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Walking up to the door.] So, is this the way to the Spirit World?

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Laughs.] No. You'll have to get there on your own. [Leans inward.] But I can take you to the most spiritual place in the entire North Pole. [Opens the door.]

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: Aang steps inside. The camera pans upward and zooms in to reveal a small verdant oasis lying ahead, a waterfall flowing directly behind it. Zooms in on Aang, who gasps in amazement.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Runs to the back of the oasis and rolls around on the ground.] I never thought I'd miss grass this much!

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Approaching the oasis.] It's so warm here! How is that possible?

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: It's the center of all spiritual energy in our land.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: The two girls remove their coats. Cuts to view of two fish, one black and one white, swimming about in the pond. Momo sticks his hand in the pond and tries to grab the two fish in the water. Cuts to shot of the two girls standing over him, looking rather irritated.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: You're right, Yue. I can feel ... something. It's so tranquil. [Positions himself to meditate.]

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: Meanwhile, Zuko emerges from the water through another hole in the ice. He lies on his back on the ice and catches his breath. He rolls over onto his side, begins shivering and breathes fire to warm himself.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [To the barking turtle seals.] Be quiet!

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: The pack of seals quiets down. Cuts to shot of several seals, who watch as Zuko walks past, pushing aside the heads of two of them. They resume barking. He makes his way through another opening where water is pouring out. Cuts to shot of his foot boring into the wall as he tries to steady himself and make his way through the channel of water. Cuts to inside the channel, where he slowly crawls his way through. Cut back to the warriors' base. Sokka is crouched on the floor, sharpening his boomerang when he is approached.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: Is something wrong, Sokka?

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Sarcastically.] Oh, no. Hahn's out there on the top-secret mission while I'm here sharpening my boomerang. Everything's fine.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: Listen to me. I took you off the mission for selfish reasons. I have a special task in mind for you.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: What, you want me to scrub the barracks?

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: I want you to guard my daughter, Princess Yue.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Rises and tries to act cool.] Oh ... Sure. That ... shouldn't be too hard.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: Arnook exits the scene; Sokka's face falls. Zuko continues to make his way through the channel of water. He exits from the channel and floats to the surface of the water. He emerges from the surface and inhales deeply several times. He proceeds to duck his head under the water, surveying the area. The camera zooms in on another channel. Zuko swims toward the channel and upward. As he attempts to resurface, however, the surface of the water had frozen into a thick ice patch. Zuko tries to break through the ice. He suddenly exhales, signaling his need for air. He heats his hands using firebending and melts a hole in the ice. Cuts to a tunnel way in the city, the ice steaming and finally melting away. Zuko emerges and catches his breath. He relaxes against the wall of the tunnel. The scene changes back to the Spirit Oasis, where Aang is meditating, Katara and Yue watching him.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: Why is he sitting like that?

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: He's meditating, trying to cross over into the Spirit World. [Aang scrunches up his face in concentration.] It takes all his concentration.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: Is there any way we can help?

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Angrily.] How about some quiet? Come on guys, I can hear every word you're saying!

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: The camera zooms in on the pond, where the two koi fish are shown circling each other. Cuts to shot of beneath the pond, showing an underside-view of the two fish. Cuts to shot of Aang staring at the fish, seemingly mesmerized. Cuts back to two fish circling each other before switching back to Aang. Cuts back to image of the two fish, which morphs into an image of the symbols for yin and yang. Cuts back to Aang, as his eyes and tattoos to light up.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Worried.] Is he okay?

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: He's crossing into the Spirit World. He'll be fine as long as we don't move his body. [Cuts to overhead shot of the pond.] That's his way back to the physical world.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: Maybe we should get some help.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Smiling.] No, he's my friend. I'm perfectly capable of protecting him.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Sarcastically.] Well, aren't you a big girl now.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Alarmed and dismayed.] No ...

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Determined.] Yes. Hand him over and I won't have to hurt you.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: Yue runs from the scene as Katara assumes a defensive stance, Zuko appearing on screen. Cuts to Zuko, who kicks up his leg, sending a fire blast Katara's way. He fires more blasts from his hands. Cuts to shot of Zuko and Katara, Zuko continually firing as Katara conjures up water shields to deflect the attacks. Cuts to Katara, who draws water from the pond and sends the stream at Zuko, who is preparing another attack. The blast pushes Zuko back several feet and knocks him to the ground.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Rising.] I see you've learned a new trick, but I didn't come this far to lose to you.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: He turns around and fires another blast which Katara blocks by summoning another shield of water. Cuts to shot of Zuko, Katara, and Aang as Katara sends a powerful jet of water at her opponent. The jet collides into Zuko, who is sent farther back. As he attempts to steady himself from the impact, small juts of ice form around his feet. Cuts to close-up of Katara, a determined look on her face. Water begins rising around Zuko and encircling him. Katara waves her arms about wildly, forming a ball of water around him which she freezes solid. Cuts to close-up of her as she smiles triumphantly. Cuts to Zuko imprisoned in the ice.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: You little peasant. You've found a master, haven't you?

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: The globule of ice begins glowing bright orange with heat and the ground rumbles. Cuts to view of entire globule as it heats up intensely before melting. He fires repeated attacks at Katara, who draws water from the oasis to deflect the attacks. She prepares to strike him with a water blast, however, Zuko manages to slip away and head toward Aang. Just as his fingers grasp Aang's collar, Katara fires a water blast, throwing Zuko to the other wall. She whips up a large wave and sends the attack at Zuko. The rush of water sends Zuko up the side of the cliff; she freezes the water, encasing him in ice. Cuts to Pakku who looks over the horizon in the city as the sun rises. The scene cuts to Zhao's ship.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
