text: It's daybreak at last. Let's write history.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: Back to the Spirit Oasis, rays of sunlight beam down on Zuko, who remains imprisoned in the ice, his head bent down. He feels the heat and sharply raises his head. With a determined look on his face, he breathes steam from his nose, melting the ice quickly. He lands on the ground and fires a blast at Katara, who had her back turned to him at that moment. She turns around swiftly and attempts to deflect the blast by conjuring a water shield; however, she creates the shield too late. The blast sends her slamming into the gate to the Spirit World, knocking her out. Smoke from the impact fills the screen. Cuts to shot of Zuko standing over her, holding Aang by the collar.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: You rise with the moon ... I rise with the sun.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: The scene changes to where Fire Navy ships break through the city wall, their bows crumbling the wall, allowing soldiers armed with spears to rush in.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: The Water Tribe can try to resist the inevitable, but their city will fall today.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: Cuts back to the oasis. Camera focuses on a close-up of Katara, whose eyes suddenly snap open as she regains consciousness, only to realize Aang is gone. She crawls around, desperately searching for him.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: Aang!

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: Sokka and Yue enter on Appa.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: What happened? Where's Zuko?

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Dismayed.] He took Aang. He took him right out from under me.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: Cuts to shot of Momo looking sorrowfully from the edge of the pond.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: [Off-camera.] Where did they go ...

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: The camera pans upward to above the oasis where Zuko is seen walking through a blizzard with Aang in tow. Cuts to shot of them walking away. The camera pans upward to show the snow falling.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: Fades to credits.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
text: Aang

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: The episode opens to the Northern Water Tribe as the siege continues. Four fireballs streak past the screen. Cuts to overhead shot of the city as the fireballs strike various locations. The camera pans downward past the Tribal Chief's palace to the Spirit Oasis where Appa can be seen presiding by the pond. Cuts to shot of the two koi fish, the Moon and Ocean Spirits, swimming in their usual circular pattern.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: [Off-screen; sorrowfully.] I can't believe I lost him.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Cut to full shot of the pond, Sokka and Yue standing beside Katara, who is kneeling on the ground.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: You did everything you could, and now we need to do everything we can to get him back. [Cuts to shot of Katara who looks up at her brother, tears in her eyes.] Zuko can't have gotten far. We'll find him. Aang's gonna be fine.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Okay. [Closes eyes and gets up. Camera pans over to where Momo remains motionless on the ground. Cuts to shot of Appa, Katara having mounted the bison.] It's all right. You stay here, Momo, in case Aang comes back.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Yip, yip.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: The camera pans upward as Appa takes off, heading upward to a location above the oasis, a vast frozen tundra where a blizzard is raging. Cuts to shot of the icy terrain of the tundra as the bison progresses. Cuts to shot of the ground, a path visible in the snow where someone has clearly been trudging along; the camera pans upward. Cuts to shot of Zuko plodding through the snow, his face partially covered to protect him from the cold, Aang slung across his back. Cuts to shot of an unconscious Aang, his tattooed arrows glowing.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Hello? I'm sorry to disturb you. I just really need to find the Moon and the Ocean Spirits.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: [Cut to a frontal shot of the baboon spirit.] Go. Away. [Opens one eye. Cut back to the side-shot.] You're still here?

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Yes, I need -

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: [Cut to close-up of the baboon spirit who shuts his eyes tightly. Louder, trying to distract himself.] Ohm! [A firefly flies past; points at the insect.] Perhaps that thing will help you. Chase it. [Aang runs after it. The mystical monkey keeps his eyes shut for a second more before opening one to confirm Aang's departure. He shakes his head and breathes a sigh of relief.] Finally.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Cuts to a shot of Aang chasing the insect throughout the swamp and up a tree. He leaps up and manages to grasp hold of it and is delighted in doing so. Cuts to zoomed out shot of him as he lands on a tree branch which instantly shrivels up and disappears entirely, causing him to fall. Cuts briefly to close-up shot of an alarmed Aang before switching to a shot of him falling into the water. Aang is shown lying on his back in the water, the firefly having escaped his grip. It flies away as he tries to reach it again.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Come back!

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: He stands up. Cuts to shot of him looking down at the water, when Roku suddenly appears before Aang in a reflection in the water.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Hello, Aang.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: [Looking at him; surprised.] Roku!

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: The scene cuts back to the real world, where Zuko continues his trek through the icy tundra. Cuts to close-up of him before a shot of the ground where he steps on ice that begins cracking beneath his feet; his eyes widen in surprise at this. Cuts to overhead shot of him, the camera zooming out, as the ice begins to splinter and cave in. Cuts to shot of him on high alert as he begins running, before switching to an overhead shot of him as he races through the snow. Cuts to shot of him as the impact of the ice caving in throws him off-balance.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Shelter. [Drags Aang into the cave and ties him up.]

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Back in the Spirit World, Aang is speaking with Roku.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Roku, the Water Tribe's under attack. I need to find the Ocean and the Moon Spirits.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: [Pops out of the reflection in front of Aang.] The Ocean and the Moon are ancient spirits. They crossed over the Spirit World to the mortal world very near the beginning. There is only one spirit I know of who is old enough to remember.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Who?

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: The spirit's name is Koh, but he is very dangerous. They call him the Face Stealer. [Aang looks horrified.] When you speak with him, you must be very careful to show no emotion at all. Not the slightest expression, or he will steal your face. [Aang looks even more horrified but calmly nods, understanding the situation.]

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Meanwhile, in the real world, Katara, Sokka, and Yue arrive to where the ice broke earlier. In the cave, Zuko is keeping warm with Breath of Fire while Aang, now tied up, remains in the Spirit World.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: I finally have you, but I can't get you home because of this blizzard. [Stands up and looks outside the cave.] There's always something. Not that you would understand. You're like my sister. Everything always came easy to her. She's a firebending prodigy, and everyone adores her. My father says she was born lucky. He says I was lucky to be born. I don't need luck, though. I don't want it. I've always had to struggle and fight and that's made me strong. It's made me who I am.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Meanwhile, back at the invasion, the Fire Nation has breached part of the wall. On the lead ship, Zhao and Iroh are speaking.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: I don't need to remind you we have a time limit. If we don't defeat the Water Tribe before the full moon rises, they will be undefeatable.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: I assure you I have everything under control. I intend to remove the moon as a factor.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: [Shocked.] Remove the moon? How?

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Hahn appears behind them and points his spear at Zhao.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Admiral Choi! Prepare to meet your fate!

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: He charges at Zhao, who casually tosses him overboard as he is still screaming. A loud splash is heard, while Iroh shakes his head in disappointment.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: [Continuing as if nothing happened.] As I was saying, years ago I stumble upon a great and powerful secret: the identity of the Moon Spirit's mortal form.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: What?

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: I was a young lieutenant serving under General Shu in the Earth Kingdom. [Fade to a flashback of a young Zhao tearing through scrolls in a library.] I discovered a hidden library. Underground, in fact. I tore through scroll after scroll. One of them contained a detailed illustration, and the words "moon" and "ocean". I knew then that these spirits could be found and killed. [The memory ends with a close up of Zhao's eyes, fade to the present.] And that it was my destiny to do so.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: [Somewhat angrily.] Zhao, the spirits are not to be trifled with!

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Yes, yes ... I know you fear the spirits, Iroh. I've heard rumors about your journey into the Spirit World. But the Ocean and Moon gave up their immortality to become a part of our world. And now they will face the consequences.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Back in the Spirit World, Aang walks up a giant tree, seeing the entrance to the cave Koh can be found in. Aang stares and slightly steps toward the cave hearing creepy noises. He glances to his left noticing that the noise wasn't coming from the cave. Aang sighs in relief.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: You're just a curly tailed blue nose.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: The monkey turns its head toward Aang, exposing that he has no face.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: [Startled.] Aaahhh! [Aang takes a deep breath and speaks with his and Avatar Roku's voices combined.] Show no fear. Show no emotion at all.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Aang steps into the cave with a straight face.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Hello? I-I'm looking for a spirit named 'Koh'.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: As Aang says the spirit's name, some "roots" on the ceiling begin to move. Aang looks around, sensing movement, but sees nothing. Cut to a close-up of Aang's face that pans slightly left, leaving the right hand portion of the screen over his shoulder momentarily empty. A moment later, a white face appears with gray patches around its eyes and luscious, blood-red lips. Cut to a close-up of the lips, which smile. Cut to a profile of Aang, his face emotionless. Suddenly, a huge centipede-like body arcs around Aang and appears in front of his face. The white, clown-like face of Koh is inches away from Aang. Around the spirit's face are eight additional legs.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: [Creepily, circling Aang.] Welcome!

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Aang keeps his face straight. Cut to a long shot; the spirit hangs from the ceiling in front of Aang, who bows with his hands clasped in front of him in a gesture of honor.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: [Emotionlessly.] Thank you. [Koh wheels around Aang to look at him from behind. His voice is low and melodic, almost purring.]

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: My old friend, the Avatar. It's been a long time.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: You know me?

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: [Now facing the camera, away from Aang.] How could I forget [He switches with a "winking" effect, as if some sort of nictitating membrane closes briefly over the old face to reveal a new one, to a mad face of a middle-aged, mustached man with thick eyebrows, long mustache, and beard; angrily.] you? One of your previous incarnations tried to slay me! Nearly eight or nine hundred years ago.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: [Confused, yet seriously.] I didn't know that. Why did he, or I, try to kill you?

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: [Switches to Ummi's scared, sad face.] Oh, it was something about stealing the face of someone you loved. [Cut to a close-up of Aang with the camera slowing, zooming in on his face. Cut back to Koh, whose face turns malicious and switches to a baboon's while laughing. Switch to a side-shot; Aang keeps a straight face while not taking his eyes off Koh as he circles around him.] Of course, that's all behind us. Why should I hold a grudge against you for something in a past life? After all, you're a different person now. [Speaks into Aang's ear from behind.] You've come to me ... with a new face.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Aang closes his eyes and takes a deep breath to the words into his ear, crossing the scene to the real world, Zuko seeing his breath.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Guess we'll be here awhile.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Cut to exterior of the cave. Cut to Appa in the blizzard.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Don't worry, Prince Zuko can't be getting too far in this weather.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: I'm not worried they'll get away in the blizzard. I'm worried that they won't.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: They're not going to die in this blizzard. If we know anything, it's that Zuko never gives up. They'll survive, and we'll find them.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: The screen flashes white back to the Spirit World to Aang's talk with the face stealer, Koh circling loosely around Aang.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: [Continues to circle around Aang.] It's been a long time since I've added a child's face to my collection. [His face is now that of an owl.] So ... how may I help you?

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: I need to find the moon and the ocean.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Their spirit names are Tui and La, push and pull. And that has been the nature of their relationship for all time.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: [Side-view of Aang.] Please. Help me find them. An entire culture could be destroyed if I don't get their help. [Top-down view of Koh who changes his face to that of an old man. Aang is visible below him.]

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Oh, you think you need their help. [Koh looks to the side.] Actually it's quite the other way round. [In an instant, Koh turns and bolts to Aang, stopping just short of the young Avatar; with an angry blue ogre-like face with red eyes and upright fangs.] Someone's going to kill them! [Aang closes his eyes briefly before opening them to look at Koh.]

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: What do you mean? How can I find them and protect them?

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: [Flipping back to his white face.] You've already met them, actually. [View of Koh from behind Aang as Koh moves to look away, turning his back on Aang.] Tui and La, your moon and ocean, have always circled each other in an eternal dance. They balance each other, push and pull, life and death, [Close-up of Aang's face.] good and evil, yin and yang.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Aang's eyes open wide as he experiences a flashback of the white and black fish circling each other in the pond and the vision he had of them as they turned into the yin and yang symbol just before he entered the Spirit World. Back to Aang.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: [Excitedly.] The koi fish! [Hearing the emotion in Aang's voice, Koh quickly reels around to stare at the now expressionless face of Aang.] I must be going now.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: [Flipping to the face of a bald, young man.] We'll meet again.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Koh recedes into the shadows as Aang walks out of his cave. Cut to Aang running in front of the tree that is Koh's lair. He stops and talks to the ground.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: The spirits are in trouble, I need to get back to the physical world.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: [Cut to Roku's image on the ground.] A friend is here, to guide you back.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: [Aang turns around; excitedly.] Hei Bai!

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: The spirit groans as Aang jumps onto him and sets off. Cut back to the physical world. Two fireballs hit the city. Cut to two Water Tribe members fleeing as a tank destroys a totem pole behind them. Cut to two Water Tribe members trying to stop a tank. Cut to a view of the ocean with many fire navy ships and the moon looming behind. Cut to a bridge as two fire navy soldiers move in front of the camera as a waterbender drops down to move the bridge back from where the fire navy soldiers came from, taking the soldiers with it. Cut to a waterbender facing a tank, submerging the tank in the snow and ice around it. Cut to waterbenders attacking fire navy soldiers with shards of ice, who use shields to protect themselves. Cut to a shot behind Pakku who freezes and takes down eight oncoming soldiers. Pakku dodges a fire blast, having become surrounded with tanks and soldiers. Unleashing a wave of water he slices tanks wheels off and freezes soldiers behind him in ice. Pakku lifts himself into the air with water while being fired upon by firebenders. Avoiding the blasts, he knocks the firebenders away using his water cyclone as a wave. Cut to waterbenders sending a tank flying toward Zhao.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: We'll be following this map to a very special location. And when we get there, we're going fishing. [He smirks.]

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Cut back to the Spirit World. Aang arrives at his starting location and jumps off Hei Bai.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: This is where I came in, but how do I get back?

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Hei Bai stands on his hind legs and sends a beam of energy at Aang, who disappears to the physical world.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: [Cut to baboon spirit sitting on a rock. Opening his eyes.] Good riddance.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Hei Bai, having assumed his monstrous form, shoots an intense beam from his mouth at the baboon spirit sending it flying, before reverting to his original form. Back in the physical world, cut to a view of the arch way and water.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Momo! [Walking toward Momo. Closer view of Aang with Momo.] Momo. Oh no, where's my body?

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Aang is surrounded by energy and flies into the air. Cut to a wide-view of the entire Water Tribe city as Aang continues to fly toward the cave. Cut to close shot of Katara. Noticing Aang she turns around. Cut to shot of Appa flying in the sky as Aang shoots past overhead to the cave.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Look, that's gotta be Aang! Yip-yip!

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Cut to Aang entering the cave, filling it with light. Cut to Aang waking up, attempting to get out of his restraints and noticing Zuko.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Welcome back.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: [Cut to close-up of Aang as he narrows his eyes.] It's good to be back.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Aang airbends Zuko into a wall and propelling himself backward out of the cave. Cut to cave exterior. Close-up of Aang wriggling like a worm in an attempt to get away, only to be caught by Zuko.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: [Zuko pulls Aang up by his collar as seen from behind Aang.] That won't be enough to escape.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: [On seeing Appa.] Appa!

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Appa lands. Katara slides off. Close-up of Zuko.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: [Throwing the tied-up Aang aside who yelps.] Here for a rematch?

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: [Confidently while countering his fire blasts.] Trust me Zuko, it's not going to be much of a match.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Katara uses waterbending to launch Zuko into the air before plummeting him down to the ground, knocking him out. Close-up shot of Sokka running toward Aang to untie him with Zuko lying unconscious.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Hey, this is some quality rope!

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: We need to get to the oasis; the spirits are in trouble!

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Switch to a wide-view of the area with Aang airbending himself atop Appa. Close-up shot of Aang landing on Appa.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Wait, we can't just leave him here.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Sure we can. Let's go.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: No, if we leave him he'll die.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Aang airbends himself off Appa and retrieves Zuko, bringing him to Appa.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: [Sarcastically.] Yeah, this makes a lot of sense. Let's bring the guy who's constantly trying to kill us.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Appa takes off. Cut to Tui and La in the oasis lake. Zhao grabs Tui from the water, placing it in a sack. The moon goes red, followed by everything else. Cut to close-up of the now red moon. Cut to a view of the entire city turning red. Cut to Pakku who loses his waterbending and falls to the ground. Cut to a waterbender attempting to waterbend but loses his bending. Cut to three more waterbenders, bending water, but they too lose their bending. Cut to Fire Navy soldiers firebending. Cut to Appa flying with the red moon behind him. Appa groans as it cuts to the saddle.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: [Yue grabs her head as if in pain.] Are you okay?

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: I feel faint.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: [Cut to Aang. Holding his head with one hand.] I feel it, too. The Moon Spirit is in trouble.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: [Cut back to the saddle.] I owe the Moon Spirit my life.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: What do you mean?

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: [Close-up of Yue.] When I was born I was very sick and very weak. [Flashback to Yue as a baby.] Most babies cry when they're born, but I was born as if I was asleep, my eyes closed. [Cut to waterbenders attempting to heal Yue as a baby.] Our healers did everything they could. [Panning shot of Yue and the waterbenders, along with Yue's parents.] They told my mother and father I was going to die. [Cut to Arnook staring at the moon.] My father pleaded with the spirits to save me. [Cut to shot panning down from the moon to the oasis.] That night, beneath the full moon, he brought me to the oasis and placed me in the pond. [Cut to Yue being placed into the pond.] My dark hair turned white. [Close-up of Yue in the oasis.] I opened my eyes and began to cry, and they knew I would live. [Cut to Yue in her parents arms with the archway and moon behind them.] That's why my mother named me Yue. [Cut back to Appa's saddle.] For the moon.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: [Cut to Zhao at the oasis.] I am ... a legend, now! [Cut to panning shot from Zhao's hand, grasping the bag with Tui in it, down to his head.] The Fire Nation will, for generations, tell stories about the great Zhao, who darkened the moon. They will call me, Zhao the Conqueror, Zhao the Moon Slayer, Zhao the Invincible! [Momo jumps on top of Zhao's head.] Ugh ... Get it off! Get it off!

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Cut to wide-view of oasis as Momo flies away toward the camera. Panning view of Momo landing on Aang's arm and running to his shoulder, with Katara and Sokka are behind him. Cut to Zhao and his soldiers, readying themselves for battle. Cut to Aang, Sokka and Katara readying themselves. Panning shot of the oasis.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Don't bother. [Close-up of Zhao as he lifts the sack up threatening to kill Tui.]

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: [Cut to Aang and the others surrendering.] Zhao, don't!

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: [Cut to panning side-view.] It's my destiny, to destroy the moon and the Water Tribe.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: [Close-up side-view of Aang.] Destroying the moon won't hurt just the Water Tribe. [Close-up panning shot of the sack with Tui inside and Zhao.] It will hurt everyone, including you. [Cut to panning shot of the oasis.] Without the moon, everything would fall out of balance. You have no idea what kind of chaos that would unleash on the world. [Cut to Zhao.]

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: [Off-screen.] He is right Zhao.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: [Cut to wide shot of oasis; calmly to Iroh.] General Iroh, why am I not surprised to discover your treachery?

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: [Close-up of Iroh while he takes off his hood.] I'm no traitor, Zhao, the Fire Nation needs the moon, too; we all depend on the balance. Whatever you do to that spirit I'll unleash on you ten-fold. Let it go, now!

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Zhao releases the koi fish into the oasis. Cut to close-up of Zhao as he hesitates before striking the koi fish with a fire slice out of anger. Cut to wide-view of the oasis. Cut to Iroh recoiling from the flames. Cut to Aang looking on and up at the moon. Cut to a view from the oasis to the sky as the moon fades out and the world goes gray. Cut to Zhao looking up until Iroh begins firebending at him. Zhao dodges and counters his firebending while retreating toward his firebending soldiers. They are swiftly defeated as Zhao escapes. Cut to show La circling the now dead Tui. Cut to Aang and the others looking on in disbelief and moving toward the water. Yue is seen looking on; her forward movement reveals that Zuko has escaped from behind her. Iroh picks up the dead koi fish.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: [Close-up of Yue and Sokka.] There's no hope now, it's over.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: [Close-up of Aang entering the Avatar State.] No, it's not over.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: You're alive?

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: [Angrily.] You tried to have me killed! [Zuko attacks Zhao.]

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: [Close-up of Zhao's face.] Yes I did. [Zuko approaches Zhao as we see the giant energy form make its way toward the ocean.] You're the Blue Spirit, an enemy of the Fire Nation! You freed the Avatar.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: I had no choice. [Zuko continues his attacks, but they are blocked by Zhao.]

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: You should have chosen to accept your failure; you're a disgrace. Then, at least, you could have lived! [Zuko and Zhao begin to fight.]

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Back at the oasis, Iroh places the dead koi fish in the water.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: It's too late, it's dead.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: [Iroh notices Yue.] You have been touched by the Moon Spirit. [Close-up of Yue.] Some of its life is in you.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Yes, you're right. It gave me life, maybe I can give it back.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: No! You don't have to do that. [Sokka reached to stop her.]

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: It's my duty, Sokka.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: I won't let you! [Close-up of him holding her hand.] Your father told me to protect you.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: [Close-up of Yue.] I have to do this.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Yue's hand slips out of Sokka's as she places her hands on the koi fish. The koi begins to glow and Yue closes her eyes.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: [Yue falls as Sokka catches her.] No! She's gone, she's gone.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Cut to Aang as he approaches the sea and sends the fire navy ships back out into the ocean. Aang continues to destroy ships and drive the rest back out. Cut back to Sokka holding Yue. Yue fades and disappears as the koi begins the light up and glow. Iroh places the koi back into the oasis water. The entire lake begins to light up until energy floats up into the air forming an image of Yue. Side-view of the oasis.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Goodbye, Sokka. [Close-up of Sokka and Yue as she comes to kiss him.] I'll always be with you.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: They kiss and Yue disappears as Sokka looks up to the moon as it reappears in the sky, bringing the color back. Cut to Aang, still fused with the Ocean Spirit, in front of the Water Tribe city. Aang looks up and notices the moon has returned. The Ocean Spirit fades into the water and moves back to the city, dropping Aang off on a wall as he leaves the Avatar State.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: [Shot of the moon over Zhao's shoulder.] It can't be!

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Zhao is consumed by the energy in the shape of a hand and dragged toward the water.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Take my hand!

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Zhao considers it for a moment before retracting his hand. The energy plummets into the water, Zhao dragged along with it, and dissipates. Cut to Pakku and others on a ledge overlooking the city. Cut to a close-up shot of Pakku, Katara stands behind him.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: I've decide to go to the South Pole. Some other benders and healers want to join me. It's time we helped rebuild our sister tribe.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: What about Aang? He still needs to learn waterbending.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Well, then he better get used to calling you Master Katara.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Cut to Arnook and Sokka standing on the ledge looking at the moon.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: The spirits gave me a vision when Yue was born. I saw a beautiful, brave, young woman become the Moon Spirit. [Sighs.] I knew this day would come.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: You must be proud.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: So proud ... and sad.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Cut to Zuko and Iroh on a raft floating away from the city.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: I'm surprised Prince Zuko, surprised that you are not at this moment trying to capture the Avatar.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: I'm tired.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Then you should rest. A man needs his rest.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Cut to Aang looking out on the ledge in the city. Katara stands behind him. He realizes she's there and turns around. They embrace. Momo chitters.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: You too, Momo.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Come here.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Momo leaps on to Aang's shoulders as we see Sokka place his hand on Aang's shoulder. All four of them look out to the ocean and the moon as Appa rises up in front of them.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Iroh is a traitor, and your brother Zuko is a failure. I have a task for you.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Close-up of Azula, looking up and smiling.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Fades to credits.

title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
text: Aang

title: The Avatar State
text: The episode opens to show a gray sky as the camera moves back and down toward the Southern Air Temple where Aang is caught in a dream. In it, he is running about the Southern Air Temple. He comes across the room where he had found Monk Gyatso's skeleton in real life and instead sees his own self in the Avatar State. The personage of himself turns to glare at him angrily. Camera cuts to a terrified Aang, wind blowing past him. Cuts to a view of Sokka and Katara huddled behind a rock, watching the Avatar State Aang as he sends a forceful gust of wind that blows the real Aang back. He falls into the room in the Fire Temple he had visited to speak to Roku. The doors to the room open and reveal the personage of Aang in the Avatar State, who breathes fire and splits the floor in half. The real Aang falls through and lands on a Fire Navy ship in the Northern seas. The monstrous koi fish, called Koizilla, created when he and La had fused together during the Siege of the North appears before him, the personage of him inside. The Kozilla makes a downward cutting motion, and the personage does the same before a blinding white appears and the dream ends. Aang awakes from it and leaves the room where the gang is sleeping, exiting through a stairway. Katara awakens and catches sight of him leaving.

title: The Avatar State
text: [Confused.] Aang ...

title: The Avatar State
text: The camera cuts to a shot of Aang standing by the ledge of the Water Tribe ship on which they are sailing. Katara approaches him.

title: The Avatar State
text: Do you want to talk about it?

title: The Avatar State
text: Nah, just a nightmare. I was in the Avatar State, but I was outside my body watching myself. It was scary. I was scary. [Closes eyes and bows his head; Katara puts her hand on his shoulder.]

title: The Avatar State
text: The scene changes to daybreak. Pakku is on the ship with two Water Tribe members and the gang.

title: The Avatar State
text: [Holds up flask.] Katara, I want you to have this. [Closes up on flask.] This amulet contains water from the Spirit Oasis. The water has unique properties. Don't lose it.

title: The Avatar State
text: [Accepts amulet and hugs Pakku.] Thank you, Master Pakku.

title: The Avatar State
text: [Hands Aang box of scrolls.] Aang, these scrolls will help you master waterbending. But remember, they're no substitute for a real master. [Aang looks up at Katara, who is sitting on Appa and looks back.] Sokka ... [Pats him on shoulder, leaving him dismayed.] take care, son. [To the entire gang while pointing out in a direction.] Fly straight to the Earth Kingdom base to the east of here. General Fong will provide you with an escort to Omashu. There, you will be safe to begin your earthbending training with King Bumi.

title: The Avatar State
text: Appa, yip yip!

title: The Avatar State
text: [As they fly away.] Say hi to Gran-Gran for me!

title: The Avatar State
text: Scene switches to a village. Iroh is lying on a table, getting a relaxing massage at a resort.

title: The Avatar State
text: This is what I've been missing. Who knew floating on a piece of driftwood for three weeks with no food or water, and sea vultures waiting to pluck out your liver could make one so tense? [Looks at the clearly unhappy Zuko, walks over to him, and sits down on the ground.] I see. It's the anniversary, isn't it?

title: The Avatar State
text: [In a brooding tone.] Three years ago today, I was banished. I lost it all. [Looks up.] I want it back. I want the Avatar, I want my honor, my throne. I want my father not to think I'm worthless. [Looks on regretfully.]

title: The Avatar State
text: I'm sure he doesn't. Why would he banish you if he didn't care? [Zuko gets up and walks away; he grimaces soon after; to the massagers.] Uh, that came out wrong, didn't it? [They look at each other in confusion.]

title: The Avatar State
text: The scene switches to a Fire Nation ship. Several men bow as a royal carriage is brought out. Within the carriage is Princess Azula, the daughter of Ozai, niece of Iroh, and sister of Zuko.

title: The Avatar State
text: [Stepping out of the carriage and walking down the line of soldiers.] My brother and my uncle have disgraced the Fire Lord, and have brought shame on all of us. You might have mixed feelings about attacking members of the Royal Family. I understand. But I assure you, if you hesitate, I will not hesitate to bring you down. Dismissed.

title: The Avatar State
text: The soldiers leave. The captain runs up to Azula.

title: The Avatar State
text: Princess, I'm afraid the tides will not allow us to bring the ship into port before nightfall.

title: The Avatar State
text: I'm sorry, captain, but I do not know much about the tides. Could you explain something to me?

title: The Avatar State
text: Of course, Your Highness.

title: The Avatar State
text: Do the tides command this ship?

title: The Avatar State
text: I'm afraid I don't understand.

title: The Avatar State
text: You said the tides would not allow us to bring the ship in. [In a sharper tone.] Do the tides command this ship?

title: The Avatar State
text: No, princess.

title: The Avatar State
text: And if I were to have you thrown overboard, would the tides think twice about smashing you against the rocky shore?

title: The Avatar State
text: [Worried.] No, princess.

title: The Avatar State
text: [Runs fingers through her bangs.] Well then, maybe you should worry less about the tides who have already made up their mind about killing you, and worry more about me, who's still mulling it over. [Turns to face the captain angrily.]

title: The Avatar State
text: I'll pull us in.

title: The Avatar State
text: He leaves. Cuts to a close-up of Azula, who glares and narrows her eyes in suspicion. The scene switches to the team flying on Appa.

title: The Avatar State
text: [Rises to view their destination.] There it is!

title: The Avatar State
text: The gang arrives at General Fong's base, where he and his soldiers are waiting.

title: The Avatar State
text: Welcome, Avatar Aang! [Cuts to shot of the team stretching after riding on Appa.] I am General Fong, and welcome, to all of you great heroes! Appa, Momo, brave Sokka, the mighty Katara ...

title: The Avatar State
text: [Pleased.] Mighty Katara? I like that.

title: The Avatar State
text: Fireworks go off, launched by the soldiers using earthbending.

title: The Avatar State
text: [Viewing the display.] Not bad, not bad.

title: The Avatar State
text: The scene cuts to inside the base, where General Fong and the team are sitting in a spacious discussion room.

title: The Avatar State
text: [Camera view depicts entire room.] Avatar Aang, we were all amazed at the stories of how you singlehandedly wiped out an entire Fire Navy fleet at the North Pole. [Closes up to Fong, stroking his beard.] I can't imagine what it feels like to wield such devastating power. It's an awesome responsibility.

title: The Avatar State
text: [Casually.] I try not to think about it too much.

title: The Avatar State
text: [Calmly.] Avatar, you're ready to face the Fire Lord now.

title: The Avatar State
text: [Shocked.] What? No I'm not!

title: The Avatar State
text: [Holds out her hand in reasoning.] Aang still needs to master all four elements.

title: The Avatar State
text: Why? With the kind of power he possesses, power enough to destroy hundreds of battle ships in a matter of minutes, he could defeat the Fire Lord now!

title: The Avatar State
text: But sir, the thing is, Aang can only do those things when he's in the Avatar State.

title: The Avatar State
text: See, it's this special state where-

title: The Avatar State
text: [Sharply.] I'm well aware! Your eyes and tattoos glow and you're able to summon unbelievable power. Without you, we'd be slaughtered before we even reach their shores. [Looks at map and guides finger from the location of the base to the location of the Fire Nation Capital.] But with you leading the way, as the ultimate weapon, we could cut a swath right through to the heart of the Fire Nation.

title: The Avatar State
text: [Doubtfully.] Right, but, I don't know how to get in or out of the Avatar State, much less what to do once I'm there.

title: The Avatar State
text: So, it's decided then. I'll help you figure out how to get into the Avatar State and then you'll face your destiny.

title: The Avatar State
text: [The group rises; angrily.] No, nothing's decided. We already have a plan. Aang's pursuing his destiny his way.

title: The Avatar State
text: Well, while you take your time learning the elements, the War goes on. May I show you something? [Leads Aang to a window.] That's the infirmary, and those soldiers are the lucky ones. [Several soldiers are injured and walking slowly.] They came back. Every day, the Fire Nation takes lives. People are dying, Aang! You could end it, now. Think about it.

title: The Avatar State
text: Aang averts his eyes to the side, looking unsure. The scene changes to Azula's ship, where she is training. She stands perfectly straight, holding her fingers in her hand. The camera cuts to where Lo and Li are sitting, overseeing her training. Cuts to shot of Azula, as she moves her arms in a circular motion, generating lightning and firing the bolt into the sky.

title: The Avatar State
text: Almost perfect.

title: The Avatar State
text: One hair out of place.

title: The Avatar State
text: [Close-up of her face as she pushes a loose strand of hair away.] Almost isn't good enough!

title: The Avatar State
text: She repeats her actions, generating lightning again and firing it off into the distance. Cuts to a shot of Iroh, who suddenly awakens from a nap, sits up and peers in curiosity. The scene changes to nightfall at Fong's base.

title: The Avatar State
text: General Fong?

title: The Avatar State
text: Come in, Aang. Have you thought about our discussion?

title: The Avatar State
text: I'm in. I'll fight the Fire Lord.

title: The Avatar State
text: The scene changes to where Aang has entered a room with several plain beds, where the team is resting for the night.

title: The Avatar State
text: [Sits on his bed.] I told the general I'd help him, by going into the Avatar State.

title: The Avatar State
text: [Sits up.] Aang, no! This is not the right way!

title: The Avatar State
text: [Resting on his bed with his arms behind his head.] Why not? Remember when he took out the Fire Navy? [Widens his eyes.] He was incredible!

title: The Avatar State
text: There's a right way to do this. Practice, study, and discipline!

title: The Avatar State
text: [Casually.] Or just glow it up and stop that Fire Lord!

title: The Avatar State
text: [Rises and throws her hands up in surrender.] If you two meat heads want to throw away everything we've worked for, fine, go ahead and glow it up! [Exits.]

title: The Avatar State
text: Katara, I'm just being realistic! I don't have time to do this the right way!

title: The Avatar State
text: Aang casts a mournful look. The scene changes to the next day where Fong, the team, and another soldier are sitting in an outdoor room. The soldier is pouring tea in a cup.

title: The Avatar State
text: [Drops white food item into the teapot.] This rare chi-enhancing tea is a natural stimulant. In an ordinary warrior, it improves strength and energy ten-fold. In you, it may induce the Avatar State.

title: The Avatar State
text: Ten-fold energy, huh?

title: The Avatar State
text: Aang drinks the tea, causing his eyebrows to twitch slightly. The camera pans downward to the same scene where Aang is riding rapidly on an air scooter, hyper from the energy boost.

title: The Avatar State
text: [Quickly in a high-pitched voice.] Is it working? Is it working? I can't tell! Somebody tell me if I'm in the Avatar State 'cause I don't have a good view of myself! Am I talking too loud?

title: The Avatar State
text: [Sitting on the floor, tired out by Aang's actions.] I guess he could talk the Fire Lord to death.

title: The Avatar State
text: Aang hits a pillar and falls backward. The scene switches to where Aang is sitting on the ground, Sokka standing a few feet away.

title: The Avatar State
text: Maybe I can shock you into the Avatar State.

title: The Avatar State
text: I love surprises!

title: The Avatar State
text: Camera cuts to view from Aang's perspective, Katara covering his eye with her hands. She uncovers his eyes to reveal Sokka towering over Aang, his head instead replaced with Momo's, who screeches. Aang screams and glances at his arrow tattoos.

title: The Avatar State
text: [Holding up hands.] Still not glowing.

title: The Avatar State
text: Cuts to view of the entire team as Sokka steps backward, loses his balance and falls to the ground off camera. Fong shakes his head in dismay. The scene changes to a dimly lit room where Aang is standing, wearing an outfit consisting of a Water Tribe cloak, an Earth Kingdom hat with leaves coming out of the top, part of a Fire Nation soldier outfit and what appears to be a belt.

title: The Avatar State
text: You are wearing a ceremonial piece of clothing from each of the bending nations. Now I will join the four elements into one! Water [Pours jug of water into the bowl.], earth [Pours in bowl of dirt.], fire [Takes nearby torch and throws it in.], air! [Releases air gust from wooden contraption.] Four elements together as one!

title: The Avatar State
text: The oracle raises the bowl and flings the contents at Aang, coating him in mud.

title: The Avatar State
text: [Annoyed.] This is just mud!

title: The Avatar State
text: [Quizzically.] So ... do you feel anything?

title: The Avatar State
text: Aang raises his finger, catching everyone's interest, only to sneeze, causing mud to fly everywhere, coating Fong, Katara, and Sokka.

title: The Avatar State
text: [Rubs mud from face.] We have to find a way.

title: The Avatar State
text: The scene changes to Zuko and Iroh's place of stay, the room dark inside. Several various shells fall from a bag onto the table. The camera pans up to where Iroh is standing at the table, picking up and examining the different shells.

title: The Avatar State
text: [Holds up one shell.] Look at these magnificent shells! [Picks up a conch.] I'll enjoy these keepsakes for years to come.

title: The Avatar State
text: We don't need any more useless things! You forget, we have to carry everything ourselves now!

title: The Avatar State
text: [From the corner, sitting at the table; calmly.] Hello, brother. Uncle.

title: The Avatar State
text: [Angrily.] What are you doing here?

title: The Avatar State
text: [Holds up a shell in her hand.] In my country, we exchange a pleasant hello before asking questions. [Rises and walks toward Zuko and Iroh.] Have you become uncivilized so soon, Zuzu?

title: The Avatar State
text: [Angrily.] Don't call me that!

title: The Avatar State
text: [Clearly upset.] To what do we owe this honor?

title: The Avatar State
text: Hmmm ... must be a family trait. Both of you so quick to get to the point. [Breaks the shell she was holding with her fingertips, leaving Iroh angry.] I've come with a message from home. Father's changed his mind. Family is suddenly very important to him. He's heard rumors of plans to overthrow him; treacherous plots. Family are the only ones you can really trust. [Pauses briefly.] Father regrets your banishment. He wants you home. [Silence.] Did you hear me? You should be happy. Excited. Grateful. I just gave you great news.

title: The Avatar State
text: I'm sure your brother simply needs a moment.

title: The Avatar State
text: [Furiously.] Don't interrupt, Uncle! [To Zuko.] I still haven't heard my thank you. [Annoyed.] I'm not a messenger. I didn't have to come all this way.

title: The Avatar State
text: [Surprised.] Father regrets? He ... wants me back?

title: The Avatar State
text: I can see you need time to take this in. I'll come to call on you tomorrow. Good evening.

title: The Avatar State
text: She exits, leaving Zuko to ponder what has just been said. Meanwhile, at Fong's base, Aang and Katara stand on a balcony, the sun setting over the horizon.

title: The Avatar State
text: Can we talk about something?

title: The Avatar State
text: Sure.

title: The Avatar State
text: [Cuts to side-shot of Aang and Katara.] Do you remember when we were at the air temple and you found Monk Gyatso's skeleton? It must have been so horrible and traumatic for you. I saw you get so upset that you weren't even you anymore. [Closes up to Katara.] I'm not saying the Avatar State doesn't have incredible and helpful power ... but you have to understand ... for the people who love you, watching you be in that much rage and pain is really scary.

title: The Avatar State
text: I'm really glad you told me that. But I still need to do this.

title: The Avatar State
text: [Upset.] I don't understand.

title: The Avatar State
text: [Cuts to overall view of Aang and Katara.] No, you don't. Every day, more and more people die. I'm already one hundred years late. Defeating the Fire Lord is the only way to stop this war. I have to try it!

title: The Avatar State
text: [Sadly.] I can't watch you do this to yourself. I'm not coming tomorrow. [Begins to exit.] Good night.

title: The Avatar State
text: [Sadly.] Good night.

title: The Avatar State
text: The scene changes to nightfall at Zuko and Iroh's house. Cuts to inside the house.

title: The Avatar State
text: [Packing belongings.] We're going home! After three long years, it's unbelievable!

title: The Avatar State
text: [Staring out the window thoughtfully.] It is unbelievable. I have never known my brother to regret anything.

title: The Avatar State
text: Did you listen to Azula? Father's realized how important family is to him! [Irritated.] He cares about me!

title: The Avatar State
text: [Turns to face Zuko and holds out arms in gesture.] I care about you! And if Ozai wants you back, well, I think it may not be for the reasons you imagine.

title: The Avatar State
text: [Turns his back to Iroh.] You don't know how my father feels about me. You don't know anything!

title: The Avatar State
text: Zuko, I only meant that in our family, things are not always what they seem.

title: The Avatar State
text: [Turns to face Iroh.] I think you are exactly what you seem! A lazy, mistrustful, shallow old man who's always been jealous of his brother!

title: The Avatar State
text: Zuko walks away, leaving Iroh saddened. Meanwhile, Aang is caught in another dream. The dream takes place in the Southern seas on Zuko's ship, where the Avatar State Aang rises from the water, riding a water vortex, similar to the way Aang did in the beginning of the series. The personage lands on deck and sweeps away the real Aang with waterbending. The personage turns to Zuko and performs the same downward, cutting motion as seen in previous dreams before the dream abruptly ends and Aang awakens.

title: The Avatar State
text: [Sits up in his bed.] Sokka! Sokka, wake up.

title: The Avatar State
text: Huh?

title: The Avatar State
text: I don't think we should be trying to bring on the Avatar State.

title: The Avatar State
text: You sure?

title: The Avatar State
text: Yes.

title: The Avatar State
text: [Nonchalantly.] Okay.

title: The Avatar State
text: Do you think the general will be mad?

title: The Avatar State
text: What can he say? You're the Avatar. Who knows better than you?

title: The Avatar State
text: Aang lies back on his bed, resting his head on his arms. The next morning, we cut back to Zuko, who is getting ready to return home. He descends a stone staircase, carrying his bags.

title: The Avatar State
text: [Holding up his hand in motion and running down the staircase after Zuko.] Wait! Don't leave without me!

title: The Avatar State
text: [Turns around, smiles and sets down pack.] Uncle! You've changed your mind!

title: The Avatar State
text: Family sticks together, right? [Lays hand on Zuko's shoulder.]

title: The Avatar State
text: The scene flashes back to a shot of Zuko's father, Ozai, resting his hand on his son's shoulder years ago. Flashes back to present day.

title: The Avatar State
text: We're finally going home!

title: The Avatar State
text: He resumes his descent. The camera closes up on Azula's ship sitting in the harbor. Closes up to Iroh, looking on with suspicion. The scene switches to the discussion room in Fong's base.

title: The Avatar State
text: [Humbly.] The thing is, I don't think we'll ever be able to trigger it on purpose. So I guess that's it.

title: The Avatar State
text: [Calmly.] You sure I can't change your mind?

title: The Avatar State
text: I'm sure. I can only reach the Avatar State when I'm in genuine danger.

title: The Avatar State
text: I see. I was afraid you'd say that.

title: The Avatar State
text: He blasts his entire desk at Aang using earthbending, sending him soaring across the room.

title: The Avatar State
text: Aang! [Attempts to come to his aid, only to be held down by two soldiers.]

title: The Avatar State
text: The impact sends Aang crashing through the wall and flying out of the building. He breaks his fall with airbending.

title: The Avatar State
text: [Walks over toward the hole that was created from the impact and points to Aang.] Men! Attack the Avatar!

title: The Avatar State
text: The scene cuts to a shot of Aang being surrounded by several earthbending soldiers, some riding on ostrich horses. Fong jumps out of the building and hits the ground, sending a rock wave at Aang which sends him back further.

title: The Avatar State
text: [Alarmed.] What are you doing?

title: The Avatar State
text: [Slyly.] I believe we're about to get results.

title: The Avatar State
text: The camera focuses on soldiers, who prepare to fire large earth coins at Aang using earthbending. Cuts to a shot of Aang, looking nervously about him. The camera zooms out to a shot of him and his attackers before switching to a soldier, who sends an earth coin at him. Aang avoids two oncoming coins and soars in the air parallel to the ground between two more coins that are thrown at him. He lands safely to the ground.

title: The Avatar State
text: [Looking about cautiously.] I'm not your enemy! I won't fight you!

title: The Avatar State
text: He jumps into the air as four earth coins are sent his way, crashing into each other. As Aang begins his descent, another earth coin is sent skidding toward him; the coin crashes into one of the four stationery coins. Aang lands on the ground where the coin was standing just moments ago. Two of the other stationery coins are closed together. The camera cuts to a shot of Aang trapped inside the holes of the earth coins, rolling speedily away. An earthbender breaks the coins, crumbling them to bits. Aang lands on the ground, rises and faces the rest of the soldiers.

title: The Avatar State
text: You can't run forever!

title: The Avatar State
text: You can't fight forever!

title: The Avatar State
text: Fong leaps forward and crushes the earth coin, just as Aang jumps to avoid the attack. Dust from the impact is sent flying toward the screen. The scene changes to where Zuko and Iroh are approaching Azula's ship. The camera pans upward and focuses on a shot of Azula standing quietly on top of a ramp leading up to the ship. Royal Procession guards stand on either side of them as they walk, forming an aisle. Iroh averts his eyes suspiciously between the guards. They reach the ship and bow; the guards behind them walk forward and close the aisle.

title: The Avatar State
text: Brother! Uncle! Welcome! I'm so glad you decided to come.

title: The Avatar State
text: The camera cuts to a side-shot of Iroh, opening his eyes slightly and casting a suspicious glance at the guards.

title: The Avatar State
text: Are we ready to depart, Your Highness?

title: The Avatar State
text: [Sweetly.] Set our course for home, captain.

title: The Avatar State
text: [Wistfully.] Home.

title: The Avatar State
text: [He walks up the ramp with Zuko and Iroh following him and raises his hand in gesture.] You heard the princess! Raise the anchors! We're taking the prisoners home!

title: The Avatar State
text: The captain widens his eyes in realization at his mistake and looks at Azula. Zuko and Iroh stop, looking surprised. Cut to Azula with a look of surprise on her face. The camera rushes to her face as her expression turns to fury. Cut back to the captain, his eyes wide.

title: The Avatar State
text: [Nervously.] Your Highness, I ...

title: The Avatar State
text: Cut to Zuko, his eyes widening. Cuts to a close-up of Iroh, who narrows his eyes to the left and suddenly begins attacking the guards. He pushes them off the edge of the walkway and sends fire blasts their way. Cuts to a side-shot of Zuko, as he stomps furiously up the ramp and throws the captain off.

title: The Avatar State
text: You lied to me! [Cut to Azula, who appears confident.]

title: The Avatar State
text: [Smugly.] Like I've never done that before.

title: The Avatar State
text: She turns her back to him and walks away, as two guards standing near her shoot fire blasts at Zuko. Zuko crosses his arms and spreads them outward, deflecting the attacks and shouts as he charges onto the ship. The scene changes to Aang, who avoids three earth coins that slam onto the ground, threatening to crush him. He runs to the left of the screen as another coin rolls his way. The scene changes to the team's bedroom, where Katara is lying on her bed, listening to the noises outside.

title: The Avatar State
text: I wonder what crazy thing they're trying to do now. [Momo, who is sleeping on a pillow, raises his head before going back to sleep. Katara hears another rumble outside and grows worried.] Maybe we should just make sure Aang's okay.

title: The Avatar State
text: She rises from her bed. The camera cuts to a shot of the base tower and pans downward to show Katara and Sokka running down opposite stairways. They meet up at the bottom of the base.

title: The Avatar State
text: [Frantically.] What's going on?

title: The Avatar State
text: The general's gone crazy! He's trying to force Aang into the Avatar State!

title: The Avatar State
text: Sokka pulls out his boomerang and throws it as Katara runs off. Cuts to a shot of a soldier, who is hit by the boomerang and falls to the ground in a daze, knocking over the earth coin in the process. Cuts to Aang, who is being chased by another soldier mounted on an ostrich horse. The head of the spear the soldier was holding is suddenly snapped off. He slows down, stunned at this. Cuts to a shot of Katara summoning a water whip.

title: The Avatar State
text: [Approaching the ostrich horse carefully.] Good ... bird ... horse thingy ...

title: The Avatar State
text: Sokka mounts it and the animal begins galloping away, leaving Katara standing in the arena. The camera zooms out to Fong. Several earth coins are summoned, rolling toward Katara before coming to a standstill.

title: The Avatar State
text: [Looking back at Aang, who has managed to escape up a stairway.] Maybe you can avoid me ... but she can't.

title: The Avatar State
text: The soldiers rotate the earth coins so that their flat sides face Katara. The camera zooms out to the entire arena, the coins forming a triangular pattern around Katara. The waterbender sends a water whip at Fong, who summons up dust pillars that deflect the water and turn it to mud. He uses earthbending to begin sinking her into the ground. She twists around, buried knee deep.

title: The Avatar State
text: [Struggling to break free.] I can't move!

title: The Avatar State
text: [Worried; clenches his fists.] Don't hurt her!

title: The Avatar State
text: He leaps onto the ground and sends a gust of wind at Fong, who summons an earth wall to block the attack. Fong brings down the earth wall and sinks Katara into the ground further, this time burying her waist deep.

title: The Avatar State
text: [Riding the ostrich horse.] Katara! No!

title: The Avatar State
text: He gallops toward her, but Fong sinks the animal's feet into the ground, flinging Sokka off the ostrich horse. Sokka slams into the hole of an earth coin, leaving him dangling.

title: The Avatar State
text: [Desperately and clutching onto Fong's arm.] Stop this! You have to let her go!

title: The Avatar State
text: You could save her if you were in the Avatar State!

title: The Avatar State
text: [Tears forming around his eyes.] I'm trying ... I'm trying!

title: The Avatar State
text: [Frantically.] Aang, I'm sinking! [Twists around again and is buried chest deep.]

title: The Avatar State
text: [Demanding.] I don't see glowing! [Lowers his right arm and begins closing his hand into a fist; Katara becomes buried neck deep.]

title: The Avatar State
text: [Desperately.] Please!

title: The Avatar State
text: [Falling to his knees, begging.] You don't need to do this!

title: The Avatar State
text: [Scornfully.] Apparently, I do.

title: The Avatar State
text: He clenches his fist tight, sinking Katara completely. She cries out in fear before being completely buried in the ground. Aang leaps forward and attempts to save her, however, he falls short. Closes up on Aang, as his arrow tattoo begins to glow a bright white. He turns his head to face Fong, the Avatar State now triggered.

title: The Avatar State
text: [Triumphantly.] It worked! It worked!

title: The Avatar State
text: An air blast is sent his way and his triumphant expression soon becomes one of fear as he realizes the situation. Cuts to Aang, who performs the downward cutting motion as seen in his previous dreams and pushes Fong back with a powerful air blast. Fong lands roughly on the ground. Cuts to Aang, who begins rising on an earth vortex.

title: The Avatar State
text: [Pushes several guards away; grabs one and wrestles him.] Zuko! Let's go!

title: The Avatar State
text: He hurls the guard over the edge and steps to the side to avoid another guard's attack and push him aside. Cuts back to Zuko, who charges at Azula with fire daggers. Zooms out to where he attempts to strike Azula, only for the princess to acutely dodge all of his blows. Cuts to close-up of her as she smirks at her brother. Zooms out to both siblings as Zuko keeps attacking and Azula keeps avoiding. Zuko brings down his right hand to land another blow, however, Azula manages to push him away.

title: The Avatar State
text: You know, Father blames Uncle for the loss of the North Pole. And he considers you a miserable failure for not finding the Avatar! [Cuts to Zuko, who is panting heavily.] Why would he want you back home, except to lock you up [Cuts back to Azula.] where you can no longer embarrass him?

title: The Avatar State
text: Zuko conjures up two fire daggers again. He leaps into the air and sends a powerful fire blast at Azula using his foot. She jumps and lands safely on the deck several feet away. Zuko charges at her as she rises to her feet. After dodging several more attacks, she manages to scrape his forehead with her fingernails, leaving three scratch marks on his temple. Zuko falls back a few feet from the impact and yells as he charges at her again.

title: The Avatar State
text: [Pleading.] Avatar Aang! Can you hear me? Your friend is safe! [Brings Katara back above ground; cuts to close-up of her as she looks up at Aang in misery.] It was just a trick to trigger the Avatar State ... [Cuts back to Fong, who smiles maniacally.] and it worked!

title: The Avatar State
text: Aang swivels about on the vortex and lands on the ground forcefully, causing a flurry of dust to spread. Fong is sent back several feet while Katara remains rooted to the ground where she was. Cuts to the left of the arena where several soldiers are standing, a torrent of dust rumbling their way. The dust clears to reveal the ground broken and in ruins. Cuts to right of the arena, where several soldiers on ostrich horses stand. The dust torrent passes over them and clears, revealing that side in ruins. Cuts to another area of the base, where several houses lie. Again, the torrent passes over, leaving the houses considerably damaged.

title: The Avatar State
text: [Looking at Aang.] It's time you learned.

title: The Avatar State
text: They fly higher above the dusty clouds. Cuts to side shot of the dragon, many small figures seen floating in the distance.

title: The Avatar State
text: [Cuts to Roku.] The Avatar State is a defense mechanism, designed to empower you with the skills and knowledge of all the past Avatars.

title: The Avatar State
text: Cuts to Avatar Kyoshi, who stands surrounded by rocky mountain terrain. Her eyes glow for a moment and she assumes a fighting stance. The camera zooms out to reveal two large earthen statues, somewhat resembling badgermoles. She performs a series of moves which cause the statues to rise into the air, and send them past toward the camera.

title: The Avatar State
text: The glow is the combination of all your past lives, focusing their energy through your body.

title: The Avatar State
text: Cuts to a shot of Avatar Kuruk, riding atop a raft in the middle of the ocean. His eyes glow momentarily before he raises his arms and summons a gigantic tsunami-like wave. He is seen rapidly riding atop the wave toward the screen. Cuts to Avatar Yangchen, who stands in a grassy field surrounded by a forest area. Her eyes glow briefly as she swings her arms and swivels around, conjuring powerful winds. The camera zooms out to the entire field and the forest blown violently by the wind.

title: The Avatar State
text: In the Avatar State, you are at your most powerful, [Cuts to Avatar Szeto, who summons lava spouts from four volcanoes; the lava washes over the screen and the scene cuts back to Roku and Aang.] but you are also at your most vulnerable.

title: The Avatar State
text: What do you mean?

title: The Avatar State
text: If you are killed in the Avatar State, [The figures of him and the Avatars in the background are blown away like dust.] the reincarnation cycle will be broken [Shows the line of Avatars with Aang standing at the end; the Avatars begin to fade away in succession down the line.] and the Avatar will cease to exist.

title: The Avatar State
text: Aang is shown with a worried look on his face. The scene cuts to the base where Fang flies over Fong's base. Cuts to Aang's body, surrounded by a dome of air. Fang flies downward, head first, passing through Aang's body and into the ground. Aang's spirit is brought back to his physical self and he exits the Avatar State.

title: The Avatar State
text: [Embracing her; regretfully.] I'm sorry, Katara. I hope you never have to see me like that again.

title: The Avatar State
text: [Triumphantly.] Ha! Are you joking? That was almost perfect! [Thoughtfully.] We just have to find out a way to control you when you're like that.

title: The Avatar State
text: [Slightly angry.] You're out of your mind.

title: The Avatar State
text: I guess we'll figure it out on the way to the Fire Nation.

title: The Avatar State
text: Sokka appears behind the general, riding the ostrich horse. He raises his club and strikes the general on the head, which knocks him out cold.

title: The Avatar State
text: Anybody got a problem with that?

title: The Avatar State
text: The soldiers shake their heads. Zooms out to the gang, several soldiers and Fong, who lies on the ground motionless.

title: The Avatar State
text: Do you still want an escort to Omashu?

title: The Avatar State
text: [Casts the group a look of annoyance.] I think we're all set.

title: The Avatar State
text: The group leaves the base on Appa. The scene changes to the village resort. Azula is seen standing on the balcony of one of the residential buildings. Two Royal Procession guards stand in the background to protect her.

title: The Avatar State
text: [Holds up wanted poster of her brother and uncle.] Anyone who harbors these traitors will face the wrath of the Fire Lord! [She lays a hand on the balcony, causing the two massagers to cower in fear; cuts to close-up of her.] There will be no place left to hide!

title: The Avatar State
text: The scene changes to a riverside. The shadowy reflections of two figures on the run can be seen in the water. Cuts to view of the river bank and the area nearby as Zuko and Iroh run frantically. Cuts to riverbank as the two stop and fall to the ground, catching their breath.

title: The Avatar State
text: I think we're safe here.

title: The Avatar State
text: Cuts to shot from Zuko's perspective as he pulls out a small dagger. Cuts to close-up of Zuko holding the dagger, its blade reflecting the sunlight. Cuts briefly to Iroh, who closes his eyes, seemingly aware of his nephew's actions. He casts a look at Zuko, who holds the knife under his ponytail. Cuts to close-up of his ponytail, as he slices it off with the knife. He holds it in his hand and looks at it for a moment before passing the knife to Iroh, who cuts off his topknot. Cuts to Zuko's hand, as he releases his ponytail. Cuts to the surface of the river, as the two topknots are released and float down the river. The camera zooms out to where Zuko and Iroh stand quietly on the bank of the river.

title: The Avatar State
text: Fades to credits.

title: The Avatar State
text: Aang

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: The episode opens to show a cliff with a small body of water, where Team Avatar is residing. The camera pans downward and cuts to where Sokka is relaxing peacefully, floating on a large leaf in the water with Momo sleeping on his stomach, while Katara and Aang are facing each other while practicing waterbending.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [With his hair covering his eyes.] You guys are going to be done soon, right? We have a lot of ground to cover if we're going to make it to Omashu today.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Rises from her hunched-over position; turns to face Sokka smugly.] What? Like you're ready to go right now, naked guy? [Smiles at him smugly.]

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: I could be ready in two minutes. Seriously, [Pulls back the hair covering his eyes.] whenever.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: So you were showing me the octopus form?

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Turns her attention back to Aang.] Right, let me see your stance.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Aang assumes a defensive stance. After careful consideration, Katara walks over to him.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Walks under his right arm.] Your arms are too far apart. [Positions his arms closer together.] See, if you move them closer together, you protect your center. You got it?

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Blushing.] Oh, yea ... thanks.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Walks away and assumes a fighting stance.] Okay, let's see what you got.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Aang bends the water, creating a globule which eventually transforms into eight whip-like water tentacles. He carefully maneuvers them, fending off shards of ice that Katara repeatedly sends at him by throwing them away or dodging them. At length, he manipulates one of the tentacles, curling it around her leg, gripping it firmly and pulling on it.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Proudly.] You make a fine octopus, Pupil Aang.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: The camera cuts to where Aang dances playfully, suspended in a globule of water shaped like an actual octopus. Suddenly, music can be heard in the distance. The group witnesses a strange group of nomads playing music on instruments and singing, approaching them.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Singing.] Da, da, da. Don't fall in love with the traveling girl. She'll leave you broke and brokenhearted. [Cuts to shot of the team standing in the lake. Sokka unexpectedly falls off his leaf into the water. Cuts to nomads. Chong stops singing and points at the group.] Hey, river people!

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: We're not river people.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Puzzled.] You're not? Well then what kind of people are you?

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Just ... people.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Aren't we all, brother?

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Walks over and says accusingly.] Who are you?

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: I'm Chong and this is my wife, Lily. We're nomads, happy to go wherever the wind takes us! [He suddenly strums his lute-like instrument in a crazy fashion much like a rock star strums crazily on their guitar.]

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Starts out with a somewhat puzzled tone, but changes it to an excited one.] You guys are nomads? That's great! I'm a nomad!

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Just as excitedly.] Hey, me too!

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Blankly.] I know ... you just said that.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Oh. [Noticing Sokka.] Nice underwear ...

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Cut to close shot of Sokka, who is only wearing his swimsuit; Aang and Katara are standing behind him. Sokka's eyes bulge at the sudden realization that he is wearing very little in front of complete strangers. He grabs Momo and places him strategically over his underwear and slides rapidly off the screen. The scene switches to a forest landscape, where Zuko and Iroh are now living as fugitives. The camera shows a close-up of Iroh's face, as he gasps and stares in awe at a red and white flower. Cuts to full view of him and an area behind him.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Emerging from the bushes, now sporting short, black hair.] I didn't find anything to eat! I can't live like this! I wasn't meant to be a fugitive. [Raises fists in the air and yells at the sky.] This is impossible! [Looking over at Iroh.] Uncle, what are you doing?

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Cuts to Iroh who dotes over the flower. Zuko appears behind him.] You're looking at the rare white dragon bush. Its leaves make a tea so delicious, it's heartbreaking. That, or it's the white jade, which is poisonous.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: We need food, not tea. I'm going fishing. [Walks away.]

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Dreamily.] Hmm ... delectable tea? [More suspiciously.] Or deadly poison?

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: The scene switches to where Team Avatar and the band of nomads are lounging nearby Appa, whose fur is braided. Chong is casually strumming his lute. Sokka approaches.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Wearing a wreath of pink flowers on his head.] Hey, Sokka, you should hear some of these stories. These guys have been everywhere!

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Stops playing.] Well not everywhere, Little Arrowhead. But where we haven't been, we've heard about through stories and songs.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: They said they'll take us to see a giant night crawler!

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Lying on the ground; in a dreamy voice.] On the way, there's a waterfall that creates a never-ending rainbow!

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Look, I hate to be the wet blanket here, but since Katara is busy, I guess it's up to me.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Katara shoots him a glare as Lily braids her hair.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: We need to get to Omashu. No sidetracks, no worms and definitely no rainbows.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Wow, sounds like someone has a case of destination fever. You're worried too much about where you're going.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: You got to focus less on the "where" and more on the "going". [She makes gestures with her hand, accidentally tugging on Katara's braid.]

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Impatiently.] O. Ma. Shu!

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Sokka's right. We need to find King Bumi, so Aang can learn earthbending somewhere safe.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Sounds like you're headed to Omashu.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Sokka smacks his forehead in frustration.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: There's an old story about a secret pass right through the mountains.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Is this real or a legend?

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Oh, it's a real legend. And it's as old as earthbending itself. [Begins strumming his lute and singing.] Two lovers, forbidden from one another, the war divides their people and the mountain divides them apart! Built a path to be together! [Stops playing.] Yeah, I forget the next couple of lines, but then it goes ... [Resumes singing.] Secret tunnel! Secret tunnel! Through the mountains, secret, secret, secret, secret tunnel! Yeah!

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: A shot showing everyone around Appa, including the nomads. who had been dancing and clapping.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Unamused while folding his arms.] I think we'll just stick with flying. We've dealt with the Fire Nation before. We'll be fine.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Yeah, thanks for the help, but Appa hates going underground. [Flashing a smile.] And we need to do whatever makes Appa most comfortable ...

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: The scene changes to a mountainous cliffside where Fire Nation soldiers are attacking the team by launching fireballs at them as they desperately try to escape on Appa.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Pointing at the trio on Appa.] Launch!

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Several catapults are activated, launching an assault of fireballs at the team, who manages to narrowly avoid them.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Ahhhh!

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: The scene cuts to the trio, covered in ash and scorch marks, casually strolling past the nomads.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Pointing forward.] Secret love cave, let's go.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: The scene switches to the forest, where Zuko has arrived from his fishing expedition. When the camera pans upward, it is revealed that he has only managed to spear a single, tiny fish which flaps about helplessly on the large branch he used for a fishing pole. Cuts to Iroh hunched over, his back to the camera.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Zuko, [Cut to a wide, overhead shot of Zuko standing behind Iroh.] remember that plant I thought might be tea?

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Shocked.] You didn't ...

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: I did ... [Turns around.] and it wasn't. [Reveals himself to be swollen and covered in red marks.]

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Cut back to Zuko who drops the branch out of shock.] Ahh!

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
