text: [Surprisingly calmly.] When the rash spreads to my throat, I will stop breathing. [Excitedly.] But look what I found. [Iroh holds out his arm to reveal berries.] These are bacui berries, known to cure the poison of the white jade. [Unenthusiastically.] That, or maka'ole berries that cause blindness.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Grabbing branch of berries and hurling it into the bushes.] We're not taking any more chances with these plants! We need to get help.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: But where are we going to go? [Kneeling down and scratching his rash vigorously.] We're enemies of the Earth Kingdom and fugitives from the Fire Nation. [Camera zooms in on his reddened leg.]

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: If the Earth Kingdom discovers us, they'll have us killed.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Rises.] But if the Fire Nation discovers us, we'll be turned over to Azula.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: They look at each other and pause briefly.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Nodding and walking away with Iroh.] Earth Kingdom it is.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: The scene changes to where Team Avatar and the band of nomads are journeying to the tunnels along a wide street surrounded by the ruins of a temple.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: How far are we from the tunnel?

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Actually, it's not just one tunnel. The lovers didn't want anyone to find out about their love, so they built a whole labyrinth!

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Halts in his tracks; in shock.] Labyrinth?

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Casually.] Oh, I'm sure we'll figure it out.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: All you need to do is trust in love ... according to the curse.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Sokka, who had resumed walking, halts once more. The others pass by him. After several moments, he flinches in terror.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [In a somewhat whining voice.] Curse!

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Camera pans to the dark entrance of the cave.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Hey-hey! We're here!

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Cuts to shot of inscription on the side of the cave entrance.] What exactly is this curse?

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: The curse says that only those who trust in love can make it through the caves. Otherwise, you'll be trapped in them forever.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: And die.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Oh yeah, and die. [Brightening.] Hey, I just remembered the rest of that song! [Stands before the entrance and strums lute, while singing an ominous line in a low voice.] And die!

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: That's it! There's no way we're going through some cursed hole!

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Turns head to observe gray smoke rising from the horizon, which he proceeds to point at.] Hey, someone's making a big campfire!

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [In a serious tone.] That's no campfire, Moku.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Grimly.] It's Fire Nation. They're tracking us.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Making sure he understands.] So all you need to do is trust in love to get through these caves?

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: That is correct, Master Arrowhead.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Aang turns to stare at Katara, who has her back to him. Her clothes and hair sway slightly as a breeze passes by. The camera closes up to his face, his eyes shining in adoration.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Smiling.] We can make it.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Gesturing to the cave; somewhat commanding.] Everyone into the hole!

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: They all begin to enter the cave. Cuts to a close-up of Appa as he groans. Several Fire Nation tanks rumble across the terrain toward the entrance of the tunnel and pause once they reach the mouth of the cave.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Hold on! It's too dangerous. Haven't you heard the song? Just close them in. The mountain will take care of the rest.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: The tanks fire rotating grappling hooks from canisters into the tunnel and release them after a few moments, unleashing a myriad of boulders. The scene switches to where the group has begun navigating their way through the tunnels only to turn and witness the entrance being closed off. Appa begins to frantically paw the walls of the tunnel.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: It's okay, Appa. We'll be fine. I hope.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: We will be fine. All we need is a plan. Chong, how long do those torches last?

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Casually.] Uh, about two hours each.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Lighting the rest of the torches in her hand.] And we have five torches, so that's ten hours!

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Grabbing torches and stomping out the fire.] It doesn't work like that if they're all lit at the same time!

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Oh, right.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: I'm going to make a map to keep track of exactly where we've been. Then we should be able to solve it like a maze and get through.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Katara and Aang look at each other with unsure expressions. The scene changes to a village. Camera cuts to a hospital before switching to the inside of the building. One doctor is treating a man with what appears to be a cupping treatment. The man grits his teeth in pain. The camera pans over to where a girl is treating Iroh's allergic reaction. Zuko is seated on a bench.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Wringing cloth.] You two must not be from around here. We know better than to touch the White Jade, much less make it into tea and drink it. [Flicks Iroh's hand away when he scratches his rash.]

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [The girl moves away from the camera's eye, revealing Iroh to be in an even worse condition than before with the rash having spread to his face and his cheeks swollen.] Whoops!

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: So where are you traveling from?

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Nervously; rises from his seat as she moves his hand down so she could wash it.] Yes, we're travelers.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Do you have names?

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Names? Of course we have names. [Song turns to see Iroh scratching and glares at him, before slapping his hand away.] I'm, uh ... Lee and this is my Uncle, uh ... Mushi?

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Shoots him angry look. Cuts to shot of Song taking a lotion from a jar. She begins slathering it over the inflamed areas.] Yes, my nephew was named after his father, so we just call him Junior. [Leans over to the side to give Zuko a pleased smile.]

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Zuko glares angrily at Iroh and moves his finger across his neck signaling that he's dead meat, but abruptly halts and puts his hands behind his back when Song turns to look at him.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Mushi and Junior, huh. My name is Song. You two look like you could use a good meal. [Slaps Iroh's hand away when he goes to scratch his rash.] Why don't you stay for dinner?

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Looking away.] Sorry, but we need to be moving on.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Screwing the cap back on the lid.] That's too bad. [Gives an innocent smile.] My mom always makes too much roast duck.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Excitedly.] Where do you live exactly?

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: The scene changes to the dark tunnel where Sokka is standing with a map in his hands, the map taking up most of the screen. He tilts it to the side a few times before drawing it closer to him.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Sokka, this is the tenth dead end you've led us to.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: This doesn't make sense. We already came through this way.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: We don't need a map. [Sokka passes by him.] We just need love. The little guy knows it.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Yeah, but I wouldn't mind a map also.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Cuts to an overhead shot of the group standing in the dark cave before switching to Sokka who looks up from the map.] There's something strange here. There's only one explanation. [Cuts to shot of the rest of the group before switching to Sokka who turns to face the camera.] The tunnels are changing.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: A wave of surprise passes over everyone as the tunnels shake. The scene cuts to nighttime to a house. Cuts to a shot of an open-wall dining room where Zuko and Iroh are sitting around Song's kitchen table.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Setting down a platter of roast duck and taking a seat.] My daughter tells me you're refugees. We were once refugees ourselves.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Sadly.] When I was a little girl, the Fire Nation raided our farming village. All the men were taken away. That was the last time I saw my father.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Close-up of the prince.] I haven't seen my father in many years.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Sorrowfully.] Oh, is he fighting in the War?

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Zuko hesitates. Iroh is seen slurping up a bowl of noodles.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Sets down dish.] Yeah. [Looks away in dismay.]

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: The scene changes to the cave.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Frantically.] The tunnels, they're a-changin'. It must be the curse! I knew we shouldn't have come down here!

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Sarcastically.] Right, if only we listened to you.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Hold up a hand in warning.] Everyone be quiet. Listen.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Cuts to shot of Sokka looking into the dark tunnel, his back to the camera. A low snarl can be heard from within the darkness of the tunnel. Momo flees from his shoulder. Sokka suspiciously holds the torch up to the tunnel to inspect the strange sound. Suddenly, a wolfbat flies from the darkness of the cave toward the camera, causing everyone to panic.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: It's a giant flying thing with teeth!

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [The creature lands. Off-camera.] No! It's a wolfbat!

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: The wolfbat takes off again. In a frenzy, Sokka swats at the creature with the lit torch. Several hot cinders are thrown about and land on Appa's skin. Yelping in pain, the bison begins running around the tunnel, releasing a discharge of rocks and debris. Aang quickly airbends Sokka and the band of nomads out of the way of the falling rocks. He races toward Katara and pushes her out of the way. The camera cuts to where he and Katara rise from the impact and witness the division of the tunnel. Meanwhile, Sokka attempts to dig his way through the barrier that divides the two groups.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Yeah, it's no use. We're separated. But at least you have us!

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Horrified.] Nooooo!

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: He resumes digging through the rocks only to have a pile of debris fall on him. The scene changes to where Zuko is sitting on Song's front porch. Song comes outside and sits beside him.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Can I join you? I know what you've been through. We've all been through it. [Witnessing Zuko's scar.] The Fire Nation has hurt you.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: She reaches out to touch his scar only to have Zuko push her hand away.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Compassionately.] It's okay. They've hurt me, too. [Pulls up pants leg to reveal burn scars on her leg.]

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Zuko casts her a surprised look upon seeing this. The scene cuts to where Chong and his group are singing much to Sokka's annoyance.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Singing as he and the nomads pass the angry warrior.] Oh, don't let the cave-in get you down! [Cuts to shot of him.] Don't let the falling rocks turn your smile into a frown! [He goes off-screen and Moku passes by, nudging Sokka.] When the tunnels are darkest, that's when you need a clown, hey! [Re-enters.] Don't let the cave-in get you down, Sokka!

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Sokka scowls at this. The scene changes to Aang and Katara who are making their way through the tunnels.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Cheerfully.] Aang, look!

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Running up to a solid rock door.] We found the exit!

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: The two struggle to open it. Appa is seen in the background, snorting and preparing to charge. The two look at each other in alarm before running away as Appa charges at the door forcefully. Cuts to the opposite side of the entrance as the door creaks open and to a wider shot of the room as the stone doorway loosens and rolls off to the side. Katara jumps into the room only to have her look of hope change into one of disappointment.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: This isn't the exit.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Walking to her side.] No. It's a tomb.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: The camera zooms out on the ominous looking tomb, Appa grunting behind the duo.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: It must be the two lovers from the legend; that's who's buried here.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: These pictures tell their story.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Katara gestures with the torch toward at the panels along the tomb, speaking about each one in turn. Aang and Katara exchanged glances and Katara narrates the story. The first image is that of a mountain.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Voice-over.] They met on top of the mountain that divided their two villages ...

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Two figures, a man dressed in red and a woman in blue, meet atop the mountain. They take each other's hands, though they swiftly let go, and a Chinese character appears.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Voice-over.] The villages were enemies, so they could not be together ... [Character flashes red as the background turns grim and dark.] but their love was strong and they found a way.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Two hills appear; on the closer one is the man, while the woman kneels on the one farther away. Though their faces cannot be seen in detail, it is obvious that they long for the other.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Voice-over.] The two lovers learned earthbending from the badgermoles; they became the first earthbenders.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: The painting of a badgermole is shown, as well as that of the young couple beginning to create the labyrinth.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Voice-over.] They built elaborate tunnels, so they could meet secretly. [The pattern of a labyrinth appears.] Anyone who tried to follow them would be forever in the labyrinth. [The couple kisses.] But, one day, the man didn't come [Cuts to a shot of the woman alone, looking startled.] - he'd died in the war between the two villages. [Arrows fly by the screen. The woman is seen weeping by a grave.] Devastated, the woman unleashed a terrible display of her earthbending power - she could have destroyed them all ... [The woman is seen displaying her immense earthbending power.] but, instead, she declared the war over. [Cuts to shot of the woman standing on a hill surrounded by the two villages.] Both villages helped her build a new city where they would live together in peace. [Shows picture of the current-day Omashu.] The woman's name was Oma and the man's name was Shu. [The characters for "Oma" appear followed by the character for "Shu". Flashback ends.] The great city was named Omashu as a monument to their love.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: The two look at each other momentarily before turning around.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Reading the inscription on the relief in the wall.] Love is brightest [Cuts to shot of a carving of the couple kissing.] in the dark.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Meanwhile, on the other side of the cave, Sokka glares at the map while Momo comically perches on the top of his head. The map takes up most of the shot until Sokka lowers it.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Oh, great! Your plans have led us to another dead end!

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Cuts to overhead shot of the entire group standing before a wall of rubble, before switching to Sokka and Moku, with Sokka glaring accusingly at the nomad.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Defensively.] At least I'm thinking of ideas and trying to get us out of here, Moku.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Whoa, whoa, wait a minute. We're thinking of ideasâ? Because I've had an idea for, like, an hour now.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Angrily; spreads arms out dramatically.] Yes! We're all thinking of ideas!

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Well, then listen to this: If love is the key out of here, then all we need to do is play a love song! [Begins playing song much to Sokka's dismay.]

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Meanwhile, in the tomb of the two lovers, Katara studies the portrait of the two lovers and the inscription while Aang stands off to side.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: How are we going to find our way out of these tunnels?

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: I have a crazy idea.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Curiously.] What?

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Hesitant. Walks away, slightly embarrassed.] Never mind. It's too crazy.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Katara, what is it?

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: I was thinking ... the curse says we'll be trapped in here forever unless we trust in love ...

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Right ...

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Turns to face him and gestures to the portrait.] And here, it says, "Love is brightest in the dark," and has a picture of them kissing.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Utterly confused and lost.] Where are you going with this?

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Shyly, blushing.] Well, what if we ... kissed?

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Very surprised.] Us ... kissingâ?

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: See? It was a crazy idea.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Dreamily.] Us ... kissing ...

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Fake-jokingly.] Us kissing. What was I thinking? Can you imagine thatâ?

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Fake-jokingly.] Yeah. [Awkwardly laughs.] I definitely wouldn't want to kiss you! [Beat.]

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Insulted.] Oh, well! I didn't realize it was such a horrible option. [Angrily.] Sorry I suggested it!

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Realizing his mistake.] No, no, I mean ... if there was a choice between kissing you and dying ...

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Disgusted.] Ugh!

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Desperately.] What? I'm saying is I would rather kiss you than die - that's a compliment.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Enraged.] Well, I'm not sure which I'd rather do! [Slams the torch into his hand and storms away.]

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Miserably.] What is wrong with me ...

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: He walks away, the screen darkening in his wake. The scene changes to where Chong and his nomads are playing love songs, the camera panning down to show the group walking past.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Singing.] Even if you're lost, you can't lose the love because it's in your heart ...

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Sokka slaps his forehead once more. The scene changes where we now see Zuko and Iroh preparing to depart from Song's house. They stand outside, dozens of fireflies in the air.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Thank you for the duck. It was excellent.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: You're welcome. It brings me pleasure to see someone eat my cooking with such ... gusto.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Pats his stomach in a contented manner.] Much practice.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Zuko turns to leave.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Junior, where are your manners? You need to thank these nice people.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Turns and bows.] Thank you.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: I know you don't think there's any hope left in the world, but there is hope. The Avatar has returned.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Bitterly.] I know.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: He leaves, but stops as he comes across an ostrich horse. Quietly, he walks over to the animal, unfastens it from its post and leads it away. The camera cuts to a shot from Song's front yard. Zuko appears on screen, riding the animal.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: What are you doing? These people just showed you great kindness.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: They're about to show us a little more kindness. Well?

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Disappointed and reluctant, Iroh mounts the ostrich horse and the two ride away, leaving Song upset. She quietly closes the screen door to the house. The scene switches to the cave where Aang and Katara are still wandering about hopelessly, their torch ready to burn out at any moment.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: We're going to run out of light any second now, aren't we?

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: I think so ...

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Then, what are we going to do?

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: What can we do?

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: She silently walks over and grabs hold of his hand. Aang smiles up at her. The camera cuts to a close-up of Katara's face. The two are seen leaning into one another as the last of the torch light fades. Suddenly, the ceiling of the cave lights up revealing thousands of glowing crystals gleaming overhead. Meanwhile, Sokka and the band of nomads are journeying through the cave when they hear low growls. The camera zooms in on a dark tunnel where several wolfbats come into the light, racing toward them. Sokka waves his hands frantically in an attempt to scare them off. The creatures fly straight past him.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Hey! You saved us, Sokka!

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: No, they were trying to get away from something!

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: From what?

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: The caves rumble. Cuts to an overhead shot of the group as a wall of rock crumbles. Without warning, two giant badgermoles burst through the caves, causing the group to panic. One badgermole closes its hands together in a prayerful manner, closing off a tunnel behind it with earthbending. The camera shifts right across the group and cuts to the other badgermole which pounds the ground with its paws and raises a wall of earth, blocking off the exits. Cuts to an overhead shot of the cave where one badgermole is seen using earthbending to create a split in the earth between the nomads and Sokka.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Hey, those things are music lovers!

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Singing nervously.] Badgermoles coming toward me. Come on guys, help me out!

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Singing.] The big, bad badgermoles who earthbend the tunnels, hate the wolfbats, but love the sounds!

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: The scene switches to Aang and Katara who are standing underneath the ceiling of glowing crystals, their hands linked.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: They're made of some kind of crystal. They must only light up in the dark.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: That's how the two lovers found each other. [Gestures with her hand along the ceiling.] They just put out their lights and followed the crystals. [Sees the exit.] That must be the way out! [The two hug.]

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: So, uh ...

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Let's go!

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: She runs toward the exit. Aang stares after her before shaking his head and smiling. He and Appa follow close behind. They make their way out of the cave and into the outdoors. Appa bounds out of the tunnel and flops onto his back, tongue lolling out in content.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: What about Sokka?

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: The two seem a bit concerned at first, but a rumbling is heard. Cuts to an overhead shot of the exit where at that moment, Sokka and the band of nomads emerge from the cave, riding atop badgermoles. Debris flies everywhere and Aang and Katara shield themselves from the rubble. The camera pans upward to Sokka riding atop one of the creatures, waving, Momo flying about.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Sokka!

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Cuts to overhead shot of the cave, the camera panning to the left. Sokka dismounts the badgermole and approaches Katara.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: How did you guys get out?

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Just like the legend said, we let love lead the way. [Smiles sheepishly.]

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Really? We let huge, ferocious beasts lead our way.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: He turns to the badgermoles and waves to them as they slowly plod their way into the cave again. Two walls of rock rise up where the badgermoles re-entered the cave. The camera pans to where Momo is seemingly communicating with Appa, telling him of his journey through the caves. Appa seemingly roars in response to the lemur. Katara is seen hugging her brother.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Why is your forehead all red?

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Talking about Aang.] Nobody react to what I'm about to tell you: I think that kid might be the Avatar!

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Sokka smacks his forehead, enlarging the red spot while Chong looks at him in curiosity. Meanwhile, Aang confronts the other nomads.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: So are you guys going to come to Omashu with us?

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Nope.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Okay. Thanks for everything, Moku.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: The band of nomads begins walking away. The camera pans to where Chong is seen placing a necklace of flowers around Sokka's neck.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Sokka, I hope you learned a little something about not letting the plans get in the way of the journey. [Hugs him.]

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [Irritated yet blushing.] Just play your songs.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Hey! Good plan! [Begins playing his lute and singing. Cuts to shot of Team Avatar.] Even if you're lost, you can't lose the love because it's in your heart. Da, da, da ...

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: While Chong is singing, Aang shoots a look at Katara, Sokka crosses his arms and Katara blushes. The camera pans upward and fades to a scene later in the day where the trio is heading up the mountainside to Omashu.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: [From afar.] The journey was long and annoying, but now you get to see what it's really about: the destination. [Close-up of him.] I present to you the Earth Kingdom city of O- [Pauses abruptly.] Oh no ...

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: The camera shifts to behind him where they soon discover that Omashu has been captured and placed under Fire Nation rule. Ominous music is heard as a close-up of the entrance draped with a Fire Nation flag is shown.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Fades to credits.

title: The Cave of Two Lovers
text: Aang

title: Return to Omashu
text: The episode opens to a bright, blue sky, the sun shining. The camera zooms out quickly to reveal a red Fire Nation flag waving in the wind. Cuts to shot of the Earth Kingdom city of Omashu having been captured by the Fire Nation. A bold red flag bearing the Fire Nation insignia is proudly hung; gray plumes of smoke fill the air surrounding the fallen city.

title: Return to Omashu
text: [Viewing the city, his back to the camera; in a somewhat shocked tone.] I can't believe it. I know the War has spread far, [Turning toward the camera sadly.] but Omashu always seemed ... untouchable.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Up until now it was. [Crosses arms over chest.] Now Ba Sing Se is the only great Earth Kingdom stronghold left.

title: Return to Omashu
text: [Cuts to shot of entire group standing on the cliffside overlooking the city.] This is horrible, [Approaches Aang; cuts to side-view of the two standing next to each other.] but we have to move on.

title: Return to Omashu
text: No, I'm going in to find Bumi.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Aang, stop. We don't even know if Bumi's still ...

title: Return to Omashu
text: [Angrily.] What? If he's still what?

title: Return to Omashu
text: [Unsurely.] A-around.

title: Return to Omashu
text: I know you had your heart set on Bumi, but there are other people who can teach you earthbending.

title: Return to Omashu
text: This isn't about finding a teacher. This is about finding my friend.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Scene changes to below Omashu's gate where Aang is attempting to open the entrance to a secret tunnel.

title: Return to Omashu
text: A secret passage? Why didn't we just use this last time?

title: Return to Omashu
text: Aang opens the tunnel, revealing it to be filled with sewage.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Ugh!

title: Return to Omashu
text: That answer your question?

title: Return to Omashu
text: Eww!

title: Return to Omashu
text: The group proceeds through the tunnel to the inside of Omashu. Aang conjures an air ball with his staff to clear the path while Katara uses waterbending to maneuver the sewage carefully around her. Sokka, on the other hand, is continually soaked in the foul substance.

title: Return to Omashu
text: That wasn't as bad as I thought.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Sokka emerges covered in slime. Katara spots water nearby and splashes Sokka with it using waterbending to wash off the sewage followed by Aang who uses airbending to dry him off while he screams which reveals that three pentapi have attached themselves to his skin.

title: Return to Omashu
text: [In a panicking tone while trying to yank the pentapox off.] Ahh! They won't let go! Help!

title: Return to Omashu
text: [Quickly tackles Sokka into a wall in order to slience him; in a somewhat cheerful tone.] Shh! Stop making so much noise. It's just a purple pentapus.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Sokka looks at the pentapuses in fear. Aang removes the first pentapus by lightly rubbing its head as Sokka watches. Sokka rubs the spot where the creature was attached, and does the same procedure to get the second one off. Several guards suddenly approach them as Aang takes the third one off.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Hey! What are you kids doing out past curfew?

title: Return to Omashu
text: Sorry. We were just on our way home.

title: Return to Omashu
text: The kids turn and walk away, Sokka bringing up the rear. The guard notices the red welts on the back of Sokka's neck.

title: Return to Omashu
text: [Notices the spots where the pentapus was attached to Sokka.] Wait, what's the matter with him?

title: Return to Omashu
text: Uh, he has pentapox, sir. [As he approaches.] Umm, it's highly contagious.

title: Return to Omashu
text: [Exaggerating.] Oh, it's so awful. I'm dying.

title: Return to Omashu
text: And deadly.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Hey, I think I heard of pentapox! Didn't your cousin Chang die of it?

title: Return to Omashu
text: We'd better go wash our hands, and burn our clothes.

title: Return to Omashu
text: The guards run away in fear.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Thank you, sewer friends.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Scene switches to on board Azula's ship. She is consulting her assistants, Li and Lo.

title: Return to Omashu
text: When tracking your brother and uncle, traveling with the royal procession may no longer be an option.

title: Return to Omashu
text: May no longer be wise.

title: Return to Omashu
text: If you hope to keep the element of surprise.

title: Return to Omashu
text: You're right. The Royal Procession is dead weight. If I want to catch my prey, I must be agile, nimble. I need a small, elite team. It's time to visit some old friends.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Scene switches to Omashu by twilight, where Aang, Katara and Sokka with Momo on his shoulder are sneaking around. They hide behind some metal bars used for construction as a patrol passes.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Let's find Bumi and get out of here.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Where would they be keeping him?

title: Return to Omashu
text: Somewhere he can't earthbend. Somewhere made of metal.

title: Return to Omashu
text: The foursome goes on. The picture switches to a close-up of a young woman with black hair and an emotionless expression named Mai. Behind her walk two Fire Nation guards.

title: Return to Omashu
text: There really is no fathoming the depths of my hatred for this place.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Cut to a wider shot to show Mai walking next to an older woman carrying a baby. They are being escorted by Fire Nation guards.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Mai, your father was appointed governor. We're like royalty here. Be happy and enjoy it.

title: Return to Omashu
text: The picture widens as the camera zooms up to show some rocks, ready to be pushed down one of Omashu's mail delivery chutes which ends near where Mai's party is walking. You can clearly see the light of the torches from up above.

title: Return to Omashu
text: The targets are approaching.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Close-up of a bearded man wearing an Earth Kingdom military uniform.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Take them out.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Cut back to Mai's party walking down below.

title: Return to Omashu
text: [In a dull tone.] I thought my life was boring in the Fire Nation, but this place is unbearably bleak. Nothing ever happens.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Cut to the resistance fighter at the beginning of the chute, who pushes the rocks down the chute with earthbending. Aang and his friends walk by and they see the rocks crumbling down at high speed. Aang looks in distress at Mai's party. He raises his staff and pulverizes the rock with a blast of air as it passes. Mai's party is alerted by the sound and looks up to see what caused it. Close-up of Mai who squints her eyes to make out who is standing above her before the picture shows Aang again. Cut back to the party.

title: Return to Omashu
text: [Pointing at Aang.] The resistance!

title: Return to Omashu
text: Close-up of Mai, who is seen for the first time with a faint smile on her face. She spreads her arms at Aang, causing tiny arrows to fly toward him. Aang quickly jumps up, avoiding the arrows which bury themselves in the stack of construction material Aang lands on. Aang, Katara, Sokka and Momo run away as two of the Fire Nation guards are climbing up ladders to get to them.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Ty Lee, could that possibly be you?

title: Return to Omashu
text: The camera moves to show a close-up of a girl, Ty Lee, standing on her index fingers. She smiles when she sees Azula.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Azula!

title: Return to Omashu
text: Ty Lee flips from her stance and spins around in a graceful twirl to bow down before Azula. She runs forward to embrace Azula.

title: Return to Omashu
text: It is so good to see you!

title: Return to Omashu
text: Please, don't let me interrupt your ... [Raises an eyebrow in wonder.] whatever it is you were doing.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Ty Lee, still smiling, does a back flip and ends up lying on her chest with one leg stretched out over her head and the other straight up to the sky.

title: Return to Omashu
text: [Glances around.] Tell me, what is the daughter of a nobleman doing here? [Looks back at Ty Lee.] Certainly our parents didn't send us to the Royal Fire Academy for Girls to end up in ... [Looks to her side.] places like this.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Azula looks as three men are trying to move a platypus bear. The Bear groans and moves up to reveal that it has laid an egg. Azula looks at this in disgust and turns her attention back to Ty Lee, grinning once more.

title: Return to Omashu
text: I have a proposition for you.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Cut to Ty Lee who is still lying on the ground, watching the same Platypus bear as Azula, but she looks happy to see what has happened. When Azula addresses her, she diverts her attention away from the bear and looks at Azula in a wondering gaze.

title: Return to Omashu
text: I'm hunting a traitor. [While looking casually at her nails.] You remember my old fuddy-duddy uncle, don't you?

title: Return to Omashu
text: [Resting on her chest and elbows, but now with her both feet resting on her head.] Oh yeah. He was so funny.

title: Return to Omashu
text: I would be honored if you would join me on my mission.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Oh ... I ... uh ... would love to. [She stands up in a fluid elegant movement.] But the truth is, I'm really happy here. [Smiling sincerely.] I mean, my aura has never been pinker!

title: Return to Omashu
text: [Raising up her hand in a "stop" motion to Ty Lee.] I'll take your word for it. Well, I wouldn't want you to give up the life you love just to please me.

title: Return to Omashu
text: [Bows in respect.] Thank you, Azula. [Continues stretching.]

title: Return to Omashu
text: [While walking away.] Of course, before I leave, I'm going to catch your show.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Ty Lee's accidentally breaks her stance, as she gasps in panic. She continues her stretch once more and the expression of panic changes to one of worry.

title: Return to Omashu
text: [Hesitantly.] Uh ... yeah ... sure ... uh ... of course ...

title: Return to Omashu
text: Cut back to Omashu, where a lot of people have gathered in some sort of underground cave. At the other side of the room, Aang, Sokka, and Katara enter the large space through a tunnel; they are talking to three other men.

title: Return to Omashu
text: So, is King Bumi with you guys? Is he leading the resistance?

title: Return to Omashu
text: Cut to a close-up of Yung who angrily balls his fist as he answers Aang's question.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Of course not! The day of the invasion, we readied ourselves for battle. We were prepared to defend our city ... to fight for our lives and for our freedom. But before we even had a chance, King Bumi surrendered.

title: Return to Omashu
text: The camera moves slowly toward Aang, who is clearly disconcerted by the news. Katara gives Aang a look of concern.

title: Return to Omashu
text: The day of the invasion, I asked King Bumi what he wanted to do. [Cut to his close-up.] He looked me in the eye and said ...

title: Return to Omashu
text: A flashback shows the day Omashu was under attack. King Bumi and Yung stand atop one of the city's walls, looking down while fire balls decorate the sky.

title: Return to Omashu
text: I'm going to do ... nothing! [He starts to laugh and snort like the mad lunatic he is.]

title: Return to Omashu
text: The flashback fades away to make room for another close-up of Yung.

title: Return to Omashu
text: It doesn't matter now. [Cut to Aang who sadly lowers his eyes as the resistance leader continues.] Fighting the Fire Nation is the only path to freedom. [Switch to a close-up of Yung again.] And freedom is worth dying for.

title: Return to Omashu
text: As Yung ends his speech, a smile plays on his face. Aang sadly leans on his staff. He raises his eyes as while he addresses Yung.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Actually there's another path to freedom. You could leave Omashu. You're directing all your energy to fight the Fire Nation. [The camera pans to the right, showing several Earth Kingdom soldiers.] But you're outnumbered. You can't win. Now's the time to retreat, so you can live to fight another day.

title: Return to Omashu
text: You don't understand. They've taken our home, and we have to fight them at any cost! [He makes some powerful hand gestures to make his point more clear.]

title: Return to Omashu
text: [In a soft tone.] I don't know, Yung, living to fight another day is startin' to sound pretty good to me.

title: Return to Omashu
text: [He takes a step forward and points toward himself. He addresses Yung with a decisive tone.] Yeah, I'm with the kid!

title: Return to Omashu
text: Yung looks at all the people who have taken refuge under ground and now are living in the sewer tunnels while they whisper among themselves. He looks back at Aang.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Fine. But there's thousands of citizens that need to leave. How're we going to get them all out?

title: Return to Omashu
text: Switch to Sokka whose hand is on his chin as he is cooking up a plan. He points at Yung as he exclaims his idea.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Suckers!

title: Return to Omashu
text: Katara raises one eyebrow and just stares at Sokka. The rest of the group follows her example. Momo chirps questionably. Sokka blinks, shifting his eyes right and left, smiling broadly.

title: Return to Omashu
text: You're all about to come down with a nasty case of pentapox.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Cut to a shot of a bucket of water filled with pentapi. A hand reaches in and takes one out. The civilian, whose face is already covered with the marks of removed pentapi, places it on his exposed left arm. Its jellylike body moves up and down a bit. After a few seconds, someone else removes the pentapus by gently rubbing its head. We see several shots of people placing and removing pentapi from their face, shoulders and arms.

title: Return to Omashu
text: The marks make ya look sick, but you gotta act sick too. Ya gotta sell it!

title: Return to Omashu
text: An old man hobbles into view, leaning heavily on his cane. He clutches his back while moaning in pain.

title: Return to Omashu
text: [Grabs the guy who is standing next to him and points at the old man.] Now that's what I'm talkin' about.

title: Return to Omashu
text: The man turns around, smiling. He taps his wooden leg with his cane.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Years of practice.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Okay everyone! Into sick formation.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Sokka and the other civilians start walking toward the gates of Omashu. Just as Katara wants to join them, she notices that Aang is walking off in the other direction.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Aang, what are you doing? Aren't you coming with us?

title: Return to Omashu
text: [He turns around.] No. I'm not leaving until I find Bumi.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Momo jumps on Aang's shoulders, tugging Aang's lips. He grabs Momo by his neck and places him back on the ground.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Sorry Momo, I'll feed you later.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Aang uses airbending to propel him unto the air. He whizzes away, jumping from one rooftop to the other.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Plague! Plague!

title: Return to Omashu
text: The guards on the ground start to retreat into the citadel behind them, away from the sick, while another guard rings the gong to alert everyone of the problem at hand.

title: Return to Omashu
text: What is going on down there?

title: Return to Omashu
text: I saw some kids yesterday who were sick with pentapox. It must have spread!

title: Return to Omashu
text: Pentapox! [He pulls his beard.] Hmm, I'm pretty sure I've heard of that.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Oh, this is terrible.

title: Return to Omashu
text: What should we do?

title: Return to Omashu
text: Drive them out of the city [He points toward the gates.] ... but don't touch them! We have to rid the city of this disease!

title: Return to Omashu
text: The guard bows in respect before leaving to spread the governor's orders. Mai calmly offers her dad the bowl of fire flakes.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Fire flakes, Dad?

title: Return to Omashu
text: [Gasping.] How awful!

title: Return to Omashu
text: The governor's family is shown from behind. As his wife hugs her husband, the little baby beside her, Mai's brother Tom-Tom toddles away from the group.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Flopsie!

title: Return to Omashu
text: As Aang calls his name, Flopsie turns around and happily tries to reach his friend. His chains hold him back, so he sadly ceases his attempts. Aang jumps over him and uses the water from his drinking bowl to freeze the lock on his chains. With one swing of his staff, Aang destroys the lock, freeing Flopsie. The happy animal hugs and licks Aang's face.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Come on, Flopsie. [He climbs on top of Flopsie.] You gotta help me find Bumi. Yip Yip! [Flopsie does not move a muscle.] Oh ... I guess that doesn't work with you. Let's go!

title: Return to Omashu
text: Flopsie races off at great speed. Meanwhile Momo is soaring through the city. He lands on a balcony and peeks through a window. We see a cluttered room with dressing panels at the back. A teddy bear is thrown repeatedly in the air by someone behind the panels. Momo spots a full scale of berries and starts to drool. He quickly enters the chamber through the window and starts to stuff his face. He rapidly spits out the seeds. Some of them land behind the panels. Cut to Tom-Tom who is playing with the stuffed animal behind the panels. He notices the seeds and crawls away, following their path. The trail of seeds leads right back to Momo, who is still sitting on the table, his tail dangling over the edge. Tom-Tom sits up in wonder as he examines the tail before pulling it. Cut to a surprised Momo who is pulled down to the ground in mid bite. He pulls a giggling Tom-Tom along as he tries to get away from his grasp. Momo pulls free and jumps out of the window on to the railing. As he looks back, he sees that the baby stumbles toward him with his arms spread out wide. Momo backs away, leaping of the railing and flying away.

title: Return to Omashu
text: The baby is too late to grab Momo, so he tumbles off the railing. While he is sliding down the roof, he cannot stop giggling. He lands in a box of berries sliding down one of Omashu's chutes. Momo lands on the same box and starts to stuff his face again. His eyes open wide as Tom-Tom emerges behind him. The baby grabs Momo's tail and bites it. The lemur jumps in the air and frantically flaps his wings in an attempt to get away once more. As the slope becomes steeper, Momo is able to lift himself as well as Tom-Tom who is still clinging on to his tail. The lemur cannot bear the weight and they start to descend. Tom-Tom is being dragged over the ground as they crash-land. Tom-Tom rolls over the ground and lands on top of Momo, pinning him to the ground, and causing him to screech and shake around desperately.

title: Return to Omashu
text: The moaning crowd passes them by, diverting Tom-Tom attention away from Momo. Momo escapes into the crowd. The baby pushes himself to his feet and staggers after the crowd, out of the gates.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Cut to the Fire Nation circus at night. Upon entering, performers in two Chinese dragon's costumes are dancing. As they move out of the frame, the circus master, Shuzumu, stands before the circus' main ring, addressing the crowd.

title: Return to Omashu
text: We're deeply honored to have the Fire Lord's daughter at our humble circus.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Switch to a shot from the back, revealing Azula sitting in high box seat with two guards at her side.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Uh ... tell us if there is anything we can do to make the show more enjoyable.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Cut to a close-up of Azula.

title: Return to Omashu
text: I will.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Cut to a shot of the circus ring. The camera moves up, revealing a net spanned under an acrobat who is balancing on a rope, high up in the air on one hand. The camera zooms in. The acrobat is Ty Lee, who is wearing very colorful clothing.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Incredible. Do you think she'll fall?

title: Return to Omashu
text: Of course not.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Then wouldn't it make it more interesting if you removed the net?

title: Return to Omashu
text: Azula looks directly at Shuzumu. Close-up of the concerned look upon his face.

title: Return to Omashu
text: [Concerned.] Uh ... the thing is ... the performers ...

title: Return to Omashu
text: You're right, you're right. That's been done. [After a short pause, she continues with a tone of dark pleasure.] I know. Set the net on fire.

title: Return to Omashu
text: [Worried.] Of course, Princess.

title: Return to Omashu
text: With a worried look upon his face, Shuzumu leaves the box to set the net of fire. Ty Lee looks down in concern at the consuming flames beneath her. She continues with her act.

title: Return to Omashu
text: [Ecstatic.] Brilliant, just brilliant! [She looks down at Shuzumu and asks happily.] Ooh, what kind of dangerous animals do you have?

title: Return to Omashu
text: Shuzumu looks up, hopeful that he can change the subject to the animals and save Ty Lee from her burning peril.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Well, our circus boasts the most exotic assortment-

title: Return to Omashu
text: Release them all!

title: Return to Omashu
text: Shuzumu looks utterly shocked by Azula's command. Close-up again of Ty Lee's worried face, as she is still balancing on one hand above the flames. Cut to an outside-view of the circus. As the camera pans up, several animal noises fill the night.

title: Return to Omashu
text: [Sadly.] We looked everywhere. No Bumi.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Katara hugs him. Flopsie moans sadly, so Sokka turns around and hugs Flopsie's face.

title: Return to Omashu
text: We've got a problem. We just did a head count.

title: Return to Omashu
text: [Worried, turns back to Yung.] Oh no. Did someone get left behind?

title: Return to Omashu
text: No, we have an extra.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Yung points to something to the left. Katara gazes in that direction and sees Momo staggering forward with the Tom-Tom clamped around his neck. Team Avatar and Yung just stare for a second at the poor animal and the baby.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Cut to the governor's house in Omashu. The governor's wife is sobbing on the balcony. Her daughter Mai slowly reaches into her robe and pulls out a handkerchief and gives it to her mother with a bored expression on her face. The governor rests his hands on the railing of the balcony as he stares out over his city. His sobbing wife, apathetic daughter and two guards stand behind him. Zoom toward the governor as he speaks.

title: Return to Omashu
text: So, the resistance has kidnapped my son. Everything so clever, so tricky. Just like their King Bumi.

title: Return to Omashu
text: He balls his right hand into a fist. One of the guards behind him steps forward.

title: Return to Omashu
text: What do you want to do, sir?

title: Return to Omashu
text: The camera pans out, showing a panoramic view of the city.

title: Return to Omashu
text: What an exquisite performance. I can't wait to see how you'll top yourself tomorrow.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Cut closer to Ty Lee. Azula and Ty Lee's face are visible in Ty Lee's mirror.

title: Return to Omashu
text: [Smiling at Azula's reflection in the mirror.] I'm sorry Azula, but unfortunately there won't be a show tomorrow.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Really?

title: Return to Omashu
text: [Hangs up her tiara.] The universe has given me strong hints that it's time for a career change. [She gets up and turns around to face Azula.] I want to join you on your mission.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Zoom to a satisfied looking Azula.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Switch back to an overview shot of the campsite in the valley. The gang, the baby, Flopsie and three resistance fighters are sitting at one of the many campfires. The baby is still trying to catch Momo. The lemur leaps out of the way and the baby tumbles down, right next to Sokka's club. He picks it up and starts to suck on it. The camera moves back as Sokka snatches the club out of the baby's hands.

title: Return to Omashu
text: No! Bad Fire Nation baby!

title: Return to Omashu
text: The child starts to cry. Katara looks from the baby to Sokka and whacks him across the face before placing her hands on her hips in a motherly fashion.

title: Return to Omashu
text: [Annoyed.] Oh ... all right.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Sokka gives his club back to the baby who immediately stops crying and starts to play with it. Katara hugs him from behind.

title: Return to Omashu
text: [Baby voice.] Oooh, you're so cute. [She kisses him on the cheek, while an annoyed Sokka looks the other side, resting his head on his hand.] Mmmmm ...

title: Return to Omashu
text: Cut to Yung sitting on the other side of the fire.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Sure he's cute now, but when he's older, he'll join the Fire Nation army. [Switch to Katara who is happily playing with the baby under the annoyed gaze of her brother.] You won't think he's so cute then. He'll be a killer.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Katara picks the baby up and shows him to Yung.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Does that look like the face of a killer to you?

title: Return to Omashu
text: Cut to a close-up of Yung whose face remains totally indifferent at the sight of the cute baby.

title: Return to Omashu
text: A messenger hawk!

title: Return to Omashu
text: Close-up of the canister on the hawk's back. It has the Fire Nation insignia on it. Aang unrolls the scroll, close-up of the message.

title: Return to Omashu
text: It's from the Fire Nation governor. He thinks we kidnapped his son. [Switch to another view. Aang is shown standing at the other side of the campfire, reading the message.] So ... he wants to make a trade. His son [Zoom to Aang's surprised face while he continues dramatically, his eyes widening.] for King Bumi.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Switch to a panoramic view by day of the mountains surrounding Omashu. Aang holds the baby in his arms while he stares at Omashu. He walks down the hill he was standing on toward Katara and Sokka, who are waiting next to Appa.

title: Return to Omashu
text: You realize we're probably walking right into a trap.

title: Return to Omashu
text: I don't think so. I'm sure the governor wants his son back as much as we want Bumi. [Smiling at the sleeping baby he holds against his chest.] It's a new day. I have a good feeling about this.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Cut to inside the city of Omashu. A royal palanquin is being carried up the stairs toward the house of the governor. The silhouette of Azula can be seen through the veils. At the base of next stairs, the lonely figure of Mai awaits the arrival of the palanquin. Azula gets out and she and Ty Lee walk over to Mai. They halt before her. Mai puts her hands together and bows slightly toward Azula.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Please tell me you're here to kill me.

title: Return to Omashu
text: A close-up of Mai. She looks up at Azula and a slight smile appears on her otherwise emotionless features. Both girls start to laugh.

title: Return to Omashu
text: [Placing her hands on Mai's shoulders.] It's great to see you, Mai.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Ty Lee rushes forward to give Mai a big hug. Mai uncomfortably pats her back a little with her left hand.

title: Return to Omashu
text: I thought you ran off and joined the circus. You said it was your calling.

title: Return to Omashu
text: [Releases Mai.] Well, Azula called a little louder.

title: Return to Omashu
text: I have a mission and I need you both. [Azula places a hand on both her friends' shoulders.]

title: Return to Omashu
text: Count me in. Anything to get me out of this place. [She looks annoyed at the palace.]

title: Return to Omashu
text: Cut to a large red flag with the black Fire Nation mark on it. The camera pans down and shows that Azula is sitting on the throne of Omashu, flanked by two Fire Nation guards. The governor and his wife are in front of her, as well as Mai and Ty Lee.

title: Return to Omashu
text: I apologize. [Switch to a closer shot of the governor who squatting down on a pillow.] You've come to Omashu at a difficult time. At noon we're making a trade with the resistance to get Tom-Tom back.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Yes, I'm so sorry to hear about your son, but really, [She crosses her legs and clasps her hands.] what did you expect by just letting all the citizens leave? [She stands up, addressing the governor in a harsher tone.] My father has trusted you with this city and you're making a mess of things! [She emphasizes her words with a hand gesture.]

title: Return to Omashu
text: The governor and his wife prostrate themselves before her.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Forgive me, Princess.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Azula walks between the four bowing people in front of her, looking down upon the governor.

title: Return to Omashu
text: You stay here. [Mai and Ty Lee get up behind her.] Mai will handle the hostage trade so you don't have a chance to mess it up. [Cut to a shot of the still smoking city of Omashu, followed by some shots of Fire Nation construction sites.] And there is no more "Omashu". I'm renaming it in honor of my father, the city of New Ozai.

title: Return to Omashu
text: The camera stops on a large statue of Ozai, still in its scaffolds. The camera pans down. A long overview shot reveals Aang, Katara and Sokka standing on a large wooden scaffold. They look serious as a party of three girls approaches, with Mai leading the way.

title: Return to Omashu
text: [Chuckling.] Hi, everybody!

title: Return to Omashu
text: Aang smiles as he sees his friend. The cage touches the ground behind Azula and the rest.

title: Return to Omashu
text: You brought my brother?

title: Return to Omashu
text: He's here. We're ready to trade.

title: Return to Omashu
text: [To Mai.] I'm sorry, but a thought just occurred to me. Do you mind?

title: Return to Omashu
text: Bumi follows the conversation, shifting his eyes from one speaker to the other.

title: Return to Omashu
text: [Turning to Azula.] Of course not, Princess Azula.

title: Return to Omashu
text: We're trading a two year old for a king. [Looks up at Bumi.] A powerful, earthbending king?

title: Return to Omashu
text: [Nods.] Mmm hmmm!

title: Return to Omashu
text: It just doesn't seem like a fair trade, does it?

title: Return to Omashu
text: Close-up of Mai's gray eyes as she ponders over the idea. She looks at her brother who yawns and happily rests his head against Sokka's shoulder.

title: Return to Omashu
text: You're right. [Azula smiles slyly while Mai walks forward.] The deal's off.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Mai holds up her hand, gesturing the guards to pull Bumi back up. As the chains reel in from above, the King is suspended in the air once again.

title: Return to Omashu
text: [Clearly amused by all this.] Whhhoa! See you all later!

title: Return to Omashu
text: Bumi chuckles and snorts as he is lifted from the scenery. Aang watches him go.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Bumi!

title: Return to Omashu
text: He sprints forward with his glider at the ready, increasing his speed with airbending. Azula tries to stop him by blocking his path with a mighty stream of blue flames. Aang dodges these by leaping high up into the air. Azula is completely shocked by this incredible jump. Aang briefly touches the scaffolding around the statue and pushes himself off, opening his glider in mid air. While opening his glider, he loses his hat, leaving his arrow tattoo exposed. He holds on to the hat with his teeth.

title: Return to Omashu
text: [Surprised.] The Avatar!

title: Return to Omashu
text: Aang circles up toward Bumi's coffin. Cut back to Azula who smiles smugly.

title: Return to Omashu
text: My lucky day.

title: Return to Omashu
text: She runs over to a pulley and blast through the rope that serves as a break. The winch begins to spin rapidly. Azula grabs hold to the rope and is pulled up rapidly toward the top of the construction scaffolding.

title: Return to Omashu
text: [Surprised.] Aang, is that you? Where did you come from?

title: Return to Omashu
text: Hang on! We're gonna get you out of here.

title: Return to Omashu
text: He takes a deep breath of starts to blow a cold wind on the chain that is lifting Bumi up. The chain slowly starts to freeze.

title: Return to Omashu
text: We've got to get the baby out of here!

title: Return to Omashu
text: [Blows on the bison whistle before looking at his sister with a big smile.] Way ahead of ya! [Tom-Tom reaches for the whistle and starts to play with it.]

title: Return to Omashu
text: Cut to an overview shot of Sokka and Katara running to the edge of the big platform. Before they can reach it, Ty Lee's fist emerges from one of the holes in the floor and punches Sokka's foot, causing him to fall over and slide toward the edge. He protectively clutches the baby in his arms, preparing for the worst, but they stop just in time.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Aang, stop your blowing for a minute.

title: Return to Omashu
text: A close-up shows that he finally succeeds in freezing the chain, when an explosion occurs on top of the scaffolding. Azula is propelled in the air and shoots a plume of blue fire toward Aang with a powerful kick. Aang startles by her sudden appearance and swift attack. He deflects the flame with a strong air current of his own.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Now hold on just a [The swing of Aang's staff breaks the frozen chain and they freefall down.] duahhh!!!

title: Return to Omashu
text: Aang turns over Bumi's coffin, so he would crash to the ground head first. As they are about to crash upon one of Omashu's chutes, Aang creates an air ball under them to break their fall. They rapidly slide down the chute they landed in.

title: Return to Omashu
text: It's just like old times, isn't it, Bumi?

title: Return to Omashu
text: [Looking serious.] Aang, I need to talk to you!

title: Return to Omashu
text: It's good to see you too!

title: Return to Omashu
text: While Aang is still smiling, he notices the fast approach of something in a chute on his left. He turns to see what it is, just as Azula shoots several fire missiles toward them. He spins his staff above his head to deflect them. Both chutes come together and Azula is now behind them. Aang directs a gust at her, but she parts it with her hands clasped together in front of her. She retaliates with several fire blasts. Aang ducks underneath them and starts to peddle with his staff, increasing their speed. They enter a portion of the chute that has wooden arches over it at short intervals. Aang cuts these through with an air blade, making them collapse upon the track. Azula is caught in the dust cloud, knocked up by the falling debris. When her box emerges again, it seems to be empty. Aang does not see Azula anymore and sighs in relief, but his sigh quickly turns into a scream as Azula emerges again from the box, sending another beam of fire toward him. Aang drops flat on his belly to avoid it. Cut back to the large wooden platform where Mai and Katara are still fighting. Mai dodges Katara's water whips and answers her attacks by shooting stiletto's out of the launcher attached to her leg. Katara easily defends herself by freezing the water to create an ice wall. Mai uses this time to charge Katara head on. The waterbender defends herself by capturing Mai's right arm in a stream of water and freezing it. Mai tries to break the ice, but fails. Ty Lee climbs on the platform behind Katara. She bounces toward Katara and hits her with several quick jabs on her arms. Katara is surprised by this attack and loses control over her water stream that splashes on the ground. She tries to raise the water again, but it only moves a little.

title: Return to Omashu
text: [Taunting.] How are you gonna fight without your bending?

title: Return to Omashu
text: Mai pulls out a sai from her robe and takes aim at a shocked Katara. Just as she is about to throw the weapon, Sokka's boomerang knocks it out of her hand. Ty Lee and Mai spin around to see Sokka flying in on Appa.

title: Return to Omashu
text: [Catching the boomerang.] I seem to manage!

title: Return to Omashu
text: Sokka and Appa land between Katara and her attackers. As Appa lands, he slams his tail hard on the ground, sending Mai and Ty Lee flying off the scaffolding.

title: Return to Omashu
text: There's Aang!

title: Return to Omashu
text: [Gazing in the direction Katara pointed.] We can catch him!

title: Return to Omashu
text: With a growl, Appa changes course toward Aang.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Hang on, Bumi! Our ride's here!

title: Return to Omashu
text: Appa swerves to avoid another blue fire blast. As he pulls closer again, Aang lifts up the coffin by hitting the side of the chute. Katara and Sokka try to grab hold of the coffin as it passes overhead, but they cannot reach it. Bumi screams as he and Aang fall down. Aang moves the coffin to a more horizontal position in midair. Their fall is broken by another chute as they land crosswise on it, breaking right through. They land on another chute and start to slide down once again with Azula on their trail.

title: Return to Omashu
text: [Shocked.] You could earthbend? All along?

title: Return to Omashu
text: Well, they didn't cover my face.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Bumi strains himself again in effort and raises another earth pillar to stop their descent down the chute. The coffin hits it and ends up standing straight atop the rock, while Aang lands in front of it, looking up at his friend.

title: Return to Omashu
text: [Slightly annoyed and angry.] I don't understand. Why didn't you free yourself? Why did you surrender when Omashu was invaded? What's the matter with you, Bumi?

title: Return to Omashu
text: [Calmly.] Listen to me, Aang. There are options in fighting, called jing. It's a choice of how you direct your energy.

title: Return to Omashu
text: [Cut to a close-up of an annoyed Aang, counting along on his fingers as he sums up the different jings.] I know! There's positive jing when you're attacking, and negative jing when you're retreating.

title: Return to Omashu
text: [Happily smiling.] ... and neutral jing when you do nothing!

title: Return to Omashu
text: [He looks shocked at his three raised fingers.] There areÂ three jings?

title: Return to Omashu
text: Well, technically there are eighty-five, but let's just focus on the third. Neutral jing is the key to earthbending. It involves listening and waiting for the right moment to strike.

title: Return to Omashu
text: [Starting to understand.] That's why you surrendered, isn't it?

title: Return to Omashu
text: Yes, and it's why I can't leave now.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Aang sadly turns around.

title: Return to Omashu
text: [Disappointed.] I guess I need to find someone else to teach me earthbending.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Your teacher will be someone who has mastered neutral jing. You need to find someone who waits and listens before striking.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Momo lands on Aang's shoulders.

title: Return to Omashu
text: [Happily.] Hey, Momo!

title: Return to Omashu
text: Momo's mastered a few jings himself!

title: Return to Omashu
text: Momo screeches loudly at Bumi.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Goodbye, Aang. I'll see you when the time is right.

title: Return to Omashu
text: King Bumi lets his coffin tumble backward and begins his ascend of the chute. He laughs and snorts like a mad man while he uses his earthbending to drive him back to the top of the chute, leaving Aang and Momo behind.

title: Return to Omashu
text: So, we're tracking down your brother and Uncle, huh?

title: Return to Omashu
text: [Turning to Mai.] It'll be interesting seeing Zuko again, [Teasing.] won't it, Mai?

title: Return to Omashu
text: Mai looks away as a smile plays upon her face.

title: Return to Omashu
text: It's not just Zuko and Iroh anymore. [Cut closer to Azula who continues on a serious tone.] We have a third target now.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Scene fades to Aang that night, peeking down over the gutter of the governor's house. The governor holds his wife while they are looking over the city with a sad expression on their face. Aang silently lands behind them and drops off Tom-Tom. Aang takes off again while the child toddles toward his parents. As they hear the cooing of the child, they turn around, gasping with surprise and excitement.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Tom-Tom!

title: Return to Omashu
text: The governor and his wife joyfully take the baby up into their arms under the watchful eye of Aang who is sitting on the roof. He smiles at the happy scene of the reunited family before he takes off.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Fades to credits.

title: Return to Omashu
text: Aang

title: The Swamp
text: The episode opens with an overhead shot of rice paddies. The camera pans down, revealing an Earth Kingdom village. The scene cuts to a shot of a bridge over a nearby stream. People carrying backpacks and other loads walk back and forth over the bridge, either entering or departing the small village.

title: The Swamp
text: [Somewhat enthusiastically.] Spare coins for weary travelers?

title: The Swamp
text: The pedestrian tosses a couple of copper pieces into Iroh's hat as Zuko turns to Iroh in anger.

title: The Swamp
text: [Angrily, with his arms folded.] This is humiliating! We're royalty! These people should be giving us whatever we want.

title: The Swamp
text: They will if you ask nicely. [A peasant woman strolls past; somewhat dramatically.] Spare change for a hungry old man?

title: The Swamp
text: [Withdrawing a coin from her sleeve.] Aw, here you go.

title: The Swamp
text: The coin is appreciated, but not as much as your smile!

title: The Swamp
text: Zuko slaps his forehead in frustration as the young girl giggles lightly and walks away. As soon as she walks away, a man with dual broadswords on his back wanders up to Iroh and Zuko.

title: The Swamp
text: [Smiling.] How about some entertainment in exchange for ... a gold piece? [He pulls the piece from his pocket with a flourish.]

title: The Swamp
text: [Annoyed.] We're not performers.

title: The Swamp
text: [Standing up.] Not professional anyway. [He puts the hat down and stands up, swaying lightly as he begins to sing.] It's a long, long way to Ba Sing Se, but the girls in the city, they look so pretty!

title: The Swamp
text: [Annoyed with the quality of the entertainment.] Come on, we're talking a gold piece here! Let's see some action! [Zuko glances up sharply as the man withdraws his swords.] Dance!

title: The Swamp
text: The man begins to slice the ground near Iroh's feet; Iroh hops up and down to "dodge" the attacks while Zuko struggles to control his anger at the man. A birds-eye shot of the street shows other citizens have stopped to watch the spectacle.

title: The Swamp
text: [Singing.] They kiss so sweet that you really got to meet the girls from Ba Sing Se!

title: The Swamp
text: [Stops slicing and laughs.] Ha, ha! Nothing like a fat man dancing for his dinner! Here ya go! [Tosses the gold coin onto the ground and walks away.]

title: The Swamp
text: [Dramatically; close to tears.] Such a kind man.

title: The Swamp
text: Zuko glares after the man in anger and humiliation. The camera cuts to Appa, flying through a gray sky over a large forested area; it is covered somewhat by fog, and looks rather menacing. Sokka is rubbing a whetstone against his machete, while Katara is studying a scroll. Aang stares at the swamp, and seems to be in a trance. Sokka notices they were slowly flying down, and notices Aang's trance-like state.

title: The Swamp
text: [To Aang.] Hey, you taking us down for a reason? [Aang continues to stare at the swamp.] Aang, [Aang snaps out of the trance.] why are we going down?

title: The Swamp
text: [Confused.] What? I didn't even notice.

title: The Swamp
text: The camera zooms out to see Appa flying down toward the swamp

title: The Swamp
text: Are you noticing now?

title: The Swamp
text: [Moving to the front of the saddle.] Is something wrong?

title: The Swamp
text: [He still seems somewhat dazed by the swamp.] I know this is going to sound weird, but I think the swamp is calling to me.

title: The Swamp
text: [Holding his stomach.] Is it telling you where we can get something to eat?

title: The Swamp
text: No, I ... I think it wants us to land there.

title: The Swamp
text: [Shrugging.] No offense to the swamp, but I don't see any land there to land on.

title: The Swamp
text: I don't know. Bumi said to learn earthbending I would have to wait and listen, and now I'm actually hearing the earth. Do you want me to ignore it?

title: The Swamp
text: Sokka, Katara and Momo look over Appa's saddle down at the swamp

title: The Swamp
text: Yes.

title: The Swamp
text: I don't know. There's something ominous about that place.

title: The Swamp
text: Momo hides inside Appa's saddle as Appa groans.

title: The Swamp
text: See, even Appa and Momo don't like it here.

title: The Swamp
text: [Resignedly.] Okay, since everyone feels so strongly about this, [Looks at swamp.] bye swamp. [Shakes Appa's rope.] Yip, Yip!

title: The Swamp
text: Appa groans and flies upward, away from the swamp. A tornado suddenly emerges from out of nowhere, heading right for Appa. Sokka, hearing something, turns around and finally sees it.

title: The Swamp
text: [Panicked.] You better throw in an extra "yip"! We gotta move!

title: The Swamp
text: Appa starts to fly faster, attempting to avoid the tornado, however he is not fast enough to get away. As the tornado begins to move closer to Appa, the wind pulls Sokka right off from the saddle. Katara manages to grab his hand, holding him back from flying into the tornado. Aang jumps up onto Appa's saddle and creates an air shield around Appa, stabilizing the air and allowing Sokka to fall back into the saddle, uninjured. The wind sucks Appa, who is still protected by the air shield, into the tornado. Aang struggles to maintain the air shield, however as it shrinks, one of Appa's legs slips from the protective air, thereby breaking it. Aang, Katara, and Sokka fall off Appa, with Aang landing lightly in muddied water as the latter two land quite roughly. Appa and Momo are thrown elsewhere in the swamp.

title: The Swamp
text: [Looking around the swamp and at his friends.] Where's Appa and Momo? [Aang jumps up to the top of the trees, looking for his animal friends as he uses the height to search for them.] Appa! Momo!

title: The Swamp
text: The scene cuts back to Katara and Sokka. Katara glances at her elbow before looking up at her brother.

title: The Swamp
text: [Pointing blandly.] Sokka, you've got an elbow leech.

title: The Swamp
text: [He spins around, panicking, trying to find it.] Where? Where?

title: The Swamp
text: A creature is shown sticking on to Sokka's elbow.

title: The Swamp
text: [Crosses her arms; sarcastically.] Where do you think?

title: The Swamp
text: [Ripping off the elbow leech and throwing it behind to Katara. He cries out angrily.] Why do things keep attaching to me?!

title: The Swamp
text: Aang swings over the muddied water on a vine, waiting for it to stop moving so he can land.

title: The Swamp
text: You couldn't find them?

title: The Swamp
text: [Jumping down into the muddy water.] No, and the tornado ... it just disappeared.

title: The Swamp
text: Katara and Sokka turn to face the darkness in the swamp. The scene switches to Appa, who is hanging suspended over the swamp, caught in a mass of vines. Momo jumps up from the saddle and begins chewing through the vines. Appa falls, with Momo, into the muddy water. He shakes the water from his fur and takes off flying, before again becoming trapped. Appa groans as Momo berates him, before the lemur begins to cut the vines, again. The scene switches back to Aang, Katara, and Sokka.

title: The Swamp
text: [Cutting the vines with his machete.] We better speed things up.

title: The Swamp
text: [To Sokka.] Maybe we should be a little nicer to the swamp.

title: The Swamp
text: [Continuing to cut the vines.] Aang, these are just plants. Do you want me to say "please" and "thank you" as I swing my machete back and forth?

title: The Swamp
text: Maybe you should listen to Aang. Something about this place feels ... alive.

title: The Swamp
text: I'm sure there are lots of things that are alive here and if we don't wanna wind up getting eaten by them, we need to find Appa as fast as we can.

title: The Swamp
text: Sokka continues to slice through the vines. The shot changes perspective to show Aang, Katara and Sokka through the vines, as though someone is looking at them. The scene changes to Appa and Momo. Appa is walking on the wet, muddy ground, trailing his footprints behind, carrying Momo on his back. A tree trunk happens to be in Appa's way, and the bison collapses to the ground, unwilling to attempt flying over it or crawling beneath it. Momo takes Aang's bison whistle and blows it to make Appa move. The bison ignores it the first time, growling angrily, but when Momo blows it a second time, he uses his tail to squash the lemur. Dazed from the blow, Momo sways and collapses. The scene changes back to Aang, Katara, and Sokka, now walking through a foggier part of the swamp.

title: The Swamp
text: [Yelling.] Appa! Momo!

title: The Swamp
text: There's no way they can hear us and no way we can see them. We'll have to make camp for the night.

title: The Swamp
text: Several flies surround Sokka. Sokka swings his machete at them, trying to shoo them away. At that moment, a huge bubble of swamp gas rises from the muddy water below them. The gas grows closer to Aang, Katara, and Sokka.

title: The Swamp
text: What was that?

title: The Swamp
text: Nothing, just swamp gas. [Indicating.] Look, there's nothing supernatural going on here.

title: The Swamp
text: The three groan as the smell reaches them, with Sokka waving his hand in front of his nose as Katara clamps hers shut. Suddenly, the quiet is shattered by a terrifying scream, causing them all to scream and huddle together, looking around wide-eyed for the source. The camera zooms backward, showing a small, grumpy-looking white bird. It opens its beak extremely wide, emitting the terrifying scream, and flutters off.

title: The Swamp
text: [Sweating, his voice cracking.] I think we should build a fire.

title: The Swamp
text: Sokka runs off to a nearby tree and cuts pieces of wood from its roots. Aang and Katara walk up to Sokka.

title: The Swamp
text: Sokka, the longer we're here, the more I think you shouldn't be doing do that.

title: The Swamp
text: No, I asked the swamp. It said this was fine. [Grabs a nearby root.] Right, swamp? [Shakes the root and fakes a reply.] "No problem, Sokka!"

title: The Swamp
