text: Sokka continues to chop up the roots, while Aang looks somewhat annoyed. The scene changes to a later shot of the trio around a fire. Katara glancing around at the swamp.

title: The Swamp
text: Does anyone else get the feeling that we're being watched?

title: The Swamp
text: Sokka is shown with a fly buzzing around him. He does not seems scared anymore.

title: The Swamp
text: Please, we're all alone out here.

title: The Swamp
text: Sokka uses his machete to try and scare the fly off. The fly turns into a big, shining ball of light. It flies away from the gang, illuminating over a dozen pairs of eyes staring at them. They turn around and see them.

title: The Swamp
text: Except for them.

title: The Swamp
text: They turn back around and huddle together.

title: The Swamp
text: [His calm demeanor vanishing.] Right, except for them.

title: The Swamp
text: The scene changes to Appa and Momo, who are lying down on a giant tree branch. The constant nocturnal noises echoing around them has Momo scuttling frantically from one end of the saddle to the other whilst chittering in fear. Appa, unable to sleep by the noise, growls loudly, causing the noises to stop, and Momo settles down on Appa's saddle. As Momo begins to close his eyes, another small sound is heard, causing his ears to perk up and his eyes to widen. The scene changes back to Aang, Katara, and Sokka. The camp fire is beginning to die out, and the three friends are huddled together, sleeping. Another perspective shot shows someone looking at them through the vines. A vine snakes its way to Sokka's leg, which is sticking out, and begins to wind around both it and Sokka's whole body.

title: The Swamp
text: Guys?

title: The Swamp
text: The scene fades to a shot of Appa's footprint, which is now filled with swamp water. Two figures are looking down at the footprint. Due is tall and skinny, while his friend Tho is short and fat. Both wear small, animal skin loincloths and have a single, large leaf on their heads to serve as a hat. Tho is carrying a stick, and uses it to indicate the animal track.

title: The Swamp
text: What'd you reckon make a track like that, Tho?

title: The Swamp
text: Don't know, Due. [Points his stick at the footprint.] Some'in with six legs. Pretty big'uns too.

title: The Swamp
text: The camera pans up to reveal more of Appa's tracks in the mud.

title: The Swamp
text: Leaves a nice, wide trail to folla'.

title: The Swamp
text: You know what's at the end of that trail?

title: The Swamp
text: Due shakes his head in the negative. Cut to a close-up of Tho's smiling face.

title: The Swamp
text: [Grinning.] Dinner.

title: The Swamp
text: The scene cuts to Appa swimming in the marshy water before cutting to a close-up of Momo. A fly is buzzing around his head, and he watches it, shifting his eyes from side to side. It flies off, and Momo goes after it. He lands on a nearby tree root, still attempting to catch the fly. He hops from tree root to tree root, following the fly, although unknowingly lands on the back of a catgator. He catches the fly on the last root, but lets go of it as he jumps to fly away from the creature. It pursues Momo as he flies back to Appa. The camera pans left, following the chase. When Momo and the crocodile reach Appa, the sky bison's mouth is open and the catgator swims right into it. Appa holds the creature there for a moment, before spitting it back out. Momo and the catfish crocodile hiss at each other for a moment, and the crocodile swims off. The scene cuts back to Appa, who shakes his head and loudly groans.

title: The Swamp
text: [Calling out.] Aang! Sokka!

title: The Swamp
text: Ahead of Katara is another Water Tribe woman, her back facing Katara. She wears the same robe as Katara and has the same hair style. Katara begins walking toward the figure.

title: The Swamp
text: Hello? Hello? Can you help me? [She squints.] Mom? [More loudly and running toward the figure.] Mom!

title: The Swamp
text: Katara runs to the figure, her eyes streaming tears of joy. She reaches the figure and places a hand on her shoulder.

title: The Swamp
text: I can't believe ...

title: The Swamp
text: The smile leaves her face as the scene begins to lighten. Katara stands in front of a tree stump as she realizes the figure was only an illusion. Katara gasps, falling to her knees as she begins to cry. It cuts to an overhead shot of the very devastated Katara, and fades to shot of Sokka's hand holding his machete in the air. The rest of Sokka appears.

title: The Swamp
text: Aang! [While slashing at the vines.] Stupid swamp! Dumb, ugly vines! Katara! [He becomes caught, and grunts with exertion before slicing himself free.] You think you're so tough, huh?

title: The Swamp
text: Sokka trips over as he cuts through the vine in which he was tangled, falling offscreen with his face in the mud. Upon lifting up his head, he sees an image of Yue in a beam of light not far in front of him. Sokka stands up, puts away his machete and starts walking toward Yue.

title: The Swamp
text: Hello? Yue? [He takes a hold of his head, before removing his hands and shrugging, turning away from the apparition.] This is just a trick of the light ... swamp gas ... I ... hit my head running away last night. I'm going crazy. [Almost fearfully, he turns around and walks closer.]

title: The Swamp
text: [Accusingly.] You didn't protect me.

title: The Swamp
text: Sokka rubs his eyes in disbelief, opening them to find that Yue has disappeared. Sokka sighs in relief, but as he turns around he falls over backward, startled at seeing Yue right before his eyes again. The image of Yue disappears immediately after that and Sokka stands up and pulls his machete back out, almost threateningly.

title: The Swamp
text: Katara! Appa!

title: The Swamp
text: Upon wading through the swamp, Aang notices an unfamiliar girl in a dress standing on a hill, accompanied by a winged pig.

title: The Swamp
text: Hello? Who are you?

title: The Swamp
text: The pig flies off and the girl giggles, before turning around and running away.

title: The Swamp
text: Hey, come back! [He holds his hand out as though to grab her.]

title: The Swamp
text: Aang jumps to the top of the hill, only to find she has completely disappeared from his sight. Hearing her laugh again, Aang turns around only to see her running across the limbs of another tree. He uses the vines, however before he can even reach his destination, the girl has moved and is now running across the ground tries to chase the girl. Aang continues his wild chase through the treetops, as the scene switches to show Appa with Momo on his back swimming through the river that flows through the swamp. A little further on the stream, covered by fog, is a group of six swamp tribe members divided over three canoes; Due and Tho sitting in the middle canoe. They look at each other in silence for a few moments, Tho wetting his lips using his tongue. Appa halts as Momo chitters at the strange people.

title: The Swamp
text: Look at that Tho. Is that a little hairy fella ridin' that thing?

title: The Swamp
text: No, that's what they call a "lemoo". Saw one at a traveling show once. Real smart they say.

title: The Swamp
text: Bet he tastes a lot like possum chicken.

title: The Swamp
text: You think everything tastes like possum chicken.

title: The Swamp
text: C'mon now, fellas. [He moves to the front of the boat.] Just a little closer. Nice and easy. Nothing to worry about. We just fixin' to eat ya.

title: The Swamp
text: Appa turns around and takes off in the opposite direction.

title: The Swamp
text: [Annoyed.] What'd you say that fer?

title: The Swamp
text: [Shrugging as he tries to appease his friend.] Well, we are!

title: The Swamp
text: But you don't have to tell 'em that.

title: The Swamp
text: [He shrugs again.] Well how'd I know they'd understand me?

title: The Swamp
text: Come on!

title: The Swamp
text: Due stands up in front of the canoe and starts spinning his arms, bending the water behind his canoe in order to chase Appa. The other two canoes follow suit, trailing behind Appa in a 'V' formation. Appa bounds through the river, desperate to escape the strange people hunting him. The scene switches back to Aang, who is still chasing the girl.

title: The Swamp
text: Who are you?

title: The Swamp
text: Peering through a wall of vegetation, Aang sees the girl on a small hill. Running after her, it is too late to stop as he notices that it is not the girl, but Katara. Aang runs into the waterbender and they both fall over. Sokka hears the commotion and turns around to investigate with his machete cocked - in the wrong direction, as only a few seconds later, Aang and Katara come barreling down the root he is standing on and hit him in the back, knocking him over too.

title: The Swamp
text: [He stands up and puts his machete away.] What do you guys think you're doing!? I've been looking all over for you!

title: The Swamp
text: [She has not moved, although her hand is on her head as she sits on the root they have fallen onto.] Well, I've been wandering around looking for you!

title: The Swamp
text: [He looks away before airbending himself to his feet. He appears embarrassed that he was not actively searching for his friends like they were him.] I was chasing some girl.

title: The Swamp
text: What girl?

title: The Swamp
text: [He walks over to Katara and helps her up before rubbing his ear.] I don't know. I heard laughing and I saw some girl in a fancy dress.

title: The Swamp
text: [Sarcastically, with exaggerated hand movements.] Well, there must be a tea party here and we just didn't get our invitations!

title: The Swamp
text: I thought I saw Mom.

title: The Swamp
text: Look, we were all just scared and hungry and our minds were playing tricks on us. That's why we all saw things out here.

title: The Swamp
text: [Surprised.] You saw something too?

title: The Swamp
text: [He looks away for a moment, before turning back and taking a step closer to his sister.] I thought I saw Yue. But, that doesn't prove anything. Look, I think about her all the time, and you saw Mom, someone you miss a lot.

title: The Swamp
text: What about me? I didn't know the girl I saw. And all our visions led us right here.

title: The Swamp
text: Aang begins walking around, as if looking for something.

title: The Swamp
text: Okay ... so where's here? The middle of the swamp?

title: The Swamp
text: Aang looks around, his gaze finally resting on a massive tree growing right next to him. The camera pans to reveal exactly how enormous the tree really is.

title: The Swamp
text: Yeah, the center ... it's the heart of the swamp. It's been calling us here. I knew it.

title: The Swamp
text: It's just a tree. [He raises his arms above his head.] It can't call anyone. For the last time, there's nothing after us and there's nothing magical happening here.

title: The Swamp
text: As Sokka finishes his tirade, a seaweed monster jumps out from the water. The gang huddles together and screams, separating as the monster begins to attack them. The seaweed monster goes after Sokka first as the trio split up, each running in different directions. Sokka is picked up and swung around, only being released as Aang uses airbending to slice part of the monster's arm off. The monster goes after Aang, flicking the monk away and into the surrounding trees. Sokka is shown fighting with the vines that had him captured only seconds ago, and so intent was he at destroying them, he failed to notice a column rising behind himself. The column attaches to the seaweed monster and Sokka is swiped from the ground. Katara comes to his rescue this time as she slices at the monster's arm. It did not have the desired effect, as more vines grew to patch up the hole her waterbending created. She manages to push the monster back a little, however it is not long before she is flung away. Aang stops to watch her, giving the monster time to attack him. Sokka is absorbed into the chest of the monster as the scene changes to Appa continuing his escape from the Foggy Swamp members. Momo throws objects at them from the back of his friend, attempting to slow them down. One of these such items was a shirt that appears to belong to Sokka at a Foggy Swamp member, resulting in the boat that member was on to spin out of control.

title: The Swamp
text: Now, what would a lemoo need a shirt fer?

title: The Swamp
text: Tho manages to capture Momo after the latter hits a low tree branch and is thrown backward. The loss of his friend encourages Appa to run faster. The scene changes back to the gang fighting the seaweed monster. After using a tornado-like airbending move, Katara freezes Sokka in place before shooting him with water, expelling him from the monster's body. The fight ends as Katara begins to waterbend repeatedly at the monster, slicing through the vines and not allowing the monster to regenerate. A person is seen inside the monster, bending the vines.

title: The Swamp
text: There's someone in there! He's bending the vines!

title: The Swamp
text: With a final slice, Katara cuts through the mask on the seaweed monster, the whole top half falling off. However, this does not stop the monster, and vines spring out of the marsh, capturing Katara high on a pillar. Aang airbends over to the monster and, using his native bending, rips apart the vines.

title: The Swamp
text: [Demanding offensively.] Why did you call me here if you just wanted to kill us!?

title: The Swamp
text: Wait! [The vines drop to reveal a slightly larger man wearing nothing but a leaf loincloth.] I didn't call you here.

title: The Swamp
text: [He shares a look of confusion with Sokka, who is also in an offensive stance.] We were flying over and I heard something calling to me, telling me to land.

title: The Swamp
text: He's the Avatar. Stuff like that happens to us a lot.

title: The Swamp
text: The Avatar? Come with me.

title: The Swamp
text: The trio drop their stances and look at each other. The scene cuts to Huu, leading the gang to the top of the giant tree Aang noticed earlier.

title: The Swamp
text: So, who are you then?

title: The Swamp
text: [Bending a vine out of the way.] I protect the swamp from folks that want to hurt it, like this fella with his big knife.

title: The Swamp
text: See, completely reasonable. [He finally puts his machete away.] Not a monster, just a regular guy defending his home. Nothing mystical about it.

title: The Swamp
text: Oh the swamp is a mystical place all right. It's sacred. I reached enlightenment right here under the banyan-grove tree. [He sits on the tree, looking at the group as he explains.] I heard it calling me, just like you did.

title: The Swamp
text: [Humoring Huu.] Sure you did. It seems real chatty.

title: The Swamp
text: [The camera zooms out as he explains, slowly revealing more and more of the swamp. It shows how large the banyan-grove tree is compared to the others, but at the final magnification, it is impossible to distinguish it from the other trees.] See this whole swamp is actually just one tree spread out over miles. Branches spread and sink, take root, and spread some more. One big, living organism. Just like the entire world.

title: The Swamp
text: [Cuts back to Aang, looking at Huu. He is still openly skeptical.] I get how the tree is one big thing, but the whole world?

title: The Swamp
text: Sure. You think you're any different from me or your friends or this tree? If you listen hard enough, you can hear every living thing breathing together. [Another shot shows the swamp river. There are the sounds of several animals heard in the background.] You can feel everything growing. We're all living together, even if most folks don't act like it. We all have the same roots and we are all branches of the same tree.

title: The Swamp
text: [She and her friends are now sitting, listening to Huu.] But what did our visions mean?

title: The Swamp
text: In the swamp, we see visions of people we've lost, people we loved, folks we think are gone. [The shot cuts to show the people that Sokka and Katara saw in the swamp, before cutting back to Huu.] But the swamp tells us they're not. We're still connected to them. Time is an illusion and so is death.

title: The Swamp
text: But what about my vision? It was someone I had never met.

title: The Swamp
text: You're the Avatar. You tell me.

title: The Swamp
text: [He looks down as he tries to understand.] Time is an illusion. So, it's someone I will meet.

title: The Swamp
text: Huu nods.

title: The Swamp
text: Sorry to interrupt the lesson, but we still need to find Appa and Momo.

title: The Swamp
text: I think I know how to find them. [Aang kneels down and places his hand on the tree.] Everything is connected. [Energy travels from Aang's hand to Appa's location. Appa is seen being captured by the Foggy Swamp members. Back at the banyan-grove tree, Aang stands up.] Come on! We've got to hurry!

title: The Swamp
text: Back to the Foggy Swamp members, Appa is trapped inside a net while Tho sings.

title: The Swamp
text: [Singing and tapping the side of his canoe. Momo is seen struggling inside the sack he has been placed in.] Set my lines by the river bed! Caught ten fish and I killed 'em dead! Cut 'em and gut 'em and I tossed the heads in the water to keep them catgators fed.

title: The Swamp
text: The boats stop when a jet of water appears and destroys the boat next to Tho and Due's. The two people from the destroyed boat fly into the water as Aang appears on a tree branch.

title: The Swamp
text: Appa!

title: The Swamp
text: Aang airbends a stream of air, throwing Tho into the water and freeing Momo who was being held by Tho.

title: The Swamp
text: We're under attack!

title: The Swamp
text: Due scoops up a puddle of water and sends it toward Aang and Katara. The three become engaged in a waterbending fight, with neither side gaining an advantage.

title: The Swamp
text: Hey, you guys are waterbenders!

title: The Swamp
text: You too! That means we're kin! [Due ceases waterbending, followed by a slightly disgusted Katara. He watches as Sokka and Huu run up to the branch Katara and Aang are standing on.] Hey Huu! How you been?

title: The Swamp
text: You know, scared some folks, swung some vines, the usual.

title: The Swamp
text: Huu?

title: The Swamp
text: The scene cuts to the gang sitting around a fire in the Foggy Swamp Tribe. There is a member waterbending some liquid in a pot to stirs it, and Due grabs a fish from the pot before moving over to the fire.

title: The Swamp
text: How you like that possum chicken?

title: The Swamp
text: Tastes just like arctic hen. So why were you guys so interested in eating Appa? [He indicates the catgator lying behind Tho.] You've got plenty of those big things wandering around.

title: The Swamp
text: You want me to eat old Slim? He's like a member of the family!

title: The Swamp
text: Due pulls the fish off the branch and gives it to Slim.

title: The Swamp
text: Nice Slim!

title: The Swamp
text: Sokka throws a bug at the catgator; it bounces off his nose and he growls at Sokka, who cowers slightly.

title: The Swamp
text: [Laughing.] Oh, he don't eat no bugs! That's people food.

title: The Swamp
text: Where'd you say you was from?

title: The Swamp
text: [Smiling. Sokka is shown chewing nonchalantly next to her.] The South Pole.

title: The Swamp
text: Didn't know there was waterbenders anywhere but here. They got a nice swamp there, do they?

title: The Swamp
text: No, it's all ice and snow.

title: The Swamp
text: Hmm. No wonder you left.

title: The Swamp
text: [To Katara.] Well, I hope you realize now that nothing strange was going on here. [He raises his arms for emphasis.] Just a bunch of greasy people living in a swamp.

title: The Swamp
text: What about the visions?

title: The Swamp
text: I told you, we were hungry. I'm eating a giant bug!

title: The Swamp
text: Sokka holds up said giant bug, taking a bit of its abdomen. He swallows it with some difficulty before exhaling sharply, sticking his tongue out.

title: The Swamp
text: [Feeding Momo.] But what about when the tree showed me where Appa and Momo were?

title: The Swamp
text: That's Avatar stuff, that doesn't count. [To Huu.] The only thing I can't figure out is how you made that tornado that sucked us down.

title: The Swamp
text: I can't do anything like that. I just bend the water in the plants.

title: The Swamp
text: Well, no accounting for weather. Still, there's absolutely nothing mysterious about the swamp.

title: The Swamp
text: Cut to a long shot of the camp from across the river. The white screaming bird from earlier lands on a visible tree branch and lets out its horrible cry. A nearby vine rises up and bats the bird into the camera, which goes dark.

title: The Swamp
text: Who's there?

title: The Swamp
text: The scene cuts to a close-up shot of his hands, which are both grabbed by another person. He is disarmed and thrown against some nearby boxes, his swords falling uselessly to the ground. His assailant's feet are seen to approach the sword. He picks them up, the camera in turn reveals that the assailant is the Blue Spirit himself.

title: The Swamp
text: Fades to credits.

title: The Swamp
text: Aang

title: Avatar Day
text: The episode begins by showing a coast before panning down to in the middle of a forest where the gang is asleep, except for Momo. Switch to a view from inside Sokka's open mouth, looking out. A spider has set up its web over his mouth. Momo discovers the spider and inspects it with great interest. When a flies lands on the web, Momo tries to grab it. As he plunges his hand completely in Sokka's mouth, Sokka opens his eyes immediately in surprise. He shoots up and starts to spit out the remains of the spider and its web.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Angrily.] What are you doing in my mouth? [Momo chitters happily while lying upside down on Sokka's belly, chewing on the fly he "rescued" from the spider's web.] Momo, you need to be a little more sensitive to my boundaries.

title: Avatar Day
text: The lemur seems to notice something else on his left. He completely ignores Sokka's comment and climbs on his face, where he erects himself and pricks up his ears to determine what it is he heard. He chitters loudly, waking up Katara, who was sleeping on a nearby sawed off tree trunk.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Shouting from up above as he looks over the campsite.] Give up! You're completely surrounded!

title: Avatar Day
text: An overview shot of the campsite shows that four rhinos are circling around the gang.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Crawling toward Appa.] Come on! Come on! Come on!

title: Avatar Day
text: Sokka climbs aboard Appa, where Aang's already waiting for him. Switch to a closer shot of Katara, as she also makes her way toward Appa. Just before she reaches him, she stops in her tracks and turns around.

title: Avatar Day
text: My scrolls!

title: Avatar Day
text: [Shocked.] My staff!

title: Avatar Day
text: He jumps off Appa's head, while Sokka just manages to get on.

title: Avatar Day
text: Yip yip!

title: Avatar Day
text: Appa rises from the ground, leaving the Rough Rhinos behind. Mongke shoots a fire ball at them as they fly over. Katara and Sokka quickly duck and cover their heads, as the fire ball just misses them. As Sokka erects again, he notices something on the ground.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Stretching out his arm over the saddle as if he wants to grab it.] Wait, my boomerang!

title: Avatar Day
text: The camera zooms out on Sokka's boomerang, which still lies in the middle of their besieged camp.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Grabbing Sokka's arm.] There's no time!

title: Avatar Day
text: [Annoyed.] Oh, I see, [Turning to Katara.] so there's time to get your scrolls [Turning toward Aang.] and time to get your staff, [Looking back at Katara with his hand on his chest.] but no time for my boomerang?

title: Avatar Day
text: [Cheerfully.] That's correct!

title: Avatar Day
text: [Bowing his head in defeat by this totally honest answer.] Oh.

title: Avatar Day
text: Cut to a shot of Mongke, who angrily turns his head as Appa disappears at the horizon.

title: Avatar Day
text: [To a sulking Sokka.] Sorry about your boomerang, Sokka.

title: Avatar Day
text: Camera moves back to show how Sokka sits on the ground in a gloomy mood. Katara is buying supplies is the background.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Sadly.] I feel like I've lost part of my identity. [He jumps up and moves Aang's hat slightly so that he can point at Aang's arrow.] Imagine if you lost your arrow, or Katara lost her ... [Makes a hair loopies gesture with a somewhat bored look.] hair loopies.

title: Avatar Day
text: He slowly saunters over to the stall, where Katara gives him a loving hug in order to comfort him before she holding her hands in front of herself while smiling lovely at Sokka.

title: Avatar Day
text: Here's your produce, ponytail guy.

title: Avatar Day
text: [He picks up the basket full of supplies, looking dejected at the nickname.] I used to be boomerang guy ...

title: Avatar Day
text: Aang and Katara follow Sokka with looks of sympathy as he walks away. The merchant heads toward Katara, who gives him some money.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Surprised, after inspecting the money.] Hey, Water Tribe money!

title: Avatar Day
text: I hope that's okay.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Clutching the coin.] So long as it's money. [The merchant closes his shop, while Katara walks over to Aang, who is trying to console a crying Sokka as the camera pans up to show just the merchant's head.] Have a nice Avatar Day!

title: Avatar Day
text: [Interested.] Avatar Day?

title: Avatar Day
text: [Turning around while waving.] You guys are going to the festival, right?

title: Avatar Day
text: They all look at each other for a moment, trying to figure out what to do. Aang and Katara smile at each other, while tears still run over Sokka's face.

title: Avatar Day
text: There's a holiday for the Avatar. Who knew?

title: Avatar Day
text: They turn around as a large effigy of Avatar Kyoshi rolls by.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Pointing at the float.] Look! They made a giant Kyoshi float!

title: Avatar Day
text: They run to the side. Switch to a close-up of Kyoshi's head. Aang, Sokka and Katara emerge from a side street.

title: Avatar Day
text: And here comes Avatar Roku! [Roku effigy rolls by.]

title: Avatar Day
text: Overview shot of the main square that is packed with people. The giant float of Kyoshi and Roku are being pulled to the middle.

title: Avatar Day
text: Having a huge festival in your honor is great, but frankly, it's just nice to be appreciated.

title: Avatar Day
text: And it's nice to appreciate their deep-fried festival food! [He takes a huge bite out of the food-item he is holding.]

title: Avatar Day
text: [Pointing at a giant float of Aang coming down the street.] Aang, look!

title: Avatar Day
text: That's the biggest me I've ever seen!

title: Avatar Day
text: Close-up as Aang's float pulls up besides that of the other two Avatars on the main square. The camera pans to the right of the floats as a villager carrying a torch comes running down the street.

title: Avatar Day
text: Now a torch, that's a nice prop. It's bright, dangerous ... [Sniffs.] smells manly. But I'm not sure I could carry it off.

title: Avatar Day
text: Sokka takes another bite of his food as Katara points at the runner.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Surprised.] Hey, what's that guy doing?

title: Avatar Day
text: With a loud scream, the runner jumps through the effigy of Kyoshi, causing it to catch fire. The fire spreads rapidly over the whole effigy.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Chanting as Kyoshi's effigy is consumed by the flames.] Down with the Avatar!Â

title: Avatar Day
text: The villagers continue chanting while the runner sets fire to the Roku effigy next. The camera zooms in on Aang, Katara, and Sokka, who are utterly shocked by the turn of events. Sokka's mouth falls open and food drips out.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Wondering.] Where did you get these?

title: Avatar Day
text: [Angrily, while walking away.] What does it matter where they came from?

title: Avatar Day
text: [Seriously.] Mmmm ... [Takes a bite out of one of the cupcakes Zuko brought. The jam drips of his chin. In delight.] ... mmmm!

title: Avatar Day
text: Switch back to the burning effigies of the Avatars in Chin Village as the chants continue. The mayor signals to the torch-bearer, who is now on the roof, to throw his torch. The torch-bearer grins as he takes aim and throws his torch with a grunt right into the right eye of Aang's float. The crowd cheers in approval, while Aang looks at his own effigy burn with a look of pain on his face, closing his own right eye. Katara runs to the front and uses her waterbending to extinguish the flames with water from two large pots nearby.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Angrily pointing an accusing finger at Katara.] That party pooper's ruining Avatar Day!

title: Avatar Day
text: Aang looks angrily at the villager. He airbends himself to the top of his own float and lands on the left shoulder of his still smoking effigy.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Angered.] That party pooper's my friend! [He takes off his hat and throws it away to reveal his arrow.]

title: Avatar Day
text: [Pointing in shock at Aang.] It's the Avatar himself!

title: Avatar Day
text: [Scared.] It's going to kill us with its awesome Avatar powers!

title: Avatar Day
text: No, I'm not, I ...

title: Avatar Day
text: Aang raises his hand. Several villagers run for cover in fear. The villager that spoke earlier throws himself into the audience. Aang looks at his hand and quickly hides it behind his back.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Crawling back on his feet.] I suggest you leave! [He waves them away with a gesture of his hand.] You're not welcome here, Avatar!

title: Avatar Day
text: Katara turns to face the mayor.

title: Avatar Day
text: Why not? Aang helps people.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Landing beside Katara.] It's true! I'm on your side.

title: Avatar Day
text: Camera zooms in slowly on the mayor.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Calmly.] I find that hard to swallow, [Raising his voice.] considering what you did to us in your past life! It was Avatar Kyoshi; she murdered our glorious leader, Chin the Great.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Utterly shocked.] You think that I ... murdered someone?

title: Avatar Day
text: [Lisping and slurring.] We used to be a great society before you killed our leader. [Pointing at himself as the camera zooms in on him.] Now look at us!

title: Avatar Day
text: The villagers next to him look at him in disgust.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Frightened by the appearances of the old man.] Huh!

title: Avatar Day
text: [Katara places her arms on Aang's shoulders and starts to defend him.] Aang would never do something like that. No Avatar would. [Shaking her head in disapproval before pointing an accusing finger at the villagers.] And it's not fair for you all to question his honor!

title: Avatar Day
text: [Raising his arm to emphasize his remark.] Let's tell her what we all think of the Avatar's "honor"!

title: Avatar Day
text: He turns around to shake his rear at Aang and blows a raspberry; the villagers cheer in approval.

title: Avatar Day
text: Give me a chance to clear my name!

title: Avatar Day
text: The only way to prove your innocence is to stand trial.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Confidently.] I'll gladly stand trial!

title: Avatar Day
text: You'll have to follow all our rules. That includes paying bail.

title: Avatar Day
text: No problem.

title: Avatar Day
text: Close-up of Aang's face. His confident look quickly disappears as the camera cuts to the next shot, where he is cuffed with his hands and head stuck in a wooden panel and thrown behind bars. Katara holds her hand before her eyes in shame while Sokka leans against the prison bars. His arms are crossed and he looks annoyed at Aang.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Apologetically.] How was I supposed to know they wouldn't take Water Tribe money?

title: Avatar Day
text: Cut to a panning down shot of the panoramic view of the village. The frame freezes for a moment on the open prison courtyard, where Aang's tunic is clearly visible. Switch to a shot from inside the prison, where Sokka, Katara, and Momo are still standing before the chained up Aang.

title: Avatar Day
text: So some people don't like you, big deal! There's a whole nation of firebenders who hate you. Now let's bust you out of here!

title: Avatar Day
text: I can't.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Upbeat.] Sure you can! A little [Theatrically jumps back and pretends to airbend by blowing air. Katara looks ashamed for her brother. He moves to the back of the room to "cut" the air.] swish-swish-swish! [He makes a grotesque movement with his arm before thrusting his face in the camera.] Airbending slice! [He resumes his place beside Katara, who is still looking annoyed by her brother. He makes a circular motion with his hands and points toward the door.] And we're on our way!

title: Avatar Day
text: Aang looks at Sokka with big eyes.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Slightly mocking.] I think what "Master Swish" is trying to say [Serious tone as she looks at Aang.] is that you're supposed to be out saving the world. You can't do that locked up in here.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Unhappy.] I can't do that with people thinking I'm a murderer either. I need you guys to help prove my innocence.

title: Avatar Day
text: How're we gonna to do that? The crime happened over three hundred years ago.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Cunningly.] That's okay, Sokka. For some reason, I thought you were an expert detective.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Content.] Well, I guess I could be classified as such.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Aiding Aang by playing Sokka's ego.] Yeah! Back home, he was famous for solving the mystery of the missing seal jerky.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Bragging.] Everyone wanted to blame it on the polar leopard, but I figured out it was Old Man Jarko wearing polar leopard boots! [Katara holds her hand to her brow, annoyed by Sokka's monologue.] See, a real eight hundred-pound polar leopard would have left much deeper tracks. [Aang is making fun of Sokka, Katara holds her hand to her mouth to refrain herself from bursting out in laughs.] Okay, I guess I am pretty good.

title: Avatar Day
text: So, you'll help me with my case?

title: Avatar Day
text: [Pretends to ponder about the question. Katara stares at him, trying to figure out what he is doing.] Fine! But I'm going to need some new props. [The camera spins around. When it stops again, Sokka is wearing a hat with a monocle.] I'm ready. [Katara looks surprised at his new outfit and giggles. Sokka extends his monocle to investigate her.] What?

title: Avatar Day
text: Cut to a wagon being pulled by an ostrich horse through the forest. An Earth Kingdom soldier sits in the front, holding the reins. Switch to the inside of the wagon, where a wealthy man in playing with his chest full of gold pieces. He is thrown to the front when the cart suddenly stops. The man looks around in fear, quickly closing and locking the chest with the precious metal. His scared eyes shift from side to side to as he hears rumbling noises outside. He clutches the chest protectively. The cold sweat is dripping down his face. He sighs in relieve as the noise died down, but he swiftly cowers back in fear as two swords pierce the top of the cart. A fist comes crashing down through the ceiling. When the aghast man looks up, he sees that it were the blades of the Blue Spirit that wrecked his cart. He anxiously holds up his treasury toward the Blue Spirit, while trying to stay away from him as far as possible. The Blue Spirit snatches it out of his hands and disappears, leaving the surprised man. The camera moves back to reveal the shocked man in his chart and the unconscious soldier on the ground.

title: Avatar Day
text: This is the crime scene. [Cut to Sokka, who inquisitively looks around. He gazes directly into the camera lens through his magnifying glass, making his left eye appear huge. He moves on to investigate the walls of the shrine, while the mayor is standing at the edge of the cliff, pointing down at something.] This is the footprint of the killer, Kyoshi. [Sokka quickly squats beside the footprint to take a closer look at it.] It was at sunset, 370 years ago today, that she emerged from the temple, and struck down Chin the Great. After that tragic day, we built this statue to immortalize our great leader. [They all look up at a statue of Chin the Great, who has a raised left hand in triumph.] Feel free to appreciate it.

title: Avatar Day
text: The mayor leaves Katara and Sokka alone to investigate things further. Sokka moves in to examine the statue from every possible angle, while Katara looks curiously at him. Sokka is investigating the base of the statue, when something catches his attention. He looks through his magnifying monocle in order to take a better look at the right foot of the statue. His eyes widen as he makes a discovery. He swiftly runs over to the shrine that is facing the statue and examines the stone it is made of.

title: Avatar Day
text: This temple and this statue were cut from the same stone. [Runs back over to the statue.] And we know that the statue was built after Chin died.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Excitedly drawing her conclusions.] So if they were built at the same time, that meansâ

title: Avatar Day
text: Sokka interrupts her before she can reach a conclusion.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Shouting.] Shhh! I wanna solve it! [Pointing at the temple.] That means Kyoshi never set foot in this temple!

title: Avatar Day
text: That's a big hole in the mayor's story, [Disappointed.] but it's not enough to prove Aang's innocence.

title: Avatar Day
text: You're right. [Blows soap bubbles with his dragon shaped pipe, while thinking about their next course of action.] We need to go to Kyoshi Island.

title: Avatar Day
text: Katara walks in the frame, looking at his pipe.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Surprised.] Where did you get that?

title: Avatar Day
text: Cut to the prison in which Aang is being held. An elephant rat sniffles his way over to an acorn. He picks it up and jumps away. Aang, still cuffed, leans dispirited against the wall of the prison. A low voice emerges from the shadows at the other side of the prison.

title: Avatar Day
text: You got a bald head. [Aang looks up in wonder to see who is talking. Switch to Aang's angle of view. A man is standing in the shadows, only his outline is visible.] Some nice tattoos. [The man emerges from the shadows. He has a strong build, earrings in both ears, and his body has a large snake tattoo that covers the top of his chest and down his right arm. He suddenly charges Aang, letting out a load growl. He is stopped in his tracks by the chains around his neck. Aang slides down the wall in fear, while the man addresses him calmly.] You're going to fit in real well around here.

title: Avatar Day
text: Aang smiles awkwardly as the man balls his fist.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Angrily stamping her foot on the ground.] Where's Aangy?

title: Avatar Day
text: [Gently breaks the news to Koko.] He couldn't be here, Koko.

title: Avatar Day
text: The villagers sigh in disappointment.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Nagging.] I wanted to see Aangy ...

title: Avatar Day
text: The foaming mouth guy woozily stands up again, staggering a bit. He looks from left to right, wipes the foam of his face and pulls his tunic over his head, before subtly sneaking away. The rest of the villagers do the same with the exception of Oyaji.

title: Avatar Day
text: Oyaji! Aang is in jail. The town of Chin says he murdered their leader in a past life.

title: Avatar Day
text: They say it was Kyoshi.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Shocked.] Kyoshi? That's crazy talk! I'll take you to her shrine. Maybe something there will help you clear her name.

title: Avatar Day
text: The threesome is walking up a gentle slope.

title: Avatar Day
text: [With feigned casualness.] So, uh ... what's Suki up to? Is she around?

title: Avatar Day
text: Sokka looks around while Katara gives him a loving smile.

title: Avatar Day
text: Actually, she and the other warriors left to fight in the war. You kids had a big impact on Suki. She said you inspired her and she wanted to help change the world.

title: Avatar Day
text: [He disappointedly slants his eyes.] Oh, well ... that's great.

title: Avatar Day
text: They walk under a large paifang gate toward a temple at the top of a hill.

title: Avatar Day
text: This temple was converted into a shrine to Kyoshi. The clerics tell us these relics are still connected to her spirit. That's her kimono.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Approvingly.] She had exquisite taste.

title: Avatar Day
text: Please don't touch!

title: Avatar Day
text: Katara quickly lets go of the robe.

title: Avatar Day
text: These fans ... [He picks up one of the fans and waves it back and forth.] They were her weapons, no?

title: Avatar Day
text: [Sternly.] Also refrain from touching the fans.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Squatting beside a really big pair of brown boots.] These were her boots? Her feet must have been enormous!

title: Avatar Day
text: Momo peeks out one of them. Katara looks surprised to see him there.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Proudly.] The biggest of any Avatar.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Realizing something.] Wait a minute ... big feet? [A flashback shows the much smaller footprint they saw at the edge of the cliff outside Chin Village.] Little footprint? [She happily exclaims her findings.] There's no wayâ

title: Avatar Day
text: Sokka clears his throat to cut her off.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Annoyed.] Special outfit? Hat and pipe? These things mean anything to you?

title: Avatar Day
text: [Sarcastically.] You're right. I'm sorry. [She bows slightly in a mocking gesture.] Please.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Dramatically raises his hand in the air.] Aha! [Showing his own boots to Oyaji.] There's no way Kyoshi could have made that footprint. [Moves toward Katara to explain everything to her.] And therefore there is nothing linking her to the crime scene.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Unimpressed.] Brilliant, Sokka. [Rolls her eyes.]

title: Avatar Day
text: Cut back to an overview shot of Chin Village at sundown. Aang is sitting in a circle with three other inmates.

title: Avatar Day
text: [In a very friendly voice that does not stroke with his scary appearances.] This girl you're talking about? She'll come around. You just gotta hang in there.

title: Avatar Day
text: Aang removes his head and hands out of the wooden panel.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Hopeful.] You think so?

title: Avatar Day
text: Sure.

title: Avatar Day
text: Yeah.

title: Avatar Day
text: You're a catch.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Doubtful.] I don't know ...

title: Avatar Day
text: He rests his head on the board.

title: Avatar Day
text: Hey! You're smart, handsome, funny. Not to mention you're the Avatar.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Smiling sincerely.] You guys are great.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Tears stream down his face while he talk in a very soft voice.] Don't be afraid to tell her how you feel. [He dries his tears and sniffs.]

title: Avatar Day
text: Switch back to Kyoshi's shrine at Kyoshi Island. Oyaji brings Sokka's and Katara's attention to a painting that depicts Kyoshi and some of the villagers.

title: Avatar Day
text: This piece is called "The Birth of Kyoshi". [Sokka investigates the painting thoroughly.] It was painted at sunrise on this day this island was founded. Why, it was today in fact, three hundred and seventy years ago.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Sokka spins around in shock, spitting out some of the bubbles he swallowed. Very surprised.] Three hundred and seventy years? Wait, [He grabs Oyaji by his collar.] are you sure it was today?

title: Avatar Day
text: Oh, seeing how it's Kyoshi Day, yes, [He pulls himself free from Sokka's grasp and throws him back a little.] I'm sure.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Staring at the painting again.] This ceremony didn't take place at sunrise. It took place at sunset. [Addresses Katara.] Look at the shadows.

title: Avatar Day
text: They point east. So the sun must have been in the west.

title: Avatar Day
text: So what?

title: Avatar Day
text: [Shoves Katara out of the way as she yelps.] If Kyoshi was in the ceremony at sunset, she couldn't have been in Chin committing the crime. She has an alibi! [Points his pipe dramatically toward the camera upon making his conclusion.]

title: Avatar Day
text: Katara grabs the pipe out of his hand and slams him hard on the head with it causing him to fall down.

title: Avatar Day
text: Honorable Mayor, we've prepared a solid defense for the Avatar. We did an investigation and found some very strong evidence.

title: Avatar Day
text: While Katara talks, a broadly smiling Sokka leans in toward Aang and points at himself to emphasize that he was the one that discovered the evidence. Aang flashes his teeth in return.

title: Avatar Day
text: Evidence? [Dismissive.] Hmph! That's not how our court system works.

title: Avatar Day
text: Then how can I prove my innocence?

title: Avatar Day
text: Simple. I say what happened [He points to himself, before pointing to Aang.], then you say what happened, and then I decide who's right. [Everyone gasps at once, horrified by this news.] That's why we call it justice. Because it's "just us."

title: Avatar Day
text: The mayor exits the room, laughing maniacally, leaving Sokka, Katara and Aang standing there with their mouths wide open in shock.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Emotionally.] Everyone loved Chin the Great because he was so great. Then the Avatar showed up and killed him, and that's how it happened.

title: Avatar Day
text: He walks away with a giant smile on his face.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Very deep, monotone voice.] The accused will now present its argument.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Raises his hand before his mouth to say some quiet, encouraging words.] You can do it, Aang. Just remember the evidence.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Still tied up, unsure.] Right ... evidence. [He shifts his eyes to the left while he is trying to remember what to say. Enthusiastically.] Ladies and gentlemen ... I'm about to tell you what really happened. And I will prove it with facts. Fact number one. [Raises his finger to count along but blanks out.] Uhhh ...

title: Avatar Day
text: [Whispers.] The footprint!

title: Avatar Day
text: Oh, yeah. You see ... I have very large feet. [The camera tilts down to reveal his small feet. The villagers are unimpressed by his argument.] Furthermore ... your temple matches your statue. [The villagers look from one to the other, not knowing where Aang is going with this.] But ... I was in a painting at sunset. [He quickly ends his exposition with a big smile.] So, there you have it, I'm not guilty.

title: Avatar Day
text: The camera switches view from Aang to the unimpressed crowd, to pan further down toward Sokka and Katara, both with big smiles on their faces, but their eyes reveal that they are fake. Sokka gives Aang a "thumbs up" gesture. Momo sits on Katara's lap, looking very confused.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Mumbles to Katara while they continue to smile.] He's dead.

title: Avatar Day
text: Cut to Zuko's and Iroh's hideout in the forest. Zuko sits next to the campfire as Iroh walks into the cave to inspect a new tea set.

title: Avatar Day
text: Looks like you did some serious shopping. [He picks up a big, gold-colored teapot.] But where did you get the money?

title: Avatar Day
text: [Lazily resting against a tree trunk.] Do you like your new teapot?

title: Avatar Day
text: To be honest with you [He puts the pot down.], the best tea tastes delicious whether it comes in a porcelain pot or a tin cup. [Iroh walks over to Zuko and squats down beside him.] I know we've had some difficult times lately. We've had to struggle just to get by. [Places a hand on Zuko's shoulder who closes his eyes as if he was holding something back.] But it's nothing to be ashamed of. There is a simple honor in poverty.

title: Avatar Day
text: There's no honor for me without the Avatar.

title: Avatar Day
text: Zuko ... [Sighs.] Even if you did capture the Avatar, I'm not so sure it would solve our problems. Not now.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Turns away from his uncle.] Then there is no hope at all.

title: Avatar Day
text: Zuko wants to stand up and leave the cave, but Iroh grabs him by the shoulders and sits him down.

title: Avatar Day
text: No, Zuko! You must never give in to despair. Allow yourself to slip down that road and you surrender to your lowest instincts. [Zuko bows his head as he listens to his uncle's wisdom.] In the darkest times, hope is something you give yourself. That is the meaning of inner strength.

title: Avatar Day
text: Zuko turns to face his uncle, who looks back at him with a sad look upon his face. Abruptly, Zuko pulls free from Iroh's grasp and heads out into the forest.

title: Avatar Day
text: Mayor Tong, I'd like for the court to hear one last testimony.

title: Avatar Day
text: I've already told you, it's just me and the accused. You can't call any witnesses!

title: Avatar Day
text: This isn't just any witness. I'm going to call ... [Spreads her arms.] Avatar Kyoshi herself!

title: Avatar Day
text: The villagers murmur among themselves while someone exits the temple. The guard escorts Aang in Kyoshi costume, to the front.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Whispering.] What are you doing?

title: Avatar Day
text: [Hopeful.] Well, she is Aang's past life. Maybe wearing her stuff will trigger something.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Plays with his magnifying glass.] I do believe in the power of stuff.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Angry.] This is a mockery of Chin Law!

title: Avatar Day
text: [Pleading.] Please! If you could just wait one more second, I'm sure Kyoshi will be here!

title: Avatar Day
text: Switch to Aang who is standing in the middle of the square, hiding his face behind one of Kyoshi's fans. He peeks over the fan.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Higher pitch.] Hey, everybody! Avatar Kyoshi here. [Rapidly blinks his eyes.]

title: Avatar Day
text: [Walking over to Aang.] This is ridiculous! [Points at Aang while he addresses the audience.] For the murder of Chin the Great, this court finds the Avatarâ

title: Avatar Day
text: Aang looks down in defeat, but is suddenly engulfed in a tornado of earth. Tong holds on to his hat to prevent it from being blown away. The sky darkens and when the tornado dies down, Aang is gone and the spirit of Kyoshi has taken his place.

title: Avatar Day
text: I killed Chin the Conqueror. [A flashback shows how Chin earthbends an earth column beneath one of his subjects as he was offering something to Chin. Voice-over.] A horrible tyrant, Chin was expanding his army to all corners of the continent.

title: Avatar Day
text: A close-up of Chin the Great fades to a shot of a map, where the trail of his campaign can be seen. He had concurred everything save to Ba Sing Se. The scene switches to a large army standing by the shores of the sea, ready to attack when given the order.

title: Avatar Day
text: When they came to the neck of the peninsula where we lived, he demanded our immediate surrender. [Kyoshi calmly walks toward him to face his challenge.] I warned him that I would not sit passively while he took our home. But he did not back down.

title: Avatar Day
text: Chin and Kyoshi stand face to face. Kyoshi is around a foot bigger than him. Chin takes a fighting stance, but Kyoshi is unimpressed. She grabs one of her fans and points it at him. A powerful gust of wind washes over the surprised Chin and strips him of all his clothes, except for his underwear.

title: Avatar Day
text: On that day, we split from the mainland.

title: Avatar Day
text: Close-up of Avatar Kyoshi as her eyes glow for a second, signaling the Avatar State. She jumps up and stretches one of her fans to the left as she lands. A powerful fissure rips through the earth and explodes at the edge of the cliff. She repeats that move to the right now with the same effect. Kyoshi calmly closes her fans and slams them into the ground, causing the whole peninsula to shake. Chin still stands in his earthbending stance.

title: Avatar Day
text: I created Kyoshi Island so my people could be safe from invaders.

title: Avatar Day
text: She slants her eyes and is engulfed by the sand tornado once more. Tong kneels to the ground and covers his head. While the sandstorm keeps spinning around Kyoshi, the darkness is lifted. Sokka holds Katara protectively in his arms while she clings on to Momo. When the tornado disappears, Aang is standing there once again, swaying from side to side. Katara catches him right before he collapses.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Confused.] So, what just happened?

title: Avatar Day
text: [Awkwardly.] Uhhh ... you kind of confessed. Sorry.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Standing up in the background.] And I find you ... [He brushes himself off and points at Aang.] Guilty! Bring out the Wheel of Punishment!

title: Avatar Day
text: The villagers break out into cheers as they hear the sentence. Momo looks around, before covering up his eyes with his tail.

title: Avatar Day
text: Uncle ... [Switch to a close-up of Iroh with Zuko on the background.] I thought a lot about what you said.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Iroh's sad expression clears up as he hears Zuko talk.] You did? Good, good.

title: Avatar Day
text: It's helped me realize something. We no longer have anything to gain by traveling together. [Iroh's brightened expression quickly disappears again.] I need to find my own way.

title: Avatar Day
text: Iroh bows his head in sorrow. Zuko looks at his uncle for a moment before grabbing his backpack and walking away. The camera zooms in on Iroh's face.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Calling after Zuko.] Wait!

title: Avatar Day
text: Iroh hands Zuko the reins of the ostrich horse. Zuko mounts it, looks at his uncle one last time and heads off, leaving a broken Iroh.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Deep, monotonous voice.] The accused will now spin the Wheel of Punishment to determine his sentence.

title: Avatar Day
text: Aang turns to looks at Sokka and Katara who are giving him glances of sympathy.

title: Avatar Day
text: I said I would face justice, so I will.

title: Avatar Day
text: He gives a good spin on the wheel. The camera pans down the amphitheater.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Hoping.] Come on, torture machine!

title: Avatar Day
text: Eaten by bears!

title: Avatar Day
text: Razor pit!

title: Avatar Day
text: [Begging.] Community service! Please stop on community service!

title: Avatar Day
text: Sokka and Katara look very worried as the wheel starts to slow down. It passes by "strangled by a platypus bear" and "eaten by sharks." Aang anxiously awaits his punishment. The wheel comes to a halt.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Monotone.] Looks like it's "boiled in oil."

title: Avatar Day
text: The villagers cheer loudly, while Aang looks scared and Katara and Sokka who are just absolutely shocked.

title: Avatar Day
text: We've come to claim this village for the Fire Lord! [Close-up.] Now show me your leader so I may ... [Kahchi swings his Guan Dao back and forth, slicing through the statue of Chin the Great. While it crumbles down, Mongke continues with a grin.] dethrone him!

title: Avatar Day
text: That's him over there!

title: Avatar Day
text: A scared villager points immediately toward the mayor. The mayor squeals and hides behind the Wheel of Punishment.

title: Avatar Day
text: Ahhh! [Commanding.] You, Avatar, do something!

title: Avatar Day
text: [Apathetically.] Gee, I'd love to help, but I'm supposed to be boiled in oil.

title: Avatar Day
text: The mayor tips the wheel one slot further. It now rests on a picture of a sweeping man.

title: Avatar Day
text: There, community service! Now serve our community and get rid of those rhinos!

title: Avatar Day
text: Aang smiles as he rushes forward and jumps out of his Kyoshi costume to face Kahchi, who readies his weapon. A he charges Aang, Aang opens his fans. He quickly spins out of the rhino's path and uses his airbending to lift Kahchi out of his saddle and blows him off the cliff with another gust.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Raising his hand while shouting his command.] Rough Rhinos, to the town!

title: Avatar Day
text: Vachir shoots three burning arrows at the down setting fire to the roof of a nearby building. Mongke uses his firebending to burn down another house. Lit arrows keep raining down on the rooftops. Close-up of Yeh-Lu as he rides by a hay wagon and drops some lit bombs in it. The wagon explodes, destroying the house next to it. Ogodei rides past another house and pulls down its support beams with his chains.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Raises his arms in the air and exclaims ecstatically.] Boomerang! You do always come back!

title: Avatar Day
text: Sokka notices that Vachir is aiming at him. He quickly weighs his options and throws his dragon-shaped pipe at the archer. The pipe slides over the burning arrow and extinguishes the fire. While Vachir looks surprised at his extinguished arrow, Katara sneaks up behind him and cuts his saddle cord with her waterbending. Vachir slides down, but his foot is still stuck in his saddle, so he is dragged away by his rhino when Katara whips it on its rear.

title: Avatar Day
text: From now on, we'll celebrate a new Avatar Day in honor of the day Avatar Aang [Camera pans down to show Katara, Aang, and Sokka, each holding a bowl and grinning happily.] saved us from the Rough Rhino Invasion.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Looks questioningly into his bowl.] What is this?

title: Avatar Day
text: A close-up of the bowl reveals several Aang-shaped pieces of dough.

title: Avatar Day
text: That's our new festival food! Un-fried dough. May we eat it and be reminded of how on this day the Avatar was not boiled in oil.

title: Avatar Day
text: The villagers cheer, but the gang gives each other some uncertain looks. They each pick up a dough cookie. Cut to a closer shot of Katara as her cookie droops in her fingers.

title: Avatar Day
text: Happy Avatar Day, everyone!

title: Avatar Day
text: Uncertainly, she chews it down. She looks down at her bowl, confused of what to make of it. The camera pans to the right to show how Aang also sticks a cookie in his mouth, although half of it is still dangling out of his mouth.

title: Avatar Day
text: [Stares skeptically at his dough-cookie.] This is by far the worst town we've ever been to.

title: Avatar Day
text: While Aang slurps the rest of his cookie inside his mouth, Sokka finally eats his and stares skeptically again at the next cookie.

title: Avatar Day
text: Fades to credits.

title: Avatar Day
text: Aang

title: The Blind Bandit
text: The camera pans across a wide-view over Gaoling. Town citizens move through the streets. The team stands inside a shop. The camera zooms in on them, gathered around a green bag. Sokka is looking at the bag while pondering. Katara and Momo on her shoulder look at him. Aang sits down, looking the other way and wearing his conical hat.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: [Pensively.] It's pricey ... but I really do like it.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Then you should get it, you deserve something nice.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: I do, don't I? [Katara looks at him with a bored expression.] But no, it's too expensive. I shouldn't.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: In the background, a town citizen tries to talk to a passer-by, showing him a flyer.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: All right, then don't.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Katara walks away in boredom. Aang gets up and follows her. Sokka pauses for a moment and goes along, too, his eyes still on the bag as he moves out of view. The town citizen with the flyers walks away into the same direction. Sokka quickly comes back into view.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: [Enthusiastically.] You know what? I'm gonna get it. [Smiles in a pleased way.]

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Aang, Katara, and Momo wait down the street. The town citizen turns toward them, showing them the flyer.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Psst, psst! Hey, you kids love earthbending? You like ... throwing rocks? Then check out Master Yu's Earthbending Academy.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: The flyer distribution man hands over a flyer with a broad smile. The shot switches to a close-up of the flyer as Aang, Katara, and Momo look at it. Aang turns it around.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Look! There's a coupon on the back! The first lesson is free.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: The camera zooms out, showing Aang, Katara, and Momo looking at the flyer.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Who knows? This Master Yu could be the earthbending teacher you've been looking for.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Sokka joins them, holding the green bag. He looks wondering at the flyer. Scene cuts to Yu's academy. The camera shows a short view of the entrance. Aang looks perplexed, wearing an Earth Kingdom outfit and a green hat. He puts his finger into his ear, wiggles it and sniffs his finger. Turning to his right, he sees that all the younger children with whom he is standing in line with sport a serious expression and he promptly straightens his back. Their teacher, Master Yu, moves toward his two opposing rows of pupils. The row opposite of Aang has rocks placed in front of them.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Take your stances! [His students take their fighting stances, except for Aang.] Now, strike as if you're punching through your opponent's head!

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Yu demonstrates the movement he means. The pupils lift their rocks. A close-up shows Aang's startled expression. The camera shifts to a close-up of the student that stands across Aang as he fires his rock at him. Aang gets hit by the rock in the gut and smashes into a vase in the shape of a tea pot by the impact of the blow.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: [Approaches Aang.] So, are you ready to commit to more lessons? If you pay for the whole year in advance, I'll bump you up to the next belt!

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Aang stares at him, covered in sand and shards. Only his eyes, nose and right hand are visible. The sand shifts and covers his face completely. Moments later, Aang walks out of the academy with the other students and returns to Katara and Sokka.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Ehhh, he's not the one. [Beats his right ear, causing sand to fall out of his left ear.]

title: The Blind Bandit
text: [Leaves the Earthbending Academy, accompanied by another student.] I think The Boulder's going to win back the belt at Earth Rumble VI.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: He's going to have to fight his way through the best earthbenders in the world to get a shot at the champ.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Aang overhears their conversation and runs after them.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Excuse me, but where is this earthbending tournament, exactly?

title: The Blind Bandit
text: [Sarcastically.] It's on the island of Noneya ... "Noneya" business!

title: The Blind Bandit
text: The students laugh and walk away as he looks on disappointed. Sokka walks up to Aang laughing while Katara glares at them while walking up.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: [Laughs and wipes tears of laughter away.] Oh, I got to remember that one!

title: The Blind Bandit
text: [Consolingly to Aang.] I'll take care of this. [To the students.] Hey, strong guys! Wait up! [Runs after the students around a corner.]

title: The Blind Bandit
text: [Looking at his bag, holding it out.] What was I thinking? [Angrily to Aang.] I don't need a new bag! Why did you let me buy this?

title: The Blind Bandit
text: He puts the bag down and crosses his arms in front of his chest. Momo hops off his shoulder, into the bag. He turns around inside of it and settles down, closing his eyes. Katara comes running back.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: You ready to find an earthbending teacher? Because we're going to Earth Rumble VI!

title: The Blind Bandit
text: [Looks surprised.] How'd you get them to tell you?

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Oh ... a girl has her ways. [Smiles.]

title: The Blind Bandit
text: A scene shows the two students frozen together at the head, encased in ice in an alley. Nightfall. The camera shows the entrance to location of Earth Rumble VI: a lighted tunnel in a rock face. People enter the tunnel. The camera shows the hall where the competition will be held. A large rectangular arena is located in the middle. The arena has stairs running down to a lower, oval shaped area. Seats for the spectators start at the same level as the arena. Team Avatar walks into an empty row of seats.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Hey, front row seats! I wonder why no one else is sitting here.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: They sit down but quickly jump back up as a huge rock smashes into the seats next to them.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: I guess that's why.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: In the center of the ring, the event's host raises an earthen platform. He brings it back to the level of the rest of the arena.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: [Raises his left arm.] Welcome to Earth Rumble VI! I am your host, Xin Fu!

title: The Blind Bandit
text: [Sighs and looks the other way.] This is just going to be a bunch of guys chucking rocks at each other, isn't it?

title: The Blind Bandit
text: [Happily.] That's what I paid for.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: The rules are simple. Just knock the other guy out of the ring, and you win! [Leaps up to a podium above the ring. A bell rings.] Round one: The Boulder vs. The Big Bad Hippo! [While Xin Fu speaks, The Boulder raises his arms and turns around to the cheering of the audience. The Hippo roars.]

title: The Blind Bandit
text: [Pointing at The Hippo.] Listen up, Hippo. You may be big, but you ain't bad! [Grinning insanely.] The Boulder's gonna win this in a landslide!

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Hippo ... mad!

title: The Blind Bandit
text: The Hippo raises his arms in anger and stomps one foot. Momo lowers himself more inside Sokka's bag out of fear. The Boulder fires three rocks. They crash into The Hippo, but he does not move. He catches one piece of rock with his mouth, chews on it and spits it out. The Hippo jumps up and down, causing the surface of the arena to tilt. The Boulder hereby loses his balance.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Unbelievable, ladies and gentlemen! The Hippo is rocking the boat!

title: The Blind Bandit
text: The Boulder reaches the edge, but saves himself by bending out part of the ring into a small platform. He grabs it and throws it at his opponent, hitting him on the back. As The Hippo turns around to look at him, The Boulder bends up The Hippo's part of the ring, and throws him out on it. The Hippo crashes in the lower area of around the arena. The fight ends thus in his favor.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: The Boulder wins!

title: The Blind Bandit
text: [Looking at The Boulder.] How about The Boulder? He's got some good moves.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: [Shrugs.] I don't know. Bumi said I need a teacher who listens to the earth. He's just listening to his big muscles. What do you think, Sokka?

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Sokka cheers loudly.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Next match ... The Boulder versus [Cut to to a close-up of Fire Nation Man happily waving a Fire Nation flag; voice-over.] Fire Nation Man!

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Far off side-shot as the crowd boos at the Fire Nation Man who is makes his way over to the arena, still waving his flag, on a makeshift earthen bridge, which crumbles away behind him. Cut to a close-up of Sokka, who loudly boos the fighter as well, while giving him a thumbs down.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: [With a pseudo-Russian accent.] Please, to rise for Fire Nation national anthem! [Put his left hand over his heart; begins to sing.] Fire Lord, my flame burns [Drops to his right knee and stretches out his left arm.] for thee!

title: The Blind Bandit
text: The crowd boos at him again while bombarding him with pieces of rock, much to his surprise. Cut to Sokka with a stone cocked back in his hand, ready to throw.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: [Yelling.] Go back to the Fire Nation!

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Sokka throws his rock. Cut to a close-up of the Fire Nation Man, who is hit against the head by a rock. He starts to become angry, though the emotion quickly changes to wonder and he is sunk chest-deep into the ground; he drops his flag in the process. Cut to a shot from over his shoulder to reveal The Boulder as the culprit, who subsequently raises himself high into the air on an earth pillar. Cut to a close-up of the Fire Nation Man, who looks petrified.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: No, no, please!

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Cut to a close-up of The Boulder grinning broadly. He leaps in the air, his face serious. Cut to a side-shot; The Boulder is plummeting straight down, his feet held back behind his back as to direct his knees to the ground. Switch to a further off shot as he slams the surface of the ring, by which he creates a pillar under Fire Nation Man that catapults him out of the ground. Frog-view shot of the Fire Nation Man as he sails screaming through the air. Cut to a frontal shot of the place where Team Avatar is sitting. The Fire Nation Man smacks upside down and face first against the large boulder that was embedded into the stand next to team Avatar. Sokka gets up and waves both hands in the air in celebration of the Fire Nation Man's defeat, while shouting in the fighter's direction.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Yeah! Wooo! [Points at Fire Nation Man.] The Boulder knows how to put the hurt in the dirt! [Close-up of Sokka as he continues to cheer and make taunting faces.] Yeah! Woohoo!

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Cut to the arena where a man riding a badgermole is going over the surface to make it smooth again, letting the animal bend all the rubble away. A turning, frog-view shot reveals the ceiling and a female assistant holding up a sign to announce the next round as a bell is struck. A montage shows The Boulder defeating several more fighters: The Gopher gets slammed between two rocks, The Gecko jumps up, but gets hit in the stomach by a broad earthen pillar, Headhunter gets hit with an earthen coin. Between his victories, The Boulder entertains the cheering crowd by wobbling his chest. As The Boulder relishes from his fans' praise, there is a faded scene with the crowd cheering with Sokka soon appearing in front. Far off shot of Xin Fu standing on his platform.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Now, the moment [The light slowly dims to put him in the spotlight.] you've all been waiting for. The Boulder versus [Cut to a shot of a person with black hair mostly obscured by a green prize belt; voice-over.] your champion ... the Blind Bandit!

title: The Blind Bandit
text: As Xin Fu was speaking, the girl raises her championship belt above her head, under loud cheering of the crowd. Cut to a further off frontal shot, showing the girl to actually be a short child, barely reaching to the waists of the female assistants standing next to her. As the spotlight dies down, the girl offers her championship belt to the assistant on her right, while the other one removes her cape, and they both walk off. The camera shifts to Aang and Katara.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: She can't really be blind. [Turn her head and squints her eyes skeptically.] It's just part of her [Cut to a close-up of the Bandit's milky-green eyes; pans right.] character, right?

title: The Blind Bandit
text: [Frontal shot.] I think she is.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: [Camera moves back to include Sokka in the shot; deadpanned.] I think she is ... [Shouting, gesturing downward with both hands.] going down!

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Sokka's movement causing Aang to flinch back and Momo to coo and hide in the bag Sokka bought earlier on the market. Cut to a shot of the Blind Bandit that nearly instantly moves back to a view from on the arena's floor level. The Boulder confidently puts his foot in the middle of the screen, cracking the floor in the process and throwing up some dust. Cut to a frog-point frontal view of the fighter.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: The Boulder feels conflicted about fighting a young blind girl.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: [Points at The Boulder. Mockingly.] Sounds to me like you're [Goes into a mockingly scared position.] scared, Boulder!

title: The Blind Bandit
text: [After a pause where he looks stunned.] The Boulder's over his conflicted feelings, [Narrows his eyes.] and now he's ready to bury you screen [Expands instantly and the Boulder makes a dramatic, crushing gesture.] in a rock-alanche!

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Whenever you're ready, The Pebble! [Throws her head back and laughs.]

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Cut back to a close-up of Aang, before switching to a flashback from "The Swamp" where he saw the girl in white and the flying boar. He remembers her laugh, which is the same as that of the Bandit. The flashback shows a closer shot of the girl in the fancy dress. The camera closes in and turns around the girl to reveal her face as the Bandit's. The flashback ends in a flash of white to reveal Aang's stunned face.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: It's on!

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Cut back to a shot from behind The Boulder who faces the Bandit, before shifting to a tilting down shot of The Boulder's head. Despite his bravado, he is sweating profusely. Switch to a frontal shot of the Bandit. The camera whirls around her head and ends with a close up shot of her ear. Cut to The Boulder, who yells and takes a step forward. As his heel hits the ground, the frame freezes and goes to black and white. Shock waves in white move out from his heel where it has struck the floor of the arena. Cut to an overhead shot of The Boulder showing the shock wave emanating away from his heel in concentric circles. Cut again to the Bandit standing perfectly still. The shock waves reach her and travel up her body.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: [Painfully.] Ooooooh!

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Cut back to the Bandit who makes a chopping motion with her right hand. Three stalagmites erupt from the ground near The Boulder and eject him from the ring. He slams into the wall beneath the stands and slides down into the crevice between the arena and the stands.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Your winner, and still the champion, [Cut to a wider shot of the Bandit, who raises her right fist in victory.] the Blind Bandit!

title: The Blind Bandit
text: How did she do that?

title: The Blind Bandit
text: She waited ... and listened.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Cut to a wide shot of the announcer's tower as Xin Fu jumps down and lands next to Toph on the arena floor. He holds a green bag in his left hand.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: To make things a little more interesting, I'm offering up this sack of gold pieces to anyone who can defeat [He motions toward the champion.] the Blind Bandit! [He motions toward Toph once again. Silence.] What? No one dares to face her?

title: The Blind Bandit
text: I will!

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Xin Fu looks disappointed for a moment before the camera cuts to Aang entering the ring. The crowd murmurs its approval. Shift to a long, wide shot of Aang as he closes the distance between himself and the Bandit. Xin Fu jumps out of the screen. Cut to Sokka and Katara.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Go Aang! Avenge The Boulder!

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Do people really want to see two little girls fighting out here?

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Oooh.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: [Aang puts his hands up in a conciliatory gesture.] I don't really want to fight you. I want to talk to you.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Cut to Sokka and Katara.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Boo! No [Katara turns to her brother with a look of disapproval.] talking!

title: The Blind Bandit
text: [Slaps Sokka.] Don't boo at him!

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Cut to Aang's feet; he takes a step. Cut back to the Bandit, who smiles as soon as his foot hits the ground. She stomps the ground with the side of her left foot. A shock wave travels across the ground and causes a large rock to grow out of the ground underneath Aang, who is launched into the air. He lands softly on the ground behind her. She turns around with an upset expression on her face.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Somebody's a little light on his feet! What's your fighting name: [Cut to Aang.] the Fancy Dancer? [Aang grins sheepishly before Toph launches another pillar, which lifts him up.] Where'd you go?

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Please, wait!

title: The Blind Bandit
text: There you are!

title: The Blind Bandit
text: She launches a rock at him. He stops it with airbending and the blast knocks Toph out of the ring. Quick shots of Xin Fu, The Boulder who is recovering from his match with the Blind Bandit, and the Water Tribe siblings as they confirm their collective shock. Cut back to Aang, who looks around in surprise as the crowd cheers. Cut to a shot of the Bandit walking away from the base of the arena. In the background is a set of stairs. Aang is at the top of the stairs and he calls after the former champion.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: [Going after her.] Please, listen! I need an earthbending teacher, and I think it's supposed to be you!

title: The Blind Bandit
text: [Angrily.] Whoever you are, just leave me alone.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Toph earthbends a doorway and exits through it. She turns and closes the door with a motion of her hands.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Wait!

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Aang reaches the wall too late. He turns and looks sad. Cut to Xin Fu holding the belt and the bag of gold, the crowd cheering behind them. Katara and Sokka enter the frame from the right. Sokka hugs Xin Fu and takes the money and the belt. He puts his arm around Aang's shoulder, but the Avatar is still morose.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: [Gets the belt and gold.] Way to go, champ!

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Aang looks down sorrowfully. Cut to the next morning, featuring a wide shot of Gaoling before zooming in on Team Avatar walking within the town.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: I've got to admit, now I'm really glad I bought this bag. It matches the belt, perfectly.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: [Sarcastically.] That is a big relief.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: If we want to find the Blind Bandit, the Earthbending Academy is a great place to start.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: The same two male students from yesterday are seen practicing.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Oh great, you again.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: [Glares at them, causing them to back off.] Yeah, I didn't think so.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: [Smugly.] Nicely done.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Hey! You're that kid who beat the Blind Bandit!

title: The Blind Bandit
text: We need to talk to her. Do you guys know where she lives?

title: The Blind Bandit
text: The Blind Bandit's a mystery. [Raises fist dramatically.] She shows up to fight, then disappears.

title: The Blind Bandit
