text: [Lays hands on Aang's shoulder.] Let me handle this. [Approaches the second student with a stern look; says accusingly.] You're not telling us everything!

title: The Blind Bandit
text: [Holds hand up defensively.] No, no, I-I swear it's true. No one knows where she goes, or who she really is.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: That's because we're asking about the wrong person. In my vision, I saw a girl, in a white dress, with a pet flying boar. Know anybody like that?

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Well, a flying boar is the symbol of the Beifong family. They're the richest people in town. Probably the whole world.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Yeah, but they don't have a daughter.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: A flying boar is good enough for me. Let's check it out.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: [Quietly.] Yeah, you better leave.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Hey, I got my eye on you.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: [States coolly.] Water Tribe.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Back at the Earth Rumble VI venue.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: I'm telling you, The Boulder was standing right there. I saw the kid strike, but there was no earthbending. Nothing made contact. The Blind Bandit just fell out of the ring. She must've took a dive and split the money with the kid.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: [Slams the wall, causing rocks to land on his feet; cries out in anger and pain.] Nobody cheats Xin Fu.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Shift to a wide, overhead shot of a walled country estate with a lovely garden and many ponds. It is daylight. A shot of the gate tilts up to reveal a crest with a flying boar emblazoned upon it. Cut to the three kids spying on the gate.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: That's the flying boar from my vision. Come on!

title: The Blind Bandit
text: They enter the courtyard. Suddenly, part of the ground lifts up, launching them into the air. They yell as they fall and land unceremoniously; Aang and Katara land in some rose bushes, but Sokka slams painfully onto the solid ground. Aang looks up; cut to an upside down shot of the Bandit, now in her fancy gown.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: What are you doing here, Twinkle Toes?!

title: The Blind Bandit
text: How did you know it was me?

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Don't answer to Twinkle Toes, it's not manly!

title: The Blind Bandit
text: You're the one whose bag matches his belt.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: How did you find me?

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Well, a crazy king told me I had to find an earthbender who listens to the earth. And then I had a vision in a magic swamp, [Toph raises her eye in disbelief.] and -

title: The Blind Bandit
text: [Cutting off Aang.] What Aang is trying to say is, he's the Avatar. And if he doesn't master earthbending soon, he won't be able to defeat the Fire Lord.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Not my problem. Now, [Begins walking away.] get out of here, or I'll call the guards.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Look, we all have to do our part to win this war, and yours is to teach Aang earthbending.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Guards! Guards, help!

title: The Blind Bandit
text: The gang scatters as two guards arrive.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Toph, what happened?

title: The Blind Bandit
text: I ... thought I heard someone. I got scared.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: You know your father doesn't want you wandering the grounds without supervision, Toph.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: They escort her and Aang peers at them from over a rooftop. He smiles and climbs down. Fade quickly to a shot of a teapot being picked up by a pair of arms that belong to someone in a brown or gold robe. The fingers have two gold rings on them. The camera follows the teapot as it is lifted up and opened. Lao and Poppy sit on a sofa drinking tea.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: [Takes a sip of tea.] I'm pleased to hear that Toph's private lessons are going well. But I want to be sure she's not trying anything too dangerous.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Absolutely not. I am keeping her at a beginner's level. Basic forms and breathing exercises only.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Very good. [A servant comes in.]

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Excuse me, sir, but you have a visitor.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Who thinks they are so important they can just come to my home unannounced?

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Uh ... the Avatar, sir. [Toph's eyes widen in shock and surprise.]

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Lao and Poppy look at each other. The servant goes away. Toph blows her hair in annoyance. The scene fades to inside the dining room, where the Beifongs, Yu, and Team Avatar gather for a dinner of soup, tea, roast duck, and tea. Aang sits across from Toph. Sokka devours his food. Servant brings a cup of soup to Toph. Lao notices.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Blow on it. It's too hot for her.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Allow me. [Sends a small tornado at the cup. Everyone claps.]

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Avatar Aang, it's an honor to have you visit us.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: In your opinion, how much longer do think the war will last?

title: The Blind Bandit
text: I'd like to defeat the Fire Lord by the end of summer, but I can't do that without finding an earthbending teacher first. [Close-up of Toph with a annoyed look.]

title: The Blind Bandit
text: [Chuckles.] Well, Master Yu is the finest teacher in the land. [The camera pans to Yu.] He's been teaching Toph since she was little.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Then she must be a great earthbender! Probably good enough to teach someone else! [Toph sends a fissure under the table at him.] Ow!

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Aang sits up a little. Lao casts an odd glance at his daughter who merely eats her soup.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Toph is still learning the basics.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Yes, and sadly, because of her blindness, I don't think she will ever become a true master.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Oh, I'm sure she's better than you think she is.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Toph sends another fissure at him, causing his face to fall into the soup. Everybody stops eating. Aang rubs some soup out of his eyes and sneezes on purpose, sending the food flying at the Beifong family.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: [Angrily.] What's your problem?!

title: The Blind Bandit
text: [Just as angrily.] What's your problem?

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Lao and Poppy wipe their faces with napkins.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Well, shall we move to the living room for dessert, then?

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Later that night, the three are in a guest room. Appa is outside the window and Aang is patting Appa.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Good night, buddy.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Toph enters, causing Aang to move into a defensive position.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Relax. Look, I'm sorry about dinner. Let's call a truce, okay? [Aang lets down his defensive position and the two head out to the yard. Toph walks along the side of a bridge.] Even though I was born blind, I've never had a problem seeing. [Jumps down.] I see with earthbending. It's kind of like seeing with my feet. I feel the vibrations in the Earth, and I can see where everything is. [The camera shows an aerial view.] You, that tree ... [Cut back to the ground.] even those ants.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: [Looks around.] That's amazing.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: My parents don't understand. They've always treated me like I was helpless.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Is that why you became the Blind Bandit?

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Yeah.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Then why stay here where you're not happy?

title: The Blind Bandit
text: They're my parents. Where else am I supposed to go?

title: The Blind Bandit
text: You could come with us.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Yeah. You guys get to go wherever you want. No one telling you what to do, that's the life. It's just not my life. [She detects something and touches the ground.] We're being ambushed!

title: The Blind Bandit
text: They try to run, but get cut off by underground digging from The Gopher. They are imprisoned in metal cages. The Hippo jumps onto the two cages and starts stomping. The rest of the Earth Rumble wrestlers jump down onto the ground.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: I think you kids owe me some money.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Later, the Beifongs, Yu, Katara, and Sokka discover what has happened. They spot a note attached to a dagger, which Sokka takes.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Whoever took Aang and Toph left this. [Hands the note to Katara.]

title: The Blind Bandit
text: "If you want to see your daughter again, bring five hundred gold pieces to the arena." It's signed Xin Fu and The Boulder.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: [Serious.] I can't believe it ... [Grabs the note much to Katara's surprise and runs off a few feet. Cut to a further off shot; enthusiastically.] I have The Boulder's autograph!

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Sokka dramatically sinks to his knees and holds the scroll above his head. Cut to a close-up of Katara, who stares at him in annoyance. Behind her, Poppy wipes the tears out of her eyes and leave her husband's embrace, exciting the screen.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Master Yu, I need you to help me get my daughter back.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: We're going with you.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Poor Toph, she must be so scared ...

title: The Blind Bandit
text: At the Earth Rumble VI venue, Toph and Aang are suspended high above the air in their cages. The Boulder and Xin Fu guard the two hostages.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: You think you're so tough? [The camera zooms back to show her case and Aang's suspended from chains. She points somewhere below her.] Why don't you come up here so I can snap that grin off your face? [Cut to Xin Fu and The Boulder looking from below them on the floor of the arena.]

title: The Blind Bandit
text: [Narrows his eyes. Dryly.] I'm not smiling.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Toph!

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Here's your money. [Sets the bag of gold on the ground.] Now let them go.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Yu earthbends the money across the ring to Xin Fu. He grabs the money, signals for Toph to be sent down, and releases her. Toph goes to Lao. They exit the arena.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: What about Aang?

title: The Blind Bandit
text: [Showing the Fire Nation wanted poster.] I think the Fire Nation will pay a hefty price for the Avatar. Now, get out of my ring.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Fire Nation Man appears in an earth tornado. The Gecko jumps down from the ceiling. The Hippo stomps on the ground and crushes a boulder. Headhunter jumps onto the ring from the bleachers. The Gopher pops up from underground.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Go, I'll be okay.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Toph, there's too many of them. We need an earthbender. We need you!

title: The Blind Bandit
text: My daughter is blind. She is blind and tiny and helpless and fragile. She cannot help you!

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Yes, I can.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: She lets go of her father's hand and walks back to the ring. Xin Fu's wrestlers prepare to leave with The Boulder holding Aang's cage on his shoulder. Toph bends up a small part of the ring to stop them from leaving.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Let him go! I beat you all before and I'll do it again!

title: The Blind Bandit
text: The Boulder takes issue with that comment.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: The Hippo throws the cage to the side. Katara and Sokka prepare to strike but Toph stops them.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Wait! [Listens to their vibrations as they run toward her; turns head to Sokka.] They're mine.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: The Water Tribe siblings watch in surprise. She shakes the ring up, shooting back the oncoming wrestlers. She enters the resulting dust crowd, unnerving Lao.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Hit it harder!

title: The Blind Bandit
text: I'm trying!

title: The Blind Bandit
text: The Gecko crawls along the floor and becomes aware of Toph's presence. He fires two rocks which she easily dodges. She bends up a series of pillars, sending him flying out of the ring. Cut to a disoriented Fire Nation Man who slowly gets up before he realizes the Gecko heading to him and he crashes into him. The Gopher tunnels and behind Toph and sends a rock at Toph's head. She grabs the rock and returns it. Cut to The Gopher turning to a distressed look before he gets knocked out of the ring and right into Fire Nation Man and the Gecko. Sokka finally breaks the cage open, releasing Aang, who prepares to fight. Sokka shakes his head and calls his attention to the battle already going on. The Boulder and The Hippo prepare to attack Toph. Lao looks on the fight biting his nails. Headhunter flies in from behind to complete the ambush. However, Toph hears him and turns the center of the ring around to put Headhunter on a collision course with the other two wrestlers. With the three men down, Toph ejects them all onto the other defeated wrestlers.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: I never knew. Your daughter's amazing!

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Toph clears the dust cloud; only her and Xin Fu remain in the ring. Cut to Toph who spits. A quick shot of her father, who looks shocked at her lack of manners, and Yu. and gets into a fighting stance and they circle the central ring. Xin Fu fires several rocks at her. She brings up an earth shield, deflecting them all. She turns part of the shield on him. He dodges one piece, but when he hits the ring again, Toph picks up his vibrations in it and senses an attack. She dodges a rock and creates a fissure, sending him flying out of the ring between Yu and Lao. Sokka collapses in shock at the sight. Aang and Katara are left amazed and run toward her. Cut back to Yu and Lao.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: She's the greatest earthbender I've ever seen.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: The scene fades to that night at the Beifong estate. Toph confronts her parents.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Dad, I know it's probably hard for you to see me this way. But the obedient little helpless blind girl that you think I am just isn't me. I love fighting. I love being an earthbender, and I'm really, really good at it. I know I've kept my life secret from you, but you were keeping me secret from the whole world. You were doing it to protect me, but I'm twelve years old and I've never had a real friend. So, now that you see who I really am, I hope it doesn't change the way you feel about me.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Of course it doesn't change the way I feel about you, Toph. It's made me realize something.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: It has?

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Yes. I've let you had far too much freedom. From now on you'll be cared for and guarded twenty-four hours a day.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: But, Dad!

title: The Blind Bandit
text: We're doing this for your own good, Toph.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Please escort the Avatar and his friends out. They are no longer welcome here.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: I'm sorry, Toph.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: I'm sorry too. Goodbye, Aang. [She sheds a tear.]

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Outside, back at Appa.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Don't worry, we'll find you a teacher. There are plenty of amazing earthbenders out there.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: [Cut to a wider shot from behind them. The full moon shines in the distance.] Not like her.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Sokka polishes the championship belt on Appa's saddle Katara jump up onto the saddle and Aang takes the reins. Suddenly, they notice Toph running toward them and panting.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Toph! What are you doing here?

title: The Blind Bandit
text: My dad changed his mind. He said I was free to travel the world. [Katara and Sokka look at each other with unsure looks, but smile at Toph.]

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Well, we'd better get out of here, before your dad changes his mind again.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Good idea.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: You're going to be a great teacher, Toph.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Speaking of which, I want to show you something.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Okay.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Aang jumps down from Appa and she bends up a rock, sending him into the air and landing in a tree.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Now we're even. Um, I'll take the belt back.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Sokka tosses the belt down, hitting Toph on the head with a sound effect and knocking her down.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Ow! [Cut to a wide shot Appa and Toph still laid out flat.]

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Sorry.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Aang falls down from the tree in the background. Back at the Beifong estate, Lao meets with Yu and Xin Fu.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: I know you two are very different. But I believe you have a common interest. [A servant brings out a chest of gold. Xin Fu and Yu exchange glances at one another.] The Avatar has kidnapped my daughter. I want you to do whatever it takes to bring her home.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Yu and Xin Fu bow in agreement. A final scene shows Toph, now content, as they all fly off on Appa.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Fade to credits.

title: The Blind Bandit
text: Aang

title: Zuko Alone
text: The episode begins with Zuko by himself, riding his stolen ostrich horse through a fairly barren landscape. After walking for a bit, they arrive at a decrepit bridge over a ravine that breaks as they cross. After regaining control, they continue crossing. A little while later, Zuko smells food and spots a steak being cooked by a couple below the ridge he is walking on. He holds his stomach in hunger, and reaches for his dual dao swords, preparing himself to steal from them. However, after noticing that the woman is pregnant, he stops himself and continues on his way.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Come on, spider snake-eyes! [He rolls a pair of dice and they land with two fives, face-up.] Ha! Ha! Yeah!

title: Zuko Alone
text: Two of the other men turn around and punch him in the stomach once each. He grunts with each punch.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Could I get some water, a bag of feed and something hot to eat? [Zuko holds out his hand. In it are two coins.]

title: Zuko Alone
text: Not enough here for a hot meal. I can get you two bags of feed.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Zuko looks down, disappointed. He notices that the four Earth Kingdom men are watching him.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Ow!

title: Zuko Alone
text: The two boys run off as the Earth Kingdom soldier turn around, looking angry. They only see Zuko behind them, so they stand up indignantly.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Hey! You throwing eggs at us, stranger?

title: Zuko Alone
text: No.

title: Zuko Alone
text: You see who did throw it?

title: Zuko Alone
text: [Turns to face them.] No.

title: Zuko Alone
text: That your favorite word, no?

title: Zuko Alone
text: Egg had to come from somewhere.

title: Zuko Alone
text: [Turns around.] Maybe a chicken flew over.

title: Zuko Alone
text: The Earth Kingdom soldier laughs, and Gow glares at him. At that moment, the store owner returns with Zuko's feed bags for the ostrich horse. Gow goes to the counter and grabs both bags before he can take them.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Thanks for your contribution. The army appreciates your support. [He throws the bags to one of his fellow soldiers.] You better leave town. Penalty for stayin's a lot steeper than you can afford, stranger. Trust me. [He pats his hammer at his side menacingly.]

title: Zuko Alone
text: The soldiers turn and leave with the bags.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Those soldiers are supposed to protect us from the Fire Nation. But they're just a bunch of thugs.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Zuko walks toward his ostrich horse. As he is about to re-mount, one of the little boys from earlier pops up from behind the animal.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Thanks for not ratting me out!

title: Zuko Alone
text: Zuko ignores the boy, gets on his steed and starts riding away. Lee casts him an annoyed look before brightening. Lee comes up from behind and grabs the reins.

title: Zuko Alone
text: I'll take you to my house and feed your ostrich horse for you. Come on, I owe you! [Lee leads the way, pulling along the animal.]

title: Zuko Alone
text: A shot of Zuko holding his stomach in hunger fades to a pig farm, Zuko and Lee arrive on a dirt road at the farm among mountains in the countryside. A little wooden farmhouse with a roof that needs re-shingling. Several different types of hybrid pigs spotted in enclosures.

title: Zuko Alone
text: No one can ever sneak up on us.

title: Zuko Alone
text: No kidding.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Lee takes the ostrich horse away. Zuko casts his glance off to the side; the camera shifts to show a pig rooster, who crows at him. A man approaches Zuko. A woman peers out from behind the farmhouse.

title: Zuko Alone
text: You a friend of Lee's?

title: Zuko Alone
text: Lee comes running out of the barn excitedly and grabs his father's arm.

title: Zuko Alone
text: This guy just stood up to the soldiers! By the end, he practically had them running away!

title: Zuko Alone
text: The woman from earlier comes forward to join her husband and son, wiping her hands on a rag.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Does this guy have a name?

title: Zuko Alone
text: [Nervously.] I'm ... uh ...

title: Zuko Alone
text: [Off-camera.] He doesn't have to say who he is if he doesn't want to, Sela. [Cuts to shot of him standing with his family.] Anyone who can hold his own against those bully soldiers is welcome here. Those men should be ashamed to wear Earth Kingdom uniforms.

title: Zuko Alone
text: The real soldiers are off fighting the War, [Cuts to shot of Lee.] like Lee's big brother Sensu. [Pause.] Supper's going to be ready soon. Would you like to stay?

title: Zuko Alone
text: I can't. I should be moving on. [The wife frowns and casts a glance at her husband.]

title: Zuko Alone
text: Gansu could use some help on the barn. Why don't you two work for a while, and then we'll eat.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Zuko nods in agreement. The camera fades to Zuko and Gansu working on the roof of the barn. Lee is resting on a ladder, watching them re-shingle the roof. While Gansu is doing well and working steadily, Zuko has several twisted and broken nails in front of him, although it is evident he is trying hard to do a good job.

title: Zuko Alone
text: You don't seem like you're from around here.

title: Zuko Alone
text: [Shaking his head.] Mm-mm.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Where are you from then?

title: Zuko Alone
text: [Lowers his hammer.] Far away.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Ohhh. Where are you going?

title: Zuko Alone
text: Lee, give it a rest. Stop asking the man personal questions, got it?

title: Zuko Alone
text: [Disappointed and rests his head on his arm. He sighs.] Yes. [Pause.] So how'd you get that scar?

title: Zuko Alone
text: Zuko is surprised at the question and swings down his hammer a little too hard. He strikes his thumb, now red, and groans in pain.

title: Zuko Alone
text: It's not nice to bother people about things they might not want to talk about. A man's past is his business.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Gansu goes back to hammering and so does Zuko. The scene fades away to the sound of hammers hitting metal as Zuko starts reminiscing about the past.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Hey Mom, want to see how Azula feeds turtle ducks? [Zuko throws the rest of the loaf of bread into the water and hits one of the baby turtle ducks. Ursa is shocked.]

title: Zuko Alone
text: Zuko! Why would you do that?

title: Zuko Alone
text: After the baby turtle duck surfaces again, the mother turtle duck charges forth and bites Zuko's ankle hard.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Ow! Ow ow! Ouch! [Ursa removes the turtle duck from Zuko and gently throws her back into the pond, where she swims off with her babies. Zuko is pouting.]

title: Zuko Alone
text: Stupid turtle duck. Why she'd do that?

title: Zuko Alone
text: Zuko. That's what moms are like. [Puts her arm around Zuko.] If you mess with their babies,[She playfully bites behind Zuko's ear.], they're gonna bite you back! [They laugh.]

title: Zuko Alone
text: A little while later, young Azula, Ty Lee and Mai are playing together in the royal yard by a man-made river and a rather large fountain. While Mai sits and watches under the shade of a tree, Azula does a complicated flip but messes up the ending and grunts. Ty Lee does the same flip, only she completes the ending perfectly and lands on her feet, arms proudly up in the air. Azula pushes her over and laughs.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Ugh! Azula!

title: Zuko Alone
text: Zuko and Ursa walk by together nearby. Mai sees them, smiles, turns away and blushes. Azula notices her obvious crush, however, and turns to Ty Lee with a plot in mind.

title: Zuko Alone
text: [Whispering in Ty Lee's ear as her friend giggles.] Watch this! [Runs toward her mother and Zuko.] Mom! Can you make Zuko play with us? We need equal teams to play a game!

title: Zuko Alone
text: I am not cart-wheeling.

title: Zuko Alone
text: You won't have to. [Rolls her eyes.] Cart-wheeling's not a game, dum-dum.

title: Zuko Alone
text: I don't care. I don't want to play with you!

title: Zuko Alone
text: We are brother and sister. It's important for us to spend time together! Don't you think so, Mom? [Shoots her mother an innocent smile.]

title: Zuko Alone
text: [Places her hands on Zuko's shoulder.] Yes, darling, I think it's a good idea to play with your sister. [Ruffles his hair.] Go on now, just for a little while. [Walks away, with Zuko glaring at his sister.]

title: Zuko Alone
text: Azula reaches for an apple on the tree that Mai was under earlier. Mai, now standing in front of the fountain, is still while Azula places the apple on her head.

title: Zuko Alone
text: [Off-camera.] Here's the way it goes. [After placing apple on Mai's head, she runs back several feet.] Now what you do is, try to knock the apple off the other person's head, like this. [Azula shots a small jet of flame to the apple with her firebending and knowingly sets it on fire.]

title: Zuko Alone
text: Zuko is shocked and runs forward toward Mai, who screams as Zuko approaches her. He slams into her and the both of them fall into the fountain, with Zuko lying on top of Mai's stomach. Both seem very shocked and embarrassed. Azula starts laughing at them.

title: Zuko Alone
text: [Lays a hand on Ty Lee's shoulder.] See, I told you it would work!

title: Zuko Alone
text: Cuts to shot of Azula and Ty Lee observing Zuko and Mai in the fountain, their backs facing the camera.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Aww, they're so cute together!

title: Zuko Alone
text: Zuko gets up angrily and leaves the fountain. Mai stands up as well.

title: Zuko Alone
text: You two are such ... ugh!

title: Zuko Alone
text: At that moment, Ursa comes from the house toward the children, a scroll of paper in her hand.

title: Zuko Alone
text: I was just coming to get you. Uncle Iroh sent us a letter from the war-front. [Zuko stomps past her, leaving small puddles behind him as he goes.] You're soaking wet?

title: Zuko Alone
text: [Raises hands in frustration.] Girls are crazy!

title: Zuko Alone
text: The scene switches to the letter and what is occurring with Iroh. Rubble surround a large gap in the wall of Ba Sing Se with smoke emitting from everywhere. A tent is set up nearby, with a younger General Iroh writing at a desk.

title: Zuko Alone
text: [Voice-over.] If the city is as magnificent as its wall, Ba Sing Se must be something to behold. I hope you all may see it someday, if we don't burn it to the ground first! [Laughs.]

title: Zuko Alone
text: Switch back to Ursa, Zuko and Azula. The children are laughing at the joke as well. Ursa continues down the letter.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Until then, enjoy these gifts.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Two servants dressed in white come up, and Zuko runs to meet them. Ursa sits there and continues reading.

title: Zuko Alone
text: For Zuko, a pearl dagger from the general who surrendered when we broke through the Outer Wall. Note the inscription and the superior craftsmanship.

title: Zuko Alone
text: [Zuko picks up the dagger admiringly, unsheathes it and reads the inscription.] Never give up without a fight.

title: Zuko Alone
text: And for Azula, a new friend. She wears the latest fashion for Earth Kingdom girls.

title: Zuko Alone
text: As Ursa reads, Azula picks up her present. It is a doll wearing green. She picks it up by the head with disgust, making sounds and sticking out her tongue.

title: Zuko Alone
text: If Uncle doesn't make it back from war, then Dad will be next in line for Fire Lord, wouldn't he?

title: Zuko Alone
text: Azula, we don't speak that way. It would be awful if Uncle Iroh didn't return. And besides, Fire Lord Azulon is a picture of health.

title: Zuko Alone
text: How would you like it if cousin Lu Ten wanted Dad to die?

title: Zuko Alone
text: I still think our dad would make a much better Fire Lord than His Royal Tea-Loving Kookiness. [Sets the doll's head on fire.]

title: Zuko Alone
text: Flashback ends. Night has fallen, and Zuko is sleeping on a pile of hay inside the barn. A door opens and Lee comes sneaking in. He takes the Dual Dao swords, but nearly stops when Zuko makes a sound in his sleep. Nevertheless, Lee walks out of the barn with the swords and closes the squeaky door. Zuko's eyes pop open as if he was only feigning sleep the whole time. Cut to a large sunflower garden, where Lee is practicing with the swords. He jumps around and chops off several sunflower heads. He starts stabbing a nearby dead tree trunk repeatedly, his tongue lolling out of his mouth and breathes heavily in effort as Zuko silently approaches behind him.

title: Zuko Alone
text: You're holding them wrong.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Lee falls backward in surprise. The shot shows Zuko, arms crossed, standing a little further back in the patch of sunflowers. Lee gets back up, ashamed, and holds out the swords to Zuko. He takes them.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Keep in mind, these are dual swords. Two halves of a single weapon. Don't think of them as separate, 'cause they're not. They're just two different parts of the same whole.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Zuko swings around the swords carefully, demonstrating his skill. He cuts off some sunflower heads, turns around, and hands the swords back to Lee to try. Lee is a little more careful this time, and a little less awkward with the swords. He turns to Zuko once he is done his mini demonstration. Zuko smiles kindly; Lee smiles back and laughs. They begin walking away from the sunflower patch together, side by side under the full moon.

title: Zuko Alone
text: I think you'd really like my brother Sensu. He used to show me stuff like this all the time.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Fade to the morning at the pig farm. Zuko mounts his ostrich horse again, ready to leave the hospitable family. Gansu, Sela and Lee have all come to see Zuko off.

title: Zuko Alone
text: [Reaches up and offers Zuko a package.] Here. This ought to get you through a few meals.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Zuko is just about to grab the package when he looks up and notices a cloud of dust in the distance. It is Gow and his cronies riding in on ostrich horses. Gansu steps forward.

title: Zuko Alone
text: What do you think they want?

title: Zuko Alone
text: Trouble.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Gow and his crew ride toward the pig farm. The animals squeal, clearly irritated at their arrival. The Earth Kingdom soldiers stop right in front of Gansu's family and Zuko.

title: Zuko Alone
text: What do you want, Gow?

title: Zuko Alone
text: Just thought someone ought to tell you that your son's battalion got captured. [To his fellow soldiers.] You boys hear what the Fire Nation did with their last group of Earth Kingdom prisoners?

title: Zuko Alone
text: Dressed 'em up in Fire Nation uniforms and put 'em on the front line unarmed, the way I heard it. [Spits on the ground.] Then they just watched.

title: Zuko Alone
text: [Angrily.] You watch your mouth!

title: Zuko Alone
text: Gow rides forward a little more toward Gansu when Zuko goes in between them, interfering. Gow and Zuko glare at each other.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Why bother rooting around in the mud with these pigs?

title: Zuko Alone
text: Gow turns around his ostrich horse and all four soldiers ride away, kicking up a cloud of dust behind them. Cut to another one of Zuko's flashbacks in the palace grounds again and to the fountain seen earlier. Zuko and Azula are happily playing together while Ursa sits in front of the fountain when a messenger in white approaches her with a scroll. She opens and reads it before standing up and crying. She turns to young Zuko and Azula.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Iroh has lost his son. Your cousin Lu Ten did not survive the battle.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Zuko seems shocked and sad at the news, while Azula does not seem to react at all. Cut back to the present, where Zuko is still in front of the family protectively. Sela and Gansu are hugging behind him; Lee is standing close by.

title: Zuko Alone
text: What's going to happen to my brother?

title: Zuko Alone
text: I'm going to the front. I'm going to find Sensu and bring him back.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Sela and Gansu walk away from Zuko, with Sela crying desperately. Lee runs toward Zuko.

title: Zuko Alone
text: When my dad goes ... will you stay?

title: Zuko Alone
text: No. I need to move on.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Zuko reaches behind him and takes out a sheathed dagger. He bends down and gives it to Lee, who takes it with a faint smile.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Here. I want you to have this. Read the inscription.

title: Zuko Alone
text: [Unsheathes the dagger.] Made in Earth Kingdom.

title: Zuko Alone
text: The other one.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Never give up without a fight.

title: Zuko Alone
text: With that, Zuko rides away from Lee. Lee runs after him for a little bit, but stops shortly afterward. Cut to Zuko's memory again; this time he is in the Royal Palace playing with his dagger from Iroh (the one he just gave to Lee.) He fakes his death, dramatically falling to the floor with a groan. Azula sits cross-legged behind him.

title: Zuko Alone
text: You waste all your time playing with knives. You're not even good!

title: Zuko Alone
text: Put an apple on your head and we'll find out how good I am!

title: Zuko Alone
text: By the way, Uncle's coming home.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Does that mean ... we won the War?

title: Zuko Alone
text: No, it means Uncle's a quitter and a loser.

title: Zuko Alone
text: What are you talking about? Uncle's not a quitter!

title: Zuko Alone
text: Oh yes he is! He found out his son died and he just fell apart! A real general would stay and burn Ba Sing Se to the ground, not lose the battle and come home crying.

title: Zuko Alone
text: How do you know what he should do? He's probably just sad his only kid is gone. Forever.

title: Zuko Alone
text: At that moment, Ursa appears in the doorway.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Your father has requested an audience with Fire Lord Azulon. Best clothes, hurry up!

title: Zuko Alone
text: Zuko runs past Ursa quickly to get ready, while Azula walks rather slowly.

title: Zuko Alone
text: [In a bored tone.] Fire Lord Azulon ... can't you just call him 'Grandfather'? He's not exactly the powerful Fire Lord he used to be. Someone will probably end up taking his place soon.

title: Zuko Alone
text: [Angrily.] Young lady! Not another word!

title: Zuko Alone
text: Azula runs past her mother and leaves.

title: Zuko Alone
text: What is wrong with that child?

title: Zuko Alone
text: The scene changes to the Fire Lord's chamber, a large room with many columns and a wall of fire in front of the Fire Lord's throne. Ozai, Ursa, Zuko, and Azula are all sitting on the floor some distance back from Fire Lord Azulon, though Ozai's face remains obscured save for his mouth.

title: Zuko Alone
text: And how was it Great-Grandfather Sozin managed to win the Battle of Han Tui?

title: Zuko Alone
text: [Confusedly.] Great-Grandfather won ... because ...

title: Zuko Alone
text: Because even though his army was outnumbered, he cleverly calculated his advantages. The enemy was downwind and there was a drought. Their defenses burned to a crisp in minutes.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Correct, my dear. Now, would you show Grandfather the new moves you demonstrated to me?

title: Zuko Alone
text: Azula stands up and moves forward. She begins with some circular motions, warms herself up, and firebends. Ozai smiles. Azula does many fairly complicated moves with ease, and Zuko watches her in amazement. She finishes off her routine with a jump and a powerful fire blast toward the throne, before landing on her feet gracefully.

title: Zuko Alone
text: She's a true prodigy! Just like her grandfather for whom she's named.

title: Zuko Alone
text: [Sits back down, and looks at Zuko out of the corner of her eye and whispers.] You'll never catch up ...

title: Zuko Alone
text: [Stands up angrily.] I'd like to demonstrate what I've been learning.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Ozai frowns at this news. Zuko starts off well, doing the same circular motions as Azula earlier. He manages to produce a small fire blast, which does not impress Fire Lord Azulon. When he tries to create another one, he falls. He gets back up, panting heavily, and tries again, only to fall harder. Ursa gets up worriedly and approaches Zuko to comfort him.

title: Zuko Alone
text: I failed.

title: Zuko Alone
text: No. I loved watching you. That's who you are, Zuko. Someone who keeps fighting even though it's hard.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Prince Ozai, why are you wasting my time with this pomp? Just tell me what you want. Everyone else, go!

title: Zuko Alone
text: Ursa, Zuko and Azula start walking out of the throne room; however, Azula pulls Zuko off to the side just before they exit. The children hide in the curtains at the back of the room.

title: Zuko Alone
text: What are you -?

title: Zuko Alone
text: Shh!

title: Zuko Alone
text: Azula and Zuko stop where the curtains open and peek back out at the throne room, exposing only their faces.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Father, you must have realized as I have, that with Lu Ten gone, Iroh's bloodline has ended. After his son's death, my brother abandoned the siege at Ba Sing Se, and who knows when he will return home. But I am here, Father, and my children are alive.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Say what it is you want!

title: Zuko Alone
text: Father, revoke Iroh's birthright. I am your humble servant, here to serve you and our nation. Use me.

title: Zuko Alone
text: You dare suggest I betray Iroh? My first born? Directly after the demise of his only beloved son? I think Iroh has suffered enough! But you ... your punishment has scarcely begun!

title: Zuko Alone
text: Azulon's anger causes the flames around him to grow. Zuko, scared, runs away from behind the curtain as Azula watches, but she stays and continues watching with an evil smile on her face.

title: Zuko Alone
text: [Sing-songy.] Dad's going to kill you! [Seriously.] Really, he is.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Ha-ha, Azula. Nice try.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Fine, don't believe me. But I heard everything. Grandfather said Dad's punishment should fit his crime. [Imitates Azulon.] "You must know the pain of losing a first-born son. By sacrificing your own!"

title: Zuko Alone
text: Liar!

title: Zuko Alone
text: I'm only telling you for your own good. I know! Maybe you could find a nice Earth Kingdom family to adopt you!

title: Zuko Alone
text: Stop it! You're lying! Dad would never do that to me!

title: Zuko Alone
text: Ursa appears in the doorway of Zuko's room.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Your father would never do what to you? What is going on here?

title: Zuko Alone
text: I don't know ...

title: Zuko Alone
text: It's time for a talk!

title: Zuko Alone
text: Ursa drags Azula away from Zuko's bed, and Azula follows reluctantly. Zuko clasps the blanket tightly in his hands.

title: Zuko Alone
text: [Chanting in a low voice.] Azula always lies. Azula always lies.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Cut to the older Zuko, lying in green grass, holding his traveler's hat to his chest.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Azula always lies.

title: Zuko Alone
text: An ostrich horse can be heard. Zuko sits up and looks to see Sela riding toward him in a carriage. She is frantic and panicked.

title: Zuko Alone
text: You have to help! It's Lee â the thugs from town came back as soon as Gansu left. When they ordered us to give them food, Lee pulled a knife on them! I don't even know where he got a knife! Then they took him away. [Begins to sob.] They told me if he's old enough to fight, he's old enough to join the army. I know we barely know you, but ...

title: Zuko Alone
text: [Stands up dramatically.] I'll get your son back.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Back in the Earth Kingdom town, it is sunset. Zuko is riding on his ostrich horse through a small archway that enters into the town. The people around scatter when they see him coming. Lee is tied up to a tower. He seems sad, but when he looks up to see Zuko. He quickly regains hope.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Hey! There he is! I told you he'd come!

title: Zuko Alone
text: The Earth Kingdom soldiers approach him, as does their leader, Gow. Zuko dismounts and takes off his hat, placing it on the ostrich horse. They face each other, battle imminent.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Let the kid go.

title: Zuko Alone
text: [Laughs loudly, but quickly regains composure.] Who do you think you are, telling us what to do?

title: Zuko Alone
text: It doesn't matter who I am. But I know who you are. You're not soldiers; you're bullies. Freeloaders, abusing your power. Mostly over women and kids. You don't want Lee in your army â you're sick cowards messing with a family who's already lost one son to the war.

title: Zuko Alone
text: [To a fellow soldier.] Are you gonna let this stranger stand there and insult you like this?

title: Zuko Alone
text: The soldier runs forward, spear in hand. He goes to attack Zuko, who pulls out his sword and punches the other man in the stomach with the hilt without fully unsheathing his sword. Zuko re-sheathes his sword while the man slides backward and runs away, panting heavily in fear.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Give him a left! A left!

title: Zuko Alone
text: It's not a fistfight ...

title: Zuko Alone
text: He's got a left sword, don't he?

title: Zuko Alone
text: Gow does the same earthbending trick as earlier; he throws three large rocks at Zuko. Zuko responds the same as before, deflecting the first two but the third one hitting him square in the abdomen. However, this time, he falls over and somersaults backward, and manages to get up, although weakened and still stumbling around. Gow smiles.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Look out!

title: Zuko Alone
text: Behind you!

title: Zuko Alone
text: Gow earthbends again, but with increasingly larger rocks each time. He shoots four rocks at Zuko, who manages to destroy each, one by one. It continues this way, Gow no longer giving little recovery breaks to Zuko. Both are fighting at full force, although Zuko is so busy being defensive of the large flying rocks that he cannot become offensive to Gow. However, finally Gow creates a rockalanche and directs it at Zuko. The crowd gasps collectively. Zuko is sent flying and lands straight on his back, and has a sudden flashback.

title: Zuko Alone
text: ... Mom?

title: Zuko Alone
text: Zuko, please, my love, listen to me. Everything I've done, I've done to protect you.

title: Zuko Alone
text: She pulls the barely conscious Zuko into a hug.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Remember this, Zuko. No matter how things may seem to change, never forget who you are.

title: Zuko Alone
text: She turns away from him with a sad smile, pulls her hood up and disappears down the dark hallway; it is the flashback Zuko had at the very beginning of the episode.

title: Zuko Alone
text: [Whispers worriedly.] Get up ...!

title: Zuko Alone
text: Gow raises his hammers to deliver the final blow when Zuko's eyes open. He reaches for his swords and gets up firebending, creating a hurricane of flame. Gow drops his hammers and is pushed over, and lands on his back. Zuko stands there, seething at Gow. Although unarmed, Gow stands up and raises his fists, determined to finish the fight. Zuko charges him, sending various fire blasts. Gow tries to deflect them with earthbending, but the blasts are too powerful and he is sent backward again. Rocks hit his head as he lands in with a cloud of dust.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Who ... who are you?

title: Zuko Alone
text: My name is Zuko. Son of Ursa and Fire Lord Ozai. Prince of the Fire Nation, and heir to the throne.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Liar! I heard of you! You're not a prince, you're an outcast! His own father burned and disowned him!

title: Zuko Alone
text: Zuko kneels down toward Gow, who shudders in fear. However, Zuko does nothing to harm him; he only takes Lee's dagger back. Zuko walks toward Lee to give it back, but Sela (who had been untying Lee) intervenes.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Not a step closer.

title: Zuko Alone
text: [Zuko kneels down in front of Sela, with Lee peeking around his mother's back, offering the knife.]Â It's yours. You should have it.

title: Zuko Alone
text: No! I hate you!

title: Zuko Alone
text: Zuko has another flashback. It is probably early morning and he is in his bed in his room. He wakes with a start.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Mom? [Zuko leaps out of bed and runs out of his room down the hallway.] Mom? Mom!

title: Zuko Alone
text: Zuko enters a pillared room, where Azula is admiring Zuko's dagger from behind a pillar. She re-sheathes it and steps out to face Zuko.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Where's Mom?

title: Zuko Alone
text: No one knows. Oh, and last night, Grandpa passed away.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Not funny, Azula! You're sick. And I want my knife back, now. [Zuko tries to grab it, but misses as Azula quickly moves out of the way, and loudly grunts.]

title: Zuko Alone
text: [Tauntingly.]Â Who's going to make me?Â Mom?

title: Zuko Alone
text: Zuko dashes forward and grabs his knife from Azula, who was dangling in a tantalizing manner. He runs away to keep looking. Zuko reaches the garden where his father is standing still, staring into a pond.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Where is she?

title: Zuko Alone
text: Ozai does not acknowledge that he has heard Zuko. Zuko bows his head.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Azulon. Fire Lord to our nation for twenty-three years. You were our fearless leader in the Battle of Garsai. Our matchless conqueror of the Hu Xin Provinces. You were father of Iroh, father of Ozai, husband of Ilah, now passed. Grandfather of Lu Ten, now passed. Grandfather of Zuko, and Azula. We lay you to rest.

title: Zuko Alone
text: With those words, two attendants in white firebend Azulon's coffin, which was on a layer of wood so it burns easily. The Fire Sage holds up the fire crown.

title: Zuko Alone
text: As was your dying wish, you are now succeeded by your second son.

title: Zuko Alone
text: He places the fire crown in Ozai's top knot and steps away.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Hail Fire Lord Ozai!

title: Zuko Alone
text: Ozai stands up, and the group of mourners wearing red and holding flags all kneel down at once, as do the Fire Sages behind him and Zuko and Azula. Azula is smiling wickedly at this new development. Zuko looks over at her and the crowd with absolute fear in his eyes. The flashback ends.

title: Zuko Alone
text: Fade to credits

title: Zuko Alone
text: Azula (flashbackÂ only)

title: The Chase
text: The episode opens to a forested area at sunset. The camera pans downward to show Team Avatar, now including Toph, preparing to set up the campsite. Aang hands Sokka a sleeping bag. Toph stands on the ground near Appa.

title: The Chase
text: Hey! You guys picked a great campsite. [This directs everyone's attention to her. She wriggles her toes in the thick mat of fur covering the ground around the bison.] The grass is so soft.

title: The Chase
text: That's not grass. [Somewhat displeased.]Â  Appa's shedding.

title: The Chase
text: [Displeased, raises foot warily.] Oh, gross!

title: The Chase
text: Cuts to Aang sitting on Appa, a bluebird perched on his head and a yellow butterfly fluttering past. Momo jumps up in an attempt to catch the butterfly.

title: The Chase
text: [Cheerfully.] That's not gross, it's just a part of spring! You know, rebirth, flowers blooming and Appa gets a new coat.

title: The Chase
text: [Sarcastically.] Ah, the beauty of spring.

title: The Chase
text: Appa, who had currently been grooming himself, sneezes, releasing a thick cloud of fur.

title: The Chase
text: [Waving arms about, now coated in fur.] Stop! Appa, stop! Ugh! [Coughs.]

title: The Chase
text: [Bending over, his back turned to her.] It's not that bad, Katara. [He turns to reveal a wig made of fur, done up in a towering beehive.] It makes a great wig!

title: The Chase
text: [Wearing a beard of fur.] And a great beard! [Aang and Sokka laugh while pointing at each other.]

title: The Chase
text: [Wiping fur off her clothing with her eyes closed.] I'm just glad we finally have another girl in the group, because you two are disgusting.

title: The Chase
text: [Walking up from behind the two boys.] Excuse me, does anyone have a razor? Because I've got some hairy pits!

title: The Chase
text: She raises her arms, revealing that she had stuffed fur in her sleeves. The three laugh; Aang sneezes, sending himself flying backward. The big sneeze causes him to crash against Appa's leg and for fur to blow off his friends and himself. The impact leaves some fur on his back. They continue to laugh joyfully, causing Katara to chuckle slightly. The scene cuts to later in the evening where the group is setting up camp. Aang sets up the tent while Sokka throws down a pile of firewood he collected. Katara, who spends her time stirring around water in a pot, notices Toph slumped lazily against a rock, chewing a piece of wheat. She approaches her.

title: The Chase
text: So Toph, usually when setting up camp, we try to divide up the work.

title: The Chase
text: [Shrugging casually.] Hey, don't worry about me. I'm good to go.

title: The Chase
text: Well, actually what I'm trying to say is, [Holds arms out in gesture.] some of us might fetch water, while someone else might set up the fire pit, or put up the tent. [Momo flies over to her, dropping several berries he had collected into her hands.] Even Momo does his fair share.

title: The Chase
text: [Breezily.] Katara, I'm fine. I can carry my own weight. I don't need a fire, [Pats bag.] I've already collected my own food and look, [Earthbends a rock tent over her.] my tent's all set up.

title: The Chase
text: [Slightly irritated.] Well, that's great for you, but we still need to finish -

title: The Chase
text: [Angered.] I don't understand what's the problem here!

title: The Chase
text: [Waves her hand dismissively and walks away.] Never mind.

title: The Chase
text: Toph earthbends herself into her tent. Later that day, set up continues. Standing on top of Appa, Aang uses airbending to lift the saddle. He mistakenly causes it to land directly on top of Sokka, who had been standing on the ground beside the bison.

title: The Chase
text: [Landing onto the ground to aid Sokka.] Sorry!

title: The Chase
text: Cuts to Katara, who sets down a jug of water. She looks over at Toph, sitting comfortably beneath her earth tent. Her dull expression changes to one of slight happiness. She approaches Toph who is eating some sort of food item.

title: The Chase
text: [Rubs back of head sheepishly.] Hey Toph, I wanted to apologize for earlier. I think we're all just a little tired and getting on each other's nerves.

title: The Chase
text: [Casually.] Yeah, you do seem pretty tired.

title: The Chase
text: [Growing disgusted.] I meant all of us.

title: The Chase
text: Cuts to shot of inside Toph's earth tent as she lazily tosses the food item onto the ground and lays her head down to rest.

title: The Chase
text: Well, good night.

title: The Chase
text: [Slightly irked.] Good night.

title: The Chase
text: Katara turns around and leaves. The scene changes to nightfall hours later where everyone is asleep. Toph is suddenly startled awake. She rises and presses her left hand to the ground to feel the vibrations within the earth. Close-up on her left hand and ear, indicating she hears something. She rises to her feet and runs out of the tent.

title: The Chase
text: There's something coming toward us!

title: The Chase
text: What is it?

title: The Chase
text: [Pressing hand to the ground.] It feels like an avalanche, but also not an avalanche.

title: The Chase
text: [Sarcastically.] Your powers of perception are frightening.

title: The Chase
text: Should we leave?

title: The Chase
text: Better safe than sorry.

title: The Chase
text: Cuts to shot of the forest, a cloud of smoke billowing toward them in a clearing in the distance. Appa appears on screen, the team riding atop him. Aang leans against the saddle to peer at the object.

title: The Chase
text: What is that thing?

title: The Chase
text: Cuts to a shot of a tank train mechanism racing speedily along the ground. Cuts to shot of the night sky, the moon partly obscured by clouds. Cuts to Aang who yawns sleepily, dark circles beginning to form under his eyes. Cuts to Sokka who appears ready to fall asleep as he leans his head on his hand. Cuts to Toph and Katara sitting on Appa's saddle idly. Cuts to Appa who flies over mountainous terrain and lands on a smooth, rocky surface.

title: The Chase
text: [Leaping off Appa and lying on the ground, relieved.] Ah, land sweet land! [Rises and says cheerfully.] See you guys in the morning!

title: The Chase
text: Actually, can you help us unload?

title: The Chase
text: [Sarcastically.] Really? You need me to help unload Sokka's funky-smelling sleeping bag?

title: The Chase
text: Aang hands Sokka his sleeping bag which he proceeds to smell. Sokka turns away, his disgusted face growing red, and falls backward, passing out.

title: The Chase
text: [Curtly.] Well, yeah. That and everything else. You're a part of our team now, and -

title: The Chase
text: [Points a finger at Katara in irritation.] Look! I didn't ask you to help unload my stuff! [Turns and begins walking away.] I'm carrying my own weight.

title: The Chase
text: [Angrily.] That's not the point. [Approaches Toph.] Ever since you joined us, you've been nothing but selfish and unhelpful!

title: The Chase
text: [Enraged.] What? Look here, sugar queen, [Points finger at Katara.] I gave up everything I had so that I could teach Aang earthbending. So don't you talk to me about being selfish!

title: The Chase
text: While she is saying this, a fuming Katara is seen tensing her muscles in frustration and raising her hand in an attempt to speak. After finished speaking, Toph sits down on the ground and earthbends an earth tent over her.

title: The Chase
text: [Furiously.] "Sugar queen"?!Â [Toph uses earthbending to close the door of the tent.] D-did you just slam the door in my face?! How can you be so infuriating?!

title: The Chase
text: Cuts to shot of Sokka and Aang standing several feet away. Katara angrily bangs her fists against the door of the wall and kicks the tent's walls with her feet.

title: The Chase
text: Should we do something?

title: The Chase
text: [Amused.] Hey, I'm just enjoying the show.

title: The Chase
text: [Approaching Katara.] Okay, okay, you both need to calm down.

title: The Chase
text: "Both"?! [Rapidly turns to face Aang, her expression crazed and her eyes bloodshot.] I'm completely calm!!

title: The Chase
text: [Awkwardly.] I ... can see that. [Backs off.]

title: The Chase
text: The scene cuts to later at night, showing shot of the dark forest. Cuts to shot of Aang, Sokka and Katara lying on the ground. Aang is lying on the ground with Momo beside him while Sokka and Katara lie in sleeping bags.

title: The Chase
text: [Mockingly.] The stars sure are beautiful tonight. Too bad you can't see them, Toph!

title: The Chase
text: Toph uses earthbending to release a fissure that channels underground and sends Katara flying into the air. She lands on top of Sokka, startling him.

title: The Chase
text: [Annoyed; pushes Katara off to the side.] Hey, how's a guy supposed to sleep with all this yelling [To Toph.] and earthquaking?

title: The Chase
text: [Reopens her tent.] That thing is back!

title: The Chase
text: Well, how far away is it? [Lies down and pulls covers of his sleeping bag over his head; says in a muffled voice.] Maybe we can close our eyes just for a few minutes.

title: The Chase
text: The camera pans upward to reveal smoke billowing from behind the treetops.

title: The Chase
text: [Notices the smoke.] I don't think so, Sokka.

title: The Chase
text: Cuts to a shot of Appa soaring away from the scene over the mountainous terrain. Cuts to a side-view of the tank train speeding across the land.

title: The Chase
text: Seriously, what is that thing?

title: The Chase
text: And how does it keep finding us?

title: The Chase
text: [Resting against the saddle; Sokka is seen lying on his back, sleeping.] I don't know. But this time, I'm going to make sure we lose it.

title: The Chase
text: Cuts to a side-view of Appa flying past a mountain. Fades to scene of him flying between two mountain ridges. The bison lands on his side on a flat-surfaced rock bed, throwing everyone onto the ground along with their belongings.

title: The Chase
text: [Lands onto the ground.] Okay, forget about setting up camp. [Crawls along the ground in sleeping bag.] I'm finding the softest pile of dirt and going to sleep.

title: The Chase
text: [Angrily; pulling her sleeping bag under her head as a pillow.] That's good because Toph wasn't going to help anyway!

title: The Chase
text: [Irritated; lying on bag.] Oh, I didn't realize the baby still needed someone to tuck her in bed.

title: The Chase
text: Come on guys, there's something after us and we don't even know what [Pulls top part of his shirt over his head; says in a muffled voice.] or who it is.

title: The Chase
text: It could be Zuko. [Rolls over on her side.] We haven't seem him since the North Pole.

title: The Chase
text: Who's Zuko?

title: The Chase
text: [Puts his head down.] Oh, just some angry freak with a ponytail who's tracked us all over the world.

title: The Chase
text: [Mockingly.] What's wrong with ponytails, Ponytail?

title: The Chase
text: [Points to his top-knot.] This is a warrior's wolf tail.

title: The Chase
text: [Jokingly.] Well, it certainly tells the other warriors that you're fun and perky.

title: The Chase
text: [Raises head, unamused.] Anyway, whoever's chasing us couldn't have followed us here, so, now would everyone just shhh?

title: The Chase
text: Momo hops onto his sleeping bag and chitters excitedly.

title: The Chase
text: [Hold up finger to silence the lemur.] No Momo, shhh. [Relaxes.] Sleepy time.

title: The Chase
text: Momo hops off Sokka and over to the ledge of the rock. He continues to chitter and raises his ears up in alert. Aang rises, followed by Toph and Katara.

title: The Chase
text: [Buries face in hands.] Oh, don't tell me ...

title: The Chase
text: That's impossible. There's no way they could have tracked us.

title: The Chase
text: I can feel it with my own two feet!

title: The Chase
text: Aang runs to the edge of the cliff next to Momo and notices smoke rising from the far end of the rocky pathway. Cuts to a shot of the tank train as it rumbles up a slope and onto level ground.

title: The Chase
text: [Nervously.] Let's get out of here.

title: The Chase
text: [Calmly.] Maybe we should face them. Find out who they are. Who knows, maybe they're friendly.

title: The Chase
text: [Hopelessly.] Always the optimist ...

title: The Chase
text: Cuts to a side-view of the tank train as it slows to a halt. The door to one compartment opens, releasing a burst of steam. From the mist emerges three Mongoose Lizards. Cuts to side-view as Ty Lee appears on screen, followed by Mai and Azula. Cuts to shot of Katara and Aang looking on in shock. The camera pans downward to where the three girls stand atop the Lizards. Cuts to shot of Azula, a determined look on her face. The three begin racing toward the group.

title: The Chase
text: [Alarmed.] It's those three girls from Omashu!

title: The Chase
text: Everyone assumes fighting stances.

title: The Chase
text: [Determined.] We can take them. Three on three.

title: The Chase
text: Actually Toph, there's four of us.

title: The Chase
text: [Sheepishly.] Oh, I'm sorry, I didn't count you. You know, no bending and all.

title: The Chase
text: [Turning to her, his face distorted with rage.] I can still fight!

title: The Chase
text: [Smugly.] Okay, three on three plus Sokka.

title: The Chase
text: [Face turns red.] Errrgh!

title: The Chase
text: Toph earthbends three columns in an attempt to hinder the girls, however, the Mongoose Lizards merely leap over the pillars and continues on their way.

title: The Chase
text: Well, we wanted to find out who they were and we found out. [Puts boomerang away; Aang and Katara are seen fleeing.] Now let's get out of here.

title: The Chase
text: Toph earthbends a huge rock wall in front of the trio. Cuts to Azula who moves her arms in a circular motion, generating lightning. She fires the bolt at the wall, blowing a huge hole in it. Shows the lizards as they clamber through the hole. Toph is clearly shocked at this. Cuts to Mai who swings her arm, releasing a flurry of stilettos. Toph launches herself off a pillar. The darts strike the pillar and she lands on Appa.

title: The Chase
text: Appa, yip yip!

title: The Chase
text: They manage to escape successfully, narrowly avoiding a blue fire blast. Cuts to shot of Azula who lowers her arm and looks up at the retreating group. Cuts to a sleepy Appa.

title: The Chase
text: [Shocked.] I can't believe those girls followed us all the way from Omashu.

title: The Chase
text: [Grumpily.] I still think we could have taken them.

title: The Chase
text: Are you kidding me? [Points fingers upward repeatedly in gesture.] The crazy blue firebending and the flying daggers are bad enough, but last time we saw them, one of those girls did something that took my bending away. That's scary.

title: The Chase
text: The scene cuts to a shot of the landscape, a prairie below, mountains in the distance. The sun is seen rising over the horizon as Appa soars past.

title: The Chase
text: [Complaining.] Oh no, the sun is rising. We've been up all night with no sleep!

title: The Chase
text: [Calmly.] Sokka, we'll be okay.

title: The Chase
text: [Nervously.] Are you sure? I've never not slept before! [Holds hands up to his head.] What if I fall asleep now and something happens? [Freaks out; eyes bulge out.] And something always happens!

title: The Chase
text: Every time we land, those girls are there. So we'll just have to keep flying.

title: The Chase
text: Cuts to shot of Appa flying past the sun.

title: The Chase
text: We can't keep flying forever.

title: The Chase
text: The scene changes to a field where a few flowers are growing. The tank train speeds by rapidly, slicing the heads of the flowers off. Cuts to ground level, indentation marks from the train in the ground and a pair of ostrich horse legs galloping by. Zuko is seen riding on his ostrich horse, a look of determination on his face. Cuts to an overhead view of him running to the left of the indentation marks. The scene changes back to Appa.

title: The Chase
text: [Yawns.] So what's our plan?

title: The Chase
text: [Slumped against the saddle, exhausted.] Don't know ... too tired to think.

title: The Chase
text: I'm sure we'll come up with something after a short nap. [Smiles.]

title: The Chase
text: [Relieved.] Yes ... sleep.

title: The Chase
text: The two begin nodding off before slowly rising into the air, wind blowing through their clothing as they lose altitude. The camera pans to the right, showing Toph hanging onto the saddle.

title: The Chase
text: [Frantically.] What's going on?

title: The Chase
text: Camera pans to the right to reveal Aang hanging in the air, gripping Appa's reins tightly.

title: The Chase
text: Appa fell asleep!

title: The Chase
text: Cuts to shot of Appa, whose eyes are closed and legs are sprawled out, as he falls through a cloud toward the ground. Katara hangs onto her brother tightly. Aang crawls over to Appa's head and leans over to face the bison.

title: The Chase
text: [Urgently.] Wake up, buddy!

title: The Chase
text: Cuts to shot of one of Appa's eyes as it slowly creaks open and widens in realization of the current situation. Having awakened, he resumes his normal flight, soaring just above the treetops. Toph, Sokka, Katara and Momo sway to the side still tightly gripping the saddle. Appa soars through the trees, colliding into and snapping several branches. Cuts to shot of the team members who brace against the impact. The camera zooms out to depict a flock of birds resting in the trees, fleeing from the incident, before panning downward to show Appa on the ground, having created a channel way behind him from the impact. Cuts to shot of Appa sleeping once more; Aang slides off his head and onto the ground.

title: The Chase
text: Appa's exhausted.

title: The Chase
text: [Trudging across the ground, carrying his sleeping bag.] Okay, we've put in a lot of distance between us and them. The plan right now is to follow Appa's lead and get some sleep.

title: The Chase
text: [Irritated.] Of course, we could've gotten some sleep earlier, [Depicts shot of Toph lying on the ground sleepily.] if Toph didn't have such issues.

title: The Chase
text: [Wakes up and slams the ground; screams furiously.] What!?

title: The Chase
text: [Trying to calm the tension.] All right, all right, everyone's exhausted! Let's just get some rest.

title: The Chase
text: [Rises and faces Katara.] No, I want to hear what Katara has to say. You think I have issues?

title: The Chase
text: [Irritated.] I'm just saying. Maybe if you helped out earlier, we could have set up our camp faster and gotten some sleep [Shouting.] and then maybe we wouldn't be in this situation!

title: The Chase
text: Cuts to shot of entire campsite, Katara, Toph and Aang standing by Appa, while Sokka lies sleepily on his sleeping bag several yards away.

title: The Chase
text: You're blaming me for this?

title: The Chase
text: Katara tosses aside her sleeping bag and gestures with her hands, challenging Toph to move closer. Aang jumps in between the two.

title: The Chase
text: [Desperately.] No! No, she's not blaming you.

title: The Chase
text: [Angrily.] No, I'm blaming her!

title: The Chase
text: Hey, [Shoves Aang out of the way.] I never asked you for diddly-doo-dah. [Points her thumb at herself.] I carry my own weight. Besides, if there's anyone to blame, it's Sheddy over here!

title: The Chase
text: [Sitting on Appa's tail.] What? You're blaming Appa?

title: The Chase
text: Yeah, you want to know how they keep finding us? [Grabs a handful of Appa's fur and lets the sheddings blow away in the wind.] He's leaving a trail everywhere we go!

title: The Chase
text: [Jumps down to face her.] How dare you blame Appa! He saved your life three times today! If there's anyone to blame it's you! You're always talking about how you carry your own weight, but you're not. He is! Appa's carrying your weight. He never had a problem flying when it was just the three of us!

title: The Chase
text: [Stomps the ground, launching her pack into the air which she catches.] I'm out of here.

title: The Chase
text: [Moves in front of Toph, his arms outstretched to halt her.] Wait!

title: The Chase
text: Toph uses earthbending to shift Sokka off to the side, leaving him surprised. Cuts to shot of fur drifting in the sky. Cuts to ground level view of the tank train speeding across the terrain. Cuts to overhead shot of Aang who raises his arms up, his eyes sorrowful.

title: The Chase
text: What did I just do? [Slumps.] I can't believe I yelled at my earthbending teacher. Now she's gone.

title: The Chase
text: [Regretfully.] I know. We're all just trying to get used to each other. And I was so mean to her.

title: The Chase
text: [From afar, drinking from a cup.] Yeah, you two were pretty much jerks.

title: The Chase
text: [Sarcastically.] Thanks, Sokka.

title: The Chase
text: No problem.

title: The Chase
text: We need to find Toph and apologize.

title: The Chase
text: Okay, but what are we going to do about the tank full of dangerous ladies chasing us?

title: The Chase
text: [Grabs a handful of fur and watches as it blows away in the wind.] I have a plan.

title: The Chase
text: The scene changes to where Appa lies in the water. The camera zooms out to a shot of him lounging in the Nan Shan River, two arched streams of water showering him on either side. Cuts to shot of the river's surface where clumps of fur collect in the water. Cuts to a shot of the top of Appa's head where Momo lands, holding a brush. He scrubs the bison's head and is forced to hastily take flight when a stream of water is bent his way. Cuts to shot of Appa's head, Sokka standing in the river several feet away, holding a brush. He groans as he becomes drenched by the stream of water. The scene changes to the campsite where Appa stands on the ground, his fur still wet from the bath. Sokka can be seen standing by the riverbank, wringing out his shirt.

title: The Chase
text: Toph was right. The fur was leaving a trail right to us. But now that he's clean, no more trail.

title: The Chase
text: Are you sure he's okay to fly?

title: The Chase
text: He'll be fine as long as we leave his saddle and all our stuff here. [Kneels down and places pieces of Appa's fur into his satchel.] I'm going to use Appa's fur to make a fake trail to lead the tank off-course.

title: The Chase
text: Cuts to shot of the treetops. Appa grunts and takes flight, Sokka and Katara riding atop him. As he flies away, his body accidentally brushes against the treetops, snapping the topmost limbs off and causing them to fall to the ground. Aang watches as the bison flies away and turns. Taking a running start, he flies away from the scene on his glider, releasing patches of fur from the bag along the way, creating a misleading trail.

title: The Chase
text: Ow ... That really hurt my tailbone.

title: The Chase
text: The scene changes to the Nan Shan River, the camera panning slightly downward to show patches of Appa's fur clinging to rocks. Azula's hands appear on screen as she grabs hold of two patches of fur and lifts to examine them.

title: The Chase
text: [Off camera; dryly.] Wads of wet fur. How delightful.

title: The Chase
text: [Thoughtfully.] Hmmm ... they're not wads, they're more like bundles, or bunches? [Scratching her head.] It's got an "uh" sound.

title: The Chase
text: [Unamused.] Clumps?

title: The Chase
text: [Clasps her hands together and says brightly.] Clumps! They're clumps! [Hugs Mai.]

title: The Chase
text: Cuts to close-up of Mai, still being embraced by Ty Lee, who peers down. Cuts to shot of the fake fur trail, the camera panning upward to reveal the direction in which it is traveling.

title: The Chase
text: [To Azula, pointing in direction of the trail.] The trail goes this way.

title: The Chase
text: Azula, who had been bending over, examining the fur, rises and looks in the direction of the trail. She averts her gaze upward. Cuts to shot of the broken treetops.

title: The Chase
text: The Avatar's trying to give us the slip. [Pointing to the broken treetops.] You two head in that direction and keep your eye out for the bison. [Looking down at fur trail.] I'll follow this trail.

title: The Chase
text: Cuts to shot of Azula who narrows her eyes. Cuts to ground level shot as Mai and Ty Lee ride away on their mongoose lizards. As they disappear from sight, Azula's mongoose lizard comes into view, the Fire Nation princess mounted on top. She pulls on the reigns and heads in the opposite direction, following the fake trail. Cuts to overhead shot of the area, Mai and Ty Lee seen traveling to the right of the screen, Azula to the left. Cuts to shot of Azula, who races toward the camera.

title: The Chase
text: [Surveying the woods.] Toph couldn't have made it too far. [Momo begins to chitter and rears up defensively.] What is it, Momo? Ooooh, no! Katara!

title: The Chase
text: Cuts to overhead shot of Sokka sitting on Appa's tail, Mai and Ty Lee following the bison in hot pursuit, mounted on mongoose lizards.

title: The Chase
text: [Shocked; urges Appa forward.] How did they find us?

title: The Chase
text: Cuts to side-view of Appa who flies dangerously close to the tree line, growing more and more tired.

title: The Chase
text: [Urgently.] Appa, come on, we need to go faster!

title: The Chase
text: He's too tired!

title: The Chase
text: [Frantically.] Not good, not good! [Appa grunts;. Cuts to ground level view of Mai and Ty Lee chasing after them. Cuts to shot of Appa heading toward the river.] We just need to make it across that river!

title: The Chase
text: [Pleading.] Come on Appa, just a little further ...

title: The Chase
text: Cuts to side-view of Appa who continues his descent, snapping off several treetops in the process. Cuts to shot from directly beneath Appa who crashes into another treetop, causing it to fall toward the screen. Cuts back to Mai and Ty Lee who chase after them. Cuts to Mai who swings her arm, firing a flurry of stilettos. Cuts back to Sokka who narrowly avoids the weapons by ducking. Cuts to view of Appa skimming the surface of the Nan Shan River before crashing into the ground on the opposite side of the river. Cuts to shot from the other side of the river, Appa's backside seen in the distance.

title: The Chase
text: [Voice-over.] We made it! We're safe.

title: The Chase
text: [Voice-over.] You did it Appa!

title: The Chase
text: Cuts to riverbank where the siblings embrace. Katara opens her eyes and gasps. Sokka turns around and becomes horrified. Cuts to side-view of the mongoose lizards paddling the water rapidly, allowing for them to walk over the surface of the river. Katara steps forward and spins around, sending a wave of water crashing into Ty Lee's mongoose lizard. Ty Lee leaps off the beast just in time and emerges from the water. She lands near the treetops where she gracefully dodges from tree trunk to tree trunk in pursuit of Katara, who opens her water skin.

title: The Chase
text: [Well off-balance.] Good try, but no.

title: The Chase
text: Cuts to shot of a tree growing near the riverbank. Katara appears on screen and halts in front of the tree. She begins to draw a stream of water with which to attack Mai, however, the knife thrower hurls two shuriken knives her way. Each of the two knives pins her wrists to the tree trunk. Katara gasps in horror. Cuts to side-view of the riverbank as the stream of water falls into the river again and Sokka hobbles on-screen as a result of the paralysis. He falls to the ground.

title: The Chase
text: How are you doing?

title: The Chase
text: [Frantically.] Well, you know ...

title: The Chase
text: [Dryly.] I thought when Ty Lee and I finally caught you guys, it would be more exciting. Oh well, victory is boring.

title: The Chase
text: The two are suddenly swept off their feet by a powerful gust of wind conjured by Appa's tail. They incidentally somersault into the air and land several yards away in the water. Cuts to shot of riverbank, Appa shaking his tail, his back facing the camera.

title: The Chase
text: [Still lying on the ground.] Thanks Appa, I don't know what we'd do without you.

title: The Chase
text: Appa sweeps his large tongue over Sokka's face, covering him in drool. Sokka expresses irritation at this, his eyebrow twitching. Cuts to overhead shot of the forest behind the river and pans downward to the opposite side of the riverbank where Mai and Ty Lee arrive at its edge, drenched.

title: The Chase
text: [Wringing out her braid.] Was it just me, or was that guy kind of cute?

title: The Chase
text: Mai casts an annoyed glance off to the side. The scene changes to Tu Zin where Aang still sits cross-legged, awaiting his enemy. Cuts to close-up of his face before a shot of him looking out over the horizon where Azula appears, riding on her mongoose lizard in a cloud of dust. Cuts to a side-view shot of her as she closes in on the town. Cuts to faraway shot of Aang sitting at the end of the village. Azula appears on-screen. Cuts to shot of the ground, covered in fur, where Azula's feet land as she dismounts. Cuts to overhead shot of the town.

title: The Chase
text: All right, you've caught up with me. Now, who are you and what do you want?

title: The Chase
text: [Coolly.] You mean you haven't guessed? You don't see the family resemblance? Here's a hint. [Covers her eye and deepens her voice, imitating Zuko.] I must find the Avatar to restore my honor! [Aang remains silent; back in her normal voice.] It's okay, you can laugh. It's funny.

title: The Chase
text: So what now?

title: The Chase
text: [Cuts to view of her left side.] Now? Now, it's over. You're tired and you have no place to go. [Cuts to view of her face.] You can run, but I'll catch you.

title: The Chase
text: [Rises to face her.] I'm not running.

title: The Chase
text: Cuts to close-up of Azula, who smirks. Cuts to shot of the sun setting over the mountains. The camera pans downward to show Toph and Iroh sitting in a rocky outcrop. Cuts to shot of a tea kettle heating over a fire. Iroh can be seen in the background, sitting next to it. He pours tea into two tin cups.

title: The Chase
text: [Handing her a cup of tea.] Here is your tea. [Cuts to shot of Toph staring blankly at the ground and back to Iroh.] You seem a little too young to be traveling alone.

title: The Chase
text: [Taking the tea from his hand.] You seem a little too old.

title: The Chase
text: [Laughs.] Perhaps I am.

title: The Chase
text: [Casually.] I know what you're thinking ... I look like I can't handle being by myself.

title: The Chase
text: I wasn't thinking that.

title: The Chase
text: You wouldn't even let me pour my own cup of tea!

title: The Chase
text: I poured your tea because I wanted to and for no other reason.

title: The Chase
text: People see me and think I'm weak. They want to take care of me, but I can take care of myself, by myself.

title: The Chase
text: You sound like my nephew, always thinking you need to do things on your own, without anyone's support. There is nothing wrong with letting the people who love you help you. Not that I love you, I just met you.

title: The Chase
text: [Laughs.] So where is your nephew?

title: The Chase
text: I've been tracking him actually.

title: The Chase
text: Is he lost?

title: The Chase
