text: [Looks away; slightly sad.] Yes, a little bit. [Cuts to shot of the rocky ledge where the two sit, the mountain region in the background; voice-over.] His life has recently changed and he's going through very difficult times. He's trying to figure out who he is and he went away.

title: The Chase
text: So now you're following him.

title: The Chase
text: I know he doesn't want me around him right now, but if he needs me, I'll be there.

title: The Chase
text: Your nephew is very lucky, even if he doesn't know it. [Gets up to leave.] Thank you.

title: The Chase
text: My pleasure. Sharing tea with a fascinating stranger is one of life's true delights.

title: The Chase
text: [Happily.] No, thank you for what you said. It helped me.

title: The Chase
text: I'm glad.

title: The Chase
text: [Rises to leave, but turns around briefly.] Oh, and about your nephew, maybe you should tell him that you need him, too.

title: The Chase
text: Iroh remains silent and sips his tea. The scene changes back to Tu Zin, the camera panning down to depict the town, Azula standing on the opposite side of town as Aang. Cuts briefly to Aang and to Azula who smiles smugly.

title: The Chase
text: Do you really want to fight me?

title: The Chase
text: Zuko suddenly appears from an alleyway, leaping off his ostrich horse onto the ground, creating a cloud of dust. He stands up straight and throws his conical hat aside.

title: The Chase
text: Yes, I really do.

title: The Chase
text: [Alarmed.] Zuko!

title: The Chase
text: [Calmly.] I was wondering when you'd show up, Zuzu.

title: The Chase
text: [Covers mouth to suppress laughter.] "Zuzu"?

title: The Chase
text: [Determined.] Back off, Azula! He's mine!

title: The Chase
text: [Assumes a fighting stance.] I'm not going anywhere.

title: The Chase
text: Cuts to overhead shot of the street way where the three opponents stand, prepared for battle. Cuts to shot of Azula, confident as ever. Cuts to shot of Zuko, who averts his gaze first to Azula before looking toward Aang. Cuts to Aang who assumes a fighting stance, pointing his glider at Zuko in fright. Cuts to shot of the three from the perspective of the front porch of a store, the camera panning to the left from Aang to Azula. Cuts to shot of Zuko, who shifts the position of his fingers a bit. Cuts to Aang, who looks about him nervously. Cuts to Azula, who continues to smirk in confidence. Cuts to close-up of Zuko, a shot of Aang, before switching back to Zuko. Cuts to close-up of Azula, whose smile widens. Cuts to brief shot of Zuko.

title: The Chase
text: [Thrilled.] Katara!

title: The Chase
text: Azula swiftly turns around and fires a blast at the waterbender, who races out of the building along the porch. Azula follows her in hot pursuit, only to be halted by Sokka, who emerges from another doorway and swings his machete her way. Katara runs off-camera, while Azula is forced to duck. Sokka begins chasing her. Cuts to overhead shot of the town where Azula is now being cornered by him, Katara and Aang. Cuts to shot of Zuko still lying on the ground as he regains consciousness. Cuts to shot of Iroh standing over him from his perspective, the shot slightly blurred to show the effect of being knocked out.

title: The Chase
text: [Slightly dazed.] Uncle ...

title: The Chase
text: Get up!

title: The Chase
text: He helps Zuko get up. Cuts to shot of Aang as he runs straight toward Azula, his back facing the camera. He leaps over her just as Azula fires a blast at him which heads directly toward the camera. She turns around and blocks a water whip Katara sends at her. She fires a blast at Sokka and swings her arm outward to prolong the blast. Aang appears on-screen behind her. She turns around and nearly manages to strike him with another blast. Cuts to overhead shot of the three Team Avatar members and Azula, who swings her arm outward, sending an arched fire blast at the three. Cuts to shot of Azula who stands, poised for attack. Camera pans downward to her feet. She suddenly falls over to the side; Toph appears from an alleyway, having just shifted the ground beneath her feet.

title: The Chase
text: I thought you guys could use a little help.

title: The Chase
text: [Happily.] Thanks.

title: The Chase
text: Azula rises to her feet and begins running away. Cuts to shot from the view of an alleyway, where Azula appears on-screen and runs through the alley. She leaps over some crates and tries to escape, however, Iroh intervenes, using his rotund belly to knock her off her feet. Zuko appears on-screen next to him. Cuts to overhead shot of Aang, Katara, Sokka, Toph, Zuko and Iroh all cornering Azula against the ruins of a stone wall.

title: The Chase
text: [Coolly, backing up as her enemies surround her.] Well, look at this. Enemies and traitors, all working together. I'm done. [Raises her hands in surrender.] I know when I'm beaten. You got me. A princess surrenders with honor.

title: The Chase
text: Cuts to shot of Iroh, who averts his gaze toward the other members, who remain on high alert. The camera switches to his point of view, zooming in on Toph and shifting upward to Aang, Katara and Sokka, who still assume fighting stances. Cuts briefly to Azula, who smirks, before switching to Toph from Iroh's point of view. Cuts to Azula, who smiles and takes a step forward, firing a blast at Iroh, who gets hit. He screams in pain and falls to the ground.

title: The Chase
text: [Horrified.] Aaaah!

title: The Chase
text: The remaining five turn to face Azula, four of them bending their respective elements and Sokka throwing his boomerang straight for her. The impact of the elements creates a minor explosion, sending a thick cloud of smoke everywhere. Cuts to buildings in the town now set alight, burning embers falling from the sky. Cuts to shot of Aang as the smoke clears, who looks from his defensive position at the effect. Cuts overhead shot of the group surrounding the corner, the smoke clearing to reveal Azula having vanished from the scene without a trace. Cuts to Zuko, who kneels before his uncle, dismayed at the turn of events.

title: The Chase
text: [Angrily.] Ugggh! [Looks at Team Avatar.] Get away from us!

title: The Chase
text: Cuts to Toph, the camera shifting to her foot, showing that she can detect the vibrations using seismic sense. Cuts to Iroh, who is still breathing, indicating that he is still alive. Katara approaches Zuko.

title: The Chase
text: Zuko, I can help.

title: The Chase
text: [Blasts an arc of fire.] Leave!

title: The Chase
text: The members of Team Avatar all run away off-screen, leaving Zuko still kneeling over Iroh. The camera pans upward to show thick smoke billowing from the fire. The scene fades to a mountain at nightfall where Appa lands. Cuts to shot of Team Avatar sleeping on the saddle. Camera zooms in on Toph and Katara resting next to each other.

title: The Chase
text: Fades to credits.

title: The Chase
text: Aang

title: Bitter Work
text: The episode opens in a mountainous terrain at sunrise as it pans down and to the right. All of Team Avatar is sleeping. Cut to Aang rising and jumping up with airbending, barefoot, and filled with excitement.

title: Bitter Work
text: Today's the day! [Lands near a sleeping Sokka.] Can you believe it? After all that time searching for a teacher, I'm finally starting earthbending! [Momo chitters and lands on Sokka.] And this place, [Momo moves on to Appa's head.] it's perfect, don't you think? Sokka? [Sokka grumbles and glares at Aang with tired eyes.] Oh, you're still sleeping, huh? [Sokka again grumbles and puts his head back down. Aang whispers.] Sorry.

title: Bitter Work
text: The ground shakes, causing Aang to turn to look toward the source of the rumbling. The camera quickly pans to the left to an earth tent, the slabs of which are tossed in every direction mere moments after. As the dust clears, Toph is standing in the middle with her left hand raised in the air.

title: Bitter Work
text: Goooood morning, [She puts both her hands on her hips.] earthbending student!

title: Bitter Work
text: Cut to the side-shot of Appa, with Momo on his head, Sokka, still sleeping and curled up within his sleeping bag with Aang standing at his feet, and Katara, who is sitting upright in her own sleeping bag. Toph walks over to them.

title: Bitter Work
text: Good morning, Sifu Toph.

title: Bitter Work
text: [Aang bows slightly to Toph; disappointed and tiredly.] Hey, you never called me Sifu Katara.

title: Bitter Work
text: [Scratches the back of his head.] Well, if you think I should ...

title: Bitter Work
text: Sokka suddenly sits up, grumbling at Aang. Cut to a closer shot of Aang, who looks down in wonder, and Toph, who has a smile on her face.

title: Bitter Work
text: Sorry, Snoozles, we'll do our earthbending as [Whispers slightly, though with amusement in her voice.] quietly as we can.

title: Bitter Work
text: Cut to a close-up of Toph's feet as she slams her left heel into the ground, creating a crack. Cut to a side-shot of Sokka, who had laid himself back down. An earth pillar rises up right underneath him, catapulting him screaming into the air. Cut to an aerial shot of the team's camping spot as Sokka flies directly toward the camera. After he has flown so close to the camera that the shot was nothing more than a close-up of this uvula, the scene cuts back to ground level of the campsite, where Katara is standing up and joins Toph and Aang in looking toward the sky. Sokka crashes to the ground in their middle with a loud thud. He immediately jumps to his feet, still in his sleeping bag with only his head visible, and hops toward Aang while grumbling. He stops in front of the Avatar and grumbles to his face, before jumping toward Toph and doing the same to her. He subsequently hops toward the camera and out of the shot, still grumbling angrily. Everyone else turns to watch him go.

title: Bitter Work
text: [Excitedly.] So what move are you going to teach me first? [Stretches out his right arm, his fist clenched, and brings it down like a hammer.] Rock-a-lanche? [He brings his left clenched fist to his right elbow, while his right arm is bent upward, the fist also clenched. He trembles with the motion.] The Trembler? Oh, maybe I could learn to make a [Stretches both arms over his head and starts to spin around.] whirlpool out of land!

title: Bitter Work
text: [Puts a hand on Aang's chest.] Let's start with ... [Makes the gesture.] move a rock.

title: Bitter Work
text: [Claps excitedly.] Sounds good, sounds good!

title: Bitter Work
text: Cuts to another part of the canyon where Toph and Aang are standing in front of two rocks as Katara watches.

title: Bitter Work
text: The key to earthbending is your stance. You've got to be steady and strong. Rock is a stubborn element. If you're going to move it, you've got to be like a rock yourself.

title: Bitter Work
text: Like a rock. Got it.

title: Bitter Work
text: Good. Now the actual motion of this one is pretty simple. [Slams the rock against the canyon wall.] Okay, you ready to give it a try?

title: Bitter Work
text: I'm ready. [Tries to move it, but instead he is forced backward into Appa.]

title: Bitter Work
text: [Amused.] Rock beats airbender!

title: Bitter Work
text: Iroh has a flashback in a dream about Lu Ten. Lu Ten pretends to firebend at Iroh who fakes a groan and falls over.

title: Bitter Work
text: I got you, Dad! [Playfully jumps on top of Iroh.]

title: Bitter Work
text: Both laugh as the scene fades to Iroh in a dream sitting over Lu Ten's tomb.

title: Bitter Work
text: My beloved Lu Ten, I will see you again.

title: Bitter Work
text: The scene fades again as Iroh wakes up to Zuko calling him.

title: Bitter Work
text: Uncle ... you were unconscious. Azula did this to you. It was a surprise attack.

title: Bitter Work
text: Somehow, that's not so surprising. [Groans.]

title: Bitter Work
text: [Hands Iroh some tea.] I hope I made it the way you like it. [Iroh takes a sip from the cup and his eyes widen. He lets out a cry of disgust, but manages to mask it.]

title: Bitter Work
text: [Grimaces.] Good. That was very ... uhhh ... bracing. [He is handed another cup, which he throws out secretly behind his shoulder.]

title: Bitter Work
text: So Uncle, I've been thinking. It's only a matter of time before I run into Azula again. I'm going to need to know more advanced firebending if I want to stand a chance against her. I know what you're going to say: she's my sister and I should be trying to get along with her.

title: Bitter Work
text: [With the exact opposite of Zuko's thoughts.] No, she's crazy, and she needs to go down. [Zuko nods. Iroh grunts as he stands up.] It's time to resume your training.

title: Bitter Work
text: Back at the canyon. Katara and Toph are standing next to the boulder Aang tried to move. Aang walks up, a hand behind his head.

title: Bitter Work
text: I don't understand what went wrong. He did it exactly the way you did.

title: Bitter Work
text: Maybe there's another way ... what if I came at the boulder from another angle?

title: Bitter Work
text: No. That's the problem. You've got to stop thinking like an airbender. There's no different angle, no clever solution, no trickety-trick that's going to move that rock. You've got to face it head on. And when I say head on, I mean like this ... [Jumps up and destroys the rock with her head.]

title: Bitter Work
text: Whoa!

title: Bitter Work
text: Toph begins to walk away, but Katara stops her.

title: Bitter Work
text: [Trying to help Toph teach.] I've been training Aang for a while now. He really responds well to a positive teaching experience. Lots of encouragement and praise. Kind words. If he's doing something wrong, maybe a gentle nudge in the right direction.

title: Bitter Work
text: Thanks, Katara. A gentle nudge. I'll try that. [Moments later; yelling at the top of her lungs.] Keep your knees high, Twinkle Toes!

title: Bitter Work
text: Cut to Aang carrying a large rock on his back, struggling to hold it up. The camera zooms out, showing Toph in the background stomping down and causing pillars of rock to rise underneath Aang's feet as he walks. Aang loses his balance and falls off-screen.

title: Bitter Work
text: Rock-like!

title: Bitter Work
text: Next, Toph gives Aang one of Sokka's weapons, much to Sokka's dismay. Cut to Sokka's face with Toph's hand holding him back. He grunts, trying to move forward. Cut to a side-view, showing Sokka struggling to get his club back from Toph, who is holding it to the side and preventing Sokka from grabbing it. She shoves him backward and he stalks offscreen. She hands the weapon to Aang. He is blindfolded as he tries to smash rocks Toph brings up. He finally gets one after about five times. Cut to Toph, who nods in approval.

title: Bitter Work
text: Rock-like!

title: Bitter Work
text: The camera pans up to reveal Aang holding a solid stance without losing his balance. Toph appears on a pillar near him and nods. Aang smiles, knowing he is finally getting the hang of it.

title: Bitter Work
text: You're awfully cute, but unfortunately you're made of meat. Just a bit closer ... [Jumps but falls into a crack that is in the ground. He looks at the cub.] Gotcha! [Sinks further in.] You are one lucky little meat creature.

title: Bitter Work
text: Back at Iroh and Zuko's setup.

title: Bitter Work
text: Lightning is a pure form of firebending, without aggression. It is not fueled by rage or emotion the way other firebending is. Some call lightning the cold-blooded fire. It is precise and deadly, like Azula. To perform the technique requires peace of mind.

title: Bitter Work
text: I see. That's why we're drinking tea, to calm the mind.

title: Bitter Work
text: Oh yeah, good point! I mean, yes. [Outside.] There is energy all around us. The energy is both yin and yang. Positive energy and negative energy. Only a select few firebenders can separate these energies. This creates an imbalance. The energy wants to restore balance, and in a moment the positive and negative energy come crashing back together, you provide release and guidance, creating lightning. [Steps up, and generates lightning, and shoots it away from the two.]

title: Bitter Work
text: I'm ready to try it!

title: Bitter Work
text: Remember, once you separate the energy, you do not command it. You are simply its humble guide. Breathe first.

title: Bitter Work
text: Zuko takes a deep breath. He tries to generate lightning, but instead an explosion launches him back. Iroh shakes his head in disappointment.

title: Bitter Work
text: This time we're going to try something a little different. Instead of moving a rock, you're going to stop a rock. Get in your horse stance! I'm going to roll that boulder down at you. If you have the attitude of an earthbender, you'll stay in your stance and stop the rock. Like this! [Stretches out, still in stance.]

title: Bitter Work
text: Sorry Toph, but are you really sure this is the way to teach Aang earthbending?

title: Bitter Work
text: I'm glad you said something. Actually there is a better way. [Blindfolds Aang.] This way, you'll actually have to sense the vibrations of the boulder to stop it. Thank you, Katara.

title: Bitter Work
text: [Sarcastically.] Yeah, thanks, Katara!

title: Bitter Work
text: [Nervously.] Heh.

title: Bitter Work
text: Cut to Toph standing at the top of the hill with Aang at the bottom. She shoves the rock forward and it begins to roll down the slope. Aang looks worried and afraid as it rolls toward him. He jumps over the boulder at the last second, causing it to roll past and crash into the cliff. Toph comes running toward Aang.

title: Bitter Work
text: I guess I just panicked. I don't know what to say.

title: Bitter Work
text: There's nothing to say, you blew it! You had a perfect stance, and a perfect form. But when it came right down to it, you didn't have the guts!

title: Bitter Work
text: [Disappointed.] I know. I'm sorry.

title: Bitter Work
text: Yeah, you are sorry! If you're not tough enough to stop the rock, then you can at least give it the pleasure of smashing you instead of jumping out of the way like a jelly-boned wimp! Now, do you have what it takes to face that rock like an earthbender?

title: Bitter Work
text: No, I don't think I do.

title: Bitter Work
text: Aang, it's no big deal. You'll take a break and try earthbending again when you're ready. Besides, you still have a lot of waterbending to work on. Okay?

title: Bitter Work
text: Yeah, that sounds good.

title: Bitter Work
text: Yeah, whatever, go splash around until you feel better.

title: Bitter Work
text: They all exit.

title: Bitter Work
text: Back to Zuko and Iroh. Another attempt by Zuko to generate lightning fails.

title: Bitter Work
text: Why can't I do it? Instead of lightning it keeps exploding in my face ... like everything always does.

title: Bitter Work
text: I was afraid this might happen. You will not be able to master lightning until you have dealt with the turmoil inside you.

title: Bitter Work
text: What turmoil?

title: Bitter Work
text: Zuko, you must let go of your feelings of shame if you want your anger to go away.

title: Bitter Work
text: But I don't feel any shame at all. I'm as proud as ever.

title: Bitter Work
text: Prince Zuko, pride is not the opposite of shame, but its source. True humility is the only antidote to shame.

title: Bitter Work
text: Well, my life has been nothing but humbling lately.

title: Bitter Work
text: I have another idea. I will teach you a firebending move that even Azula doesn't know, because I made it up myself. [Zuko smiles.]

title: Bitter Work
text: Back to Sokka, who remains trapped with the small, brown animal.

title: Bitter Work
text: You probably think I deserve this, don't you? Look, I'm sorry I hunted you, but that's just the natural order of things. Big things eat smaller things, nothing personal. But this time it didn't work out that way. I admit it ... you're cute. Okay, you convinced me, if I get out of this alive, it's a karmically correct, vegetarian existence for me. No meat. Even though meat is so tasty. [The cub brings an apple.] Hey, looks like my karma is already paying off! That's okay, I got it. [Tosses his boomerang at it in a desperate attempt.] Now, come back boomerang.

title: Bitter Work
text: In a pond in another part of the canyon. Momo tries to grab a frog. Aang and Katara move a single blob of water back and forth among each other in a circular motion.

title: Bitter Work
text: You know this block you're having is only temporary, right?

title: Bitter Work
text: I don't want to talk about it.

title: Bitter Work
text: You do realize that's the problem, don't you? If you face this issue instead of avoiding itâ

title: Bitter Work
text: [Frustrated at himself.] I know, I know, I know, I know! I get it, all right? I need to face it head on like a rock, but I just can't do it. I don't know why I can't, but I can't.

title: Bitter Work
text: Aang, if fire and water are opposites, then what's the opposite of air?

title: Bitter Work
text: I guess it's earth.

title: Bitter Work
text: That's why it's so difficult for you to get this. You're working with your natural opposite. But you'll figure it out. I know you will. Think fast! [Throws a piece of reed at him, but Aang slices it in half with waterbending.] Excellent. You have the reflexes of a waterbending master.

title: Bitter Work
text: Thanks, Katara. Sifu Katara. [Bows.]

title: Bitter Work
text: Katara also bows at Aang. Back to Zuko and Iroh.

title: Bitter Work
text: Fire is the element of power. [Draws the firebending insignia in the dirt.] The people of the Fire Nation have desire and will, and the energy to drive and achieve what they want. Earth is the element of substance. [Draws the earthbending insignia.] The people of the Earth Kingdom are diverse and strong. They are persistent and enduring. Air is the element of freedom. [Draws the airbending insignia.] The Air Nomads detached themselves from worldly concerns and found peace and freedom. Also, they apparently had pretty good senses of humor! [Smiles broadly but returns to a more serious demeanor when Zuko doesn't react at all.] Water is the element of change. [Draws the waterbending insignia.] The people of the Water Tribe are capable of adapting to many things. They have a deep sense of community and love that holds them together through anything.

title: Bitter Work
text: Why are you telling me these things?

title: Bitter Work
text: It is important to draw wisdom from many different places. If you take it from only one place, it becomes rigid and stale. [Divides the four insignias into separate sections.] Understanding others, the other elements, and the other nations will help you become whole. [Draws a circle around the insignias.]

title: Bitter Work
text: All this four elements talk is sounding like Avatar stuff.

title: Bitter Work
text: It is the combination of the four elements in one person that makes the Avatar so powerful. But it can make you more powerful, too. You see the technique I'm about to teach you is one I learned by studying the waterbenders.

title: Bitter Work
text: Back to the campsite. Aang is meditating when Toph enters, holding Aang's staff.

title: Bitter Work
text: Aang, I found these nuts in your bag. I figured you wouldn't mind. And besides, even if you did, you're too much of a pushover to do anything about it.

title: Bitter Work
text: As a matter of fact, I don't mind. I'm happy to share anything I have.

title: Bitter Work
text: You know, I'm really glad you feel that way. Because I also have this great new nutcracker.

title: Bitter Work
text: She spins Aang's staff above her head. Cut to Aang, who looks over his shoulder with a pained expression on his face. Cut to Toph as she smiles widely, lifts the staff, and starts using it to break nutshells.

title: Bitter Work
text: Actually, I prefer if you didn't ... [Crack.] That's an antique, handcrafted by the monks ... [Crack.] It's a delicate instrument!

title: Bitter Work
text: It's not the only delicate instrument around here. [Walks away, hitting the staff off rocks.]

title: Bitter Work
text: [Resumes meditating.] Ohm.

title: Bitter Work
text: Hey Aang, have you seenâ

title: Bitter Work
text: [Frustrated.] Meditating here!

title: Bitter Work
text: It's important. It's almost sundown and Sokka isn't back yet. I think we should search for him.

title: Bitter Work
text: We'll find him faster if we split up. [The two begin to search.]

title: Bitter Work
text: Back to Sokka.

title: Bitter Work
text: Okay, karma person or thing, whoever's in charge of this stuff. If I can just get out of this situation alive, I will give up meat and sarcasm. Okay? [Sokka's warrior's wolf tail gets yanked out of his hair by the cub.] Ow! That's all I got. It's pretty much my whole identity. Sokka, the meat and sarcasm guy. But I'm willing to be Sokka, the veggies and straight talk fellow. Deal? [Aang shows up.] Aang! Thank goodness! Have you got any meat?

title: Bitter Work
text: Sokka! Are you okay? [Tries to pull him out.]

title: Bitter Work
text: Aggh, stop, stop! You're going to pull my fingers off and I don't think the rest of me is coming!

title: Bitter Work
text: Hmmm ... I bet I can airbend you out of here. [Blows up a gust of wind but Sokka remains trapped.]

title: Bitter Work
text: Seriously Aang, I know you're new at it, but I could use a little earthbending here. How about it?

title: Bitter Work
text: I can't ... I can't do it.

title: Bitter Work
text: Well, if you can't earthbend me out of here, go get Toph.

title: Bitter Work
text: I can't do that either.

title: Bitter Work
text: You can't? Why not?

title: Bitter Work
text: It would just be really ... uncomfortable.

title: Bitter Work
text: Uncomfortable? [Sarcastically.] Well, I wouldn't want you to feel uncomfortable ...

title: Bitter Work
text: Thanks, Sokka. This whole earthbending thing really has me confused. There's so much pressure. Everyone expects me to get it right away. It puts me in a really awkward position.

title: Bitter Work
text: Awkward position, I think I know the feeling.

title: Bitter Work
text: If I try, I fail. If I don't try, I'm never going to get it. I feel like I'm caught between a rock and a hard place.

title: Bitter Work
text: Hmmm ... how about that. Aang, this is my friend, Foo Foo Cuddlypoops. Foo Foo Cuddlypoops, Aang.

title: Bitter Work
text: Awww, what a cute name for a baby saber-tooth moose-lion cub.

title: Bitter Work
text: Really? He looks nothing like a saber-tooth moose-lion.

title: Bitter Work
text: It's hard to tell before their giant teeth and horns grow in. What are you doing out here little guy? Did you lose your mama?

title: Bitter Work
text: Suddenly, a large moose-lion appears.

title: Bitter Work
text: The scene cuts back to Zuko and Iroh.

title: Bitter Work
text: Waterbenders deal with the flow of energy. A waterbender lets their defense become their offense, turning their opponents' energy against them. I learned a way to do this with lightning.

title: Bitter Work
text: You can teach me to redirect lightning?

title: Bitter Work
text: If you let the energy in your own body flow, the lightning will follow it. You must create a pathway from your fingertips, up your arm to your shoulder, then down into your stomach. The stomach is the source of energy in your body. It is called the sea of chi. Only in my case it is more like a vast ocean. [Laughs.] From the stomach, you direct it up again, and out the other arm. The stomach detour is critical. You must not let the lightning pass through your heart, or the damage could be deadly. You may wish to try a physical motion, to get a feel for the pathways' flow, like this. [The two begin to practice the redirection motion.] Now, are you focusing your energy? Can you feel your own chi flowing in, down, up, and out?

title: Bitter Work
text: I think so.

title: Bitter Work
text: Come on, you've got to feel the flow. [They practice the motion for a few minutes.] Excellent! You've got it!

title: Bitter Work
text: Great, I'm ready to try it with real lightning!

title: Bitter Work
text: What, are you crazy? Lightning is very dangerous!

title: Bitter Work
text: I thought that was the point! You teaching me to protect myself from it!

title: Bitter Work
text: Yeah! But I'm not going to shoot lightning at you! If you're lucky, you will never have to use this technique at all!

title: Bitter Work
text: Well, if you won't help me, I'll find my own lightning. [Rides away.]

title: Bitter Work
text: Back to the canyon, Aang begins to talk to the saber-tooth moose-lion mother.

title: Bitter Work
text: Hey there, we found your cub! See, we have no problem with you! We're friendly!

title: Bitter Work
text: Aang, this is bad, you've got to get me out of here!

title: Bitter Work
text: The moose-lion charges at Sokka, but Aang sends it over his head with airbending.

title: Bitter Work
text: This is really bad! Please Aang, you have to earthbend me out, there's no other way!

title: Bitter Work
text: Aang tries, but all his attempts produce nothing.

title: Bitter Work
text: Oh no! [Gets on top of a rock to try and distract the saber-tooth moose-lion.] Woo-hoo, look at me!

title: Bitter Work
text: The moose-lion charges again but is again held off.

title: Bitter Work
text: Please, don't leave me again.

title: Bitter Work
text: I won't.

title: Bitter Work
text: He stands his ground, and at the last second, throws the moose-lion back with a blast of air. The beast leaves. Suddenly, slight clapping can be heard. Cut to shot of Toph sitting on a rock nearby.

title: Bitter Work
text: What are you doing here?

title: Bitter Work
text: Just enjoying the show.

title: Bitter Work
text: What? You were there the whole time?

title: Bitter Work
text: Pretty much.

title: Bitter Work
text: Why didn't you do something? Sokka was in trouble! I was in trouble! You could have gotten him out and helped us get away!

title: Bitter Work
text: Guess it just didn't occur to me. [Throws a nut down and attempts to crack it with the staff.]

title: Bitter Work
text: [Grabs hold of it.] Enough! I want my staff back! [Takes it away.]

title: Bitter Work
text: Do it now!

title: Bitter Work
text: What?

title: Bitter Work
text: Earthbend, Twinkle Toes. You just stood your ground against a crazy beast. And even more impressive, you stood your ground against me. You've got stuff.

title: Bitter Work
text: Butâ

title: Bitter Work
text: Do it!

title: Bitter Work
text: Aang slams the ground and sends a rock into the canyon wall.

title: Bitter Work
text: You did it! You're an earthbender.

title: Bitter Work
text: I can't believe it!

title: Bitter Work
text: [Sarcastically.] Awww, this is a really wonderful, touching moment. So could you get me out of here so I can give you both a big, snuggly hug?

title: Bitter Work
text: No problem, Sokka!

title: Bitter Work
text: Actually, you should probably let me do that. You're still a little new to this. You might accidentally crush him.

title: Bitter Work
text: Yeah, no crushing, please.

title: Bitter Work
text: Toph kicks up the rock and yanks him out. Nightfall hits. Katara meets up with them.

title: Bitter Work
text: You found him! [Embraces Sokka.]

title: Bitter Work
text: The whole time, I was in that hole, not knowing if I was going to live or die. It makes a man to think about what's really important. I realizedâ

title: Bitter Work
text: [Interrupting Sokka.] Hey Katara, look what I can do! [Bends a rock and slams it on the ground.]

title: Bitter Work
text: You did it! I knew you would! [Whispering to Toph.] You tried the positive reinforcement, didn't you?

title: Bitter Work
text: [Happily.] Yep, it worked wonders.

title: Bitter Work
text: Appa, Appa, I can earthbend now! The key is being completely rooted. Physically and mentally unmovable!

title: Bitter Work
text: Appa licks him and sends him flying a few feet. Sokka laughs hysterically, and Aang laughs as well. Meanwhile, Zuko has tracked down a storm, seeking lightning.

title: Bitter Work
text: You've always thrown everything you could at me! Well, I can take it, and now I can give it back! [Yelling as loud as he can at the storm.] Come on, strike me! You've never held back before!

title: Bitter Work
text: No lightning strikes. Tears stream down Zuko's cheeks, and he yells at the top of his lungs.

title: Bitter Work
text: Fade to credits.

title: Bitter Work
text: Aang

title: The Library
text: The episode begins with a view of the mountains. The camera pans down to show a back shot of Aang sitting in cross legged in a prairie on the ground looking over a vast open savanna landscape. The landscape is mostly barren save for small shoots of grass which bend in the breeze. A range of mountains can be seen in the distance. The ground in front of Aang is littered with holes.

title: The Library
text: What's out here?

title: The Library
text: Shot changes to show Appa, Sokka, Toph, Katara, and Momo standing behind Aang, who holds a flute.

title: The Library
text: [Puts her hand on the ground.] A lot, actually. There's hundreds of little ...

title: The Library
text: [Turns around and silences Toph.] Shh! I know you can see underground, but don't ruin the surprise. Just watch. [Blows a note on the flute. A groundhog-type creature pops out of a hole in the ground and mimics the note.] Yeah! [Plays another note and another groundhog mimics it.] I'm putting an orchestra together.

title: The Library
text: [Makes hand motions while looking on with annoyance.] Orchestra, huh? Well, la-di-da.

title: The Library
text: Three groundhogs pop out of the ground and sing descending notes. Momo jumps into a hole and comes out the middle one, trying to catch the groundhogs. The shot shows all of the holes in the ground. Aang plays four notes and Momo tries to catch the groundhogs that pop up. Aang plays another note as Sokka runs up to Aang and plugs the flute with his finger, causing nothing to play. As Aang's cheeks swell with air, the Avatar looks at Sokka with a sad expression.

title: The Library
text: [Annoyed.] This is great and all, but don't we have more important things to worry about? We should be making plans.

title: The Library
text: We did make plans. We're all picking mini-vacations.

title: The Library
text: There's no time for vacations.

title: The Library
text: I'm learning the elements as fast as I can. I practice hard every day with Toph and Katara. I've been training my arrow off!

title: The Library
text: [Walks next to Aang.] Yeah, what's wrong with having a little fun in our down time?

title: The Library
text: Even if you do master all of the elements, then what? It's not like we have a map of the Fire Nation. [Gestures to the side, sarcastically.] Should we just head west until we reach the Fire Lord's house? [Knocking on an imaginary door.] Knock, knock. Hello, Fire Lord? Anybody home? I don't think so. We need some intelligence if we're going to win this war.

title: The Library
text: Aang plays a note on the flute and a groundhog pops up underneath Sokka and sings the note.

title: The Library
text: All right, we'll finish our vacations and [Mockingly.] then we'll look for Sokka's intelligence. [Aang laughs.]

title: The Library
text: [Opening a map and shows it to Katara.] Your turn, Katara. Where would you like to go on your mini-vacation?

title: The Library
text: [Pointing at the map.] How about the Misty Palms Oasis? That sounds refreshing.

title: The Library
text: Oh, yeah, I've been there. It's a pristine natural ice spring. And I usually don't use the word "pristine". [Cut to the symbol on the map.] It's one of nature's wonders.

title: The Library
text: The close-up of the map's illustration fades to the Misty Palm Oasis, which has a small ice spring in the center. Cut to a shot of Aang, Katara, Sokka, and Toph stare at the oasis in disappointment.

title: The Library
text: Must've changed ownership since I was here. [Laughs sheepishly.]

title: The Library
text: They walk through the entrance and the hanging sign falls down. Fade to Team Avatar walking past the small ice spring. They walk into the bar and pass five sandbenders hanging around outside. One sandbender spits at Sokka's feet. Sokka looks at the man angrily. The man utters a raspy groan, slurps, and chuckles. Katara grabs Sokka and pulls him into the bar, which is filled with weary travelers.

title: The Library
text: [To the bartender.] One mango, please.

title: The Library
text: The bartender uses two swords to slice a bowl from a large chunk of ice. He cuts down some mangos from the overhanging fruit and dices them up. He chops up a piece of fruit and pours a jug of milk into the bowl, still using the swords. He throws a decorative umbrella and straw into the bowl and serves it to Zei, who gives the bartender a coin.

title: The Library
text: I don't see anything wrong with having one of those fruity beverages while we plan our strategy. [Runs up to the bartender.] Excuse me.

title: The Library
text: Zei bumps into Aang and spills his drink onto the airbender.

title: The Library
text: No worries, I clean up easy. [Airbends the drink off of his clothes.]

title: The Library
text: [Gasps.] You're a living relic.

title: The Library
text: [Shrugs.] Thanks, I try.

title: The Library
text: An Air Nomad, right in front of me. [Shot changes to show Katara holding an icy bowl.] Professor Zei, head of anthropology at Ba Sing Se University. [Grabs Aang's arm and points at his arrow tattoo. Camera pans to Aang's face.] Tell me, which of the air temples do you hail from?

title: The Library
text: The Southern Temple.

title: The Library
text: [Measures Aang's head with a pair of calipers and speaking excitedly.] Oh, splendid! Now tell me- what was the primary agricultural product of your people?

title: The Library
text: [Nervously.] Uh, are fruit pies an agricultural product?

title: The Library
text: Oh, truly fascinating. That is one for the journal. [While Sokka speaks, Zei writes in his journal.]

title: The Library
text: So Professor, you're obviously a well-traveled guy. Do you have a more current map? Ours seems to be a little dated.

title: The Library
text: Certainly.

title: The Library
text: Sokka unrolls a map on a table and examines. Toph sips her drink and props her legs on another chair.

title: The Library
text: What, no Fire Nation? [Straightening his back.] Doesn't anybody have a good map of that place?

title: The Library
text: [Examines the map while the camera pans across it.] You've made a lot of trips into the desert.

title: The Library
text: All in vain, I'm afraid. I've found lost civilizations all over the Earth Kingdom, [Raises his fist slightly.] but I haven't managed to find the crown jewel: Wan Shi Tong's Library. [Cut to a shot of Toph laying down. Her feet are closest to the camera, showing her dirt-stained soles.]

title: The Library
text: [In disbelief.] You spent years walking through the desert to find some guy's library?

title: The Library
text: This library is more valuable than gold, little lady. It is said to contain a vast collection of knowledge, and knowledge is priceless.

title: The Library
text: [Sarcastically.] Hmm, sounds like good times.

title: The Library
text: Oh, it is. According to legend, it was built by the great Knowledge Spirit, Wan Shi Tong, with the help of his "foxy" knowledge seekers.

title: The Library
text: [Intrigued.] Oh, so this spirit has attractive assistants, huh?

title: The Library
text: [Puts her hand on the side of Sokka's face to stop him from talking.] I think he means they look like actual foxes, Sokka.

title: The Library
text: You're both right. [Katara and Sokka turn to him in surprise. Cut to Zei.] Handsome little creatures. [Takes out a drawing of the library and places it on the table.] Wan Shi Tong and his knowledge seekers collected books from all over the world, and put them on display for mankind to read, so that we might better ourselves.

title: The Library
text: If this place has books from all over the world, [Aang walks over to look at the maps while he sips his drink.] do you think they've got info on the Fire Nation? A map, maybe?

title: The Library
text: I wouldn't know. But if such a thing exists, it's in Wan Shi Tong's Library.

title: The Library
text: Then it's settled. Aang, I do believe it's my turn. I'd like to spend my vacation [Cut to a shot of Sokka as he points his finger into the air dramatically. The background changes to a rushing one.] at the library! [Sokka's voice echoes. Zoom back to a group shot, with Sokka still having his finger raised in the air.]

title: The Library
text: [Waving her hand to gain the others attention.] Uh, hey, what about me? When do I get to pick?

title: The Library
text: You gotta work here a little longer before you qualify for vacation time.

title: The Library
text: Hmph! [Slams her drink on the table and folds her arms. Cut to a shot of Zei.]

title: The Library
text: Of course, there's the matter of finding it. I've made several trips into the Si Wong Desert and almost died each time. [In a depressed voice.] I'm afraid that desert's impossible to cross.

title: The Library
text: Professor, would you like to see our sky bison?

title: The Library
text: A sky bison?! You actually have one?

title: The Library
text: Cut to Appa retreating from four sandbenders, as he growls.

title: The Library
text: [Runs toward the sandbenders.] Sandbenders, shoo, away from the bison!

title: The Library
text: The sandbenders run away and get into two sand-sailers. They drive the sailers by creating a small tornado of sand near the sail. Cut to a ground view of Appa flying across the sky. Cut to Appa's saddle and pan from Katara and Toph leaning against the sides to Sokka who grabs a telescope and looks over the side. The shot changes to Momo, Zei, and Aang on Appa's head. Zei leans over Appa's head.

title: The Library
text: Tell me, sky bison, are you the last of your breed? [Appa growls and Zei responds enthusiastically.] Delightful! I only wish I spoke his tongue. [Scratches Appa's head.] Oh, the stories this beast could tell. [Momo crawls up to Zei's side and starts chittering.] Shush, chatty monkey.

title: The Library
text: [Examines the picture of the library.] Wow, shouldn't be too hard to find a place like this out here.

title: The Library
text: Appa flies away from the camera. Cut back to the saddle.

title: The Library
text: [Groans in frustration.] Does this place even exist?

title: The Library
text: Some say it doesn't.

title: The Library
text: [Eyes widen in surprise before narrowing.] Shouldn't you have mentioned that before? [Collapses on the saddle, putting her feet over the side.]

title: The Library
text: Cut to an aerial view of Appa flying. Cut to Zei, who writes in his journal and pans to Toph.

title: The Library
text: [Pointing over the side of the saddle with excitement.] There it is! [Everybody on Appa looks to where Toph is pointing, but they can only see sand dunes. Aang, Katara, and Sokka glare at Toph in annoyance for tricking them. Cut back to the shot of Toph.] That's what it will sound like when one of you spots it. [Waves her hand in front of her face with a blank grin to remind them of the fact that she is blind. She quickly goes back to clutching the saddle.]

title: The Library
text: Cut to Appa flying and shows a closer shot of Aang driving Appa while Momo sleeps on Aang's head. Sokka and Katara search for the library on Appa's saddle.

title: The Library
text: It shouldn't be this hard to spot a giant, ornate building from the air.

title: The Library
text: [Looks through his telescope and spots a tower. Pointing.] Down there, what's that?

title: The Library
text: Momo wakes up. Cut to the tower and Appa flies down next to it.

title: The Library
text: [Holding the illustrations.] Forget it. It's obviously not what we're looking for. [Side shot.] The building in this drawing is enormous.

title: The Library
text: They see a sparkle in the distance and a fox holding a scroll with its mouth walking over a dune.

title: The Library
text: [To Zei.] What kind of animal is that?

title: The Library
text: The fox runs up the tower. Shot changes to a window at the top of the tower through which the fox enters.

title: The Library
text: I think that was one of the Knowledge Seekers. [Frontal shot.] Oh, we must be close to the library!

title: The Library
text: [Looking at the illustration Katara is holding.] No, this is the library- look! [Camera pans down from the tower to the illustration.] It's completely buried.

title: The Library
text: Cut to a zoom out shot of the spire from far away.

title: The Library
text: Further shot of the top of library. The camera pans up from the sand to the top of the library.

title: The Library
text: [Shouting dramatically.] The library is buried?! [Cut to a shot of the group standing in front of the spire. Zei runs forward. Depressed.] My life's ambition is now full of sand. [Collapses. Smiling, he lifts his head and reveals a small shovel in hand. Excitedly.] Well, time to start excavating. [He attempts to unearth the library using the tiny shovel. Cut to a close-up of the spire's surface as Toph places her palm against it.]

title: The Library
text: [Cut a small part of the library which Toph puts her hand on.] Actually, that won't be necessary. The inside seems to be completely intact. [Aerial shot.] And it's huge.

title: The Library
text: That fox thingy went in through a window. I say we climb up there and give it a look.

title: The Library
text: I say you guys go ahead without me.

title: The Library
text: You got something against libraries?

title: The Library
text: I've held books before. And I gotta tell you, they don't exactly do it for me.

title: The Library
text: [Sheepishly.] Oh, right. Sorry.

title: The Library
text: Let me know if they have something you can listen to.

title: The Library
text: Cut to the window at the top of the tower. A boomerang with a rope tied to it is thrown into the window. At the bottom of the tower, Sokka starts scaling the rope and the camera pans to Aang, Appa, and Toph.

title: The Library
text: [To Appa.] Don't worry, buddy. I'm not making you go underground ever again. You can stay out here with Toph. [Walks off camera.]

title: The Library
text: Appa makes a low, rumbling growl.

title: The Library
text: [Awkwardly.] What's up?

title: The Library
text: Cut to overhead shot Katara, Sokka, Aang, and Zei scaling the rope inside the library. The shot changes to a closer view as Zei, Aang, Sokka, and Katara climb down and Momo flies down. The shot changes to show the library's ceiling dome.

title: The Library
text: Oh, it's breathtaking! [Shot changes to show Zei, Aang, and Sokka climb down the rope with owl arches in the background.] The spirit spared no expense in designing this place. [Pointing.] Look at those beautiful buttresses! [Cut to an above shot of Sokka, Aang, and Zei, who are hanging from the rope.Â Sokka and Aang giggle at the word.] What's funny?

title: The Library
text: Nothing. We just like architecture.

title: The Library
text: [Cut back to a smiling Zei.] As do I.

title: The Library
text: They slide off the rope onto a bridge and Momo lands on Aang's shoulder.

title: The Library
text: My word! [Examines an owl mosaic above two pillars.] The exquisite mosaic handiwork of this tile-rendered avian symbol ... [Sokka, Katara, and Aang look at Zei quizzically.] Eh, nice owl.

title: The Library
text: They hear rustling noises. Sokka and Katara run behind a pillar. Aang grabs Zei and they hide behind another pillar. Wan Shi Tong, an owl spirit, walks over the bridge and examines the rope. Aang cranes his head around the pillar.

title: The Library
text: [Turns his head around.] I know you're back there.

title: The Library
text: Aang gasps and hides again.

title: The Library
text: [Smiles and walks from behind the pillar and up to Wan Shi Tong.] Hello, I'm Professor Zei, head of anthropology at Ba Sing Se University.

title: The Library
text: You should leave the way you came. [Looks to the side.] Unless you want to become a stuffed head of anthropology.

title: The Library
text: The camera pans to three stuffed animal heads on a pillar. Frontal shot of Zei, as he moans and clutches his neck. Katara, Sokka, and Aang walk out from behind their pillars and up to Wan Shi Tong.

title: The Library
text: Are you the spirit who brought this library to the physical world?

title: The Library
text: Indeed, I am Wan Shi Tong, "He Who Knows Ten Thousand Things." And you are obviously humans, which, by the way, are no longer permitted in my study.

title: The Library
text: What do you have against humans?

title: The Library
text: Hm! Humans only bother learning things to get the edge on other humans. [Cut to Zhao, studying scrolls in the library. Voice-over.] Like that firebender who came to this place a few years ago, looking to destroy his enemy. [Scene changes to the present.] So ... [Leans toward a sweating Sokka.] who are you trying to destroy?

title: The Library
text: [Cut to his reflection in Wan Shi Tong's eye.] What? No-no-no-no destroying. We're not into that.

title: The Library
text: [Blinks.] Then why have you come here?

title: The Library
text: Um ... knowledge for knowledge's sake?

title: The Library
text: [Shot changes to him leaning toward Sokka.] If you're going to lie to an all-knowing spirit being, you should at least put some effort into it.

title: The Library
text: I'm not lying, I'm here with the Avatar, [Grabs Aang and puts him into the shot.] and he's the bridge between our worlds. He'll vouch for me. [Nudges Aang.]

title: The Library
text: Ow. [Frontal shot.] Uh, yeah, I'll vouch. We will not abuse the knowledge in your library, good spirit. [Side shot.] You have my word. [They bow to Wan Shi Tong.]

title: The Library
text: Hmm, very well. I'll let you peruse my vast collection [Shot changes to Zei, Aang, Katara, and Sokka looking hopefully.] on one condition. [They look at the spirit a little worriedly. Further overhead shot.] To prove your worth as scholars, you have to contribute some worthwhile knowledge.

title: The Library
text: [Walks up to Wan Shi Tong holding a book and kneels down.] Please accept this tome as a donation to your library.

title: The Library
text: [Frontal shot.] First edition, very nice. [Grabs the book with his wing.]

title: The Library
text: [Camera pans up to show her holding the waterbending scroll.] I have an authentic waterbending scroll.

title: The Library
text: [Frontal shot.] Ooh, these illustrations are quite stylish. [Grabs the scroll.]

title: The Library
text: [Cut to him.] Uh ... oh, I know! [Grabs his wanted poster out of his shirt and shows it to Wan Shi Tong.] Hah!

title: The Library
text: I suppose that counts. [Takes the poster.]

title: The Library
text: [Side shot of him walking forward.] Oh, great spirit, [Frontal shot of him holding a piece of string.] check this out. [Ties the string into a butterfly knot and shows it to Wan Shi Tong.] Ta-da! [Aang, Katara, and Zei look at Sokka with uncertainty.Â Shot of Wan Shi Tong just looking at him in silence.] It's a special knot. That counts as knowledge!

title: The Library
text: [Frontal shot.] You're not very bright, are you? [Sokka grunts as Wan Shi Tong takes the knot.] Enjoy the library. [Jumps off the bridge and flies down to lower levels of the library.]

title: The Library
text: Team Avatar and Zei walk toward the library.

title: The Library
text: [Narrows his eyes.] Bright enough to fool you.

title: The Library
text: Cut to an overhead view of the desert outside the library, where Appa and Toph rest in the shade. The shot changes to a closer view of Appa and Toph.

title: The Library
text: [To Appa.] So ... you like ... flying? [Appa purrs deeply and scratches his ear.] Of course, I'm more comfortable on the ground where I can see. Well, I don't see the way you do. I feel the vibrations in the ground with my feet. [Closer shot of the two. Toph picks up a handful of sand and lets it fall.] But this sand is so loose and shifty, it makes everything look fuzzy. [Appa makes a rumbling groan with a further shot.] Not that there's anything wrong with fuzzy. [Appa grunts.]

title: The Library
text: Cut to a large room full of books and the camera pans down to show the Knowledge Seeker, Team Avatar, and Zei at a bookshelf. In a closer shot, the Knowledge Seeker deposits its scroll on a shelf and the camera pans to the right to Team Avatar and Zei. Closer shot of Aang, as he flips a page on his book. He finds an illustration of a person talking to a lion turtle with two more lion turtles in the background.

title: The Library
text: [Holds the illustration up to show Sokka and Katara.] Hey, look at these weird lion turtle things.

title: The Library
text: [Pulls a book off the bookshelf with the symbols å­ç½ on the cover.] Eh, I've seen weirder.

title: The Library
text: [Walks up to Aang, carrying a book.] Aang, did you know in a past life, you were left-handed?

title: The Library
text: I always knew I was special.

title: The Library
text: Cut to Sokka and Zei. While Zei takes books off of bookshelves and adds them to his stack, Sokka takes a scroll from a shelf, reads it, and puts it in his purse. Back shot of Sokka walking up to a podium. He sees the burnt piece of parchment framed on the podium with the characters å¹æ²»é¾å¹´ä¸æä¹æ¥çç«åæé»æçä¸å¤©.

title: The Library
text: [Reading from the parchment.] "The darkest day in Fire Nation history." It's got a date at the top, but it doesn't say anything else. [He looks around, making sure no one is watching, before prying open the frame with his sword and taking the parchment.]

title: The Library
text: [Walks in with Katara and Zei.] Sokka, where are you going?

title: The Library
text: [Running down a section of a library.] I want to know what happened to the Fire Nation on their darkest day. This could be promising. [Aang, Katara, and Zei follow him.] The information on the Fire Nation should be right up here.

title: The Library
text: [Looking at a room full of ashes.] Firebenders.

title: The Library
text: They destroyed everything having to do with the Fire Nation.

title: The Library
text: That's so unfair! Just when I think I'm one step ahead of the Fire Nation, it turns out they beat us here a long time ago. [Collapses on his knees.] I need to know what happened on the darkest day. [Hears whimpering and looks at the entrance to see the Knowledge Seeker standing on its hind legs.] Hello, little weird fox guy.

title: The Library
text: The Knowledge Seeker gets on its four legs and points outside the room.

title: The Library
text: Seems it's trying to assist you.

title: The Library
text: Um, sure, I guess I'll follow you.

title: The Library
text: They follow the Knowledge Seeker to a large round door with a texture lining the bottom sides of the wall. The Knowledge Seeker enters a small door in the texture. The large door opens showing the Knowledge Seeker standing behind it. Team Avatar and Zei walk toward the center of the room. The Knowledge Seeker pushes a lever beside the calendar wheel and the domed ceiling changes from day to night.

title: The Library
text: This room is a true marvel, a mechanical wonder. It's a planetarium that shows the heavens moving.

title: The Library
text: The domed ceiling changes back into day.

title: The Library
text: Uh, this is beautiful, but how is it helpful?

title: The Library
text: Maybe these dials represent dates and times. Sokka, try entering that date from that parchment you took.

title: The Library
text: [Mock whispering.] Shh, Katara, not in front of the fox, he's with the owl.

title: The Library
text: The Knowledge Seeker whimpers. Sokka glances at the parchment and changes four of the calendar wheels. He pushes the lever and the domed ceiling changes from day to night.

title: The Library
text: Wow, I got to hand it to you, Sokka. You picked the best mini-vacation for sure.

title: The Library
text: The ceiling changes from night to day and the planetarium suddenly grows dark.

title: The Library
text: Hey, wait. What happened to the sun?

title: The Library
text: [Narrows his eyes.] Great, you must have broken it.

title: The Library
text: [Walks next to Aang.] It's not broken. [Shot changes to show the sun piece of the planetarium covered by the moon piece.] The sun is behind the moon. It's a solar eclipse! It's literally the darkest day in Fire Nation history. Now I get it. [Grabs Aang's shoulders and shakes him.] Something awful happened on that day. I don't know what, but I do know why. Firebenders lose their bending during a solar eclipse. [Pushes Aang back.] Sorry.

title: The Library
text: That makes sense. I mean, think what the lunar eclipse at the North Pole did to the waterbenders. This is huge.

title: The Library
text: The Knowledge Seeker gets on its hind legs and begs.

title: The Library
text: [To the Knowledge Seeker.] Fine, you earned it. [Tosses the fox a snack from his bag. To Aang and Katara.] We've gotta get this information to the Earth King at Ba Sing Se. We'll wait for the next eclipse, then we'll invade the Fire Nation when they're totally helpless. The Fire Lord is going down!

title: The Library
text: [Enters the shot from behind Sokka.] Mortals are so predictable, and such terrible liars. [Sokka gulps. Shot changes to show Wan Shi Tong talking to them from the entrance.] You betrayed my trust. From the beginning, you intended to misuse this knowledge for evil purposes.

title: The Library
text: You don't understand. If anyone's evil, it's the Fire Nation. You saw what they did to your library. They're destructive and dangerous. We need this information.

title: The Library
text: You think you're the first person to believe their war was justified? Countless others before you have come here seeking weapons or weaknesses or battle strategies.

title: The Library
text: We had no choice. Please, we're just desperate to protect the people we love.

title: The Library
text: And now I'm going to protect what I love. [Flaps his wings and the library starts shaking.]

title: The Library
text: What are you doing?

title: The Library
text: I'm taking my knowledge back. No one will ever abuse it again.

title: The Library
text: [Sand pours from the ceiling.] He's sinking the building. We've gotta get out of here.

title: The Library
text: I'm afraid I can't allow that. You already know too much. [Pecks at them, but misses.]

title: The Library
text: Wan Shi Tong pursues them as they run out the planetarium. The camera pans up to the surface. Appa snarls as the library starts sinking and the ground starts shaking.

title: The Library
text: I already told you, I don't wanna snuggle. [Appa stands up and hurries away from the library. Toph looks at the sinking library.] Library sinking. [Running up to the library.] Library sinking! [Punches both fists into the library to stop it from sinking. Her feet slip in the sand, so she pauses to solidify it.] Hi-yah! [Struggles to stop it from sinking again.]

title: The Library
text: The camera pans down to an aerial view of Team Avatar and Zei running through the library. They round a corner, and Wan Shi Tong continues pursuing them.

title: The Library
text: [Stops running and turns back toward Wan Shi Tong.] Great Knowledge Spirit, I beg you, do not destroy your vast collection of priceless tomes.

title: The Library
text: Aang uses air suction to move Zei out of Wan Shi Tong's attack. Aang fires an air blast at Wan Shi Tong, sending the spirit falling off the side of the bridge.

title: The Library
text: [Runs back to Katara, Zei, and Sokka.] We've gotta get back to the surface!

title: The Library
text: Sokka, let's go.

title: The Library
text: But we still don't know when the next eclipse is gonna to happen.

title: The Library
text: Don't be stupid! We'll find out later!

title: The Library
text: No, we won't. If we leave this place, we'll never get the information. Aang, come with me to the planetarium, [Aang runs up to him.] I need cover. Katara, take Momo and get out of here!

title: The Library
text: But ...!

title: The Library
text: Wan Shi Tong breaks in between the two groups and pursues Katara and Zei.

title: The Library
text: Go!

title: The Library
text: Hurry, Sokka!

title: The Library
text: Sokka and Aang run away. Zei evades Wan Shi Tong by diving into a smaller aisle of books. He grabs a book, looking at the cover excitedly. Katara runs and Wan Shi Tong swoops down. Cut to the surface with Toph holding up the library. Appa grunts nervously.

title: The Library
text: What is it now?

title: The Library
text: Cut to three sand-sailers. The camera pans across a sandbender's face and cuts to a side shot of the sailer. The sandbenders direct a sand blast at Appa.

title: The Library
text: [Struggling.] Who's there?

title: The Library
text: The sand-sailers circle Appa and a sandbender jumps out. Cut to inside the library, where Sokka and Aang run across a bridge and reach the entrance to the planetarium.

title: The Library
text: Why are we doing this?

title: The Library
text: Because if this calendar can tell us about eclipses in the past, then maybe it can project when the next one will be.

title: The Library
text: You can't possibly check every single date.

title: The Library
text: [Adjusting the calendar wheel.] I don't have to. We just need to check every date before Sozin's Comet arrives. Because after that- well, try not to think about that.

title: The Library
text: Sokka finishes adjusting the wheels and Aang pushes the lever. The camera fades from the moon traveling across the ceiling to Sokka adjusting the wheel calendar, before switching to the ceiling changing from night to day. The camera fades to Aang looking at the night sky to the moon traveling across the ceiling, to the calendar wheel, to Sokka adjusting the wheel, to the sun and moon traveling close to each other, to Sokka trying again.

title: The Library
text: [Pushing the lever.] Come on, eclipse.

title: The Library
text: Cut to the moon and sun traveling across the ceiling until the moon overlaps with the sun.

title: The Library
text: That's it! The solar eclipse! It's just a few months away. [Takes out a piece of paper and writes down the date.] Got it. Now, let's get to Ba Sing Se.

title: The Library
text: They run out of the planetarium. Cut to Appa surrounded by sandbenders yielding weighted ropes. They throw the ropes over Appa and solidify the sand near their feet to bring Appa down.

title: The Library
text: Don't make me put this down.

title: The Library
text: Toph lets go of the library and earthbends a slice of sand at the sandbenders, but misses. She grabs the library again. Cut to a tied up Appa as the sand-sailers drag him away.

title: The Library
text: No! Stop sinking! [Fires three more slices of sand.] No! [Grabs the library.] I'm sorry, Appa. [Closes her eyes as the camera pans to show the sand-sailers dragging Appa away.]

title: The Library
text: Cut to Katara running away from Wan Shi Tong. She stops beside a bookshelf, holding Momo. Wan Shi Tong walks on the other side of the bookshelf and spots Momo's tail.

title: The Library
text: At least I'll have one specimen to add to my collection.

title: The Library
text: Wan Shi Tong tries to grab Momo with his beak, but Katara runs away with Momo. She reaches the bridge with the rope and turns back to face Wan Shi Tong.

title: The Library
text: Your waterbending won't do you much good here. [Raises his head and unfolds his wings to attack.] I've studied Northern water style, Southern water style, even Foggy Swamp style.

title: The Library
text: Cut to a view of the ceiling. Aang flies his glider holding Sokka, who jumps off holding a book, yelling. Sokka slams the book onto Wan Shi Tong's head, knocking him out.

title: The Library
text: That's called Sokka style. [Swings his fist to the side as he says this.] Learn it.

title: The Library
text: Pan up to a shot of the hole in the ceiling where the rope is dangling. Light from the outside is pouring down. Cut to a shot from the side of Sokka, Katara, and Momo, and the defeated spirit lying unconscious on the bridge. More streams of sand pour in from above. Sokka and Katara climb over Wan Shi Tong and up the rope. Aang glides past them. Cut to a close shot of Sokka climbing the rope. He stops and looks back down.

title: The Library
text: Wait! Professor, let's go.

title: The Library
text: [Sitting among a pile of books holding a scroll that surrounds him. The sand is building up and beginning to cover some of the stacks. Zei is reading a scroll. The camera slowly zooms in.] I'm not leaving. I can't. [Drops the parchment to his lap and raises his right fist.] I've spent too long trying to find this place. [Places his hand on his chest and looks up.] There's not another collection of knowledge like this on earth. [Cut to a close-up of Zei with his eyes closed. He opens his eyes while smiling and speaks wistfully.] I could spend an eternity in here.

title: The Library
text: [Cut to a shot of Sokka and Katara looking at the professor. Katara looks up at Sokka.] Just go!

title: The Library
text: Wan Shi Tong screeches and shakes the rope, making Sokka and Katara fall off. Aang catches them and they fly up while Wan Shi Tong pursues them. Cut to outside the library, where Aang, Sokka, and Katara land. Toph lets go of the library, falling back. Aerial shot showing the ground where the library used to be.

title: The Library
text: We got it. There's a solar eclipse coming. [Jumps and hugs his sister.] The Fire Nation's in trouble now!

title: The Library
text: [Stands up and walks toward Toph.] Where's Appa?

title: The Library
text: Toph shakes her head. Aang gasps and a tear falls down his cheek. The camera pans up from the crater to the sun. Fade to white, followed by the credits.

title: The Library
text: Aang

title: The Desert
text: The camera shows a wide-view of the desert. Team Avatar looks in every direction over the vast ocean of sand for Appa. The camera halts as Aang and Toph come into view. Aang turns around to face Toph angrily.

title: The Desert
text: [Enraged.] How could you let them take Appa?! â Why didn't you stop themâ?!

title: The Desert
text: Cut to close-up of Aang's angry face.

title: The Desert
text: [Defensively.] I couldn't! The library was sinking! You guys were still inside and-

title: The Desert
text: Aang interrupts Toph as he walks over to her.

title: The Desert
text: [Still enraged.] You could've come to get us. I could've saved him!

title: The Desert
text: [Turns to face him slightly.] I can hardly feel any vibrations out here. The sandbenders snuck up on me and there wasn't time for â

title: The Desert
text: [Snaps at Toph in a harsh way.] You just didn't care! You never liked Appa! You wanted him gone!

title: The Desert
text: Aang looks extremely furious at Toph as Katara walks over to him. She puts her hand on his shoulder to try and calm him down.

title: The Desert
text: Aang, stop it. You know Toph did all she could. She saved our lives.

title: The Desert
text: Camera moves to Sokka, who is still looking out into the desert.

title: The Desert
text: Who's going to save our lives now? We'll never make it out of here.

title: The Desert
text: Aang irately walks away from the rest of the group.

title: The Desert
text: That's all any of you guys care about, yourselves! You don't care whether Appa is okay or not!

title: The Desert
text: We're all concerned, but we can't afford to be fighting now.

title: The Desert
text: [In a cold, hard tone.] I'm going after Appa.

title: The Desert
text: Aang flies off. Katara calls after him, running to the place he took off.

title: The Desert
text: Aang, wait!

title: The Desert
text: Cut to a view from the sky, showing Aang flying away from the rest of the group who stand by the large crater created by the disappeared library. Cut back to Katara, who is still looking in the direction Aang took off.

title: The Desert
text: We'd better start walking. We're the only people who know about the solar eclipse. We have to get that information to Ba Sing Se.

title: The Desert
text: The group starts walking in the same direction as Aang took off to, with Katara leading the way, followed by Sokka. Toph closes the ranks.

title: The Desert
text: You think if we dig out the giant owl, he'll give us a ride?

title: The Desert
text: Cut to Zuko and Iroh riding on their ostrich horse. Iroh fake-moans in pretend pain at every step the ostrich horse takes, clasping his left arm.

title: The Desert
text: Maybe we should make camp.

title: The Desert
text: No please, don't stop just for me!

title: The Desert
text: Switch to a front view of Zuko and Iroh. Iroh theatrically lets out several more groans of pain. Zuko pull at the reins, annoyed by the performance displayed by his uncle. As they dismount, the ostrich horse is alarmed by something. Zuko immediately takes on a firebending form, ready to defend himself.

title: The Desert
text: [Annoyed.] What now?

title: The Desert
text: The Rough Rhinos ride through the thicket at both sides of the road Zuko and Iroh were traveling on. Mongke's rhino steps the ground forcefully breaking the surface. Mongke is shown, pulling back the reigns. Zuko keeps up his defensive position, looking at the men that surrounded them. Iroh's face clears up as he stands up and places a hand on Zuko's shoulder.

title: The Desert
text: Colonel Mongke! What a pleasant surprise!

title: The Desert
text: If you're surprised we're here, then the Dragon of the West has lost a few steps.

title: The Desert
text: The Rough Rhinos prepare themselves for battle, each readying their own weapon of expertise.

title: The Desert
text: [Surprised.] You know these guys?

title: The Desert
text: Sure. Colonel Mongke and the Rough Rhinos are legendary. Each one is a different kind of weapon specialist. [The camera cuts to each member of the Rough Rhinos.] They are also a very capable singing group.

title: The Desert
text: Cut to Mongke, who has his fist raised, ready for firebending.

title: The Desert
text: We're not here to give a concert. We're here to apprehend fugitives!

title: The Desert
text: [While rubbing his arm.] Would you like some tea first? I'd love some. How about you, Kahchi? I make you as a jasmine man. Am I right?

title: The Desert
text: Enough stalling! Round 'em up!

title: The Desert
text: Camera shows an overhead view of the situation. Cut to a dark skinned, pony tailed guy that swings his ball and chain at Iroh, who kicks it away. The chain wraps itself around the leg of a nearby standing Rhino. Iroh tumbles over the ground, dodging two fire blasts. He rises back up and hits the Rhino in the rear, making it dash away, yanking the dark skinned warrior off his rhino and dragging him along. Iroh waves goodbye as he watches them go.

title: The Desert
text: It's nice to see old friends.

title: The Desert
text: Too bad you don't have any old friends that don't want to attack you.

title: The Desert
text: [Grasping his shoulder again as he racks his brain in search of an answer.] Hmmm ... Old friends that don't want to attack me ...

title: The Desert
text: Cut to Katara, Sokka and Toph, all exhausted and dehydrated, still wandering through the desert. Sokka stops to take Momo off his back and use his wings to create some shade, causing Toph to crash into him.

title: The Desert
text: [Annoyed.] Can't you watch where you're ... [His eyes widen in comprehension as he sees who bumped into him.]

title: The Desert
text: No.

title: The Desert
text: Right. Sorry.

title: The Desert
text: Katara turns around to encourage the others.

title: The Desert
text: Come on guys, we've got to stick together.

title: The Desert
text: Sokka's clothes stick to Toph. He tries to free himself by pushing her away.

title: The Desert
text: If I sweat anymore, I don't think sticking together will be a problem.

title: The Desert
text: An irritated Toph places her hand on Sokka's face and pushes him to the ground, freeing them both.

title: The Desert
text: Katara, can I have some more water?

title: The Desert
text: Okay, but we've got to try to conserve it.

title: The Desert
text: Katara bends three small blobs of water out of her pouch and into the mouths of Sokka, Toph and Momo. Sokka circulates the water in his mouth before swallowing it.

title: The Desert
text: [As he points to his mouth.] We're drinking your bending water. [He tries to define the taste of the water, smacking his lips. Disgustedly he exclaims.] You used this on the swamp guy! Urch!

title: The Desert
text: It does taste swampy.

title: The Desert
text: Momo lets out a sad cry in protest of the water's flavor, after also smacking his lips. Katara sadly puts the cork back on her water sack.

title: The Desert
text: [Sad tone.] I'm sorry, it's all we have.

title: The Desert
text: Not anymore! Look!

title: The Desert
text: Katara looks in the direction Sokka's pointing. He walks over to the cactus and cuts off a piece with his machete. He happily drinks the fluid that's inside while Momo crawls over to him.

title: The Desert
text: [Worried.] Sokka, wait! You shouldn't be eating strange plants!

title: The Desert
text: She drags Toph along on her arm as she runs toward Sokka. He and Momo are quenching their thirst with plenty of cactus juice. He cuts open another part of the cactus, excitedly offering its content to a skeptic looking Katara.

title: The Desert
text: There's water trapped inside these!

title: The Desert
text: [Backing away from Sokka and the cactus.] I don't know ...

title: The Desert
text: [While cactus juice drips off his chin.] Suit yourself. It's very thirst quenching though.

title: The Desert
text: He gives Katara a big smile like a true salesman. Cut to close-up of his left eye as his pupil dilates rapidly. He tries to shake off the feeling by rapidly shaking his head. He starts to trip.

title: The Desert
text: [In a strange echoing voice.] Drink cactus juice. It'll quench ya! Nothing's quenchier. [He crawls over the ground as a caterpillar before jumping back to the front, pushing his face toward the camera with a big smile.] It's the quenchiest!

title: The Desert
text: Katara gives Sokka a very weird look. She grabs his cactus juice and pours it away.

title: The Desert
text: Okay, I think you've had enough.

title: The Desert
text: Who lit Toph on fire?

title: The Desert
text: Katara wants to react on Sokka's comment, but is distracted by a sound in the sky. She looks up to see Momo flying around in circles, increasing his speed, before plummeting into the ground, head first. Katara picks up and cradles the unconscious animal.

title: The Desert
text: Can I get some of that cactus?

title: The Desert
text: [Wrapping her arm around Toph's shoulders.] I don't think that's a good idea. Come on, we need to find Aang.

title: The Desert
text: Katara leads Toph away. Sokka stays behind, staring blankly at the sky. Katara retraces her steps and pulls Sokka along by his arms. Cut to an overview shot of the endless desert.

title: The Desert
text: [In awe.] How did we get out here in the middle of the ocean?

title: The Desert
text: Katara sighs as the scene cuts to Aang flying over the desert in search of Appa. He blows his bison whistle.

title: The Desert
text: Appa! [He glides down and lands on a dune.] Appa!

title: The Desert
text: The camera circles around Aang. While he stares across the horizon, it begins to dawn on him that he is not going to find his friend out here. The tears well up in his eyes.

title: The Desert
text: No ... [Yelling.] No!

title: The Desert
text: Overcome by anger, he slams his staff on the ground, creating a large mushroom-shaped cloud of sand. Dust that was kicked up by Aang's blow washes over Katara, Sokka and Toph as they climb over another dune.

title: The Desert
text: What is that?

title: The Desert
text: What? What is what?

title: The Desert
text: It's a giant mushroom! [Very excited.] Maybe it's friendly!

title: The Desert
text: Let's just keep moving. I hope Aang's okay ...

title: The Desert
text: As Katara leads Toph away, Sokka starts to worship the mushroom by waving his arms up and down, back and forth.

title: The Desert
text: Friendly mushroom! Mushy giant friend!

title: The Desert
text: Cut to the village with the Misty Palms Oasis at the border of the desert.

title: The Desert
text: Yeah, a little barefoot blind girl and her friends passed through here a few days ago.

title: The Desert
text: Did they give you any indication where they were headedâ?

title: The Desert
text: Maybe you could give me a little incentiveâ?

title: The Desert
text: The man makes the money sign with his fingers.

title: The Desert
text: You suggesting I break your fingersâ?

title: The Desert
text: The man quickly hides his hand behind his back and points with the other one toward the desert.

title: The Desert
text: They went in the desert! Too bad there's almost no chance they survived.

title: The Desert
text: That's okay, 'cause she's wanted dead or alive.

title: The Desert
text: The man quietly backs away from Xin Fu and Yu

title: The Desert
text: No she's not! I'm certain her father wants her alive.

title: The Desert
text: Hey, look ... Fire Nation wanted posters!

title: The Desert
text: Yu follows Xin Fu's lead and examines the wanted posters. A poster of Zuko and Iroh is surrounded by posters of Aang, the Blue Spirit, Jeong Jeong and Chey.

title: The Desert
text: So?

title: The Desert
text: Xin Fu looks at Zuko and Iroh as they walk toward the tavern.

title: The Desert
text: So, look who's here.

title: The Desert
text: Cut to Katara, Toph and Sokka. It is nearly twilight and they are still walking in a single file through the desert. A shadow passes over their heads and Aang lands behind them, kicking up a small cloud of sand. As the sand clears, Aang is still down.

title: The Desert
text: I'm sorry, Aang. I know it's hard for you right now but ... we need to focus on getting out of here.

title: The Desert
text: She walks over to him and puts a hand on his shoulder to comfort him. He pulls away.

title: The Desert
text: [Hopelessly.] What's the difference? We won't survive without Appa. We all know it.

title: The Desert
text: [Encouraging.] Come on, Aang. We can do this if we work together. Right Toph?

title: The Desert
text: As far as I can feel, we're trapped in a giant bowl of sand pudding. I got nothin'.

title: The Desert
text: [Hopeful.] Sokka? Any ideas how to find Ba Sing Se?

title: The Desert
text: Sokka and Momo lie side by side on their backs, arms and legs stretched out. Sokka smiles blissfully.

title: The Desert
text: [Pointing up at the sky.] Why don't we ask the circle birds?

title: The Desert
text: Katara directs her gaze to the sky and sees four buzzard wasps circling above their heads. She looks at every other member in the team. Aang still sits down sulking and Toph staggers a bit. Sokka sniggers a bit while Momo lazily claws at the buzzard wasps.

title: The Desert
text: [Grabs her head in annoyance.] Ugh ... We're getting out of this desert, and we're going to do it together! Aang, get up. Everybody, hold hands. We can do this. We have to.

title: The Desert
