text: She takes one more look at the buzzard wasps in the sky before pulling Aang along by his staff. Aang holds on to Toph's hand and she holds on to Sokka's in turn. A big grinning Sokka pulls Momo along by his tail, who lazily tries to fly in the other direction.

title: The Desert
text: I think we should stop for the night.

title: The Desert
text: The rest of the group sighs and falls down of exhaustion.

title: The Desert
text: Is there any more water?

title: The Desert
text: This is the last of it. Everyone can have a little drink.

title: The Desert
text: Sokka crawls toward Katara with Momo riding on his back when she begins to bend the water out of her pouch. Momo leaps forward at the water, causing it to fall in the sand.

title: The Desert
text: [Theatrically panics, grabbing his head in despair.] Momo, no! You've killed us all!

title: The Desert
text: Katara calmly holds her hand over the moist spot of sand and begins to bend the water back into her pouch, before giving it to Toph to drink.

title: The Desert
text: No, he hasn't.

title: The Desert
text: [Relieved.] Oh, right. Bending.

title: The Desert
text: Sokka, let me see the things you got from the library.

title: The Desert
text: He immediately backs away and defensively grabs his back full of scrolls.

title: The Desert
text: [Offended.] What?! I didn't steal anything! Who told you that? [Pointing an accusing finger at Momo.] It was you! You ratted me out!

title: The Desert
text: Sokka, I was there.

title: The Desert
text: Katara takes the bag from Sokka and start to examine the scrolls.

title: The Desert
text: [Sadly.] It doesn't matter. None of those will tell us where Appa is.

title: The Desert
text: No, but we can find out which way Ba Sing Se is. We can use the stars to guide us. [She pulls out a map of the stars.] That way we can travel at night when it's cool and rest during the day.

title: The Desert
text: She turns around and sighs at the sight of the rest of the group. They are all lying there, exhausted from the long walk and their grief for the loss of Appa.

title: The Desert
text: Just try to get some sleep. We'll start again in a few hours.

title: The Desert
text: Fade to Zuko and Iroh sitting at a table in the tavern at the Misty Palms Oasis.

title: The Desert
text: No one here is going to help us. These people just look like filthy wanderers.

title: The Desert
text: So do we. [Pointing at something behind Zuko.] Ah, this is interesting. I think I found our friend.

title: The Desert
text: As Zuko turns around to see where Iroh is pointing at, the camera pans over his shoulder to reveal an old man sitting at a Pai Sho table.

title: The Desert
text: You brought us here to gamble on Pai Sho?

title: The Desert
text: I don't think this is a gamble.

title: The Desert
text: Zuko and Iroh walk toward the Pai Sho table. The camera zooms toward Xin Fu and Yu, who are sitting on a bench at the other side of the tavern. Xin Fu jumps up with the intention to grab them, but Yu places a hand on his shoulder to restrain him.

title: The Desert
text: Let's take them now!

title: The Desert
text: This place is full of desperate characters. If they find out we're collecting a bounty, we might have to fight them all just to keep our prize. Patience.

title: The Desert
text: Cut to Iroh and Zuko approaching the Pai Sho table.

title: The Desert
text: May I have this game?

title: The Desert
text: [Gesturing Iroh to sit down.] The guest has the first move. [Iroh places the lotus tile in the center of the board.] I see you favor the white lotus gambit. Not many still cling to the ancient ways. [He cups his hands toward Iroh.]

title: The Desert
text: Those who do can always find a friend.

title: The Desert
text: He copies the gesture of the old man, also cupping his hands toward him.

title: The Desert
text: Then let us play.

title: The Desert
text: The old man places a tile on the board, quickly followed by a tile placed by Iroh. Seemingly without even looking at what the other person is doing, the two man quickly place their tiles on the board. Zuko sits down and watches intently as the two man place one tile after the other. When they are done, their tiles form the shape of a lotus flower.

title: The Desert
text: Welcome, brother. The White Lotus opens wide to those who know her secrets.

title: The Desert
text: What are you old gasbags talking about?

title: The Desert
text: I always tried to tell you that Pai Sho is more than just a game.

title: The Desert
text: Iroh rolls a tile over his knuckles and clutches it.

title: The Desert
text: I'm not waiting all night for these geezers to finish yapping! [He walks over to the Pai Sho table, followed by Yu.] It's over! You two fugitives are coming with me!

title: The Desert
text: [Quickly places himself before Iroh and Zuko, preventing Xin Fu and Yu from reaching them.] I knew it! You two are wanted criminals with a giant bounty on your heads!

title: The Desert
text: I thought you said he would help!

title: The Desert
text: [Places a hand on Zuko's shoulder to reassure him.] He is. Just watch.

title: The Desert
text: [To Yu and Xin Fu.] You think you're going to capture them and collect all that gold?

title: The Desert
text: Gold?

title: The Desert
text: Every person in the bar looks up when they hear the word 'gold'. Some of them stand up, pulling a knife, ready to attack.

title: The Desert
text: Uh ... Maybe we shouldn't.

title: The Desert
text: Camera shows a close-up of a grinning Xin Fu. As he moves toward Zuko and Iroh, two men jump in front of him to block his path. With a reverse roundhouse kick, the earthbender bends a rock from the ground and easily pushes them out of his way.

title: The Desert
text: Come on, get up. We need to go.

title: The Desert
text: Sokka drowsily sits up and smiles like a drunken idiot. Toph also erects herself, smacking her lips.

title: The Desert
text: Yesterday my mouth tasted like mud. Now it just tastes like sand. I never thought I'd miss the taste of mud so much.

title: The Desert
text: Katara goes to Aang to wake him up, but he interrupts her before she can touch him.

title: The Desert
text: I'm awake. I couldn't sleep.

title: The Desert
text: Well, we need to get moving if we want to get out of this sand pit.

title: The Desert
text: Aang and Katara spot something large in the sky. He quickly sits up. Cut to a shot of a large, bison shaped object floating by the bright, full moon. Aang's expression brightens up in an instant.

title: The Desert
text: [Joyfully.] Appa!

title: The Desert
text: Appaâ? But why would Princess Yue need himâ? She's the moon! [Grabs Momo's tail, using it to rub his cheek.] She flies by herself!

title: The Desert
text: A closer shot of the floating object reveals that it is just a small desert cloud.

title: The Desert
text: [Sadly.] It's just a cloud. Wait! A cloud! [Offers he pouch to Aang.] Here, fly up and bend the water from that cloud into my pouch.

title: The Desert
text: Aang gives Katara an angry look before snatching the offered water pouch out of her hands. The group gazes at him as he quickly passes two times over the cloud. The few remains of the cloud evaporate. He throws the pouch at Katara when he lands and she peeks in.

title: The Desert
text: [Disappointed.] Wow ... there's hardly any in here.

title: The Desert
text: [Lashes out.] I'm sorry, okay! It's a desert cloud; I did all I could! What's anyone else doing?! [Pointing his staff at Katara.] What are you doingâ?!

title: The Desert
text: She returns his attack with a shocked look on her face.

title: The Desert
text: Trying to keep everyone together. Let's just get moving. We need to head this direction.

title: The Desert
text: Katara looks at her charts once more and leads the group in the chosen direction. They are walking silently through the desert, until Toph trips and falls flat on her face. Aang and Katara are looking at Toph, while Sokka and Momo just stand there, staring blankly to the sky. Toph sits up and rubs her right foot.

title: The Desert
text: Ow! Crud! I am so sick of not feeling where I'm going! [Pointing toward the little rocklike shaped object she tripped over.] And what idiot buried a boat in the middle of the desertâ?

title: The Desert
text: A boatâ?

title: The Desert
text: Katara runs over to inspect the object.

title: The Desert
text: Believe me, I kicked it hard enough to feel plenty of vibrations.

title: The Desert
text: Sokka turns around, swinging like a string puppet, to see what Katara is so excited about. Katara begins to rub of the sand of the object that appears to be made of wood. Aang steps forward, suggestively holding up his staff. As soon as Katara backs away, Aang swings his staff around, creating a mighty gust of wind, revealing a boat of some sort. Katara crawls aboard and examines it.

title: The Desert
text: It's one of the gliders the sandbenders use! And look! It's got some kind of compass on it! [Tapping the compass.] I bet it can point us out of here! Aang, you can bend a breeze so we can sail it. We're going to make it!

title: The Desert
text: Shot of Sokka laughing childishly while burying Momo in the sand.

title: The Desert
text: It is an honor to welcome such a high-ranking member of the Order of the White Lotus. Being a Grand Master, you must know so many secrets.

title: The Desert
text: [Annoyed.] Now that you played Pai Sho, are you going to do some flower arranging, or is someone in this club going to offer some real helpâ?

title: The Desert
text: You must forgive my nephew. He is not an initiate and has little appreciation for the cryptic arts.

title: The Desert
text: The Pai Sho player leads Iroh toward a door with a peephole in it. He knocks two times. A man slides open the small window in the door and peeks through.

title: The Desert
text: Who knocks at the guarded gateâ?

title: The Desert
text: One who has eaten the fruit and tasted its mysteries.

title: The Desert
text: Iroh smiles as the door opens to let him and the Pai Sho player through. When Zuko attempts to follow them, the door slams shut in front of him. He looks at the door with a pout when Iroh opens the small window.

title: The Desert
text: I'm afraid it's members only. Wait out here.

title: The Desert
text: An annoyed Zuko frowns and crosses his arms as he rests against a nearby table. He leans over to sniff the plant on the table.

title: The Desert
text: The needle on this compass doesn't seem to be pointing north according to my charts.

title: The Desert
text: Katara places her charts over the compass. Sokka sits beside her, dangling his legs over the edge and holding Momo by the tail, who glides in the opposite direction.

title: The Desert
text: [Dreamily.] Take it easy little lady. I'm sure the sand folks who built this baby know how to get around here.

title: The Desert
text: Katara looks annoyed at Sokka. When she focuses her attention back toward the horizon in front of her, she gasps is comprehension when she sees a giant rock in the distance.

title: The Desert
text: That's what the compass is pointing to! That giant rock! It must be the magnetic center of the desert.

title: The Desert
text: [Ecstatic.] A rockâ?! Yes! Let's go!

title: The Desert
text: [Hopeful.] Maybe we can find some water there!

title: The Desert
text: [Darkly.] Maybe we can find some sandbenders.

title: The Desert
text: Aang continues to send gusts of wind into the sails of the glider, directing it toward the rock. Switch to a shot of the glider at the base of the rock. The sun's already rising when team Avatar reaches the top.

title: The Desert
text: Ahhh ... Finally! Solid ground!

title: The Desert
text: Toph happily lets herself drop flat on her back, moving her arms and legs back and forth, creating a rock angel. After she is done, the group starts to explore the caves that decorate the top of the rock. They enter a round tunnel. The cave's surface is covered with a yellow, gooey substance.

title: The Desert
text: [Breathes deeply.] I think my head is starting to clear out the cactus juice. And look!

title: The Desert
text: Sokka dips his hand in the yellow goo and tastes it, sharing his find with Momo. They both spit it out and Sokka makes a disgusted gagging noise.

title: The Desert
text: Tastes like rotten penguin meat! Awww, I feel woozy.

title: The Desert
text: [Irritated.] You've been hallucinating on cactus juice all day and then you just lick something you find stuck to the wall of a caveâ?!

title: The Desert
text: I have a natural curiosity.

title: The Desert
text: I don't think this is a normal cave. This was carved by something.

title: The Desert
text: Yeah ... look at the shape.

title: The Desert
text: [Close-up of her feet.] There's something buzzing in here. [Camera pans up to her.] Something that's coming for us!

title: The Desert
text: The camera shows how the group runs out of the cave, back into the open. Toph and Aang scream as the first buzzard wasp emerges. Aang pulls Toph down as it flies over their heads. A second wasp dives directly toward the camera.

title: The Desert
text: [Surprised.] What are you doing? That rock almost crushed me!

title: The Desert
text: Sorry, I can't tell where they are in the air!

title: The Desert
text: A loud buzzing signals the passing of another wasp. Sokka readies his machete and runs after it.

title: The Desert
text: I got this one.

title: The Desert
text: He ferociously swings his weapon back and forth at the camera.

title: The Desert
text: Sokka, there's nothing there!

title: The Desert
text: The camera pans back. He lowers his machete, looking around in search for his imagined foe.

title: The Desert
text: I guess my head's not as clear as I thought.

title: The Desert
text: Cut to a close-up of a crouched up Momo. In the background, Katara backs a few steps in Aang's direction.

title: The Desert
text: We have to get out of here! I'm completely out of water to bend!

title: The Desert
text: A buzzard wasp swoops in from the sky and snatches up a screeching Momo as it flies away from the hive and the benders.

title: The Desert
text: Momo! I'm not losing anyone else out here.

title: The Desert
text: Full of anger, he takes off on his glider in hot pursuit of Momo and the wasp. Katara and Sokka watch him go.

title: The Desert
text: Come on, we're going down.

title: The Desert
text: They descend along a narrow ledge. Katara leads Toph by hand.

title: The Desert
text: Toph, shoot a rock right there. Fire!

title: The Desert
text: Katara places Toph in the right direction. Toph kicks up some rocks and shoots them forward. The incoming buzzard wasp is shot down, taking several blows to the head. Sokka cheers, swinging his machete in the air.

title: The Desert
text: Yeah! You got it! She got it, rightâ?

title: The Desert
text: Yes. Now let's move.

title: The Desert
text: Katara leads Toph on as they start to run along the ledge.

title: The Desert
text: On your left!

title: The Desert
text: Toph reacts immediately and shoots a rock at her left. The buzzard wasp takes the rock full in the chest, shrieking on impact before tumbling down.

title: The Desert
text: What's going on? Is the club meeting overâ?

title: The Desert
text: Everything is taken care of. We're heading to Ba Sing Se.

title: The Desert
text: Iroh and Fung bow to each other in respect.

title: The Desert
text: Ba Sing Se? âWhy would we go to the Earth Kingdom capitalâ?

title: The Desert
text: [Calmly.] The city is filled with refugees. No one will notice two more.

title: The Desert
text: We can hide in plain sight there. And it's the safest place in the world from the Fire Nation. Even I couldn't break through to the city. [Happily shrugs his shoulders.]

title: The Desert
text: A bell signals that someone has entered the shop. A young man approaches the group, holding up some papers.

title: The Desert
text: I have the passports for our guests, but there are two men out on the street looking for them.

title: The Desert
text: Xin Fu and Yu can be seen through a small window in the door of the flower shop. They are holding up a wanted poster that depicts Iroh and Zuko to man walking by.

title: The Desert
text: You seen these guysâ?

title: The Desert
text: Shift back to a shot of the base of the giant rock, where the leader of the sandbenders confronts Aang and the rest.

title: The Desert
text: What are you doing in our land with a sandbender sailer? â From the looks of it, you stole it from the Hami tribe.

title: The Desert
text: We found the sailer abandoned in the desert. We're traveling with the Avatar. [She gestures at Aang. The leader's eyes widen a bit at this information.] Our bison was stolen and we have to get to Ba Sing Se.

title: The Desert
text: A young man to the right of the leader takes a step forward and aggressively addresses Katara.

title: The Desert
text: You dare accuse our people of theft while you ride in on a stolen sand sailerâ?!

title: The Desert
text: Close-up of Toph's misty, green eye, narrowing as she hears the young man's voice.

title: The Desert
text: Quiet, Ghashiun. No one accused our people of anything. If what they say is true, we must give them hospitality.

title: The Desert
text: Sorry, father.

title: The Desert
text: Toph's eye widens.

title: The Desert
text: I recognize the son's voice. He's the one that stole Appa.

title: The Desert
text: Are you sure?â

title: The Desert
text: I never forget a voice.

title: The Desert
text: Aang's tunic flutters around him as he charges forward, threateningly brandishing his staff toward Ghashiun.

title: The Desert
text: [Angry.] You stole Appa! Where is he? âWhat did you do to him?

title: The Desert
text: Ghashiun cowers back.

title: The Desert
text: They're lying! They're the thieves!

title: The Desert
text: With an angry frown and a growl of frustration, Aang smacks his staff on the ground, obliterating one of the sandbender's sailers with a powerful blade of air.

title: The Desert
text: [Enraged.] Where is my bisonâ?

title: The Desert
text: The scene changes again to the flower shop, where a man exits the door, pulling two big flowerpots on a wooden wagon. After he leaves, Xin Fu and Yu walk toward the door. Xin Fu slams the door open with such ferocity that an overhanging plant comes crashing down. He shoves Zuko's and Iroh's wanted poster under the nose of the florist.

title: The Desert
text: Hey you, where are these menâ? I got a tip that they're in your shop.

title: The Desert
text: [Calmly.] As you can see, no one is here but us.

title: The Desert
text: We know all about your secret back room. [To Xin Fu.] Kick it down.

title: The Desert
text: Xin Fu charges the door like a mad bull and knocks it down along with the surrounding wall, with one mighty kick.

title: The Desert
text: Hey! That room is for flowers only!

title: The Desert
text: Some unlucky soul has an incomplete Pai Sho set.

title: The Desert
text: Yu picks up a lotus tile that lies in the center of the room and shows it to Xin Fu, who angrily knocks it out of his hands.

title: The Desert
text: Let's go back to finding the girl.

title: The Desert
text: The scene switches to the man pulling the wooden wagon with the two large pots over some dunes. Zuko's and Iroh's head emerges from underneath the flowers. They briefly peek around before sinking back into their pots.

title: The Desert
text: You tell me where he is now!

title: The Desert
text: To emphasize his order, Aang sends a strong blast of air toward another sailer. The sandbenders watch in shock as it blows up.

title: The Desert
text: [To Ghashiun.] What did you doâ?

title: The Desert
text: I-It wasn't me!

title: The Desert
text: You said to put a muzzle on him!

title: The Desert
text: [Enraged.] You muzzled Appaâ?

title: The Desert
text: Aang's eyes and tattoos start to glow as he enters the Avatar State. With a swing of his staff, he destroys the last of the sandbender's sailers.

title: The Desert
text: I'm sorry! I didn't know that it belonged to the Avatar!

title: The Desert
text: [With the voices of all the Avatars.] Tell me where Appa is!

title: The Desert
text: [Frightened.] I traded him! To some merchants! He's probably in Ba Sing Se by now! They were going to sell him there! [The sandbenders raise their hands as if to ward off the Avatar's bright, angry glare.] Please! We'll escort you out of the desert! We'll help however we can!

title: The Desert
text: The wind around Avatar Aang starts the swirl, as his anger is reaching its peak. Sokka pull Toph along with him as he starts to make a break for it, running away from his enraged friend.

title: The Desert
text: Just get out of here! Run!

title: The Desert
text: Aang drops his staff. The wind around him forms a fast moving sphere, knocking up sand high into the sky. As everyone runs away, Katara stays put, staring sadly at the ground. The sandstorm engulfs her and Aang completely, obscuring them from the sight of the others. They brace themselves as the whirlwind swoops over them.

title: The Desert
text: Aang

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: The team is situated at the waterfall pond. Sokka is surveying a map. Toph is sitting with her feet in the water, moving it back and forth. Aang is swimming while Katara is located at the top of the lake near the waterfall. Aang goes underwater for a moment and bends an ice cube around himself for amusement.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: [Excitedly.] Waterbending bomb! Yeah! [Jumps into the water.]

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: The splash sends Aang out of the water, breaks his ice prison, and soaks Sokka, Toph, and the maps which he tried to protect.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: [Sarcastically.] Sure, five thousand year-old maps from the spirit library. Just splash some water on 'em.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Sorry. [Wrings her hair dry and bends the water off the map.]

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: So, did you figure out what route we're going to take?

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Okay, we just got out of the desert, so we must be around here. And we need to go to Ba Sing Se, which is here. It looks like the only passage connecting the south to the north is this sliver of land called the Serpent's Pass.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: You sure that's the best way to go?

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: It's the only way. I mean, it's not like we have Appa to fly us there.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: [Quietly.] Shush up about Appa. Can't you at least try to be sensitive?

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Katara, it's okay. I know I was upset about losing Appa before, but I just want to focus on getting to Ba Sing Se and telling the Earth King about the solar eclipse.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: [Surprised.] Oh ... well, okay. I'm glad you're doing better.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Then to Ba Sing Se we go. No more distractions.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Suddenly, three refugees arrive.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Hello there, fellow refugees!

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: So, you guys are headed to Ba Sing Se, too?

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Sure are. We're trying to get there before my wife Ying has her baby.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Great! We can travel through the Serpent's Pass together.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: The three refugees look up in shock.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: The Serpent's Pass? Only the truly desperate take that deadly route!

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Deadly route. [Punches Sokka in the arm.] Great pick, Sokka!

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Well, we are desperate.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: You should come with us to Full Moon Bay. Ferries take refugees across the lake. It's the fastest way to Ba Sing Se.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: And it's hidden, so the Fire Nation can't find it.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Hmm ... peaceful ferry ride or deadly pass?

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: At Full Moon Bay.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: I can't believe how many people's lives have been uprooted by the Fire Nation.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: We're all looking for a better life, safe behind the walls of Ba Sing Se.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: A ferry departs. Zuko and Iroh are on board.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Who would have thought after all these years, I'd return to the scene of my greatest military disgrace ... [Turns away for a second before turning back with a floral hat on his head.] as a tourist!

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Look around. We're not tourists, we're refugees. [Sips food and spits it out.] Ugh! I'm sick of eating rotten food, sleeping in the dirt. I'm tired of living like this!

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Aren't we all? My name's Jet and these are my Freedom Fighters, Smellerbee and Longshot.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Hey. [Longshot nods.]

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Hello.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Here's the deal. I hear the captain's eating like a king while the refugees have to feed off his scraps. Doesn't seem fair, does it?

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: What sort of king is he eating like?

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: The fat, happy kind. [At this, Iroh's mouth hangs open as he starts to drool.] You want to help us "liberate" some food?

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: [Tosses the bowl of rotten food into the water.] I'm in.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Jet smirks.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: I told you already ... no vegetables on the ferry! One cabbage slug could destroy the entire ecosystem of Ba Sing Se! Security!

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: A platypus bear destroys the cabbage cart.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Ahhh! My cabbages! [He is carried away.]

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Next!

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Um, four tickets for the ferry to Ba Sing Se, please.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Passports?

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Uh ... no one told us we had to have passports.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Don't you know who this is? He's the Avatar!

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Ah, I see fifty Avatars a day and, by the way, not a very impressive costume. [The screen pans to show several impostors; notices Momo.] Besides, no animals allowed. Do I need to call security?

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: The platypus bear chomps down on the cabbage. Momo hides in fear.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: That won't be necessary.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Next!

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: I'll take care of this. My name is Toph Beifong, and I'll need four tickets. [Presents her passport.]

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Ah, the golden seal of the flying boar! It is my pleasure to help anyone of the Beifong family.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: It is your pleasure. As you can see, I am blind and these three imbeciles are my valets. [Sweeps her arm behind her, presenting her friends to the hesitant clerk.]

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: But, the animal-

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: -is my seeing-eye lemur.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Well, normally it's only one ticket per passport, but this document is so official ... I guess it's worth four tickets. [Stamps an approval seal on the tickets.]

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Thank you very much.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: All right, we scammed that lady good!

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Suddenly, a security guard, actually Suki without makeup, grabs Sokka.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Tickets and passports please.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Is there a problem?

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Yeah, I got a problem with you! I've seen your type before. Probably sarcastic, think you're hilarious and let me guess, you're traveling with the Avatar.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Do I know you?

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: You mean you don't remember? Maybe you'll remember this! [Kisses Sokka on the cheek.]

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Suki! [Embraces her.]

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Sokka, it's good to see you!

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Later, in a different location of the station. The gang and Suki talk.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: You look so different without your makeup! And the new outfit.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: That crabby lady makes all the security guards wear them. And look at you, sleeveless guy. Been working out?

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Ahhh, I'll grab a tree branch and do a few chin touches every now and then. Nothing major.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Are the other Kyoshi Warriors around?

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Yeah. After you left Kyoshi, we wanted to find a way to help people. We ended up escorting some refugees and we've been here ever since. [Momo jumps up next to her.] Hi, Momo! Good to see you too! [Scratches his head near his ear.] So why are you guys getting tickets for the ferry? Wouldn't you just fly across on Appa?

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Appa is missing. We hope to find him in Ba Sing Se.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: I'm so sorry to hear that. [To Aang.] Are you doing okay?

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: I'm doing fine. Would everybody stop worrying about me?

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Avatar Aang, you have to help us! Someone took all of our belongings; our passports, our tickets, everything's gone!

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: I'll talk to the lady for you.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Back at the desk.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: No passports, no tickets! [Stamps a "denied" stamp on Aang's forehead.]

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: But she's pregnant and all of her stuff was stolen! You have to make an exception!

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: No exceptions! If I just gave away tickets willy-nilly to anyone, there would be no more order! You know what that means, no more civilization!

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: What if we gave them our tickets?

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: No!

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: But ...

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Next!

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Don't worry, you'll get to the city safely. I'll lead you through the Serpent's Pass.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Moments later.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: I can't believe we gave up our tickets and now we're going through the Serpent's Pass.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: I can't believe you're still complaining about it.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: [In her normal Kyoshi Warrior attire.] I'm coming too!

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Are you sure that's a good idea?

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Sokka, I thought you'd want me to come.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: I do, it's justâ

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Just what?

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Nothing. I'm glad you're coming.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Outside, at the pass.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: This is the Serpent's Pass? I thought it would be a little more wind-y, you know, like a serpent. Huh, I guess they misnamed it.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Look at this writing! How awful!

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: What does it say?

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: It says, "abandon hope".

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: How can we abandon hope? It's all we have!

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: I don't know. The monks used to say that hope was just a distraction, so maybe we do need to abandon it.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: What are you talking about?

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Hope is not going to get us into Ba Sing Se and it's not going to help find Appa. We need to focus on what we're doing right now and that's getting across this path.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Okay, if you say so.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Within the pass.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: The Fire Nation controls the western lake. Rumor has it they're working on something big on the other side of it and don't want anyone to find out what it is.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: They all pass by a sailing Fire Nation ship. A part of the rock gives out, causing Than to fall. Toph stops it from falling and lifts him back up with earthbending.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: I'm okay! [The rock falls to the water, which the Fire Nation ship notices. It fires.]

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: They've spotted us! Let's go, let's go!

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Aang gets on his glider and deflects the fireball back. Another fireball hits the mountain, causing several pieces of rock over Suki to fall. Sokka pushes her out of the way. Toph bends out a part of the mountain to keep the rocks from falling on Sokka.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Suki, are you okay? You have to be more careful! Come on!

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: [Pretending to be Sokka.] "Thanks for saving my life, Toph." Hey, no problem, Sokka.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Hours later, at sunset, the travelers set up their camp. Sokka approaches Suki.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Suki, you shouldn't sleep there. Who knows how stable this ledge is, it could give away at any moment! [Moves her sleeping bag.]

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Sokka, I'm fine, stop worrying!

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: You're right, you're right, you're perfectly capable of taking care of yourself! Wait! Oh, never mind, I thought I saw a spider, but, you're fine.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Back on the ferry. Zuko, Jet, and Smellerbee sneak up to the food storage area. Jet breaks the door open with his twin tiger hook swords, and he and Zuko take some food.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Guard's coming!

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Longshot fires an arrow with a rope attached to it, allowing the three to slide down it. Longshot pulls it away before the guard notices. Back at the pass, Aang is standing at the edge of the rock, looking out at the ocean, blankly. Katara approaches him.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: You know, it's okay to miss Appa. [Aang remains silent.] What's going on with you? In the desert, all you cared about was finding Appa and now it's like you don't care about him at all.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: You saw what I did out there. I was so angry about losing Appa that I couldn't control myself. I hated feeling like that.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: But now you're not letting yourself feel anything. I know sometimes it hurts more to hope and it hurts more to care. But you have to promise me that you won't stop caring. [ Holds out her arms.] Come on, you need a hug.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: [Bows before her.] Thank you for your concern, Katara. [Exits.]

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Katara shows visible concern.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: It's a beautiful moon.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Yeah, it really is.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Look, I know you're just trying to help, but I can take care of myself.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: I know you can.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Then why are you acting so overprotective?

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: It's so hard to lose someone you care about. Something happened at the North Pole and I couldn't protect someone. I don't want anything like that to ever happen again.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: I lost someone I care about. He didn't die, he just went away. I only had a few days to get to know him, but he was smart and brave and funny ...

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: [Jealous.] Who is this guy? Is he taller than me?

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: No, he's about your height.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Is he better-looking?

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: It is you, stupid!

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Oh!

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: The two prepare to kiss, but Sokka pulls back at the last moment.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: I can't.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: I'm sorry.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: No, you shouldn't be. [Exits.]

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Back on the ferry. Jet passes out food to other travelers. The other Freedom Fighters, Zuko, and Iroh sit together.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: So, Smellerbee. That's an unusual name for a young man.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Maybe it's because I'm not a man ... I'm a girl! [Walks away.]

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: [Calling out to her.] Oh, now I see. It's a beautiful name for a lovely girl!

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Longshot approaches Smellerbee and gestures at her.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: I know, you're right. As long as I'm confident with who I am, it doesn't matter what other people think. Thanks, Longshot.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Longshot nods at her. Jet approaches Zuko and Iroh.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: From what I heard, people eat like this every night in Ba Sing Se. I can't wait to set my eyes on that giant wall.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: It is a magnificent sight.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: So you've been there before?

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Once. When I was a ... different man.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: I've done some things in my past that I'm not proud of, but that's why I'm going to Ba Sing Se: for a new beginning. A second chance.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: That's very noble of you. I believe people can change their lives if they want to. I believe in second chances.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Back at the Serpent's Pass. The travelers notice that a section of the pass is below the sea level, and not able to be navigated.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Everyone single file! [She divides the water, allowing everyone to walk through the drowned out path.] Aang, I need help! [Aang helps by creating an air bubble.]

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Momo's curiosity is aroused by the fish. He dives in the water, only to return back when he sees a large shadow. The rest of them notice.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: What is that thing?

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: The shadow breaks through the water, breaking the divide. Toph quickly uses her earthbending to raise the ground they are standing on above the water. The shadow is actually a large serpent, which appears from the water with a shriek.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: I think I just figured out why they call it the Serpent's Pass! Suki, you know about giant sea monsters, make it go away!

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Just because I live near the unagi doesn't mean I'm an expert!

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: [Holds up Momo.] Oh great and powerful sea serpent, please accept this humble and tasty offering. Thank you.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Sokka!

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: [Blasts the Serpent back with a burst of air.] I'll distract it. Katara, get everyone across! [Takes off on his glider.]

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Katara freezes the water to create an ice trail. Everyone except for Toph crosses. Katara tries to ice up the serpent, but it fails.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Toph, come on, it's just ice!

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: [Feels the ice but her sense of sight is restricted.] Actually, I'm going to stay on my little island, where I can see! [The serpent takes out half the island.] Okay, I'm coming! [Slowly crosses the ice.]

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: You're doing great! Just follow the sound of my voice!

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: It's hard to ignore.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: You're almost there!

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: The serpent slams down the ice trail, dropping Toph into a struggle to stay above water.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Help! I can't swim!

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: I'm coming, Toph!

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Before he can do anything, Suki jumps in for the save.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Help!

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Toph falls below the water, but Suki pulls her up before she drowns.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: [Thinking it is Sokka.] Oh Sokka, you saved me! [Kisses Suki on the cheek.]

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Actually, it's me.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Oh ... well ... [Chuckles. Embarrassed.] you can go ahead and let me drown now.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Meanwhile, the serpent is caught in a whirlpool created by Aang and Katara. The force of it slams the serpent into the mountain, causing it to fall back below water. Upon seeing the two return, the rest of the travelers cheer. Moments later, near Ba Sing Se's wall.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: There's the wall! Now it's nothing but smooth sailing to Ba Sing Se.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: [Groans in pain.] Oh no!

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: What's wrong?

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: The baby's coming!

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: [Panicked.] What? Now? Can't you hold it in or something?

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Sokka, calm down. I helped Gran-Gran deliver lots of babies back home.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: This isn't the same as delivering an arctic seal! This is a real ... human ... thing!

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: It's called a baby and I helped her deliver plenty of those, too. Aang, get some rags. Sokka, water. Toph, I need you to make an earth tent, a big one. [Toph earthbends the rock to form a tent.] Suki, come with me.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Back on the ferry. Jet approaches Zuko.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: You know, as soon as I saw your scar, I knew exactly who you were. You're an outcast, like me. And us outcasts have to stick together. We have to watch each other's backs. Because no one else will.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: I've realized lately that being on your own isn't always the best path.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: The ferry closes in on the walls.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: You're doing great, Ying. Sokka, where's that water? Now get ready to push. One ... two ... [Sokka enters.] ... three, push!

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Ying groans; Sokka passes out. Moments later, the baby arrives and begins to cry. Aang, Toph, and Sokka are all outside the tent.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: [From inside the tent.] It's a girl!

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: So, you want to go see the baby, or are you going to faint like an old lady again?

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: No, no, I'm good this time. [Toph and Sokka enter the tent.]

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Aang, you have to come see this.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Aang enters to see the new life.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: She sounds healthy.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: She's beautiful.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: It's so ... squishy looking.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Aang begins to smile.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: What should we name her?

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: I want our daughter's name to be unique. I want it to mean something.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: [Sheds some tears.] I've been going through a really hard time lately. But you've made me ... hopeful again.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: I know what I want to name our baby now. Hope.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: That's a perfect name. Hope.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Outside the tent. Aang meets with Katara. Suki, Sokka, and Toph stand next to the tent.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: I thought I was trying to be strong. But really I was just running away from my feelings. Seeing this family together, so full of happiness and love, it's reminded me how I feel about Appa ... and how I feel about you.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Katara sheds some tears. Aang and Katara embrace, Katara's eyes still watering. The other three approach.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: I promise, I'll find Appa as fast as I can. I just really need to do this.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: See you in the big city.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Say hi to that big fuzzball for me. [Punches Aang in the arm.]

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: You'll find him, Aang.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: I know. Thank you, Katara. You ready, Momo? [Aang and Momo fly off. The rest wave goodbye.]

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Suki approaches Sokka.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Sokka, it's been really great to see you again.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Whoa, hold on. Why does it sound like you're saying goodbye?

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: I came along because I wanted to make sure you got through the Serpent's Pass safely. But now I need to get back to the other Kyoshi Warriors.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: So you came along to protect me?

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Listen, I'm really sorry about last night. We were talking ... and saying things ... and I just got carried away and before I knew it -

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: [Kisses Suki.] You talk too much.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: The two share a deep kiss. Aang and Momo fly to the top of the Outer Wall of Ba Sing Se. However, Aang quickly notices a large drill with a Fire Nation insignia, heading for the wall.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Sorry Momo, Appa's going to have to wait.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Fade to credits.

title: The Serpent's Pass
text: Aang

title: The Drill
text: The episode opens where several Fire Nation tanks rumble across the terrain, a large metal mechanism following close behind. The camera zooms out to a shot of the Fire Nation drill slowly moving its way toward the Outer Wall of Ba Sing Se. Several sections of the drill extend forward, releasing steam as spikes are driven into the ground. The drill's command module ascends where inside are Princess Azula, her friends, Mai and Ty Lee, War Minister Qin and several operators of the drill.

title: The Drill
text: This drill is a feat of scientific ingenuity and raw destructive power. Once it tunnels through the wall, our troops will storm their city. The Earth Kingdom will finally fall, and you can claim Ba Sing Se in the name of your father. Nothing can stop us.

title: The Drill
text: [Looking through the telescope.] Hmmm, what about those muscle-y guys down there?

title: The Drill
text: She peers through a periscope at several Earth Kingdom troops using earthbending to create large trenches, Fire Nation forces following them in hot pursuit.

title: The Drill
text: [Strikes the periscope roughly alarming Ty Lee.] Please. The drill's metal shell is impervious to any earthbending attack.

title: The Drill
text: Oh, I'm sure it is, War Minister Qin, but just to be on the safe side ... [Sharply while looking at the two girls.] Mai and Ty Lee, take the earthbenders out!

title: The Drill
text: [Swinging a knife around her finger; relieved.] Finally, something to do. [Rises and walks out.]

title: The Drill
text: The scene changes to where Katara, Sokka and Toph are escorting Than and his family to the city. Aang appears, flying in on his glider with Momo behind him. He lands, Momo perched on his shoulder.

title: The Drill
text: [Surprised.] Aang, what are you doing here? I thought you were looking for Appa.

title: The Drill
text: I was, but something stopped me. Something big.

title: The Drill
text: The scene switches to the base of the Outer Wall where Aang and Toph use earthbending to transport everyone up the wall.

title: The Drill
text: Now what's so big that Appa has to wait?

title: The Drill
text: [Camera zooms out to drill.] That.

title: The Drill
text: The group arrives at the top of the Outer Wall.

title: The Drill
text: [Despairingly.] We made it to Ba Sing Se and we're still not safe. No one is! [Huddles with family members.]

title: The Drill
text: What are you people doing here? Civilians aren't allowed on the wall!

title: The Drill
text: I'm the Avatar. Take me to whoever is in charge.

title: The Drill
text: The scene changes to a portion of the Outer Wall where a roof rises overhead, supported by tall arches. An Earth Kingdom general sits behind a desk.

title: The Drill
text: [Happily.] It is an honor to welcome you to the Outer Wall, young Avatar, but your help is not needed.

title: The Drill
text: Not needed?

title: The Drill
text: [Calmly.] Not needed. I have the situation under control. I assure you the Fire Nation cannot penetrate this wall. Many have tried to break through it, but none have succeeded.

title: The Drill
text: What about the Dragon of the West? He got in.

title: The Drill
text: [Slightly taken aback.] Well ... uh, technically yes, but he was quickly expunged. [Confidently.] Nevertheless, that is why the city is named Ba Sing Se. It's the "impenetrable city". They don't call it Na Sing Se. [Laughs, but subsequently turns serious.] That means "penetrable city."

title: The Drill
text: Yeah, thanks for the tour, but we still got the drill problem.

title: The Drill
text: Not for long. To stop it, I've sent an elite platoon of earthbenders called the Terra Team.

title: The Drill
text: That's a good group name. Very catchy.

title: The Drill
text: The scene cuts to where the Terra Team is launching their assault on the Fire Nation drill. They manage to overthrow one tank and get closer to the drill.

title: The Drill
text: Ready ... attack!

title: The Drill
text: The earthbenders wedge large earth spikes into the metal shell of the drill to halt it. However, the drill's segments separate, reducing the columns to crumbles. The Terra Team narrowly manages to conjure earth shields to defend themselves against an assault of flying daggers hurled by Mai. She and Ty Lee are seen sliding down the shell of the drill. The scene cuts to the side of the drill where Ty Lee lands gracefully onto the ground. She effortlessly manages to defeat the earthbenders through an acrobatic display, utilizing chi blocking.

title: The Drill
text: [Upon witnessing the defeat of the Terra Team.] We're doomed! [Flails arms in panic.]

title: The Drill
text: [Slaps him across the face.] Get a hold of yourself, man!

title: The Drill
text: [Rubbing cheek.] You're right. I'm sorry.

title: The Drill
text: Maybe you'd like the Avatar's help now?

title: The Drill
text: [Meekly stands before the Avatar. Humbly.] Yes, please.

title: The Drill
text: The scene changes to where Aang and the rest are overlooking the wall at the drill.

title: The Drill
text: The question is, how are we going to stop that thing? [All turn their heads to Sokka.]

title: The Drill
text: Why are you all looking at me?

title: The Drill
text: You're the idea guy.

title: The Drill
text: [Complaining.] So I'm the only one who can ever come up with a plan? That's a lot of pressure.

title: The Drill
text: And also the complaining guy.

title: The Drill
text: That part I don't mind.

title: The Drill
text: The scene changes to where a ticket woman is inspecting Zuko and Iroh's tickets.

title: The Drill
text: So, Mr. Lee and Mr. ummm ... Mushy, is it?

title: The Drill
text: It's pronounced Mushi.

title: The Drill
text: [Annoyed.] You telling me how to do my job?

title: The Drill
text: [Approaches the ticket booth.] Uh, no, no. But may I just say you're like a flower in bloom. Your beauty is intoxicating.

title: The Drill
text: [Flirtatiously.] You're pretty easy on the eyes yourself, handsome. Raorr! Welcome to Ba Sing Se. [Stamps their tickets.]

title: The Drill
text: [Disgusted.] I'm going to forget I saw that. [Grabs ticket and walks away.]

title: The Drill
text: Camera changes to view of Jet, overlooking Zuko, now under the adopted alias, Lee.

title: The Drill
text: I think Lee would make a good Freedom Fighter. He's just trying to find his way in the world, like us.

title: The Drill
text: You don't know anything about him, Jet.

title: The Drill
text: I know he didn't get that scar from a waterbender.

title: The Drill
text: Besides, I thought we were going straight now.

title: The Drill
text: We are, and the new Freedom Fighters could use a guy like Lee. What do you think, Longshot?

title: The Drill
text: Longshot looks over at him silently with a meaningful look on his face and blinks his eyes.

title: The Drill
text: I can respect that.

title: The Drill
text: Meanwhile, back at the Outer Wall, Katara attempts to heal a member of the Terra Team.

title: The Drill
text: What's wrong with him? He doesn't look injured.

title: The Drill
text: His chi is blocked. [Stops healing.] Who did this to you?

title: The Drill
text: Two girls ambushed us. One of them hit me with a bunch of quick jabs and suddenly I couldn't earthbend anymore and I could barely move. Then she cartwheeled away.

title: The Drill
text: [Eyes widen in realization.] Ty Lee. She doesn't look dangerous, but she knows the human body and its weak points. It's like she takes you down from the inside.

title: The Drill
text: [Excitedly.] Ooh, ooh, ooh, ooh! Ooh!

title: The Drill
text: Yes?

title: The Drill
text: What you just said! That's how we're going to take down the drill! The same way Ty Lee took down all those big earthbenders!

title: The Drill
text: By hitting its pressure points!

title: The Drill
text: [Looking out over the wall with a determined look.] We'll take it down from the inside.

title: The Drill
text: The scene cuts to the Fire Nation drill. The camera pans to where Aang, Katara, Sokka and Toph are crouching together in one of the abandoned trenches of the Terra Team.

title: The Drill
text: [Gesturing toward the drill.] Once I whip up some cover, you're not going to be able to see. So, stay close to me.

title: The Drill
text: She steps outside the trench and with a powerful stomp of her foot, sending a mass of flying debris clouding toward the drill.

title: The Drill
text: Run!

title: The Drill
text: The group races into the dust cloud behind Toph. The scene cuts to the command module where Ty Lee is peering at the cloud through the periscope.

title: The Drill
text: Hey, look at that dust cloud. [Periscope view shows front of drill and billowing cloud.] It's so ... poofy. [Cut back to Ty Lee who looks away from the periscope with a spaced-out expression.] Poof.

title: The Drill
text: Don't worry, Princess. I'm sure it's nothing. [Azula casts a doubtful look.]

title: The Drill
text: The scene changes to outside where the group is standing in the midst of the dust beside the drill. Toph earthbends a hole into the ground.

title: The Drill
text: Everyone into the hole!

title: The Drill
text: She and the others jump into the hole and the ground above them closes shut. The camera pans to underground where it is pitch black.

title: The Drill
text: It's so dark down here, I can't see a thing!

title: The Drill
text: [Sarcastically.] Oh no, what a nightmare!

title: The Drill
text: [Sheepishly.] Sorry.

title: The Drill
text: They make their way to the surface underneath the drill, where Sokka spots an opening.

title: The Drill
text: There!

title: The Drill
text: Aang leaps up to the bar hanging from the opening and, dangling upside-down from his legs, hoists Sokka and Katara into the drill. He realizes Toph is not following them. Sokka sticks his head out of the drill.

title: The Drill
text: Toph, come on!

title: The Drill
text: No way am I going in that metal monster. I can't bend in there. I'll try to slow it down out here.

title: The Drill
text: Okay, good luck! [He and Aang disappear into the drill.]

title: The Drill
text: Toph earthbends a wedge of rock into the drill, however, it is proving to be a difficult task as it pushes her back. The scene changes to inside the drill where Sokka is leading the others through a tunnel of valves and pipes.

title: The Drill
text: I need a plan of this machine. Some schematics that show what the inside looks like. Then we can find its weak points.

title: The Drill
text: Where are we going to get something like that? [Sokka unexpectedly cuts off a steam valve with his machete.] What are you doing? Someone's going to hear us!

title: The Drill
text: That's the point. I figure a machine this big needs engineers to run it. And when something breaks ...

title: The Drill
text: They come to fix it!

title: The Drill
text: Aang and Katara smile at each other. Moments later, an engineer wearing a mask is seen walking down the misty hallway to the site of the damage.

title: The Drill
text: [Appears behind him.] Hi.

title: The Drill
text: She freezes the mist, covering the engineer in a thin layer of ice. Sokka runs up to the frozen engineer and takes his schematics.

title: The Drill
text: This'll work. Thanks!

title: The Drill
text: The trio runs off, leaving the helpless engineer who drops his spear unintentionally. The scene changes to where Sokka and the others are studying the plans.

title: The Drill
text: It looks like the drill is made up of two main structures. There's the inner mechanism where we are now and the outer shell. The inner part and the outer part are connected by these braces. If we cut through them, the entire thing will collapse.

title: The Drill
text: Aang and Katara nod in agreement. The scene changes to the train station where Zuko, Iroh and the three Freedom Fighters are awaiting their train. The camera focuses on Zuko and Iroh, who sit in the waiting area. Jet approaches and sits next to Zuko.

title: The Drill
text: So, you guys got plans once you're inside the city?

title: The Drill
text: Get your hot tea here! Finest tea in Ba Sing Se!

title: The Drill
text: [Waves hand.] Ooh! Jasmine please.

title: The Drill
text: The tea seller pours tea into a leaf cup for Iroh. Iroh sips the tea, but soon grimaces at its repulsive taste.

title: The Drill
text: Blaugh! Ugh, coldest tea in Ba Sing Se is more like it! What a disgrace!

title: The Drill
text: Hey, can I talk to you for a second?

title: The Drill
text: He motions for Zuko to follow him. Zuko sighs and reluctantly rises. The two walk several feet away from Iroh's spot.

title: The Drill
text: You and I have a much better chance of making it in the city if we stick together. You want to join the Freedom Fighters?

title: The Drill
text: Thanks, but I don't think you want me in your gang.

title: The Drill
text: Come on, we made a great team looting that captain's food. Think of all the good we could do for these refugees.

title: The Drill
text: [Walking away.] I said no.

title: The Drill
text: Have it your way.

title: The Drill
text: He catches sight of Iroh, who is sipping his now steaming hot tea, causing his eyes to widen in shock and realization. Zuko, approaching Iroh, glances over his shoulder at Jet, who narrows his eyes and walks away. Angrily, he knocks the tea cup out of Iroh's hand.

title: The Drill
text: Hey!

title: The Drill
text: [Gritting in a whisper.] What are you doing firebending your tea? For a wise, old man, that was a pretty stupid move!

title: The Drill
text: [Mourning.] I know you're not supposed to cry over spilled tea, but ... [Sniffs. The cup is shown overturned in a puddle.] it's just so sad!

title: The Drill
text: The scene switches to the interior of the drill where Sokka is leading the others through a door onto a massive steal beam.

title: The Drill
text: Wow, it looks a lot thicker in person than it does in the plans. We're going to have to work pretty hard to cut through that.

title: The Drill
text: [Crosses her arms.] What's this "we" stuff? Aang and I are going to have to do all the work.

title: The Drill
text: [Turns and gestures to self.] Look, I'm the plan guy. You two [Makes rapid chop-chop gestures.] are the cut stuff up with waterbending guys. [Strikes a heroic pose.] Together, we're Team Avatar!

title: The Drill
text: Katara and Aang shoot each other awkward looks. The scene cuts to one where the two are positioned on either side of one brace. Using waterbending, they slice through the metal sharply. The shot changes to when the brace is sliced halfway through. Both Katara and Aang are bent over and gasping in exhaustion.

title: The Drill
text: [Pumping arms in the air.] C'mon team. Don't quit now. [Katara grinds her teeth as she seethes with rage.] We're ...

title: The Drill
text: [Explodes with frustration.] Grrr!

title: The Drill
text: Katara shoots a menacing glare while pulling out her water whip and threatening to strike him with it. Cut to Sokka, who stands wide-eyed, arms still in air.

title: The Drill
text: I mean, [Recovers and points reassuringly.] you're almost there.

title: The Drill
text: The two resume work slicing the brace. With every lash of the water whip, the cut through the brace enlarges and Sokka grows more and more eager. At last, a cut is made clean through the brace, however, to their disappointment, the brace budges mere inches from its position.

title: The Drill
text: [Panting in exhaustion.] At this rate, we won't do enough damage before the drill reaches the wall.

title: The Drill
text: I don't know how many more of those I have in me.

title: The Drill
text: The drill suddenly creaks.

title: The Drill
text: Do you hear that? We took it down! We better get out of here fast!

title: The Drill
text: The trio run for the door, only to halt upon hearing an announcement being made through overhead speaking tubes.

title: The Drill
text: Congratulations, crew. The drill has made contact with the wall of Ba Sing Se. [Cuts to him standing in the command module.] Start the countdown to victory!

title: The Drill
text: Cheers erupt from the crew. The camera cuts to Azula, a threatening look of determination on her face. Aang, Katara and Sokka look at each other in shock and dismay. The camera cuts to a scene of the drill hammering through the wall, sending loose boulders in every direction. The scene changes to one of a stream of a saturated rock and water solution traveling through tubes and making its way through the back entrance of the drill. Cuts to Sokka, who is desperately attempting to move the brace.

title: The Drill
text: [Pushing against brace.] C'mon brace ... budge! [Makes several more attempts to move it.]

title: The Drill
text: This is bad, really bad.

title: The Drill
text: We're putting everything we've got into busting these braces, but it's taking too long!

title: The Drill
text: [Struck with realization.] Maybe we don't need to cut all the way through. Toph has been teaching me that you shouldn't give one hundred percent of your energy into any one strike. [Rises.] Sokka, take a fighting stance. You've got to be quick and accurate. Hit a series of points and break your opponent's stance. [Strikes Sokka several times.] And when he's reeling back, you deliver the final blow. [Hits him softly on the head.] His own weight becomes his downfall, literally.

title: The Drill
text: As Aang is speaking, Sokka kneels over.

title: The Drill
text: So we just need to weaken the braces, instead of cutting all the way through.

title: The Drill
text: Then I'll go to the top of this thing and deliver the final blow.

title: The Drill
text: [Rising.] And boom! It all comes crashing down!

title: The Drill
text: Everyone inside that wall. The whole world is counting on us.

title: The Drill
text: The whole world minus the Fire Nation that is.

title: The Drill
text: Sokka grins, while the other two simply stare at each other exasperated. The scene cuts to Toph under the drill, putting all her strength into keeping the rock column stable as she is slowly pushed back by the force of the drill.

title: The Drill
text: [Straining as the drill continues to push her back.] C'mon, Twinkle Toes, hurry up!

title: The Drill
text: The scene changes to where Aang and Katara are making rapid progress, slicing through several braces halfway to weaken them.

title: The Drill
text: That's enough! We need to get to the next one!

title: The Drill
text: The scene changes to outside the drill, where earthbenders are sending boulders down at the drill from the wall. The scene changes to the command module where the War Minister receives shocking news from engineers communicating through speaking tubes.

title: The Drill
text: War Minister, an engineer was ambushed! His schematics were stolen!

title: The Drill
text: Qin is clearly surprised while Azula narrows her eyes in suspicion.

title: The Drill
text: War Minister, a brace on the starboard side has been cut clean through! It's sabotage, sir!

title: The Drill
text: [Sharply.] Let's go, ladies!

title: The Drill
text: The scene changes to where the trio continues to slice through the braces.

title: The Drill
text: Good work, Team Avatar! Now Aang just needs to ... [Glances up in horror.] duck!

title: The Drill
text: He ducks just in time to evade the blue fire blast sent his way by Azula, who runs out and stands on another brace followed by her friends.

title: The Drill
text: [Barely misses another fire blast.] Whoa!

title: The Drill
text: Wow, Azula, you were right! It is the Avatar! [Cut to a close-up of Ty Lee; she smiles flirtatiously at Sokka.] ... and friends.

title: The Drill
text: [Smiles and waves.] Hey.

title: The Drill
text: Katara approaches her brother and drags him away, clearly annoyed. Ty Lee swings herself forward toward Aang who quickly airbends her away. The trio escape the scene and race through the drill's hallways. They come to an intersection.

title: The Drill
text: Guys, get out of here. I know what I need to do.

title: The Drill
text: Wait. [Throws him her water skin.] You need this water more than I do!

title: The Drill
text: Aang catches the water skin and starts running again. Azula and her team reach the intersection.

title: The Drill
text: Follow them! The Avatar's mine!

title: The Drill
text: Mai and Ty Lee begin chasing Katara and Sokka while Azula chases after Aang. Meanwhile, the two siblings have arrived at the end of the hallway where there is a closed hatch.

title: The Drill
text: [Reads a sign nearby, while Sokka struggles to open the hatch.] Slurry pipeline? What does that mean?

title: The Drill
text: [Having successfully opened hatch which leads to a canal channeling slurry.] It's rock and water mixed together. It means our way out!

title: The Drill
text: The two begin descending into the pipe when Mai and Ty Lee arrive. They manage to escape into the canal just as a flurry of daggers is sent their way. The camera cuts to a shot of them floating through the slurry. Mai and Ty Lee run over and peer into the pipeline.

title: The Drill
text: [Holds her hands over the slurry.] Ugh, disgusting!

title: The Drill
text: C'mon! You heard Azula. We have to follow them!

title: The Drill
text: She can shoot all the lightning she wants at me. I am not going in that wall sludge juice. [Shivers in disgust.]

title: The Drill
text: Ty Lee shrugs and leaps through the pipeline into the slurry. Mai shudders with a final expression of disgust and closes the hatch. The scene cuts to where Aang races past several engineers through the drill. The camera cuts to the rear of the drill where a flood of slurry is continually being released. Katara and Sokka slide through the slurry onto the ground with Ty Lee following them in hot pursuit. Katara uses waterbending to stop the flow of slurry and plug up the back entrance of the drill, thus trapping Ty Lee.

title: The Drill
text: [Hatefully and tauntingly.] Why don't you try blocking my chi now, circus freak?

title: The Drill
text: Katara, keep that up. The pressure will build up in the drill. Then when Aang delivers the final blow, it'll be ready to pop!

title: The Drill
text: The scene changes to where Aang and Momo have made their way to the top of the drill.

title: The Drill
text: [Halting.] This looks like a good spot, Momo. [Looks up to find boulders being hurtled down the wall, nearly crushing him. Yelling.] General Sung, tell your soldiers to stop shooting rocks down here!

title: The Drill
text: [Frantically.] Soldiers, whatever you do, don't stop shooting rocks down there!

title: The Drill
text: The soldiers nod and launch another round of rocks toward the drill. Aang leaps out of the way of the oncoming boulders and begins slicing at the hull of the metal using water from Katara's water skin. The scene changes to where Katara continues to hold Ty Lee captive in the slurry.

title: The Drill
text: Good technique, little sister! Keep it up! Don't forget to breathe!

title: The Drill
text: [Irritated.] You know, I'm just about sick and tired of you telling me what to do all day! You're like a chattering hog-monkey!

title: The Drill
text: [Screaming.] Just bend the slurry, woman!

title: The Drill
text: Frustrated, Katara bends a wave of slurry into her brother with her free hand, knocking him down into the foul muck.

title: The Drill
text: [Approaching Katara.] You guys need some help?

title: The Drill
text: Toph, help me plug up this drain.

title: The Drill
text: The two cooperate with each other to bend the slurry, sending Ty Lee farther into the drill and causing the pipes to begin to expand under the pressure. The scene cuts to where Aang continues to slice the metal of the drill.

title: The Drill
text: [Exhausted.] What I'd give to be a metalbender.

title: The Drill
text: Momo suddenly shrieks and Aang deflects a blue fire blast just in time.

title: The Drill
text: [Assuming a fighting stance.] Momo, get out of here!

title: The Drill
text: Azula appears before the Avatar and a battle ensues between the two. Azula shoots fire blasts at Aang, who manages to block them using airbending. She continues the fire attacks only to have each one of her strikes deterred by water whips. She eventually manages to vaporize the water, sending Aang back. The two narrowly dodge the several boulders that are hurtled toward them at that moment. Aang uses earthbending and airbending to send rocks at Azula, who manages to avoid them all. Azula sends another powerful firebending assault that slams Aang into the Outer Wall of Ba Sing Se, leaving him unconscious.

title: The Drill
text: Thanks, Momo. I owe you one. [Runs over to the wedge he sliced in the drill.] Now all I need ... [A boulder falls before him.] Actually, that is what I need for once.

title: The Drill
text: He uses airbending to position the boulder over the X mark in the drill. Using earthbending, he cuts the rock several times, creating a wedge that fits inside the middle of the hole. He begins sprinting toward the wall, scales up its side by riding an air scooter and, once he arrives at his highest point, rockets at lightning speed toward the bottom. As he propels himself downward, Azula catches sight of him and fires at him. She misses by mere seconds and is sent back forcefully as Aang leaps and slams down on the wedge, creating a large ripple effect. The impact of the blow causes the sliced braces inside the drill to collapse and the pipes to burst, releasing a torrent of slurry. Slurry begins to seep from the drill. The scene cuts to Katara and Toph, who remain in their bending stances.

title: The Drill
text: Woohoo!

title: The Drill
text: Here it comes!

title: The Drill
text: She earthbends Katara, Sokka, and herself onto a rock pillar to avoid the flood of slurry. Slurry gushes from the rear of the drill, and Ty Lee slams into the wall of the rock pillar as she is forcefully pushed forwardÂ by the flood. The drill begins to release steam and its segments begin to collapse. On the other side of the wall, the drill is seen coming to a halt.

title: The Drill
text: [Dryly.] We lost.

title: The Drill
text: The scene changes to the train station.

title: The Drill
text: Last call for Ba Sing Se!

title: The Drill
text: Scene shifts to Jet, who is storming toward the train, Longshot and Smellerbee following close behind.

title: The Drill
text: Jet, relax. So the old guy had some hot tea. Big deal.

title: The Drill
text: He heated it himself! [Darkly.] Those guys are firebenders!

title: The Drill
text: Iroh and Zuko board the train, Jet and his groups eying them. Iroh and Zuko seat themselves next to Than and his family. Iroh notices Hope.

title: The Drill
text: What a handsome baby. [Strokes the infant.]

title: The Drill
text: Thank you.

title: The Drill
text: Camera closes up on Hope, who is sleeping. Scene cuts to outside where two earthbenders begin moving the train out of the station. Scene changes to Team Avatar standing at the top of the wall, overlooking the sunset.

title: The Drill
text: I just want to say, good effort out there today, Team Avatar!

title: The Drill
text: [Unamused.] Enough with the Team Avatar stuff. No matter how many times you say it, it's not going to catch on.

title: The Drill
text: How about ... [Pulls out boomerang.] the Boomeraang Squad! See it's good because it's got "Aang" in it. Boomeraang.

title: The Drill
text: [Grins.] I kind of like that one.

title: The Drill
text: [Begins walking away.] Let's talk about this on our way into the city.

title: The Drill
text: The Aang Gang?

title: The Drill
text: Sokka ...

title: The Drill
text: The Fearsome Foursome?

title: The Drill
text: [Also walking away.] You're crazy.

title: The Drill
text: Why? We're fearsome!

title: The Drill
text: He runs after them.

title: The Drill
text: Fades to credits.

title: The Drill
text: Aang

title: City of Walls and Secrets
text: The episode opens to two fox antelopes, grazing on a hill side. They look up at the monorail tracks behind them as a monorail goes past, pushed by two earthbenders. Cut to inside the car where Aang, Katara, Sokka, Toph, and Momo are awaiting their arrival at Ba Sing Se. Katara looks out from the window and notices the Inner Wall of the Earth Kingdom capital drawing closer.

title: City of Walls and Secrets
text: [Excitedly.] Look, the Inner Wall! [Cut to a shot of the monorail approaching the wall. Cut back inside monorail.] I can't believe we finally made it to Ba Sing Se in one piece.

title: City of Walls and Secrets
text: [Slightly skeptically.] Hey, don't jinx it! We can still be attacked by some giant exploding Fire Nation spoon. Or find out the city's been submerged in an ocean full of killer shrimp!

title: City of Walls and Secrets
text: [Slightly annoyed, yet still jokingly.] You been hitting the cactus juice again?

title: City of Walls and Secrets
text: I'm just sayin', weird stuff happens to us.

title: City of Walls and Secrets
text: A man, sucking a corn plant in his mouth, takes a seat between Toph and Sokka, startling them. The scene changes to Aang and Katara looking out the windows, the former closing his eyes sadly.

title: City of Walls and Secrets
text: [Sympathetically.] Don't worry Aang, we'll find Appa.

title: City of Walls and Secrets
text: [Doubtfully.] It's such a big city.

title: City of Walls and Secrets
text: [Somewhat optimistically.] He's a giant bison! Where could someone possibly hide him?

title: City of Walls and Secrets
text: The scene shows the monorail entering the Inner Wall. Cut to Sokka, Katara, and Aang viewing the giant city through the windows.

title: City of Walls and Secrets
text: [Realizing the city's gigantic size.] Oh.

title: City of Walls and Secrets
text: The three notice that Ba Sing Se stretches almost as far as their eyes can see, and it has many roads and buildings. Their train enters the monorail station, stopping there. All of them disembark.

title: City of Walls and Secrets
text: [Sighs.] Back in the city. Great.

title: City of Walls and Secrets
text: [Excitedly.] What's the problem? It's amazing!

title: City of Walls and Secrets
text: [Shot shows Sokka and Toph with Momo resting on her shoulder.] It's just a bunch of walls and rules. You wait, you'll get sick of it in a couple of days.

title: City of Walls and Secrets
text: Scene changes to Aang looking at the bison whistle in his palm, and he blows it.

title: City of Walls and Secrets
text: I'm comin' for ya, buddy. [Katara walks over to the downtrodden Aang, and places her hand on his shoulder. More confidently.] He's here; I can feel it.

title: City of Walls and Secrets
text: The shot changes to the monorail departing, behind the team. Cut to the other side of the track, where there is a woman with long dark hair that billows in the wind. She approaches them with a strange smile on her face.

title: City of Walls and Secrets
text: [Excited.] Hello, my name is Joo Dee! I have been given the great honor of showing the Avatar around Ba Sing Se. And you must be Sokka, Katara, and Toph! Welcome to our wonderful city. Shall we get started?

title: City of Walls and Secrets
text: Yes. We have information about the Fire Nation army that we need to deliver to the Earth King, immediately.

title: City of Walls and Secrets
text: Great! Let's begin our tour. And then I'll show you to your new home here. I think you'll like it!

title: City of Walls and Secrets
text: [Slightly annoyed.] Ugh! [Walks up to Joo Dee.] Maybe you missed what I said. We need to talk to the king about the War, it's important.

title: City of Walls and Secrets
text: [Close-up on Joo Dee's face.] You're in Ba Sing Se now. Everyone is safe here.

title: City of Walls and Secrets
text: Team Avatar has a confused look on their faces regarding Joo Dee's strange statement. Cut to an overhead shot of the area of the city near the wall. An ostrich horse pulls a carriage through the streets. Many shops and refugees line the streets. Cut to a shot of the inside of the carriage containing Joo Dee and Team Avatar.

title: City of Walls and Secrets
text: This is the Lower Ring.

title: City of Walls and Secrets
text: What's that wall for?

title: City of Walls and Secrets
text: Oh, Ba Sing Se has many walls! There are the ones outside protecting us, and the ones inside, that help maintain order. [Shot changes to outside the carriage as the camera pans across some refugees.] This is where our newest arrivals live, as well as our craftsman and artisans, people that work with their hands. [Shot changes back to inside the carriage.] It's so quaint and lively!

title: City of Walls and Secrets
text: Cut to a shot of two men conversing in an alley. One of them is holding a large sword that glistens in the light. Both glare at the carriage as it passes. Cut back to the carriage, where Katara becomes unnerved, her face blanking out, while Momo, who was looking out of the window by hanging from the ceiling, quickly retreats completely into the carriage.

title: City of Walls and Secrets
text: [Nervously.] You do want to watch your step, though.

title: City of Walls and Secrets
text: [Nervous look on her face.] Why do they have all these poor people blocked off in one part of the city?

title: City of Walls and Secrets
text: [Upset and somewhat bored.] This is why I never came here before. I always heard it was so different from the way the monks taught us to live. [Looks out the window.]

title: City of Walls and Secrets
text: The scene changes to another part of the Lower Ring. Cut to Zuko walking down the street. Iroh catches up to him from behind, holding a large vase with several orange flowers placed in it. Cut to a close-up of Zuko staring coldly at the flora and Iroh.

title: City of Walls and Secrets
text: I just want our place to look nice, in case someone brings home a lady friend! [He gives Zuko a nudge with the elbow.]

title: City of Walls and Secrets
text: [Bleakly.] This city is a prison. I don't want to make a life here.

title: City of Walls and Secrets
text: Cut to overhead view of the street they are walking down.

title: City of Walls and Secrets
text: Life happens wherever you are, whether you make it or not. Now come on, I found us some new jobs, and we start this afternoon!

title: City of Walls and Secrets
