text: Aang and Appa fly away. Sokka arrives at the camp, where all the warriors greet him warmly.

title: The Guru
text: Sokka, good to see you.

title: The Guru
text: He looks and sees the main tent. Inside, Hakoda, Sokka's father, is looking at a map with more warriors, including Bato, now with scars on his arm. Bato nudges Hakoda and Hakoda becomes happy upon seeing Sokka.

title: The Guru
text: Sokka.

title: The Guru
text: Hi, Dad.

title: The Guru
text: The two embrace. Back at the Earth King's Royal Palace, the "Kyoshi Warriors", Azula, Mai, and Ty Lee in disguise, sit before King Kuei.

title: The Guru
text: Look Bosco! The Kyoshi Warriors are here to protect us! Aren't you excited? [Bosco yawns.] It's been a difficult week for me. My most trusted advisor, Long Feng, and his Dai Li agents tried to take control of Ba Sing Se from me.

title: The Guru
text: It's terrible when you can't trust the people who are closest to you.

title: The Guru
text: [Pets Bosco.] But there is good news. As we speak, the Council of Five is meeting to plan an invasion of the Fire Nation this summer, on the day of a solar eclipse.

title: The Guru
text: For a second, Azula's eyes slightly widen with shock and worry upon hearing this, but she quickly hides it.

title: The Guru
text: Really? Now that sounds like a fascinating and brilliant plan. [Glances off as Mai and Ty Lee look at each other.]

title: The Guru
text: Cut to the Council of Five meeting, where Katara and Momo are present.

title: The Guru
text: General Fong's base will serve as the launching point for the attack. In exactly two months, the army and navy will invade the Fire Nation on the Day of Black Sun.

title: The Guru
text: Momo jumps on the map and begins knocking over the pieces.

title: The Guru
text: Or we could send in Momo to do some damage! [Chuckles. The Council of Five are unamused.] 'Cause, the ... sorry.

title: The Guru
text: [Uses earthbending to stand the pieces back up, scaring Momo.] All we need is the Earth King's seal in order to execute the plan. [Sends the scroll across the table to Katara.]

title: The Guru
text: I'll get these scrolls to him right away. Thank you, General How.

title: The Guru
text: Aang continues his journey to the Eastern Air Temple. He spots Guru Pathik, who is meditating, and lands Appa.

title: The Guru
text: Uhhh ... hello? You're Guru Pathik, right? [Aang approaches Pathik.] The person who attached the note to Appa's horn?

title: The Guru
text: Indeed. I was a spiritual brother of your people and a personal friend of Monk Gyatso. [Aang looks slightly surprised to hear this.]

title: The Guru
text: In your note, [Aang sits.] you said you could teach me how to gain control of the Avatar State. How?

title: The Guru
text: You must gain balance within yourself, before you can bring balance to the world. And the first step to gaining balance begins with this. [Hands Aang a yellow beverage in a wooden cup.] Drink up!

title: The Guru
text: [Takes it and looks at it. Drinks it and quickly spits it out to his left in disgust.] Uggh! It tastes like onion and banana juice!

title: The Guru
text: That's because it is! [Pathik empties another bowl and holds it over his head.] Yum yum!

title: The Guru
text: Aang blinks in disbelief. Meanwhile, Xin Fu and Master Yu are working to bring Toph back to the Beifong Estate.

title: The Guru
text: I believe we need to go right!

title: The Guru
text: What are you talking about? The Beifong Estate's this way!

title: The Guru
text: I'm quite certain you're mistaken.

title: The Guru
text: [Banging at the cell.] Hey! Can you two old ladies quit your bickering for a second? [Cut to inside the cell.] I got to go to the bathroom!

title: The Guru
text: Oooh ... uhhh, okay, but make it quick! [Getting up with a key in hand.]

title: The Guru
text: [Stopping Yu.] What's wrong with you?

title: The Guru
text: Ooh, very sneaky Toph! Nice try, but you can't trick me! [Sits down.]

title: The Guru
text: Let me out of here so I can kick both your butts!

title: The Guru
text: Quit your banging! [Bangs the metal box.] You might think you're the greatest earthbender in the world, but even you can't bend metal!

title: The Guru
text: Toph looks sad as she places her hand on a side of the metal box. The scene cuts to that night, and where Azula, Mai and Ty Lee are staying which is a small building in the Upper Ring. Mai and Ty Lee are removing their make-up. A smiling Ty Lee is looking in a mirror. She is wiping the last traces of her Kyoshi makeup from her face. Mai is seated next to Ty Lee, still working on her own face.

title: The Guru
text: We have been presented with an extraordinary opportunity, girls.

title: The Guru
text: Mai finally gets to wear make-up that's not totally depressing? [Azula walks past toward a window.]

title: The Guru
text: [With large, dark splotches of black makeup dripping down her eyes; Sarcastically.] Ha, ha.

title: The Guru
text: I'm talking about conquering the whole Earth Kingdom. [The two girls turn with shocked looks.] For one hundred years, the Fire Nation has hammered away at Ba Sing Se from the outside. [Walks away from the girls and smirks while looking out of a window.]Â But now we're on the inside, and we can take it by ourselves.

title: The Guru
text: [Admiringly.] Gosh, you're so confident. I really admire that about you.

title: The Guru
text: From the inside, we're in perfect position to organize a coup and overthrow the Earth King. The key is the Dai Li. Whoever controls the Dai Li [Turns back into the room.] controls Ba Sing Se.

title: The Guru
text: Back to the Eastern Air Temple at a creek.

title: The Guru
text: In order to master the Avatar State, you must open all the chakras. Aang, tell me everything you know about chakras.

title: The Guru
text: [Rubs eyes.] What are chakras?

title: The Guru
text: [Disappointedly.] Oh, I see. I guess we'll start with the basics. [As he explains he points to the water and the moss within.] The water flows through this creek, much like the energy flows through your body. As you see, there are several pools where the water swirls around before flowing on. These pools are like our chakras.

title: The Guru
text: So chakras are pools of spiraling energy in our bodies?

title: The Guru
text: Exactly. If nothing else were around, this creek would flow pure and clear. However, life is messy, and things tend to fall in the creek. And then what happens?

title: The Guru
text: The creek can't flow?

title: The Guru
text: Yes. But, if we open the ponds between the pools ... [He removes moss blocking the exit for the water.]

title: The Guru
text: The energy flows! [The water that was blocked by the moss becomes clear. Aang and Pathik smile at each other.]

title: The Guru
text: In another part of the temple, a cavern.

title: The Guru
text: There are seven chakras that go up the body. Each pool of energy has a purpose, and can be blocked by a specific kind of emotional muck. Be warned, opening the chakras is an intense experience, and once you begin the process, you cannot stop until all seven are open. Are you ready?

title: The Guru
text: [Momentarily looks down.] I'll do whatever it takes.

title: The Guru
text: First we will open the Earth Chakra, located at the base of the spine. It deals with survival, and is blocked by fear. What are you most afraid of? Let your fears become clear to you.

title: The Guru
text: Aang sees images of things that cause him great fear, including the Blue Spirit attacking him, General Fong sinking Katara into the ground, himself merging with La at the North Pole, Fire Lord Ozai, and Sozin's Comet, which make him scream.

title: The Guru
text: Aang, your vision is not real. You are concerned for your survival, but you must surrender those fears. Let your fears flow down the creek. [Aang clears the image away.] You have opened your Earth Chakra! [Aang wipes sweat off his forehead.]

title: The Guru
text: Later, behind a waterfall.

title: The Guru
text: Next is the ...

title: The Guru
text: Water Chakra?

title: The Guru
text: Brilliant! Maybe one day you will be a guru too! This chakra deals with pleasure and is blocked by guilt. Now, look at all the guilt with burdens you so. What do you blame yourself for?

title: The Guru
text: [Sees the image of him leaving home.] I ran away. [Sees images of him in the Avatar State at General Fong's base.] I hurt all of those people.

title: The Guru
text: Accept the reality that these things happened, but do not let them cloud and poison your energy. If you are to be a positive influence on the world, you need to forgive yourself. [Aang takes a deep, focused breath, opening his Water Chakra.]

title: The Guru
text: Scene cuts to the next day at the Water Tribe camp.

title: The Guru
text: This bay leads directly to the outskirts of Ba Sing Se. We've been using these tangle mines to stop the Fire Nation ships from getting through.

title: The Guru
text: [Filling the mine with skunk fish and seaweed before moving away.] Your father invented tangle mines himself.

title: The Guru
text: Destructive? Buoyant? And ... [Sniffs and immediately becomes disgusted.] Aggh, ehhh! Terrible smelling!

title: The Guru
text: Very perceptive. The mines are filled with skunk fish and seaweed. When a ship detonates the mine, the seaweed tangles up the propeller and the foul smell forces people to abandon the ship. I call it the "stink and sink."

title: The Guru
text: [Laughs.] Good one, Dad!

title: The Guru
text: [Nearby, unamused.] You're definitely your father's son.

title: The Guru
text: [Approaching.] Hakoda, our scouts have spotted four Fire Nation ships!

title: The Guru
text: Bato, get these mines loaded up! The rest of you men, prepare for battle!

title: The Guru
text: The warriors run off to prepare as Sokka looks around before looking back to his father.

title: The Guru
text: Uhhh ... what should I do, Dad?

title: The Guru
text: Aren't you listening? I said, "The rest of you men, get ready for battle".

title: The Guru
text: Sokka smiles, nods, and departs. Hakoda smiles proudly. Back in Ba Sing Se, at the Jasmine Dragon. Zuko and Iroh observe the happenings standing at the back.

title: The Guru
text: Who thought when we came to this city as refugees, that I'd end up owning my own tea shop? Follow your passion, Zuko, and life will reward you.

title: The Guru
text: Congratulations, Uncle.

title: The Guru
text: I am very thankful.

title: The Guru
text: You deserve it. The Jasmine Dragon will be the best tea shop in the city.

title: The Guru
text: No. I'm thankful because you decided to share this special day with me. It means more than you know. [The two embrace.]

title: The Guru
text: Now let's make these people some tea! [Walks away to the back.]

title: The Guru
text: [Overjoyed.] Yes, let's make some tea!

title: The Guru
text: Back to the Eastern Air Temple, Aang and Pathik sit on a ledge.

title: The Guru
text: Third is the Fire Chakra, located in the stomach.

title: The Guru
text: [Holding his stomach.] My Fire Chakra would like to eat something other than onion-banana juice.

title: The Guru
text: [Chuckles.] Good one! Moving on. This chakra deals with willpower, and is blocked by shame. What are you ashamed of? [Cuts to Aang's vision of his first attempt at firebending, which resulted in him accidentally burning Katara's hands.] What are your biggest disappointments in yourself?

title: The Guru
text: I'm never going to firebend again. I can't.

title: The Guru
text: You will never find balance if you deny this part of your life. You are the Avatar and therefore, you are a firebender. [Aang breathes deeply.] Hmmm ... that chakra opened less like a flowing creek, and more like a ... burping bison.

title: The Guru
text: [Loud belch.] Tastes like onions and bananas, but strangely something else. Pickles? [Pathik shrugs, and hums as if to say "I don't know".]

title: The Guru
text: Back at the palace, two Dai Li agents hide on two pillars and secretly spy on a conversation between Mai and Ty Lee. The former is sitting on the stairs and the latter is practicing chi blocking and acrobatics.

title: The Guru
text: [Sighs.] I'm tired of wearing this girly disguise. I don't know how anyone could fight in this.

title: The Guru
text: Maybe that's why it was so easy to beat the Kyoshi Warriors and take their clothes. [Punches the air, imitating her chi blocking.]

title: The Guru
text: How much longer do we have to serve the Earth King? If I have to clean up one more pile of bear poop, I'm going to throw up.

title: The Guru
text: [Walks on her hands.] Princess Azula promised we would go back to the Fire Nation as soon as we captured the Avatar. We just have to be patient.

title: The Guru
text: [Stands up.] Shush up! Do you want the whole palace to know we're Fire Nation?

title: The Guru
text: Sorry!

title: The Guru
text: The agents smile and climb away. Azula, who was hiding behind another pillar, walks up to them.

title: The Guru
text: Good work, girls. I'm sure the Dai Li will deliver the message.

title: The Guru
text: Back at the Air Temple.

title: The Guru
text: The fourth chakra is located in the heart. It deals with love and is blocked by grief. [Aang smiles and looks at a Air Nomad statue nearby before looking sad.] Lay all your grief out in front of you.

title: The Guru
text: Aang sees images of many airbenders, including Gyatso and Yangchen. He smiles upon seeing them, but becomes saddened as they start to vanish into smoke.

title: The Guru
text: You have indeed felt a great loss. [The airbenders appear floating in the clouds.] But love is a form of energy, and it swirls all around us. [Aang is lifted into the air and sees the Air Nomads floating in the smoke.] The Air Nomads' love for you has not left this world. It is still inside of your heart, and is reborn in the form of new love.

title: The Guru
text: The smoke in front of Aang forms a face and shows the first thing he saw upon waking up from his iceberg: Katara. Back in the real world, Aang is starting to cry tears of joy.

title: The Guru
text: Let the pain flow away. [Aang wipes away his tears.] Very good.

title: The Guru
text: [Choking up.] Can I have some onion-banana juice, please?

title: The Guru
text: Inside another part of the temple.

title: The Guru
text: The fifth in the chain is the Sound Chakra, located in the throat. It deals with truth and is blocked by lies. The ones we tell ourselves.

title: The Guru
text: Aang flashes back to when he, Katara, and Sokka first began their journey to the North Pole.

title: The Guru
text: Why didn't you tell us you were the Avatar?

title: The Guru
text: Back to the real world, Aang finds himself answering the question.

title: The Guru
text: Because I never wanted to be.

title: The Guru
text: You cannot lie about your own nature. You must accept that you are the Avatar. [Aang inhales and, seeing an image of himself on a cliff looking down at the ground, exhales, and accepts his nature.] Very good, Aang. You have opened the chakra of truth.

title: The Guru
text: Outside the temple interior.

title: The Guru
text: The sixth pool of energy is the light chakra, located in the center of the forehead. It deals with insight and is blocked by illusion. The greatest illusion of this world is the illusion of separation. Things you think are separate and different are actually one in the same.

title: The Guru
text: [An image is shown of the world, with the four nations' territories marked.] Like the four nations.

title: The Guru
text: [The image changes so the territories become the same color.] Yes. We are all one people, [The territories become separate again.] but we live as if divided.

title: The Guru
text: We're all connected. Everything is connected.

title: The Guru
text: That's right! Even the separation of the four elements is an illusion. If you open your mind, you will see that all the elements are one. Four parts of the same whole. Even metal is just a part of earth that has been purified and refined.

title: The Guru
text: As Pathik speaks, the camera fades to Xin Fu and Yu trying to take Toph home. She feels around the metal cage with seismic sense and feels tiny particles of earth in the metal. She smiles, exhales deeply and begins to push against the metal.

title: The Guru
text: [Struggling.] Come on, metal. Budge! [She punches a hole in the metal and shakes her hand in pain.] Wooo! Toph, you rule.

title: The Guru
text: She takes another punch as we cut back to Ba Sing Se. Katara walks by the Jasmine Dragon.

title: The Guru
text: What do you say, Momo? A cup of tea before we get back to the king? [Arrives at the shop.] Table for two, please.

title: The Guru
text: Uncle! I need two jasmine, one green, and one lychee!

title: The Guru
text: I'm brewing as fast as I can!

title: The Guru
text: Katara notices Zuko and Iroh. Stunned, she runs away from the shop.

title: The Guru
text: The scene returns to Aang and Pathik, who sit at the top of the temple at night.

title: The Guru
text: This is the last chakra, isn't it?

title: The Guru
text: Yes. Once you open this chakra, you will be able to go in and out of the Avatar State at will and when you are in the Avatar State, you will have complete control and awareness of all your actions.

title: The Guru
text: [Smiles with determination.] Let's do this.

title: The Guru
text: The Thought Chakra is located at the crown of the head. It deals with pure cosmic energy, and is blocked by earthly attachment. Meditate on what attaches you to this world. [Images of Katara appear before Aang.] Now, let all of those attachments go. Let them flow down the river, forgotten.

title: The Guru
text: [Coming out of his meditation.] What? Why would I let go of Katara? I ... I love her!

title: The Guru
text: Learn to let her go, or you cannot let the pure cosmic energy flow in from the universe.

title: The Guru
text: Why would I choose cosmic energy over Katara? [Aang throws his hands up.] How could it be a bad thing that I feel an attachment to her? Three chakras ago that was a good thing!

title: The Guru
text: You must learn to let go. [Aang contemplates worriedly.]

title: The Guru
text: Back at the palace, Katara runs to inform the Earth King, only to encounter the "Kyoshi Warriors".

title: The Guru
text: Thank goodness you're here, Suki. Something terrible is going on. The Fire Nation has infiltrated the city, I just saw Prince Zuko and his uncle! [Azula widens her eyes in surprise and smiles slyly.] We have to tell the Earth King right away!

title: The Guru
text: Oh, don't worry, I'll be sure to let him know.

title: The Guru
text: Katara notices "Suki" has gold eyes and is shocked upon realization that the "Kyoshi Warriors" are actually Azula, Mai, and Ty Lee. She prepares to attack, but Ty Lee quickly jumps forward and blocks her chi.

title: The Guru
text: [While the three girls gather around the fallen Katara; pans to camera looking up to the three girls.] So, Zuzu's in the city, too? I think it's time for a family reunion. [Momo flies off.]

title: The Guru
text: Back at the temple.

title: The Guru
text: I'm sorry, but I can't let go of Katara.

title: The Guru
text: Aang, to master the Avatar State, you must open all the chakras. Surrender yourself.

title: The Guru
text: Okay, I'll try.

title: The Guru
text: Now think of your attachments and let them go. Let the pure cosmic energy flow.

title: The Guru
text: Aang sees an image of him letting Katara go, and a bridge that will lead him to Avatar State mastery. His image looks down, smiles at the bridge, and walks up to the Avatar Spirit, which is an enlarged image of himself in the Avatar State. The Avatar Spirit is holding a ball of energy, and AangÂ walks directly inside of it. As he does so, his tatooes glow, and he closes his eyes. Right before he is able to completely open the final chakra and master the Avatar State, however, he hears a shriek from Katara and sees a vision of her in chains. At this, he jumps out of the energy sphere and runs away from the Avatar Spirit. The energy bridge that lead him there slowly vanishes behind him until it catches up and falls from underneath him, causing his image to plummet toward Earth. This cuts his connection to the Avatar State, which forces him back to reality.

title: The Guru
text: Katara's in danger! I have to go! [Prepares to exit.]

title: The Guru
text: No, Aang! By choosing attachment, you have locked the chakra! If you leave now, you won't be able to go into the Avatar State at all!

title: The Guru
text: Aang hesitates but leaves anyway, leaving Pathik concerned and disappointed. Meanwhile, the journey to take Toph back to her home is stopped when Xin Fu and Yu hear a loud noise. They go to investigate, and notice a hole in the cage and that Toph is gone.

title: The Guru
text: It's another one her tricks!

title: The Guru
text: There's a giant hole in the box! How is that a trick!?

title: The Guru
text: [From behind them.] It's not! It's the real deal!

title: The Guru
text: She earthbends the two men together, throws them in the cage, and metalbends the cage shut.

title: The Guru
text: [Jumps on top of the box.] I am the greatest earthbender in the world! Don't you two dunderheads ever forget it! [Stomps on the box and exits using earth surfing.]

title: The Guru
text: [Inside the box.] I'm going to be stuck in here forever with you, aren't I?

title: The Guru
text: I have to go the bathroom. [Xin Fu groans and slams his head against the box.]

title: The Guru
text: Back at the Water Tribe camp, Hakoda approaches Sokka.

title: The Guru
text: Ready to go knock some Fire Nation heads?

title: The Guru
text: You don't know how much this means to me, Dad. I'll make you proud and I'll finally prove to you what a great warrior I am.

title: The Guru
text: [Placing his hand on Sokka's shoulder.] Sokka, you don't have to prove anything to me. I'm already proud of you and I've always known you're a great warrior.

title: The Guru
text: Really?

title: The Guru
text: Why do you think I trusted you to look after our tribe when I left?

title: The Guru
text: Just as the two are boarding the ship, Aang and Appa appear. Aang shows a clear look of concern.

title: The Guru
text: This can't be good news.

title: The Guru
text: Aang and Sokka depart. Just as they're leaving, Sokka looks back at Hakoda, who looks back and grins. Back in Ba Sing Se, Azula is led into a prison by two Dai Li agents. She is taken to Long Feng's cell.

title: The Guru
text: What is this about? Your agents show up in the middle of the night and drag me down here? You will not treat a Kyoshi Warrior this way!

title: The Guru
text: But you're not a Kyoshi Warrior, are you, [Standing.] Princess Azula of the Fire Nation?

title: The Guru
text: What do you want?

title: The Guru
text: I want to make a deal. It's time that I regain control of Ba Sing Se and you have something I need.

title: The Guru
text: Oh?

title: The Guru
text: The Earth King's trust.

title: The Guru
text: Why should I help you?

title: The Guru
text: Because I can get you the Avatar.

title: The Guru
text: [Smirks.] I'm listening ...

title: The Guru
text: Long Feng smiles. Back at the Jasmine Dragon, a royal messenger enters.

title: The Guru
text: A message from the Royal Palace.

title: The Guru
text: [Reads through, becomes shocked, and smiles.] I ... I can't believe it!

title: The Guru
text: What is it, Uncle?

title: The Guru
text: [Excited.] Great news! We've been invited to serve tea to the Earth King! [Runs off.]

title: The Guru
text: Zuko smiles as he continues sweeping. Back in the prison hold, the door to Long Feng's cell is closed. Azula leaves Long Feng's presence and gives a smirk. Fade to credits.

title: The Guru
text: Aang

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Ostrich horses are drinking water from a river as Appa, Aang, and Sokka fly over them.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: So, what kind of trouble is Katara in?

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: I don't know. In my vision, I just knew she needed help.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: It would be nice if your Avatar powers could be just a little more specific from time to time. [He looks down and notices a mound of earth passing nearby, heading to the wall.] What is that?

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: They fly down and follow the mound. Toph is seen still earth surfing. Aang and Sokka come down beside her.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Need a ride?

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Toph becomes startled at the sound of Sokka's voice and falls backward off of the mound. Sokka and Aang cringe upon seeing her fall. Scene changes to Azula speaking to the Dai Li.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: [While pacing back and forth.] The Earth King and the Council of Five do not trust the Dai Li. They imprisoned your leader, Long Feng. Soon they will turn on all of you and eliminate you. Seizing power today is a matter of life and death. [As she talks, an agent with a mustache starts looking nervous and slightly lowers his head.] This coup must be swift and decisive. The Earth King and each of the five generals must be taken out simultaneously. Long Feng has placed you in my command while we overthrow the government. [Walks over to her left, to another agent with a tiny, vertical scar on his right cheek. When she nears him, she stares sideways at the agent while still addressing all the agents.] If I sense any disloyalty, any hesitation, any weakness at all, [She stops right in front of the scarred agent.] I will snuff it out. [She continues walking, with the eyes of the now nervous scarred agent following her.] That is all.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: The Dai Li leave, and Azula walks up to Ty Lee, who is pouring tea.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Nice speech, Azula. It was pretty and poetic, but also scary in a good way. [She hands the cup to Azula. Camera pans over to a close-up of Mai.]

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: [Amused.] Yeah. I thought you were going to make that one guy pee his pants.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: There are still a few loose ends. The Avatar, and my brother and uncle.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Scene fades to outside the Royal Palace, where Zuko and Iroh begin walking toward it.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Many times I imagined myself here, at the threshold of the palace. [Camera pans to show the Earth Kingdom Emblem above the palace doors.] But I always thought I would be here as a conqueror. Instead, we are the Earth King's personal guests, here to serve him tea. Destiny is a funny thing.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: It sure is, Uncle.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Scene changes back to Appa, Toph, Aang, and Sokka still flying back to the Palace. Toph is seen holding onto Sokka's arm so she does not fall.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: So how did it go with the guru? Did you master the Avatar State?

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Uh ...

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Aang looks down and thinks back to what Guru Pathik said before he left.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: If you leave now, you won't be able to go into the Avatar State at all!

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Fades back to the present.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Aang, are you okay?

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: I'm great! It went great with the guru. I completely mastered the Avatar State. [He laughs nervously and looks down.] Yeah.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Scene changes back to the Royal Palace, where Zuko and Iroh are sitting at a table in a room, waiting for the Earth King. Iroh pours some tea into a cup.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: What's taking so long?

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Maybe the Earth King overslept.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Dai Li agents begin to circle around the two.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Something's not right.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Azula walks past the Dai Li and comes in front of her brother outside the circle of Dai Li agents.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: It's tea time!

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: [He quickly stands up.] Azula!

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Have you met the Dai Li? They're earthbenders, but they have a killer instinct that's so firebender. I just love it.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Camera pans over to show Iroh picking up his cup of tea.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Did I ever tell you how I got the nickname "The Dragon of the West"?

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: I'm not interested in a lengthy anecdote, Uncle. [She looks at her nails condescendingly.]

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: It's more of a demonstration, really.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Iroh begins drinking his tea. Zuko looks over at him and smiles before going behind him. Iroh begins breathing fire. Cut to a corridor outside the room as a fire blast makes a hole in the wall, allowing Iroh and Zuko to escape. The Dai Li agents begin shooting some rock gloves at them, but miss as Zuko and Iroh turn around the corner. Iroh generates lightning and destroys the wall in front before jumping down, yelling, into a bush below. Zuko stops at the edge.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Come on! You'll be fine!

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: No! I'm tired of running! It's time I faced Azula!

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Zuko turns around and walks back. Iroh smacks his head upon hearing this and runs away.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: You're so dramatic. What? Are you going to challenge me to an Agni Kai?

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Yes! I challenge you!

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: No thanks.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Zuko shoots a fire blast toward her, but two Dai Li agents intervene and pull up a section of the floor, making a wall. They shoot some rock gloves at Zuko's feet, making him lose his balance. He puts his right hand down, but another rock glove traps that one. Azula turns around smiling and walks away as the agents capture him. Scene changes to inside the throne room, where Sokka, Toph, and Aang confront Kuei.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Katara's fine. You have nothing to worry about.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: But, in my vision, I felt so sure she was in trouble.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Well, she met with the Council of Generals to plan the invasion, and since then, she been off with your friends, the Kyoshi Warriors.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: See, Aang? She's with Suki. They're probably back at our apartment right now talking about make-up or something.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Okay. Maybe you're right.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Believe me, if there was any danger at all, Bosco's animal instincts would sense it.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Bosco lifts up his head from sleeping to look at the three. Scene changes to inside the Crystal Catacombs, where Katara is pacing back and forth. She stops pacing upon hearing a hole open up above.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: You've got company.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: He throws Zuko in, who rolls down and lands in front of Katara.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Zuko!

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Katara's shocked face becomes an angry one as Zuko sits up, looking back at her with surprise, and the hole closes behind him. The scene changes to Toph, Aang, and Sokka reaching their house on Appa. The three jump off and run inside to see if Katara was in there. Momo runs up to them.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Momo!

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Momo climbs up Aang onto his shoulders. Toph looks around.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: There's no one else here.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Katara is in trouble! I knew it!

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Oh, no!

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Wait! Someone's at the door. [Someone knocks on the door a second later.] Actually, I know who it is. It's an old friend of mine. [She walks over to the door and opens it, showing Iroh behind the door.] Glad to see you're okay.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: I need your help.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Sokka and Aang become shocked and angry upon seeing him, and get into a fighting stance. Toph calmly smiles and waves at him. Momo flies away upon seeing him.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: You guys know each other?

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: I met him in the woods once and knocked him down. [Iroh smiles sheepishly and rubs the back of his head.]Â Then he gave me some tea and some very good advice.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: May I come in? [Toph nods, and he walks in before turning to the group.] Princess Azula is here in Ba Sing Se.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: She must have Katara.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: She has captured my nephew as well.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Then we'll work together to fight Azula, and save Katara and Zuko.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: [Approaching Aang and pointing at him.] Whoa there! You lost me at "Zuko".

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: I know how you must feel about my nephew. [Moving forward to place his hands on Sokka's shoulders.] But believe me when I tell you that there is good inside him.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: [Pushing Iroh away.] "Good inside him" isn't enough! Why don't you come back when it's outside him too, okay?

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Katara's in trouble. All of Ba Sing Se is in trouble. Working together is our best chance.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Sokka understands, and nods. Iroh begins walking back to the door.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: I brought someone along who might help us.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: They all walk outside. Toph puts a couple earth pillars around the nervous Dai Li agent and makes him stand up. Iroh walks over to him and takes the gag off his mouth, revealing this to be the scarred agent.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Azula and Long Feng are plotting a coup! They're going to overthrow the Earth King!

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: My sister! Where are they keeping Katara?

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: In the Crystal Catacombs of Old Ba Sing Se, deep beneath the palace.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Iroh, Aang, Toph, and Sokka run away to help Katara and the Earth King, leaving the captured agent bound. Scene fades to the jail where Long Feng is. He meditates in his cell while a Dai Li agent informs him of what is going on.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: The movements of the Earth King and all the generals have been plotted out step-by-step.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Good. And the Fire Nation princess is cooperating?

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Oh, yes. More than cooperating. She's really taken charge. She's terrifying and inspirational at the same time. It's hard to explain.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: The Dai Li agent walks away. Scene changes to inside the Crystal Catacombs, where Katara is yelling at Zuko, who sits with his back turned.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Why did they throw you in here? [Zuko says nothing.] Oh, wait, let me guess. It's a trap. So that when Aang shows up to help me, you can finally have him in your little Fire Nation clutches!

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Zuko turns his head to look at her, turns back, and looks at the ground again.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: [Continuing to lament.] You're a terrible person! You know that? Always following us! Hunting the Avatar! Trying to capture the world's last hope for peace! But what do you care? You're the Fire Lord's son. Spreading war and violence and hatred is in your blood!

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: [Looks back at her.] You don't know what you're talking about!

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: [Angrily.] I don't? How dare you! You have no idea what this war has put me through! [Sits down.] Me personally! [She sits down and touches her necklace, begins to cry.] The Fire Nation took my mother away from me.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: [He turns around to face Katara.] I'm sorry. [Pauses. Katara is now sobbing.] That's something we have in common.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Katara looks back, surprised, and wipes away the tears from her eyes. The scene changes to Toph feeling the ground below, finding the Crystal Catacombs.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Well, what'd you know? There is an ancient city down there. But it's deep.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: She makes a tunnel through the ground, beginning to lead to the catacombs. Sokka is seen thinking of a plan.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: We should split up. Aang, you go with Iroh to look for Katara and the angry jerk, [Remembers Iroh is there and places his left hand on Iroh's right shoulder.] no offense.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: [Shrugging.] None taken.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: And I'll go with Toph to warn the Earth King of Azula's coup.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Aang and Iroh are seen walking through the tunnel down to the Catacombs. Iroh is bending a small fire for light, and Aang is earthbending the way down.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: So, Toph thinks you give pretty good advice, and great tea!

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: The key to both is proper aging. What's on your mind?

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Aang earthbends again before replying.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Well, I met with this guru who was supposed to help me master the Avatar State and control this great power, but to do it, I had to let go of someone I love. [He and Iroh stop.] And I just couldn't.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Perfection and power are overrated. I think you were very wise to choose happiness and love.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: [Earthbends again.] What happens if we can't save anyone and beat Azula? Without the Avatar State,Â what if I'm not powerful enough?

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: I don't know the answer. Sometimes, life is like this dark tunnel. You can't always see the light at the end of the tunnel, but if you just keep moving, [Aang earthbends the rocks away one last time. Iroh's fire blows out. He smiles.] you will come to a better place.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Camera pans over a large area of the Catacombs. Scene changes to Toph and Sokka climbing the stairs, with Momo flying behind them.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: There's General How!

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Sokka puts his arm out in front of Toph and pulls her behind a pillar. General How continues walking toward the stairs. The Dai Li agents can be seen hiding beside the pillars before putting cuffs on his wrists and pulling him down to his knees. Another agent drops in front of How.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: What's going on here?!

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: You're under house arrest.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: The coup is happening right now! We've gotta warn the Earth King!

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Sokka, Toph, and Momo run to head to the Earth King. One of the generals is seen walking when some chains fly up and trap him. General Sung is taken by some chains into a dark area. Two other generals are seen in their headquarters when the Dai Li toss some chains to circle around their legs and pull them up. Scene changes to the throne room, where Toph, Sokka, and Momo have just reached the Earth King.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Thank goodness we're in time!

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: In time for what?

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Yeah. What are you in time for, [Cartwheels to Sokka, standing just inches from his face.] cutie?

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: [He begins to sweat and places his hand behind his head in discomfort. Nervously.] Uh, I'm kinda involved with Suki.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Who?

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Toph knocks her away from Sokka with earthbending, in which she flips up above them.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: They're not the real Kyoshi Warriors!

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Kuei gasps, surprised.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: [Sarcastically.] Sorry to disappoint you.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: She shoots some of her daggers at Toph, who uses an earth shield to stop them, and kicks the shield to Mai, who jumps over it. However, just as Mai lands, Toph brings up another pillar, knocking Mai over. Toph smiles confidently. Ty Lee comes up in front of Sokka, laughing. She starts trying to jab him, but he evades all of them.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Oooh, it's like we're dancing together!

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Azula is seen holding Kuei at flame-point.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: [Gravely.] This fight is over.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Toph and Sokka surrender, and Ty Lee chi blocks them. Momo tries flying away, but a Dai Li agent traps him with a rock glove. Azula shoves Kuei down the steps leading to his throne.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Get them all out of my sight.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Toph, Sokka, Kuei, and Bosco are all taken to prison. Long Feng walks into the room, looking grim, with some Dai Li agents behind him.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Now comes the part where I double cross you. Dai Li, arrest the Fire Nation princess! [None of the Dai Li agents move, to Long Feng's disappointment.] I said arrest her! [Short pause. They still do nothing.]Â What is wrong with you?!

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: It's because they haven't made up their minds. [Long Feng snaps his head toward Azula.]Â They're waiting to see how this is going to end.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: What are you talking about?

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: I can see your whole history in your eyes. You were born with nothing, so you've had to struggle, and connive, and claw your way to power. But true power, the divine right to rule, is something you're born with. The fact is, they don't know which one of us is going to be sitting on that throne, and which one is going to be bowing down. [Long Feng looks worried.] But I know, and you know. [She sits down on the throne and crosses her legs.] Well?

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: [His worried look turns into fright, then into a look of submission. He walks up and bows to her.] You've beaten me at my own game.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Don't flatter yourself! You were never even a player.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: The scene changes to Zuko and Katara in the Crystal Catacombs.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: [Apologetic.] I'm sorry I yelled at you before.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: It doesn't matter.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: It's just that for so long now, whenever I would imagine the face of the enemy, it was your face.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: My face? I see. [He touches his scar.]

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: No, no, that's-that's not what I mean. [Approaches Zuko.]

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: It's okay. I used to think this scar marked me. The mark of the banished prince, cursed to chase the Avatar forever. But lately, I've realized I'm free to determine my own destiny, even if I'll never be free of my mark.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Maybe you could be free of it.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: What?

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: I have healing abilities.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: It's a scar, it can't be healed.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: [Holds up a vial.] This is water from the Spirit Oasis at the North Pole. It has special properties, so I've been saving it for something important. [Moves in front of Zuko.] I don't know if it would work, but ...

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Katara puts one hand on Zuko's scar. Zuko closes his eyes, only to be interrupted by Aang and Iroh.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Aang!

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Aang looks surprised at seeing Zuko alone with Katara. As Katara hugs him, he briefly smiles at her, then looks over Katara's shoulder to glare at Zuko. Cut to Zuko, who gets a hug from Iroh, and glares back.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Aang, I knew you would come. [She hugs Aang again.]

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Uncle, I don't understand. What are you doing with the Avatar? [Points to Aang.]

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Saving you, that's what.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Zuko growls and takes one confrontational step in Aang's direction, but Iroh stops him.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Zuko, it's time we talked. [To Aang and Katara.] Go help you other friends. We'll catch up with you. [They walk away, Katara looks back at Zuko, who is looking sadly to the side, before moving on.]

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: [Hurt.] Why, Uncle?

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: You're not the man you used to be, Zuko. [Smiles.] You are stronger and wiser and freer than you have ever been. And now you have come to the crossroads of your destiny. [Close-up to Zuko's face.] It's time for you to choose. It's time for you to choose good.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: As Zuko contemplates what his uncle is telling him, he yells as crystals grow to encase Iroh. He assumes a fighting position to prepare for the intruders. A different shot shows Azula along with two Dai Li agents sliding down from the sides of the chamber.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: I expected this kind of treachery from Uncle. [Cut to Iroh, still trapped in crystals. Cut to a side shot, where Zuko protects his uncle.] But Zuko, Prince Zuko, you're a lot of things, but you're not a traitor, are you?

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Release him immediately.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: It's not too late for you, Zuko. You can still redeem yourself.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: [To Zuko.] The kind of redemption she offers is not for you.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Why don't you let him decide, Uncle? [To Zuko.] I need you, Zuko. I've plotted every move of this day, [Makes a fist.] this glorious day in Fire Nation history, and the only way we win is together. At the end of this day, you will have your honor back. You will have Father's love. You will have everything you want.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Zuko, I am begging you. [Close-up of Zuko's face as he focuses from Azula back to Iroh.]Â Look into your heart and see what it is that you truly want. [Zuko resumes contemplating.]

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: You are free to choose.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: She gestures at the two Dai Li agents to leave, who earthbend themselves out. Azula leaves to follow Aang and Katara. The camera cuts to Zuko multiple times as he contemplates his choice. He drops his head. Cut to Aang and Katara running through the Crystal Catacombs.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: We've got to find Sokka and Toph.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: An intense shot of blue fire attacks them from behind. Aang stops it using earthbending, but the impact forces him backward a few steps. The camera zooms back toward Azula, the source of the blast, with smoke trailing from her fingertips. Katara uses waterbending to stop another attack, then sends a wave crashing toward Azula, who vaporizes the water with firebending. The mist from the vaporized water allows Azula to jump onto a crystal and firebend two blasts of blue fire. Together, Aang and Katara use waterbending to stop the blasts. Azula finishes her jump by landing on a rock pillar. Aang uses earthbending on the pillar, and Azula gasps once she notices the pillar crumbling. She jumps off and lands between Katara and Aang. She points at both of them, preparing to attack or defend herself.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: See any Dai Li agents nearby?

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Nope, all clear.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Toph cracks her knuckles and places her hands against the cell door, preparing to metalbend it. Cut to outside the prison cell in the where the door crumples and gets thrown away from the doorway.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Let's go. [Sokka grabs the Earth King's hand and follows Toph.]

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: [While being guided by Sokka.] I'm not leaving without Bosco!

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Cut back to Zuko and Aang fighting. Aang airbends the air currents around him to make a human-shaped gust of air at Zuko, knocking him down. Aang attacks Zuko with more airbending, but Zuko maneuvers around the attacks and gets back up on his feet. He fires more blasts at Aang who is clinging on to a rock pillar. Aang jumps onto a clump of crystals to avoid the attack. Furious, Zuko summons a greater blast of fire. Aang earthbends some crystals to protect him, but the crystals shatter, sending Aang flying to another clump of crystals. Zuko uses fire whips to attack Aang once again, but Aang jumps to another patch of crystals and Zuko keeps attacking.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: I thought you had changed! [She grunts.]

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: I have changed.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Zuko fires another blast. Cut to Azula and Aang standing opposite each other. A closer shot of Azula and Aang as they prepare to fight. Azula uses firebending to charge at Aang. Aang earthbends crystals around him into a crystal encased armor and charges at Azula. Azula stops, and uses her firebending to break Aang's crystal armor and send him flying back into an old building. Cut to Mai, Ty Lee, and Bosco in the Earth King's throne room.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: [To Bosco.] Come on, it's easy. You just walk on your front paws instead of your rear ones. [She demonstrates.] Like this.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Suddenly, the floor traps Ty Lee's hands, causingÂ  and her feet when they touch the ground. Bosco starts clapping. The view changes to reveal Kuei, Toph, and Sokka.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: [Sarcastically.] That is a nice trick.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Sokka takes out his boomerang and Toph earthbends a large block of the ground in preparation to fight against Mai. The camera zooms toward Mai.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: [Uninterested, knowing she does not stand a chance.] Just take the bear.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Cut to Bosco.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: [Runs to Bosco.] Bosco! [Bosco growls happily.]

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: The scene changes back to Zuko and Azula both fighting Katara. Hopelessly outnumbered, Katara gets knocked down. Aang jumps from the old building and earth surfs toward Zuko and Azula to stop them from attacking Katara, with a fiercely determined look on his face. However, a Dai Li agent appears and jumps in front of Aang's surf, sending him flying off. Aang yells as he falls. More Dai Li agents gather behind Zuko and Azula. Katara starts regaining her focus and Dai Li agents surround her. Katara uses the octopus form to defend herself. Aang stands up in a fighting stance, but his determined face quickly turns into one of despair.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: There's too many. [He looks at Katara.]

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: [From Aang's memory.] The only way is to let her go.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: I'm sorry, Katara.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Closing his eyes, he turns away from Azula and Zuko and earthbends a crystal shelter tent. Aang starts meditating. Inside Aang's mind, a giant version of himself in the Avatar State, the Avatar Spirit, holds an airbending sphere with a normal-sized version of himself in the Avatar State. Back in the crystal shelter, Aang enters the Avatar State and the crystal shelter starts glowing, alerting those outside. Inside the shelter, Aang opens his glowing eyes and breaks the crystal above him. The camera shows Katara looking up to Aang, now rising in to the air, with hope. But before Aang can let Katara go and control the Avatar State, a bolt of lightning strikes him in the back. Cut to Azula's eyeball watching Aang getting struck, before it zooms out to show her smiling menacingly in a lightning summoning position with her fingers smoking. The Avatar Spirit lets go of Aang and falls out of the plane of existence. As Aang falls down, Katara, tears now falling down her face, creates a wave to catch Aang. The wave knocks down the Dai Li agents and Zuko. She looks down at Aang's lifeless body and back up with tears in her eyes. Zuko and Azula prepare to attack Katara, but a blast of fire stops them. Iroh, the source of the blast, jumps down from the wall of the cave and shields Aang and Katara from Zuko and Azula.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: You've got to get out of here! I'll hold them off as long as I can! [Fires some blasts at Zuko and Azula.]

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Katara walks away slowly with Aang's body to a waterfall, and she uses waterbending to lift herself and Aang's body up its path. Iroh holds off the Dai Li agents, taking blows of earthbending, until after Aang and Katara leave. He submits to the Dai Li, who use earthbending to encase him in crystals. Azula is triumphantly smirking next to Zuko, both looking at Iroh. Iroh is looking back at Zuko, then closes his eyes and turns away. Cut to Bosco, Kuei, Toph, Sokka, Aang, and Katara riding on Appa. Appa moans sadly. Cut to a closer shot of Katara placing Aang's body on Appa. Katara opens the vial around her neck and uses water healing on Aang's wounded back. The rest of Team Avatar, Kuei, and Bosco all look sadly and in anticipation. The glowing from the spirit water stops, and Katara starts crying, assuming that it was not enough to save Aang. Aang's tattoos glow for a second and Aang groans. Katara, overcome with joy that Aang is alive, looks at him, who smiles a little, and she holds him closer. Cut to the Earth King's throne room with Azula sitting down at the throne with Zuko at her left.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: We've done it, Zuko. It's taken a hundred years, but the Fire Nation has conquered Ba Sing Se.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: I betrayed Uncle.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: No, he betrayed you. [She stands up from the throne.] Zuko, when you return home, Father will welcome you as a war hero.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: But I don't have the Avatar. What if Father doesn't restore my honor?

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: He doesn't need to, Zuko. [She puts a hand on Zuko's shoulder.] Today, you restored your own honor.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Zuko looks turns away, uncertain of himself. Cut to an aerial view of Ba Sing Se. Cut to Appa's passengers.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: The Earth Kingdom ... has fallen.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: The camera pans down to show Katara, who sits next to an unconscious Aang, and looks up. Appa flies over the walls of Ba Sing Se. Fade to credits.

title: The Crossroads of Destiny
text: Aang

title: The Awakening
text: The episode opens on board a Fire Nation ship where Aang finally regains consciousness. The camera zooms out on his face as he opens his eyes and rises from his bed, visibly shaken and in pain, and now with a head full of hair.

title: The Awakening
text: What happened? [Sees the Fire Nation designs and flag and immediately assumes he has been captured.] Oh no!

title: The Awakening
text: He leaves his room, carefully creaking open the door and peering outside for any sign of Fire Nation soldiers. Using his glider as a crutch, Aang stumbles across the hall, occasionally leaning on the wall for support due to being weak. He stops at a turn in the hallway upon hearing two guards, who are actually Pipsqueak and The Duke, talking to each other.

title: The Awakening
text: You hear something? [Aang retreats behind the wall, where he dons a determined look and quickly steps out to send a weak air blast at them, which only ruffles their clothes, and moves past the hallway.] He's awake! [The two begin chasing Aang, who struggles to escape.] Stop! Wait!

title: The Awakening
text: Aang manages to reach the deck of the ship, however, he stumbles on the stairway and drops his staff. It slides over to where Hakoda and Bato, disguised as Fire Nation soldiers, are petting Momo.

title: The Awakening
text: [Confused.] Momo?

title: The Awakening
text: Momo runs toward Aang, jumps on his shoulder and licks his face. Toph and Katara, standing near the edge of the ship, hear the events.

title: The Awakening
text: Twinkle Toes! That's got to be you!

title: The Awakening
text: Aang, you're awake! [The two race over to him.]

title: The Awakening
text: Are you sure? [Rubs eyes.] I feel like I'm dreaming.

title: The Awakening
text: [Hugs Aang.] You're not dreaming. You're finally awake.

title: The Awakening
text: [Hugs Aang; is disguised as a Fire Nation guard.] Aang, good to see you back with the living, buddy!

title: The Awakening
text: Sokka? [Breathes heavily, appears to be passing out.]

title: The Awakening
text: Uh-oh, somebody catch him, he's going to-

title: The Awakening
text: The screen becomes black as Aang collapses to the floor, Katara running short of catching him. The shot cuts to the entire group, including Appa, surrounding Aang who is now in Katara's arms. Meanwhile, on another ship, Zuko is heading toward the Fire Nation. Mai joins him.

title: The Awakening
text: Aren't you cold?

title: The Awakening
text: I've got a lot on my mind. It's been so long, over three years since I was home. I wonder what's changed. I wonder how I've changed.

title: The Awakening
text: [Yawns.] I just asked if you were cold, I didn't ask for your whole life story. [Zuko frowns at her sarcastic response. Mai giggles and holds his face in her hands.] Stop worrying.

title: The Awakening
text: The two kiss. Mai exits, and Zuko stays there with an expression of relief on his face. We return to the ship where Team Avatar is on. Aang is awake once again. He sits in front of Katara, also sitting, surrounded by Toph and Sokka. Appa rests behind them. Aang receives a robe to cover him.

title: The Awakening
text: Why are we on a Fire Nation ship? Why is everyone dressed this way? And why am I the only one who's completely out of it? [Katara and Aang are left alone.]

title: The Awakening
text: You need to take it easy, okay? You got hurt pretty bad. [Smiling at him.] I like your hair.

title: The Awakening
text: I have hair? [Feels it.] How long was I out?

title: The Awakening
text: A few weeks.

title: The Awakening
text: Everything okay?

title: The Awakening
text: [Looking away, annoyed. Annoyed tone.] We're fine, Dad.

title: The Awakening
text: [To Aang.] I'm Hakoda, Katara and Sokka's father. [Aang moves to shake his outstretched hand.]

title: The Awakening
text: [Placing her hands on Aang's shoulders stopping him.] He knows who you are. I just called you "Dad", didn't I?

title: The Awakening
text: I guess you're right.

title: The Awakening
text: [Removing Katara's hand he shakes Hakoda's hand.] Nice to officially meet you, Chief Hakoda.

title: The Awakening
text: It's an honor to meet you.

title: The Awakening
text: Great, great, so now you guys have finally met. So would you mind giving us a little privacy?

title: The Awakening
text: Of course. [Walks away.]

title: The Awakening
text: Are you mad at your dad or something? [Katara looks at Hakoda leave with an expression of annoyance on her face.]

title: The Awakening
text: [Confused look.] What, not at all. Why would you say that?

title: The Awakening
text: Aang shrugs and murmurs as if to say "I don't know." but gasps in pain.

title: The Awakening
text: Maybe we should go upstairs. [Helping Aang up.] You need a healing session.

title: The Awakening
text: Back in Aang's room on the ship. Katara bends some water onto the scar left by Azula's lightning attack.

title: The Awakening
text: Tell me where the pain feels most intense.

title: The Awakening
text: Mmm, a little higher. Uhhh!

title: The Awakening
text: Aang briefly flashes back to the battle at Old Ba Sing Se where he rose into the Avatar State, then back to reality.

title: The Awakening
text: Wow, you're definitely in the right area there.

title: The Awakening
text: I can feel a lot of energy twisted up around there. [Begins to remove the water.] Let me just see if I can-

title: The Awakening
text: As Katara bends the water from Aang's scar, he suddenly jerks backward and again flashes back to the battle at Old Ba Sing Se, to the moment where he was shot by Azula's lightning. The flashback scene then changes to Katara is tearfully looking over Aang, looking comatose, flying on top of Appa as they flee Ba Sing Se. After that, he snaps back to reality.

title: The Awakening
text: I went down! I didn't just get hurt, did I? It was worse than that. I was gone! But you brought me back.

title: The Awakening
text: I just used the spirit water from the North Pole. I don't know what I did exactly.

title: The Awakening
text: [Turning to look at her.] You saved me.

title: The Awakening
text: [Placing a hand on the side of his face.] You need to rest.

title: The Awakening
text: The scene switches to the Fire Nation Capital, Li and Lo addressing a crowd below.

title: The Awakening
text: Your Princess Azula, clever and beautiful, disguised herself as the enemy and entered the Earth Kingdom's Capital. In Ba Sing Se, she found her brother Zuko, and together they faced the Avatar ...

title: The Awakening
text: And the Avatar fell! And the Earth Kingdom fell!

title: The Awakening
text: Azula's agents quickly overtook the entire city. They went to Ba Sing Se's great walls ...

title: The Awakening
text: And brought them down!

title: The Awakening
text: The armies of the Fire Nation surged through the walls and swarmed over Ba Sing Se, securing our victory.

title: The Awakening
text: A flashback shows the Dai Li taking down Ba Sing Se's walls and the Fire Nation troops entering the city as Earth Kingdom citizens look on with fear. Tanks are seen approaching the Ba Sing Se's royal palace before flashing back to Li and Lo with Azula approaching between them.

title: The Awakening
text: Now the heroes have returned home!

title: The Awakening
text: Your princess, Azula ... [Crowd cheers.]

title: The Awakening
text: And after three long years, your prince has returned ...

title: The Awakening
text: Zuko!

title: The Awakening
text: Zuko approaches with a worried expression. Crowd cheers. We now go back to Team Avatar's ship. Sokka sits on a crate with a map with the others surrounding him as he narrates past events.

title: The Awakening
text: After what happened at Ba Sing Se, we had to get you to safety. We flew back to Chameleon Bay where we found my father and the other Water Tribe men. [Flashback preparing to leave by taking off his Earth King robes revealing traveling robes beneath.] The Earth King decided he wanted to travel the world in disguise, so he set off alone. [Bosco is shown taking off his own attire and hat before Kuei jumps on Bosco and they set off.] Well, not completely alone. [Cut back to Sokka continuing the story.] Soon, the bay was overrun by Fire Nation ships. Rather than fight them all, we captured a single ship and made it our disguise. Since then we've been traveling west. We crossed through the Serpent's Pass a few days ago. We've seen a few Fire Nation ships, but none have bothered us.

title: The Awakening
text: So what now?

title: The Awakening
text: We've been working on a modified version of the invasion plan.

title: The Awakening
text: [Sharply.]Â It's Sokka's invasion plan.

title: The Awakening
text: Yes, Sokka's plan. We won't be able to mount a massive invasion without the Earth King's armies, but the solar eclipse will still leave the Fire Nation vulnerable.

title: The Awakening
text: So we're planning a smaller invasion. Just a ragtag team of our friends and allies from around the Earth Kingdom. We already ran into Pipsqueak and The Duke.

title: The Awakening
text: [Eating noodles with The Duke on his shoulder.] Good to see you again, Aang!

title: The Awakening
text: And the best part is, the eclipse isn't even our biggest advantage! [Whispers.] We have a secret... [Looks at both of his sides.]Â You!

title: The Awakening
text: Me?

title: The Awakening
text: Yep, the whole world thinks you're dead! Isn't that great? [Stands up and raises both of his fists triumphantly.]

title: The Awakening
text: Aang is shocked. Cut to Aang looking out to the water from a side of the boat.

title: The Awakening
text: The world thinks I'm dead? How is that good news? That's terrible!

title: The Awakening
text: [Approaching Aang.] No, it's great! It means the Fire Nation won't be hunting us anymore! And even better, they won't be expecting you on the Day of Black Sun!

title: The Awakening
text: No, no, no, no, no. You have no idea. This is so messed up!

title: The Awakening
text: Another Fire Nation ship approaches.

title: The Awakening
text: I'll handle this. The Avatar is back. [Opens glider and grunts in pain.]

title: The Awakening
text: [Approaching Aang.] Aang, wait! Remember, they don't know we're not Fire Nation!

title: The Awakening
text: Sweating, Aang puts his glider away.

title: The Awakening
text: Everyone just stay calm. [He and Bato put their helmets on.] Bato and I will take care of this.

title: The Awakening
text: Pipsqueak and The Duke cover Appa and Momo, while Aang, Toph, Sokka and Katara hide in a square hole.

title: The Awakening
text: I hate not being able to do anything.

title: The Awakening
text: Hopefully, you won't need to.

title: The Awakening
text: Crew from the other ship boards Team Avatar's ship.

title: The Awakening
text: Commander, why are you off course? All Western Fleet ships are supposed to be moving toward Ba Sing Se to support the occupation!

title: The Awakening
text: Actually, we're from the Eastern Fleet. We have orders to deliver some cargo.

title: The Awakening
text: Ahhh ... Eastern Fleet. Well, nice of Admiral Chan to let us know he was sending one of his ships our way.

title: The Awakening
text: I'm sure Admiral Chan meant no disrespect, sir.

title: The Awakening
text: I mean, how hard is it to write a quick note and send a hawk our way?

title: The Awakening
text: Next time, we'll send [Bato and Hakoda glance at each other.] two hawks to make sure you get the message.

title: The Awakening
text: The two bow to each other, and Hakoda and Bato exit.

title: The Awakening
text: Sir ... Admiral Chan has been on leave for two months at Ember Island.

title: The Awakening
text: What? Why doesn't anyone ever tell me anything? Something's not right; they should have known that. I think this is a captured ship. [Whispering.] Just stay quiet until we're safely across the ramp. Then we'll sink this ship.

title: The Awakening
text: Toph, hearing this, emerges.

title: The Awakening
text: They know!

title: The Awakening
text: She metalbends the bridge between the ships off. The captain and his guards fall into the water. Katara creates a large wave which separates the other ship from theirs. Team Avatar's ship departs quickly. The captain and his guards from the other ship climbs back on board theirs by rope ladder. Meanwhile, back at the Fire Nation Capital, Zuko feeds turtle ducks in a lake with some bread. Azula joins him.

title: The Awakening
text: You seem so downcast. Has Mai gotten to you already? Though actually, Mai has been in a strangely good mood lately.

title: The Awakening
text: I haven't seen Dad yet. I haven't seen him in three years, since I was banished.

title: The Awakening
text: So what?

title: The Awakening
text: So, I didn't capture the Avatar.

title: The Awakening
text: Who cares? The Avatar is dead ... [Zuko looks away.] unless you think he somehow miraculously survived.

title: The Awakening
text: Zuko flashes back to when Katara explained about her vial of spirit water in the Crystal Catacombs.

title: The Awakening
text: [During flashback.] This is water from the spirit oasis at the north pole. It has special properties so I've been saving it for something important.

title: The Awakening
text: Back to the present.

title: The Awakening
text: No. There's no way he could have survived. [They glare at each other.]

title: The Awakening
text: Well, then I'm sure you have nothing to worry about.

title: The Awakening
text: Back at the ocean. The second ship begins firing at Team Avatar's. Toph takes an earthbending stance while The Duke stands behind her to guide her.

title: The Awakening
text: Load the Toph!

title: The Awakening
text: Pipsqueak drops a boulder in front of Toph who begins earthbending it at the attacking ship. It hits a catapult as another fires. others try to fight back with a series of rocks that Toph earthbends at the other ship. With The Duke's guidance, Toph earthbends another piece of rock and sends it to intercept the oncoming fireball. Aang, inside the ship with Sokka, makes a move to help but is stopped by Sokka. In frustration he bangs his head against his staff. The other ship fires a harpoon, piercing a hole in Team Avatar's ship's bottom. As water flows in, Katara, noticing this, freezes the water below to plug the hole.

title: The Awakening
text: I'm gonna give us some cover!

title: The Awakening
text: She brings up vapor from the water to create a fog screen. However, a fireball makes its way through and destroys the rocks that Toph had been using.

title: The Awakening
text: Cut back to Aang and Sokka in the ship.

title: The Awakening
text: I just can't stand by and do nothing! [Runs out.]

title: The Awakening
text: [Following.] Aang, no! [Grabs the staff.] You're still hurt, and you have to stay secret! Just let us handle this.

title: The Awakening
text: Fine. [Grabs his staff and walks away.]

title: The Awakening
text: Two fireballs hit the ship causing a fire. Katara quickly extinguishes it with waterbending.

title: The Awakening
text: How are we doing?

title: The Awakening
text: Things couldn't get much worse. [A serpent rises from the water near their ship. Sokka turns around and looks at it in despar. Yelling.] The universe just loves proving me wrong, doesn't it?

title: The Awakening
text: You make it too easy!

title: The Awakening
text: The serpent is hit by a fireball from the other ship. In anger, it wraps itself around the other ship, allowing Team Avatar's ship to escape.

title: The Awakening
text: Thank you, the universe!

title: The Awakening
text: Team Avatar's ship arrives a port in a town. Aang is alone in his room, until the rest of the gang enter.

title: The Awakening
text: Hey, Aang! We're going into town to find some dinner.

title: The Awakening
text: [Clutching his stomach.] Well, I am pretty hungry. Maybe dinner's a good idea.

title: The Awakening
text: Here, [Offering a Fire Nation bandana.] tie this around your head. It will cover your arrow.

title: The Awakening
text: I'm not going out if I can't wear my arrow proudly! [He lies back down.]

title: The Awakening
text: Aang, come on. Be practical.

title: The Awakening
text: [Placing a hand on Sokka's shoulder.] You guys go ahead without us. We'll catch up to you. [Toph and Sokka exit. Katara sits on Aang's bed, placing a hand on his shoulder.] I think I understand why being a secret bothers you so much. You don't want people to think you failed.

title: The Awakening
text: You're right, I don't. But the problem is, I did fail!

title: The Awakening
text: Aang, that's not true.

title: The Awakening
text: [Getting up.] It is true. I was in Ba Sing Se. I was there! But I lost. And now the Earth Kingdom is fallen for good.

title: The Awakening
text: It's not for good. [Getting up too.] Remember, there's still a plan. The invasion!

title: The Awakening
text: And I hate the invasion plan, too! [Rips down the Fire Nation flag covering his staff.] I don't want you or anyone else risking your lives to fix my mistakes! I've always known that I would have to face the Fire Lord. But now I know I need to do it alone.

title: The Awakening
text: [Moving to comfort him.] Aang ...

title: The Awakening
text: Katara, please! Just go ... please.

title: The Awakening
text: [Exiting.] Is there anything you need?

title: The Awakening
text: I need to redeem myself. I need my honor back.

title: The Awakening
text: Back at the Fire Nation Capital, Zuko returns to the royal palace and prepares to face his father, Ozai. He breathes deeply and enters. We briefly see Ozai before cutting back to Team Avatar's ship. Katara returns to Aang's room.

title: The Awakening
text: I brought you some food! [Notices Aang has gone missing.] Oh no ... [Drops the food tray and runs.]

title: The Awakening
text: Cut to Aang, flying on his glider. Back at the Royal Palace, Zuko bows before Ozai.

title: The Awakening
text: You've been away for a long time. I see the weight of your travels has changed you. You have redeemed yourself, my son. [Approaches Zuko; the camera pans up to view Ozai's full face for the first time.] Welcome home.

title: The Awakening
text: Aang struggles to remain in flight against his injuries. Back on the ship, Katara runs toward Bato and Hakoda. She is in tears.

title: The Awakening
text: I'll leave you two alone. [Exits.]

title: The Awakening
text: What's wrong, Katara?

title: The Awakening
text: He left.

title: The Awakening
text: What?

title: The Awakening
text: Aang. He just took his glider and disappeared. He has this ridiculous notion that he has to save the world alone, that it's all his responsibility.

title: The Awakening
text: Maybe that's his way of being brave.

title: The Awakening
text: It's not brave, it's selfish and stupid! We could be helping him and I know the world needs him, but doesn't he know how much we need him, too? How can he just leave us behind?

title: The Awakening
text: You're talking about me too, aren't you?

title: The Awakening
text: How could you leave us, Dad? [She attempts to wipe away the tears.] I mean, I know we had Gran-Gran, and she loved us, but we were just so lost without you.

title: The Awakening
text: Hakoda moves to comfort her as she turns away.

title: The Awakening
text: I'm so sorry, Katara.

title: The Awakening
text: [Embraces Hakoda.] I understand why you left. I really do, and I know that you had to go, so why do I still feel this way? I'm so sad and angry and hurt!

title: The Awakening
text: I love you more than anything. You and your brother are my entire world. I thought about you every day when I was gone and every night when I went to sleep, I would lie awake missing you so much it would ache.

title: The Awakening
text: The scene switches to the Royal Palace.

title: The Awakening
text: I am proud of you, Prince Zuko. I am proud because you and your sister conquered Ba Sing Se. I am proud because when your loyalty was tested by your treacherous uncle, you did the right thing and captured the traitor. And I am proudest of all of your most legendary accomplishment: you slayed the Avatar.

title: The Awakening
text: [Shocked.] What did you hear?

title: The Awakening
text: Azula told me everything. She said she was amazed and impressed at your power and ferocity at the moment of truth.

title: The Awakening
text: The scene changes back to Aang continuing his flight, struggling. He comes upon a Fire Nation blockade.

title: The Awakening
text: A blockade.

title: The Awakening
text: He takes a deep breath and swims under it. Upon emerging, he finds a tree bark and rides it like a surfboard through the water. A storm turns the seas very choppy. He falls off and into the water and his staff flies away. Back to the palace, Azula is asleep when Zuko enters her room.

title: The Awakening
text: Why'd you do it?

title: The Awakening
text: [Smiling, with her eyes still shut.] You're going to have to be a little more specific.

title: The Awakening
text: Why did you tell Father that I was the one who killed the Avatar?

title: The Awakening
text: Can't this wait until the morning?

title: The Awakening
text: It. Can't.

title: The Awakening
text: [Sighs and opens her eyes.] Fine. You seemed so worried about how Father would treat you because you hadn't captured the Avatar. I figured if I gave you the credit, you'd have nothing to worry about.

title: The Awakening
text: But why?

title: The Awakening
text: [Getting out of bed.] Call it a generous gesture. I wanted to thank you for your help and I was happy to share the glory.

title: The Awakening
text: You're lying.

title: The Awakening
text: [Walking past Zuko.] If you say so ...

title: The Awakening
text: You have another motive for doing this, I just haven't figured out what it is.

title: The Awakening
text: Please Zuko, what ulterior motive could I have? What could I possibly gain by letting you get all the glory for defeating the Avatar? [Approaching close to Zuko she places a hand on his shoulder.] Unless, somehow, the Avatar was actually alive. All that glory would suddenly turn to shame and foolishness. But you said it yourself, that was impossible. [Zuko begins to leave.] Sleep well, Zuzu.

title: The Awakening
text: Back in the sea, Aang struggles to stay above water or reach his glider. After letting out a scream, a wave overcomes him and he falls into the water. He re-emerges after a brief time.

title: The Awakening
text: I'm not gonna make it. I failed. [Within the lightning strikes, the spirit of Roku appears before Aang.] Roku?

title: The Awakening
text: You haven't failed, Aang.

title: The Awakening
text: But everyone thinks I'm dead again. They think I've abandoned them, and I'm losing this war. I'm letting the whole world down.

title: The Awakening
text: If anyone is to blame for the state of the world, it is me. I should have seen this war coming and prevented it. You inherited my problems and my mistakes. But I believe you are destined to redeem me and save the world.

title: The Awakening
text: I don't know.

title: The Awakening
text: Moonlight shines on on Aang as Yue's spirit appears above.

title: The Awakening
text: You already saved the world. And you'll save the world again, but you can't give up.

title: The Awakening
text: The storm ends. The spirit of Roku disappears, while Yue's spirit descends toward Aang.

title: The Awakening
text: [Determined.] You're right. I won't give up.

title: The Awakening
text: He creates a wave and surfs it with the tree bark. Yue's spirit watches him leave and ascends back to the moon.
