Aang is washed up at the base of a volcano, on the same crescent island where Roku's temple once was. Later, Momo finds him and licks his face, waking him up. Katara, Sokka, and Toph find him, reaching him via Appa. Katara runs to hug him, her worried look changing to happiness.

title: The Awakening
text: You're okay!

title: The Awakening
text: They all, including Momo and Appa, come together for a group hug.

title: The Awakening
text: I have so much to do.

title: The Awakening
text: I know, but you'll have our help.

title: The Awakening
text: You didn't think you could get out of training just by coming to the Fire Nation, did you?

title: The Awakening
text: What about the invasion?

title: The Awakening
text: We'll join up with my dad and the invasion force the day of the eclipse.

title: The Awakening
text: [Notices Aang's damaged staff has washed ashore.] Hey! What's ... oh, it's your glider.

title: The Awakening
text: It's okay. If someone saw it, it would give away my identity. It's better for now that no one knows I'm alive.

title: The Awakening
text: Flies up and sticks it in the volcano's lava trails, causing it to catch fire as they depart. Scene fades to credits.

title: The Awakening
text: Aang

title: The Headband
text: The episode opens with a shot of the incline leading to the Royal Caldera city, as the camera pans above to an aerial shot of the city. Shot cuts to the Fire Nation Royal Palace, before cutting to Zuko's bedroom, to show Zuko tossing and turning in his bed, unable to sleep. He opens his eyes and gets up, donning a cloak. Cut to the rim of the volcano, as he walks through a path. Cut to the Capital City Prison as Zuko walks toward it. Cut to an overhead shot of him stopping and looking above. Cut to a guard walking around a balcony, who spots him.

title: The Headband
text: Who's there?!

title: The Headband
text: Zuko, without speaking a word, turns around and walks away. The guard, seeing Zuko leave, resumes his patrol. Scene changes to some islands at day time, as a mysterious cloud goes toward one of the islands at an abnormal speed. Cut to the cloud "descending" on one of the islands.

title: The Headband
text: [From inside the cloud.] I think I see a cave below.

title: The Headband
text: [Commanding.] Sh! Keep quiet!

title: The Headband
text: Aang airbends the cloud surrounding Appa as the flying bison lands. Sokka jumps to the ground from Appa and reconnoiters, before crossing his arms and looking toward Team Avatar.

title: The Headband
text: Great job with the cloud camo, but next time, let's disguise ourselves as the kind of cloud that knows how to keep its mouth shut. [He reconnoiters again.]

title: The Headband
text: [Cut to the Toph, Katara, and Aang standing in front of Sokka, who is reconnoitering. Sarcastically.] Yeah, we wouldn't want a bird to hear us chatting up there and turn us in.

title: The Headband
text: [Turning back toward the other three.] Hey, we're in enemy territory. [He points above as camera zooms back to show four toucan puffins standing on a rock behind him.] Those are enemy birds.

title: The Headband
text: One toucan puffin jumps onto Sokka's head and screeches. Cut to the other three as they laugh, and walk toward the cave, with Sokka following behind. Suddenly, he jumps above them and comes "diving" down. He looks suspicious, as shot cuts to an aerial shot of him running into the cave, followed by the rest of the group.

title: The Headband
text: Well, this is it. [Cut to Sokka standing in front of the other three.] This is how we'll be living until the invasion begins. [His head drops each time he says the word, "cave".] Hiding in cave after cave after cave after cave ...

title: The Headband
text: [Cut to Katara, standing near Aang, from behind Sokka.] Sokka, we don't need to become cave people. What we need is some new clothes.

title: The Headband
text: Yeah, blending in is better than hiding out. [Cut to Aang and Katara.] If we get Fire Nation disguises, [Smiling.] we would be just as safe as we would be hiding in a cave.

title: The Headband
text: [Cut to Toph, who is sitting down with her legs slightly folded.] Plus, they have real food out there. Does anyone want to sit in the dirt and eat cave hoppers?

title: The Headband
text: Toph punches the cave wall, causing cave hoppers to jump out, Momo grabs one and eats it. He turns around and spits out a cave hopper limb.

title: The Headband
text: Looks like we got outvoted, sport. Let's get some new clothes.

title: The Headband
text: Cut to outside a Fire Nation home near a waterfall. Next to the home, clothes hang out to dry on clotheslines over natural steam vents. Katara, Aang, Sokka, and Toph hide behind a rock wall.

title: The Headband
text: [Whispering.] I don't know about this. [Cut to a view of Team Avatar from the clothes.] These clothes belong to somebody.

title: The Headband
text: I call the silk robe! [Jumps out from behind the rock wall and grabs two outfits.]

title: The Headband
text: But if it's essential to our survival ... then I call the suit! [Jumps over the wall.]

title: The Headband
text: Cut to a view of the hanging clothes from inside a house through doorway where a man sleeps. Aang and Toph run across, grabbing clothes. Sokka stands still, examining shirts on the clothesline and grabs the third one.

title: The Headband
text: [Puts on a headband, revealing his whole new Fire Nation disguise.] Ta-dah! Normal kid.

title: The Headband
text: Hm ... I should probably wear shoes. But then I won't be able to see as well. [Sits down.] Sorry, shoes! [Pulls on the shoe, launching the sole at Sokka's face, leaving a red mark.] Finally, a stylish shoe for the blind earthbender.

title: The Headband
text: [Walks partially on camera.] How do I look? [The camera pans from Katara's dress to her whole outfit.]

title: The Headband
text: [Blushing, scratching his head.] Uh ... your mom's necklace.

title: The Headband
text: Oh, [Touches necklace.] oh, yeah. I guess it's pretty obviously Water Tribe, isn't it? [Takes off the necklace and holds it in her hand.]

title: The Headband
text: In the city, Katara puts some money on a head-wear display. She puts on a Fire Nation necklace, Toph puts on a crown, and Sokka wears a top-knot. Aang pats down Momo's ears and hides him in his shirt.

title: The Headband
text: I used to visit my friend Kuzon here a hundred years ago. So, everyone just follow my lead and stay cool. Or, as they say in the Fire Nation, "stay flamin'". [Walks around the building corner. To a man eating meat on a stick.] Greetings, my good hotman.

title: The Headband
text: [Confused.] Uh, hi. [Sokka shrugs at him as he passes.] I guess ...

title: The Headband
text: [Looking at a meat display. Dissapointedly.] Oh, we're going to a meat place?

title: The Headband
text: Come on, Aang, everyone here eats meat. Even the meat! [Points at a hippo cow eating a piece of meat swarming with flies.]

title: The Headband
text: You guys go ahead. I'll just get some lettuce out of the garbage. [Aang and Katara wave each at each other as the rest enter. Turns around to greet random people on the street.] Hotman. Hotman. Hotman. Hotman. Hotman. Hotman.

title: The Headband
text: Three soldiers approach Aang.

title: The Headband
text: It's over. We caught you.

title: The Headband
text: [Guiltily.] Who, me?

title: The Headband
text: It couldn't be more obvious that you don't belong here. [Cut to Aang looking very nervous.] Next time you play hooky, you might wanna take off your school uniform.

title: The Headband
text: Aang laughs nervously and the soldier grabs Aang. Cut to the two guards push Aang into a classroom. The camera pans across the room, stopping at the teacher, Ms. Kwan.

title: The Headband
text: Oh. Is this a new mind ready for molding?

title: The Headband
text: That's right. [Knocking on his head.] Let the molding begin. [The two guards turn away to leave.]

title: The Headband
text: Wait a minute. [The two guards turn back.] You're not from the Fire Nation. [Walks around Aang.] Clearly you're from the colonies.

title: The Headband
text: Yeah, the colonies, of course. The Fire Nation colonies in the Earth Kingdom. [The two guards walk away.]

title: The Headband
text: Your etiquette is terrible. In the homeland, we bow to our elders. [Walks in front of her desk.] Like so. [Bows.]

title: The Headband
text: Sorry, ma'am.

title: The Headband
text: Bows to her. She taps his hands to correct him. A girl sitting in the front row shows the correct way to bow. Aang bows the proper way this time.

title: The Headband
text: And we don't wear head coverings indoors.

title: The Headband
text: Um ... I have a scar. It's really embarrassing.

title: The Headband
text: Very well. What is your name? Or should we just call you "Mannerless Colony Slob"?

title: The Headband
text: [Chuckles.] Just "slob" is fine. Or, uh, Kuzon. [Camera pans out to Aang facing his classmates.]

title: The Headband
text: The school bell rings and the students walk out of school. Momo peeks out of Aang's school uniform.

title: The Headband
text: [Quietly.] We made it through the day Momo, and it was pretty fun.

title: The Headband
text: [From behind Aang.] Don't let the headmaster catch you with that monkey. [The camera shifts to show her.]

title: The Headband
text: [Turns around, trying to act innocent.] What monkey?

title: The Headband
text: Don't worry, I'm not a tattletale. My name's On Ji. I like your headband, by the way.

title: The Headband
text: [Walks past Aang, slightly bumping him away and puts a hand around On Ji's shoulders.] On Ji, you don't have to baby-sit the new kid.

title: The Headband
text: Wow. [Bows.] You must be one of those popular kids I've been hearing about.

title: The Headband
text: That's right. Now listen, friend. I know you're from the colonies, so I'll say this slowly. [Leans close to Aang, talking slowly.] On Ji is my girlfriend. [Pokes Aang's chest.] Don't forget it.

title: The Headband
text: Momo tries to get out of Aang's shirt and Aang pushes him back in. Aang pushes Momo back as Hide signifies to Aang that he is watching him and begins to leave.

title: The Headband
text: [Waving goodbye to On Ji and Hide.] It was nice meeting you.

title: The Headband
text: [Approaches Aang.] I don't believe it, he didn't beat you up. Not even a little.

title: The Headband
text: I guess I'm just lucky.

title: The Headband
text: We were on our way to play hide and explode. You wanna come?

title: The Headband
text: I'd love to.

title: The Headband
text: Shoji, his friends, and Aang all run off to play the game.

title: The Headband
text: [Concernedly.] Where have you been? We've been worried sick.

title: The Headband
text: [Undoing his headband.] I got invited to play with some kids after school.

title: The Headband
text: [Springs up to his feet in shock.] After what?!

title: The Headband
text: I enrolled in a Fire Nation school, and I'm going back tomorrow.

title: The Headband
text: [With an exasperated facial expression.] Enrolled in what?! [Falls backward in disbelief.]

title: The Headband
text: Cut to an outside-view of the Capital City Prison. Cut to inside, where Zuko walks through the halls and the guard is alerted to his presence.

title: The Headband
text: [Readies his spear, with it pointed directly at Zuko.] You again? Stop where you are! [Zuko raises his head, looking at the guard.] Prince Zuko ...

title: The Headband
text: Zuko grabs the guard by his collar and slams him against the wall.

title: The Headband
text: I'm going in for a visit. You're going to stand guard here, and no one is going to know about this. [Zuko releases the guard, enters Iroh's cell, and approaches him.] Uncle, it's me. [Iroh, sitting on the floor, turns away from Zuko with a scowl on his face.]

title: The Headband
text: The scene cuts back to show the team inside the cave sitting around a fire.

title: The Headband
text: Aang, I'm trying to be mature and not immediately shoot down your idea, but it sounds ... really terrible.

title: The Headband
text: Yeah, we got our outfits. What do you need to go to school for?

title: The Headband
text: Every minute I'm in that classroom, I'm learning new things about the Fire Nation. I already have a picture of Fire Lord Ozai. [Holds up the picture.] And here's one that I made out of noodles! [Holds up his picture of Ozai.]

title: The Headband
text: Impressive, I admit, but I still think it's too dangerous.

title: The Headband
text: I guess we'll never find out about the secret river then. It goes right to the Fire Lord's palace. We were supposed to learn about it in class tomorrow.

title: The Headband
text: Hmm, I am a fan of secret rivers ... fine, let's stay a few more days.

title: The Headband
text: Flamey-o, hotman! [Runs off.]

title: The Headband
text: [To Katara.] Flamey-o?

title: The Headband
text: Katara shrugs and murmurs as if to say "I don't know." Cut to the prison. Zuko is standing inside Iroh's cell.

title: The Headband
text: You brought this on yourself you know. We could have returned together. You could have been a hero! [Iroh shifts but does not look at him.] You have no right to judge me, Uncle. I did what I had to do in Ba Sing Se, and you're a fool for not joining me. [Iroh continues ignoring him.] You're not going to say anything? [Kicks up a small stool and destroys it with firebending.] You're a crazy old man! You're crazy! And if you weren't in jail, you'd be sleeping in a gutter! [Zuko leaves, slamming the door behind him as Iroh's head drops slightly and he closes his eyes.]

title: The Headband
text: The scene cuts to show the classroom with the class assembled inside. Kwan walks in, and the class collectively rises to bow.

title: The Headband
text: Good morning class. Recite the Fire Nation oath. [Sits down at her desk.]

title: The Headband
text: The class turns to face a large painting of Ozai.

title: The Headband
text: [Turns to a large painting of Ozai at the back of the class.] My life I give to my country, with my hands I fight for Fire Lord Ozai and our forefathers before him.

title: The Headband
text: [Glances around the room as the class recites the oath.] Fire Lord ... forefathers ...

title: The Headband
text: With my mind I seek ways to better my country, and with my feet may our March of Civilization continue.

title: The Headband
text: Firebenders ... Fire Lord ... wah, bah, blah, blah. [The class snickers at him as they sit down as the teacher looks on with a stern expression.]

title: The Headband
text: Since it's obviously hilarious to mock our national oath, we'll begin with a pop quiz on our great March of Civilization. [The class groans and picks up their pens.] Question one: What year did Fire Lord Sozin battle the Air Nation army? [Aang raises his hand.] Kuzon?

title: The Headband
text: Is that a trick question? The Air Nomads didn't have a formal military. Sozin defeated them by ambush. [The entire class stares at him, dumbfounded.]

title: The Headband
text: Well, I don't know how you could possibly know more than our national history book. Unless you were there a hundred years ago.

title: The Headband
text: I'll just write down my best guess.

title: The Headband
text: The camera fades to show the music teacher standing at a podium with the rest of the class before him, playing instruments. Aang plays loudly in very discordant notes, dancing while sitting.

title: The Headband
text: Kuzon?

title: The Headband
text: [Stopping.] I know, I'm a terrible tsungi hornist.

title: The Headband
text: No, child. That hullabaloo going on with your feet. Is that a nervous disorder?

title: The Headband
text: I was just dancing. You do dances here in the homeland, right?

title: The Headband
text: Not really, no.

title: The Headband
text: Dancing is not conducive to a proper learning environment. Young people must have rigid discipline and order.

title: The Headband
text: But what about expressing yourself?

title: The Headband
text: I know sometimes we're so ruled by our love for our nation that we can't control our own bodies. [He puts his hand to his face at what he is saying before continuing on.] If you must, you may march in place quietly next time the urge hits you.

title: The Headband
text: He settles back down to the podium and the class resumes playing. Aang plays a few notes. marching in place, and stops, looking very dismayed at this. Cut to the school yard. Aang is walking through it, and all the other students stop and stare at him, murmuring among themselves.

title: The Headband
text: [Waves at Aang.] Uh, hi, Kuzon. I really liked that crazy dance you were doing.

title: The Headband
text: Thanks On Ji. I could show it to you again if you like. Ah! [He jumps as a blast of fire hits the ground at his feet.]

title: The Headband
text: What'd you say, colony trash? You're gonna show her something?

title: The Headband
text: [Nervously.] Just some dance movements.

title: The Headband
text: Nobody shows my On Ji anything, especially movements!

title: The Headband
text: Hide attempts to strike Aang, but Aang easily steps out of the way. The other students gather around to watch. Hide continues trying to punch at Aang, but he continuously evades with ease, much to Hide's frustration. Aang gets behind Hide's back and moves to the side to match Hide's movements. Aang knocks back Hide by butting him. Hide tries to strike Aang two more times, but Aang slides behind Hide through his legs. Hide tries punching Aang two more times and falls down as Aang side steps and trips him. The Headmaster arrives, and Hide sniffles as he gets up to his knees. He is seen with tears in his eyes as the Headmaster talks.

title: The Headband
text: [Angrily.] Picking fights on your second day? We need to have a conference to discuss your punishment. Bring your parents to my office after school.

title: The Headband
text: [Worriedly.] Parents? But-

title: The Headband
text: Don't be late!

title: The Headband
text: The Headmaster walks off and Hide smirks behind his back. Cut to a picture of Ozai, and the camera pans to show the Headmaster sitting at his office.

title: The Headband
text: Thank you for coming, Mr. and Mrs ... [Shot changes to show Sokka in diguise with a large fake beard, and Katara in disguise with a different hairstyle and appearing pregnant, with Aang sitting between them.]

title: The Headband
text: [With an exaggerated accent.] Fire. [Stroking his beard.] Wang Fire. [Pointing to Katara.] This is my wife, Sapphire.

title: The Headband
text: Sapphire Fire. Nice to meet you.

title: The Headband
text: Mr. and Mrs ... Fire, your son has been enrolled here for two days and he's already causing problems. He's argued with his history teacher, disrupted music class, and roughed up my star pupil.

title: The Headband
text: My goodness! That doesn't sound like our Kuzon.

title: The Headband
text: That's what any mother would say, Ma'am. Nonetheless, you're forewarned; if he acts up one more time, I'll have him sent to reform school- [Stands up.] by which I mean the coal mines. Are we clear?

title: The Headband
text: Don't you worry, Mr. Headmaster. I'll straighten this boy out somethin' fierce! [Turns to Aang.] Young man, as soon as we get home you're gonna get the punishment of a lifetime! [Aang and Katara are visibly alarmed.]

title: The Headband
text: That's what I like to hear.

title: The Headband
text: They turn to leave, and the scene cuts to show Zuko and Mai sitting on a cliff side together, watching the sunset.

title: The Headband
text: Orange is such an awful color.

title: The Headband
text: [Snickers.] You're so beautiful when you hate the world.

title: The Headband
text: I don't hate you.

title: The Headband
text: I don't hate you too. [They kiss, but are interrupted by Azula.]

title: The Headband
text: Ahem. [They turn to look at her, clearly annoyed.] Zuko, could I have a word with you?

title: The Headband
text: Can't you see we're busy? [They kiss again.]

title: The Headband
text: Oh Mai, Ty Lee needs your help untangling her braid.

title: The Headband
text: [Stands up, smiling.] Sounds pretty serious. [Leaves, but throws an angry glance at Azula behind her back.]

title: The Headband
text: So, I've heard you've been to visit your uncle fatso in the prison tower.

title: The Headband
text: [Standing angrily.] That guard told you.

title: The Headband
text: No. You did. Just now.

title: The Headband
text: [Sits back down.] Okay, you caught me. What is it that you want, Azula?

title: The Headband
text: Actually, nothing. Believe it or not, I'm looking out for you. If people find out you've been to see Uncle, they'll think you're plotting with him. Just be careful, Dum-Dum.

title: The Headband
text: Cuts to the cave where the Team is gathered. Momo attempts to pounce on birds, but he misses and they scatter.

title: The Headband
text: [Frontal shot, still acting as Wang Fire.] That settles it! No more school for you, young man! [Strokes his beard.]

title: The Headband
text: I'm not ready to leave yet. I'm having fun for once, just being a normal kid. You don't know what it's like, Sokka. You get to be normal all the time.

title: The Headband
text: Ha ha! [Sokka glares at her.]

title: The Headband
text: Listen guys, those kids at school are the future of the Fire Nation. If we want to change this place for the better, we need to show them a little taste of freedom.

title: The Headband
text: What could you possibly do for a country of depraved little fire monsters?

title: The Headband
text: I'm gonna throw them, [Starts dancing.] a secret dance party! [Everybody stares at Aang.]

title: The Headband
text: [In Wang Fire voice.] Go to your room!

title: The Headband
text: Cut to the cave with candles on the sides. Toph earthbends a stage. Aang puts on his headband.

title: The Headband
text: [Placing a candle.] I can't believe we're having a dance party. It seems so ... silly.

title: The Headband
text: Don't think of it as a dance party, but as a cultural event celebrating the art of fancy footwork! [Dances.]

title: The Headband
text: Cut to a shot outside we see many pairs of feet as the guests arrive. Cut back to Toph.

title: The Headband
text: [Feeling their approach.] They're coming! Everyone stop bending.

title: The Headband
text: [To Appa.] Sorry buddy, you should probably wait out back. [Appa grumbles as Aang herds him into the back.] I know, you got fancier feet than anybody. And six of 'em! [Turns around with his hands on his hips, grinning widely.]

title: The Headband
text: Cut to several kids playing instruments on the earth platforms as the guests filter into the room.

title: The Headband
text: [Jumps in front of the stage.] Ladies and gentlemen, the Flamey-O's! [To himself.]Â Yeah, this ought to get everybody moving. [He looks around at the kids standing shyly at the edge of the cave.]

title: The Headband
text: Now what do we do?

title: The Headband
text: This is when you start dancing.

title: The Headband
text: [Shyly hiding his face behind his collar.] I don't think my parents want me dancing in a cave ...

title: The Headband
text: [Runs in front of the camera.] Yeah! What if someone finds out?! [Looks around nervously before exiting left.]

title: The Headband
text: Oh boy. Listen guys, dancing isn't something you think about. It's a form of self-expression that no one can ever take away from you.

title: The Headband
text: Maybe it was different in the colonies, Kuzon, but we don't do that here.

title: The Headband
text: Sure you do, you have for generations! It just so happens that I know several classic Fire Nation dances. A hundred years ago, this was known as the 'Phoenix Flight'. [The students ooh and aah as Aang runs low to the ground.] And, this was the 'Camelephant Strut'.

title: The Headband
text: Aang jumps from side to side and does a rolls close to two nearby girls as they giggle. Aang finishes the dance with a back flip, landing on one foot. The boys stare in awe at Aang. Cut to Toph and Katara, who drink out of ice cups.

title: The Headband
text: [To Katara.] Who knew Twinkle Toes could dance?

title: The Headband
text: Katara smiles. Cut to Zuko back into Iroh's cell.

title: The Headband
text: [Sliding food into Iroh's cell as Iroh keeps his back to him.] I brought you some komodo chicken. I know you don't care for it, but I figure it beats prison food. I admit it, I have everything I always wanted, but it's not as all how I thought it would be. The truth is, I need your advice. [Grips the bars.] I think the Avatar is still alive, I know he's out there, I'm losing my mind. [Iroh does not respond.Â Desperately.] Please, Uncle, I'm so confused I need your help. [Iroh still has nothing to say to him. Angrily.] Forget it, I'll solve it myself! Waste away in here for all I care! [He glances back before leaving, and a tear slides down Iroh's face.]

title: The Headband
text: Cut back to the cave, where Aang is still dancing, spinning through the air. Aang offers his hand to On Ji, who blushes and accepts. He pulls her to the middle of the room.

title: The Headband
text: And this is how they do it in the ballrooms of Ba Sing Se. [He starts tapping his feet from side to side and On Ji joins him.]

title: The Headband
text: [Watching as Aang dances with On Ji.] Wow, they look pretty good together.

title: The Headband
text: [Barely hiding her envy as she looks away.] Eh, if that's what you like ... [She looks back surreptitiously.]

title: The Headband
text: Yeah, that's it! That's the sound of happy feet. [The rest of the kids start dancing with them.] All right, go with that! Everybody freestyle!

title: The Headband
text: One student dances crazily. Another student, standing amid a group of non-dancers, starts moving his arms and Shoji sways his head with the rhythm. Aang runs over to Katara and holds his hand out to her, inviting her to dance.

title: The Headband
text: [Looks away nervously.] I don't know, Aang. [Starts nervously pulling her hair.] These shoes aren't really right for dancing, and I-I'm not sure that I know how to-

title: The Headband
text: [Smiling.] Take my hand.

title: The Headband
text: [Smiles back.] Okay.

title: The Headband
text: He pulls her out into the room and whispers into her ear, and everybody stops to stare at them as the two extend their arms to each other and begin circling each other and performing dance moves.

title: The Headband
text: [Looking around.] Aang, everyone's watching.

title: The Headband
text: Don't worry about them. [Smiles.] It's just you and me right now.

title: The Headband
text: Katara blushes as they began to move around each other in an elaborate dance. The dance incorporates different moves including kicks and flips. At one point they come close together as if they are about to kiss, both just smile and continue on. Aang finishes the dance by catching Katara as she leans over his arm. Cut to a close-up view of them smiling at each other as they pant and sweat. The camera cuts to show the Headmaster and several soldiers coming to the cave.

title: The Headband
text: It is a dancing party. [Turns to Hide standing behind him.] You did the right thing by telling me, Hide.

title: The Headband
text: [Bows.] Anytime, Headmaster sir.

title: The Headband
text: The camera cuts back to the dancing kids.

title: The Headband
text: [Waving a hand in the air.] This is incredible! It's like my inhibitions just disappear! [He sees the Headmaster come into the cave, and immediately stops dancing and attempts to shrink into his robes.] Okay, they're back again.

title: The Headband
text: Aang continues to dance past as everyone else stops until the Headmaster talks.

title: The Headband
text: [Pointing.] He's the one we want! The boy with the headband!

title: The Headband
text: Uh-oh. [Aang starts running away through the crowd as the soldiers chase him. One soldier sees a boy with a headband, and grabs him.]

title: The Headband
text: Gotcha! [The boy turns, but the guard is confused upon seeing a different boy there.]

title: The Headband
text: Looking for me?

title: The Headband
text: Cut to the Headmaster and Hide.

title: The Headband
text: That's not the one. He's here somewhere. Don't let him leave the cave!

title: The Headband
text: The Headmaster points toward the back of the cave, Hide imitating him. Cut to two soldiers who continue searching. One soldier sees another kid with a headband, and turns her around. He is again confused upon seeing her face.

title: The Headband
text: Yes?

title: The Headband
text: Another soldier sees two more children standing next to each other with headbands and turns them both around.

title: The Headband
text: [Picking his nose.] Hi there.

title: The Headband
text: How're we doing?

title: The Headband
text: The Headmaster sees who he thinks is Aang in the crowd, and goes after him himself. Shoving people out of the way, he scoops up the boy in the crowd.

title: The Headband
text: Looking for someone?

title: The Headband
text: The Headmaster looks around in horror as he sees all the children are now wearing headbands.

title: The Headband
text: Who are you looking for?

title: The Headband
text: Do you need something?

title: The Headband
text: Over here.

title: The Headband
text: The students completely surround the soldiers and the Headmaster as Aang escapes through the back of the cave. Shoji winks at Aang, who bows in return. Aang leaves and earthbends the back of the cave shut, at which Shoji drops his jaw in astonishment.

title: The Headband
text: Cut to the Headmaster surrounded by guards where two of them have started dancing.

title: The Headband
text: [To one of the soldiers, who starts dancing.] Stop that! [To another soldier, who is tapping her foot.] Stop that!

title: The Headband
text: Cut to outside the cave where the team flies away on Appa.

title: The Headband
text: We're safe Sokka, you can take off the mustache now.

title: The Headband
text: [He is seen with his Wang Fire mustache on and begins stroking it.] Oh, no I can't. It's permanently glued to my skin.

title: The Headband
text: [To Aang.] Way to go, dancy pants. I think you really did help those kids, you taught them to be free.

title: The Headband
text: I don't know, it was just a dance party, that's all.

title: The Headband
text: Well, that was some dance party Aang. [She kisses him on the cheek, and Aang blushes.]

title: The Headband
text: [Clapping lightly.] Flamey-o sir, flamey-o.

title: The Headband
text: Cut to Zuko walking alone in a dark alley. He lowers his hood as a huge man with a metal leg approaches him.

title: The Headband
text: You're sure you weren't followed? I've heard about you. They say you're good at what you do, and even better at keeping secrets. The Avatar is alive. I want you to find him, and end him.

title: The Headband
text: The man's face is shown. The camera zooms in on a strange third eye tattooed on his forehead. Fade to credits.

title: The Headband
text: Aang

title: The Painted Lady
text: The episode opens with Appa, the gang in his saddle, slogging his way down the course of the sludge-infested river Jang Hui in the Fire Nation. Aang and Momo are frolicking in the putrescent water.

title: The Painted Lady
text: Momo! [Dives into the water.] Oh Momo! [Dives again and Momo flies to Aang.] Hahahahaha! You found me, buddy! [Looks down at the water in distaste and airbends up to Appa's saddle, where he stands dripping in sludge.] Hey guys, I think this river's polluted. [Airbends mud off himself, splattering the rest of Team Avatar with mud, which causes them to cry out in disgust.]

title: The Painted Lady
text: [Tastes mud on her mouth, and spits.] Pah! Plegh! [Aang airbends again, blowing the rest of the mud back into the river and messing up their hair.]

title: The Painted Lady
text: Well that explains why I can't catch a fish around here, because normally my fishing skills are off the hook! [Holds up a fishing hook. The gang is unamused as Aang sits back down.] Get it? Like a fishing hook? [Grinning.]

title: The Painted Lady
text: [Countering.] Too bad your skills aren't on the hook.

title: The Painted Lady
text: Toph, Aang, and Katara laugh as Sokka makes a disgruntled face.

title: The Painted Lady
text: It looks like we'll need to go somewhere else to get food, [Unrolls a long scroll in front of her.] assuming that'll fit into Sokka's master schedule.

title: The Painted Lady
text: Hmmm ... It's doable. But that means only two potty breaks today.

title: The Painted Lady
text: Hey, maybe we can get food there! [Points at a village in the middle of the river.]

title: The Painted Lady
text: The camera zooms to the village and fades to Appa as Aang hides him under a mat of grass.

title: The Painted Lady
text: Now you look just like a little hill with horns! Bye, buddy!

title: The Painted Lady
text: Appa groans as Momo briefly reveals himself under some more grass nearby. Scene changes to the Jang Hui River, while Toph, Katara, Aang, and Sokka approach the river.

title: The Painted Lady
text: I don't feel anything. Where is the village?

title: The Painted Lady
text: It's in the middle of the river! [Pointing at the village.]

title: The Painted Lady
text: Camera pans down to show a man standing on a ferry.

title: The Painted Lady
text: Sure is! My name's Dock. Mind if I ask who you are?

title: The Painted Lady
text: We're um ... from the Earth Kingdom colonies.

title: The Painted Lady
text: Wow ... Colonials. Hop on, I give you ride in the town.

title: The Painted Lady
text: The scene changes to the river, while Dock paddles the boat across.

title: The Painted Lady
text: Why do you guys live on the river? [Looking at the village.]

title: The Painted Lady
text: [Turns his paddle to the right side, pointing at the Fire Nation factory.] Because we're a fishing town. At least that's how it was before the factory moved in. [Closer shot of the Fire Nation factory and pans down.] Army makes their metal there. Moved in a few years ago and started gunking up our river. [Shot changes back to the ferry. Aang and Katara glance sadly at each other.] Now our little village is struggling to survive.

title: The Painted Lady
text: The camera pans downs to the villagers, showing their conditions of poverty and starvation. Team Avatar gets off the ferry boat.

title: The Painted Lady
text: Thanks for the ride! [Waves his hand to Dock, who waves back.]

title: The Painted Lady
text: [Cut to three villagers sitting on a porch.] Look at this place. [Cut to two other villagers, an old man and a young boy.] It's so sad. [Cut back to Katara looking down.] We have to do something to help.

title: The Painted Lady
text: No, we can't waste our time here. We have a bigger mission that we need to stay focused on. These people are on their own.

title: The Painted Lady
text: [Chases Sokka and grabs his shoulder.] These people are starving! But you'd turn your back on them? [Puts her hands on her hips.] How can you be so cold and heartless?

title: The Painted Lady
text: [Shot changes to show their argument from the river as a barrel bobs up and down.] I'm not turning my back, I'm just being realistic. We can't go around helping every rinky-dink town we wander into. We'll be helping them all by taking out the Fire Lord. [Aang guides Toph toward the arguing siblings.]

title: The Painted Lady
text: [Covering Sokka's mouth with her hand.] Hey, loud mouths! Maybe we should be a little quieter when we talk aboutÂ  [Quietly.] "taking out the Fire Lord."

title: The Painted Lady
text: Come on, Katara, be reasonable about this. You know our mission has to come first.

title: The Painted Lady
text: [Reluctantly.] I guess so. [Looks annoyed.]

title: The Painted Lady
text: Let's just get what we need and go. [Smiling to Katara, who smiles back.]

title: The Painted Lady
text: Cut to an aerial view of the village. The shot changes to show the counter of an outdoor market stall. As Team Avatar walks up to it, they notice a man who looks like Dock, but wearing a different hat, bowed behind the counter.

title: The Painted Lady
text: Hey, Dock. You work here too?

title: The Painted Lady
text: I'm not Dock. I'm Xu! Dock's my brother.

title: The Painted Lady
text: Team Avatar looks confused.

title: The Painted Lady
text: But we just saw you. You're even wearing the same clothes. [Close-up of his hat.] The only difference is your hat.

title: The Painted Lady
text: [Camera zooms out to Xu talking.] Dock works on the docks. That's why we call him, "Dock", and I work in the shop, that's why they call me, "Xu"!

title: The Painted Lady
text: I don't get it.

title: The Painted Lady
text: Me neither. [Jumps down behind the counter and pulls out a crate filled with rancid gray seafood.] What I can getcha? [Katara, Aang, and Sokka look disgusted.] Hey, I'll give you a special deal. If you buy three fish, I'll give you a clam for free. [Sokka pushes a clam, and mucus splashes out from it.]

title: The Painted Lady
text: Aang and Katara both recoil, muttering in disgust.

title: The Painted Lady
text: [Picks up three fish. Carefully.] We'll just take the fish. [Xu takes the fish.] Mind telling your brother we need a ride back to shore? [Xu jumps down behind the counter and jumps up wearing Dock's hat.]

title: The Painted Lady
text: Hey, colonials! My brother says you need a lift. [Jumps over the counter, and walks to the dock.]

title: The Painted Lady
text: Team Avatar follows Dock to the dock. A little boy stops Katara.

title: The Painted Lady
text: Can you spare some food?

title: The Painted Lady
text: [Touched.] I wish I could help more. [Gives the boy a fish, and the boy bows to her and leaves to give the fish to his sick mother.]

title: The Painted Lady
text: Fade to nighttime, as the camera shows an aerial view of Team Avatar's camp. Shot changes to show a barrel of polluted water. Aang lifts the water with waterbending and Toph separates the pollutants from the water with earthbending. Aang passes the water to Katara, who boils it in a crock.

title: The Painted Lady
text: Our detour into town today has completely thrown off our schedule. It's gonna take some serious finagling to get us back on track.

title: The Painted Lady
text: [Sarcastically.] Finagle away, oh schedule master.

title: The Painted Lady
text: Well, for starters, it looks like we'll need to wake up forty-three minutes earlier every day.

title: The Painted Lady
text: Forty-three minutes?

title: The Painted Lady
text: [Pointing to various spots on his schedule.] Look, we only have a few weeks to get to the Fire Lord in time for the invasion and the eclipse, which, by the way, only lasts for eight minutes. And we just lost a whole day. So if we want to make up the time and stay on schedule, we have to wake up early!

title: The Painted Lady
text: Well I'm not waking up early.

title: The Painted Lady
text: Or we could just cut out all of our eating breaks.

title: The Painted Lady
text: What?

title: The Painted Lady
text: No way!

title: The Painted Lady
text: Forget it!

title: The Painted Lady
text: [Gets a sly look on his face.] I got it, how's this from now on, we'll take food breaks and potty breaks at the same time.

title: The Painted Lady
text: Katara, Toph, and Aang express their disgust at this idea with Aang doing a spit take.

title: The Painted Lady
text: Hey, it might be gross, but it's efficient. Either way, we have to leave here first thing tomorrow morning.

title: The Painted Lady
text: Close-up of Katara's face, who looks distraught at Sokka's words. Cut to an aerial view of the village the following morning and cut to the campsite. Appa lies on his side, groaning, while Katara ministers to him.

title: The Painted Lady
text: What's the matter Katara?

title: The Painted Lady
text: I think Appa's sick.

title: The Painted Lady
text: [Panicking.] What? Appa's sick? That's awful!

title: The Painted Lady
text: Wow, Sokka, I didn't realize you cared so much.

title: The Painted Lady
text: Of course I care. I might as well just throw our schedule away now. [Pulls out his schedule. He stops and looks at the group. Cut to a shot of the rest of the gang giving him the evil eye, and he quickly changes his tone, rushing solicitously to Appa's side.] And I'm concerned because my big, furry friend doesn't feel well.

title: The Painted Lady
text: He must have gotten sick from being in the polluted water.

title: The Painted Lady
text: He doesn't look sick. You okay, buddy? [Appa groans and Aang pulls out Appa's purple tongue.] His tongue is purple! That can't be good. Katara, can you heal him?

title: The Painted Lady
text: It looks like he needs some medicine. Maybe we can find the right herbs in town.

title: The Painted Lady
text: Momo arrives and attempts to lick Appa's tongue before being pulled off by Aang. Cut to the village, which is bustling and lively. One villager pole vaults from one house to another.

title: The Painted Lady
text: Is it just me, or does this place seem different?

title: The Painted Lady
text: Yeah, are the people ... happier?

title: The Painted Lady
text: The little boy from the previous day runs by, bouncing a ball, and Katara smiles to herself. The kids walk up to Xu/Dock's market.

title: The Painted Lady
text: Hey, Xu, what's going on with everyone today?

title: The Painted Lady
text: [Drinks from a ladle.] Ah, something amazing happened last night. Food was delivered to our village by a mysterious and wonderful person ... the Painted Lady.

title: The Painted Lady
text: The Painted who now?

title: The Painted Lady
text: The Painted Lady. [He places a miniature statuette of the spirit down on the counter.] She's part of our town's lore. They say she's a river spirit who watches over our town in times of need. I always thought she was just a legend. Until now.

title: The Painted Lady
text: See, we don't need to help these people, they already have someone to help them. All we need is medicine for our sick friend.

title: The Painted Lady
text: Medicine? Sorry, all the medicine we have goes to the factory. That's why there's so many sick people in our village.

title: The Painted Lady
text: Looks like we need to stay another night so Appa can rest.

title: The Painted Lady
text: [Sighs.] I guess you're right. You got any more food to sell?

title: The Painted Lady
text: [Goes under the counter and emerges holding a fish in each hand.] Would you like the one-headed fish, or the two-headed fish? [He turns the fish on the left sideways to show the second head.]

title: The Painted Lady
text: [Ponders.] Two-headed! [The rest of the group lowers their heads and small sweat drops appear.] What? You get more for your money that way! [Holds up the polluted fish.]

title: The Painted Lady
text: The rest of the group get even bigger exaggerated sweat drops as they express their disgust and run away from Sokka who follows behind with the polluted fish.

title: The Painted Lady
text: Thank you, Painted Lady.

title: The Painted Lady
text: The lady stops and nods her head before disappearing into the water. Cut to the village, the next day. Dock polishes his figurine with a rag as Sokka steps up to the counter.

title: The Painted Lady
text: Hi, Dock. Is Xu around?

title: The Painted Lady
text: Let me check ... [He runs around the shop and ducks beneath the counter to switch hats.] Hey there! Back again, are ya?

title: The Painted Lady
text: [Pushes Sokka away.] We need more food. [Slams the money on the counter.] Our friend is still sick and we can't leave until he's better.

title: The Painted Lady
text: Xu obligingly presents them with a platter of polluted clams. The camera pans in on the clams. Sokka comically slides in behind them and gives silent chuckle along with a comical annoyed symbol on his forehead. It appears he has an idea brewing.

title: The Painted Lady
text: Oh, well, that's too bad. Maybe if you guys are lucky, the Painted Lady will visit you in the night, and heal your friend.

title: The Painted Lady
text: [Picks up the clams. Sarcastically.] And maybe she'll cook us a midnight snack, and we'll all have a sing-along.

title: The Painted Lady
text: [Not getting the sarcasm. Sokka looks annoyed now.] Yeah, maybe! You know, last night she visited us again. Healed most of our sick folks.

title: The Painted Lady
text: Is that why this place seems so festive?

title: The Painted Lady
text: A villagers raises a large statue of the Painted Lady in the town square, everyone cheers and applause.

title: The Painted Lady
text: Yep, it's all because of the Painted Lady.

title: The Painted Lady
text: Can you believe how much an entire village can be affected by one lady I mean ... spirit?

title: The Painted Lady
text: Well, I hope she returns every night. Otherwise this place would go right back to the way it was.

title: The Painted Lady
text: [Gets annoyed.] Why would you say that? Look how much better off these people are.

title: The Painted Lady
text: Yeah, now, but without her they wouldn't be able to fend for themselves. If she really wanted to help, she would use her spirit magic to blow up that factory. [He makes mocking gestures to indicate explosive spirit magic. He crosses his arms with a smile. Katara gets even more annoyed. The screen pans to the right to show Aang who has his arms crossed not impressed.]

title: The Painted Lady
text: Spirit magic doesn't work that way, Sokka. It's more like ... [He waves his body with arms in the air making similar gestures to indicate spirit magic. Katara storms away from the two.]

title: The Painted Lady
text: [Sokka wraps and arm over Aang's shoulder and the two combined their little imitation but far more ridiculous.] Wooooooooo ... [Sokka chuckles.]

title: The Painted Lady
text: Cut to Katara on the edge of a dock looking out toward the factory. Cut to the campsite, that night. Katara slips out of her sleeping bag and stuffs dried grass into it to disguise her absence. She dons a makeshift Painted Lady costume, wrapping a ragged gown around her. Katara bends the water to make a mirror so she can apply the markings. She puts on a wide conical hat similar to the Painted Lady's, but with a diaphanous white veil covering her face. She glides away toward the village, but not quietly enough; she wakes Momo, and he wakes Aang by jumping on him.

title: The Painted Lady
text: What's the matter, buddy? [Katara leaves Team Avatar.] It's her! [Excited, waves his hand to Katara and puts on his headband.] Hello, Painted Lady Spirit!

title: The Painted Lady
text: Katara shocked, quickly flees from Aang. Meanwhile, Aang uses his airbending to accelerate his run. The camera moves to a hill as Katara climbs up and continues on as Aang easily keeps up.

title: The Painted Lady
text: [Jumps up the hill.] Excuse me, I don't mean to bother you, but my friend's sick and we're on kind of a tight schedule. [Continues to follow her down the hill as she crosses the river.] Wait! But I'm a great bridge between your world and mine! [Aang freezes some water to form stepping stones to cross the river.] I know Hei Bai! We're close personal friends! [Katara moves faster, and Aang jumps on a wooden bridge. Katara runs out of the river onto the docks and notices Aang's reflection in the water. She looks up and sees Aang running across a roof.] Heeey! [He suddenly hits a pole, Katara flinches and feels sorry for him but continues on across the river to the other side. She stops to look out at the village thinking she is safe but Aang drops in front of her.] My name's Aang. I'm the Avatar. [Lifts his headband and points at his arrow.]

title: The Painted Lady
text: [Using a disguised voice.] Well, hello Avatar. I wish I could talk, but I am very busy.

title: The Painted Lady
text: Yeah, me too. I hate that. [Looks at Katara's face from behind the veil.] You know, you're really pretty, for a spirit. I don't meet too many spirits, but the ones I do meet, not very attractive. [Looks at Katara suspiciously. Tries to look under the hat.]

title: The Painted Lady
text: [Giggles nervously.] Thank you, but-

title: The Painted Lady
text: You seem familiar too.

title: The Painted Lady
text: A lot of people say that.

title: The Painted Lady
text: [Suspicious.] No, you really seem familiar.

title: The Painted Lady
text: Look, I really should get going. [Covers her face and runs, but Aang uses his airbending and blasts her hat up into the air, exposing her.]

title: The Painted Lady
text: Katara?

title: The Painted Lady
text: [Guiltily.] Hi, Aang.

title: The Painted Lady
text: [Shocked.] You're the Painted Lady? [Pointing at Katara.] But how?

title: The Painted Lady
text: I wasn't her at first, I was just trying to help the village. [Takes her hat off.] But since everyone thought that's who I was anyway, I guess I just kinda became her. [Drops her hat on the ground.]

title: The Painted Lady
text: So you've been sneaking out at night? Wait, is Appa even sick?

title: The Painted Lady
text: He might be sick of the purple berries I've been feeding him, but other than that he's fine!

title: The Painted Lady
text: I can't believe you lied to everyone, so you could help these people.

title: The Painted Lady
text: I'm sorry, I know I shouldn't have ...

title: The Painted Lady
text: [Happily.] No, I think it's great! You're like a secret hero!

title: The Painted Lady
text: Well, if you wanna help, there's one more thing I have to do.

title: The Painted Lady
text: Aang gives her a curious look. Cut to the Fire Nation factory. Aang and Katara run along the river's edge toward it. Aang looks at the polluted water.

title: The Painted Lady
text: You wanna destroy this factory?

title: The Painted Lady
text: Yes. Sokka was just kidding, but he was right. Getting rid of this factory is the only way to help these people permanently.

title: The Painted Lady
text: Aang and Katara enter and move to different sides of the factory. Katara uses waterbending to cut the metal hooks that hang barrels of a magma. Aang, with protective gloves on, overturns bigger hanging barrels, smiling at his work. Aang uses earthbending to break apart the pipe system in the factory. Katara bends a huge wave of water through the windows and floods the factory. The scene cuts to outside as the factory explodes from within and muck stops flowing from the pipes. Cut to Aang and Katara walking back to their campsite. Aang laughs and makes explosion noises.

title: The Painted Lady
text: Shhh! [Quietly.] We don't wanna wake Sokka. [She turns and sees that Sokka and Toph are awake.] Hi, Sokka, we were just out on a morning walk!

title: The Painted Lady
text: [Angrily and disappointed.] Oh, really? A morning walk? [Dumps the hay out of Katara's sleeping bag.] I know you're the Painted Lady, I know you've been sneaking out at night, and I know you've been lying about Appa and been feeding him [Sticks out his own tongue.] purpleising tongue berries! [Toph sticks out her tongue and shows that it is purple and holds up a bag of berries which Momo starts eating.] Katara, what you did put our whole mission in jeopardy. We're leaving right now!

title: The Painted Lady
text: Katara walks past Sokka sadly. Sokka confronts Aang as he follows.

title: The Painted Lady
text: And how long did you know about this?

title: The Painted Lady
text: [Defensively.] Hey, I just found out this morning!

title: The Painted Lady
text: Aang sprints away with airbending. The scene changes to the Fire Nation factory where a man can be seen coming out of the smoke and looking angrily toward the town. Cut to Team Avatar packing, but they pause when they hear buzzing. The factory workers are shown headed for the town on jet skis. Cut to the gang on a cliff looking down at the river below.

title: The Painted Lady
text: [Approaching and kneeling down with the others.] What's going on?

title: The Painted Lady
text: Fire Nation soldiers are heading toward the village!

title: The Painted Lady
text: [To Katara.] What did you do?

title: The Painted Lady
text: I kind of destroyed their factory.

title: The Painted Lady
text: You what?

title: The Painted Lady
text: [Defensively.] It was your idea!

title: The Painted Lady
text: I was joking! I also said to use spirit magic and made funny noises! [Slaps his forehead.] Did you even think this through? The army is gonna blame the villagers! They're headed there right now to get revenge!

title: The Painted Lady
text: Well, what was I supposed to do?

title: The Painted Lady
text: Leave! Do nothing!

title: The Painted Lady
text: [Angrily.] No, I will never, ever turn my back on people who need me! [Gets up.] I'm going down to that village, and I am gonna do whatever I can.

title: The Painted Lady
text: As Katara walks away, Sokka stops her by putting his hand on her shoulder.

title: The Painted Lady
text: Wait! I'm coming, too.

title: The Painted Lady
text: I thought you didn't want to help.

title: The Painted Lady
text: You need me, and I will never turn my back on you.

title: The Painted Lady
text: Sokka, you really do have a heart. [The two hug.]

title: The Painted Lady
text: [Wiping away tears.] He really does have a heart, doesn't he?

title: The Painted Lady
text: Aang turns to Toph for confirmation. Toph, however, elbows him and he falls off camera with a thump. Cut to the Fire Nation soldiers on jet skis. Cut to Team Avatar looking at the village. Cut to Mung and his soldiers standing on the dock.

title: The Painted Lady
text: I thought we could live as neighbors, in peace. But I guess I was wrong. You steal our food, our medicine ... and then you destroy our factory.

title: The Painted Lady
text: [Pops out of the crowd wearing Dock hat.] We didn't do any of that. [Pops out in a different place wearing his Xu hat.] Yeah, the Painted Lady brought us food. She's the one that healed our sick, not your medicine.

title: The Painted Lady
text: [Holding a statuette.] Oh, right, the mysterious Painted Lady did it. And I suppose she drew the army emblem on your containers, too. [Throws the statuette at the container, smashing it. The crowd gasps.] This is a town of thieves and liars! [Firebends a blast at a house. Mockingly.] Where's your Painted Lady now? We're going to cure the world of this wretched village.

title: The Painted Lady
text: The soldiers begin demolishing the town. A jet ski, with two soldiers, goes past a dock as a soldier sends a hook and chain toward it. The chain wraps around a log holding up a house and it breaks as the jet ski drives away. The house crumbles into the water. Cut to two soldiers who light a large flammable ball perched on a buoy in the river, but a mysterious gust of wind blows out the fire, twice.

title: The Painted Lady
text: Light it again!

title: The Painted Lady
text: They follow Mung's command, and it is blown out again. Eerie flute music begins floating over the water.

title: The Painted Lady
text: Look at that! Where's it coming from?

title: The Painted Lady
text: Cut to a heavy fog rapidly pouring in.

title: The Painted Lady
text: I don't know. Something strange is going on.

title: The Painted Lady
text: An ominous growling noise echoes over the river.

title: The Painted Lady
text: It's the Painted Lady. [Grins slyly. Ominous tone.] She's coming.

title: The Painted Lady
text: There is no Painted Lady!

title: The Painted Lady
text: A repetitive thudding noise, as of giant footsteps, has begun. Pan over the river to the further bank where we see that the thudding is caused by Toph elevating and dropping a large boulder, while Appa provides the growling. Sokka mans the flute, producing eerie noises.

title: The Painted Lady
text: What is that sound?

title: The Painted Lady
text: Maybe it is her.

title: The Painted Lady
text: The fog parts dramatically to reveal Katara in full Painted Lady regalia. She pauses a moment and rushes toward the soldiers with a burst of waterbending. She alights on the dock and slowly approaches them.

title: The Painted Lady
text: Do something! [Pushes his soldiers forward. As they timidly draw near, they are rattled by a blast of airbending. Aang is shown hiding beneath the dock. The two soldiers run off. To the remaining soldiers.] Stand your ground! [Katara waterbends two jet skis into a nearby cliff. As she raises her hand to wreak further damage, the soldiers jump into the remaining jet skis and speed off, leaving Mung.] I'll take care of you myself.

title: The Painted Lady
text: He bends an arc of fire at Katara, we see it advance toward her in slow motion. Aang, still concealed beneath the dock, sends Katara flying into the sky on a column of air; the flame passes harmlessly beneath her. Aang rends the dock in two with a blast of wind, sending Mung flying into the river. As he flounders, Katara rises out of the polluted water before him and raises her arms threateningly.

title: The Painted Lady
text: Leave this village and never come back.

title: The Painted Lady
text: He swims desperately away from her. A stray jet ski passes by and he clambers into it; the ski buzzes off. Sokka and Toph row toward the village as the people applaud Katara as she returns to the dock.

title: The Painted Lady
text: I knew you'd come.

title: The Painted Lady
text: Thank you!

title: The Painted Lady
text: Painted Lady, you're the best!

title: The Painted Lady
text: Me and my brothers really owe you a lot. [Looking at her and her faded Painted Lady marks.] Hey, wait a minute! I know you! You're not the Painted Lady, you're that colonial girl!

title: The Painted Lady
text: Katara places a hand on her face and realizes her make-up is smudged.

title: The Painted Lady
text: Yeah, you're the lady that gave me a fish.

title: The Painted Lady
text: [Angrily.] You've been tricking us. You're a waterbender!

title: The Painted Lady
text: She's a waterbender!

title: The Painted Lady
text: How dare you act like our Painted Lady!

title: The Painted Lady
text: The crowd surges forward in anger. Sokka runs forward to intervene.

title: The Painted Lady
text: Maybe she is a waterbender, but she was just trying to help you. Because of her, that factory won't be polluting your river, and the army is gone. You should be down on your knees thanking her!

title: The Painted Lady
text: Sokka, it's okay. [She steps forward and moves Sokka back. To the villagers.] I shouldn't have acted like someone I wasn't, and I shouldn't have tricked you. But I felt like I had to do something. It doesn't matter if the Painted Lady is real or not. Because your problems are real, and this river is real. You can't wait around for someone to help you. You have to help yourself.

title: The Painted Lady
text: She's right, but what should we do?

title: The Painted Lady
text: [Pops out from behind the little boy's mother and uses a lower voice.] Maybe we can clean the river!

title: The Painted Lady
text: Yeah, we can clean the river! [The crowd cheers.] Thank you. You know, you're not so bad for a waterbender.

title: The Painted Lady
text: You wouldn't mind keeping that a secret, by the way, would you?

title: The Painted Lady
text: No problem. Keeping my mouth shut is a personal specialty. My brother Xu, on the other hand, ohh, he's a blabbermouth. [Sokka facepalms.]

title: The Painted Lady
text: So, Dock, are you gonna help us clean?

title: The Painted Lady
text: No, ma'am. I'm going to get my other brother, Bushi. He loves cleaning rivers. [Dock brazenly switches hats right in front of them.] All right, I'm Bushi! Let's get some river cleaning done!

title: The Painted Lady
text: Aha, I knew it! I knew you were the same guy. You're the shop owner and the boat guy.

title: The Painted Lady
text: Oh, you must be talking about my brothers, Dock and Xu.

title: The Painted Lady
text: [Annoyed.] No, I just saw you! You switched hats and called yourself a different name!

title: The Painted Lady
text: [Annoyed.] Oh, you know who does that? My brother, Dock. [Conspiratorial whisper.] He's crazy. [Goes off chuckling.]

title: The Painted Lady
text: Aang fumes in annoyance. Cut to an aerial view of the village with boats in the surrounding river. The shot changes to the boats on the river as the villagers spread clean out the pollutants. Katara bends the water into a large vat while Aang and Toph separate the pollutants using earthbending and putting it in a large boat. Cut to an aerial view of the village as the day passes by and the river becomes cleaner. Cut to Team Avatar's campsite at night. Katara sits on an overlook of the river when suddenly clouds of fog appear and the real Painted Lady emerges.

title: The Painted Lady
text: Thank you. [Slowly disappears.]

title: The Painted Lady
text: Katara is first shocked, but she smiles. Fade to credits.

title: The Painted Lady
text: Aang

title: Sokka's Master
text: The episode begins a shot of a meteor shower. Camera pans down with Aang, Katara, Toph and Sokka watching the meteor shower.

title: Sokka's Master
text: Wow, this is amazing to watch.

title: Sokka's Master
text: Cut closer to a side-view of the group.

title: Sokka's Master
text: Kind of makes you realize how insignificant we are.

title: Sokka's Master
text: [Close-up. Causally.] Eh, you've seen nothing once, you've seen it a thousand times.

title: Sokka's Master
text: Cut further away showing the meteor shower above them. They see a big meteor heading for the ground and let out gasps of amazement.

title: Sokka's Master
text: Oh man, [Close-up. Standing.] you've never not seen anything like this.

title: Sokka's Master
text: The others, minus Toph, stand up next to him. Cut to panning shot as the meteor flies past. Cut to overhead shot of meteor as it flies past the group. Cut to side-view of the group as the meteor passes over head. Cut to Sokka as he turns to see the meteor crash nearby. Cut to the other side of a hill as Toph climbs up. Cut to wide shot as the camera zooms out with the group looking toward the crash site. Frontal view of Aang, Katara and Sokka who look at each other concerned. Cut to the team arriving at the crash site on Appa.

title: Sokka's Master
text: The fire is gonna destroy that town!

title: Sokka's Master
text: Not if we can stop it!

title: Sokka's Master
text: Cut to Appa landing next to the crash site. Everyone but Katara jumps off.

title: Sokka's Master
text: [Jumps onto Appa's head, taking the reins.] There's a creek over here. I'll bend the water onto the fire. [Signals Appa to take off.]

title: Sokka's Master
text: [Frontal view of Toph, Sokka, and Aang.] Toph, let's make a trench to stop the fire from coming any closer.

title: Sokka's Master
text: Toph and Aang move off. Sokka looks down.

title: Sokka's Master
text: What should I do?

title: Sokka's Master
text: Cut to view from Sokka's perspective as Toph and Aang stop to respond. Momo flies by.

title: Sokka's Master
text: [Slight pause, points at Momo.] Keep an eye on Momo.

title: Sokka's Master
text: Cut to aerial view of Sokka. Momo lands on his shoulder.

title: Sokka's Master
text: So what, I'm just a lemur sitter? [Pets Momo; sarcastically.] There, there, feel better?

title: Sokka's Master
text: Cut to Aang and Toph as they begin to earthbend. Cut to aerial shot as a trench forms. Briefly cut back to Aang and Toph continuing to earthbend. Cut to aerial shot as they finish the trench, pushing the fire back. Cut to aerial view of Sokka as flames fly near him and land on the ground. Sokka puts out one with his machete, however Momo ups him by putting out five in the same time, much to his dismay. Cut to Katara on Appa flying over a river. Katara grabs some water and they return to the crash site. Cut to side-view of Katara, on Appa, with a large globule of water following behind. Frontal view of Katara as she begins to waterbend the water behind her. Side-view of the crash site as Sokka and Momo look on while Katara puts out some of the fire with her waterbending. Cut to Toph beginning to earthbend. Cut to aerial view of her and the nearby crash site as she uses earthbending to put some of the fire out. Cut to Sokka, who sits, watching, along with Momo as the earth Toph is using rolls past. Cut to Aang as Appa flies past with Katara. Katara gives Aang some water to bend.waterbending and airbending to put the rest of the fire out, but the water hits Sokka and Aang's blast also makes it snow.

title: Sokka's Master
text: Sokka, stand clear!

title: Sokka's Master
text: [Side-view of the crash site with Sokka and Momo looking left.] Right. [Picks up Momo and makes to move away.] Staying clear, got it.

title: Sokka's Master
text: Cut to Aang as he begins to use both the water and airbending. Cut to frontal view of Sokka still walking away as the water overwhelms him. Cut to aerial view of the crash site as the water expands to put out the fire. The dome of water explodes into snow. Cut to frontal view of Aang as Appa, along with Katara, lands behind him as Toph walks toward him, too.

title: Sokka's Master
text: Good work, everybody.

title: Sokka's Master
text: Aerial view of the town and crash site. Cut to Sokka as he emerges from a pile of snow. Momo slides across the icy surface.

title: Sokka's Master
text: Look at you, [Frontal view.] you're just a fat, disgusting old man. [Panning aerial view from behind.] You do nothing, you say nothing, you just eat and roll around in your own filth like a pig. [Frontal view of Poon as Iroh continues to eat.] You're a disgrace. [Spits on the floor in front of him and leaves.]

title: Sokka's Master
text: Frontal view of Iroh as the door shuts. Close-up of Iroh as he stops eating. Iroh moves his hair out of his face. Cut to a frontal view further away as he sits up and starts eating like a normal person, not eating anything from the floor as the camera pans out.

title: Sokka's Master
text: These people have no idea [Closer side-view of the three.] how close they were to getting toasted last night.

title: Sokka's Master
text: Yeah, the worst thing about being in disguise is that we don't get the hero worship anymore. I miss the love.

title: Sokka's Master
text: [Sarcastically.] Boo-hoo, [Shot of Sokka from behind looking back.] poor heroes. [Turns away.]

title: Sokka's Master
text: Frontal view of Sokka with the others sat further behind him.

title: Sokka's Master
text: What's your problem? You haven't even touched your smoked sea slug.

title: Sokka's Master
text: It's just, all you guys can do this awesome bending stuff like putting out forest fires, and flying around and [Side-view of Toph, Aang and Katara.] making other stuff fly around. I can't fly around, okay? [View of Sokka from behind.] I can't do anything.

title: Sokka's Master
text: Side-view of the group.

title: Sokka's Master
text: That's not true. No one can read a map like you.

title: Sokka's Master
text: I can't read at all!

title: Sokka's Master
text: Yeah, and who keeps us laughing with sarcastic comments all the time? [Frontal view of Katara and Aang.] I mean, look at Katara's hair, right? What's up with that?

title: Sokka's Master
text: What? What's wrong with my hair? [Blushes.]

title: Sokka's Master
text: [Realizing his mistake.] Nothing. I was just trying to ...

title: Sokka's Master
text: Look, I appreciate the effort, [Cut to view from behind.] but the fact is each of you is so amazing and so special and I'm ... not. [Side-view close-up.] I'm just the guy in the group who's regular.

title: Sokka's Master
text: [Approaches and sits next to him.] I'm sorry you're feeling so down, but I hope you know, none of us see you that way. [Frontal view of the two. Looks down for a moment before putting her hand on his shoulder.] I know something that's going to make you feel better.

title: Sokka's Master
text: [Side-view. Sadly.] You do?

title: Sokka's Master
text: Cut to close-up of Sokka's face as the camera quickly pans out to reveal they are inside a shop full of weapons and armor.

title: Sokka's Master
text: Shopping! [Clapping excitedly. Runs toward the camera. Cut to side-view as he approaches to view some weapons.] Maybe a little something to reinvigorate my battling. [Spots some nunchaku.] Hey, how about these? [Frontal view of Sokka. Sokka tests the nunchaku, making attacking noises, but he hits himself on the head and falls into some of the other weapons.]

title: Sokka's Master
text: Cut to Katara trying on some gloves.

title: Sokka's Master
text: [Off-screen.] What do you think? [Cut to Aang as the camera pans up to see him wearing strange, scary armor.] Pretty slick, huh? [Close-up of Katara with a scared and surprised expression. Side-view of Katara approaching Aang, holding a hand up to avoid the glare coming off Aang's helmet.] All I need to complete the outfit is a wind sword.

title: Sokka's Master
text: What's a wind sword?

title: Sokka's Master
text: It's where I get a sword handle and then I just swing this around and bend air out like a blade. [Raises a sword handle, swishing it around like a sword.] Whoosh, whoosh, whoosh.

title: Sokka's Master
text: [Unconvincingly.] Yeah ... nice.

title: Sokka's Master
text: Aang begins to fall over. Katara tries to stop him from falling, but Aang and the armor fall to the floor with a loud noise, causing Katara to cover her ears.

title: Sokka's Master
text: I'll just stick to what I got.

title: Sokka's Master
text: Cut to Sokka holding a guan dao. He swings it to one side, swings it over his head and spins it in a circle. The weapon flies up toward the ceiling and Sokka puts his hands behind his back, innocently. Sokka is next seen dragging an enormous, metal club across the floor. He groans as he tries to lift it, but loses his grip and falls. Sokka is next seen holding two swords. He marches and chops downward with them. Sokka is next seen spinning a chain over his head, but he wraps the chain around himself and falls over. Sokka is seen running, carrying a very wobbly spear. Cut to close-up shot of Sokka standing up into the frame inspecting a sai, before using it as a toothpick. At that moment, something to his left gets his attention. Sokka turns to look as the camera pans round behind him. Sokka sees a sword rack on the wall, and a particular sword framed and positioned above the others. Cut close-up as the camera pans rights, showing all the details of the hilt and scabbard.

title: Sokka's Master
text: [Close-up.] Ooh! [Walks to the sword. Side-view of Sokka inspecting the sword.] That's what Sokka's talking about.

title: Sokka's Master
text: You have a good eye. [Aerial view of Sokka as shopkeeper approaches.] That's an original from Piandao, [Katara, Toph and Aang approach.] the greatest swordsmaster and sword maker in Fire Nation history. [Close-up.] He lives in the big castle up the road from here. [Walks away.]

title: Sokka's Master
text: [Side-view of group.] That's it! That's what you needed all along, Sokka.

title: Sokka's Master
text: A sword?

title: Sokka's Master
text: Not the sword, a master. [Sokka takes the sword from the rack.] We've all had masters to help us get better. You should see if you can study with Piandao.

title: Sokka's Master
text: [Frontal view of Sokka with Katara behind.] That's a great idea. I could've never gotten to where I am without Master Pakku. Everyone needs a teacher.

title: Sokka's Master
text: [Side-view of group.] I learned from badgermoles. They don't talk, but they're still good teachers.

title: Sokka's Master
text: [Close-up. Pulling out the blade, inspecting it.] It would be nice to be a master sword fighter. All right, I'll talk to him.

title: Sokka's Master
text: The scene cuts to a shot of the top of the bars of Iroh's cell. A ray of sunlight shines through a small window. It goes to an overhead shot of Iroh lying on his back on straw mat in the corner, hands behind his head. Cut to close-up side-view of his face. The camera suddenly zooms in as his eyes open wider. Cut to frontal view as Iroh begins to do a series of sit ups, grunting as he does so. The scene cuts to a shot of Piandao's castle, located on top of a large bluff. It goes down to a side-view of Sokka at the front gates. Cut closer behind Sokka as he grabs a knocker and taps it against the large door a few times. He waits a moment and looks around, but there is no answer. Sokka knocks the door and waits again. Still receiving no answer, Sokka becomes frustrated and grabs both knockers, banging them loudly and frantically. The right door is opened by the butler, Fat, frightening Sokka.

title: Sokka's Master
text: [A little annoyed.] Can I help you?

title: Sokka's Master
text: The scene cuts to a close-up of Sokka still looking frightened. He quickly composes himself and assumes a more mannered persona.

title: Sokka's Master
text: I've come to train with the master.

title: Sokka's Master
text: [Side-view of both.] You should know The Master turns almost everyone away. [Holds hand out in front of Sokka.] What did you bring him to prove your worth?

title: Sokka's Master
text: [Frontal view.] Well, uhh ... [Feels around, patting his clothes for something to offer.]

title: Sokka's Master
text: [Frontal view.] Right ... [Shakes head sadly.] Let's get this over with.

title: Sokka's Master
text: Fat gestures for Sokka to enter. Sokka steps through the gate and Fat closes the door. The scene cuts to an overhead shot of the castle courtyard as Sokka and Fat walk toward the main structure of the castle. The camera tilts up to the tallest tower. It cuts to a large room with a red carpet and tall windows, giving a view of the valley. Rows of lit candles are places on both sides of the windows. Piandao sits at a small table in front of the windows, his back to the camera. He has dark skin and wears a black cheongsam. Cut to a close-up of Piandao's hand holding a calligraphy brush and dipping it into a tray of ink, carefully holding his sleeve with the other hand. His hands move off screen and Sokka and Fat are seen in the background. The camera zooms in on Sokka as he steps forward.

title: Sokka's Master
text: Master, my name is Sokka, and I wish to be instructed in the way of the sword.

title: Sokka's Master
text: The scene cuts to a shot of Piandao, his back still toward Sokka. His sword is placed next to the table.

title: Sokka's Master
text: Sokka. That's an unusual name.

title: Sokka's Master
text: [Frontal view. Nervously.] Oh, uh, really, uh where I come from, the Fire Nation colonies, it's a pretty normal name ... for Fire Nation colonials.

title: Sokka's Master
text: [Side-view. Writing calligraphy on a piece of parchment.] Let me guess. You've come hundreds of miles from your little village where you're the best swordsman in town. And you think you deserve to learn from the master.

title: Sokka's Master
text: [Frontal view.] Well, actually, I've been all over the world.

title: Sokka's Master
text: [Side-view of his arm and hand as he continues to write. Knowingly.] Yep, here we go.

title: Sokka's Master
text: [Frontal view.] And I know one thing for sure: [Gets down on his knees and hangs his head.] I have a lot to learn.

title: Sokka's Master
text: [Shot from behind. Glancing back.] You're not doing a very good job of selling yourself.

title: Sokka's Master
text: [Side-view of room.] I know. Your butler told me that when I met you, I would have to prove my worth. [Close-up.] But the truth is ... I don't know if I am worthy.

title: Sokka's Master
text: [Close-up side-view.] Hm, I see. [Smiles and turns his head. Cut to his hand picking up his sword.] Well, then, [Close-up of Sokka.] let's find out together how worthy you are.

title: Sokka's Master
text: Sokka looks up as Piandao's shadow passes over him. Cut to a shot of the red carpet the end of Piandao's sword's scabbard strikes the floor. The camera quickly zooms out to a shot of Piandao standing before Sokka, sword firmly planted before him. Cut to a close-up of Piandao.

title: Sokka's Master
text: I will train you.

title: Sokka's Master
text: Close-up of Sokka as a huge smile spreads across his face. The camera switches to Sokka and Piandao standing in a sword fighting ring in front of the building they were in earlier. Sokka is wearing an almost identical outfit to Piandao's.

title: Sokka's Master
text: [Frontal view.] The first thing you must learn is that your weapon is an extension of yourself. [Cut further away as he unsheathes his sword and begins performing a sword form.] You must think of it as another part of your own body.

title: Sokka's Master
text: [Close-up.] Like a second head.

title: Sokka's Master
text: [Frontal view.] Well, more like an extra-long, really sharp arm. [Side-view of both. Continuing his demonstration.] The sword is a simple tool, but in the hands of a master it becomes [Close-up.] the most versatile of weapons, [Frontal view from below. Sheathes his sword and assumes a stance.] and just as the imagination is limitless, [Close-up of Sokka smiling in amazement.] so too are the possibilities of the sword.

title: Sokka's Master
text: Sokka nods his head in understanding. Cut to Aang, Toph, Katara, Appa, and Momo in the countryside. Appa is sleeping under the makeshift roof.Â

title: Sokka's Master
text: What should we do todayâ?

title: Sokka's Master
text: Cut to an overhead shot of Aang, Top, and Katara lying on their backs in a circle. Momo runs up to them and lies down next to Katara.

title: Sokka's Master
text: I'm tapped out. I already picked my toes, twice.

title: Sokka's Master
text: Twice?

title: Sokka's Master
text: The first time was for cleaning, but the second time's just for the [Wiggles her toes.] sweet picking sensation!

title: Sokka's Master
text: Sokka's been in charge of the schedule. I'm not sure what we should be doing.

title: Sokka's Master
text: [Frontal view of Aang with Toph behind. Picking her nose.] Plus, it's so hot today.

title: Sokka's Master
text: [Attempting to joke.] How hot is it?

title: Sokka's Master
text: I dunno. Real hotâ?

title: Sokka's Master
text: [Camera pans across to show Katara.] I-It's so hot, it's so hot ... Momo is shedding like Appa. [Pets Momo and flicks tufts of fur from her fingers.] Huh, huhâ?

title: Sokka's Master
text: Aang scratches his head and Katara's joke receives no laughs, leaving her disappointed. It goes back to the overhead shot.

title: Sokka's Master
text: I guess the jokes don't run in the family.

title: Sokka's Master
text: Cut back to view of the countryside.

title: Sokka's Master
text: Oh, everyone's a critic.

title: Sokka's Master
text: Appa grunts in response. The scene cuts to a shot of Iroh hanging upside down and doing crunches, panting with effort. It switches to a shot of his feet as he hangs from the overhead bars. Cut to and zoom out from a wide shot of Iroh doing the upside down crunches in his cell. The scene shifts to Piandao and Sokka standing in front of a table inside the building. On the table is calligraphy stationary.

title: Sokka's Master
text: The warrior practices a variety of arts to keep his mind sharp and fluid. [Flattens out a piece of paper on the table.] The first you will learn is calligraphy. [Cut to his hands as Piandao delicately hands a brush to Sokka, who takes it, messing the bristles up with his thumb.] Write your name.

title: Sokka's Master
text: [Close-up. Skeptical.] Writing my name will make me a better swordsmanâ?

title: Sokka's Master
text: [Takes the brush and positions it correctly in Sokka's hand. Cut to a wide shot of both.] When you write your name, you stamp the paper with your identity.
