text: Cut to a line of young Air Nomad monks. The camera pans right to show Avatar Roku at the end of the line. Roku is airbending his long black hair at another young monk's face, who, irritated, bends it back at Roku. Roku responds by nudging the monk with his shoulder.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: And also where I met an old friend of yours: Monk Gyatso.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: No way!

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: Cut to an aerial shot of the airbenders on a grassy ledge. An older Air Nomad leads the students, and launches off the side of the ledge. The students line up by twos to follow their teacher. Cut to Gyatso and Roku soaring through the air on their gliders.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: Hey, Gyatso, you wanna see a new glider trick? [He flies up and loops twice.]

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: [Laughing.] Check this out! [He flips himself over and stands on top of his glider. Cut to Aang and Roku.]

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: He's air surfing! I can't believe I never thought of that.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: Cut back to Gyatso, as he loses his balance on the glider, but as he falls, Roku catches him on the back of his glider. Roku is unable to control the glider, and the both go down toward the other young monks, who are now back on the grassy ledge. Cut to the other students looking up at the falling airbenders, as they panic and try to run. Cut to Roku and Gyatso, flying low, about to crash. They crash, leaving a large cloud of dust. Cut to the young monks knocked over, and scattered about. Roku's hair is in his face. Gyatso airbends it back while Roku lifts his head. They both grin widely, and Roku pats Gyatso on his shoulder. Cut to a close-up of Aang.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: [Smiling and surprised.] That's amazing! I can't believe you were friends with Monk Gyatso just like I was!

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: [Camera pans back to show Roku.] Some friendships are so strong, [He closes his eyes.] they can even transcend lifetimes.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: As Fang flies off, the scene changes to the Northern Water Tribe, where, in the distance, two individuals are standing on a plateau of ice. Cut to a close-up of an older Roku.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: After my years mastering airbending, I traveled to the Northern Water Tribe.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: Cut to Roku's waterbending master, who bends a large water drill from the ocean waters behind him. It thrusts forward, knocking Roku, and a part of the plateau, into the water.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: Waterbending was especially challenging for me. But in time, I mastered it as well.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: Cut to a shot of the water, as Roku emerges from it, and bends an enormous wave of water directly at his master standing on the glacier. The blast completely destroys the glacier, and carries his master all the way back to a Northern Water Tribe building. His master sits up, and shakes his head. Cut to Roku, standing on an ice float, as he smiles. Scene changes to Roku, standing shirtless, and wearing Earth Kingdom clothing from the waist. He moves his arms in quick motions across his body to bend a large piece of earth, riding up the side of a mountain.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: I moved on to the Earth Kingdom.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: Cut to Roku racing up the slope, as another earthbender catches up to him. Cut to a brief shot of the earthbender, before cutting back to Roku, as they compete for speed.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: My earthbending master, Sud, was uncompromising, stubborn, and blunt ...

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: The two benders race into thick brush and trees, as they disappear from view. Cut to the top of the mountain overlooking a valley.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: ... And a lifelong friend.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: As Sud comes to the finishing point, quickly brings his landmass to a halt. He thrusts his fists into the air, cheering for himself. The look on his face changes quickly to shock when he realizes that Roku not only beat him to the top, but he also had enough time to seat himself and pour them both tea. Cut back to Sud as he smiles at his pupil. Cut to a side shot of Roku and Sud. They both drink from their teacups. Scene changes to a close-up of Roku's head dress and slowly pans down to show his face in an extreme close-up.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: It was bitter work ... [The camera pans back to Roku, as he moves his arms to bend the different elements.] but the results were worth it. [He starts by waterbending, before moving on to earthbending, firebending, and finally, airbending. The camera zooms out to an aerial view of Roku at the center of the four elements.]

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: Scene changes to Zuko, still reading Sozin's history in the chamber. An extreme close-up shows his eyes quivering with each word he reads.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: Twelve long years passed before I saw my friend again. When Roku returned, he was a fully realized Avatar, and I had changed as well.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: A wall of flames appears, as the scene changes to Sozin sitting in his throne room. Roku walks down a long red carpet toward Sozin.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: Sozin! Or should I say, Fire Lord!

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: [Scene changes to Sozin from below him. Serious.] Customarily, my subjects bow before greeting me. [He walks down from his throne.] But you're the exception. [He smiles and hugs Roku.]

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: Cut to the older Roku and Aang watching from behind.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: After all these years, he was still my best friend. [Scene changes to a wedding ceremony and celebration in a Fire Nation courtyard, with many guests attending. Cut to Roku, on whose right is Sozin, holding a scroll.] And a few months later, he was my best man.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: [As Roku lifts the veil.] Roku, it's that girl who didn't even know you're alive!

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: Ta Min. I was persistent. [She stands up near Roku.] When love is real, it finds a way. [The attendees clap, as the newly-wed couple bow their heads. Cut to a shot of the couple from the side, as Aang and Roku watch.] And being the Avatar doesn't hurt your chances with the ladies, either.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: Scene changes to Zuko.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: On wedding days, we look to the future with optimism and joy. [Fade to Sozin in deep thought.] I had my own vision for a brighter future.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: Cut to Roku and Ta Min receiving and thanking guests. Sozin walks up behind the couple.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: [Leaning toward Ta Min.] Excuse me. May I borrow him for a momentâ?

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: It's not very traditional, but, okay.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: Cut to Roku and Sozin on a balcony.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: What's on your mind?

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: [Raises his fist slightly.] I've been thinking hard about the state of the world lately.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: [Putting his arm over Sozin's shoulder.] Sozin, it is my wedding! Have a cookie, dance with someone, lighten up!

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: [Smiling slightly.] I know, I know, but just hear me out. [Roku bows in agreement. Cut to a shadowed side-shot of the balcony as they walk.] Right from the start, I was destined to be Fire Lord. And although we didn't always know it, you were destined to be the Avatar. [Cut to a close-up side-shot of the two. Roku stops as Sozin continues on.] It's an amazing stroke of fate we know each other so well, isn't it? Together, we could do ... anything.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: [The camera pans toward Roku. Now serious.] Yeah, we could.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: [Cut to a shot of the Fire Nation from the balcony.] Our nation is enjoying an unprecedented time of peace and wealth. Our people are happy, and we're so fortunate in so many ways.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: [Concerned.] Where are you going with this?

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: I've been thinking, we should share this prosperity with the rest of the world. [Cut to a shocked Roku with the camera closing in on him.] In our hands is the most successful empire in history. [Back to a close-up of Sozin.] It's time we expanded it.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: No! The four nations are meant to be just that: four.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: [Cut to Sozin.] Roku, you haven't even stopped to consider the possibilities.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: [Cut to a close-up side-shot of Roku.] There are no possibilities. This is the last I want to hear [Closes his eyes.] about this. [He walks away from the balcony, with an angry expression on his face.]

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: [His spirit speaks to Aang.] That was my first real test as the Avatar. Unfortunately, it was many years before I learned [Cut to a extreme close-up of Sozin.] that Sozin [Sozin narrows his eyes. Fade to a back-shot of Fang flying with Roku.] had gone ahead with his plan, despite my warning.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: Scene changes to Roku flying over a body of water on Fang, as he approaches land. As Roku flies over, he sees an Earth Nation dock, but as the camera pans up, he sees an Earth Nation fortress with plumes of smoke rising from inside, with the Fire Nation insignia strewn over the original Earth Kingdom symbol, covering it. The camera zooms in to an extreme close-up of the Fire Nation banner. Cut to Roku who widens his eyes in shock by his discovery. Scene changes to Roku, bursting through the doors of Fire Lord Sozin's throne room with steam coming out. Cut to an overhead shot of Roku's shadow in the doorway cast on the long red carpet.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: [Angry.] I've seen the colonies, Sozin. [Points at Sozin.] How dare you occupy Earth Kingdom territory!

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: [Cut to Sozin, as Roku walks up to him.] How dare you, a citizen of the Fire Nation, address your Fire Lord this way. [Cut to a close-up of Sozin's face from the side.] Your loyalty is to our nation first. Anything less makes you a traitor.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: Don't do this, Sozin. Don't challenge me. It will only end badly. It's over.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: As Roku turns back and starts to leave, Sozin, full of rage, jumps from his throne and delivers an immensely powerful fire stream. As the flames go out, Roku is nowhere to be seen. Sozin widens his eyes in suprise, expression becoming blank as he looks around. Suddenly, Roku bursts from the ground behind Sozin, revealing that he has burrowed into the ground with earthbending to defend from Sozin's attack. Before Sozin can turn back, Roku delivers a powerful air blast at the Fire Lord, which causes him to slam on the gates of the room. As Sozin falls down, Roku immediately earthbends a pillar of earth that lifts Sozin into the air and pins him by the back of his robes to the ceiling. Cut to a close-up of Avatar Roku, as he brings his hands together in front of his face, and enters the Avatar State. Cut to a shot of the entire throne room, as Roku breaks the pillars of the throne room. Cut to an aerial shot of the palace, as it is destroyed. Cut to Sozin, uncovering his face. Roku airbends an air spout, and raises himself to Sozin.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: I'm sparing you, Sozin. [Cut to a frontal shot of Roku.] I'm letting you go in the name of our past friendship. But I warn you. [Cut to a extreme close up of Roku.] Even a single step out of line will result in your permanent end.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: Sozin stares at Roku, his face still full of anger. Suddenly, his expression drops, and he hangs his head in defeat. Roku turns, and rides the cyclone quickly away from Sozin. Scene changes to an aerial shot of Roku's island at night.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: Sozin and I didn't speak or see each other for twenty-five years after our battle. [Cut to Roku's house.] I spent most of my spare time here, at my home.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: Cut to an overhead shot of an elderly Roku and Ta Min sleeping, as a loud noise awakes Roku and he leaps out from the bed, and looks through the window. Cut to a shot of the window, as large fireballs falling from the sky, and crashing into the island. Roku and his wife flee the room, but as they do so, Roku's headpiece falls to the floor, and is left behind. Roku emerges from the house to find the air filled with smoke and ash. Coughing, Roku and his wife shield their faces. A worried Roku looks at the erupting volcano in the island.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: Let's go! [He catches his wife's hand, and airbends smoke and ash in their way, creating a path, as both run through the path he created.]

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: Scene changes to the town, as the townspeople run through the streets to escape the waves of smoke and ash that now pour through the streets. Cut to Roku's home, as Fang flies up from behind the house. He narrowly escapes as an ash flow completely buries the house. Cut to a wide shot of Roku, with his face covered, leading his wife and many townspeople to safety. Ash continues to fall as we see a swell of lava ooze from the mouth of the volcano. Cut to a close-up of Roku still running. He looks to his wife, as shot cuts to her running. He lets go of her hand, and motions her to go on without him. With her arm still outstretched, she looks at him, and runs to safety. She continues to look back, desperately hoping Roku will grab her hand. Ta Min runs off with many of the townspeople. Roku turns to face the advancing smoke, and airbends a huge dome of protection around himself. Cut to the townspeople in boats, as they see the air dome. Cut to the worried faces of the people, including Ta Min. Scene changes to the volcano erupting in the island from the Fire Nation palace, as camera zooms back to show an elderly Fire Lord Sozin watching from his balcony.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: Roku's island was a hundred miles away. But I could still feel it rumbling and see the black plume of smoke. I had never seen anything like this catastrophe.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: Cut to Sozin's face, before cutting to an aerial shot of the volcano. Large columns of black smoke billow from the summit, as lightning strikes above the volcano and the earth rumbles from the disaster. Cut to a close-up of a landslide quickly approaching the town, destroying it completely. Roku earthbends a gigantic wall, and rides the wall to meet the falling earth, and stop it. As he succeeds in stopping it, the volcano ejects a massive wave of lava. The flow breeches the wall of earth, causing Roku to flee to the bottom of the summit. He cuts into the earth using his earthbending, creating a channel to divert the lava into the surrounding ocean, away from the town. Cut to an aerial shot of the island, as the channel fills with lava, and empties into the ocean. Cut to Roku and Aang watching the destruction from a distance.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: This is amazing, Roku! You're battling a volcano, and you're winning.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: Unfortunately, my success didn't last long, Aang. There was no way I could do it all.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: Shot cuts to Roku looking up the top of the volcano. As the camera pans up and focuses on the mouth of the volcano, it violently expels another giant wave of lava. Roku runs toward the volcano, and leaps. Roku blows a powerful blast of air from his mouth at the lava, which cools and hardens, as Roku lands on it. Suddenly, a blast of poisonous gas spouts to his right, he turns and covers his face. He turns to the jet, airbending it away. Suddenly lava appears on his right, which he airbends, and quickly another jet of gases blasts to his left, and he quickly airbends it as well.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: [To Aang.] Battling the elements was hard enough. I had to do it while I could barely breathe. The poisonous, volcanic gases were overwhelming.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: Cut to an overhead shot of the sky directly over the eruption. Lightning crashes around the crater as Fang comes, flying. The summit emits another lava fountain. Fang pulls back, narrowly escaping the blast, and roars.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: [Airbends a jet of gases.] It's all right Fang! [Coughs.] Get out of here! I'm fine!

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: Roku turns his body from side to side, and enters the Avatar State. With a powerful blow from his fist, Roku earthbends a tremor through the volcano, breaking out the back side of the crater, which lessens the lava flow. As the lava flows down, the second volcano erupts, as Roku, no longer in the Avatar State, hopelessly drops his head. Cut to a view of Roku from behind, as Sozin, on a blue dragon, appears.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: Need a hand, old friend?

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: [A surprised Roku turns back.] Sozin?

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: There's not a moment to waste.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: Cut to an aerial view of the two volcanoes. Sozin and Roku ride on the Fire Lord's dragon's back to the second volcano. Cut to Roku bending the fire fountain down into the crater. Cut to Sozin balanced on the mouth of the vent, as he cools the lava by absorbing the heat, passing it through himself, and redirects out through his other hand. The scene pans out to show the silhouettes of the two friends, controlling the disaster. Cut to the townspeople in the boats, as they see the volcanoes erupting. Cut to a shot of Ta Min, with an anxious expression on her face. The scene cuts back to Roku and Sozin on the edge of the crater. Lightning blasts above Sozin, as the earth beneath him becomes unstable. He begins to fall back off the side of the volcano, but Roku quickly earthbends an earth shelf to catch Sozin. Stable again, Sozin looks to Roku for a moment. Suddenly, the earth violently shakes and another surge of ash and rock shoot from the crater, and the two turn to run.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: Don't breathe the toxic gas.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: As the two run, a jet of toxic gas shoots up directly next to Sozin. Roku quickly airbends it away to protect Sozin. Suddenly gas erupts directly into Roku's face, causing him to be disoriented.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: [Shaking, Cut to Roku's point of view. He lifts his hands to look at them, as they blur out of focus.] It's too much.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: Overwhelmed by the poisons, Roku falls to his knees. He looks up toward Sozin, and holds out his hand for help.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: Please.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: Cut to Roku's point of view again.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: Without you, all my plans are suddenly possible. [Cut to Roku.] I have a vision for the future, Roku.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: Sozin's dragon appears. As Roku kneels, Sozin mounts the dragon and flies away. Cut to Roku, on the side of the volcano. He is surrounded by toxic gas, and behind him a surge of rock and ash flows swiftly toward him. Cut to a shot of the black clouds billowing from the island, as Sozin's dragon emerges from the plumes. The camera zooms to an extreme close-up of Sozin's eye. Shot cuts to Roku, from the back, still on his knees. He is coughing, and is unable to get to his feet. Fang appears from the right, and flies above him. Cut to a close-up of Roku from the side, as he looks up toward his dragon. Cut to an aerial view of the debris, rapidly approaching Avatar Roku. With the rock avalanche just moments away from swallowing Roku, Fang flies down, and wraps himself around Roku. The wave of ash and rubble cover the two completely, killing both of them. Fade to a bright light, as the camera pans to show an arched window frame. A baby's cries can be heard. The camera pans down to show a smiling born infant.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: Who's ... wait, that's me, isn't it? [Cut to a long shot of three Air Nomads. A nun holds up the baby to the light while two people, presumably the infant's parents, stand in the shadows.]

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: Make sense of our past, Aang. [Cut to Roku and Aang.] And you will bring peace, and restore balance in the world. [He slowly disappears.]

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: Roku? Roku!

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: Aang walks out of the flashback into whiteness as the scene changes to Zuko reading in the Dragonbone Catacombs.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: With Roku gone, and the great comet returning, the timing was perfect to change the world. [Cut to Sozin, standing on a balcony, from the behind, looking at his soldiers and the Fire Navy ships.] I knew the next Avatar would be born an Air Nomad. So I wiped out the Air Temples. [Scene changes to a burning temple. The camera slowly fades into an extreme close-up of Sozin's face.] But somehow, the new Avatar eluded me. [Scene changes to Fire Navy ships searching in the polar regions.] I wasted the remainder of my life searching in vain. [Cut to underside of the ship.] I know he's hiding out there somewhere. [Camera pans below to show the iceberg Aang was trapped in.] The Fire Nation's greatest threat ... the last airbender.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: Fade to a close-up of the scroll Zuko is reading.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: That can't be it! Where's the rest of it? [He searches the scroll to find more information.]

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: Zuko puts the scroll down and stands up, as the camera pans out. Scene changes to the Fire Nation prison, where Iroh is imprisoned. Cut to Zuko from the behind, slamming the door to the cell behind him as he enters. Cut to Iroh sitting with his head down.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: [Angrily.] You sent this, didn't you? I found the secret history, which by the way should be renamed history most people already know! The note said that I needed to know about my great-grandfather's death, but he was still alive in the end.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: [Looking up at Zuko.] No, he wasn't.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: [Confused.] What are you talking about?

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: You have more than one great-grandfather, Prince Zuko. Sozin was your father's grandfather. [Cut to a bewildered Zuko.] Your mother's grandfather was Avatar Roku.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: [Shocked.] Why are you telling me this?

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: Because understanding the struggle between your two great-grandfathers can help you better understand the battle within yourself. [Zuko sits down, with his head facing down.] Evil and good are always at war inside you, Zuko. It is your nature, your legacy. But, there is a bright side. [Zuko looks up.] What happened generations ago can be resolved now, by you. Because of your legacy, you alone can cleanse the sins of our family and the Fire Nation. Born in you, along with all the strife, is the power to restore balance to the world.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: Cut to a bundle inside of a brick wall. Iroh removes a brick and reaches for the bundle. Cut to Iroh slowly unwrapping the bundle, revealing the once-lost headdress, while he walks toward Zuko.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: This is a royal artifact. It's supposed to be worn [Zuko stands.] by the Crown Prince.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: Zuko takes the headdress from Iroh's hand, and holds the artifact, as the shot cuts to Zuko from the behind, standing outside of Iroh's cell. Iroh stands quietly, looking at his nephew. Cut to a shot of the hardened lava wave the gang had been sitting on. Cut to a shot of Sokka, Katara, and Toph all facing Aang as the camera pans down.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: You mean, after all Roku and Sozin went through together, even after Roku showed him mercy, Sozin betrayed him like thatâ?

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: [Cut to Toph.] It's like these people are born bad.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: [Cut to Aang from the side, with Sokka standing near him.] No, that's wrong. I don't think that was the point of what Roku showed me at all.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: [Shrugging.] Then what was the point?

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: [Cut to Katara, Toph and Sokka from the behind, as Aang speaks.] Roku was just as much Fire Nation as Sozin was, right? If anything, their story proves anyone's capable of great good and great evil. [Cut to an aerial shot of the hardened lava wave.] Everyone, even the Fire Lord and the Fire Nation have to be treated like they're worth giving a chance. [Shot cuts to a close-up of Aang's face.] And I also think it was about friendships.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: [Camera pans to Toph, and cuts to a close-up of her face.] Do you really think friendships can last more than one lifetime?

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: [Catching Toph's hand.] I don't see why not.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: Katara catches Toph's other hand.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: Well, scientifically speaking, there's no way to prove that ...

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: [Annoyed.] Oh, Sokka, just hold hands.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: Sokka stops talking, and without moving, he thrusts out his hand to hold Katara's. Shot cuts to an aerial shot of Team Avatar, holding hands, and looking out toward the ocean. Fade to credits.

title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
text: Aang

title: The Runaway
text: The episode opens in Fire Fountain City, where a giant statue of Fire Lord Ozai roaring is shown with flames coming from the fists and out of the mouth. The camera moves down to Toph, who is seen running from someone, but turns around and is caught with a net and falls to the ground. She angrily looks in front of her at someone.

title: The Runaway
text: [Angrily.] How could you do this to me? You betrayed me!

title: The Runaway
text: The camera cuts to a shot of Katara, who is glaring back at Toph.

title: The Runaway
text: [Crosses her arms.] You brought this on yourself. I had no choice. [Turns away from Toph with her arms folded.]

title: The Runaway
text: Toph is dragged away in the net, all the while glaring back at Katara. The screen fades to three days earlier. Toph and Katara are seen facing each other, each taking a fighting stance, the latter controlling two streams of water in her hands. Aang appears on the screen, tying his headband over his eyes like a blindfold.

title: The Runaway
text: Okay. I'm ready for some training.

title: The Runaway
text: He turns to face the girls and takes two steps forward in a stance similar to Toph's. Upon impact with the second step, he picks up vibrations from the ground with seismic sense. He quickly dodges three earth pillars that appear out of the ground near him. He hears a water attack coming from Katara and redirects it at her. He quickly launches a boulder at Toph who catches it and stops it.

title: The Runaway
text: Good job, Twinkle Toes. Visualize, then attack.

title: The Runaway
text: She launches the boulder back at Aang, who burrows into a hole with earthbending. The boulder instead hits Katara square in the chest, knocking her down. She stands back up and brushes dust off of her.

title: The Runaway
text: Maybe you should take your own advice, Toph!

title: The Runaway
text: What's the matter? Can't handle a little dirt, Madame Fussy-Britches?

title: The Runaway
text: Katara's eyebrow twitches and she glares at Toph with her vein shown on her head before she angrily creates a wave and sends it at Toph, who gets splashed by it and becomes annoyed.

title: The Runaway
text: Oh, sorry. Did I splash you, Mud-Slug?

title: The Runaway
text: Katara creates an ice ramp, and Toph creates an earth ramp, both proceeding to head straight for each other. They crash and both of the girls go flying.

title: The Runaway
text: Are we taking a break?

title: The Runaway
text: Meanwhile, Sokka is seen hiding behind Aang with an evil smile. He quickly gets up and charges at Aang. The background changes to a rushing one.

title: The Runaway
text: [Screaming.] Sneak Attack!

title: The Runaway
text: Aang, casually and still looking away from Sokka, creates an earth wall, which stops Sokka dead in his tracks. He lowers the wall, which causes Sokka to fall down.

title: The Runaway
text: [While raising his blindfold and turning to face Sokka.] Sokka, sneak attacks don't work if you yell it out loud.

title: The Runaway
text: Katara and Toph are seen wrestling in a puddle of mud.

title: The Runaway
text: Hungry for a mud pie? [Kicks mud in Katara's face.]

title: The Runaway
text: [Wiping mud off of her face.] I'll give you a mud pie!

title: The Runaway
text: Katara waterbends a stream of mud at Toph, knocking her down. She quickly gets up and earthbends a pillar underneath Katara, which sends her flying toward a wall. She starts running toward Katara, but stops at the last second when they hear Aang.

title: The Runaway
text: Uh guys, I thought we were supposed to be training me.

title: The Runaway
text: [Takes a few steps forward, covered in mud; calmly.] Very well, pupil. I believe we've had enough training for today. [Turns and walks away.]

title: The Runaway
text: While Katara cleans up, [Earthbends the mud off of herself and runs toward Aang and Sokka.] let's go have some fun!

title: The Runaway
text: Yeah!

title: The Runaway
text: [Simultaneously with Aang.] Yes!

title: The Runaway
text: Aang, Sokka and Toph head to Fire Fountain City. Sokka is carrying his sword horizontally across his shoulders. He looks up and sees messenger hawks flying in and out of a large coop.

title: The Runaway
text: Look at all those messenger hawks! You know, I've been thinking about getting one for myself. That way, I wouldn't have to talk to anyone. I could just send them messages.

title: The Runaway
text: I gotta say, I like the idea of not talking to you. [Sokka glares at her.]

title: The Runaway
text: [While holding up a silver piece.] So, guys. What are we gonna get with our last silver piece?

title: The Runaway
text: [Stops walking.] We can get more money. [They both look back at her.] Right there. [Points to an area beneath them. Aang and Sokka move back to look where she is pointing.]

title: The Runaway
text: In the area is a table with two men sitting across from each other, with people around them watching the action. The table has three shells on it, all upside down. The first man places some money on the table and the second man, a scam artist, lifts the shells to reveal that the middle one has a rock underneath it. He places the shells back down as they were and starts moving them around.

title: The Runaway
text: This is where you seeing people are at a disadvantage. Everyone guesses wrong because the dealer moves the rock at the last minute. But I can feel it with my earthbending. [As she says this, the scam artist continues to move the shells around as the gambler tries to focus on the shell with the rock, and right before stopping, the scam artist quickly and inconspicuously earthbends the rock from underneath one of the shells into his sleeve.]

title: The Runaway
text: The scam artist stops moving the shells and arranges them how they originally were: Horizontally right in front of him. The gambler points at the shell in the middle, which the scam artist lifts to reveal nothing underneath. The gambler stands up and walks away crying. A few more people move and the dealer notices Toph, and that she is blind.

title: The Runaway
text: [To Toph.] You there. Wanna play a friendly game?

title: The Runaway
text: How can I possibly play? [Waves her hand in front of her face.] I'm blind.

title: The Runaway
text: You don't have to see to be lucky.

title: The Runaway
text: Toph sits in front of the table and feels around it, pretending to be helpless. She places their last silver piece on the table. The scam artist shows the rock under the shell in the middle and starts moving them around. This time, he tosses one rock from his sleeves into each of the two empty shells. Toph senses this and smiles slyly. When he stops, Toph points to the one on her left, which has a rock underneath, winning about two silver pieces.

title: The Runaway
text: Flamey-O, Toph.

title: The Runaway
text: Wow. Fancy guessing. You are amazing at this. [Plays with a few silver pieces in his hands.] Would you like to make the game a little more interesting?

title: The Runaway
text: [Curiously.] More interesting? How?

title: The Runaway
text: [Points at Sokka's sword.] Well, let's say you toss in your friend's fine sword there, [Grabs a big bag of money.] then I'll put up twenty silver pieces against it, and that's more interesting.

title: The Runaway
text: [Grabs Sokka's sword.] I'll do it for forty silver pieces. [Sokka stares at them with his mouth wide open.]

title: The Runaway
text: Forty silver pieces it is. [Drops some more money into the bag and starts moving the shells, faster this time.]

title: The Runaway
text: The scam artist moves the first two rocks into his sleeves, which Toph senses as she smiles slyly again. He attempts to do the same with the third rock, but Toph inconspicuously clutches her fist, causing the rock to move back underneath the shell, which the scam artist does not notice. When he stops, she smiles and points at the shell in the middle.

title: The Runaway
text: [Moves his hand over to the shell, about to lift it.] Sorry, little lady, but- [Lifts up the shell and sees the rock, which shocks and confuses him.] Huh? [Stares closely at the rock.]

title: The Runaway
text: I won! [She grabs the bag of money, and Sokka grabs his sword as they run off.]

title: The Runaway
text: Cut to Toph, Aang, and Sokka heading back to camp, laughing and carrying baskets full of goods. Katara is seen cooking something in a pot as they all drop their baskets onto the ground and Katara looks at the baskets with curiosity.

title: The Runaway
text: Where did you guys get the money to buy all this stuff?

title: The Runaway
text: Toph got us money. [Grabs an apple and takes a bite out of it as he sits down.] She scammed one of those guys in town who moves the shells around all sneaky-like. [He mimics the scam artist moving the shells with his hand. Katara's expression shows disapproval.]

title: The Runaway
text: [Sits down too.] She used earthbending to win the game! Classic!

title: The Runaway
text: Ah, so she cheated.

title: The Runaway
text: [Starts to bite her apple, but stops to defend herself.] Hey! I only cheated because he was cheating! [Smiles.] I cheated a cheater. [Closes her eyes in confidence.] What's wrong with that?

title: The Runaway
text: I'm just saying this isn't something we should make a habit of doing.

title: The Runaway
text: Why? Because it's fun? And you hate fun?

title: The Runaway
text: I don't hate fun! [Places Momo on her head like a hat while grinning unconvincingly.] See? Fun! [Momo slips off her head, screeches at her, and runs away.]

title: The Runaway
text: [Stands up.] Katara, [Slightly lifts his headband to reveal his airbender tattoo and bows.] I'll personally make you an Avatar Promise that we won't make a habit of doing these scams.

title: The Runaway
text: Guys, I think these scams have gone far enough. If you keep doing them, something bad is gonna happen.

title: The Runaway
text: Could you for once stop being such a sourpuss and just lighten up? [Tosses some money to Katara.]

title: The Runaway
text: [Angrily.] Oh, I'm sorry! You think I should be more like you? Like some wild child? [Tosses the money back at Toph.]

title: The Runaway
text: Yeah! Maybe! Maybe then you'd seeÂ [Sokka grabs the money off the ground.]Â how great we have it! I mean, look at us! [Leans back on the rock behind her and crosses her arms behind her head.] We're traveling around the world! Making easy money! Having fun! With no parents to tell us what to do!

title: The Runaway
text: Ah. I see. You're acting like this because of your parents.

title: The Runaway
text: Whatever.

title: The Runaway
text: They were controlling over you, so you ran away, and now you act like your parents don't exist. You act like you hate them, but you don't. You just feel guilty.

title: The Runaway
text: I do hate them.

title: The Runaway
text: I don't think so. I think you miss them, but you just don't wanna deal with that, so instead you act like this crazy person.

title: The Runaway
text: [Stands up; angrily.] Look, I ran away to help Aang!

title: The Runaway
text: You know what? It doesn't matter. These scams put us all at risk, and we don't need that. [Points at her forehead.] We've already got some third-eyed freak after us.

title: The Runaway
text: Speaking of that "third-eyed freak", I think I've come up with a name for him. What do you think of "Sparky-Sparky-Boom Man"? [Silence.] Just think about it.

title: The Runaway
text: [Angrily.] We have enough money! You need to stop this!

title: The Runaway
text: [Angrily.] I'll stop when I wanna stop and not when you tell me! [Uses earthbending to launch the bag of money behind her into her hand and walks away angrily. Katara shakes her head angrily as Toph sits and creates an earth tent.]

title: The Runaway
text: [Grabs his bag of money and his sword and stands up.] Speaking of money, I'm off to spend some. See you guys later. [Walks away.]

title: The Runaway
text: In town, Sokka just bought a messenger hawk, which he names Hawky.

title: The Runaway
text: Hawky, welcome to Team Avatar. My name's Sokka, and I'm your new owner, and as such I should warn you that there's already a lemur in our group, so I don't wanna see any fighting. [Scratches Hawky on the stomach.] Good little messenger hawky. Who's got pretty feathers? [While walking away, he notices a wanted poster he had just past with Toph's picture on it. He gasps in horror and rips it off the wall. Hawky screeches.] You're right, Hawky. This is bad. [Suddenly, the bird poops while standing on Sokka's arm.]

title: The Runaway
text: The scene changes to back at camp. Katara and Aang are practicing waterbending, while Toph is counting her money. Sokka walks up to her.

title: The Runaway
text: Toph, while I was in town, I found something that you're not gonna like. [Pulls out the wanted poster and shows it to her.]

title: The Runaway
text: Well it sounds like a sheet of paper, but I guess you're referring to what's on the sheet of paper.

title: The Runaway
text: It's a wanted poster. Of you. They've nicknamed you the Runaway.

title: The Runaway
text: [Happily.] A wanted poster! That's so great! "The Runaway." I love my new nickname. Is there a picture of me? Does it look good?

title: The Runaway
text: [Looks a few times at both the wanted poster and Toph.] Well yeah, actually, it does look pretty good. [Gets back on topic.] But, Toph, you're missing the point. Maybe Katara was right. These scams are drawing too much attention to us.

title: The Runaway
text: Don't be such a worrywart like your sister. [Stands up and walks up to Sokka.] Think of it this way: Now you've got plenty of money to help with the invasion plan. [Holds up a bag of money and jiggles it in front of him.]

title: The Runaway
text: [Ponders for a moment.] Well, that is true. I had this idea of making armor for Appa. [Looks at Appa, who is napping, but opens one eye upon hearing this.]

title: The Runaway
text: [Takes some money out of the bag and hands the money to him.] Here's a little extra, so you can get yourself a nice map of the Fire Nation. You know what? [Gives the entire bag to him.] Make it an atlas.

title: The Runaway
text: [While taking the bag.] I do like expensive atlases.

title: The Runaway
text: Of course you do. [Grabs the wanted poster and tucks it into her outfit.] And that's why this wanted poster is going to stay our little secret. [Walks away.]

title: The Runaway
text: Aang and Katara walk up to Sokka, who tucks his new money into his outfit

title: The Runaway
text: Sokka, [Places her hand on her face; annoyed.] tell me you didn't buy a bird.

title: The Runaway
text: Not just a bird, a messenger bird. Now we can send messages all over the world. Even to Gran Gran.

title: The Runaway
text: [Excited.] Wow, how does it work?

title: The Runaway
text: Hm. Uh, I never actually thought about that. Hawky, [Points away from himself.] Gran Gran, South Pole. [Hawky shakes himself.] I think he gets it.

title: The Runaway
text: Momo appears on Aang's shoulder and screeches at Hawky. He jumps to Sokka and starts chasing Hawky around Sokka's head.

title: The Runaway
text: Hawky! Make nice! Bad Hawky!

title: The Runaway
text: Later on at camp, Katara is mixing something in a cooking pot via waterbending. She waterbends some of it out of the pot and into Appa's mouth, which causes him to lick his lips, while Aang sits on a ledge in front of Appa and drinks something out of a cup. Toph and Sokka, the latter with Hawky on his shoulder, show up carrying big bags of money.

title: The Runaway
text: [Sarcastically.] Well. Look who decided to join us. [Stands up.] Where have you two been? Off scamming again?

title: The Runaway
text: Yes, we were. [Puts her bag down.]

title: The Runaway
text: [Slides to the right to behind Toph.] And I suppose you don't think what you're doing is dangerous at all?

title: The Runaway
text: No, I don't.

title: The Runaway
text: Really?

title: The Runaway
text: Yes. Really.

title: The Runaway
text: [Starts to pull something out.] Well then. What's this? [Shows Toph her wanted poster.]

title: The Runaway
text: [Annoyed.] I don't know! I mean, seriously! What is with you people? I'm blind! [Points at her eyes and pulls down her bottom eyelids to emphasize her words.]

title: The Runaway
text: It's a wanted poster of you! "The Runaway!" Is that what you're called now? Are you proud of this?

title: The Runaway
text: [Angrily.] Where did you get that!?

title: The Runaway
text: It doesn't matter where I got it. The fact is-

title: The Runaway
text: You went through my stuff! You had no right!

title: The Runaway
text: Your stuff was messy and I was just straightening up, and I happened to stumble across it!

title: The Runaway
text: That's a lie! [Points at her.] You're lying, Katara!

title: The Runaway
text: [Cut to a surprised Katara who glares at Toph. Pushes Toph's pointing hand out of her face.] Fine! It's a lie! But you've been so out of control lately, I knew something was up! I knew you were hiding something and you were! [Shows her the poster again, but Toph grabs it, tosses it and starts to walk past Katara.] Don't you walk away from me while I'm talking to you!

title: The Runaway
text: [Sarcastically.] Oh really, Mom? Or what are you gonna do? Send me to my room?

title: The Runaway
text: I wish I could!

title: The Runaway
text: Well you can't! Because you're not my mom, and you're not their mom! [Extends her arm at Aang and Sokka, who are sitting on a ledge.]

title: The Runaway
text: I never said I was!

title: The Runaway
text: No, but you certainly act like it! You think it's your job to boss everyone around, but it's not! You're just a regular kid like the rest of us! So stop acting like you can tell me what to do! I can do whatever I want!

title: The Runaway
text: I don't act that way! [Looks at Sokka, who jumps as she says his name.] Sokka, do I act motherly?

title: The Runaway
text: [Puts his hands up defensively.] Hey. I'm staying out of this one.

title: The Runaway
text: [Looks at Aang.] What do you think, Aang? Do I act like a mom?

title: The Runaway
text: [Rubs his eye.] Well. I, uh-

title: The Runaway
text: [Slightly annoyed.] Stop rubbing your eye and speak clearly when you talk!

title: The Runaway
text: [He and Sokka sit straight.] Yes, ma'am.

title: The Runaway
text: I can't be around you right now!

title: The Runaway
text: Well, I can't be around you!

title: The Runaway
text: Both girls turn and walk away. Hawky, sitting on Sokka's shoulder, screeches.

title: The Runaway
text: [Rests his head in his hands.] I know, Hawky. Why can't they just get along?

title: The Runaway
text: Later on at camp, Sokka and Aang are sitting together. Toph and Katara are sitting at separate edges of the cliff, their backs to one another.

title: The Runaway
text: Hey, Aang. You wanna test out my messenger hawk with me? I've got an idea.

title: The Runaway
text: Sure. [Leans his head closer to Sokka.]

title: The Runaway
text: [Talks into Aang's ear.] I'm going to send a note to Katara and say it's from Toph, who wants to apologize. Then everyone will be friends again.

title: The Runaway
text: I gotta say, Sokka, you continue to impress me with your ideas.

title: The Runaway
text: It's a gift. [Pulls out a pen and ink and a piece of paper and starts to write.] "Dear Katara, sorry for everything. Your friend, Toph."

title: The Runaway
text: Sokka positions Hawky on his arm and places the note in Hawky's message holder. Hawky flies to Katara, who takes the note out, reads it, and angrily stands up.

title: The Runaway
text: I know this is from you, Sokka! Toph can't write! [Tears the note up into pieces.] Ugh! You're all driving me crazy! [Turns and walks away.]

title: The Runaway
text: I can't believe we forgot Toph can't write.

title: The Runaway
text: Yup. We're idiots. [Hawky flies back onto his arm.]

title: The Runaway
text: I guess Plan B is we send a note to Toph pretending it's from Katara.

title: The Runaway
text: I think we're gonna run into a similar problem. [Hawky screeches.] Sorry, Hawky. Looks like I'm gonna have to do this without your help. [Walks to Toph.] Come on. We need to talk.

title: The Runaway
text: Toph exhales, annoyed. The camera cuts to another area of the camp. Katara is bathing in a lake directly below a cliff. Sokka and Toph walk up to the edge of the cliff and sit down, not noticing Katara.

title: The Runaway
text: So lemme guess: You brought me out here to tell me that your sister's not as annoying as I make her out to be.

title: The Runaway
text: Nah, she's pretty much a pain. [Katara, looking up at their feet from below and behind, glares and looks away.] She's always got to be right about everything and she gets all bossy and involved and in your business ...

title: The Runaway
text: Yeah. I don't know how you could deal with it.

title: The Runaway
text: Actually, in a way, I rely on it. [Katara looks back up at them.]

title: The Runaway
text: I don't understand.

title: The Runaway
text: When our mom died, that was the hardest time in my life. Our family was a mess, but Katara? She had so much strength. She stepped up and took on so much responsibility. She helped fill the void that was left by our mom.

title: The Runaway
text: I guess I never thought about that.

title: The Runaway
text: I'm gonna tell you something crazy. I never told anyone this before, but honestly? I'm not sure I can remember what my mother looked like. It really seems like my whole life, Katara's been the one looking out for me. She's always been the one that's there. And now, when I try to remember my mom, Katara's is the only face I can picture. [Katara, touched by what Sokka says, is reduced to tears.]

title: The Runaway
text: The truth is sometimes Katara does act motherly, but that's not always a bad thing. She's compassionate and kind, and she actually cares about me. [Wipes away tears from her left eye.] You know, the real me. That's more than my own mom. [Katara, deeply touched by Toph's words, sinks slightly into the water. Toph punches Sokka in the arm.] Don't ever tell her I said any of this!

title: The Runaway
text: Hey, my lips are sealed.

title: The Runaway
text: At around nightfall, Katara is sitting next to Momo, who is napping with Katara rubbing the top of his head. Katara is looking down in front of her, saddened. She sees Sokka and Toph walking toward her and walks up to Toph. When they reach each other, Sokka keeps walking.

title: The Runaway
text: Hi, Toph. Um, I wanna-

title: The Runaway
text: [Holds up her hand in a "stop" fashion.] Katara, stop. You don't need to apologize. I was the one being stupid. These scams are out of control, and I'm done with them.

title: The Runaway
text: [Smiles.] Actually I wasn't going to apologize. I was gonna say ... I wanna pull a scam with you. [Aang and Sokka stare at her from behind, extremely shocked.]

title: The Runaway
text: [Also shocked.] What? You wanna pull a scam?

title: The Runaway
text: Not just any scam. The ultimate scam. [Sokka and Aang, still staring at her with shock, look at each other and faint, foaming from the mouth slightly. Katara puts her arm around Toph's shoulder, who gives a sly smile.] Whaddaya say, Toph? Just me and you. One last go. You in?

title: The Runaway
text: [Excited.] You know I'm in! Now what's this idea of yours? [They walk away and leave Aang and Sokka behind, who are now unconscious and foaming at the mouth.]

title: The Runaway
text: The scene changes to Katara and Toph going over the plan. Katara is looking at Toph's wanted poster.

title: The Runaway
text: The plan is simple: This wanted poster says you're worth a lot of money; Ten times more than you've made in all of your scams. So I'm gonna turn you in and collect the reward. Then you metalbend yourself out of jail, and we're on our way. [As she speaks, the screen fades to the beginning of the episode, where Toph is seen running from the authorities and is caught in a net.]

title: The Runaway
text: [Angrily.] How could you do this to me? You betrayed me!

title: The Runaway
text: [Crosses her arms.] You brought this on yourself. I had no choice. [Turns away from Toph.]

title: The Runaway
text: Toph is dragged away in the net, all the while glaring back at Katara. Katara glances back slightly and gives a sly smile. She is joined by the chief of authorities.

title: The Runaway
text: You did the right thing by turning in the Runaway.

title: The Runaway
text: The right thing is its own reward.

title: The Runaway
text: Well, I'm happy to hear you say that.

title: The Runaway
text: [Pauses for a moment.] But, I still want the actual reward.

title: The Runaway
text: Of course. Right this way.

title: The Runaway
text: Meanwhile, a female guard drags Toph into a jail. She throws Toph from the net into a wooden cell and closes it. Toph feels the floor of her cell, but is shocked when she can't sense any earth in it. She gets up and looks outside the cell at the guard.

title: The Runaway
text: Hey! What kind of cell is this?

title: The Runaway
text: A wooden one. [She walks away as Toph becomes visibly worried.]

title: The Runaway
text: In an office, the town authority grabs a box underneath a desk and looks around in it. A door opens behind Katara, who is standing across the desk from the chief. The chief closes the box and points at Katara.

title: The Runaway
text: That's her! That's the girl you were looking for!

title: The Runaway
text: Katara turns and sees the assassin with the third eye tattooed on his head, aka "Sparky-Sparky-Boom Man", walk in, leaving her shocked and horrified. Meanwhile, at camp, Sokka and Aang are worried, the latter pacing back and forth.

title: The Runaway
text: Do you think this scam of theirs should be taking this long?

title: The Runaway
text: I was just wondering the same thing. We'd better check it out. [To Hawky and Momo.] You two behave. [Pointing at Appa.] Appa's in charge. [Appa lifts his head as the two animals start screeching at each other as soon as Sokka and Aang leave, but stop as soon as Appa roars at them.]

title: The Runaway
text: The camera cuts to Toph's cell, which now holds Katara too. They both are sitting on the floor, downcast, when Toph suddenly realizes something.

title: The Runaway
text: Wait! It's a trap!

title: The Runaway
text: [Sarcastically.] Really? No kidding! Is that why we're sitting in a wooden cage right now? Gee, how'd you figure out it was a trap?

title: The Runaway
text: Not for us, Katara! We're the bait! He wants Aang! [Katara's eyes widen with realization.]

title: The Runaway
text: I can't believe I'm so stupid! See? This is exactly why I'm against these scams! I knew this would happen!

title: The Runaway
text: But, this was your idea.

title: The Runaway
text: I know. I wanted to show that I'm not so motherly. I wanted to show you that I can have fun too.

title: The Runaway
text: Katara, you are fun. If nothing else, you're at least fun to argue with.

title: The Runaway
text: I know your relationship with your parents is complicated. And I shouldn't have said what I said.

title: The Runaway
text: It's okay. I was really mad when you said that because ... well because, maybe it's true. [Starts to cry.] I try not to think about it, but when I left, I probably really hurt them.

title: The Runaway
text: Katara embraces Toph. Meanwhile, Sokka and Aang walk around town looking for Katara and Toph. The town is seemingly abandoned.

title: The Runaway
text: Where do you think they might be?

title: The Runaway
text: Where do you think anyone is? [The assassin is seen walking across a rooftop behind them. Aang hears him inhaling and becomes shocked when he turns and sees him.] Sokka, watch out! [He grabs Sokka as they dodge a blast from the assassin and take cover behind an Ozai statue.] It's Sparky-Sparky-Boom Man!

title: The Runaway
text: You know, I'm starting to think that name doesn't quite fit.

title: The Runaway
text: The assassin jumps down from the roof and fires another blast at them. They barely dodge it, but get sent flying back by the blast, which shakes the ceiling of Toph and Katara's cell. Toph is trying to break out, while Katara is sitting down.

title: The Runaway
text: What are we gonna do?

title: The Runaway
text: I don't know. I wish we had some earth or water. We need bendables.

title: The Runaway
text: What about your meteor bracelet? You can make a saw.

title: The Runaway
text: I left it back at camp. [Sits down.] I was worried they would take it.

title: The Runaway
text: Katara exhales deeply and wipes her forehead with the back of her hand. Her eyes widen with realization as she notices her hand is covered in sweat. She smiles and quickly stands up to start running in place.

title: The Runaway
text: [Confused.] Um, Katara? Are you okay?

title: The Runaway
text: Just fine.

title: The Runaway
text: [Still confused.] Well, what are you doing?

title: The Runaway
text: I'm making my own water.

title: The Runaway
text: Katara stops running and wipes her forehead again. This time, she uses waterbending to use the midair sweat as blades to cut through the wooden cage. Toph stands up upon noticing this.

title: The Runaway
text: [Amazed.] Katara! You're a genius! A sweaty, stinky genius!

title: The Runaway
text: Katara waterbends another blade of sweat, this time from under her arms. Cut to Aang and Sokka being chased by the assassin. The assassin fires a blast at them which they dodge but still get sent flying. Sokka crashes onto a wheelbarrow, which they hide behind.

title: The Runaway
text: This guy is too good! He shoots fire from his brain!

title: The Runaway
text: We should split up. He can't chase us both.

title: The Runaway
text: The assassin walks out of the smoke. Aang runs off from his left and Sokka from his right. The assassin fires a blast at the wheelbarrow and blows it up. Aang runs past him on a roof to his left. The assassin quickly turns and fires another blast, which sends Aang flying into the Ozai statue. He falls from the statue to the ground. He looks up and sees the assassin standing above him inhale, about to fire another blast at Aang, but his head is suddenly encased in ice. The assassin moves and Aang sees Katara, Sokka, and Toph standing behind the assassin.

title: The Runaway
text: Aang, get up! [She helps him up and they run away.]

title: The Runaway
text: Let's get out of here!

title: The Runaway
text: The assassin breaks the ice with brute force. He launches another blast at Team Avatar, but Toph quickly launches a boulder at the blast, blowing the boulder up. A pebble from the boulder flies toward the assassin and hits him square in his third eye, which momentarily stuns and angers him. He tries to fire another blast, but with his chi is blocked, he ignites the air around him and gets sent back, head-first into a wall. When he stands up and shakes it off, Team Avatar is gone.

title: The Runaway
text: [Still running.] Hey, I got it! The perfect name for that guy: "Combustion Man!"

title: The Runaway
text: Good job, Sokka. Now let's get outta here before Combustion Man catches us.

title: The Runaway
text: See? It fits so well!

title: The Runaway
text: Later that night, the gang flies to another camp spot on Appa.

title: The Runaway
text: [Yawns.] Well, I'm exhausted. Hawky, how about you, buddy? [Hawky makes a bird call.] Yeah. You're such a lazy little bird.

title: The Runaway
text: Aang and Sokka get off Appa. Katara is about to dismount Appa, but is stopped by Toph.

title: The Runaway
text: Katara? I need your help.

title: The Runaway
text: [Sits back down.] What is it, Toph?

title: The Runaway
text: [Pulls out a sheet of paper.] I need you to write some things down for me. I wanna send a letter to my parents.

title: The Runaway
text: [Smiling.] I'll be happy to help.

title: The Runaway
text: They place a letter inside Hawky's holder and send him off as he flies away.

title: The Runaway
text: Hey, where'd Hawky go?

title: The Runaway
text: Fade to credits.

title: The Runaway
text: Aang

title: The Puppetmaster
text: [Narrating a preview.] Previously on Avatar ...

title: The Puppetmaster
text: You're looking at the only waterbender in the whole South Pole. This ship has haunted my tribe when Gran-Gran was a little girl. It was part of the Fire Nation's first attacks.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: The legend said the moon was the first waterbender. Our ancestor saw how it pushed and pulled the tides, and learned how to do it themselves.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: I always noticed my waterbending is stronger at night.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: What are you doing?

title: The Puppetmaster
text: I'm making my own water!

title: The Puppetmaster
text: The episode opens to a waxing gibbous moon glowing in the night sky. The scene cuts to a shot of a field of fire lilies, a mountain in the distance. Cuts to a forested area, where Team Avatar is camping out among the trees. The darkness of the night gives the landscape an ominous feeling.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: [Telling a ghost story.] Suddenly, they heard something down the hall in the dark. Oooh ... It came into the torchlight ... and they knew the blade of Wing Fung was haunted! [Draws sword, stands up and points it toward the fire; yells dramatically.] Ooh-aaah!

title: The Puppetmaster
text: Cuts to shot of the entire group sitting around the campfire. Aang is lying down, Katara is hunched over in a sitting position and Toph sits casually, all three looking unamused.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: [Unimpressed.] I think I like "the man with a sword for a hand" better.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: Water Tribe slumber parties must stink.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: No, wait! I've got one! And this is a true Southern Water Tribe story.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: [Sitting down.] Is this one of those "a friend of my cousin knew some guy that this happened to" stories?

title: The Puppetmaster
text: No, it happened to Mom.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: Upon hearing this, Sokka stiffens. Cuts to Aang, who sits up to listen intently.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: One winter when Mom was a girl, a snowstorm buried the whole village for weeks. A month later, Mom noticed she hadn't seen her friend Nini since the storm. So Mom and some others went to check on Nini's family. When they got there, no one was home. [Cuts to ground-level shot of the group sitting around the fire, the camera panning slightly to the right.] Just a fire flickering in the fireplace. While the men went out to search, Mom stayed in the house. When she was alone, she heard a voice. [In a scary voice.] "It's so cold and I can't get warm!" [Sokka stiffens in fear.] Mom turned and saw Nini standing by the fire. She was blue like she was frozen. Mom ran outside for help, but when everyone came back, Nini was gone.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: Aang uses Momo's ears to cover his face in fear. The camera shifts to show Sokka hiding behind a gnarled tree stump.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: [Peering from behind a tree trunk.] Where'd she go?

title: The Puppetmaster
text: No one knows. Nini's house stands empty to this day, but sometimes, people see smoke coming up from the chimney, like little Nini is still trying to get warm.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: The camera zooms out to where the gang is all huddled by the fire. Suddenly, Toph straightens up and places her hands on the ground.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: [Gasping.] Wait! Guys, did you hear that? [Aang, Katara, and Sokka clutch each other tightly, too stiff to move, with Toph standing alertly.] I hear people under the mountain. And they're screaming.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: Sokka, assuming Toph is joking, relaxes his grip.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: Pfft! Nice try.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: [Cuts to shot of the campsite viewed through the ominous-looking tree branches.] No, I'm serious. I hear something.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: You're probably just jumpy from the ghost stories ...

title: The Puppetmaster
text: It just ... stopped.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: [Cuts back to him and Katara, still hugging, Sokka sitting close by.] All right, now I'm getting scared.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: [Off-camera from behind group.] Hello, children.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: Everyone screams in terror upon hearing the strange woman's voice and scrambles from the ground. An elderly woman emerges from the shadows.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: Sorry to frighten you. My name is Hama. [Cuts to side-view of the campsite.] You children shouldn't be out in the forest by yourselves at night. [Cuts to ground-level shot of Hama standing over the fire.] I have an inn nearby. Why don't you come back there for some spiced tea and warm beds?

title: The Puppetmaster
text: [Sheepishly, places arm behind head.] Yes, please.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: Hama smiles and begins walking away. The scene changes to a village, her local inn lying atop a small hill. Cuts to inside the building, where tea is being poured into a teacup. Cuts to shot of the group sitting around the kitchen table.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: Thanks for letting us stay here tonight. You have a lovely inn.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: [Sets teapot down.] Aren't you sweet? [Walks over to her seat and sits down.] You know you should be careful. People have been disappearing in those woods you were camping in.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: What do you mean "disappearing"?

title: The Puppetmaster
text: [Sets her teacup down.] When the moon turns full, people walk in and they don't come out. [Stand up and holds up her teapot; cheerfully smiling.] Who wants more tea?

title: The Puppetmaster
text: Cuts to shot of the group, who has by now fallen completely silent, the camera panning to the right to show all of them sitting around the table.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: Don't worry, you'll all be completely safe here. [Clasps hands together and smiles.] Why don't I show you to your rooms and you can get a good night's rest?

title: The Puppetmaster
text: The scene changes to Sokka's room, where he is lying in bed with Momo asleep on the floor. Cuts to shot of him in bed as he rolls over. A creaking noise comes from outside, frightening him. He draws his sword quickly while Momo scampers under the covers.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: I know, Momo. [Places sword back inside holster and sets it down.] This place is creepy! [Lies back down on the pillow and pulls the covers over him.] I don't know if I'm gonna be able to fall asleep!

title: The Puppetmaster
text: The scene switches over to later in the night, where Sokka is fast asleep in his bed, snoring and drooling on his pillow. As it fades to the morning, he is lying sideways, next to the bed, though still fast asleep. Cut to a close-up of his face as a shadow approaches him. He slowly awakens, rubbing his eye.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: [Off-camera.] Wakey, wakey! [Cuts to shot of the innkeeper, standing brightly over him.] Time to go shopping!

title: The Puppetmaster
text: Katara appears by her side, dressed and happily smiling. The camera shifts counter-clockwise, showing Sokka later in the day, dressed in his ordinary clothes, standing in the marketplace where Hama has just made her purchase. A friendly old man smiles and waves to her as she walks away.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: That Mr. Yao seems to have a thing for you. Maybe we should go back and see if he'll give us some free komodo sausages?

title: The Puppetmaster
text: [Seriously.] You would have me use my feminine charms to take advantage of that poor man? [Cheerfully.] I think you and I are going to get along swimmingly!

title: The Puppetmaster
text: The two walk off-camera with Katara smiling at this remark. The scene switches over to two villagers having a conversation by a stand.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: You won't have any ash bananas till next week?

title: The Puppetmaster
text: Well, I have to send the boy to Hing Wa Island to get them, and it's a two-day trip.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: Oh, right. Tomorrow's the full moon.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: [In a lowered voice.] Exactly. I can't lose another delivery boy in the woods.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: Cuts to shot of Aang, Sokka, and Toph walking through the marketplace. Aang carrying a package slung over his shoulder, Sokka carrying a package attached to his sword, while Toph carries a large, round basket on her head.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: People disappearing in the woods, weird stuff happening during full moons? This just reeks of Spirit World shenanigans.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: I bet if we take a little walk around town, we'll find out what these people did to the environment to make the spirits mad.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: [Makes gesture with his hand.] And then you can sew up this little mystery lickety-split, Avatar style!

title: The Puppetmaster
text: [Proudly.] Helping people ... that's what I do.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: Cuts to overhead shot of the group standing in the marketplace as he, Sokka and Toph approach Katara and Hama.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: Why don't you take all those things back to the inn? I just have to run a couple more errands. I'll be back in a little while.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: [Walks up to her.] This is a mysterious little town you have here.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: [Extremely close-up. Ominously.] Mysterious town for mysterious children.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: She smiles creepily and saunters away, leaving Sokka feeling suspicious. The scene changes to a shot of Hama's inn, starting outside, before moving inside, where the gang is unpacking groceries. Sokka walks over to a counter and sets his basket down.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: That Hama seems a little strange. Like she knows something, or she's hiding something.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: [Unpacking items.] That's ridiculous. She's a nice woman who took us in and gave us a place to stay. [Picks up cabbage.] She kinda reminds me of Gran-Gran.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: But what did she mean by that comment, "mysterious children"?

title: The Puppetmaster
text: Gee, I don't know. Maybe because she found four strange kids camping in the woods at night? Isn't that a little mysterious?

title: The Puppetmaster
text: I'm gonna take a look around. [Walks away and up a flight of wooden stairs.]

title: The Puppetmaster
text: [Appears along with the others at the bottom of the stairwell.] Sokka! Sokka, what are you doing? [Off-camera as Sokka peers around the inn.] You can't just snoop around someone's house.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: It'll be fine.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: [Off-camera while Sokka peers into a room.] She could be home any minute.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: [Walking down hallway with the rest of the team.] Sokka, you're gonna get us all in trouble and this is just plain rude!

title: The Puppetmaster
text: [Tugging on a cupboard door.] I'm not finished yet. [Grunts, as he tries to pull it free.] Come on ...

title: The Puppetmaster
text: The cupboard suddenly opens, revealing several wooden puppets stowed inside. The dolls fall forward, held together only by their strings. Everyone gasps; Sokka withdraws his sword, backs up and points it straight at the puppets.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: Okay, that's pretty creepy.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: [Walks over and closes the cupboard; a bit weirded out.] So she's got a hobby. There's nothing weird about that. [Angrily.] Sokka, you've looked enough. [Off-camera as Sokka ascends into the attic.] Hama will be back soon.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: Just an ordinary puppet-loving innkeeper, huh? Well then why does she have a locked door up here?

title: The Puppetmaster
text: [Annoyed.] Probably to keep people like you from snooping through her stuff!

title: The Puppetmaster
text: We'll see. [Peers through the keyhole into the room. Cuts to shot of the attic from his perspective. Through the keyhole, a small room can be seen, with a chest lying on the ground in the middle. The camera zooms in on the chest.] It's empty, except for a little chest.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: Maybe it's treasure!

title: The Puppetmaster
text: Sokka grows excited, his eyes growing wide, and uses his sword to pick the lock.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: [Approaches him.] Sokka, what are you doing? You're breaking into a private room!

title: The Puppetmaster
text: I have to see what's in there.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: The door unlocks and creaks open. The four step cautiously inside; Sokka puts away his sword and approaches the small chest.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: We shouldn't be doing this.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: Sokka picks up the chest and tries to pry it open, only to discover it is locked.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: Maybe there's a key here somewhere ...

title: The Puppetmaster
text: Ooh! Hand it over!

title: The Puppetmaster
text: She takes the chest, removes her meteor bracelet from her arm and earthbends it into the shape of a small key, which she sticks into the keyhole of the chest.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: [Eagerly.] Come on, come on!

title: The Puppetmaster
text: [Annoyed; Katara appears from behind her, peering nervously over her shoulder.] This isn't as easy as it looks!

title: The Puppetmaster
text: [Nervously.] Guys, I don't know about this ...

title: The Puppetmaster
text: This is crazy! I'm leaving!

title: The Puppetmaster
text: Suit yourself! Do it, Toph!

title: The Puppetmaster
text: Katara turns to leave the moment Toph signals that she has successfully opened the chest, holding her thumb up. All four eagerly surround the box in a comical fashion, anticipating what they will find inside.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: [Off-camera from behind them.] I'll tell you what's in the box.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: All, except Toph, scream and turn sharply to find Hama standing in the doorway. Cuts to shot of the group, still looking stunned, except Toph. Sokka guiltily hands her the box. Cuts to shot from inside the chest, as Hama lifts the lid and reaches her hand inside. Cuts to close-up of Sokka, his eyes wide in anxiousness, and a shot of Hama still in the process of lifting the object. Cuts to shot of the team standing together from her perspective. Her left arm appears on-screen, a blue whale tooth comb in her hand. Cuts to shot of her holding the comb, smiling.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: [Surprised.] An old comb?

title: The Puppetmaster
text: It's my greatest treasure. It's the last thing I own from growing up in the Southern Water Tribe.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: The camera zooms in on Katara and Sokka, who stare at her in astonishment.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: [Stunned.] You're from the Southern Water Tribe?

title: The Puppetmaster
text: [Sets down comb.] Just like you.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: How did you know?

title: The Puppetmaster
text: I heard you talking around your campfire.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: But why didn't you tell us?

title: The Puppetmaster
text: I wanted to surprise you! I bought all this food today so I could fix you a big Water Tribe dinner. Of course, I can't get all the ingredients I need here, but ocean kumquats are a lot like sea prunes if you stew them long enough.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: [Sticking his tongue out in disgust.] Great ...

title: The Puppetmaster
text: I knew I felt a bond with you right away.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: And I knew you were keeping a secret, so I guess we're both right. [Grimaces as Katara hits him in the arm.] But I'm sorry we were sneaking around.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: Apology accepted. [Turns to the side and motions with her hand.] Now, let's get cooking!

title: The Puppetmaster
text: The scene changes to later that night, where Aang races from the inn to the barn located toward the back of the property. Cuts to overhead shot of inside the barn, where Appa and Momo lie. The doors creak open and Aang steps inside. Cuts to ground-level shot of him standing before the bison, tossing a cabbage-like vegetable into Appa's mouth. Momo dances in front of the bison's face and chitters, irritated. Appa opens his mouth and releases the cabbage, which Momo grabs. The lemur skitters away. Cuts to shot of Hama's kitchen table, as she sets down a bowl of soup. Cuts to shot of the entire room, the team and the innkeeper sitting around the table. Sokka is seen chewing on a food item, as Hama takes her seat at the head of the table.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: [Whispering to Toph.] I'd steer clear of the sea prunes.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: I thought they were ocean kumquats.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: Close enough.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: Who wants five flavor soup?

title: The Puppetmaster
text: All four raise their hands in acceptance. Hama situates her hands over the bowl and suddenly uses waterbending to summon a globule of soup and fill each of their bowls. Cuts to shot of the team looking at the spectacle in astonishment, the camera panning to the right. Four streams of soup land gracefully into each of their bowls.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: [Delighted.] You're a waterbender! [Faces Hama in delight.] I've never met another waterbender from our tribe!

title: The Puppetmaster
text: [Cuts to side-view of her; sadly.] That's because the Fire Nation wiped them all out. I was the last one ...

title: The Puppetmaster
text: Cuts to shot of Sokka and Katara, Katara clasping her hands together, an expression of pity on her face.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: So how did you end up out here?

title: The Puppetmaster
text: [Grimly.] I was stolen from my home.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: The scene fades to a flashback of a much younger Hama peacefully sauntering through her Southern Water Tribe village.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: [Voice-over.] It was over sixty years ago when the raids started.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: She approaches her friend, Kanna, and they share a laugh before they notice ashen snow falling from the sky. The two race to the shores, where five Fire Nation ships are rapidly approaching the tribe. Five fireballs are launched from trebuchets and strike the village. Fire Nation soldiers swarm the area, battling the waterbenders, who desperately attempt to fend them off.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: [Voice-over.] They came again and again, each time rounding up more of our waterbenders and taking them captive.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: The battle scene fades to another scene, where Hama and several other waterbenders use waterbending to capsize a Fire Nation vessel.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: [Voice-over.] We did our best to hold them off, but our numbers dwindled as the raids continued.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: As she is narrating, Water Tribe civilians who aided in the suspension of the vessel are seen slowly fading, signaling their capture by the Fire Nation. The camera rotates around her and zooms out, revealing dozens of firebenders surrounding her.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: [Voice-over.] Finally, I too was captured.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: The younger Hama is seen being led by Fire Nation soldiers onto one of their naval vessels, having now been captured herself.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: [Voice-over.] I was led away in chains. The last waterbender of the Southern Water Tribe.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: A final scene shows her looking out onto her tribe's members, including her friend, Kanna, in tears as the bow creaks upward. The flashback ends. Now in present time, Katara is seen walking over to Hama and placing her arms around her shoulder comfortingly.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: They put us in terrible prisons here in the Fire Nation. I was the only one who managed to escape.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: How did you get away? And why did you stay in the Fire Nation?

title: The Puppetmaster
text: I'm sorry. It's too painful to talk about anymore.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: We completely understand. We lost our mother in a raid.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: [Sympathetically.] Oh, you poor things.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: Aang and Sokka cast their heads down solemnly.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: I can't tell you what it means to meet you. It's an honor. You're a hero.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: I never thought I'd meet another Southern waterbender. I'd like to teach you what I know so you can carry on the Southern tradition when I'm gone.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: Yes! Yes, of course! To learn about my heritage, it would mean everything to me.

title: The Puppetmaster
text: She bows to her newfound friend, who smiles warmly. The scene changes to the next day, where Hama and Katara are strolling on the outskirts of Hama's village.

title: The Puppetmaster
