text: Everyone's counting on me to lead this mission Katara, I won't let them down. [Attempts to stand again but can't.] Ahh!

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
text: Can't you heal him any faster?

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
text: I'm doing everything I can.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
text: [Looks around before looking confidant.] I'll do it.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
text: No offense Sokka, but you're not exactly Mr. Healing Hands.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
text: No. [Stands confidently.] I'll lead the invasion force.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
text: Don't be crazy Sokka.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
text: Maybe I am a little crazy, but the eclipse is about to start and we need to be up that volcano by the time it does.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
text: You can do this. [Cuts to a close-up of him.] I'm proud of you son.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
text: I still think you're crazy, but I'm proud of you too.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
text: [Nods, puts his helmet on and boards Appa.] Yip yip.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
text: Appa flies away as the scene cuts to show the battlefield, a mess of Fire Nation tanks destroyed everywhere. Several raised battlements fire on the army below. Appa lands and takes out an enemy tank as Sokka makes his way to the back of the saddle to rally the soldiers.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
text: Listen up, everyone. I want the tanks in wedge formation. Warriors and benders in the middle. We're taking that tower, and heading for the royal palace. [All the tanks come together in wedge formation behind Appa, soldiers protected in the middle. Cut to Sokka, on Appa, who draws his sword and thrusts it forward.] Charge!

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
text: The scene cuts to show Aang standing on the edge of the volcano. He glides down to a building attempting to hide. He rises, confused, as there is nobody there.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
text: [Looking around.] That's strange. [He continues onto the Royal Palace, breaks open the door, and takes a fighting stance.] The Avatar is back! [Realizing no one is around he relaxes, looking confused.] Hello? Anyone home?

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
text: The scene cuts to the tanks, which are making their way up the volcano, unaffected by fire blasts from firebenders in front. Cut to Sokka steering a vehicle full of explosives into a wall before jumping off. Cut to an aerial view showing two explosions at the inner walls. Cut to Sokka, soldiers behind him, as they charge forward. Firebenders attempt to stop them but are pushed back. Cut to Tyro running in with the other troops as Bato appears behind him.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
text: The Fire Nation is falling back!

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
text: Sokka, we're on our way to victory!

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
text: Sokka looks ahead as the camera cuts to show Aang airbending his way into an empty, darkened throne room.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
text: No. [Kneels down on the ground; frustrated.] No, no, no! Fire Lord Ozai, where are you!?

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
text: Scene fades to credits.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 1: The Invasion
text: Aang

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: The episode opens to the invasion of the Fire Nation where the moon can be seen gradually moving in front of the sun. Cuts to a shot of the submarines remaining stationery at the shores of the plaza. The camera pans upward, revealing the plaza empty except for Huu, disguised as the swamp monster, and several Foggy Swamp Tribe members.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Brightening.] Dad! [Rising and approaching the two.] You're on your feet again.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Sitting down; somewhat weakly.] Thanks to your sister. I'm in no shape to fight, but maybe there's some way I can help.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Everything's going smoothly and the eclipse hasn't even kicked in yet.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Katara moves away, sensing something in the distance.] Let's hope our luck holds out. [Noticing her move away.] Katara, you seem distracted. Is something wrong?

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Quizzically.] Yeah. Is that ... is that Aang?

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Shocked.] What? [Cuts to shot of Aang riding in on his glider, dodging several fireballs. He lands in front of the group.] Please tell me you're here because the Fire Lord turned out to be a big wimp and you didn't even need the eclipse to take him down.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Katara and Aang kneel with Sokka.] He wasn't home. No one was. The entire palace city is abandoned.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [With epiphany; the camera shifts from a side-view of his face to a frontal view.] They knew.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Cuts to overhead shot of the group sitting together in a circle. Aang rubs his fingers along the ground idly.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Dismayed.] It's over. The Fire Lord is probably long-gone; far away on some remote island where he'll be safe during the eclipse.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Thoughtfully.] No. My instincts tell me he wouldn't go too far. He would have a secret bunker; somewhere he could go and be safe during the siege but still be close enough to lead his nation.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: If it's an underground secret bunker we're looking for, [Points to herself.] I'm just the girl to find it.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Pulling out mechanism.] The mechanist gave me this timing device. It looks like we've got about ten minutes until the full eclipse. Ten minutes to find the Fire Lord.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: We can still do this. We can still win the day.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Worried.] Wait! If they knew we were coming it could all be a trap. [Looks at the others; the camera pans to the right.] Maybe we should use the time we have left to make sure we all get out of here safely.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Everyone who's here today came prepared to risk everything for this mission. They know what's at stake. If there's still a chance and there's still hope, I think they would want Aang to go for it.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [To Aang.] What do you think? You're the one that has to face the Fire Lord. Whatever you decide, I'm with you.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Rising, turning his back to the group, determined.] I've gotta try.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: The scene changes to where Aang, Toph, and Sokka are flying on Appa to the Caldera Volcano in the Fire Nation. Appa lands on the side as the others jump off.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Do you feel anything down there?

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Placing her hand on the ground to feel vibrations.] Yep. There are natural tunnels criss-crossing through the inside of the volcano.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Anything else? Is there a structure somewhere?

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Taking her hands and digging her fingers into the surface.] There is something big, dense and made of metal deep in the heart of the volcano.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Raises arms up in the background.] Sounds like a secret bunker to me.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Toph earthbends a hole in the volcano, blowing up a cloud of dust. Sokka follows her into the tunnel.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [To Appa and Momo.] Stay safe. We'll be back soon.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: He enters the tunnel into a dark cavern, with Toph leaning over and surveying the area using seismic sense.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Pointing.] This way! That one's a dead end!

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Following her.] What would we do without you?

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Camera view changes to show the group walking past magma channels.] Perish in burning hot magma.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Observing the magma channels; blushing.] Yeah, pretty much.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: They arrive at a chamber where magma erupts from several spouts in the ground.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: The tunnel continues on the other side and It leads right to the bunker.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: We'll have to be fast, but careful.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: He begins walking past only for a geyser of magma to erupt, nearly striking him. Aang uses airbending to cool and solidify the gush.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: How is that careful?

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: I was wrong. We need to be fast, careful and lucky.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: The three leap and run their way through the chamber, narrowly avoiding magma spouts. They arrive to a rock ledge, completely surrounded by molten lava.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: There's no floor. It's just a river of lava.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Spinning his staff open.] Climb aboard and hold on tight.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Scene changes to where Sokka and Toph, screaming in fear, are clinging to Aang's glider for their life as they ride swiftly over the river of lava. They reach the other side safely and approach a large metal, dome-like structure with a huge door.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Impressed.] That's some door!

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Walks over to the door and bangs the metal with her fist.] Not a problem.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: She uses metalbending, jamming into the door with her elbows, creating cracks in the metal. She steps back several feet, kisses her fingertips and splits the door wide open. Stepping inside the interior, she points in a direction.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Entering the bunker while making some hand movements.] I am so glad we added you to the group!

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Back at the invasion, the Fire Nation is beginning to fall back, unsuccessfully trying to deflect the attacks of the invasion force. The Boulder and The Hippo use earthbending to create landslides that collapse several battlements.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Witnessing the sun as the moon begins to overshadow it.] Retreat! Everyone move to the secondary defensive position! Retreat!

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: The Fire Nation soldiers halt their attacks and begin escaping the scene.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Standing from the side of an Earth Kingdom tank.] The eclipse is only minutes away. We should be able to make it up to hill by the time it starts and secure the entire palace by the time it's finished.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: The troops cheer gruffly and continue on their way to the capital.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Stopping with her father.] We can wait here if you want.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Determined.] No. I wanna press forward with the others.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: The two resume walking. The scene changes to Aang, Toph and Sokka running down the tunnels. Qin is coming down the same hallway, whistling. The team, upon seeing him, immediately corners him, prepared to attack.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Out of fear.] The Fire Lord's chamber is that way, down the hall, to the left, [Makes climbing motions with his fingers.] and up the stairs, you can't miss it!

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Suspicious look suddenly becomes friendly.] Thanks!

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: The trio continues on their way to find the Fire Lord. Qin relaxes himself, does a few double takes, and continues whistling as if nothing happened before walking away. The group continues running; Sokka pulls out his timing device.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Only thirty seconds until the total eclipse.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: The approach a set of large doors. The camera focuses on a determined Aang.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: I'm ready. I'm ready to face the Fire Lord.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: He blasts the doors down with airbending. They step inside where Azula is heard speaking.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: So, you are alive after all. [Aang stares at her in shock.] I had a hunch that you survived. But it doesn't matter. [Proudly.] I've known about the invasion for months.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: The entire group looks at the princess in surprise and horror. Meanwhile, Zuko stands before a small metal door, a burning torch surrounding either side of it.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [To himself.] I'm ready to face you.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: He opens the door, revealing Fire Lord Ozai sitting on the far side of the room, drinking tea. The Fire Lord is surrounded by several Royal Procession guards. He sets his teacup down upon seeing the prince.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Prince Zuko? What are you doing here?

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: The scene switches to outside, showing the moon nearly blocking out the entire sun. Cut to aerial view of the inside of the volcano. Cut to the army marching onward as the eclipse is beginning. The mechanist appears near the troops and addresses the troops.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: The eclipse is starting! [Pulls out specialized eyewear and puts it on.] Put on your eclipse glasses!

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: The warriors stop, prop their weapons into the ground and put on their eclipse glasses. Katara and Hakoda, wearing eclipse glasses, turn to watch the eclipse. The camera zooms out, the eclipse having officially begun. The scene changes to where Zuko is confronting Ozai.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Why are you here?

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: I'm here to tell the truth.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Off-camera.] Telling the truth during the middle of an eclipse. [Cuts to shot of him.] This should be interesting.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: He sends the guards out of the room. One by one the guards file out, closing the doors behind them.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: First of all, in Ba Sing Se, it was Azula who took down the Avatar, not me.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Why would she lie to me about that?

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Because the Avatar's not dead. He survived.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Shocked and horrified.] What?

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: In fact, he's probably leading this invasion. He could be on his way here right now.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Rises from his seat and points toward the door.] Get out! Get out of my sight right now if you know what's good for you!

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: That's another thing. I'm not taking orders from you anymore.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Angrily.] You will obey me, or this defiant breath will be your last!

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Pulls out his swords.] Think again. I am going to speak my mind, and you are going to listen.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Ozai sits down, dismayed at the turn of events. The scene switches to Aang, Sokka and Toph confronting Azula.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Where is he? Where's the Fire Lord?

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Rises from throne.] You mean I'm not good enough for you? [Acts hurt.] You're hurting my feelings.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Stop wasting our time and give us the information. [Points sword at her.] You're powerless right now, so you're in no position to refuse.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Appears on scene and clenches fist.] And stick to the truth. I'll be able to tell if you're lying.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Walking a few steps forward.] Are you sure? I'm a pretty good liar. [Pauses slightly.] I am a four-hundred foot tall purple platypus bear with pink horns and silver wings.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Cuts to Toph; short pause.] Okay, you're good, I admit it. [Traps Azula using earthbending.] But you ought to consider telling the truth anyway!

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Without warning, the earth trap crumbles and breaks, leaving the trio surprised.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Brushing off dust.] When I left Ba Sing Se I brought home some souvenirs: Dai Li agents!

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Two Dai Li agents descend into the room. Aang sends an air swipe at them with his glider; however, the agents quickly conjure up an earth wall that blocks the attack. Cut to a view of the inside of the volcano. Cuts to Bato reaching the rim of the volcano, followed by the rest of the army.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Surround the periphery! [Raises spear.] We have to secure the palace by the time the eclipse is over! Otherwise, we'll be in for the fight of our lives.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Troops from the invasion force incur several Fire Nation soldiers.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Stop! Surrender peacefully and we won't harm you.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: We'll never surrender! [Makes frenzied motions and tries to firebend, but cannot.] Okay, we surrender. [Fire Nation soldiers back down.]

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Hakoda approaches the rim of the volcano, leaning on his daughter's shoulders.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Happily.] There it is: the Fire Nation Royal Palace. We've come so far.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Doubtful.] It's not over yet.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: The scene changes to where Zuko is confronting Ozai.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: For so long, all I wanted was for you to love me, to accept me. I thought it was my honor I wanted, but really, I was just trying to please you. You, my father, who banished me just for talking out of turn. [Points a broadsword at his father.] My father, who challenged me, a thirteen-year-old boy, to an Agni Kai. [Cuts to shot of Ozai, looking angered.] How could you possibly justify a duel with a child?

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Scornful.] It was to teach you respect!

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: It was cruel! And it was wrong.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Angrily.] Then you have learned nothing!

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: No, I've learned everything! And I've had to learn it on my own! Growing up, we were taught that the Fire Nation was the greatest civilization in history. And somehow, the War was our way of sharing our greatness with the rest of the world. What an amazing lie that was. The people of the world are terrified by the Fire Nation. They don't see our greatness. They hate us! And we deserve it! [Camera view shows top profile of Zuko and Ozai through an overhead grate.] We've created an era of fear in the world. And if we don't want the world to destroy itself [Cuts to shot of Zuko.], we need to replace it with an era of peace and kindness.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Laughs.] Your uncle has gotten to you, hasn't he?

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Yes. [Smiles proudly.] He has.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Ozai only grows more furious. The scene changes to where Team Avatar is fighting Azula and her Dai Li agents. Aang bursts through the stone wall the agents had created and the team runs toward the Fire Nation princess. A stone column erupts from the surface, which Aang manages to dodge. Toph bends two stone slabs sending the agents toward the two sidewalls of the room. The agents each land on one sidewall and send two earth pillars straight at Toph, who conjures two earth walls to block their attacks. She proceeds to send a stream of earth at Azula, who nimbly back-flips onto the throne after being pushed back by the stream. She smirks as she lands.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [While running.] I can't pin her down! She's too quick!

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Azula races through a door, entering a tunnel. A Dai Li agent follows close behind, earthbending a stone wall to block the entranceway. He proceeds to run after the princess. Aang bursts the wall and chases them. The Dai Li agent is suddenly pushed over by a stone column that jutted out from the side of tunnel's wall. A hole appears and Toph emerges from it. The agent lands into a crevice of a nearby metal beam and prepares to attack Toph only for the blind earthbender to destroy his rock gloves and metalbend the grooves of the beam together, trapping him. She and Aang continue chasing Azula. Sokka quickly runs up to them.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Stops running.] Wait! Aang! Toph! Stop attacking! Don't you see what she's doing? She's just playing with us. She's not even trying to win this fight!

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Calmly.] Not true. I'm giving it my all.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Angrily.] You're trying to keep us here and waste all our time!

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Sarcastically.] Um, right, I think your friend just said that, genius. And since you can't see, I should tell you I'm rolling my eyes. [Rolls her eyes in disgust.]

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Angrily.] I'll roll your whole head!

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: She's just baiting you again.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Okay, so what do we do, just ignore her?

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: We don't have a choice. We just have to get out of here and find the Fire Lord on our own somehow.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: The trio turns to leave, walking toward the opposite end of the tunnel.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Coolly.] It's a trap. Don't say I didn't warn you.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Aang and Toph stop walking and turn to look at the princess, both appearing hesitant. Sokka continues to walk forward.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Waves hand up in gesture.] Ignore!

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Craftily.] So, Sokka's your name, right? My favorite prisoner used to mention you all the time. [Sokka stops walking and casts Azula a suspicious glance.] She was convinced you were going to come rescue her. Of course you never came, and she gave up on you.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Sokka sheds a few tears before charging at Azula in blind rage. The princess stands perfectly still.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Evilly to herself.] Come and get it.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: With a quick motion of her left hand, she reveals a hidden dagger, prepared to strike Sokka when he comes within range. Toph senses the weapon and pins Azula's hand to the tunnel wall by sending a rock aimed at her wrist. Sokka grabs her by the shoulder, coming face-to-face with her.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Where. Is. Suki?!

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: The scene changes to Zuko and Ozai.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: After I leave here today, I'm gonna free Uncle Iroh from his prison and I'm gonna beg for his forgiveness. [Cuts to shot of Ozai.] He's the one who's been a real father to me.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Laughs.] Oh, that's just beautiful. And maybe he can pass down to you the ways of tea and failure.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: But I've come to an even more important decision. [Closes eyes and momentarily pauses.] I'm going to join the Avatar and I'm going to help him defeat you.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Smugly.] Really? Since you're a full-blown traitor now and you want me gone, why wait? I'm powerless. You've got your swords. Why don't you just do it now?

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Because I know my own destiny. Taking you down is the Avatar's destiny. [Puts his swords away.] Goodbye.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Camera focuses on Zuko walking away, the Fire Lord in the background, now on his feet.] Coward! You think you're brave enough to face me, but you'll only do it during the eclipse. If you have any real courage, you'll stick around until the sun comes out. Don't you want to know what happened to your mother?

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Zuko abruptly stops and turns to face his father. Ozai smiles. The camera cuts to a shot of outside where the solar eclipse continues. Cut back to Zuko confronting Ozai.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: What happened that night?

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: My father, Fire Lord Azulon, had commanded me to do the unthinkable to you, my own son, and I was going to do it. [Cuts to side-view of Zuko.] Your mother found out and swore she would protect you at any cost. [Camera focuses on Ozai.] She knew I wanted the throne and she proposed a plan, a plan in which I would become Fire Lord and your life would be spared.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Cuts to a close-up shot of Sokka, who narrows his eyes, angrily interrogating Azula.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Where's Suki? Answer me!

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Grabs Sokka's shoulder as camera pans slightly to the right.] Sokka, she won't talk.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Ignores him.] Where are you keeping her?

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: The camera focuses on Azula, who grins smugly, keeping her lips sealed. The shot fades to Ozai who continues his account of the night Ursa disappeared.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Your mother did vicious, treasonous things that night. She knew the consequences and accepted them. For her treason, she was banished.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Grows teary-eyed.] So she's alive?

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Calmly.] Perhaps. Now I realize that banishment is far too merciful a penalty for treason. [Ozai closes his eyes. Shot fades to outside where the solar eclipse begins to end.] Your penalty will be far steeper.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Fade briefly to show the eclipse ending. Fade to Ozai as he opens his eyes and, in split seconds, generates lightning, firing the bolt at Zuko. Zuko slides back several feet from the impact of the bolt, yet manages to redirect it, sending it back to right in front of his father. The resulting explosion causes the Fire Lord to slam into the back wall, where he falls over and raises his head, his face distorted in rage as flames from the lightning attack surround him. The flag behind him falls and the camera cuts to a shot of the room, revealing that Zuko had made his escape. The scene changes to Team Avatar.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Oh, sounds like the firebending's back on.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: She kicks her leg in a wide arc, sending a fire blast that nearly strikes Sokka. Sokka takes several steps back as he narrowly avoids Azula's attacks. She back-flips onto the tunnel wall and uses firebending to break free from Toph's earth cuffs. She flips forward, extending her leg forward, nearly striking Aang, who manages to dodge the incoming danger.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Rises and smirks.] Dad's all the way at the end of the hall then down a secret stairway on the left. I'm sure he'd be more than happy to see you now.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: She runs away, leaving the trio dismayed.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Ashamed.] I fell for it! I used up all our time.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: It's not your fault, Sokka. Azula was ready for us. She had every move planned out.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Sorrowfully.] And now it's too late.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Maybe it's not too late. The eclipse is over. But I can face the Fire Lord anyway.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Matter-of-factly.] No. I don't think that's a good idea.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: But I'm ready! I came here with a job to do and everyone's counting on me.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: The Fire Lord knew we were coming this time. We thought we had surprise on our side but we didn't. It just wasn't our day. What we need to do now is go and help our friends.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Disappointed.] I guess you guys are right.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Placing a hand on Aang's shoulder.] You'll have another chance. I know you will.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: The scene changes to outside where the Invasion force has ceased their attacks. Katara leans Hakoda against an Earth Kingdom tank.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: What should we do, Hakoda? Shouldn't something have happened by now?

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: I don't know. [Katara crosses her arms in scorn.] But now that the eclipse is over, I expect we're going to see some firebenders any minute.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Bato looks up and suddenly becomes alarmed. The camera zooms out to Katara, who looks behind her in the same direction. Cuts to the top of the Royal Palace, where several war balloons rise into the air. Cuts to view of the entire palace, the battlefield where dozens of soldiers stand and where the war balloons continue to rise. Cuts to close-up of the balloons, Fire Nation soldiers fueling them with firebending.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Off-camera.] My own invention. [Cuts to shot of him.] Oh, this is terrible!

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Teo lays a hand on his father's shoulder to comfort him. Cuts to front shot of a war balloon, a much larger contraption rising behind it. Cuts to shot of the entire battlefield, showing the balloons and five airships rising into the air. Katara turns and points to the sky.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: They're back!

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Cut to Appa groaning as he flies in, Toph, Aang, Sokka, and Momo with him. Cuts to Aang looking at the airships. Shows shot of him and Sokka looking very dismayed at the turn of events. Cuts to an airship; camera pans to the right to reveal it entirely. Cuts to Katara running up to Appa who lands. Aang looks at her with a saddened look on his face as the camera pans to Sokka and Toph in the saddle.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Getting off Appa.] It was all a trap! Azula knew we were coming and she's plotted out every move! [Toph gets off, too.] We've just got to get to the beach as fast as we can. [Hakoda approaches.] If we can make it to the submarines, maybe we can get away safely.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: They've got air power, but so do I! [Cut to Aang as he opens his glider.] I'm gonna do what I can to slow them down. [He tosses his glider into the air and takes off, Momo following close behind.]

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Appa, you and I can help too. [Mounts Appa and follows Aang.]

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Shows front view of the airship fleet, Aang flying straight toward it, Katara coming up close behind. Cuts back to Sokka and the invasion force.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Everyone, let's get back to the subs! [Begins running.]

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Cuts back to Aang flying on his glider and Katara flying on Appa. Aang approaches a war balloon. One of the soldiers operating it sees him and fires at him. Aang twists around, dodging several fireballs. Cuts to side-view of him; he closes his glider and soars straight through the balloon, cutting through it. The balloon begins falling as it loses air. Katara approaches another balloon, swiveling around once and slicing it clean through with waterbending. The top portion of the balloon drifts upward while the rest falls downward. Cuts to where the team keeps heading toward the fleet, avoiding fireballs at every turn. Appa's armor is struck with fireballs several times; he grunts. Katara uses water shields to deflect the blasts.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: We can't keep them all back! There's too many of them!

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Let's join the others! [Dodges another fireball.]

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Cuts to shot of the capital as they fly away. The scene changes to the capital city prison; camera pans downward to the ground where Zuko is seen running toward the building. Inside, he runs down a hallway past a guard, who crouches in fear as he passes. He arrives at the entrance to his uncle's prison cell.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Uncle! [Zuko sees a big hole in Iroh's cell and sees Warden Poon on the ground; grabs a dazed Poon by the collar.] Where is my uncle?

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Bewildered and terrified.] He's gone. He busted himself out. I've never seen anything like it, he was like a one-man army!

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Zuko lets go of Poon and leaves. At the invasion, the team is navigating their way down the sides of the volcano. Cuts to view of the underside of an airship; a hatch at the bottom opens.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Try and find cover! I think we're about to see some bombs!

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Aang, Katara, and Appa are seen approaching in the distance. Toph bends a ceiling of earth overhead. Cuts to undersides of the airships as they release bombs. Cuts to overhead view of the invasion force as the bombs rain down and detonate. One bomb lands very near the earth ceiling, causing it to start crumbling. Toph props it up by bending two earth columns to support it. Cuts to view of the earthbending tanks, the soldiers being shaken about by the activity. The airships pass over. The team runs out from under the ceiling. Cuts to view of the Royal Plaza, the airships flying past.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Why aren't they turning around to attack us again?

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Thoughtfully.] They're heading for the beach ... [Alarmed.] They're gonna destroy the submarines!

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Hopelessly.] How are we all going to escape?

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Approaching, helped by Bato.] We're not.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Looks determined.] Then our only choice is to stand and fight. We have the Avatar, we could still win.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Yes, with the Avatar we could still win. On another day. You kids have to leave. You have to escape on Appa together.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Surprised.] What? [Grabs Hakoda.] We can't leave you behind! [Looks at the rest of the invasion force.] We won't leave anyone behind!

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: You're our only chance in the long run. You and Sokka have to go with Aang somewhere safe. [Katara looks back at Aang and Sokka sorrowfully.] It's the only way to keep hope alive.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: The youngest of our group should go with you. The adults will stay behind and surrender. We'll be prisoners, but we'll all survive this battle.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Approaching the two.] I've got some experience with the Fire Nation prisons. It's not going to be easy, but we'll get by.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Turning, alarmed.] They're at the beach already!

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Cuts to the Royal Plaza, the shadows of the airships seen moving along the ground. Camera pans upward to the shore. Cuts to view of the swamp monster, airships flying directly overhead. Tho and Due attempt to deflect the bombs with waterbending; they manage to destroy some. The swamp monster grabs several more and tosses them away. One bomb, however, lands inside the seaweed figure and detonates. Steaming piles of seaweed land onto the ground. Huu, along with Tho and Due, emerge from the mess, defeated. Five bombs are released onto each of the submarines, destroying all five of them. The team looks on in disappointment. Sokka closes his eyes resentfully.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Rising on an earth column along with Toph and helps son mount Appa.] Bye, son. [Hugs Teo.]

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Bye, Dad. I'm really proud of you.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: The mechanist looks up at Teo as the earth column is lowered by Toph.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Struggling to mount Appa.] I'll miss you, Pipsqueak.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Propping The Duke onto the saddle.] Take care, The Duke.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Hugs his father.] We'll be back for you, Dad.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: If we don't escape on our own first.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Haru bows respectfully to Tyro.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Hands on both Sokka and Katara's shoulders.] We lost today, but we've never been this close. [Kneels down to face his two children.] We tasted victory, and that counts for something.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: We'll miss you, Dad. [The two hug him.]

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Bye, Dad. We won't be apart for too long this time. I promise.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Cuts to shot of Hakoda embracing his children; he closes his eyes. Cuts to shot of Aang, sitting on Appa's head, tears streaming down his face. Katara approaches him, puts a hand around his shoulders and smiles at him proudly. Aang wipes away his tears and rises to face the invasion force.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Thank you all for being so brave and so strong. I'm gonna make this up to you.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: The team turns to leave on Appa. Appa moans and takes off as the team looks back sadly at those remaining. Cut to a view of those remaining watching them leave. Meanwhile, on a Fire Nation airship.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Should we follow them, princess?

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: No, they're too fast. It doesn't matter. They'll be back. [Smiles evilly.]

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: [Looking at the airship in the distance then looks ahead.] I know just the place for us to go where we'll be safe for a while. The Western Air Temple!

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Appa flies away in the distance. A war balloon approaches from behind. Cuts to Zuko, a determined look on his face as he follows them. Fades to credits.

title: The Day of Black Sun, Part 2: The Eclipse
text: Aang

title: The Western Air Temple
text: The episode begins with an aerial shot of Appa, still in his armor, and the rest of the gang, now including Haru, The Duke, and Teo, searching for the Western Air Temple on foot. Cut to Toph leading with Haru and Sokka behind. Cut to Aang, Momo on his head, walking next to Appa. Cut to Teo and The Duke. Cut to Katara, Sokka next to her.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: This is humiliating.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: [Looking up at her.] You mean getting thoroughly spanked by the Fire Nation or having to walk all the way to the Western Air Temple?

title: The Western Air Temple
text: [Looking at him momentarily before answering.] Both.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Cut to Aang.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: [He pets Appa, smiling slightly.] Sorry guys, but Appa gets tired carrying all these people.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Cut to a view of the whole team, Toph leading the way.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: I wonder how the rest of the troops are.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: [Frontal view.] They're probably on their way to a prison. Seems like my dad just got out and now he's going back in.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Cut to view of The Duke walking next to Sokka.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: I miss Pipsqueak.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: I miss not having blisters on my feet.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Brief view of the team from behind before we see Toph's foot stamp down. Cut to Toph looking up, smiling.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Hey, we're here! I can feel it!

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Cut to a wide panning shot of the surrounding area. A cliff edge in front of the gang.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Uhhh ... I think your feet need their eyes checked.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Cut to Aang with Sokka behind.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: No, she's right. We are here!

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Sokka looks around before shrugging. Cut to the front of the gang as the camera pans down, revealing the temple, hidden under the cliff.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Wow ... it's amazing!

title: The Western Air Temple
text: At another part of the temple, Zuko descends down a rope and swings back and forth twice before jumping down. When he lands on the ground, he has a flashback to three years ago, just after his banishment. Cut to a frontal shot of the cliff similar to the one Toph and the group were on earlier. Camera pans down to show the various natural structures through the mist of the temple.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: What a stunning view.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Cut to Zuko with covering over his fresh scar. Iroh stands behind him.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: The only view I'm interested in seeing is the Avatar in chains.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: You know, the Avatar hasn't been seen for one hundred years. The chances of finding him here are very slim. [Cut to a shot of Zuko's bandaged side.]

title: The Western Air Temple
text: [Determined.] First we'll check each of the air temples, then we'll scour the world, searching even the most remote locations until we find him.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Prince Zuko, it's only been a week since your banishment. You should take some time to heal and rest.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: What else would I expect to hear from the laziest man in the Fire Nation? [Iroh sighs.] The only way to regain my honor is to find the Avatar, so I will.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Iroh walks away as the flashback ends, fading to Zuko who looks disappointed in himself. Zuko notices Appa flying nearby and hides quickly. He subsequently runs off. Cut back to Team Avatar.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: It's so different from the Northern Air Temple. I wonder if there are any secret rooms.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: [Running off to explore.] Let's go check it out!

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Teo and The Duke follow Haru. Aang tries to, but is cut off by Katara.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: You guys go. I think we need to talk about some things.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: I'll race you, Duke.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: I told you, it's The Duke!

title: The Western Air Temple
text: The three head off. Cut to Katara and Aang.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Why can't I go?

title: The Western Air Temple
text: We need to decide what we're gonna do now, and since you're the Avatar, maybe you should be a part of this.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: [Sitting down.] Fair enough. So, what's the new plan?

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Well, if you ask me, the new plan is the old plan! You just need to master all four elements and confront the Fire Lord before the comet comes.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: [Sarcastically.] Oh, yeah. That's great, no problem. I'll just do that.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Aang, no one said it's going to be easy.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Well, it's not even gonna be possible! Where am I supposed to get a firebending teacher?

title: The Western Air Temple
text: We could look for Jeong Jeong!

title: The Western Air Temple
text: [Shooting her idea down.] Yeah ... right. [He lays down on the bench without a care.] Like we'll ever run into Jeong Jeong again.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: [Curiously.] Who's ... oh, [She folds her arms irritably.] never mind. If it's important I'll find out.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Oh well, guess we can't come up with anybody. Why don't we just take a nice tour around the temple? [He and Momo fly off.]

title: The Western Air Temple
text: What's up with him?

title: The Western Air Temple
text: There's gotta be someone who can teach him firebending.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Katara and Toph look down dejectedly as the camera slowly pans up and fades to a smiling Zuko in a forested area with his tent.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Hello ... [Raises an arm in greeting.] Zuko here, but I guess [Rubs his hand against the back of his head nervously.] you probably already know me, sort of. Uhhh ... so, the thing is I have a lot of firebending experience, and I'm [Places an arm on his chest with pride.] considered to be pretty good at it. [He continues smiling.] Well, you've seen me, you know, when I was attacking you. [His eyes widen.] Uhhh ... yeah, I guess [Places his fingers against his forehead in embarrassment.] I should apologize for that. But anyway, [Waves an arm to the side dismissively.] I'm good now. [Clenches both fists and places one on his chest while the other arm is raised.] I mean, I thought I was good before, but I realize I was bad, [He gets visibly uncomfortable and drops his arms into a slouch.] but anyway, I think it's time I joined your group and taught [Straightens up with a sincere expression on his face.] the Avatar firebending. [A badgerfrog croaks at him. Angrily.] Well, what's your answer? [The badgerfrog hops on his head before hopping away.] Yeah ... that's what I'd say, too. How am I supposed to convince these people that I'm on their side? What would Uncle do? [Imitating Iroh.] Zuko, you have to look within yourself to save yourself from your other self. Only then will your true self, reveal itself. [Normal voice.] Even when I'm talking for him I can't figure out what he means. What would Azula do? [Imitating Azula.] Listen, Avatar, I can join your group, or I can do something unspeakably horrible to you and your friends. Your choice. [Normal voice. Stops and sits down.] I guess I'm just not that good at impersonations.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: A badgerfrog jumps in front of him as he sits and croaks. Meanwhile, Aang is flying on his glider. Sokka, Katara, and Toph follow him on Appa.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Aang, can we talk about you learning firebending now?

title: The Western Air Temple
text: What? The wind is too loud in my ears! Check out this loop!

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Aang proceeds to do a loop.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Aang, I think we should be making some plans about our future!

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Okay, we can do that while I show you the giant Pai Sho table! Oh, you're gonna love the all-day echo chamber!

title: The Western Air Temple
text: [Cut to a close up of Toph as she turns serious.] I think that'll have to wait.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Toph points behind herself, and the camera zooms out to show Team Avatar looking at her quizzically. Appa moves out of the way to reveal a shadow, and as the camera pans up, it is revealed to belong to Zuko. Cut to a close-up of the team as they look at him with shocked expressions, which subsequently turn into anger.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: [Cut to a close up of Zuko's face.] Hello ... [Raises his arm up in greeting and waves.] Zuko here.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: The gang prepares to attack.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Hey, I heard you guys flying around down there, so, I just thought I'd wait for you here. [Appa growls at him and licks him twice. Cut to a surprised Momo and Aang as he lowers his staff slightly.] I know you must be surprised to see me here.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Not really, since you've followed us all over the world.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Right. Well, uhhh ... anyway ... what I wanted to tell you about is that I've changed, and I, uhhh, I'm good now, and well I think I should join your group, oh, and I can teach firebending to you. [The gang expresses shock.] See, I, uhhh ...

title: The Western Air Temple
text: You want to what now?

title: The Western Air Temple
text: You can't possibly think that any of us would trust you, can you? I mean, how stupid do you think we are?!

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Yeah, all you've ever done is hunt us down and try to capture Aang!

title: The Western Air Temple
text: I've done some good things! I mean, I could have stolen your bison in Ba Sing Se, but I set him free. That's something! [Appa licks him again, much to his surprise.]

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Appa [The siblings turn toward her.] does seem to like him.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: He probably just covered himself in honey or something so that Appa would lick him. I'm not buying it.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: I can understand why you wouldn't trust me, and I know I've made some mistakes in the past.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Like when you attacked our village?

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Or when you stole my mother's necklace and used it to track us down and capture us?

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Look, I admit I've some awful things. I was wrong to try to capture you, and I'm sorry that I attacked the Water Tribe. And I never should have sent that Fire Nation assassin after you. [Toph and Sokka's eyes widen with shock.] I'm going to try and stop-

title: The Western Air Temple
text: [Pulls out his boomerang; angrily.] Wait, you sent Combustion Man after us?

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Well, that's not his name, but-

title: The Western Air Temple
text: [Sarcastically.] Ohhh, sorry. I didn't mean to insult your friend!

title: The Western Air Temple
text: [Angrily.] He's not my friend!

title: The Western Air Temple
text: That guy locked me and Katara in jail and tried to blow us all up!

title: The Western Air Temple
text: [To Aang.] Why aren't you saying anything? You once said you thought we could be friends. You know I have good in me.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Â Aang turns to look at his friends, and Sokka shakes his head at Aang.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: There's no way we can trust you after everything you've done. We'll never let you join us.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: You need to get out of here. Now.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: I'm trying to explain that I'm not that person anymore!

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Either you leave, or we attack.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: If you won't accept me as a friend, then maybe you'll take me as a prisoner. [Zuko kneels down, bends his head, and raises his arms in surrender.]

title: The Western Air Temple
text: No, we won't! [Blasts water at him.] Get out of here, and don't come back! And if we ever see you again, well, we'd better not see you again!

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Zuko walks away. Cut back to Zuko's campsite.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Uggh! I can't believe how stupid I am! I mean, what was I thinking? Telling them I sent an assassin after them? Why didn't I just say Azula did that? They would have believed that! Stupid! [A badgerfrog croaks at him.] Uggh!

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Back at the air temple.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Why would he try to fool us like that?

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Obviously he wants to lead us into some kind of trap.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: This is just like when we were in prison together at Ba Sing Se. He starts talking about his mother and making it seem like he's an actual human being with feelings.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: He wants you to trust and feel sorry for him so you let your guard down, then he strikes.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: The thing is, it worked. I did feel sorry for him. I felt like he was really confused and hurt, but obviously, when the time came, he made his choice, and we paid the price. We can't trust him.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: I kind of have a confession to make. Remember when you two were sick and I got captured by Zhao?

title: The Western Air Temple
text: And you made us suck on frozen frogs? How could I forget? I had a wart on the flap that hangs down from the back of my throat for a month!

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Sokka, I looked at it, and I told you, there was nothing there!

title: The Western Air Temple
text: I could feel it! It's my throatal flap!

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Anyway, when Zhao had me chained up, it was Zuko who came in and got me out. He risked his life to save me.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: No way! I'm sure he only did it so he could capture you himself!

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Yeah, face it Aang, you're nothing but a big prize to him.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: You're probably right.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: And what was all that crazy stuff about setting Appa free? What a liar!

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Actually, he wasn't lying.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: [Sarcastically.] Oh, hooray! In a lifetime of evil, at least he didn't add animal cruelty to the list.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: I'm just saying that, considering his messed-up family and how he was raised, he could have turned out a lot worse.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: [Sarcastically.] You're right, Toph! Let's go find him and give him a medal. The "not as much of a jerk as you could have been" award!

title: The Western Air Temple
text: All I know is that while he was talking to us, he was sincere. Maybe you're all just letting your hurt feelings keep you from thinking clearly.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Easy for you to say! You weren't there when he had us attacked by pirates!

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Or when he burned down Kyoshi Island!

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Or when he tried to capture me at the Fire Temple!

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Why would you even try to defend him?

title: The Western Air Temple
text: [Angrily.] Because Katara, you're all ignoring one crucial fact: [Pokes Aang in the chest.] Aang needs a firebending teacher! We can't think of a single person in the world to do the job! Now one shows up on a silver platter, and you won't even think about it? [Stamps her feet on the ground to a point where the ground shakes slightly.]

title: The Western Air Temple
text: I'm not having Zuko as my teacher!

title: The Western Air Temple
text: You're darn right you're not, buddy.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Well, I guess that settles that.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Ergh! I'm beginning to wonder who's really the blind one around here! [Walks away.]

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Nightfall. Zuko's campsite. Zuko is asleep when he hears something.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Who's there? Stay back! [Whips fire.]

title: The Western Air Temple
text: It's me! [Throws up an earth shield, but steps back into Zuko's fire blast.] Ow! You burned my feet!

title: The Western Air Temple
text: I'm sorry, it was a mistake! [Comes toward her, but she begins to crawl away.]

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Get away from me! [As Toph crawls away, she grabs the earth under her and throws it backward at Zuko.]

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Let me help you! [Dodges another rock.] I'm sorry! [Tries to grab her.]

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Get off me, get off me! [Brings up some earth which sends Zuko flying back.]

title: The Western Air Temple
text: I didn't know it was you! Uggh, come back! [Toph leaves.] Uggh! Why am I so bad at being good?

title: The Western Air Temple
text: The next morning, Western Air Temple. Katara is serving everyone breakfast.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: [Handing a bowl to The Duke.] Has anyone seen Toph?

title: The Western Air Temple
text: I haven't seen her since she stormed off yesterday.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Maybe she's just exploring the air temple. There are some pretty fun spots to practice earthbending.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: I think we should go look for her.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: [Sitting.] Let her have fun with her rocks. I'm in no rush to have her yelling at us again.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: We can go check for her!

title: The Western Air Temple
text: [Has a bandage around his forehead.] Yeah! I want to ride that tunnel down to the Hall of Statues again. It will work a lot better now that I fixed my brakes.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Haru, The Duke, and Teo exit.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: A large rumble occurs. Toph falls down the pile of rock that she created from a wall.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: [Approaching, with Sokka and Aang. Worried.] Toph! What happened?

title: The Western Air Temple
text: My feet got burned!

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Oh no, what happened?

title: The Western Air Temple
text: I just told you, my feet got burned!

title: The Western Air Temple
text: I meant, how.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Well, I kind of went to see Zuko last night. [Everyone is shocked.]

title: The Western Air Temple
text: You what?

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Zuko?

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Uhhh ...!

title: The Western Air Temple
text: I thought he could be helpful to us. [Katara begins to try and heal her feet.] And if I talked to him, maybe we could work something out.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: So he attacked you?

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Well, he did, and he didn't. It was sort of an accident.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: But he did firebend at you?

title: The Western Air Temple
text: [Sighs.] Yes.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: See? You trusted Zuko, and you got burned. Literally!

title: The Western Air Temple
text: It's gonna take a while for your feet to get better. [Stops healing.] I wish I could have worked on them sooner.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Yeah, me too.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Zuko's clearly too dangerous to be left alone. We're gonna have to go after him.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: I hate to go looking for a fight, but you're right. After what he did to Toph, I don't think we have a choice.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: He's crafty, but we'll find a way to capture him.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Maybe just invite him back here. [Aang and Sokka go to pick her up.] He's already offered himself up as a prisoner once.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Yeah, get him to come back and say he'll be our prisoner, then we'll jump him and really make him our prisoner. He'll never suspect it! [Aang and Sokka carry Toph away.]

title: The Western Air Temple
text: [Following. Sarcastically.] You are a master of surprise, Sokka ...

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Cut to Toph's feet as they are dipped into a fountain.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Ahhh, that's the stuff. Now I know how the rest of you guys feel. Not being able to see with your feet stinks. [Katara sits next to her putting a hand on her shoulder.]

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Meanwhile, Combustion Man eyes the gang from a higher elevation. He sets his sights on Aang. As he prepares to fire, however, Zuko jumps in and knocks him off-balance, causing his shot to be wild. Team Avatar make to run away before hearing Zuko.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Stop! [Team Avatar turns their head up to the sound.] I don't want you hunting the Avatar anymore! [Cut to a quick close up of Aang looking up with shock as he is helping Sokka carry Toph. Cut back to Zuko as he stands in front of Combustion Man, arms spread out to block him.] The mission is off. I'm ordering you to stop.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Combustion Man shoves him away and attacks again.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: If you keep attacking, I won't pay you! [Attempts to firebend at him, but Combustion Man grabs him.] All right, I'll pay you double to stop!

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Zuko kicks Combustion Man as he fires, causing him to miss again. He subsequently takes aim at Zuko. Zuko creates a firewall to stop the attack but is pushed off the ledge. Cut to a shot of Team Avatar looking over the edge of the fountain shocked. Cut to a shot from behind Combustion Man as he faces a small crater in the floor and the smoke that is dissipating. Cut to a shot of the edge of the ledge and strafe right, revealing climbing a vine hanging underneath it and Zuko survived by grabbing the plant's root. Cut to Combustion Man as he turns back. Cut to a close up of Aang as he stands up from behind the fountain pool and runs to the side. Cut to a shot of Aang doing a spinning back kick, airbending and kicking up the dust around him, and leaping straight up just as a blast from Combustion Man explodes beneath him. The camera turns up to Aang spinning in mid air, airbending a tornado and kicking it at Combustion Man. Combustion Man leaps over the tornado and fires another blast as he descends. Aang lands and quickly back flips away from the blast, landing next to Katara and Sokka. Cut to a shot of Combustion Man falling before switching to a shot of his metal, clawed hand as it catches on a small ledge and breaks it, slowing his fall. He lands on a new ledge and rolls, firing a blast just as he stops. Cut to a shot of Katara and Aang shielding themselves as the blast hits the fountain water. The camera follows Katara as she runs forward and bends the water from the pool. Cut to a far shot from the side as Katara bends a huge wave up between them and Combustion Man. Cut to a shot in front of the camera as she descends from jumping, bringing her arms down and crossing them and giving a battle cry. The wave matches her arm movements and icicles in both directions. Cut to a shot of Combustion Man as the icicles speed toward him. He brings his metal arm over his face and lifts his metal leg to shield him from the attack. The icicles break against him. Combustion Man flings his arms down to shake off the ice shards and steps forward, an angry frown on his face. Cut to his perspective as he scans the area. The group is nowhere to be seen. Aang fires a tornado, which the assassin jumps over and fires again. Aang narrowly avoids the blast by jumping back. Combustion man falls and lands on a ledge as he fires and misses again. Katara bends water from the fountain and turns it into ice spikes, but Combustion Man appears unaffected. The assassin looks up and realizes they have disappeared but continues firing. Cut to shot of the team hiding behind a wall, out of sight.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: He's going to blast this whole place right off the cliff side!

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Katara looks out from behind the wall only to see another incoming blast.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: I can't step out to waterbend at him without being blown up and I can't get a good enough angle on him from down here.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: [Pausing for a moment to think before having an idea.] I know how to get an angle on him! [Takes out his boomerang. After another blast, he sneaks his head out, but has to hide from another shot. He projects Combustion Man's angle with his boomerang.] All right buddy, don't fail me now! [Throws his boomerang.]

title: The Western Air Temple
text: The boomerang hits the assassin in the head where his third eye tattoo is, causing him to hit the ground, before it returns back.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Yeah, boomerang! [Jumps up and grabs it, but Combustion Man gets up, albeit clearly shaken.] Awww, boomerang ...

title: The Western Air Temple
text: As the team runs back to their hiding spot, Combustion Man gears up again, but is dizzy and cannot aim properly. His next shot fails to escape, causing an explosion around him resulting in the building he stands on getting destroyed. Cut to his metal arm as it flies away from the explosion, followed by the falling building. The gang looks on, shocked. Haru, Teo, and The Duke all appear from behind a pillar also shocked.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Zuko climbs a plant root, having survived the ordeal. Later, Zuko again approaches the gang.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: I can't believe I'm saying this, but ... thanks, Zuko.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Hey, what about me? I did the boomerang thing.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Listen, I know I didn't explain myself very well yesterday, I've been through a lot in the last few years, and it's been hard. But I'm realizing that I had to go through all those things to learn the truth. I thought I had lost my honor, and that somehow my father could return it to me. But I know now that no one can give you your honor. It's something you earn for yourself, by choosing to do what's right. All I want to do now is play my part in ending this war, and I know my destiny is to help you restore balance to the world. [To Toph.] I'm sorry for what I did to you. [Bows to her.] It was an accident. Fire can be dangerous and wild, so as a firebender, I need to be more careful and control my bending, so I don't hurt people unintentionally.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: [Looks at Zuko shocked, hearing these words, and thinks for a moment.] I think you are supposed to be my firebending teacher. When I first tried to learn firebending, I burned Katara, and after that, I never wanted to firebend again. But now I know you understand how easy it is to hurt the people you love. I'd like you to teach me. [Bows before Zuko.]

title: The Western Air Temple
text: [Bows.] Thank you. I'm so happy you've accepted me into your group.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Not so fast. I still have to ask my friends if it's okay with them. [To Toph.] Toph, you're the one that Zuko burned. What do you think?

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Go ahead and let him join. [Pounds her fist into her palm jokingly.] It'll give me plenty of time to get back at him for burning my feet.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: [Turning to Sokka.] Sokka?

title: The Western Air Temple
text: [Shrugging.] Hey, all I want is to defeat the Fire Lord. If you think this is the way to do it, then, I'm all for it.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: [Approaching Katara.] Katara?

title: The Western Air Temple
text: [Glares at Zuko for a moment and Zuko starts to sweat; reluctantly.] I'll go along with whatever you think is right. [Aang smiles.]

title: The Western Air Temple
text: [Excitedly approaching the group.] I won't let you down! I promise!

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Aang, Katara, and Sokka exit, the latter carrying Toph. Later, Sokka shows Zuko to his room.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: So, here you go, home sweet home, I guess, you know, for now. Unpack? Lunch, soon? Uhhh ... welcome aboard? [Zuko glances back and smiles at him.] Yeah. [Walks out of the room and meets Aang in the hallway; to Aang.] Okay, this is really, really weird.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: The two exit. Cut to Zuko as he pulls out a painting of Iroh. He subsequently has another flashback to three years ago.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: If I have to, I will spend every day of the rest of my life hunting the Avatar. I know it's my destiny to capture him.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: [Placing a hand on his shoulder.] You know Prince Zuko, destiny is a funny thing. You never know how things are going to work out. But if you keep an open mind, and an open heart, I promise you will find your own destiny someday.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Fade to Zuko in the present, smiling at the memory. Zuko suddenly notices a clearly disgruntled Katara at the door.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: You might have everyone else here buying your ... transformation, but you and I both know you've struggled with doing the right thing in the past. [Approaches him; threateningly.] So let me tell you something, right now. You make one step backward, [Close-up of Zuko.] one slip-up, give me one reason to think you might hurt Aang, and you won't have to worry about your destiny anymore. [Close-up of Katara's angry face.] Because I'll make sure your destiny ends ... right then and there. Permanently.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: She walks away and slams the door shut. Zuko slumps his shoulders.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Fade to credits.

title: The Western Air Temple
text: Aang

title: The Firebending Masters
text: The episode opens with a shot of the sky from the Western Air Temple, and the camera pans below to Zuko and Aang standing on the balcony of an upside down pagoda in the temple.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: I know you're nervous, but remember, firebending in it of itself is not something to fear.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Cut to Aang, as he sighs heavily.] Okay. Not something to fear.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Cut to Zuko from behind Aang.] But if you don't respect it, [He raises his voice, as the camera zooms to a close-up of his face.] it'll chew you up and spit you out like an angry komodo rhino!

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Cut to Aang's face, as he yelps in fear, before cutting back to Zuko.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Now show me what you've got. Any amount of fire you can make.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Cut to Aang, as he inhales nervously and tries to firebend. Cut to a close-up of his palm, as a small cloud of smoke appears, and is dissipated. Camera pans left to Aang.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Maybe I need a little more instruction. Perhaps a demonstration?

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Cut to an aerial shot of the both.] Good idea. You might wanna take a couple steps back.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Aang walks back, and shot cuts to a close-up of Zuko's face, as he inhales deeply. Screen zooms back to show Zuko grunting, and cuts to his fist, which lets out a very small flame. Aang applauds at this display.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Takes a step back.] What was that? That was the worst firebending I've ever seen!

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Cut to Aang.] I thought it was ... nice. [Smiles slightly and shrugs.]

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Zuko grunts again and tries firebending again, with all three attempts resulting in very small flames similar to the first. He grunts and looks at his palms.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Frustrated.] Why is this happening?

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Rubbing his head, confused.] Maybe it's the altitude.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Turning back.] Yeah, could be.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Scene changes to some pagodas and pans below to Aang sitting on a broken pillar and Zuko standing. Zuko attempts firebending, which results in a similar small flame again. He grunts and delivers another similar blast, as Aang yawns and lies down on the pillar.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Just breathe, and ... [He delivers another blast with no improvement.]

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Gets up.] That one kind of felt hot.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Very angry.] Don't patronize me! You know what it's supposed to look like!

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Sorry, Sifu Hotman.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Raises his arms to his head, and throws them down back, and shouts in frustration, as Aang cringes.] And stop calling me that!

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Shot cuts to Sokka walking toward the teacher and his pupil, eating an apple. Sokka sits down near the two, as they turn their heads toward him.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Hey, jerks! Mind if I watch you two jerks do your jerkbending?

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Frustrated.] Get out of here! [He lashes his arm and points to a side.]

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Okay, take it easy. [He drops his half-eaten apple.] I was just kiddin' around. [He gets up and turns around, laughing as he adjusts his shirt.] Jerkbending, still got it. [Zuko drops his head, dejected, and moans.]

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Scene changes to an aerial shot of Appa resting near a fountain at night, and zooms to show him eating a small bale of hay. Screen pans to the right to show Zuko leaning on a column with his arms crossed, looking below and thinking deeply. He turns his head to the campfire where everyone is settled for dinner, and walks toward them.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Listen everybody, I've got some pretty bad news. I've lost my stuff. [He looks below dejectedly.]

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Raises both hands to her head.] Don't look at me, [She folds her arms.] I didn't touch your stuff.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: I'm talking about my firebending. It's gone. [He looks below again.]

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Cut to Sokka, Haru, The Duke, and Teo looking at him, as the former Freedom Fighter sits up. Camera pans left, as Katara laughs, and everyone's attention is focused on her. Zuko looks at the waterbender with an annoyed expression.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: I'm sorry. I'm just laughing at the irony. You know, how it would've been nice for us if you lost your firebending a long time ago.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Camera zooms back to show everyone sitting around the campfire and Zuko standing.] Well, it's not lost. It's just ... weaker for some reason.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Holding up her bowl and glaring at Zuko.] Maybe you're not as good as you think you are.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Screen pans left to Toph.] Ouch. [She smiles sarcastically.]

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [With an idea.] I bet it's because I changed sides.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Still holding her bowl.] That's ridiculous. [She drinks from the bowl.]

title: The Firebending Masters
text: I don't know. Maybe it isn't. Maybe your firebending comes from rage and you just don't have enough anger to fuel it the way you used to.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Leans toward Zuko and points a finger above.] Sooo, all we need to do is make Zuko angry. Easy enough.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Sokka pokes Zuko with his sword's hilt in the head and waist several times, laughing.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Okay, cut it out! [Sokka stops poking, as his sword slips from his hands and is thrown above, before falling on his head. Zuko rubs his nose.] Look, even if you're right, I don't want to rely on hate and anger anymore. There has to be another way.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Cut to Toph, as Sokka sits near her, and rubs his head.] You're gonna need to learn to draw your firebending from a different source. I recommend the original source. [Eats the food from her bowl.]

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Excited.] How's he supposed to do thatâ? By jumping into a volcanoâ?

title: The Firebending Masters
text: No. Zuko needs to go back to whatever the original source of firebending is.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Seriously.â] So, is it jumping into a volcano?

title: The Firebending Masters
