text: I don't know. [Places her bowl down as the shot cuts to a close-up of her face.] For earthbending, the original benders were badgermoles.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Scene changes to a cave in a flashback as a younger Toph wearing a gown is kneeling down, and crying, as screen zooms out.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Voice-over.] One day, when I was little, I ran away and hid in a cave.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Cut to the younger Toph's face, as she is startled by a rumbling noise, and part of the cave's wall breaks. Shot cuts to behind Toph to show one of a badgermole's legs.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: That's where I met them.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Toph cringes in fear, and the badgermole comes into the screen near Toph and sniffs her. Toph sniffs back and the badgermole licks her cheek, causing her to giggle in delight. She touches the badgermole's snout with both hands before licking it, and giggles again.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: They were blind, just like me. [The badgermole walks away as Toph attempts to crawls after it.] So we understood each other. I was able to learn earthbending, [Cut to an overhead shot of the badgermole, which moves its paws in a sweeping motion.] not just as a martial art, but as an extension of my senses. [Screen fades to an overhead shot of Toph mimicking the creature's actions.] For them, the original earthbenders, [The badgermole comes across a pile of rocks and earthbends them to the side.] it wasn't just about fighting. It was their way of interacting with the world. [She stops crawling and stands up. She earthbends a stone and smiles at her success.]

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Screen fades from the younger Toph's face back to the present Toph's smiling face.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: That's amazing, Toph!

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Cut to an aerial shot of the group.] I learned from the monks, but the original airbenders were the sky bison. [Camera pans above to show a mural of three sky bison. Aang leans back to look at Appa.] Maybe you can give me a lesson sometime, buddy.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Appa growls from the shed.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Well, this doesn't help me. The original firebenders were the dragons, and they're extinct.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Shot cuts to behind Zuko as he looks at the group.] What do you meanâ? Roku had a dragon, and there were plenty of dragons when I was a kid.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Cut to Zuko's face, as he yells.] Well, they aren't around anymore, okay?

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Okay, okay. [Moves his arms in an appeasing manner.] I'm sorry.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: But maybe there's another way. [He walks toward a fountain.] The first people to learn from the dragons were the ancient Sun Warriors.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Walks toward Zuko.] Sun Warriors? Well, I know they weren't around when I was a kid.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Turning his head toward Aang.] No, they died off thousands of years ago. But their civilization wasn't too far from where we are now. [Cut to a shot of the two from the side, as Zuko turns his head toward the Avatar.] Maybe we can learn something by poking around their ruins.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: It's like the monks used to tell me. Sometimes, the shadows of the past can be felt by the present.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: So, what? [Aang and Zuko look back at him and the shot cuts to Sokka seated.] Maybe you'll pick up some super old Sun Warrior energy just by standing [Moves his hand in a strange motion.] where they stood a thousand years ago?

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Cut to an aerial shot.] More or less. Either I find a new way to firebend, [Cut to a shot of the two from the side. Zuko turns his head toward Aang.] or the Avatar has to find a new teacher. [Aang looks concerned and worried at Zuko's statement.]

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Scene changes to Aang and Zuko flying on Appa over an ocean. Cut to a bored Zuko.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: We've been riding for hours. I don't know why, but I thought this thing would be a lot faster.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Cut to Appa from below, as he growls.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Turning his head toward Zuko.] Appa's right, Zuko. In our group, typically we start our missions with a more up-beat attitude.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Whispering.] I can't believe this. [He lies down.]

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Cut to Appa flying from behind.] Don't worry, you'll get the hang of it.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Scene changes to an aerial shot of the ocean, as the screen pans above to an aerial shot of an island. Scene changes to an aerial shot of Appa descending to land on some ruins. The ruins make Aang and Zuko full of awe.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Whoa!

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Cut to Appa landing from the side. Shot cuts to show some mountains and pans below to an aerial shot of Aang and Zuko walking through the ruins.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Even though these buildings are ancient, there's something eerily familiar about them. [Cut to Aang and Zuko walking.] I can tell the Fire Sages' temples are somehow descended from these.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Cut to some structures as screen pans right to show more of them.] Okay. We've learned something about architecture. [Cut back to the two walking.] Hopefully, we'll learn something about firebending too. The past can be a great teacher.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Cut to a tripwire, which is pulled when Aang walks by. He trips and yelps, as an overhead shot shows a small portion of the path in front of him going down and some spikes coming up from holes. Aang nearly falls on the spikes but blows a blast of air from his mouth which thrusts him up, and somersaults on to the other side, as he managed to regain balance.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Scared.] Zuko, I think the past is trying to kill me.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Kneeling down to inspect the spikes.] I can't believe it. [He picks the tripwire up and examines it.] This booby trap must be centuries old and it still works.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: There's probably a lot more. Maybe this means we shouldn't be here.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Zuko takes two steps back and runs toward the wall adjoining the path. He runs on the wall before jumping on the other side of the spikes.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Dusting some dirt on his shirt.] Where's that up-beat attitude you were talkin' about? [He smiles, as Aang turns back. Cut to Zuko's point of view of the path as screen pans above to a building.] Besides, people don't make traps unless they've got something worth protecting.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Cut to Zuko and Aang coming onto the building from stairs.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Look, this seems promising. [Cut to Zuko and Aang from the behind, as they see a carving of a person being surrounded by two dragons who are breathing fire at him.] Though I'm not sure what this tells us about the original source of firebending.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Cut to Zuko and Aang looking at the carving from the side.] They look pretty angry to me.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Cut to a part of the carving from below as screen pans right to show more of it.] I thought the dragons were friends with the Sun Warriors.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Well, they had a funny way of showing it.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Cut back to the both from the side, as Zuko looks down for a moment and starts walking, with Aang looking.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Zuko, [Zuko stops walking.] something happened to the dragons in the last hundred years. [Zuko closes his eyes.] Something you're not telling me.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [He opens his eyes.] My great-grandfather Sozin happened.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Zuko walks away with Aang following him. Scene changes to the two walking on a bridge.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: He started the tradition of hunting dragons for glory. There were the ultimate firebenders. [Cut to them walking from below the bridge, with the screen panning right as they walk.] And if you could conquer one, your firebending talents would become legendary and you'd earn the honorary title, Dragon. [They approach a path which has one dragon's statue on both sides, and stop walking.] The last great dragon was conquered long before I was born, [Cut to a close-up of one of the dragon's statue's eyes as Zuko places one of his palms on it.] by my uncle.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Cut to the both from a side.] But I thought your uncle was ... I don't know, good?

title: The Firebending Masters
text: He had a complicated past. [Cut to Zuko's face.] Family tradition, I guess. Let's just move on.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Zuko starts walking as shot cuts to an overhead shot of him walking away, with Aang running to catch up to him. Scene changes to a vertical column with a sunstone in the center, as Zuko and Aang walk past it. Screen pans above to show a wall with two gates, with the both walking toward them. As the both come closer, Zuko stops walking, and Aang runs to the gates, drops his staff, and unsuccessfully tries opening the gates.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: It's locked up!

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Zuko rubs his head, and looks behind, before quickly going aside to show the sunstone from the column in front of the gates beaming light.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Wait. [Cut to an overhead shot of Zuko, as he realizes something and takes a step behind, and looks at the position he stood at a moment before. Screen zooms in to show the light from the sunstone beaming on a circular carving on the ground.] It's a celestial calendar. [Cut to an aerial shot of Zuko and Aang standing in front of the column as screen pans to right to show the gates.] Just like the Fire Sages have in their temples. [Cut to a similar sunstone above the gates.] I bet that sunstone opens the door, but only when sunlight hits at just the right angle. [Screen pans below to show Aang in front of the gates.] On the solstice.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Exasperated.] Monkeyfeathers! The solstice again? We can't wait here that long.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Cut to Zuko.] No, we can't. [He unsheathes one of his swords.] But we might be able to speed time up. [Cut to the circle carved on the ground on which light from the sunstone is being beamed. He places his sword on it with an angle, causing it to reflect the light. Cut to Zuko reflecting the light from the column.] Let's see if we can outsmart the sunstone.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Cut to the side of the gate as the light being reflected by Zuko's sword moves to the other sunstone on top of the gates. Screen pans below to show Aang looking at it.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Nothing's happening.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Cut to Zuko, who is kneeling down and reflecting the light.] Come on ...

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Cut to a close-up of the sunstone as the ground starts shaking. Cut to inside the room as the gates are opened and the shaking stops.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [He picks his staff, and Zuko, walking up to the gates, unsheathes his sword.] You know, Zuko, I don't care what everyone else says about you. [Aang nudges Zuko with his elbow.] You're pretty smart.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Zuko smiles at Aang's compliment, before realizing what Aang actually said. Aang walks inside the dark room and looks around it. He narrows his eyes, as the shot cuts to show a statue of a man with an angry expression. Cut back to Aang, who gasps.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Relax. They're just statues.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Cut to a shot of two statues from behind Aang and Zuko. Cut to an aerial shot of the room to show many statues lined up in a circle as they both walk into it. Aang walks up to a statue and reads something on it.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: It says this is something called the Dancing Dragon.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Aang places his staff to lean on the statue. Cut to a shot of the statue from behind Aang to show him taking the same posture the statue is in. Cut to his leg, which presses a button on the ground. Aang comes out of the posture and examines the button. He looks around at all the statues, runs toward Zuko, catches him by the hand, and pulls him.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Zuko, get over here! I want you to dance with me!

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [He pulls his hand back.] What?

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Just do it.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Aang pulls him to a side, as shot cuts to the both standing in front of two statues that are to the sides of the path that leads into the circle, as Zuko groans.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Let's follow the steps of the statues. [Aang and Zuko take the posture of the statue in front of them and move to their right and left, respectively, taking the postures of the statues in front of them, which pressed similar buttons lying on the ground in front of all the statues. Cut to an aerial shot of the room.] Don't you see? These aren't dance moves. These statues are giving us a lesson. [Cut to Zuko moving through each statue.] I think this is some kind of Sun Warrior firebending form.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: This better teach us some really good firebending.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Cut to Aang, as he does the same moves as Zuko. Cut to two statues with their waists bent toward each other, and their arms in the direction of each other. Zuko and Aang perform the same move. Cut to a part of the ground detracting and a vertical column emerging from it, as the both look behind at it. Cut to a close-up of the yellow, egg-shaped sunstone on the column. Cut to an aerial shot of Zuko and Aang standing in front of the column as Aang raises his arms in triumph.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Hurray! [Putting his hands down, and rubbing his head.] Wait, what exactly is that?

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [He runs toward the sunstone.] It's some kind of mystical gemstone.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Cut to the gemstone as Zuko runs toward it. Aang raises his arms.] Well, don't touch it! [Zuko stops and Aang catches up to him.]

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Why not?

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Remember what happened out there with those spikes? [Turns to look at the side and raises his arms again.] I'm just very suspicious of giant glowing gems sitting on pedestals.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Zuko ignores the Avatar and picks the sunstone, as Aang's eyes twitch.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: It feels almost alive.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: He tries to put the sunstone back but yells in surprise as a geyser of viscous slime erupts out from the pedestal and pushes Zuko toward the grates in the ceiling, sticking him there.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Cut to a worried Aang's face, as he turns to look at the gates of the room, which close.] Oh no, it's another trap!

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Cut to an overhead shot of the column as more viscous slime comes from it, causing Aang to walk back. Cut to Zuko who is stuck to the grates and unsuccessfully struggles to break free.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Ugh, I can't pull free. It's like some kind of glue.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Cut to Aang, as he jumps across the slime and grabs his staff on the other side of the room. He climbs on a statue's head, jumps onto another of the statues' head and airbends a gust of wind toward Zuko, due to which Zuko is pushed from his back to his front. Cut to an aerial shot to show that the slime is rising and the screen zooms to show Aang is still on the statue's head. His staff gets stuck in the slime and he is not successful in pulling it out. He jumps up toward the grates, as the slime engulfs the room.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Trying to pull his hands from the grates.] I can't move! Zuko, do something!

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Me? I can't move either!

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Cut to a shot of the entire room being filled by the slime. Cut to the other side of the grates as they groan due to the slime pushing them against the grates. The slime stops.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: It stopped.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: At least we have air. Maybe if we stay calm, we can figure a way out of this.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Cut to an aerial shot of the two being stuck to the grates, as screen zooms out slowly. Screen fades to the building at night, and cuts to the two still stuck to the grates.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: You had to pick up the glowing egg, didn't you?

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Cut to their heads sticking out from the grates.] At least I made something happen. If it were up to you, we'd never have made it past the courtyard.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [He opens his mouth very widely and yells.] Help!

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Who are you yelling to? Nobody's lived here for centuries.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Well, what do you think we should do?

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Think about our place in the universeâ?

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Cut to the grates from the side, as Aang sighs, and a foot wearing a sandal steps near it.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Cut to Zuko and Aang's point of view, as the Sun Warrior chief comes into sight. Cut to his face.] Who is down there?

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Cut to both boys bearing shocked expressions. Cut to a shot of the building, before cutting to Zuko and Aang as the slime is removed by aardvark sloths on either side of them. Shot cuts to an aerial shot to show the two surrounded by men and women who are in circles.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Walking toward the two.] For trying to take our sunstone, you must be severely punished!

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Cut to Aang and Zuko from the side.] We didn't come here to take your sunstone. We came here to find the ancient origin of all firebending.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Cut to an aerial shot of the people, as Ham Ghao steps forward.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Yeah, right. They are obviously thieves, [Cut to the chief and Ham Ghao from the side to show that he is holding the sunstone.] here to steal Sun Warrior treasures.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Please, I don't normally play this card, but ... [Places his palm on his chest.] I'm the Avatar. [Cut to Ham Ghao looking toward the chief from the side, puzzled. Cut to Aang, who stands up and gives a weak smile.] Just hear us out.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Standing up.] My name is Zuko, Crown Prince of the Fire Nation. [Looks down at the ground.] O-or at least I used to be. [Cut to Zuko's point of view to the Sun Warriors as screen pans right to show more of them.] I know my people have distorted the ways of firebending, to be fueled by anger and rage. But now I want to learn the true way, [Cut back to Aang and Zuko.] the original way. When we came here, I never imagined [Cut to an aerial shot that shows the Sun Warriors surrounding the two.] the Sun Warrior's civilization was secretly alive. I am truly humbled to be in your presence. [Cut back to the two, as they bow their heads.] Please, teach us.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Cut to the chief.] If you wish to learn the ways of the Sun, you must learn them from the masters, Ran and Shaw.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Cut to Aang and Zuko.] Ran and Shaw? There are two of them?

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Walks toward them and looks at Aang.] When you present yourself to them, they will examine you. [Turns to look at Zuko.] They'll read your hearts, your souls, and your ancestry. [Takes a step toward Zuko and towers over Zuko, who looks worried.] If they deem you worthy, they'll teach you. [Cut to a close-up of the chief.] If they don't, you'll be destroyed on the spot.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: The chief walks back, and Aang and Zuko look at each other. Scene changes to a building on the next day. Screen zooms to the top of the building.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: If you're going to see the masters, [Cut to an aerial shot of the Sun Warriors sitting in many arcs inside the room in front of the Eternal Flame. Aang, Zuko, and the Sun Warrior chief are standing.] you must bring them a piece of the Eternal Flame. [Cut to the chief standing in front of the fire from behind him.] This fire is the very first one. [Raises his hands to his head and turns back at Zuko and Aang.] It was given to man by the dragons. [Cut to the chief talking to Zuko and Aang from the side as the other Sun Warriors look.] We have kept it going for thousands of years.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Surprised.] I don't believe it.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Cut to the Sun Warriors sitting and the chief explaining their job to the two, as screen pans to the right.] You will each take a piece of it to the masters, to show your commitment to the sacred art of firebending.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Cut to an unsure Aang as he places his palm on his neck.] Umm, Mister Sun Chief Sirâ, yeah, I'm not a firebender yet. [Pointing to Zuko.] Couldn't my friend here carry my fire for me?

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Unyielding.] No. [He turns back to face the fire. Cut to Aang, who looks very uneasy, before cutting to the chief, who takes a part of the Eternal Flame on his hand and turns back toward the two.] This ritual illustrates [He turns around in a circle and splits the fire on his palm into two parts.] the essence of Sun Warrior philosophy. [Cut to Aang, as he stares at the flame.] You must maintain a constant heat. The flame will go out if you make it too small. [Aang cringes, as the screen pans to Zuko, who is standing beside Aang.] Make it too big, and you might lose control.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Zuko stares at the flame and brings his arms forward to take the flame. He looks at Aang, as shot cuts to the chief offering Aang the flame from the side.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: I'm sorry, I'm just a little nervous. [He takes the flame in his hand and his expression changes to a relieved one.] It's like a little heartbeat.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Cut to the chief.] Fire is life, [Cut to Aang. Screen zooms in to his face as he smiles.] not just destruction. You will take your flames up there. [Cut to Zuko and Aang standing in front of the chief as he points to a mountain from the side. Screen zooms in to the mountain.] The cave of the masters is beneath that rock.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Screen changes to Aang and Zuko walking through a steep forest, before changing to the steep surface. Cut to Zuko, who has reached the top of the steepness, turning back to look at Aang who is lagging behind.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Hurry up.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: I can't. [Cut to Aang approaching a rock.] If I walk too fast, my flame will go out. [Climbs up the rock and looks at his flame.]

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Your flame's [Aang looks at Zuko.] gonna go out [Cut to Zuko from below.] because it's too small. You're too timid, give it more juice.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [He climbs another rock.] But what if I can't control it?

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Cut to Zuko.] You can do it. I know you can. [Cut to an unsure Aang.] You're a talented kid.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Aang smiles at the compliment and climbs up another rock, reaching the top. Zuko starts walking and Aang follows him. Screen pans above to the top of the mountain. Scene changes to Zuko and Aang as the reach the top of the mountain, and see that warriors are already there, with the Sun Warrior chief, Ham Ghao, and another Sun Warrior standing. Screen zooms out to show two vertical rocks with a bridge in the center.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [He and the other two Sun Warriors walk up to the two.] Facing the judgment of the firebending masters will be very dangerous for you. Your ancestors [Cut to Zuko.] are directly responsible for the dragons' disappearance. [Zuko looks toward the side.] The masters might not be so happy to see you.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [He places his hand on his hip.] I know I wouldn't be.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: But once they find out I'm the Avatar ...

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Cut to the chief.] Have you forgotten that you vanished, allowing the Fire Nation to wreak havoc on the worldâ? [Cut to a guilty Aang.] The decline of the dragons is your burden, too. [Aang looks toward the side.]

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Cut to an overhead shot of the chief rooting his staff on the ground. The other two Sun Warriors get into a kneeling position and the chief walks toward Zuko and Aang, takes a small portion of their flames and gives the flames to both of the Sun Warriors, who go to each of the sides. The chief turns back and walks. Cut to some Sun Warriors standing and sitting, alternately, as the two Warriors standing create a circle made of fire. Cut to Aang and Zuko watching the chief walk.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Turning to Zuko.] We could turn back now. We've already learned more about fire than we'd hoped. [Aang shows Zuko his flame and gives a weak smile.]

title: The Firebending Masters
text: No, we're seeing this through to the end. We're gonna meet these masters and find out [Cut to an overhead shot of Aang.] what's so great about them.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Looking toward the rocks.] What if they judge us, and attack us?

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Cut to Zuko.] Well, we're the Fire Prince and the Avatar. [Unsheathes his swords slightly.] I think we could take these guys in a fight, whoever they are. [He smiles.]

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Cut to Aang, who nods uneasily. Cut to the entire courtyard to show that all alternate Sun Warriors have made their fire circles. Zuko turns toward the Sun Warrior chief.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Bring 'em out!

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Cut to the chief to show him stretching his both hands out on both sides.] Chanters!

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Cut to an aerial shot of the courtyard as the chanters play the music. Cut to the Sun Warriors, who are sitting down, beating their drums in a synchronized rhythm. Cut to the other Sun Warriors holding the fire circle in their crouched positions. Cut to the Warriors, as Zuko and Aang walk toward the stairs. Cut to the other side of the circle to show the Warriors alternatively rising and bowing. Cut to an overhead shot of the two nearing the steps. Cut to a shot of the stairs as screen slowly pans below. Cut to the chief and the other two Warriors, as they step aside to let Zuko and Aang pass.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Cut to a Sun Warrior using an sound-amplifying device.] Those who wish to meet the masters, Ran and Shaw, will now present their fire.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Aang and Zuko turn toward the caves and bow down with their hands stretched toward the caves. Screen zooms out to show them in this posture.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Sound the call!

title: The Firebending Masters
text: A warrior takes a deep breath and blows a horn. The sound from the horn sends a flock of birds scattering. The cave Aang is facing rumbles, causing him to tremble. Aang accidentally places his hand down, extinguishing his flame.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: What's happeningâ? [He looks to look at Zuko, who turns his head toward Aang. Aang cringes and quickly returns back to his position, and realizes that his flame is extinguished and gasps. He turns toward Zuko again, and whispers.] Zuko, my fire went out.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Whispering.] What do you want me to doâ?

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Give me some of yours. [He reaches for Zuko's flame and Zuko pushes him behind.]

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Whispering.] No, just make your own.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Whispering as well.] I can't. [He reaches for Zuko's flame again.]

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Cut to an aerial shot of the bridge.] Get some from those warriors. [Cut to the chief and the two Warriors beside him.] Hurry! [Cuts to shot of the Sun Warriors below; off-screen.] Stop cheating off me!

title: The Firebending Masters
text: The chief and Ham Ghao look at each other.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Off-screen.] Quit being stingy!

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Shot cuts to Aang trying to reach for Zuko's flame; he is unable to do so as Zuko raises his hand high up in the air. Aang continues his attempt to get Zuko's flame but Zuko stretches his arms away. Aang pulls Zuko's arm down, extinguishing the flame. They both look at each other. Cut to the two from inside the caves as the ground rumbles. Cut to the two with a worried expression. They turn to look at the other cave as screen zooms in to the cave.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Uh oh.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Two eyes glow inside a cave and a red dragon comes out, roaring, circling around the bridge. Cut to the boys, who take a step back. Cut to Zuko, who looks at the dragon. Cut to a blue dragon coming out of the other cave. It joins the other dragon as they circle the bridge.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Cut to Zuko and Aang standing.] These are the masters.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [In a low voice.] Still think we can take 'em?

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Sshh. I never said that.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Cut to the dragons circling the bridge from below. Screen pans down to the warriors as they bow down. Cut to Ham Ghao and the chief.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Oh, here it comes. [Looks up at the bridge.] Any moment now. Dinner for the masters.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Turns toward Ham Ghao.] Quiet, Ham Ghao!

title: The Firebending Masters
text: What? [Turns his head away.] Everyone's thinking it.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Cut to the bridge where the dragons are still flying around the bridge. Cut to Aang, who looks at them flying.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Whispers.] Zuko, I think we're supposed to do the Dragon Dance with them.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Turning his head toward Zuko.] Whatâ? What about this situation makes you think they want us to danceâ?

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Well, I think they want us to do something. Let's just try it.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Unwillingly.] Fine.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Aang and Zuko get into the first posture of the Dancing Dragon and change their postures to the next. Cut to Aang spreading his arms out as the blue dragon flies behind him following the shape of his arms. Aang turns his arms to his side as the dragon turns as well. Screen zooms out to show the dragons performing the same movements as each other. Cut to Zuko, who pushes his hand up as the red dragon behind him goes up as well. Zuko dips and the dragon dives down accordingly. Cut to the dragons flying above the bridge as screen pans below to show the two performing the Dancing Dragon. Cut to them performing the final move. They look to either side as shot cuts to show that the dragons have stopped moving and are hovering on either side of the bridge.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Still bowing.] Judgment time.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Cut to the blue dragon which stares at Zuko, as Aang trembles. Zuko looks at it, with his mouth wide open. Cut to Aang trembles, as shot cuts to the two dragons sitting, with their legs at the bottom of the bridge. Cut to the red dragon as it breathes fire at the two. Cut to the blue dragon doing the same. Cut to Zuko and Aang yelling and covering their faces as they are engulfed by a multi-colored flame vortex. Cut to the top of the vortex from inside it. It slowly pans down to the boys who look at it, shocked. Cut to the bridge as the dragons continue breathing fire. Screen pans above to the flame vortex. Cut to the inside of the vortex and the two stare at the scene in awe. Cut to Aang's eyes.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Wow.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Cut to Zuko's face, as he stares at the flames.] I understand.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: The vortex slowly dissipates and the dragons curl their bodies, fly up, circle one time and go into their caves. Cut to the boys who still remain on the bridge. Cut to an annoyed Ham Ghao, before cutting to one of the warriors holding the circle of fire as he moves his arm in a circle, and extinguishes the flame and ending his hands in a position. Cut to an aerial shot of Zuko and Aang descending from the steps.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Cut to Zuko.] Their fire was beautiful. I saw so many colors, colors I've never imagined.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Cut to the two descending from the side.] Like firebending harmony.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Yes. They judged you, and gave you visions of the meaning of firebending. [The other two Sun Warriors walk away.]

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Cut to Zuko.] I can't believe there are still living dragons. My uncle Iroh said he faced the last dragon and killed it.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Looking at Zuko.] So your uncle lied.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Cut to the smiling chief from the side.] Actually, it wasn't a total lie. Iroh was the last outsider to face the masters. [Raising his hand above slightly.] They deemed him worthy and passed the secret onto him as well.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Surprised. Shot cuts to an aerial shot of the courtyard.] He must have lied to protect them, so no one else would hunt them.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Cut to Aang.] All this time, I thought firebending was destruction. Since I hurt Katara, I've been too afraid and hesitant. But now I know what it really is ... it's energy, and life. [He smiles.]

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Yeah. It's like the Sun, [He curls his hand into a fist.] but inside of you. Do you guys realize this?

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Smiling.] Well, our civilization is called the Sun Warriors ... so yeah.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: That's why my firebending was so weak before. Because for so many years, hunting you [Turns toward Aang as screen zooms out to show Aang.] was my drive ... it was my purpose. [Aang turns toward Zuko as well.] So when I joined you, I lost sight of my inner fire. But now, I have a new drive. [Cut to Zuko's face as screen zooms in.] I have to help you defeat my father and restore balance to the world.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Zuko delivers two fire blasts more powerful than in the Western Air Temple. Aang also bends a similar blast. Cut to Aang's face, as he grins at his success. Cut to both of them, who walk toward each other, smiling.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [He walks toward the two and become serious.] Now that you have learned the secrets, and you know about our tribe's existence, [He stops walking.] we have no choice but to imprison you here forever. [Cut to the two, who are shocked, before cutting back to the smiling chief.] Just kidding. [Cut to the two as they look relieved. The chief's expression becomes serious again.] But seriously, don't tell anyone!

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Scene changes to the upside-down pagodas in the Western Air Temple.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Cut to Aang and Zuko demonstrating the Dancing Dragon to the rest of Team Avatar and friends.] With this technique the dragons showed us, Zuko and I will be unstoppable.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: The two get into their final postures and Team Avatar applauds.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Yeah, that's a great dance you two learned there.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: It's not a dance. It's a firebending form.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Cut to Sokka, as he moves his fingers in a dancing manner.] We'll just tap-dance our way to victory over the Fire Lord.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Walks toward Sokka.] It's a sacred form that happens to be thousands of years old!

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Oh, yeahâ? What's your little form calledâ?

title: The Firebending Masters
text: [Embarrassed.] The Dancing Dragon.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Team Avatar laughs, and the shot cuts to Zuko who shuts his eyes and cringes in embarrassment. Fade to credits.

title: The Firebending Masters
text: Aang

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: The scene opens to the Western Air Temple at nightfall. Zuko is pouring tea to give to the members of Team Avatar.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: [Cut to a tray full of tea cups with Zuko's hand holding a kettle and filling up the empty cups.] No one can make tea like Uncle [Camera pans up to Zuko's face.], but hopefully I learned a thing or two. Would you like to hear Uncle's favorite tea joke?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Sure. [Cut to an overhead of the group sitting around a fire.]

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: I like jokes.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Bring it!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Okay. [Serves tea to The Duke and Haru and stands up with his tray.] Well, I can't remember how it starts, but the punch line [The boys help themselves to the tea.] is "Leaf me alone, I'm bushed!" [No response.] Well, it's funnier when Uncle tells it.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Right ... maybe that's because he remembers the whole thing.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Everyone else laughs. Zuko smiles a little.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: It's nice to get a chance to relax a little. It hardly ever happens.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Zuko hands tea to Teo and Toph. He subsequently approaches Sokka.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Hey, can I talk to you for a second? [Stands up and walks out.]

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Zuko sets down the tray of tea. The camera switches to a shot of him and Sokka walking away from where the rest of the group is gathered.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: So, what's up? [Appa wakes up and looks as they walk past him.]

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: If someone was captured by the Fire Nation, where would they be taken?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: What do you mean? Who was captured?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: When the invasion plan failed, some of our troops were taken. I just want to know where they might be.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: I can't tell you.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: What? Why not?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Trust me. Knowing would just make you feel worse. [Turns to leave, but is stopped by Sokka.]

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: It's my dad. He was captured too. I need to know what I put him through.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: It's not good, Sokka.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Please.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: My guess is, they were taken to the Boiling Rock.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: What's that?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: The highest security prison in the Fire Nation. [Sokka looks at him, horrified.] It's on an island in the middle of a boiling lake. It's inescapable.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: So, where is this place?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Why do you need to know? What are you planning?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Nothing. [Pauses for a moment.] Boy, you're so paranoid.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: It's in the middle of a volcano between here and the Fire Nation. You guys actually flew right past it on your way here.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Thanks, Zuko. [Yawns.] Just knowing makes me feel better.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: [Sarcastically.] Yeah, I'm sure it does.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Fade to later that night. With everyone asleep, Sokka sneaks away from everyone. He sighs and almost steps on Momo, narrowly avoiding tripping over him and waking him up. He climbs onto Appa, who awakes.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: [To Appa.] Shhh.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Appa goes back to sleep, as Sokka climbs on top of him. However, as he climbs up, he notices Zuko is already in the saddle with his arms crossed.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Not up to anything, huh?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: [Falls off Appa, his bag's contents fall out.] Fine, you caught me. I'm gonna rescue my dad. You happy now?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: I'm never happy.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: [Picking up the fallen items.] Look, I have to do this. The invasion plan was my idea, it was my decision to stay when things were going wrong. [Zuko jumps off of Appa.] It's my mistake, and it's my job to fix it. I have to regain my honor. You can't stop me, Zuko. [Pushes Zuko aside and begins to climb up Appa on Appa's saddle.]

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: You need to regain your honor? Believe me, I get it. I'm going with you.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: No. I have to do this alone.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: How are you going to get there? On Appa? Last time I checked, prisons don't have bison daycares. [Sokka stops climbing, sighs, and looks back at Zuko.] We'll take my war balloon. [They walk off to the war balloon.]

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Cut to Appa and Momo, still sleeping at sunrise. The Duke gives Appa some hay. Katara notices that Momo is holding a note.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: What does it say?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: "Need meat. Gone fishing. Back in a few days. Sokka and Zuko." [As she says this, Aang yawns and turns around to lie back down.] One more thing. "Aang, practice your firebending while I'm gone. Do twenty sets of fire fists and ten hot squats every time you hear a badgerfrog croak. Zuko."

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: A badgerfrog croaks, waking Aang from his rest.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: [Sighs.] Nobody else has homework. [Stands up and walks to a spot and starts hot squatting while Katara and Toph walk away.] One hot squat, two hot squat, three hot squat, four hot squat ...

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Scene cuts to Zuko and Sokka in the air in the war balloon. Zuko blasts fire into the tank to keep it moving. A moment of awkward silence between the two follows.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Pretty clouds.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Yeah ... fluffy. [Sokka whistles.] What?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: What? Oh, I didn't say anything. You know, a friend of mine actually designed these war balloons.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: No kidding.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Yep, a balloon ... but for war.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: If there's one thing my dad's good at, it's war. [Blasts more fire into the tank.]

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Yeah, it seems to run in the family.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: [Looks at Sokka, defensively.] Hey, hold on. Not everyone in my family is like that.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: I know, I know, you've changed.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: [Downcast.] I meant my uncle. He was more of a father to me. And I really let him down.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: I think your uncle would be proud of you. Leaving your home to come help us? That's hard.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: It wasn't that hard.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Really? You didn't leave behind anyone you cared about?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Well, I did have a girlfriend. Mai.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: [Smiles and looks at Zuko with interest.] That gloomy girl who sighs a lot?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: [Smiles.] Yeah. Everyone in the Fire Nation thinks I'm a traitor. I couldn't drag her into it.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: My first girlfriend turned into the moon.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: [Shocked for a moment. Looks up at the sky briefly, before glancing back at Sokka.] That's rough, buddy.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Nightfall. Sokka is asleep, snoring loudly. Zuko continues to keep the tank full. He stops to look out in the distance.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: There it is! [Sokka awakens to see it.] There's plenty of steam to keep us covered. As long as we're quiet, we should be able to navigate through it without being caught.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: As they enter the volcano's steam, the balloon begins losing altitude quickly.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: [Frantically blasting fire into the tank.] We're going down! The balloon's not working anymore! [Blasts fire up into the balloon.]

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: The air outside is just as hot as the air inside so we can't fly!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: [Falls to the side as the balloon tips.] So what are we supposed to do?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: I don't know! Crash-landing?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: The balloon skids along the boiling water, splashing Sokka's hand, which he shakes while blocking his mouth to prevent himself from screaming. The balloon hits the base of the rock, ejecting the two from it.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: [Looking at the destroyed war balloon.] How are we gonna get off the island if the balloon won't work?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: We'll figure something out! I suspected it might be a one-way ticket.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: You knew this would happen and you wanted to come anyway?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: [Walks to the destroyed balloon.] My dad might be here! I had to come and see!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Uncle always said I never thought things through. But this ... this is just crazy!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: [Gathers parts from the balloon together.] Hey, I never wanted you to come along in the first place! And for the record, I always think things through! But my plans haven't exactly worked, so this time, I'm playing it by ear. So there. [After the hot water on the balloon burns his hand, Sokka kicks it into the water.]

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: What are you doing?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: It doesn't work anyway, and we don't want anyone to find it.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: I hope you know what you're doing. [They both turn to look at the prison.] There's no turning back now.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Morning. Zuko and Sokka have entered the prison, and come out of a supply room filled with reserve guard uniforms. Both of them wear prison guard uniforms.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: I hope these disguises work.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: We just need to lay low and find my dad as soon as possible.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: A series of guards run by. One of them runs back and looks at them.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Guards! There's a scuffle in the yard. Come on.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: The two go to the yard. Prisoners are gathered in a circle as the guards move through to the inside.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: I didn't do anything! I'm going back to my cell.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: [Whips fire at him.] Stop right there, Chit Sang.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Zuko tries to approach, but Sokka grabs his arm to stop him.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: We can't blow our cover.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: I've had it with your unruly behavior!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: What did I do?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: He wants to know what he did. [To Zuko and Sokka.] Isn't that cute? [Gives them a look when they say nothing.]

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Uh, very cute, sir.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Super cute.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: [Walks up to Chit Sang.] You didn't bow down when I walked by, Chit Sang!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: What? That's not a prison rule.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Do it!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Make me.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: The bully guard walks away, but as he is leaving, he whips fire at Chit Sang. Chit Sang blocks it, and redirects it at him. The bully guard breaks the blast with a kick.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Tsk, tsk. Firebending is prohibited. You're going in the cooler. [Pointing at Sokka.] You! Help me take him in.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: [Whispers to Zuko.] Meet back here in an hour. [Runs up to Chit Sang and the guard.]

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Back inside, Chit Sang is led to a cooler.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: The warden will deal with you soon. [Sokka closes the doors.] Can you believe this guy?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: [Playing along.] Prisoners! Am I right?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Ugh. Tell me about it.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Meal time for the guards. Zuko is getting food, noticeably the only guard wearing a helmet.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Hey, new guy! I know it's the rule to have your helmet on at all times, but this is the lounge. Relax.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: But what if there's an incident? If I'm not prepared, someone could strike me on the head.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: The guards laugh.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Give it a week, he'll loosen up.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Can the new guy ask you veterans a few questions about the prison?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: [Bluntly.] No, you can't date the female guards.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Trust me, you don't want to. [The female guard throws a cup at him, which causes the guard sitting behind him to laugh.]

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: No, that's not it. The Boiling Rock, it holds the Fire Nation's most dangerous criminals, right? [The other guards nod.] So what about war prisoners?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: In the yard, the warden arrives on the gondolas. Meanwhile, Sokka and the bully guard continue to stand guard by the cooler. Sokka is looking inside at Chit Sang who is shivering.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: It sure looks cold in there.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: That's why we call it the cooler. He won't be firebending there. [Notices someone coming; lowers his mask.] It's the warden! [He and Sokka stand to attention.] Look alive!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: [Opens the cooler.] So Chit Sang, I hear you used firebending to try to escape. You should know better.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: I wasn't trying to escape.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: He's lying! I saw it with my own eyes. [He is pushed aside by one of the warden's bodyguards.]

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: No one has ever, ever escaped from here. I'd sooner jump in the Boiling Lake myself than let that record fall. Don't forget it. Now go back to your shivering.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Back in the yard. Zuko approaches Sokka, but does not know it is him.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Hey there, fellow guard, how goes it?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: [Lifts up his helmet's visor.] Zuko?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Shhh! Listen, I asked around the lounge. There are no Water Tribe prisoners. [Lifts up his visor.] I'm afraid your father's not here.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: What? Are you sure, did you double-check?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Yeah, I'm sure.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: No. No! [Bangs his fists against the wall in frustration.]

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: I'm really sorry, Sokka.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: So we came all this way for nothing? I failed ... again.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Ah, [Holds his chin in thought.] what would Uncle say? [Cut to a frog-view as he looks up at the sky.] Sometimes, clouds have two sides, [Walks over to the railing.] a dark and light, and a silver lining in between. It's like a silver sandwich! [Close-up of a disinterested Sokka; voice-over.] So ... when life seems hard ... [Sokka glances to the side.] take a bite out of the silver sandwich!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Sokka's eyes widen when he notices something; close-up of his cheerful expression as he gets up. Cut to a frontal shot of Zuko while Sokka runs up to grab the railing next to him, excitedly looking down to the yard below.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Maybe we haven't failed after all!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: That's the spirit! [Folds his arms.] I can't believe that worked. [Looks down.] I didn't even know what I was saying.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: No, what you said made no sense at all. But look ... [As he points, the camera shifts to an overhead view of the yard, before rapidly zooming in on a dejected-looking Suki.] It's Suki!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Suki, sitting in the prison yard in prison garb, looks up at hearing the continuous ringing of a bell.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: [Voice-over.] Prisoners, [Suki gets up.] back in your cells!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Cut to a view of the prison yard from ground level as the prisoners start to walk back inside. Cut to a frontal shot of Zuko and Sokka. The latter's eyes are now rapidly blinking pink hearts, while Zuko gives him a conspicuous look. Sokka does not pay attention and lowers the visor of his helmet with a smile before dashing out of the scene with a surprised Zuko quicking turning his head and looking after him. Cut to the prisoners' housing area. Camera slowly pans to show a guard mopping the floor and another one doing his rounds. Cut to Suki lying on her bed and staring at the ceiling in sadness. The door to her cell opens and closes, illuminating her face as her eyes turn to the door. Cut to a further off side-shot of Sokka entering Suki's cell.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: [Sits up; aggressively.] What is it? Did I do something wrong?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: [Crosses arms.] You mean you don't recognize me?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: [Close-up. She averts her eyes; bitterly.] You people all look the same to me.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: [Frontal shot; smugly.] Oh? Then maybe you'll recognize this.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Sokka purses his lips and attempts smooching sounds as he leans in to kiss Suki. His lips are suddenly grasped by a hand. The camera switches to the side-shot as Suki violently shoves him against the door. Frontal shot of Sokka as he makes contact with the door, his helm flinging off in the process. He looks bewildered to Suki. Cut to a close-up of Suki, her left arm still stretched out in the move she used to push him away. Her angry expression instantly brightens.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Sokka! [Runs up to him; cut to a side-view.] It's you!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Suki rushes to pull Sokka into an embrace. Still bewildered, he does not immediately return the gesture. Cut to a frontal shot of Sokka, Suki resting her head on his shoulder, and he mellows into the embrace, returning it in all honestly while closing his eyes. Cut to a close-up side-shot of Suki, who is tearing up out of joy.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: [They both stand up, not releasing each other.] The other Kyoshi Warriors, are they here?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: No. I don't know where they are. They locked me in here because I'm the leader.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: [Places his right hand on her left cheek.] Well, you won't be here for long. I'm busting you out.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: [Frontal shot.] I'm so glad [Places her hand over Sokka's on her face and closes her eyes.] to see you Sokka. [Opens them again.] I knew you'd come.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Cut to a side-shot of the now-reunited couple as they gaze lovingly at each other. They release hands, placing them on the other's arms, and lean in to kiss; Suki throws her arms around Sokka's neck. Cut to a close-up frontal shot of Zuko standing guard outside the cell. He suddenly looks to his right. Cut to a further off shot, showing the entire hallway, revealing that the sound that drew Zuko's attention was a guard ascending nearby stairs. He taps on the cell door to get Sokka and Suki's attention. Cut to inside the cell where the couple stops kissing, Sokka casting a suspicious look to the door. Cut back to outside the cell, where the female guard approaches Zuko, who is standing in front of the cell door, his arms crossed behind his back. He turns to her as she pulls up next to him.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Excuse me. [Cut to a shot from behind Zuko.] I need to get into that cell.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: [Shot from over the guard's shoulder.] No, you can't go in there! [Looks at the prison cell; unsure.] The lights are out. [Points at the door.] The prisoner could sneak up on you.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: [Close-up. Cut to a side-shot; annoyed.] Step aside, fool. [She raises her left arm to push Zuko out of the way, though before she can touch him, he grabs hold of the arm and turns her around, slamming her face first against the door.] Hey, hey, what are you doing?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: She turns to retaliate against Zuko's action. Cut to inside the cell, where Zuko's head can be seen through the looking hole as he is slammed against the door. The camera pans down to show Sokka and Suki pushed against the door, looking up in worry. Sokka's expression turns serious as he lowers his gaze and puts on his helmet. Cut to a close-up shot of the guard's right calf as Zuko plants his own leg behind it. Switch to a further off shot. Zuko grabs a hold of the woman's right arm and forces her to bend backward, thus averting her sight from the door that slides open. Sokka quickly exits the cell and shuffles away, his back pressed against the wall. The female guard manages to push Zuko's face up with her left arm, regaining a more leveled pose herself. Cut to a close-up side-shot of her from underneath Zuko's arms as she looks to her right.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: [Instantly cut to a frontal shot of Sokka, who freezes over.] Guard, help! [He turns to look at the struggle.] I think he's an impostor! [Frontal shot of Sokka, looking unsure.] Arrest him!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Cut to a view of the gondola making its way to the prison. Cut back to inside the prison as the struggle continues.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Get him off me and arrest him!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: [Grabs Zuko and throws him down on the floor.] You're under arrest! [Whispering.] Don't worry, I'll figure it out.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Sokka leads Zuko away, followed by the female guard. Later, Zuko, now in prison garb, is in an isolated room. The door opens, revealing the warden.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Well, well, well. I never thought I'd find you in here, [Smiles evilly and walks into the cell.] Prince Zuko.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: [Shocked.] How did you know who I am?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: How could I not? You broke my niece's heart.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: [Even more shocked.] You're Mai's uncle? I never meant to hurt her.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Quiet! You're my special prisoner now. And you'd best behave. If these criminals found out who you are, the traitor prince who let his nation down, why they'd tear you to shreds.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: [Folds his arms.] So what's in it for you? Why don't you just tell my father to come collect a reward?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Oh, in due time, believe me, I intend to collect. [Walks away and shuts the door.]

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Outside the cells, Sokka comes down and sees Zuko and Suki mopping floors.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Oh, good, you guys have met.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Actually, we met a long time ago.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: We did?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: [Somewhat angrily.] Yeah, you kind of burned down my village.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: [Stops mopping for a second.] Oh, sorry about that. Nice to see you again.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Zuko and Suki stop mopping and hide from the other guards beside a staircase.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: So, listen, I think I have an escape plan. I checked out the coolers again, and the point of them is to keep firebenders contained, right?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Yeah ...

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: So, they're completely insulated and sealed to keep the cold in. Well, to keep the cold in, it also has to keep the heat out, right?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Just get to the point, Sokka.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: It's a perfect boat for getting through the boiling water.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: [Exchanges a worried glance with Suki.] The cooler as a boat? Are you sure?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: I'm telling you, it'll work. [Flashes back to Sokka walking around the island; voice-over.] I walked around the perimeter. There's a blind spot between two guard towers. It's the perfect launching point. [Sokka puts a miniature boat in the water and watching it float away.] I already tested it out. We'll roll the cooler into the water and just float with the current. It'll take us straight across. As long as we don't make a sound, no one will notice. [Fade back to Sokka talking to Zuko and Suki.] And bing-bang-boom, we're home free.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: But how are you going to get the cooler out?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: [From the staircase.] Yeah, how are you going to get the cooler out? [Jumps down.]

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: [Covering up.] What? We didn't ... w-we didn't say that.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Yeah, you heard wrong.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: I heard you hatching an escape plan, and I want in.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: There's nothing to get in on.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Yeah, the only thing we're hatching is ... an egg?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Zuko lowers his head and Suki covers her eyes while they both sigh in annoyance. Cut back to Chit Sang.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: [Unconvinced.] Okay, well, I come with you or the warden [Camera pans from a serious-looking Zuko to Suki.] hears about this egg, too.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: [To Sokka.] I guess we have no choice.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Okay, you're in. [Handing Zuko a wrench.] Now first we need someone to unbolt the cooler, from the inside.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Oh, I can get you inside.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Cut to a view of the stairs as two guards look down at the prison area. Chit Sang walks out from behind the stairs and stands in a spot. Zuko pretends to be mopping and bumps into Chit Sang.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Hey! What are you, stupid? Watch where you're going! [Shoves Zuko.]

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Hey, you watch who you're shoving! [He pushes Chit Sang.]

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: I think you mean whom I'm shoving!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: The two scuffle as the prisoners cheer them on. They break apart and Zuko goes for a punch. Chit Sang throws Zuko onto the floor.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: [Approaching. Yelling.] I need backup over here!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Zuko dodges Chit Sang as he tries to elbow him. Zuko blasts fire at Chit Sang.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: No firebending! [Pointing.] Into the cooler!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Zuko is taken down and escorted away by two guards. Sokka looks at Suki, who is mopping and looks back, as he walks off. Later, Sokka opens the cooler.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: I can take you back to your cell if you've learned your lesson.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: [Raises his head slightly and releases a small breath of fire to warm himself up.] Yes, I have ... completely. [Reveals all the removed bolts and screws, which makes Sokka smile.]

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: [Lifts his visor; whispering.] I got Suki and Chit Sang out of their cells a few minutes ago. They'll be waiting for us at the shore.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Someone's coming! [Takes Sokka into the cooler and closes the door.]

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Yeah, new arrivals coming in at dawn.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Anybody interesting?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Nah, just the usual. Some robbers, a couple traitors, some war prisoners, [Sokka looks at Zuko with shock and worry.] though I did hear there might be a pirate.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: No fooling!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: War prisoners. It could be your father.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: I know.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Well, what should we do? Are we going ahead with the plan or are we waiting another night?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: I don't know! Is it right for me to risk Suki's freedom, all of our freedom on the slim chance that my dad is gonna show up?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: It's your call, Sokka.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Cut to outside the prison, night time. Suki and Chit Sang are waiting for Sokka and Zuko until they hear them above, rolling the, now detached, cooler down the hill. Suki and Chit Sang move to help.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Took you guys long enough. [Cut briefly to two other prisoners, a male sitting on a rock, and a female waving.] This here's my girl and my best buddy, they're coming too.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Fine. Everybody in the cooler. Let's go. [They move the cooler into the water. Cut to Sokka lifting a rock hiding his Water Tribe outfit.]

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Are you sure you wanna go? You're the one who said you wanted to redeem yourself. Redeem your honor. Rescuing your dad is your chance.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: [Approaching.] Your dad?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: [Turns to Zuko.] If I had just cut my losses at the invasion, maybe we wouldn't be in this mess. Maybe sometimes it's just better to call it quits before you fail.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: No, it's not. Look Sokka, you're going to fail a lot before things work out.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: [Standing.] That supposed to make me feel better?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: [Sokka moves away.] Even though you'll probably fail over and over and over again ...

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Seriously, not helping.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: [Grabs Sokka's shoulder.] You have to try every time. You can't quit because you're afraid you might fail.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: [Standing by the cooler boat.] Hey, if you two are done cuddling, can we get a move on?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: No. I'm staying. You guys go. [To Suki.] You've been here long enough.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: I'm not leaving without you, Sokka.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: I'm staying, too.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Not me, I'm out. Let's roll, baby. [Pushes the cooler into the lake and jumps in.]

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: We gave up our only chance of escaping. I hope we haven't just made a huge mistake.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: As morning arrives, the cooler holding Chit Sang, his buddy, and his girlfriend is still within the perimeter of the prison. The current escapees are sweating as the cooler slowly floats with the current.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Aah, this current is so slow. I can use this to paddle. [Rips off a piece of the cooler. When he puts the piece of metal in the water, the steaming water splashes on to his hand, causing him to scream loudly.]

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: A watchman catches notice. Two watchmen hit an alarm bell as the warden approaches.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Guards! Secure the perimeter and lock down the prisoners! Now!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Many guards appear to lock down the prisoners as we see one guard use a fire whip to control the prisoners. Cut to the outside of the prison walls as the camera pans down to Sokka, Suki, and Zuko.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: The plan failed! They're caught!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Cut back to the warden near a launcher.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Get the fugitives and throw them in the cooler!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: [The guard in charge of the steering wheel turns toward the warden.] Uh ... they are in a cooler, sir.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: One that's bolted down and not floating in the water! This is a lockdown! We have new prisoners arriving! Everything must be completely secure!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: The male guard fires a large ballista bolt, catching hold of the cooler, and drags it back toward the prison.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: The gondola's moving. [Cut to a side-view of the gondola approaching the prison. Cut to a view of the prison yard as the gondola nears its stop. Cut to Sokka and Suki now in the yard.] This is it. [Cut to the gondola arriving. Cut to Sokka, Zuko and Suki in the yard.] If my dad's not there, we've risked everything for nothing.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: We had to. [Holds Sokka's hand.]

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Come on, come on ...

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Cut to a large man with a tattoo and nose ring comes off the gondola first.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Is that him? [Cut to Sokka.]

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: My dad doesn't have a nose ring. [Cut briefly to the gondola as several men step off.] Where is he? [Cut to the gondola briefly as we see one more prisoner exit. Hakoda does not appear.] That's it? That can't be it.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: [Comforting.] I'm sorry, Sokka.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Oh, no.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Hey, you! Get off the gondola!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Cut to the gondola as Hakoda steps out.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: [Cut to Sokka, Shocked.] Dad ...

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Fade to the words "TO BE CONTINUED ..." followed by the credits.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 1
text: Chit Sang

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: The episode opens to morning at the Boiling Rock, where an overhead shot of the volcano is seen. Cut to view from some point in the boiling water, where the stronghold lies ahead. Cut to view of the warden walking forward, toward the camera.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Line 'em up for the warden!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Cut to an overhead shot of the perimeter on which they are standing, the warden's back facing the camera. Eight prisoners are seen filing in line, one next to the other, including Hakoda. Cut to the end of the line of prisoners where the last of them line up, the camera zooming out to show Hakoda, who stands at the very end of the line on the right side. Cut to Sokka, who walks forward and lifts his guard mask.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Dad ... [Exiting a stairway and passing through a lineup of guards, surprising them a bit.] Excuse me, coming through. The warden wants me over there. [Points in the warden's direction.] Sorry!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Cut to overhead shot of the perimeter, the prisoners lined up toward the right and the guards to the left of the screen. Sokka is seen inching his way behind several guards, taller than him. The warden approaches the new prisoners.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Walking past the line of prisoners starting from the left.] Welcome to the Boiling Rock. I'm sure you've all heard the horrible rumors about our little island. Well, I just want to tell you that they don't have to be true, as long as you do everything I say. [He stops in front of Hakoda who looks downward; looks closer at Hakoda.] Look me in the eye when I'm talking to you.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Averting his gaze slightly off to the side; firmly.] No.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Oh? You'd rather look at my shoes? [Angrily.] Then take a look!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: He raises his left leg and drags Hakoda by his handcuffs down onto the floor. Cut to a side-view of Hakoda kneeling over, his face expressing anger. Cut to Sokka standing behind two guards as he gasps in horror. Cut to shot from below Hakoda, where the warden stands over him, keeping his foot firmly pressed on the warrior's handcuffs.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: I know exactly who you are, Hakoda of the Water Tribe. So strong-willed. [Cut to the warden's face.] But don't worry, we'll get rid of that in time. Now look me in the eye!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Hakoda reluctantly lifts his head to look the warden in the eye and glares hatefully at him.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Calmer.] See, isn't that better? [To the other prisoners.] You will all do as I say or pay the price. You will all-

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: He begins to walk forward only for Hakoda to lift his left handcuff slightly, tripping the warden and causing him to fall flat on the ground. Sokka stifles a chuckle, as the two guards he was standing behind rush to aid the warden.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Standing over him.] Are you okay, sir?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Rises and snaps angrily.] I'm fine! Get these prisoners out of my sight!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: He storms away impatiently. The two guards look at each other. Cut to wide-view of the perimeter where the prisoners file one behind the other and are led down a stairwell into what is presumed to be the prison hold. Sokka runs away off-screen. Cut to inside the prison, followed by an overhead shot of inside Hakoda's cell, where he sits on his mattress, his face buried in his arms. A sliver of light appears as the doorway to the cell is opened. Hakoda raises his head to see who has entered. Cut to side-view of the entire cell, revealing that Sokka has walked in, still dressed as a guard.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Approaches his father.] Thank goodness you're okay.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Rises to his feet and extends his right arm out, clenched in a fist, not realizing the guard is his son in disguise; Sokka backs up a bit.] If you take one step closer, you'll see just how "okay" I am.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Lifting up his helmet mask.] Dad, it's me.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Softens up and grows teary-eyed.] Sokka, [The two embrace; Sokka drops his helmet to the floor.] my son. [Amused.] You know Sokka, you should be more careful with that guard outfit on. I almost punched you in the gut.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Rubs the back of his neck sheepishly.] Yeah, I ran into that problem earlier.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Cut to a dimly-lit corridor. Cut to view of a door as it slides open, revealing Chit Sang sitting inside an interrogation room, cuffed to a wooden chair. The warden walks on-screen into the room. Cut to an overhead shot of the interrogation room as he approaches the prisoner.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Calmly.] Are you comfortable, Chit Sang?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Snaps.] If you're trying to get me to talk, forget it! [The warden appears behind him.] I'm not a squealer!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Cuts to close-up of his face; casually.] Chit Sang, I only asked if you were comfortable.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Brightly.] Well, yeah, actually I am pretty comfortable.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: The warden, in a fit of anger, kicks the chair to the ground. Chit Sang falls forward off screen. Cuts to shot of him lying on the floor, still bound to the chair, his face pressed against the ground. The warden walks up to Chit Sang.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Are you still comfortable?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: No.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: I know you and your cronies are not smart enough to come up with that little escape plan. So you're gonna tell me ... [Leans in closer to Chit Sang.] who is?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: The warden exits the room. Cut to view of the room, as the two guards hoist the chair upward and set it on the ground. The guard on Chit Sang's left walks over to the doorway and slides the door to the cell closed. Cut to shot of the prison courtyard. Cut to shot of outside Hakoda's cell where Sokka can be seen looking through the open slit in the cell door, averting his eyes in different directions.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [To Hakoda.] So where's Bato? [Cut to inside the prison cell; Sokka turns away from the door.] Where's everyone else from the invasion?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: The others are being held at a prison near the Fire Nation palace. They singled me out as their leader and sent me here. [Sokka comes by his father and sits down.] But before I left, I met some young women who said they knew you. The ... Oshinama Fighters?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Smiles.] You mean the Kyoshi Warriors?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: That's right.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Their leader Suki is here and she's gonna escape with us.
