title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Lays a hand on Sokka's shoulder.] Good. We'll need all the help we can get.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: And you know Prince Zuko?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: The son of the Fire Lord? I don't know him, but I know of him.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Well, he's here too.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Crosses his arms angrily.] Sounds like a major problem.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Actually, he's on our side now. [Cut to Hakoda, who gives his son a suspicious look.] I know. I had the same reaction. After all he's done, it was hard to trust him. But he's really proven himself, and I never would've found you without his help. [Hakoda nods his head at Sokka, indicating that he understands.]

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: So, do you have a plan?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Downcast.] We had one, but some of the other prisoners got involved and ruined it. [Leans forward and rests his face in his arms.] I dunno if there's another way off this island.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Smiles and pats a hand on Sokka's back.] Sokka, there's no prison in the world that can hold two Water Tribe geniuses.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Then we'd better find two.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Hakoda laughs. Sokka chuckles nervously. Cut to a ground level shot of inside the prison hold. Sokka approaches a cell door and averts his gaze alertly. He lifts his helmet mask and peers into the slit of a cell doorway.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [In a hushed voice.] Zuko, are you there?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [A view of Zuko's eyes appears in the slit from inside the cell.] I'm here.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: I just got done talking to my dad. We came up with an escape plan together.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Off-camera; startles Sokka.] What are you doing here?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Sokka turns around, pulling down his helmet mask. The camera shifts to reveal two guards standing on the stairwell behind him. Cut to shot from in between the two guards.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Pointing to the cell and trying to act gruff.] I was just telling this dirty lowlife what I think of him!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Well, you'll have to do that later. He's coming with us.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Puzzled.] Why?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Irritated.] Because we have orders straight from the warden, that's why!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Could I just get ten more seconds to rough him up a bit? [Punches his palm with his fist.]

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Fine, ten seconds.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: The two guards fold their arms. Sokka enters the cell and begins to "rough up" Zuko. The female guard leans against the wall, crosses her arms and shakes her head in mock disapproval.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Off-camera from inside the cell.] Take that ... and this! [Punching noises come from the cell.]

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Amused.] Newbie.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Cut to shot of a bundled-up mattress being held up, several blows being landed to it. Cut to shot of the cell where Sokka is seen punching the mattress which Zuko holds up, the two faking the entire scenario. Zuko shouts a few times in mock pain.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [In a hushed voice while still punching the mattress.] We have a new plan, but it's gonna need a big distraction. [Cuts to shot of Zuko who peers from behind the blanket; off camera.] Be in the yard in one hour.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: A sliver of light appears as the cell door is opened. Sokka suddenly grabs Zuko and begins to wrestle him to look convincing as the two guards enter.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Separates the two.] All right, that's enough.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Zuko is escorted out of the cell by the guards while Sokka remains behind. Cut to an overhead shot of a hallway, the camera shifting downward to show Zuko being dragged.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Voice-over.] What are you doing? Where are you taking me? [He is thrown into a chair in an interrogation room.] I didn't do anything wrong!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Come on, [Zuko looks to the source of the voice.] Zuko. [Emerges from the corner of the room; annoyed.] We all know that's a lie.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Shocked.] Mai!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Cut to shot of the entire cell, Zuko still sitting on the floor with Mai standing over him. The cell door is open, with at least one guard patrolling it from outside. Cut to view of prison hold before switching to an upside-down shot of the warden sliding open another cell door and entering the room.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: How is he?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Cut to right-side up shot of the two guards holding Chit Sang upside-down in the chair. Chit Sang's face is red and strained.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: I think he's ready to talk.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: They toss chair the chair forward toward the warden back to a normal position. Chit Sang inhales deeply a few times, his face slowly returning to normal color, sweat dripping down his face.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Approaches him from behind.] Have you had enough time to think about what I asked?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Yes.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Eager.] And?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: You're right. There was another person involved in the escape plan.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Places his hand on Chit Sang's shoulder.] Who?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: It's a guy who's disguised like a prison guard. Only he's not a prison guard. He's the mastermind. He came up with the plan.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: The warden smiles slyly, pats Chit Sang on the head, and exits. The camera focuses on Chit Sang, who maintains a cold-hard expression. The scene changes to the prison cell where Zuko sits in the chair slumped over and Mai stands over him.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: How did you know I was here?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Because I know you so well.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: But, how-

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: The warden's my uncle, you idiot. [Zuko sighs; Mai shows him a letter.] The truth is, I guess I don't know you. All I get is a letter? You could have least looked me in the eye when you ripped out my heart.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: I didn't mean to -

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: You didn't mean to? [Reading the letter.] "Dear Mai, I'm sorry you that you have to find out this way, but I'm leaving."

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Stop! This isn't about you. This is about the Fire Nation!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Sarcastically.] Thanks Zuko, that makes me feel all better. [Throws the letter at him.]

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Stands up.] Mai, I never wanted to hurt you. But I have to do this to save my country.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Save it? You're betraying your country!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: That's not how I see it.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Cut back to Mai who looks away from him sulkily and folds her arms. Cut to Suki's cell, where she is practicing her fighting moves. Sokka enters.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Sokka, what's going on?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Places his hand on her shoulder.] I don't have much time. If I'm seen with you the guards might think something's up. [Walks over to the door and peers outside.] I just talked to my dad.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: That's great.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Yeah, and we're escaping today, on the gondola.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: What?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: My dad and I came up with the plan together. We're gonna commandeer the gondola [Puts both hands on her shoulders.] and we're gonna take a hostage with us so they won't cut the lines.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Takes his hands off her shoulders.] We'll never make it onto the gondola. There's too many guards.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: My dad already thought of that. He said we'll need a distraction. That's why we're gonna start a prison riot.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Okay, let's say by some miracle this all works and we make it on the gondola. The warden will still just cut the lines, even if we have a captive.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Not if the warden is the captive. [Nearby noise occurs. Moves to look outside.] I have to go. [Suki hugs him.] I'll find you before we start the riot. [Cut to outside the cell, where he slides out of the cell.]

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Hey, you, the warden wants to see you!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Why?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: I don't know, I didn't ask.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Maybe I could schedule another time with him? How's tomorrow? [Walks off-screen.]

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: He wants to see you ... now. [Sokka is escorted by two guards.]

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Scene moves to the yard with a line-up of guards, the warden, and Chit Sang present.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Put him in the line-up.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: They throw Sokka in the line-up with a bunch of other guards, now with no helmet like the rest of them. He tries hiding behind a lowly guard, but the guard pushes him away.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: One of you is an impostor who thought he could fool me. [Chit Sang steps forward.] But now, that person is going to be in a lot of trouble. Who is it?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Sokka's teeth start chattering, clearly nervous among the other calm guards. The camera stays on Sokka, who closes his eyes.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Off-screen.] That's him, warden. He's the impostor! [The camera shifts to Chit Sang, who is pointing at the bully guard.]

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: What?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Cut to the warden, who smiles evilly and walks away.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Grabs Chit Sang by the shirt.] I am not! [Chit Sang just raises his hands nonchalantly in defense.] He's lying! [Another guard grabs him.] He's a liar!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: The guard is taken away. Chit Sang turns and smiles slyly at Sokka, who looks on and breathes a sigh of relief.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: I'm telling you ... it wasn't me!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Save your breath! I know you were working together. [Turns around and moves in closer to the guard.] You threw Chit Sang in the very cooler they used to escape. It was all part of your plan.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: That was just a coincidence!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: The door opens, someone enters.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Sir, there's someone to see you.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Angrily.] Who told you to interrupt me?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: The warden turns angrily toward the door, but looks shocked and bows upon seeing who it is. Cut to show Azula standing at the door with Ty Lee behind her. All of the guards bow to her as well.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: I did.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Cut closer to Azula.] Princess Azula. [Azula and Ty Lee walk in.] Ah ... It is an honor to welcome you to the Fire Nation's most exemplary prison. [Stands up.] I didn't realize you were coming.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Walks in and notices the guard sitting in the chair.] Who is this?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Cut to the bully guard, who looks away.] He's a guard who was involved in a recent and feeble escape attempt.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Desperately.] It wasn't me!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Angrily.] Quiet, you!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Crossing her arms.] You're wasting your time. That's not one of them. [Turns and starts to leave.]

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: The warden turns and looking surprised, and confused, looks from Azula to the guard before looking back to Azula again.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: How do you know?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Smiles sinisterly; quietly.] Because I'm a people person. [Exits.]

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: In the hall, Sokka approaches a guard in charge of the cell doors.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Hey, I just got orders. Let the prisoners out into the yard.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: But we're in the middle of a lockdown.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Oh, okay, I'll just go tell the warden you said that. [Walks off-screen; the guard raises his mask and looks at him speechless.] I'm sure he'll be glad to hear about you undermining his authority. [Guard grows more nervous. Walks back on-screen, lifting his helmet mask.] What's your name again?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Starts to sweat; horrified.] Wait! Don't tell the warden. I'm just a little confused.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Hey, I'm confused too, but the warden's in a bad mood, and ... irrational, so if you ask me, it's best not to question it, and just do what he says. [Places his arm around the guard's shoulder.]

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Yeah ... you're right. We're letting them out!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: The guard opens all the doors by pulling the levers. The prisoners head for the yard. The prisoners mingle in the yard, where Sokka, Suki, and Hakoda meet.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: This is it! We have to start a riot.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Okay. But how do we do that?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Smiles smugly.]Â I'll show you. [Shoves a prisoner.]

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Hey! What'd you do that for? That hurt my feelings.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Aren't you mad at me?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Uh, well, normally I would be, but I've been learning to control my anger.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: This isn't working.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Suddenly, Chit Sang appears behind Sokka and puts his hand on Sokka's shoulder.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Hey you! You're lucky I didn't rat you out, [Smiles.] but my generosity comes with a price. I know you're planning another escape attempt, and I want in.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Gets an idea.] Actually, we're trying to escape right now, but we need a riot. [Points to him.] You wouldn't happen to know how to start one, would you?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: A prison riot? Please. [Grabs a prisoner and lifts him in the air, bouncing him up and down.] Hey! [All the prisoners look at him.] Riot!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: The riot begins. Several blasts of fire go off.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Looks shocked for a moment.]Â Impressive.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Forget about controlling my anger ... [Raises his arms.] let's riot! [He is taken down by another prisoner. The riot is in full swing. Cut the floor of the yard as chaos and dust ensues everywhere. Cut to a prisoner sitting on another prisoner's shoulders, attempting to choke him. Cut to the bottom of a tower as various guards look down at the scene.]

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Who let these prisoners into the yard? [Cut to the warden on a balcony.] This is supposed to be a lockdown!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: The door guard, who was in charge of the control room, raises his visor and looks at the warden, horrified. He puts his back against the wall and sneaks away by quickly tip-toeing and ducks to a corner. The camera cuts back to Zuko and Mai.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Ma'am, there's a riot going on! I'm here to protect you!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: I don't need any protection.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Gives a slight chuckle; proudly.] Believe me, she doesn't.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: I'm sorry, but I'm under direct orders from your uncle to make sure nothing happens. [Zuko gives a serious look.]

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Zuko blasts fire at the guard and starts to run toward the door. The guard jumps in front of Mai to shield her.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Get off of me! [She throws the guard away from her and chases Zuko.]

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Exiting, Zuko closes and locks the door, trapping Mai and the guard in the room. He looks at Mai through the slit in the door with regret, while she stares back in anger, before running off to join his friends. Back in the yard, he reaches everyone else and slams down another guard as the riot continues.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Zuko! Good, we're all here. Now all we need to do is grab the warden, and get to the gondolas!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: And how do we do that?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: I'm not sure.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Groans.] I thought you thought this through!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: I thought you told me it's okay not to think everything through!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Maybe not everything, but this is kind of important! [Rubs his forehead.]

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Hey, uh, fellas. I think your girlfriend's taking care of it.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Sokka peeks out and looks amazed as he sees Suki hop up on the heads of the rioters before jumping and flipping onto the tower. She easily defeats the first guard with a few quick jabs. Two more guards arrive. She ducks a fire blast and sweeps the first one, promptly dodges the second one's fire blast, and continues to climb the tower. She makes it up to the top and defeats the final guard with a sliding kick. She soon grabs the warden, threatening him with her fist in front of his face.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: You wouldn't dare.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Ties his hands together and uses his headband as a gag.] Sorry, warden. You're my prisoner now. [Slams the warden against the wall; the rest of the escapees arrive.] We've got the warden! Now let's get out of here!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Everyone else is out of breath.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: That's some girl.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Proudly.] Tell me about it.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Cut to the roof as they all make the run to the gondola.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: We're almost there!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: They are stopped by guards who launch two fire blasts at them. Zuko shoves Sokka out of the way and blocks the two fire blasts. More guards appear to help.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Back off! We've got the warden! [The guards see the warden on Chit Sang's shoulder, bound and gagged, and clear the way.] Let's go!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: They continue along their path, cautiously watching the guards so they do not try any sudden moves. They arrive at the gondola. Suki opens the door.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Everyone in!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Zuko starts the gondola and kicks the handle a few times attempting to break it. He sees the guards rushing toward him and kicks the handle again and breaks it. He jumps toward the gondola while dodging guards fire blasts. Sokka grabs Zuko's hand and helps him into the gondola.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: What are you doing?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: I'm making it so they can't stop us.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Way to think ahead.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: We're on our way!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Wait! Who's that?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Azula and Ty Lee stand at the bottom of the gondola station. All the guards bow down.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: That's a problem. It's my sister and her friend.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Looking up at the retreating gondola, Azula suddenly snatches a pair of handcuffs from a guard's belt and runs forward. Behind her, Ty Lee jumps up and onto the cable, running along it toward the gondola. After elevating herself to the line with a fire blast, Azula uses the cuffs to attach herself to the cable and propel herself forwaard. The occupants of the gondola watch as they approach, Suki looking very grim.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Determined.] This is a rematch I've been waiting for.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Me too.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Sokka, Suki, and Zuko climb to the top of the gondola to meet Azula and Ty Lee. Ty Lee flips into the air and lands in front of Suki, who growls and assumes a battle-ready position. Azula pulls herself up onto the roof and faces Zuko and Sokka. An overhead shot shows them all standing atop the gondola before closing in on Azula again. The Fire Nation princess assumes a battle stance and performs a slicing kick, sending blue fire at her opponents, but Zuko blocks it. Ty Lee and Suki trade blows, the latter blocking the former's attempts to use chi blocking each time. Ty Lee is forced to the edge but jumps into the gondola and comes out the other side, continuing her attacks. Zuko continues to wipe out Azula's fire blasts. Sokka draws her back to the edge with his sword. Zuko goes in for a finish, but Azula dodges Zuko's blast and stays on the gondola. She counters with a blast that goes wide, almost striking Suki and Ty Lee, who barely manage to dodge it. Meanwhile, the warden attempts to free himself while the other prisoners are distracted. A male guard watches from a telescope.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: There's the warden! I see him!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Frees himself and runs to look out of the gondola.] Cut the line! [Chit Sang notices and grabs the warden.]

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: He wants us to cut the line.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: But if we cut the line, there's no way he'll survive!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Puts down his telescope.] He knows that.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: The guards stop the gondola by jamming the mechanism with metal bars; the wheel screeches angrily as it grinds to a halt. The gondola rocks back and forth from the sudden stop, disrupting the combatants from their respective duels. Losing his balance, Sokka slides to the edge of the gondola, but Zuko pulls him in at the last moment. Ty Lee jumps up to the top of the wire to see what is happening.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: They're about to cut the line!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: The guards work to cut the line. Azula notices another gondola approaching on the other wire, heading inbound.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Smirks.] Then it's time to leave. [Blasts herself up.] Goodbye, Zuko. [Reaches the other gondola.]

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Ty Lee backflips to the other gondola. When she reaches it, she looks back at Sokka, Suki, and Zuko with concern, in contrast to Azula's sadistic smile. The other three jump back into the gondola.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: They're cutting the line! The gondola's about to go!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: I hope this thing floats.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Pan down to the Boiling Lake. The line is almost entirely severed by now, but before the guards can finish the job, they are suddenly yanked away from it and pinned to the wall by stilettos.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: What are you doing?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: The camera cuts to show Mai standing near the line.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Saving the jerk who dumped me.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Other guards try to attack Mai, but she dodges all their fire blasts and retaliates with her knives, pinning them all down by their wristguards. Mai rears up in front of a female guard, who stops in fear, and deploys four knives that send the two guards behind her flying, dislodging one of the bars jamming the wheel mechanism. She pulls out her three-pronged sai and pins down the last guard. Releasing the block on the line, she allows the gondola to continue in motion. Everyone looks back to see what happened.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Who's that?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Mai continues to fight off guards and turns her head to see the others.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Shocked.] It's Mai!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Angrily.] What is she doing?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Ty Lee shrugs and makes a small sound as they watch her continue to fight off guards, all of whom are helpless against her. The gondola makes it to the top of the hill. Everyone leaves. Chit Sang holds the warden and throws him back in when Hakoda points at it.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Sorry, warden. Your record is officially broken. [The warden struggles against his bindings.]

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Cut to the others escaping over the rim of the volcano.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Well, we made it out. Now what?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Sokka turns and notices Zuko standing still.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Zuko, what are you doing?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: My sister was on that island.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Yeah, and she's probably right behind us, so let's not stop!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: What I mean is she must have come here somehow. [Walks up to a large hill by the sea.] There! [Pan down to a large airship.] That's our way out of here!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Back at the prison. Mai is detained by two guards, while Azula glares at her. Ty Lee stands in the middle, looking terrified and concerned at the two.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Leave us alone. [The guards give the Fire Nation salute and exit. Mai raises her head a little, looking defiant.] I never expected this from you. [Cut to a side view of Mai, followed by a frontal shot of Ty Lee, who looks from one to the other, tears in her eyes, and back to Azula.] The thing I don't understand is "Why?". Why would you do it? You know the consequences.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: I guess you just don't know people as well as you think you do. You miscalculated. I love Zuko more than I fear you.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Her intrigued expression contorts into one of absolute rage.] No, you miscalculated! You should have feared me more!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Azula angles her fingers to create lightning, and Mai readies one of her stilettos, her eyes narrowed. Before Azula can complete her attack, however, she is struck twice by Ty Lee, who chi blocks her. Cuts to Mai, blade still in hand and looking very surprised, and to Azula, who dumbfoundedly falls to the ground, paralyzed. Ty Lee seems surprised at her own actions.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Runs to a shocked Mai, shaking her from her stupor.] Come on! Let's get out of here!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Mai and Ty Lee are quickly surrounded by guards and captured before they can escape.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Still on the ground; angrily.] You're both fools!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Azula is helped up by two guards. Mai and Ty Lee are both restrained, looking defiantly at the princess.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: What shall we do with them, princess?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Put them somewhere I'll never have to see their faces again, and let them rot!

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Nightfall, Western Air Temple. The ship is returned. Zuko and Sokka exit, standing in front of Toph, Aang, and Katara.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: What are you doing in this thing? What happened to the war balloon?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: It kind of got destroyed.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Sounds like a crazy fishing trip.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Did you at least get some good meat?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: I did. The best meat of all. The meat of friendship and fatherhood.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Suki, Hakoda, and Chit Sang exit.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Waving.] I'm new. What's up, everybody?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: [Tearing up; overjoyed.] Dad? [Runs to him.]

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Hi, Katara. [They embrace.]

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: How are you here? What is going on? Where did you go?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: We kind of went to a Fire Nation prison.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Hakoda pulls Sokka into the embrace. The camera pans away from the scene.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Seriously? You guys didn't find any meat?

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Fade to credits.

title: The Boiling Rock, Part 2
text: Chit Sang

title: The Southern Raiders
text: The episode opens to morning at the Western Air Temple. Cuts to overhead shot of the team's campsite, the camera panning downward slightly, showing their sleeping bags all arranged in a circular form. Cuts to overhead shot of Suki and Chit Sang sleeping, Chit Sang snoring. The camera pans to the right to reveal Hakoda asleep next to Chit Sang. Cuts to ground-level shot of Teo asleep, The Duke and Zuko in the background also in a slumber.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: [As he runs and pushes her out of harm's way.] Watch out!

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Cuts to shot of the two as they roll across the floor, the debris from the ceiling crashing several feet away from them. They finally settle on the ground.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: [Angrily.] What are you doing?

title: The Southern Raiders
text: [Calmly.] Keeping rocks from crushing you.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Okay, I'm not crushed. You can get off me now!

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Katara rushes out from under Zuko and exits off screen.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: I'll take that as a thank you. [Rises.]

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Cuts to a section of the wall where a hole is bored through. The camera zooms out to show Toph and Haru, who have created the exit way using earthbending.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: [Pointing to the exit.] Come on! We can get out through here!

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Cuts to overhead shot of the tunnel as everyone begins entering the passageway. Aang stays behind, trying to get Appa to leave with him by pulling on the bison's reins. The camera zooms out, as he spots Zuko standing, facing the airships.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: [To Zuko.] What are you doing?

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Go ahead! I'll hold them off. I think this is a family visit. [Runs off.]

title: The Southern Raiders
text: [In the background, Sokka and Katara run up to him.] Zuko! No!

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Come on! We've gotta get out of here!

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Aang, Katara, and Sokka begin pulling on the reins together in an attempt to budge Appa. Cuts to shot of the doors of the building, which continue to be destroyed. Debris continues to fall to the ground as Zuko races toward the doors and leaps over to the other side just as another piece of the door falls and shatters. Cuts to shot of Zuko running toward the airships. One bomb is launched and lands several feet before him where it detonates. Thick gray plumes of smoke rise; after a brief moment, Zuko emerges from the smoke cover, unharmed.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: What are you doing here?

title: The Southern Raiders
text: [Smiling.] You mean it's not obvious yet? I am about to celebrate becoming an only child!

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Azula kicks a large blast of flame at her brother. Zuko dodges and runs backward into the temple, but falls. Several blasts are sent his way as the temple begins to fall apart. He runs toward the airships. As he jumps toward the ship, he sends several shots toward Azula, but fails to hit her and jumps onto the airship. He falls down into the misty floor below.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: I can't get him to go in there! Appa hates tunnels!

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Aang, there's no way we can fly out of here.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: We'll have to find a way!

title: The Southern Raiders
text: We need to split up. [To the others.] Take the tunnel and get to the stolen airship.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: [Turns around and suddenly grows angry.] No! [Walks up to her father.] The Fire Nation can't separate our family again!

title: The Southern Raiders
text: It'll be okay. It's not forever.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Katara hesitates before hugging her dad and running back to Aang. Sokka and Hakoda hug also as Sokka takes Suki and runs with the others. The two groups go their separate ways. Toph is seen touching a wall.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: I can clear that away and we can fly out through there!

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Um, there's an awful lot of fire in that general direction ...

title: The Southern Raiders
text: We'll get through. Let's go.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Appa flies through to the outside of the temple, covered by a shield of rock in front. Azula tries to bring him down, only for the shield to absorb the blasts. Appa escapes and the shield disintegrates. Behind Azula, a second airship rises, revealing Zuko survived his fall by getting onto another airship.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: She's ... not gonna make it ... [Azula uses her firebending to propel herself toward the wall, stopping her fall with her hair pin and saving herself.] Of course she did.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Cuts to shot of Azula, who stands on the side of the cliff, smiling evilly. Cuts to shot of her watching as the team escapes, her back to the camera. The scene switches to where the gang is camping outside.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Wow, camping ... it really seems like old times again, doesn't it?

title: The Southern Raiders
text: [Jokingly.] If you really want it to feel like old times, I could, uh ... chase you around a while and try to capture you. [He smiles and the rest of the group laughs, except for Katara.]

title: The Southern Raiders
text: [Sarcastically.] Ha, ha.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: [Holding up his cup.] To Zuko! Who knew after all those times he tried to snuff us out, today he'd be our hero?

title: The Southern Raiders
text: [Everybody except Katara holds up their cups.] Hear! Hear! [Aang nudges him with his elbow, before Toph lightly punches him.]

title: The Southern Raiders
text: [Smiling.] I'm touched. [Stops smiling.] I don't deserve this.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: [Angrily.] Yeah, no kidding. [Walks away.]

title: The Southern Raiders
text: What's with her?

title: The Southern Raiders
text: I wish I knew. [Follows her.]

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Cuts to shot of the entire campsite.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: [Voice-over.] What's with him?

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Cuts to shot of a waxing gibbous moon, partially obscured by the clouds. Cuts to a shot of Katara sitting on a rock and overlooking a rocky cliff, Zuko approaching her from behind. She catches sight of him, immediately grows antagonistic, and rises to walk farther away toward the cliff.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: This isn't fair! Everyone else seems to trust me now! What is it with you?

title: The Southern Raiders
text: [Turns around; furiously.] Oh, everyone trusts you now! I was the first person to trust you! [Places her left hand on her heart.] Remember, back in Ba Sing Se. [Points to the ocean.] And you turned around and betrayed me, betrayed all of us!

title: The Southern Raiders
text: [Closes eyes in resentment.] What can I do to make it up to you?

title: The Southern Raiders
text: [Cuts to shot of her and Zuko standing on the cliff as she approaches him while snapping at him angrily.] You really want to know? Hmm, maybe you could reconquer Ba Sing Se in the name of the Earth King. [Cuts to side-view of her and Zuko.] Or, I know! You could bring my mother back!

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Katara storms away, slightly hitting his left shoulder with her right one as she passes Zuko, leaving him disappointed. Cuts to shot of entire cliff side, the waves crashing against the rocky wall. The scene switches to the campsite where Zuko accidentally runs into Suki on his way to confront Sokka.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: [Embarrassed.] Oops, wrong tent!

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Sorry, do you need to talk to Sokka, too?

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Nope, not me! [Walks away.]

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Zuko enters the tent, a look of disbelief spreading across his face.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: [Holding a rose in his mouth, surrounded by lit candles.] Well, hello ... [Surprised to find Zuko in his tent, destroying the rose in his mouth.] Uh, Zuko! Yes, why would I be expecting anyone different? [Painfully swallows rose petals and thorns.] So what's on your mind?

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Your sister. She hates me! And I don't know why, but I do care what she thinks of me.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Nah, she doesn't hate you. Katara doesn't hate anyone. Except maybe some people in the Fire Nation. [His eyes widen as he realizes his mistake.] No, I mean, uh, not people who are good, but used to be bad. I mean, bad people. Fire Nation people who are still bad, who've never been good and probably won't be, ever!

title: The Southern Raiders
text: [Interrupting him.] Stop. Okay, listen. I know this may seem out of nowhere, but I want you to tell me what happened to your mother.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: [Slightly taken aback.] What? Why would you want to know that?

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Katara mentioned it before when we were imprisoned together in Ba Sing Se, and again just now when she was yelling at me. I think somehow she's connected her anger at that to her anger at me.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: [Sadly.] It's not a day I like to remember.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: A flashback is shown of a younger Katara having a snowball fight with her brother. Sokka peers over a snow wall and prepares to throw a snowball at his sister only to be hit by a snowball thrown by a younger Katara, off-screen. Cuts to shot of Katara, who giggles joyfully. Cuts to shot of Sokka, who climbs over the snow wall, carrying an exceptionally large snowball. He drops it, however, upon witnessing blackened snow falling from the sky.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: I'm going to find Mom! [Runs off.]

title: The Southern Raiders
text: [Voice-over.] Many of the warriors had seen the black snow before and they knew what it meant: a Fire Nation raid. [A battle scene is depicted of Water Tribe Warriors and Fire Nation soldiers charging and attacking one another.] We were badly outnumbered, but somehow, we managed to drive them off. As quickly as they came, they just left.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Cuts to shot of Sokka tossing his boomerang toward the retreating soldiers. The scene switches back to present day.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: I was so relieved when it was over, but that's because I didn't know yet what had happened. I didn't know we had lost our mother.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Wait. Can you remember any details about the soldiers who raided your village? Like what the lead ship looked like?

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Yeah ... sea ravens. [Scene shows flashback of three red flags waving in the breeze, bearing sea ravens.] The main ship had flags with sea ravens on them.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: The symbol of the Southern Raiders. Thanks, Sokka.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: [Urging Zuko hurriedly out of the tent.] No problem. Thanks for stopping by! [Zuko leaves.] I'd thought he'd never leave. [Peaks head out excitedly and whispers.] Suki!

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Unfortunately for him, Zuko has barely taken two steps away from the tent and is looking curiously at Sokka. Sokka pretends to be completely oblivious and whistles. The next day, Katara emerges from her tent to find Zuko waiting outside, sitting on a rock.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: [Angrily.] You look terrible.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: I waited out here all night.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: [Brushing her hair.] What do you want?

title: The Southern Raiders
text: I know who killed your mother, [She abruptly stops.] and I'm going to help you find him.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Katara casts him a look of shock, which soon turns to a look of anger.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: I need to borrow Appa.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: [Jokingly.] Why? Is it your turn to take a little field trip with Zuko?

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Yes, it is.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: [Slightly surprised.] Oh. What's going on?

title: The Southern Raiders
text: We're going to find the man who took my mother from me.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Sokka pauses and stands up, surprised.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Sokka told me the story of what happened. I know who did it and I know how to find him.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Um ... and what exactly do you think this will accomplish?

title: The Southern Raiders
text: [Shakes her head in dismay.] Ugh, I knew you wouldn't understand. [Begins to walk away.]

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Wait! Stop! I do understand. You're feeling unbelievable pain and rage. How do think I felt about the sandbenders when they stole Appa? How do you think I felt about the Fire Nation when I found out what happened to my people?

title: The Southern Raiders
text: She needs this, Aang. This is about getting closure and justice.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: I don't think so. I think it's about getting revenge.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: [Angrily.] Fine, maybe it is! Maybe that's what I need! Maybe that's what he deserves!

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Katara, you sound like Jet.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: It's not the same! Jet attacked the innocent. This man, he's a monster.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Katara, she was my mother, too, but I think Aang might be right.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Then you didn't love her the way I did!

title: The Southern Raiders
text: [Hurt.] Katara!

title: The Southern Raiders
text: The monks used to say that revenge is like a two-headed rat viper. While you watch your enemy go down, you're being poisoned yourself.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: That's cute, but this isn't air temple preschool. It's the real world.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Now that I know he's out there ... now that I know we can find him, I feel like I have no choice.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Katara, you do have a choice: forgiveness.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: That's the same as doing nothing!

title: The Southern Raiders
text: No, it's not. It's easy to do nothing, but it's hard to forgive.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: It's not just hard, it's impossible. [Cuts to overhead shot of the field as she walks away, Zuko following behind.]

title: The Southern Raiders
text: The scene changes to later that night where Katara is seen dressed in a black cloak, tying her hair in a ponytail. Aang and Sokka watch her from behind a rock before emerging from behind it.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: So you were just gonna take Appa anyway?

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Yes.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: It's okay, because I forgive you. [Pauses.] That give you any ideas?

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Don't try to stop us.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: I wasn't planning to. This is a journey you need to take. You need to face this man. [Katara situates herself on Appa's head.] But when you do, please don't choose revenge. Let your anger out, and then let it go. Forgive him.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: [Sarcastically.] Okay, we'll be sure to do that, guru goody-goody. [Climbs aboard Appa.]

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Thanks for understanding, Aang. Yip-yip. [Appa takes flight; Aang and Sokka look up at the departing bison, their backs facing the camera.]

title: The Southern Raiders
text: You know, you're pretty wise for a kid.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Thanks, Sokka.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: [Cuts to shot of the two standing together looking up.] Usually it's annoying, but right now, I'm impressed.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: I appreciate that.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: So, can I borrow Momo for a week?

title: The Southern Raiders
text: [Surprised.] Why do you need Momo?

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Sokka simply shrugs.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: We need to find the Fire Navy communication tower. All the navy's movements are coordinated by messenger hawk. And every tower has to be up to date on where everyone is deployed.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: [Cuts to shot of the communication tower situated on an island in the middle of the ocean; off-camera.] So once we find the communication tower, we bust in and take the information we need.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: [Voice-over.] Not exactly. We need to be stealthy and make sure no one spots us, [Cuts to shot of the communication tower, the camera panning downward.] otherwise they'll warn the Southern Raiders long before we reach them.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: The scene switches to where Zuko and Katara run out from behind a mass of large rocks. Using waterbending, Katara creates a raft of ice for her and Zuko to ride on to the communication tower. The scene cuts to a corridor of tower where the two are crouched in a corner, watching two guards walk out a door. After the guards have passed, they stealthily run through the open door. The scene cuts to a female guard sitting at a writing desk. The duo peers at her from overhead gratings. Katara waterbends the ink onto the guard's hands. She rises from the desk and walks away. Katara and Zuko use the time to comb through the files stored in the drawers.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Okay, Southern Raiders. [Opens a scroll.] Bam. [Points to location on map; off-camera.] On patrol near Whaletail Island.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: [Cuts to shot of Zuko and Katara looking at the map.] Whaletail Island, here we come.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: The scene changes to the next morning. Zuko arises from his sleep and looks at Katara steering Appa. She has dark circles under her eyes from lack of sleep.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: You should get some rest. We'll be there in a few hours. You'll need all your strength.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Oh, don't you worry about my strength. I have plenty. I'm not the helpless little girl I was when they came.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: The scene fades into a flashback of the Southern Raiders' attack.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: I'm going to find Mom.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: She runs nervously past her brother. Several Water Tribe warriors are shown running about in a frantic motion. The camera focuses on Katara again, who arrives at their igloo and pushes back the curtain.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Mom!

title: The Southern Raiders
text: She runs in to discover her mother seated on the floor, a man towering over her.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Just let her go and I'll give you the information you want.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: You heard your mother. Get out of here!

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Mommy, I'm scared.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Go find your dad, sweetie. I'll handle this.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Katara gazes into the menacing eyes of the Southern Raiders commander and runs off. The scene changes to her sprinting across the snowy battlefield.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: [Voice-over.] I ran as fast as I could.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: [Arrives to where her father is battling Fire Nation soldiers.] Dad, Dad! Please, I think Mom's in trouble! There's a man in our house!

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Kya!

title: The Southern Raiders
text: The two run to their house frantically. Hakoda pushes back the blue drapes before the scene fades to white back to present day.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: But we were too late. When we got there, the man was gone. [Voice begins breaking.] And so was she.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Your mother was a brave woman.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: [Clutches her necklace.] I know.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: The scene changes to later that night, where Zuko has taken command of Appa and Katara is sleeping on Appa's saddle. Zuko is looking through a telescope.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: There! [Katara looks up.] See those sea raven flags? [Tosses the telescope to Katara.] It's the Southern Raiders.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: [Determined.] Let's do this.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Appa submerges underwater, Katara waterbending an air bubble around his head so they can breathe. The camera cuts to a shot of a group of Fire Nation soldiers having a conversation on the deck of the ship.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: So there I was, and I was like, 'You know ...'

title: The Southern Raiders
text: He yells as a large water whip emerges from the surface and coils around his body, dragging him off the ship. The other soldiers run to the source of the incident in shock. Appa surfaces and Katara waterbends two huge waves at the ship. The others turn around to see the torrent of water flood the ship, washing them overboard. Appa lands on the deck. One soldier, who has managed to stay aboard the ship, attacks Katara, who pushes him away with a gush of water. She and Zuko make their way through the corridors of the ship, Katara's arms covered in water for defense. One soldier bursts from his cabin, a sword in hand only to be attacked and locked back inside by Zuko. Katara follows him to a large doorway, where they abruptly halt.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: This is it, Katara. Are you ready to face him?

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Katara pulls down her face mask and lets out a cry as she sends a powerful stream of water toward the door. The scene changes to the inside of the room, the door having been knocked down by the impact of the water. The Southern Raiders commander attempts to attack Zuko, who only deflects his firebending attacks.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Who are you?

title: The Southern Raiders
text: You don't remember her? You will soon, trust me.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: The Southern Raiders commander prepares to strike once more, however, his hand fails to move and begins trembling.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: What's ... [He attempts to control his arm which bends about uncontrollably.] happening to me?

title: The Southern Raiders
text: The camera focuses on Katara using bloodbending on him. With swift motions, she forces him to the ground. Zuko looks on at her, momentarily stunned before turning his attention back to the commander.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Think back. Think back to your last raid on the Southern Water Tribe.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: [Helplessly subdued.] I don't know what you're talking about. Please, I don't know!

title: The Southern Raiders
text: [Bending down closer to the commander.] Don't lie! You look her in the eye and you tell me you don't remember what you did.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Katara bloodbends him, fixing him into a position where the Southern Raiders commander looks right into her eyes. She gives him a cold, hard stare. The camera closes up on one of the commander's eyes before cutting to where Katara's face has changed from one of hate to one of shock.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: It's not him. [She frees him from her grip.] He's not the man.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: What? What do you mean he's not? He's the leader of the Southern Raiders! He has to be the guy!

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Katara remains silent and begins walking away. Zuko grabs the weak commander and pins him to the wall.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: If you're not the man we're looking for, who is?

title: The Southern Raiders
text: You must be looking for Yon Rha. He retired four years ago.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: The camera focuses on Katara, whose eyes are filled with tears. The scene changes to a shot of the ground where an anonymous character rakes the soil with a trough. Cuts to a side-view shot of a house where a man is tending to his garden. The sky is dark and gray with storm clouds. An elderly woman walks up to the open door of the house behind him.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Yon Rha! You lazy piece of work, I need something.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: [Stops his work and attempts to placate.] Yes, Mother. What is it?

title: The Southern Raiders
text: The tomato-carrots from your garden are too hard for my gums. I need something soft and juicy!

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Would you like something else from the garden? I would be happy to ...

title: The Southern Raiders
text: [Angrily. Her fists clench as she interrupts.] Forget your stupid garden! [Cut to a close-up of her as she yells at him; irritatingly.] Get your grimy hind to the market and buy me some real food!

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Cut to the flower bed as Yon Rha stands up. Cut to the back view of Yon Rha as he walks toward the town's entrance. Cut to some vegetables on display at a stall. The scene changes to where Yon Rha is walking to the marketplace of the village, the place almost desolate. Yon Rha enters the screen. He begins to buy vegetables from a stand. A wind chime tinkles from one of the other stands. Yon Rha sharply turns around to view the suspicious activity. The camera view changes to someone ducking behind the stand.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: [Suspiciously.] Hello? [To stand owner.] Did you see someone?

title: The Southern Raiders
text: The stand owner shakes his head. Yon Rha is later seen walking back to house down some steps. He stops again and looks up.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Hello? [Camera view shifts to show someone hiding.] Is someone there?

title: The Southern Raiders
text: He resumes walking again. Katara and Zuko appear from their hiding place.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: That was him. That was the monster.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: The scene cuts to where Yon Rha is walking, rain beginning to fall. He turns and stops once more.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Nobody sneaks up on me without getting burned! [Drops basket of vegetables and firebends at a nearby bush.]

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Sensing no one, he picks up the fallen vegetables and continues on his way. He unknowingly steps on a thin wire, causing him to fall into the mud. He tries to get up only to see a fire blast coming his way which he quickly avoids. Zuko appears before him.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: We weren't behind the bush. [Cut to a side view of the confrontation as Zuko takes a step forward to threaten Yon Rha.] And I wouldn't try firebending again!

title: The Southern Raiders
text: [Cut to Yon Rha on the ground with his arm shielding his face. Frightened.] Whoever you are, take my money. Take whatever you want. I'll cooperate.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Katara walks up to Yon Rha and pulls down her face mask.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Do you know who I am?

title: The Southern Raiders
text: No. I'm not sure.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Oh, you better remember me like your life depends on it! Why don't you take a closer look? [Camera focuses on front view of her face.]

title: The Southern Raiders
text: [Camera focuses on him.] Yes, yes, I remember you now. [Focuses on Katara again.] You're that little Water Tribe girl.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Lightning strikes, darkening the screen and flashing back to the incident in the igloo with the young Katara, her mother and Yon Rha.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Just let her go and [Camera zooms out to show Kya kneeling on the floor in front of Yon Rha.] I'll give you the information you want.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: You heard your mother. Get out of here!

title: The Southern Raiders
text: [Holds her hands together.] Mommy, I'm scared.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Go find your dad, sweetie. I'll handle this.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Young Katara leaves the igloo. Yon Rha faces Kya again.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Now tell me, who is it? Who's the waterbender?

title: The Southern Raiders
text: There are no waterbenders here. The Fire Nation took them all away a long time ago.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: You're lying. My source says there's one waterbender left in the Southern Water Tribe. We're not leaving until we find the waterbender!

title: The Southern Raiders
text: If I tell you, do you promise [She lowers her head and closes her eyes to make a decision.] to leave the rest of the village alone? [Cut to a side view of Yon Rha who nods.] It's me. [Cut to Kya who looks up.] Take me as your prisoner.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: [Cut to a close-up of Yon Rha who smiles evilly.] I'm afraid I'm not taking prisoners today ...

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Fade to present day Yon Rha who gulps in terror as the flashback ends. Lightning strikes in the background.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: She lied to you! [Cut to a close-up of Katara who turns away from Yon Rha as she closes her eyes sadly.] She was protecting the last waterbender!

title: The Southern Raiders
text: [Shocked.] What? Who?

title: The Southern Raiders
text: [Cut back to Katara who turns to face him again as she opens her eyes and looks back furiously.] Me!

title: The Southern Raiders
text: She holds both her arms out, halting the falling raindrops and creating a shield above the three of them. After a few moments, she sends a forceful stream of water at Yon Rha, transforming the stream into a flurry of ice daggers midway through her attack. Yon Rha crouches in fear, preparing to be hit. When he does not feel harmed, he looks up to see the ice daggers floating in midair. Katara's expression softens and she allows for the daggers to liquefy and drop to the ground.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: [Falls to his knees.] I did a bad thing! I know I did and you deserve revenge, so why don't you take my mother? That would be fair! [Attempts to smile weakly.]

title: The Southern Raiders
text: [Sorrowfully.] I always wondered what kind of person could do such a thing, but now that I see you, I think I understand. There's just nothing inside you, nothing at all. You're pathetic and sad and empty.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: [Humbly.] Please, spare me! [Cries.]

title: The Southern Raiders
text: But as much as I hate you ... I just can't do it.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Katara closes her eyes and lowers her head. Cut to Yon Rha, a hint of a smile gracing his lips upon realizing he will be spared. Without saying another word, Katara turns around and walks away; Zuko looks from Katara to Yon Rha, shooting the latter a last dirty look, and follows her. Yon Rha continues crying and shivering in the rain. The scene cuts to a boardwalk overlooking the water. It is later that day. Scene cuts to Katara, who is sitting on the edge of the dock, her eyes closed, paddling the water with her feet. She opens her eyes sadly as Aang and Zuko approach her.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Katara? Are you okay?

title: The Southern Raiders
text: I'm doing fine.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Zuko told me what you did. Or what you didn't do, I guess. I'm proud of you.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: I wanted to do it. I wanted to take out all my anger at him, but I couldn't. I don't know if it's because I'm too weak to do it or because I'm strong enough not to.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: You did the right thing. Forgiveness is the first step you have to take to begin healing.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: [Rises from boardwalk.] But I didn't forgive him. I'll never forgive him. [Smiles at Zuko and walks up to him.] But I am ready to forgive you.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: The two hug and Katara begins walking away.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: You were right about what Katara needed. Violence wasn't the answer.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: It never is.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Then I have a question for you. [Turns to look at him.] What are you gonna do when you face my father?

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Camera focuses on Aang, who now has a worried expression on his face. Fades to credits.

title: The Southern Raiders
text: Katara

title: The Ember Island Players
text: The episode begins at Ozai's home on Ember Island. Cut to overhead shot of a courtyard where Aang and Zuko practice firebending using synchronized fire blasts. Cut to ground-level shot of the two as they create sweeping arcs of fire that dissipate into the ground. They each raise an arm and leg, sending forth streams of fire, before leaning forward and sending forth another stream of fire. Cut to closer shot of Aang and Zuko as they stand upright, assuming a final fighting stance before closing their eyes, relaxing their postures, and taking a deep breath. Toph and Katara are seen in the background, sitting on steps nearby. Zuko and Aang bow to one another, and the latter stretches his arms and walks away. Cut to Katara and Toph, who is lying down on the ground, relaxing.

title: The Ember Island Players
text: Doesn't it seem kind of weird that we're hiding from the Fire Lord in his own house?

title: The Ember Island Players
text: I told you, [Cut to Zuko sitting on a dry fountain and wiping his head with a cloth.] my father hasn't come here since our family was actually happy. And that was a long time ago. It's the last place anyone would think to look for us.

title: The Ember Island Players
text: Cut to wide-view of the courtyard from where Katara and Toph are sitting, their backs to the screen. Sokka and Suki enter on-screen from afar, Sokka holding a rolled-up piece of paper.

title: The Ember Island Players
text: You guys are not gonna believe this! There's a play about us.

title: The Ember Island Players
text: [Cut to close-up of her and Sokka.] We were just in town and we found this poster! [Sokka shows the poster for the play to the team. It depicts Katara, Aang, and Sokka with Zuko's scarred face in the background.]

title: The Ember Island Players
text: What? How is that possible?

title: The Ember Island Players
text: Listen to this ... [Turns the poster toward him.] "The Boy in the Iceberg is a new production from acclaimed playwright Pu-on Tim, [Cut to a close shot of the poster as the camera pans up.] who scoured the globe gathering information on the Avatar, from the icy South Pole to the heart of Ba Sing Se. [Shot changes to show Team Avatar.] His sources include singing nomads, pirates, prisoners of war, and a surprisingly knowledgeable merchant of cabbage."

title: The Ember Island Players
text: "Brought to you by the critically acclaimed Ember Island Players."

title: The Ember Island Players
text: [Recalling a memory.] Ugh! My mother used to take us to see them. They butchered Love Amongst the Dragons every year!

title: The Ember Island Players
text: Sokka, do you really think it's a good idea for us to attend a play about ourselves?

title: The Ember Island Players
text: [Persuasively.] Come on, a day at the theater? This is the kind of wacky time-wasting nonsense I've been missing! [He holds up the poster anxiously and smiles sheepishly; Katara looks away, appears nonplussed.]

title: The Ember Island Players
text: Fade to nighttime at the theater. Cut to inside the theater to show the stage and curtain. The camera zooms out to show the balcony as Toph, Katara, and Aang arrive, with Aang wearing a hat to cover his head tattoos. Toph and Katara sit down; Zuko sits next to Katara as Aang tries to sit next to her. Aang stands back up.

title: The Ember Island Players
text: [To Zuko; points to his seat and tries to act casual.] Hey, uh ... I wanted to sit there.

title: The Ember Island Players
text: [Removing his hood.] Just sit next to me. What's the big deal?

title: The Ember Island Players
text: I was just, I wanted to ... okay. [Sits down.]

title: The Ember Island Players
text: Sokka and Suki sit in the row behind the rest of Team Avatar.

title: The Ember Island Players
text: Why are we sitting in the nosebleed section? My feet can't see a thing from up here!

title: The Ember Island Players
text: Don't worry, I'll tell your feet what's happening.

title: The Ember Island Players
text: The curtain rises to reveal a set representative of the South Pole seas. Actress Katara and Actor Sokka are rowing their boat along. Cut to Katara who looks thrilled to see herself onstage, and Sokka grabs her shoulder, pointing at her, himself, and the stage excitedly. Cut to shot of Actress Katara, an older, more robust woman wearing Water Tribe garments.

title: The Ember Island Players
text: [Sighs.] Sokka, my only brother! We constantly roam these icy South Pole seas, and yet never do we find anything fulfilling!

title: The Ember Island Players
text: [Cut to Actor Sokka, a thin, lanky man.] All I want is a full feeling in my stomach! I'm starving!

title: The Ember Island Players
text: The audience laughs. Cut to Sokka and Katara as their faces fall; they look at each other, confused. Cut to angled shot of the stage.

title: The Ember Island Players
text: Is food the only thing on your mind?

title: The Ember Island Players
text: [Cut to shot of the actor.] Well, I'm trying to it get out of my mind and into my mouth! I'm starving! [Audience laughs.]

title: The Ember Island Players
text: [Leans forward in his seat; clearly annoyed.] This is pathetic! My jokes are way funnier than this! [Extends his arm in a dramatic gesture.]

title: The Ember Island Players
text: [Laughing.] I think he's got you pegged!

title: The Ember Island Players
text: [Cut to the stage where Actress Katara now stands in the canoe.] Every day, the world awaits a beacon to guide us, yet none appears! [Cut to close-up of the actress who holds her hand out and clasps her hands together dramatically.] Still, we cannot give up hope! For hope, [Begins to cry.] is all we have! And we must never relinquish it, even ... [Sniffs and falls back into a sitting position.] even to our dying breath! [Leans over the side of the canoe and buries her face in her hands, crying.]

title: The Ember Island Players
text: Cut to the team, Suki holding her hand over her mouth to suppress a laugh and Sokka looking over at Katara with an amused smile.

title: The Ember Island Players
text: [With crossed arms, displeased.] Well, that's just silly. I don't sound like that.

title: The Ember Island Players
text: [Elated.] Oh man! This writer's a genius!

title: The Ember Island Players
text: Cut to Actress Katara still slumped over the side of the canoe. An iridescent light suddenly appears from above and she turns her head upward. Cut to shot of the stage where a model iceberg can be seen, the vague shadow of a figure visible from behind. The two actors stand up in the canoe.

title: The Ember Island Players
text: It appears to be someone frozen in ice, perhaps for a hundred years.

title: The Ember Island Players
text: [Closer shot of the silhouette swaying from side to side inside the iceberg prop.] But who? Who is the boy in the iceberg?

title: The Ember Island Players
text: Cut to Aang who smiles and leans forward in his seat. Cut to close-up of the model iceberg where Actress Katara stands before the silhouetted figure, Actor Sokka hosting himself onto the prop.

title: The Ember Island Players
text: Waterbend! Hi-yah!

title: The Ember Island Players
text: She performs a karate chop, mimicking waterbending. The silhouette disappears from view and the prop splits in half, sending forth a jet of steam. An actress, meant to portray Aang, leaps up on screen and poses, winking and with one hand on hip. The actress is visibly wearing a flesh-colored cap over her hair to portray herself as bald; the cap also bears the airbending mastery tattoo. She wears an excessive amount of blush on her cheeks and her overall physiognomy and demeanor clearly display her femininity.

title: The Ember Island Players
text: Who are you, frozen boy?

title: The Ember Island Players
text: [Laughs; in a high-pitched voice.] I'm the Avatar, silly, here to spread joy and fun! [She leans toward Actress Katara, laying a finger on her lips, and also motions toward Actor Sokka before standing upright and spreading her arms out in a cheery gesture.]

title: The Ember Island Players
text: Wait, is that a woman playing me?

title: The Ember Island Players
text: A crude, costumed-version of Appa suddenly bursts up from behind the trio of actors; loud festival music previously heard in the episode "Avatar Day" is presently played. The replica of Appa sways from side to side before leaping off the iceberg prop. Cut to a wide shot of the stage as the three actors wearing the bison costume, only their legs visible, land to the right of the stage, run across to the left side, and finally behind the iceberg prop.

title: The Ember Island Players
text: [Gasps.] An airbender! [Clasps her hands to her chest.] My heart is so full of hope, [Drops down on one knee emotionally.] that it's making me tearbend! [Begins to cry and grabs on to Actress Aang's leg. Cut to close-up of Actress Katara who continues to bawl dramatically. Cut back to shot of the entire trio.]

title: The Ember Island Players
text: My stomach is so empty, that it's making me tearbend! [Throws his arms up hopelessly before dropping to his knees, clutching on to Actress Aang's other leg, and crying.] I need meat! [Cut to close-up of Actor Sokka.]

title: The Ember Island Players
text: [Stoops down, puts her arm around Actor Sokka's shoulders, and points upward.] But wait! Is that a platter of meaty dumplings? [Cut to actual Aang whose head and arm rest lazily on the railing, unimpressed.]

title: The Ember Island Players
text: Cut back to shot of the trio, Actress Aang now sitting down, her legs dangling over the edge of the iceberg prop. Both Actress Katara and Actor Sokka are kneeling down.

title: The Ember Island Players
text: [Excitedly; shielding his eyes with his hand and turning his head, searching for the alleged dumplings.] Ooh, where, where?

title: The Ember Island Players
text: [Laughs and swings arm jovially.] Did I mention that I'm an incurable prankster? [Crosses her legs as the audience laughs.]

title: The Ember Island Players
text: [Cut to wide shot of Team Avatar. Aang extends his arm toward the stage, angry with the actress' bad portrayal.] I don't do that! That's not what I'm like! And I'm not a woman! [Throws hands up in frustration.]

title: The Ember Island Players
text: [Laughs and turns to face Aang.] Oh, they nailed you, Twinkle Toes! [Continues to laugh.]

title: The Ember Island Players
text: Cut to stage where the trio of actors and iceberg prop are no longer present; the scene continues to depict the South Pole seas. A model Fire Nation ship prop glides onto stage from the left; a man portraying Prince Zuko stands at the bow of the ship, garbed in Zuko's outfit from Book One and peering through a telescope. The actor portraying Iroh stands at the helm.

title: The Ember Island Players
text: Prince Zuko, you must try this cake! [Holds up a platter of cake with one slice missing.]

title: The Ember Island Players
text: Cut to Actor Zuko looking through the telescope. He wears a headpiece that sports the ponytail Zuko once wore, albeit slightly exaggerated, and Zuko's scar; the replicated scar, while realistic, is worn over the wrong eye.

title: The Ember Island Players
text: I don't have time to stuff my face! [Lowers his telescope and turns to Actor Iroh.] I must capture the Avatar to regain my honor! [Faces out into the audience, clutching his hand in a fist assertively.]

title: The Ember Island Players
text: [Cut to wide shot of the model ship.] Well, while you do that, maybe I'll capture another slice. [He holds the cake up higher before bringing it toward his face and proceeding to gobble it down ravenously and noisily.]

title: The Ember Island Players
text: [Viewing Actor Iroh.] You sicken me!

title: The Ember Island Players
text: Cut to shot of Katara and Zuko in their seats, both with their arms crossed. Zuko appears displeased with his character portrayal while Katara looks at him with a smug smile.

title: The Ember Island Players
text: [Gestures toward the stage.] They make me look totally stiff and humorless.

title: The Ember Island Players
text: [Complacently amused.] Actually, I think that actor's pretty spot on.

title: The Ember Island Players
text: [In protest; holding his arms out.] How could you say that?

title: The Ember Island Players
text: Cut to the bow of the model ship where Actor Zuko has resumed peering through his telescope. Actor Iroh stands behind him.

title: The Ember Island Players
text: [Completely at ease.] Let's forget about the Avatar and get massages!

title: The Ember Island Players
text: [Turns toward his uncle, leaning forward menacingly; shouting.] How could you say that?

title: The Ember Island Players
text: Cut to Katara and Zuko; the former continues to smile smugly as the latter slumps down in his seat, defeated and dismayed to find her claim accurate.

title: The Ember Island Players
text: Hey look, I think I found something! [Tiptoes to the bush. Actor Sokka scratches his head while Actress Katara shrugs. Actress Aang picks up the Momo prop, a rabbit-monkey puppet.] It's a flying rabbit-monkey! I think I'll name him, Momo! [Laughs; using puppet.] Hi everybody, I love you! [The audience laughs.]

title: The Ember Island Players
text: Ugh.

title: The Ember Island Players
text: Cut to Actress Suki, holding up two fans. She lifts them up. Actor Sokka enters in the Kyoshi Warriors' uniform.

title: The Ember Island Players
text: [Pointing to his backside.] Does this dress make my butt look fat?

title: The Ember Island Players
text: Audience laughs, as does Suki. Sokka gives her an embarrassed look.

title: The Ember Island Players
text: Riddles and challenges you must face, [Camera pans back to show the whole stage.] if you are ever to leave this place! [Laughs.]

title: The Ember Island Players
text: Actress Aang dodges a swaying rock while a goat gorilla chases Actor Sokka across stage. Actress Katara stands amidst a jennamite prop.

title: The Ember Island Players
text: [Lifting up a piece of the jennamite prop.] Ugh! Oh!

title: The Ember Island Players
text: Katara gives a disgusted look and sticks out her tongue. Cut to the stage with a pirate ship background with the Team Avatar players in center stage. The pirates enter the stage from both side holding weapons in the air and attack them. The Team Avatar players slip away, with Actress Katara holding a large scroll. They tiptoe off stage.

title: The Ember Island Players
text: Why did you have to steal that waterbending scroll?

title: The Ember Island Players
text: [Crying.] It just gave me so much hope! [Katara narrows her eyes.]

title: The Ember Island Players
text: Cut to a stage hand holding a sheet of metal, which he shakes to make a sound effect. Cut to the stage to show Actress Aang tied to a platform guarded by six Fire Nation soldiers. Actor Zuko stands in front of the platform.

title: The Ember Island Players
text: The Avatar is mine! [Looking of stage.] Wait, who's coming?

title: The Ember Island Players
text: [Jumps on stage holding two swords and has a large mask.] I'm the Blue Spirit, the scourge of the Fire Nation, here to save the Avatar!

title: The Ember Island Players
text: The Blue Spirit walks across the stage waving his swords. The guards fall down and Actor Zuko runs around the platform and throws a blue strip of paper to symbolize firebending. The Blue Spirit points a sword at Actor Zuko, who runs away.

title: The Ember Island Players
text: My hero! [Jumps on top of the Blue Spirit's large mask.]

title: The Ember Island Players
text: Blue Spirit walks off stage. Zuko and Aang frown, giving each other an embarrassed look.

title: The Ember Island Players
text: Don't cry, baby! Jet will wipe out that nasty town for you!

title: The Ember Island Players
text: A large blue banner pulled by a stagehand dressed in black crosses the stage. Actress Katara and Actor Jet ascend on their platform.

title: The Ember Island Players
text: Oh Jet, you're so bad.

title: The Ember Island Players
text: Both exit. Katara appears embarrassed. Toph laughs.

title: The Ember Island Players
text: [Gasps.] Look! It's the Great Divide! The biggest canyon in the Earth Kingdom!

title: The Ember Island Players
text: Eh, let's keep flying.

title: The Ember Island Players
text: Cut to a stagehand dropping a bag of fake snow on stage in one spot. Cut to Actor Sokka and Actress Yue with a Northern Water Tribe background painting.

title: The Ember Island Players
text: Don't go, Yue! You're the only woman who has taken my mind off of food! [Kisses Yue. Gags.] Wait, did you have pickled fish for dinner?

title: The Ember Island Players
text: Goodbye, Sokka! I have important moon duties to take care of! [Exits on the moon prop.] And yes, I did have pickled fish!

title: The Ember Island Players
text: [Laughs.] You never told me you made out with a Moon Spirit.

title: The Ember Island Players
text: Shhh! [Tearing up.] I'm trying to watch! [Suki looks away, and folds her arms.]

title: The Ember Island Players
text: Cut to miniature Fire Nation ships being pulled across the stage by ropes. Actress Aang, wearing a Koizilla costume, stomps on them. She waves a doll of Zhao.

title: The Ember Island Players
text: [Laughs.] The Avatar is back to save the day! Yay! [Actress Aang stomps three more miniature ships before tripping over her Koizilla costume and falling.]

title: The Ember Island Players
text: Curtain drops. The audience cheers and Toph laughs. All the other members of Team Avatar appear disgusted.

title: The Ember Island Players
text: Ugh!

title: The Ember Island Players
text: Cut to outside the theater. The camera pans to Team Avatar sitting on a flight of stairs during intermission.

title: The Ember Island Players
